Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock rocked hard!”
Reviews.Author: Vanee S
Reviews.Content: I just got home from celebrating my 30th birthday at the Hard Rock in Las Vegas. I admit that since my birthday lands right smack in the middle of spring break that the environment might not have been what I was looking for, but boy was I wrong! When I arrived with my friends, our room was automatically upgraded to a suite in the new HRH tower. The room was beautiful! Everything was automated and there were even 2 built in ipod docs to play our own music through the room speakers with! The beds were luxe and comfy. The comforters were UNBELIEVABLY soft and warm. Even the couches were extremely comfortable while still looking extremely chic. I fell asleep there by accident on more than one occasion. I am not the biggest gambler, but I did actually win more than100% profit! That was so cool for me since I barely gamble to get that kind of payout. Beginners luck I guess. The cocktail waitresses were all so sweet and accommodating. They were just friendly enough to make you feel comfortable without doing too much. The hotel is not on the strip, but just the perfect distance away to miss the heavy traffic but be able to drive/ride there in less than 5 minutes. However, there really was no need to leave the hotel. You could get the whole Las Vegas experience there. The restaurants were great (OMG you simply MUST have the guacamole at Pink's Taco's)! The casino is great, the service is great and most everyone seems happy to help you. My party did have trouble with one very rude HRH employee who refused to serve us at the bar (a group of 30+ year old women with appropriate identification). When I brought the issue to the attention of the front desk, a manager was standing in front of me within 5 minutes, getting details about what happened and seeming genuinely concerned, as if how I felt really mattered. I appreciated that, especially since it was my birthday. Not only was the issue swiftly resolved, but I was also given a $50 room credit for my inconvenience. The food and beverage manager and registration manager saw to it. They were amazing and so kind. I expected less from such a busy place with so many other guests to see to. I was so surprised at the personal attention I was given. That sold me. I am a HRH customer from now on whenever I come to Vegas. My girlfriend and I both turned 30 this week. We and our friends all had an amazing time courtesy of HRH. I highly recommend the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Diappointed”
Reviews.Author: allizzonn
Reviews.Content: Booked online at hotels.com stated if you stayed 3 nights you got a bottle of alcohol free, upon checking in I was told not only am I charged 18.00 extra per night which I knew I also need a credit card so they could bill me 50.00 a night for a securrity deposit which I didn't get back till I checked out then it takes 72 hrs to credit to you acct. I was not told this, the girl informed me No bottle of alcohol was reserved for me. I stay at the Hrock in Boloxi and the rooms are beautiful, walking into the room I thought I was in a Days Inn. It was terrible. No coffee maker and when going into the room someone had ordered room service and the cart with the left over food sat outside our room on a cart for 24 hrs until I complained and then it was removed. We never saw a housekeeper, the beds were made but in 4 days never changed the bathroom floor was never mopped and all they did was wipe the sink out add new towels and left new soap. Hardly no one was in the casino and you have to take a cab to the strip, we went to the same drop off spot every time and coming and going we paid a different fare every time. Upon check out I complained to Mike he was the only nice part of Hard Rock. He gave me 40.00 off and a coupon for a free bottle of Vodke which I can't use cause I was flying home that day. But when I go back I will stop there on my way to my next hotel get my free bottle and stay somewhere else. Make sure you stay on the strip not at the Hard Rock. Oh also I have a Hard Rock card from Biloxi but they don't honor it and the points for the hotel don't go on that card. I do not recommend this hotel unless you are staying there for Rehab that's what the HH tower is for Shanks and alcoholics :(

Reviews.Title: “Good Place - Good Value - Recommended For Party Goers”
Reviews.Author: JLeoG21
Reviews.Content: Haven't been to a ton of Vegas hotels but my experience at the HRH was positive. From a price standpoint, it was one of the best values I could find and you get a lot for what you spend. There were 4 of us so we stayed in the Queen Suite room (no extra person fee). It had 2 beds in one room (which were very comfy) and a separate living room with a huuuggee bathroom. Definitely plenty of space for 2 couples. Negatives: The view which was of a parking garage. However if you are on the pool side, be aware that music starts pumping early in the morning which can affect you if you want to sleep in. We couldn't hear anything since we were not on that side. There is also a fee to use the steam and sauna which I wasn't expecting (but fitness center is free). We also had trouble checking in. We arrived real late (1am) and they didn't have a rooms for us, even though we specified we were getting in late on reservation. You may want to call prior to arrival to make sure they have your room. After waiting a bit they found one which was actually out of order (it was missing a door in bathroom) but we took it and they provided us with a food/beverage credit. Dining: Ate at 3 restaurants and was real happy with the food and service. I would suggest getting Resaturant.com coupons to use which are offered for most on their property. My favorite part of the property were the pools. Plenty of areas from party spots to private spots. Has sand areas and 2nd level pools, palm trees, hot tubs, gambling tables and more. I would definitely stay at this hotel again as long as it stays within this price range and would recommend it to other younger, party goers.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in the Casino.”
Reviews.Author: LeilaJean
Reviews.Content: We love the music and the atmosphere. We never wanted or waited for a drink. Good time!

Reviews.Title: “Great! PARADISE TOWER”
Reviews.Author: Taylor B
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal on Groupon, each night up to seven nights, $59.00 a night. I admit I was a little skeptical of this hotel but when I got there it was really cool. It isnt huge and there isnt a a big variteyof slots and table games, but the workers there are friendly and the waitresses are on point. The rooms were nice. Pretty empty though, there was plenty of room left for a nice size couch and another chair or table. The shower is HUGE, ridiculously huge, so their is no bath. and also no pictures on the wall. the pool wasnt poppin because I stayed on a wednesday and thursday, but it looked beautiful. Overall this casino is not the best, but its a great place to stay. The hotel isnt too far from the strip either, about an $8 cab drive

Reviews.Title: “Our new March Madness Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LilBuddy11
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Vegas 10 years in a row with my friends for March Madness. We decided to take a chance on the HRH after we were told to give it a try. I am so glad we did. We have stayed over at Caesars for many many years and after the time we had at hard rock, will never go back. We landed a little early and checked in, but did not know that we could have checked in at the HRH Tower Check in, but check in no problem. Picked up our back stage passes and off we went to explore. I had been to the casino floor before but never really checked out the rest of the property. The rock collections our incredible. The pool incredible, the music pumping incredible. The best thing about our experince at the HRH was the service. Every one there made sure our stay was perfect. The energy from the crowd is awesome. The rooms are great in the HRH Tower and I highly suggest staying. We will be returing next year.

Reviews.Title: “Just stay in the HRH tower”
Reviews.Author: CapricornSister
Reviews.Content: Just get a room in the HRH tower and drive right in to the valet on that side off Harmon. It's convenient. The rooms are nicer and newer. Check in is less hectic. Stop being cheap and taking your poor friend/spouse/significant other to the other side and making him/her drag luggage all the way through the casino. Have bell services handle your bags. They are quick. Get the highest floor you can. Enjoy the view looking down at the pool. There’s always something interesting going on. Just save up for these things and you will be appreciated. Be prepared to party among scantily clad people to loud music day and night. That’s just the way it is. If you have kids, just mellow out about what they are seeing. Why are you bringing them here, anyway? If you are old like me, just mellow out about the constant pulsing beat that starts in the morning, emanates from the pool and works its way right into the center of your brain. It will stop at sunset. Just enjoy it and feel young again. Remember, you were annoying once too. Have a cocktail. Enjoy the rock memorabilia. Take some time to relax at the spa. The décor with tons of white tile reminds me of an old hospital from the 1940’s. In a cool, retro way. I’ve been to this one several times and it has always been very clean. The indoor co-ed spa pool is lovely. The pool room is wonderfully decorated. I plan to return for concerts and the Halloween Ball.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful roof view?”
Reviews.Author: kris47
Reviews.Content: Booked a weekend package deal through Groupon for my wife's birthday. I thought for the rest of this review I'd use bullet points to simplify my comments. Pros: - Enjoyed the rock theme and music played throughout (a given) - Nacho's at the Pink Taco (hilarious name) are amazing! - Interacted with two of the bell staff and they were incredibly friendly and helpful Cons: -No signs to point you to Registration when coming from parking structures. Got lost after directions from staff, he must have misunderstood my question (Where do we check in?) -Pleasantly surprised by room, initially. Then disappointment. Then aggravation. Then phone call to front desk. Followed by more disappointment and aggravation. Then alcohol, leading to acceptance and unspeakables. -French doors leading to balcony. There was a railing immediately outside the doors. The room was level with the roof, and there was a wall about 30 feet away. So our only view was of a half smoked cigar, an empty can of beer, and a small ball of something that looked like a limbless, headless mouse. Oh and cigarette butts. Call to complain resulted in (see above). -About $10 cab ride one way to strip, or free 15 minute walk. -Bathroom was small with little lighting, or "mood" lighting. All in all, would not return. The Hard Rock would be average if it was on the strip, but it's snot.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: melodys_adventures
Reviews.Content: We booked this "SUITE" as a 5 star "mystery deal" on bookit.com and sadly we did NOT have a 5 Star experience. We left later than expected on Friday and did not arrive until 1am. The snippy girl at the front desk said "It's really late so we gave away your room. I can put you in another tower." Since we were getting downgraded we asked if there was any type of compensation she could offer and she ROLLED HER EYES before offering us a $50 food and bev credit and a room switch for the next night. Fine. The room itself was OK. Nothing outstanding, nothing disturbing. The next day we woke up late, decided to eat something at Mr. Lucky's the 24 hour "diner" downstairs. DON'T ORDER THE BREAKFAST BAGEL. YUCK! After eating we tried to change our room only to find out that they only do that up to noon and it was past noon. Since no one told us that the night before we spoke to the manager who was very nice and apoligized for the misunderstanding. She offered us additional credit which was better than nothing so we used the credit at Pink Taco. Yummy! Although the name is a bit crass, the food is pretty good. I'd recommend the appetizer platter and the nachos. The pool was very crowded so we decided to do some gambling. Save your money if you're into slots though, it seemed other hotels had the newer - more interactive slot machines which I enjoyed playing more. Although the front desk swore they were fully booked the casino was empty...but maybe it was because the AC was broken? It was so hot in parts of the casino I thought the heaters must be running full blast!

Reviews.Title: “Simply outstanding, soup to nuts.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel A
Reviews.Content: The most attractive, best-served, and technologically advanced sports book; a legendary pool system; rooms that give nothing away to the newest (and far more expensive) resorts on the Strip; and perhaps most pleasing of all--the most amazing music, playing continously, throughout the facility. You will find no better option for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock was Fun”
Reviews.Author: af3458
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock on a Wednesday after two days at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. The experience was positive. It is a younger crowd, and a bit loud so if you are looking for quiet, this is not the place. The rooms were large and clean with nice beds. I stayed in the Casino Tower. I am a bit older than the 20 somethings that were mostly there, but I enjoyed the energy. I played in the casino at the table games and found the dealers and pit to be more kicked back and enjoying themselves. This made the whole experience fun. It was mid week so not very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience at both suites and casino”
Reviews.Author: bbqchris
Reviews.Content: My wife and i trully enjoyed our stay.We were treated very nice by all the staff.Some of the reviews i had read made me leary if i had made the right choice for our mini getaway.I once worked for the airlines years ago and we stayed at alexis park across the street and i always enjoyed the casino and property.I booked the trip before reading the reviews and was afraid at 50 years young i would feel out of place or too old to rock and roll.To my delight my wife (who is 30 something} and i had a gret time with all and at no point did i feel the least bit out of place!The suites were awesome.comfy beds.Very quiet and peacefull.We dined on site and were very happy with all the restaurants.The bartenders were awesome and i spent alot of my time gambling at the sportsbook.They took great care of us and we had most if not all of our meals comped. I would go back again and stay longer if i would get the chance.Although 15 years had past since i had been to hard rock my memories of the place and fun i had in my younger days Sure did not disappoint me! Also always ask about specials at the 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: 619kathy
Reviews.Content: We received a great deal on a suite at the HRH. The room was incredible, the staff was very friendly. Our expectations were exceeded!

Reviews.Title: “March Madness”
Reviews.Author: bekkSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Wednesday through Sunday during the first weekend of March Madness. There were plenty of places to sit enjoy the games and it was never too crowded - but it was crowded enough for it to be fun. The sports book is run by Cantor and there were plenty of types of bets to be made. Our room was a 2 double bed in the Paradise Tower. We should have had the King because the feather-like top on the double beds, although nice and comfy, also made it hard for us to both be confortable in the bed. We felt the bed was higher in the middle. The paradise tower is a longer walk to and from the Casino than the others. I does have a its own coffee mart so you don't have to trek too far in the morning. We had a shower only - no bath tub. The bathroom is mostly black and it seems dark but there was a very nice lighted makeup mirror attached to the wall. No in room coffee, no refrigerator except the mini bar (you can't store your own stuff in it). The room was very clean and modern. There was a nice TV and Ipod/Iphone docking alarm clock. We were on the 17th floor pretty far from the elevators and it was nice and quiet. We used the spa. The Roman bath was very nice. Male/Female couples can enjoy it together. We were there using a Living Social deal for the first two days and other advertised special for the weekend - so it was not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: DXB2GB
Reviews.Content: Positives: huge room very clean value for money Negatives: i didnt have a great view from my window gym opening hours were too short not a great location if you want to be where the action is

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Natalie R
Reviews.Content: The bed was so comfortable. Room was very clean! Great service! beautiful hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pool Party!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CW2021
Reviews.Content: What a great location for a pool party on Sunday Rehab! Be ready to enjoy the music as it gets cranked. We are from Texas and love to be a part of the pool scene regardless of age. The new hotel addition is incredible. Highly recommend SkyyBar. Get a drink at the Center Bar and don't forget about Vanity Night Club-get there early or be ready to wait in line. Rock On!!!!

Reviews.Title: “HRH All Suite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kennedy1964
Reviews.Content: I was Debating on the Hard Rock or the Cosmopolitan& decided to book at the HRH All Suite Tower. I was greeted at the HRH valet like I was at home. I got my bags taken in and my car parked. A young guy named "Nick" (Very well groomed, smelled so great, & looked like a model off the advertisements you see) who greeted our family on the drive way gave us our orientation to the room & property. The information & personality of this gentlemen was so sincere & I knew I instantly had a friend to rely on. Let me tell you! Every dollar spent was worth my stay. The Valet & Bell staff alone will make me stay again. This hotel cares about where you are headed after you leave Paradise Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “For the younger crowd”
Reviews.Author: RuxCooks
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock is off the main strip so you will have to take a cab or use their shuttle service. The casino itself is not that big as compared to other Hotel & Casinos in the area but there is plenty of games to play. My favorite part was the Rehab party on Sunday at the pool. It's free to get in if you are staying at the hotel and you get dibs to go in first. I got up early grabbed towels and took a good spot. You can always find someone that will be working that day and give a nice tip and they will save you a couple of chair/lounges. This place gets crazy crowded and to the point where you are basically surrounded by people in the pool that I was shocked that the pool did not overflow.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay by choice”
Reviews.Author: I_like_2_travel008
Reviews.Content: In comparison to other Las Vegas properties it does not rate very high on my list. I had to stay there for convenience reasons but I am not a fan. I got a room in the HRH Tower which was quite nice but still does not match other all suite hotels in Vegas. The location sucks and you have to get a taxi to anywhere else. The one site restaurants were below average especially the 24 hour option. All in all it was ok. wouldn't stay again if I have the choice.

Reviews.Title: “HRH Tower Corner Suite Review”
Reviews.Author: uglyagnes
Reviews.Content: We were getting married in Vegas at the Cosmopolitan Popup Chapel, but decided against staying at the Cosmo because there was a group of us and the cost was prohibitive for some. The rooms at the Hard Rock were a great deal $47 for the other towers, $99 for the HRH Tower. We tried to check in early to our HRH room, but unfortunately only the corner suite would be available right away for a $50 upgrade (per night I believe) it was a special day and I wanted to get in so I said yes of course! My friends in the other towers had no problem checking in early. The corner suite was beautiful, great bed, awesome bathroom, two huge tvs. I'm glad I upgraded. It had an awesome view of the strip at night (even though its not on the strip, you can see it!) and it was great for having everyone over while we got ready for the wedding. The casino was pretty dead on the Sunday and Monday nights we were there.. But the dealers were friendly and put up with us while we tried to figure out how to play roulette. It was very easy to get drinks. Monday morning we used the spa and it was a great amenity! I had a super massage and an ok pedicure! I'd recommend this as an alternative to the strip anytime! (we had stayed at the Mirage for the 2 nights prior, and honestly we were getting sick of the strip life!).

Reviews.Title: “Best time I have ever had in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: srgardella
Reviews.Content: My husband and I head to Vegas a lot. We usually stay on the strip. We had a deal through expedia to stay at Hard Rock that we couldn't pass up......It was AWESOME! The branding at this hotel is amazing...while I had been to the casino before at HRH, I had never been a hotel guest. We truly felt like rockstars! We stayed in the "Paradise Tower" and our room was fantastic and clean. We went to the pool everyday that we were in town-best pool scene in Vegas, hands down-and I have been to a lot of resorts on the strip. Can't wait to visit again! If you are concerned about being further away from the strip, look into taking the city bus-it stops right at the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient location, so-so-rooms”
Reviews.Author: Marie63_12
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel/Casino is at least a mile from the strip. There is a shuttle that runs hourly to the Fashion Show mall, but that was inconvenient for me so I just walked. It was a beautiful 72 degree day so it was no problem. The rooms were nicely decorated and the bed was comfy, but the shower was bad. It wouldn't drain so you were basically ankle-deep in water - yuck. The same was true for the sink. We had to do maintenance every time we used it. The black furniture attracted major dust and someone had taken some cookies from the mini-bar and left a few in the wrapper, though we weren't charged. We had a pool view and watched construction going on the deck the entire time we were there. No one was swimming. Can't comment on the casino as we went to the strip to gamble with the rest of our friends, but it was small and had the overwhelming stench of cigarette smoke. Mr. Lucky's restaurant had a good breakfast and prompt service. Would not stay again mostly due to location and drainage issues.

Reviews.Title: “Had An Amazing Time!”
Reviews.Author: Stacey S
Reviews.Content: I read some reviews, but not till after I had made my reservations. A little skeptical at first, but after we checked in all was erased! We had a great time. The dealers are friendly and helpful to newcomers. The drinks at the tables come quickly. The music is awesome! The only thing negative I can say was the smoke was heavy, but would be every casino in Vegas. The beds in the rooms are heavenly! All employees are friendly. The food, although a bit expensive, was excellent in the two restaurants we ate in. We will definitely be back! Take a taxi from the airport as it is cheaper than the shuttle and you won't have to stop at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock. ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: thecool272
Reviews.Content: Ive read alot of mixed reviews on this hotel with alot being fairly negative, but i have to say this place will definitely be one of my Go-TO spots in Vegas. I had an AMAZING stay. This is going to be long one so bear with me. :-) First off, the property is one of the best looking in Vegas. From inside and out. Its clean, dark, sexy, new, has everything you need, and is filled with cool Rock n Roll memorabilia to check out. (artist instruments, photography, clothing, press releases, etc, etc, feels like a smaller version of the Rock n Roll Hall of Fame.) And the music in the hotel is jamming rock hits 24/7! It's located a little behind the main strip on Las Veags Blvd so you wont be in the middle of all the madness. I liked staying off the strip so it doesnt attract a TON of tourists and crazy party people. The hotel felt a little more private and exclusive since it was mostly hotel guests actually staying there and not people just walking thru crowding up the areas. I supposed it helps keep riff raff away as well. (thefts, violence, etc) There is also FREE PARKING in huge parking garages, so if you have a car its really easy to get in and out of the hotel. The walk to the strip is probably a little under a mile but the strip is so long and with some other hotels located on the opposite side of the main highway (The Palms, Rio, etc) its sometimes better to have a vehicle while your there. If your not staying in the middle of the strip, id advise to rent a car or be ready to take cabs. All that walking can really tear you down by the end of the nights. The entire property consists of 3 towers and is the perfect size. its definitely not as big as many of the properties on the strip but i found its smaller size to be better so it didnt take you forever to walk thru your hotel to your room or wherever your going. it takes FOREVER to walk thru most of the hotels on the strip so by the time you get to your room your beat. (see: Planet Hollywood, The Bellagio, Mandalay Bay, Bally's, Ceasar's, MGM, etc, etc) I'll mention "walking alot" during this review because trust me, you'll pound the pavement while your there and its 24/7 GO-GO-GO! its Vegas baby. There's alot to do at the hotel so you can spend alot of time there then pick certain nights to go hit the strip hard.There are some really good dining choices along with the famous Hard Rock Cafe. there's convienient type stores, a starbucks, a john varvatos store, Hart & Huntington Tattoo shop, Vanity Nightclub, The Joint - Live Music Venue, Sports Bar/Betting Rooms, excellent gym, spa, pools, etc, etc. Like i said, its got everything you need. If your into the club/live music scene, this is a great place to stay. Vanity Nightclub always has special guest dj's and huge events and The Joint always does live concerts from all sorts of rock n rollers. The pool at the Hard Rock is composed of 4 or 5 areas and has to be the biggest and best one in Vegas. It clean, with lots of room to hang poolside on chairs, lounge beds, cabana's or bars. The service was EXCELLENT, QUICK, and FUN. If your looking for a party with party people and slamming music, this is the one. There is a resident dj and usually special guest dj's 24/7 so the pool is always jumping. The music starts in the afternoon and stops around 4 or 5 when the pool closes so its plenty of time to party and it wont keep you up at night. if you sleep. :-) Rehab at the Hard Rock pools starts in the summer on Sunday's and is insanity, which you know if you've ever been there or have seen it on tv. IF you dont want to be subject to the biggest pool party in the world over the summer during a trip to Vegas, then dont stay here... Its crazy insane. If your on a family vacay and are looking for a nice relaxing time at the pool with the kids, then dont stay here... if you are looking for all that, then by all means STAY HERE. The rooms are amazing as to be expected. I stayed in the Paradise Tower on the 16th floor and got a room that overlooked the entire pool area and bit of the strip so the view was awesome. The rooms are super comfortable and are a really good size. Nice bathrooms, huge showers, double sinks with seating area, 40" flatscreen tv with cable and pay per view, wi-fi, mp3 stereos, king or queen size super comfortable beds, desk area, table and chair sitting area, closet and drawer area with iron and ironing board, in room safe, mini refridgerator (be careful tho, if you eat or drink anything, you have to pay for it. and its usually expensive. i took what they had in there, out of mine and used mine for a fridge to stock my drinks and leftovers) My room was VERY quiet too. The hotel seemed packed and really busy but it wasnt loud in the rooms from outside hall noise or noisy neighbors. My room package came with free WiFi access so im not sure at what people are talking about them charging for WiFi. I thought it was free since they do charge a "resort-fee" at something like $18-$20 per night but it may not be free. Its SUPER quick high speeds and I was able to run my laptop on it playing online graphic intensive console games, music, and hd movies. i also connected my phone and tablet without an issue. The room service was great too. Fairly quick and really nice and knowledgeable. They will drop off and pick up everything you order so you dont have to take your dishes and uneaten items anywhere. The food was good and you get a really good amount of everything. I seemed to have leftovers constantly. Only thing is, the room service is expensive. Althought, sometimes it's better then having to walk to a restaurant and sit somewhere while you eat or having to drive to a fast food spot nearby. If you want to lay in your comfortable bed, rest, eat, and chill, then use the room service. Sometimes, if you get a good deal on Groupon or something like that, they will throw in free room service credits. i got $100 free on mine so that was perfect. Housekeeping is prompt and fast and they kept my room really clean. I left all my stuff laying all over the floor one night and left early in the morning for a gambling session then came back to everything picked up and laid on the bed in a neat stack. (shirts, magazines, stuff, etc) Always had clean towels, toilet paper, and toiletries, The casino is nice and has lots of tables, machines and bars to play at. It's not that big so you can stick to what you like without having to search for it. id say its about the size of The Palms casino floor. At nights on the weekends the place gets jumping with dancers on platform stripper poles and rock music. The bartenders are all great and fast. Drinks are pricey but their is a 2 for 1 happy hour on sun-thur from 12am to 8pm so if your starting late thats a pretty good deal. There is smoking inside of course, but the ceilings are decently high so its not too smokey inside like some other casinos. The staff and service at the HRH is great and some of the best ive ever experienced. From check in to check out, i was impressed. Efficiency, knowledge, and professionalism is all key and every staff member i encounted, had that. From front desk to pool boy. All in all, the Hard Rock Hotel was an incredible experience and i'll definitely stay there again. i dont understand all the negative reviews. Unless i just stayed during a good time of year and missed all the drama. 2 Thumbs up for the HRH. Book it, thank me later.

Reviews.Title: “If you party and drink this is your place”
Reviews.Author: Sypris1982
Reviews.Content: This place is not for the average. The crowd is a little on the young side and it is noisy everywhere. The rooms are "ok" but you can hear everything next door. Not really a family place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my room.”
Reviews.Author: hibi428
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock in order to be close to UNLV. I was there for 5 nights and loved my room. I had a king suite in the HRH tower. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom spectacular. The spa was delightful. My complaints - the $18 resort fee is silly. The fitness center is large by hotel standards but otherwise fairly ordinary. There is no other amenity (at least not in the winter) warranting the resort fee. Room service was good - good food and fast service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible”
Reviews.Author: cal_woodside
Reviews.Content: In my effort to find a hotel that is fun, but decent in Vegas I attempted the Hard Rock Hotel. First of all, I reserved a "City View" Suitewith one King Bed which looked great on the website. I checked in and was assigned my room. When I got to my room, first it had two queen beds..not a huge deal. I open up my curtains to look at my "city view" and I discover that I am looking into the parking garage directly and two gentlmen are urinating in front of me. So that was great. I go back to desk and ask if there is a possibility to change rooms and the agent says "what exactly don't you like about your room" I say first it has two queen beds which I can deal with, but I reserved a city room and I look literally into the garage and there are two men there relieving themself outside my window. She tells me ok you are lucky as I park in that garage for work and I usually look into the rooms at naked people. I told her that is fascinating news, but I am not really into it. She then tells me the room is what I paid for as "City View" at the Hard rock means it is not a pool view and you look at the garage in most of the rooms. City like. WOW. So for an upgrade charge of $30 per night she can switch me to the other side of the building which looks at the pool. So now I am up to 180 per night at a hotel that normally charges not more than $100 and I am looking into another building and a pool. The upgraded room was very much like the orignal room, smelled like baby oil which was not ok. The service was not great. Upon checkouot after having just a really horrible few days, the agent asks me "how was your stay?" I reply it was actually really bad, probably one of the worst ever. She then replies "Ok then have a great day" and handed me my receipt. So I am thinking they are pretty much aware the hotel is not a super great place, but is a step above like Motel 6 for example.

Reviews.Title: “Party and rock and roll style”
Reviews.Author: Retrorich
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Casino Towers which are the ones directly in the main building, accessible opposite the main check in. What to expect: Rooms - very cool and stylish in a rock and roll way. Zebra like black and white carpet, oversized headboard with black fabric, dark wood and metal. white sheets and comforter--amazingly comfortable bed! Big rooms The lobby- yeah, its going to get loud and sloppy. If you're young and want to get drunk this is the place. Come to party at this hotel. And not necessarily if you want to see the strip though because on busy weekends you're looking at lines as long as 40 people to get a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “What a Mistake!”
Reviews.Author: Anne009
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin. The front desk is incompetent and negligent. We asked for adjoining rooms, were reassured that we had them when we checked in, and discovered that our rooms were about half a mile from each other. When we tried to call the desk to complain, we were put on hold for so long we finally had to call guest services to even talk to anyone. My impulse right then was to try to find another hotel, but we had paid in advance for a "package deal," another mistake. The rude concierge told us that there was no public transportation to the Strip, (the location is very inconvenient), so we shelled out big bucks for cab fare, only to discover on the last day of our stay that there was an hourly shuttle. They never informed us about the resort fee (the pool was closed and the internet costs .25/minute, so I don't know what this fee is for) and tried to tack on charges at every opportunity. I got home yesterday to find three bogus charges on my account and, of course, can't reach anyone to discuss them. I'm cancelling my card (another inconvenience) because I don't trust that they won't put additional charges on my account. This outfit banks on people just accepting extra charges and shoddy treatment. Stay away at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel oversold, reservation not honored”
Reviews.Author: smsinatra
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at all of the major properties in Las Vegas. I have stayed at HRH 4 times. At check in on 2/21/12 we were informed by the hotel manager Matthew that the hotel had been oversold. And despite having a valid prepaid reservation the HRH would be unable to accommodate my wife and I. The hotel manager was apologetic and polite and explained that he would be moving us to another property at his expense. He would be refunding our reservation, and inviting us back for free accommodations at the HRH at a later date. It was late, we were tired from traveling, and I was not in the mood to argue. I made the mistake of trusting that the accomodations would be comparable to what we had expected when making a reservation with the HRH. We were transported to a renovated motel complex near the HRH. It was not what we were expecting and certainly not consistent with the accomodations at the HRH or any other Las Vegas property we are use to staying at. The small motel lobby was crowded with people who, let's just say, made us feel uncomfortable... When we got into our ground level motel room, my wife cried. She felt unsafe and did not sleep. In the morning we moved to a hotel on the strip. What makes this situation so bad is that the HRH never refunded our payment as they had promised. We received no formal communication from the HRH concerning the future complimentary stay that we were promised. It's highly unlikely that we will ever return to the HRH. Not because the hotel was oversold, but because the manager did not follow through on the promises he made to us.

Reviews.Title: “Saved my trip!”
Reviews.Author: MJhagroo
Reviews.Content: We were originally staying at The Tropicana on the strip. However after waking up to someone robbing us (while we were in the room at The Tropicana - see my review of that hotel), we changed to The Hard Rock Hotel and Casino (which is about a mile or so off the strip). It was interesting that we ended up there, because we had been debating between those two hotels and chose the one on the strip. I really wish I had picked the Hard Rock from the beginning. The rooms are spacious and the decor is modern. The Casino rivals those on the strip. The club, Vanity is awesome and frequented by some of the rich and famous. The only thing is that we were leaving on a Tuesday and there wasn't much to do at the hotel on Monday night other than gamble (so we had to go hang out on the strip again). Also, even though the hotel is only about a mile away from the strip, I wouldn't walk it. Some of the area in between seemed a bit questionable. All in all, moving my party to The Hard Rock Hotel saved our Vegas trip!!!! Thank you HRH!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: chefaleslie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cool. The sound track, the memorabillia, the room's all very cool. The room was big HRH corner suite. The bed was good. 2 TV's in the room with Hard rock music in the rooms. The Casino is small, and the whole hotel is far from the strip. the Shuttle only runs from 10-5 once a hour and drops you off at some mall on the strip, so you need to pay for taxis to get a round. They should run taxies every 30 minutes untill 1am.

Reviews.Title: “Fun relaxed vibe”
Reviews.Author: MicheleL1980
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Hard Rock. The memorabilia was really cool to look at and added a special something to the hotel. We upgraded our room to one in the HRH tower and it was absolutely gorgeous. Huge room with cool stereo unit built into the wall. Rain shower, bathtub. It was great! I have seen a lot of reviews saying it is a young party crowd, but I didn't really see too much of that. Very cool vibe, loved it! The only downer is that it is a bit far from the strip. It looks close...but it's not. Probably a 30 minute walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice For Off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: RachelDH
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the staff here! They were marvelous! We stayed in the HRH Towers (all suite) and definitely worth the extra you'll pay. The room was clean, however, when we asked the maid to come back in an hour as we were in the room, she did not. However, the front desk staff did rectify this with a small room service comp. So all turned out well. The room was clean and spacious. It is recommended for 2 adults and 2 children, however, I did not see that the couches pulled out, so the kids would be sleeping on the couch cushions. The minibar was stocked with all sorts of goodies, from 'Romance' kits to the usual. Huge tub, huge shower. They have like 7 pools. Very good for romance and couples but would not recommend for people with children staying for more than a couple days.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting to see”
Reviews.Author: familyfour1
Reviews.Content: Overnight stay for business was good. Pros: The bed was SUPER comfy and the hotel itself is a feast for the eyes. Loads of pictures, guitars, clothing, etc from the world of rock. Cons: Poor room lighting (probably good if you're bringing a stranger in, HORRIBLE if you want to actually see anything. The bathroom was like a cave). Late opening of the fitness center (yes, 6am is late). It isn't on the strip. Being the Hard Rock, they should have live bands nightly.

Reviews.Title: “Lose your inhibition!”
Reviews.Author: Leila1234
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews, first and foremost be fair and carefree. We arrived Sunday 03-04-12, was prepared for the worst. Had my reservations copy printed, I purchased HRH Tower 2 beds with strip view. 1st front desk said she needed proof I had purchased HRH Tower room. She was going to give me a room in the casino tower. I showed her my paperwork and gave me room on 6th floor with view of parking lot if you tilt to the left a strip view but it was a joke! Waited for another room as purchased a second one idenitied as HRH Tower King Corner Room view of pool and strip. Ahhh, perfect! 2nd front desk was more accommodating, she had a heart & more empathy! She gave me a room on the 8th floor (with excellent views of the strip and pool as mentioned) instead of the 6th floor reason being my uncle is on wheel chair. He needed to be at close to my reach. Overall, my uncle and mom enjoyed there stay! Just remember the staff at least most of them are there to help and make the stay pleasurable! The beds are just so comfortable, like sleeping in a bed of clouds. Security excellent! Too far from strip.

Reviews.Title: “HRH Towers not that royal.”
Reviews.Author: escholte
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the HRH Tower entrance around 7pm to check in. After being taken for ride, literally and figuratively, by a taxi driver who took the longest route to the hotel we had to struggle through the doors with our luggage as there was no one to take it from us. We struggled through doors that open outwards to the check-in desk. Even though we had booked a non-smoking king there wasn't one ready for us at this time of the day! We could wait for 45 minutes to have one cleaned or take one on a smoking floor. The other option was to pay $35 for an upgrade to the next level room. After a 12 hour flight from London we just wanted to get to a room so agreed but afterwards felt this could have been waived as a gesture of goodwill. The room was spacious but slightly sterile. Nice deep bath, very comfortable bed. We had a nice meal at 35 Steaks and Martinis. Check out was quick and uneventful. The taxi fare to the hotel was $36 to the hotel and $11 back - our return driver must have known a quicker way obviously. We filled in an online guest card and have been offered a 1-night stay but don't think we will take up the offer.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY ROOMS CAUSED SCABIES”
Reviews.Author: Experienced T
Reviews.Content: Arrived at around 11 am December 20, 2011 and was told only one room would be available (had requested adjoining rooms) We told them that would be fine because we wanted to grab lunch. We could put all of our luggage in the one room while waiting for the 2nd room to be cleaned. I was told they would call when the 2nd room was cleaned. At approximately 7:30 at night I FINALLY got a call that our 2nd room was clean. We had dinner plans so went up and changed, then right out to dinner/show. As we left, we checked the door and noticed it didn't lock.... I called down to the front desk and asked for it to be fixed. I locked it from the inside and told them to access that room from the adjoining room. When we returned, the door was working and we went right to bed. In the morning... we got up to shower and .... NO TOWELS AT ALL! We also couldnt find the remote control for the TV. As we searched for the remote we found.... A CRISPY DIRTY WASHCLOTH IN OUR BED!!! YES!!! I called down to the front desk and informed them of our situation. They brought towels and said they would let the manager know. All the kids slept in the other room, but when the boys woke up they were complaining of their bed and bad rest. We could tell that the bed looked "broken" in the middle and had a large V shape slant. This made the boys "slide" out of bed. I lifted up the sheets to see if maybe it was the feather bed only to find a large stain on the mattress what looked like kool-aid or wine. I thought that hotels got rid of soiled and broken beds???? I let the front desk know about this situation when I went into the lobby. The receptionist said she would have a manager contact me. We ordered room service a couple nights... only the food so cold or hard that even the kids wouldn't/couldn't eat it. I WAS NEVER CONTACTED BY ANY MEMBER OF MANAGEMENT ABOUT ANY OF THE ABOVE ISSUES!!!! To top it off when I got home I had a sudden case of athletes feet.... I have very healthy feet and this is NOT a regular occurrence. Then.... sometime after our visit BOTH boys that slept in the broken bed had a strange rash. We have been treating it with benadryl, creams etc with no luck until I finally took my son to the doctor. Because BOTH boys had the rash, it is assumed that they caught it on that trip since that is the only time they have shared sleeping arrangements in the same bed (TWO doctors confirmed) I finally took my son to the doctor and he was diagnosed with SCABIES... He had to go through two treatments. According to the prescription it can take up to four weeks for the MITES to quit itching in the skin and for the rash to disappear. This is one of the WORST and DISGUSTING experiences I have EVER had at a hotel. We all travel a lot and I don't care if it is fancy... but it should be CLEAN! I filled out an online survey about my visit and STILL never heard from anyone until this email. I wrote a letter and they denied all claims and didn't even apolgize!! They just sent a condesending email about how their hotel meets "standards" and how scabies is contracted. Trust me, I am well educated about scabies after staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the atmosphere at HRH”
Reviews.Author: amorri2
Reviews.Content: On 3-4-2012 I was in Vegas and made a reservation before leaving North Carolina. I loved the Hard Rock Hotel but when It came for me to reserve a room I was told that they were out of King size rooms and was told to up grade. It appeared that they didn't want to honor my coupon purchase from the website Groupon for a Sunday night stay at a$59.00 rate. I called the night before check in and reserved a king size room that was then available, at check in time I was told that all reservation were not guaranteed and had to upgrade for $50.00 extra dollars. After refusing to upgrade I was given a beautiful suite which was dirty; left over trash and a dirty bathroom. I had did all the site seeing I could do and wanted to relax in a clean room.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Oscar S
Reviews.Content: We just got home from the HRH in Vegas. We had a blast. It was a great vegas experience the staff was very helpful with our every whim we loved it

Reviews.Title: “Motley Crue rocked the house!”
Reviews.Author: musicfan72
Reviews.Content: As usual the Hard Rock delivered an AWESOME time. Motley Crue did as well. DOn't be fooled becasue tey don't sit riht on the Strip. If your in Vegas and not staying at and The Hard Rock Hotel you don't realize what you are missing...Great rooms, awesome and friendly staff (especially at the Registration Desk and Housekeeping), incredible food, and one the coolest Casinos in Vegas. Where else can you party like a rock star and be treated like one as well. Plus, the beds are like sleeping in heaven. One really cool touch, we had a vintage photo of the Monkees and Jack Nicholson and other photo of Fiona Apple over looking our beds, a Kurt Cobain portrait in the entry way. The bathroom mirrors were sick with lights embedded into them! You will want to see a show at The Joint and eat at Lucky's after the show. The food and service are outstanding. We went back to our room after the Motely Crue show to unwind after screaming our heads off for two hours and then went down to Lucky's and didn't even have to wait to be seated. Try the waffles with fresh strawberries and cream. Best my wife and daughter ever had, period. I just loved the spicy Bloody Mary I got to go with my country fried steak and eggs. We found that Pink Taco has the most mouthwatering taquitos that are filled with potatoes and even better - deliciousness. My 17 yr old. daughter has literally been "dreaming" about them for over a year now since the last time we visited. Be sure and get a side of Guacamole for their fresh cooked corn chips. Just the perfect amount of garlic. The Margarita's are just the tip of the iceberg...loved the Peach ones the best. Overall, we had one of the best times we have ever had and can't wait to go back. 2 for 2! Two great shows and two incredible weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Locals love the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: nutpea40
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Hard Rock Hotel. It is just a fun place to stay for young and not-so-old people. The rooms are spectacular and very comfortable. Love the decor. We always ask for a room high up so that we can be sure to get a great view of Las Vegas, and we have never been disappointed. Even though we live in Las Vegas, we try to stay at the Hard Rock whenever we can--at least twice a year.

Reviews.Title: “Average, but NO BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: yvrgirl69
Reviews.Content: Was in Las Vegas mid-February on a Groupon for the Hard Rock Hotel. It was a decent hotel with a definite "rock" vibe. Motley Crue were in residency at the time, so it may have seemed more like that than normal, but all the staff and dealers seemed relatively young with a more laid-back rocker style. We ate at Pink Taco - was decent, nothing overly special, but good food & drinks, the best food we ate at the hotel was probably at the 24 hour place, just above the 'centre bar', in fact that's where all the hotel's room service comes from as well. It's bigger than you think and they get you in and out in decent time and with a friendly attitude...no b.s. Once we finally got to our room, which was in Paradise Tower w/pool view, it was pretty big with a nice bathroom with separate shower/toilet. The only downside to the bathroom is the lighting and I find a lot of hotels screw this up - better lighting, please!! The black floor, black sinks and dark everything makes it cool, but at least give people (particularly women, who need decent lighting for make-up) the choice of brighter lighting!!! I beg you. Otherwise great room, NO BED BUGS, super-comfy beds you really sink into...which is usually the case after a night in Vegas;) Oh, btw, DO NOT even think about touching any of the 'mini-bar' items or anything in the fridge. The moment you pick it up, you're room is charged!! We knew this, so didn't get screwed, but I could see it happening! Overall the hotel was good enough. I likely wouldn't choose to stay here again, mainly on the basis that it's off the strip and about a 30 minute walk or $15 cab ride either way. On the other hand, if that doesn't matter to you and especially if you're seeing a show at The Joint, it's a decent place at a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Great strip view!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela G
Reviews.Content: I went only for one night with one of my best friends who moved to LA & I was staying with her for a week. We drove to Vegas in January, met up with good friends and got a cheap deal to stay at the hard rock with a strip view. Really, who cares about the room? I mean, your in VEGAS! You want to be out, not in the room. All that matters is that you have a good fridge to put your drinks in, a good bed to sleep in, and a good bathroom to get ready and look good! The strip view is awesome though....got a queen room and it was perfect for us. Two people slept in the bed comfortably as it was a king bed. It's so close to everything...just a block down to Bellagio where we went for the breakfast buffet, and block down to Ceasars Palace for shopping. Vegas was one of the best nights I have ever had. So many hotels to choose from so it's hard to choose...my brothers and friends choose a different one every year. Hard rock has crazy suites during that's definitely good to use during the winter. Because it's vegas, I can't stay in the same place every time...I gotta try all the good hotels...but I'd def come back to try out their suite. I walked past one of them & saw it while maids where cleaning it and got tempted to book it, but it was fully booked. Definitely get the suite for a party...awesome pool table and entertainment. By the way...definitely go to XS nightclub. Best night ever!

Reviews.Title: “Cheaters and Crooks (That is a nice as I can say it)”
Reviews.Author: travelrob
Reviews.Content: We paid in advance for three nights at a FIVE STAR mystery suite from Bookit that turned out to be the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino property. We arrived a day late due to problems with our flights. We, of course, called them with our intentions of arriving in time for the last two days. We knew better than to expect a refund since the rules are clearly stated that no refunds will be given but they also charged us for a RESORT FEE when we weren't even there. But that is minor compared to the big rip off. Our five star mystery suite had turned into a two and a half star room in another tower. The room was the size of your regular Best Western room with an oversized chair and absolutely nothing else that you wouldn't find in any two or three star room anywhere in Las Vegas. We knew that the five star HRH was nice from a trip there last year and that was what we expected. The front desk (including the manager on duty) gave us the old run around and the nonsense explanation that our room had gone to the Motley Crue fans who were overrunning the property. They told us that the picture of the room on Bookit was a "mistake." We tried and tried to call Bookit and, of course, we couldn't get through at the time (check in) when we really needed them. In conclusion, I expect that this switcheroo happens all the time and that Bookit is a willing participant. Don't trust the Hard Rock. If you want a five star property the chances of getting it here is slim.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Luvtotravellinda
Reviews.Content: Our weekend getaway was actually a gift - so we can't be too critical. Our room in the casino tower was fine and had a great view of the pool. The beds were comfortable, however the coverlet was tattered and torn. A towel from the previous guest was left hanging on the back f the bathroom door. We always visit the Hard Rock, but our first time to be overnight guests. We arrived at 3pm and our room wasnt ready, which was ok but we never got a call that our room was ready. We finally checked back ourselves and were able to check in. Strange encounter in the casino with a "hustler" type person asking to use my sims card from my iphone - made me very uncomfortable!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the corner suite”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNauta
Reviews.Content: We arrived in our first room and it was not what we had ordered. We immediately called the front desk to explain and they stated they didn't have another king bed room and offered to move us to the other tower (paradise tower) to a king corner suite room, with floor to ceiling window across both sides, for free. What an amazing room. Food was ok at the in hotel restaurant and they have a $7.77 special that is not on the menu and you have to ask for it by name, the 7-7-7 gamblers special. The special is a rib-eye 8 oz. steak, potato and side salad....not too bad for the price. This hotel is about a good mile walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Let there be rock”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the HRH, and I was impressed. The entire staff was friendly and engaging. I loved the variety of rock music played. The patrons were younger (25-33). Although the hotel is not on the strip, that didn't hinder my Vegas experience. I will definately stay again. I can't wait for the Rehab pool party.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything”
Reviews.Author: Jill P
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the HRH tower suites and LOVED IT. Felt pampered from arrival to departure. Tons of personal attention and very attentive staff. Liked that it was a separate part of the building and was nice to be able to go from the fun and noisy atmosphere of the casino to the serenity of the suites tower. Always quiet on the floors. Fun to look at the memorabilia all over the casino, lots of it. The bed was so comfortable. The shuttle to the mall/strip came in handy instead of taking a taxi. The suite was beautiful and roomy. Nice variety of restaurants from super casual to fancy. Loved the shower coming from the ceiling. Had a great time and cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: kar344
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in the Casino Tower at the Hard Rock for four nights in February 2012. Every person we dealt with was nice and helpful. The hotel is nice, too, but a little young and noisy for my taste. Checkin was fast; elevators were fast. As usual in Las Vegas, none of the rooms have coffeepots. The shower was weird--the showerhead was WAY high, and the tub edge was too high. The beds were exceptionally comfortable. We ate at Mr. Lucky's one night; it was fine, but not great. The free shuttle runs once an hour from the hotel to the Fashion Show Mall, but it stops at five p.m. Overall, this is a nice place. The main reason I probably won't stay at the Hard Rock again is simply the location. I like being able to walk out of my hotel and hop on the Deuce, and you can;'t do that at the Hard Rock. The Deuce is at least half a mile from the hotel, and even the regular bus only goes in one direction, so there is too much walking, or you have to take cabs. The concert (Motley Crue) was great, so I'm glad we stayed right there, but in the future, I'll be on the Strip or downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, great pool area”
Reviews.Author: Craig U
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days for a convention. It is a ways from the strip, although within walking distance. (Albeit a long trek) I would advise taking a cab at night, as Harmon ave. is dark, and has sections of construction where you walk on gravel. Being off the strip isn't a bad thing though, as it's much less busy than the ever cram-jammed strip sidewalks. If you want GREAT views, go to the top level of the HRH tower self park. (8th floor) To avoid high prices of the supplied goody bar on the dresser, walk across the street to the CVS pharmacy. A bottle of smart water is $7.50 on the goody bar, and if you so much as rattle something there, you're charged for it. (Everything sits on sensors) Same with the minibar, look but don't touch unless you want to pay premium price. The room is dark colors with dim lighting, so pack a flashlight. :-) The bed is comfy and has fluffy pillows and down comforter. I stayed in the off season, but still got sun on a lounge chair in 70 degree weather. A nice sunning place is on the 3rd floor of the center island building. Take the elevator to the top. The pool up there is heated, and has windows in the floor looking down into the dance floor below. The pool area was under construction, but was still amazing. There are hot tubs and pools everywhere. You literally need a pool map. I'd come back to the Hard Rock again in summer just for the pools here. The shower has a rain head, and is all slate tiled with thick glass doors. Those doors have big gaps though, and you end up with a flooded floor by the toilet. I just swabbed after every shower with a towel. The supplied shampoo and conditioner is nice. The casino is noisy, but show me one in Vegas that isn't. The room was quiet, although you hear people in the hallway to the point you wonder if the door isn't open a crack. A nice touch is your own HVAC. I like a cold room to sleep in, and it took it down to 60 degrees with no problem. There is a clock/radio with an iPOD jack. Forget the radio though, as about any FM station has static. The WiFi is only a couple of bars and is extra if you want to surf the 'net. (Despite the extra "resort fee" including it) Opening a browser only redirects to the sign up screen. The room has a safe in a cabinet which is nice for leaving stuff behind for the day. You set your own combo. To save time when returning after a day in Vegas, have your cabbie take you to the tower you're staying in. The HRH has a cab stand in the self park. The Paradise has a back casino entrance which is marked "self park" inside, and can be reached by driving around past the main entrance and down past the CVS pharmacy. I had breakfast in Lucky 7, but it was only so-so. The service was okay, but the food wasn't that good. For a fantastic breakfast, take a cab to the Golden Nugget and do the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the new HRH Tower”
Reviews.Author: ucrazykid
Reviews.Content: Checked in and got bumped up to the new HRH Tower. The suite was beautiful and very comfortable. I will definitely stay there again. What I really appreciated was its private entrance that allowed me to come and go without having to walk through the casino or wait in a taxi line. Being in Vegas on a business trip, this was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Meh--So Much Potential, Such Limited Delivery”
Reviews.Author: Incurable_Romantic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at HRH to kick off a vacation. Nothing major wrong, but set your expectations low to avoid being disappointed. It's several blocks from the strip, which would not be a big deal if the amenities at the hotel were a major draw, which they are not. We were surprised to be greeted by pole dancers in the middle of the hotel/casino lobby. Some definitely cool costumes and knick knacks on display from musicians ranging from Michael Jackson to the Stones, which was really fun to walk around and enjoy. The room was quite modern, but odd in some ways--for example, a bottle of wine in the room, but no wine glasses. Room service was a bit slow, expensive, and food was so-so; not bad, just mediocre. In sum, it was fine, but don't get your hopes up for a knock-out event.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hard rock”
Reviews.Author: Crueslt
Reviews.Content: I've stayed all over Vegas and then we stayed here I will never stay anywhere else casino is awesome beds are awesome. Clean and cool atmosphere. everyone is always really nice

Reviews.Title: “Great Rock & Roll atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Just_Mel42
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for the Motley Crue concert. Overall it's a nice hotel. I did have one issue when we checked in. I had requested a non-smoking room and this was confirmed at check-in, however when we got to our room it was clearly a smoking room. I was then told that all the non-smoking rooms were occupied that night, but was able to move to a non-smoking room the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Who cares if it's off the strip just abit”
Reviews.Author: WCC964
Reviews.Content: This place is the s##t. Great people with no attitudes, tattoos, affliction clothes and hard rock, can you really ask for more. FYI tip the desk girls at check- in for a cool upgrade. I tipped $100 for a 4 night stay and got upgraded to an awesome suite. And the Rehab party needs to introduction, crazy

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much....”
Reviews.Author: S R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel about a week ago, along with my friend and his wife. This was our first time ever visiting Las Vegas, and the Hard Rock definitely did not bring the 'A Game' that you would expect from an iconic hotel and brand name. There is a laundry list of things that went wrong, or had to be fixed while we were there. Between our rooms being switched at THEIR request after 2 nights, the lack of hot water in the showers(and the shower handle halfway broken), the valet slamming my friend's hand in the taxi door, and the list goes on and on! The Hard Rock is definitely a party hotel, which we loved the thought of. It felt as if we were more of an inconvenience, rather than "guests." Maybe if we went into this trip not expecting a great time, it wouldn't have been that much of a disappointment. We'll definitely go to Vegas again, but I doubt the Hard Rock will see much of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay if you are going to the JOinT!!”
Reviews.Author: Deuceters22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at HRH for the Motley Crue Shows at the Joint. The Casino and Hotel are very nice, not too crazy busy and we were there on a very busy weekend as the Crue closed out their residency at the Hard Rock. We stayed in the older part of the hotel and rooms were very nice with rock star appeal. Pink Taco was excellent for lunch, dinner, or late night! Casino was definitely nice and kept your interest with rock star memorbilia throughout! It is off strip but only a short cab ride to it. Definitely reccommend if you are going to a concert at the joint - which is an excellent venue, they offered concert hotel package that was a great deal! Casino not as big as some of your others on the strip but still plenty big enough and can accomodate any gaming need!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but I was expecting more”
Reviews.Author: mee21
Reviews.Content: Based on the price of the room I was expecting more, but I guess your paying for a lot more than just the room. The restaurants were good and casino was fun. It was low season when we were there so the famous pool parties were not going on then. I would go back to this hotel but not before checking some others in Vegas out first.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: carey44
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Hard Rock on Feb 13th to the 15th in the Paradise Tower. Arrived at 8pm and check in was quick and easy. The paradise tower is about a 5-10min walk from the registration desk. Upon entering the room the first thing you notice is how dark the rooms are. The bathroom is very dark and even the vanity area is fairly dark. My wife did not like the lighting for doing her make up and I have to admit it was very dark. The rest of the room was ok. The bed was comfy and there is a 42" TV which had some excellent music channels as well as the normal tv channels. There also was a ipod docking clock radio.The room was clean and we had a nice view of the pool. The biggest problem beside the lighting was the noise level in the rooms. starting at about 6:00am you hear planes that fly right above the hotel quite often. Also they were working on the pool and you could hear the jack hammering non stop from 9am. So if you want to sleep in forget it. Overall for the price you can do better on the strip. Also the casino does not have a very good selection of slot machines. They are quick on giving you drinks and the sports booking room is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel and Casino - Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: calnevatraveler
Reviews.Content: This stay was for a family member who wanted to see the last Motley Crue concert on 2/19. I have stayed at this hotel many times over the last 15 years & have always been pleased with accommodations. In the early years, I had at least 2 dozen stays all in the casino tower adjoining the original pool. Before Wynn & Venetian came aboard, I always felt they had the best standard rooms in Vegas. In the last year, I have stayed at the HRH Tower several times usually in a Supreme King Suite. If you're an iPod/iPhone fanatic, bring all your devices because the HRH rooms are set up to ENHANCE, not just maximize your devices. You dock your devices in a docking station in the wall & it plays throughout the room's speakers. Didn't bring your devices? It's OK, they have a genre library that you can listen to which is probably better than what you have at home. I have stayed at suites all along the Strip & I would rate only the Wynn as having a better (standard) suite experience overall but HRH is "tops" in the aural experiences!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky new tower rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelmom810
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the HRH Tower suites and it was very nice. Like another reviewer stated it had it's own entrance and the wait was minimal compared to the line cicrcling around out in the lobby for the other 'Casino Tower' rooms. We had to move rooms initially however, because when we walked in to our first suite it was clear someone had been smoking in it and we found cigarette butts in the toilet. The decor was nice, but they put in white, cloth, couches and these appeared dirty. The shower and beds were amazing! Had friends in the 'Casino Tower' and their room was average. We ate and the Pink Taco and the service was great, the margaritas too. Overall, I would stay again, but only in the HRH Tower rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: TexHoward
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. The room was nice enough and the bed was very comfortable. I found the hotel to be VERY noisy with rock playing everywhere pretty much 24/7. Want to sleep pool-side and enjoy the sun to get over the hangover...forget it because they have speakers everywhere blasting music! there is nowhere to find peace and quiet.....a real shame as its a nice oasis. Motley Crue concert was amazing. I have stayed in many hotels round the world and NEVER have I been hit with a $20.00 per person resort fee on departure. What was this I asked? WELL its for the use of the pool and hot tub (That was closed) its for the WIFI internet (that never worked anywhere in the hotel the time we were there) its for the use of the room phone to make local calls ( had no one to call) its for complementary newspapers that I guess you have to ask for at the front desk because they don't deliver them to your room, its for the complimentary shuttle that takes you to the mall (which is paid for by the mall)...If you don't know about it the doormen certainly will not tell you and offer you a cab for $$ Its Nickel and Dime Money Grab which made me so angry that I asked to speak to the manager. After a lengthy conversation they removed it from my bill, which for 4 people was $360.00....that was in addition to paying $100 per night!! Before you book your trip ask if your hotel charges this...not all of them do. Its a RIP OFF for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: roadtriper1
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino Las Vegas February 2012. If you love music and music memoribilia this is a great place for you. The hotel was located about a mile from the main strip which is about a 15 to 20 minute walk. Keep that in mind if you plan on spending most of your time there. We stayed in the Casino Tower (older building) and although the rooms were a bit in need of some updating, our room was kept very clean and comfortable. The staff here was excellent, very friendly and helpful. Over all, I would recommend a stay at the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “HRH Tower Suites”
Reviews.Author: MissBirdy
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend at the Hard Rock Hotel in Las Vegas. I had a spectacular time in the new HRH Tower Suites. I stayed with a friend to see Motley Crue at the Joint and party away the weekend. ROOM: You have your own entrance with concierge and bell service. This cuts down the time at the check in line. The lobby is dark leather and very sedate. There is a side entrance to the nightclub Vanity so you don't have to stand in line for that either. The rooms are large and luxurious. Great bedding, towels, and amenities. I wish they gave you body gel, though, not just soap. There is a flat panel TV in the bedroom and in the sitting area. Great view of the pools and the strip. You can't use the HDMI input on the TV though. Lame! There is an iPod dock in the wall so you can play tunes in the sitting area. The room was surprisingly quiet for a party hotel. Bathroom has two sinks, large soaking tub, and HUGE three person shower with rain shower head or regular. The JOINT: This is a great venue for seeing a show. Every seat is a good seat and the General Admissions floor is right up close and personal. There is a large bar area where you can stand with a drink and still enjoy the show. The bathrooms are maintained by an attendant so they stay pretty clean. CASINO: Very friendly casino staff, helped me to learn Craps and made the evening entertaining. The players card is easy to use and even I got a nice comp for not much play. The circle bar is fun and the bartenders are cute. Most of the hotel guests + staff appear to be <25 years old. ETC: Mr Lucky's is a nice diner style restaurant. Ask for the $7.77 steak and shrimp special. Pancakes are awesome. You can spend your $$$ at the gift shop, upscale lingerie, convenience store, and Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “First stay... Might or might not be back”
Reviews.Author: taimgxe
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Feb. 19 for a 2 night stay. I bought the Motley Crue package for the last concert and upgraded to the HRH all suite hotel. First impression: Lobby, really nice; leads directly into casino. Easy to get around... However, the suite was in need of some cleaning... In fact, the carpet looked so dirty that even though the beds and bathroom looked "clean" it made me suspect the entire cleaning process. Therefore, I called down to request another room... Was on hold for a long time tot he point I went down and made the request in person. Got another room and that room had a funny smell... again, the carpet looked like it needed to be clean bad even though the bed and bathroom appeared to be clean... my wife wanted to rest so I let it stand. Anyway, the package I bought was for one night... Really Hard Rock?!?! Why only 1 night? I ended up purchasing a Groupon deal for an additional night stay. Anyway, I thought I had confirmed prior to arrival about the two stay package and I even inquired upon check in if I had to do anything to make sure the stay was smooth. I was told both times that everything was in order and that I wouldn't have check out and check in for both stays. With the Groupon deal, I was given some vouchers for free drinks and credit. However, I was told that I would have to wait till the day the Groupon deal was active to receive the promotion... So the next morning just prior to the check out time I went to the front desk and asked for my vouchers. I was told that I had to go the main Hard Rock reservation desk to get them... Why? What if I wanted to just stay at the HRH for the entire stay and not venture out into the casino or other hotels? So, I finally went to retrieve my vouchers and then we went sightseeing/shopping. Upon our return to the room, our keys would not work. I had to go to the front desk to get my keys reactivated. At this point, I asked to speak to a manager. When approached by a manager I explained my frustration with the service that I had received... I told them my first impression of the hotel customer service and room was not very nice... I was asked what did I want and I said nothing other than to express my opinion and to make it known that something like this would not make me feel like coming back... I was offered a $50.00 food and beverage credit for my trouble, which I accepted. However, even that ended up having a caveat. We ate at Mr. Lucky's and thought it would be comped because of the credit. It was except for the tip... Really...??? A $6.00 would have to be paid in cash at check out? What..? The waiter would not get his tip from the hotel credit??? Pretty bad if you ask me... Anyway, I will say that the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino is a nice place... Mr. Lucky's was good for meals... The wait staff there was great!! Food was pretty good, too! Try the Strip steak and shrimp deal for $7.77 and the All You Can Eat Prime Rib dinner for $9.99. Both were pretty good. Won money at the casino and enjoyed the concert... but I am not sure I would come back unless I have a good deal (another Groupon, perhaps) with all of the other casino hotels in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but could use a deep cleaning”
Reviews.Author: islandfix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock for the Motley Crue show last Sunday. The hotel was great as far as design and decor go. I wished they had more retail shops, being so far from the strip. Due to the time of year and weather, there wasn't much in terms of places to just relax, as there would be in the summer. However, the upside to the weather was that it made the walk to Planet Hollywood and the strip reasonable. It didn't seem far at all, except maybe a little coming home because the temperature dropped a bit. The room and hotel in general could benefit from a deep scrubbing. The bathroom was a little worn out. The floor in the bathroom was dirty, I just averted my eyes from the corners of the room and tried not to think about what was lurking on the dirty doorknobs, etc. The bed was comfy and the room was reasonably quiet. We got a Groupon deal which did mention the resort fee and taxes and still came to a good deal once we took advantage of the drink coupons and meal voucher. The concert venue was Awesome, I will say that!

Reviews.Title: “Fun but pricey”
Reviews.Author: NC_Smith
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2/17 -2/19 ok rooms nothing to brag about but the bed was great. Stayed in casino tower 3rd floor. I was expecting a little more considering the price. It is off the strip so all the stuff to do is a cab ride away. I had a friend staying in the newer tower and his room was way better. I think it's called the hard rock or paradise not sure but it's newer. At checkout was charged 20 resort per day that I did not know anything about until checkout. The table games were good, so was sportsbook and the vanity club was cool place. Not much interaction with staff other table game people which were cool.

Reviews.Title: “As always.... Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Milhouse34
Reviews.Content: This is now firmly, no more discussion required, rooted as our official bi-annual boys trip location. We are 3 years running with the HRH as our SuperBowl home, & last year we added a 'ReHab' weekend to the agenda. By far the favourite casino in Las Vegas to gamble in. To the point that I will always gamble when I'm here, but may not in many of the other casinos. Great music & mostly cool dealers. The addition of the HRH tower & the accompanying rooms make this a for sure for next year (& hopefully this summer) as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Perki
Reviews.Content: We stayed one Saturday night so we could enjoy ourselves at the Mötley Crüe concert and not have to worry about driving home.
