We had a kingbed pool view room on the 14th floor in the Paradise Tower and it was wonderful. Great beds and bedding, loved the decor, looked just like the picture and seemed to have been recently updated so nice and modern. Will definitely consider getting a room here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service is completely unsatisfactory”
Reviews.Author: dszmDenver
Reviews.Content: We are on day three of a four day stay. Our room has not been cleaned once. Today we went as far as to ask the maid to please clean our room, and the room still remains unmade. We spoke to management this evening and they did try to correct it. Clean towels and soap were brought to our room, but the staff did not empty the trash or take the dirty towels even after we requested these services. Management did comp part of stay after I explained that cleaning the room a few hours before check-out would not help the situation. The rooms are good sized and well furnished. However, the vibrations from the Vanity Club can be felt throughout the entire HRH wing making it difficult to sleep before 2:30 or 3:00 on weekends. The spa is amazing. It is easy to spend half a day enjoying the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “YOU MUST BE KINDING”
Reviews.Author: Omar B
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel the smell was terrible when you get to a casino/hotel the smell should not be the first thing you feel about the place. At check told we would be charged 18 dollars for amenities at 7pm the amenites were closed shuttle to outlets and fitness center. Give me a break. An paper thin walls you hear everything outside the room and in the rooms next store good thing the drunks passed out. The photos are wrong the rooms are dark and ugly nothing like the photoshop pictures published just a ripoff for the cost never again.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping is Questionable to say the least...”
Reviews.Author: MomEof2
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Hard Rock hotel for the Magic show convention (clothing related... not Chris Angel related), which consequently was also during Valentine's weekend in Vegas. We've stayed here before, and since it's Vegas we rarely stay in our room. We gamble, love to dine, and I love to shop... awe the perfect trifecta. The hotel was busy, I mean really busy, we had twenty people waiting to either check-in or check out while we were waiting, which was a drag. But, we had a really nice representative who checked us in. Fast forward a couple of hours, and we find our questionable housekeeping episode. I decided to take a shower, and I as I stepped out of the tub my eyes transfixed on the 6x6 huge glass bathroom mirror. This is what the previous visitor of room 611 wrote in the foggy mirror " We will be waiting at Pink Taco(this is a taco bar located in the lobby area of the hotel )..."explicative", along with a drawing of a women's legs open with an anatomically correct depiction of a women's nether region. It wasn't the drawing or the writing that eerked me, but rather that housekeeping OBVIOUSLY did not wipe down the mirror. On the second night, and after another housekeeping "attempt", the mirror was still left unclean. Since housekeeping was lacking, I started to get grossed out at all the possible other areas that were left uncleaned i.e. bed sheets, toilet, and desks. Other than the gross housekeeping, the hotel area was nice. Here are the pros and cons in a nutshell: Pros: Great price contemporary room Free shuttle to the strip Cons: $10 cab far to the strip $20 resort fee, for what exactly I don't know??? housekeeping??? high minimum for table gambling ~$20 P.S. The concierge was a joke, the blonde woman who claimed to be concierge was rude and unhelpful. Example: There were two people waiting in the concierge line, myself and this other guy. After this lady helped the guy, she got on the phone and then "signaled" to me to wait while she chatted. I'm not in the customer service game, but I think the guest standing in front of you is more important that a guest that's on the phone. That's just my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Veronica J
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. Great bang for your buck. Arrived on Sunday for five days and were upgraded to a deluxe suite in the Casino Tower. Some previous reviews have stated that the Casino Tower was loud with dirty rooms. Our room was very clean and quiet, even with Motley Crue performing. It's location is about a ten minute walk to the middle of the strip, however, would not recommend walking it in the dark. Only draw back would be the resort fees.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Christine R
Reviews.Content: This is too far to walk to the strip, you are stuck taking a cab everyday to make your way back in the evening. Was told by doorman not safe to walk back at night. There is a shuttle once every hour during the day but gets full so you may be stuck cabing it also. What is up with resot fees, paid $90 for 4 days for what exactly - nothing avaialble except a casino and restaurants, no indoor pool and can't swim in November, what a rip off! Next time will be staying on the strip and somewhere with no resort fees so don't be fooled that you are paying a bit less since you end up spending it on cabs and fees anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: classyk
Reviews.Content: I'm not a real die-hard rock-n-roll fan, but this hotel was nice. The bed was comfy, the room was clean and I loved decor. Our room was in the paradise tower and it had an outstanding view at night. The memorabilia added to the theme of the hotel and it was in close proximity to the strip; by foot it was only 15 minutes. We didn't eat in the hotel, but friends ate at Johnny Smalls and recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 1000YardStare
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the HRH in Sept 2010 at the end of a 4 week road trip and stayed for 3 nights over a weekend. I have been to Vegas over 8-10 times in the past few years and this is by far the best room/hotel i have stayed in. The room itself was spacious and spotless and very rock n roll the highlight(s) were the bed it was soooooooo comfy and big we were both impressed never experienced another bed like it before or since, the other major highlight was the view we were in thr tower block and thought with the great price we paid we would get a crappy view boy were we surprised we were very high up with a panoramic vista of the pool and the Vegas skyline a brilliant spectacle to just chill out and watch. A word of warning if you want a quiet time by the pool do not arrive at the weekend when the Rehab event is on as it can get loud and raucous but it is a site to behold and if you like watching loads of Yanks getting loaded then you won't be dissapointed. The pool however is very good and large with loads of different areas and they do have a pool area set aside for non Rehab guests but it does get a bit crowded at times. The casino is great and as you can imagine they have a very good sound track to listen to whilst you play your favourite game, and when i got bored i wondered around taking in all the great Hard Rock memorabilia which was just awsome. One down side to this stay and i must point out it is not the fault of HRH is the adjacent Hard Rock Cafe. Went there one night for a meal which was fine but our waiter sold us a Hard Club membership card which we were told would get us subtsantial discount on all HR merchandice anywhere in the world I specifically asked if this included the hotel and casino (i wanted a HRH tee shirt) was told yes. So the next day just before departing i went to purchase one from the hotel and was told HR Cafe was a separate business and no discounts were given, so i left feeling rather dissapointed and ripped off. Also had a meal at the Pink Taco and this was very good and at a reasonable price too. All in all a very enjoyable stay at the HRH Shame on HR Cafe!

Reviews.Title: “Best party hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Blackjack4949
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hard rock for a vacation w/ friends. I so enjoyed this hotel. The pool is a great scene and it had plenty of available chairs during the weekdays. The rooms have such fun decor and the staff (although appears very vegas) was always helpful and polite. We grabbed quick bites quite a few times at the Pink Taco onsite and i really enjoyed the Cal-Mex fare they offered. We also grabbed lunch at the cafeteria a couple of times, but nothing stands out about the food there. Our stay also included passes to Rehab Sunday w/ seems to be a hot ticket in town. The hotel was a bit distance from the other hotels that seemed to have all the other attractions but we were able to cab it there without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK-great for party scene”
Reviews.Author: Anaps
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights while in town for business. In the future I definitely would not choose this hotel if your traveling for work. I stayed in the HRH tower, rooms were very spacious. Yes there were some stains on the couches, other than that it was very clean, housekeeping was great a long with front desk and room service staff. BUT the one thing that drove me crazy was the walls are paper thin and I could hear bass vibrating in my room from 1-4 am one night. Not fun when you have to get up for work at 6:30 am. Pink Taco was good, Nobu was delicious as usual.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST!”
Reviews.Author: Grommets
Reviews.Content: This place is classy from top to bottom. The rooms, the restaurants, the staff, everything! I LOVE this place! It's my new favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly Great”
Reviews.Author: a d
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas 10+ times and usually subscribe to the "a hotel is a hotel" maxim, but I was pleasantly surprised and very pleased with the HRH. The room was spotless, the bed was fantastic and there were french doors that opened up for fresh air. The staff was great, check in and out were a breeze - we got a great deal through one of those groupon sites, and ended up with spa access and enjoyed every second of that. They were flexible and allowed us to visit the spa the day we checked out and use a dinner voucher after we checked out also. Just a really pleasant experience and a very decent location - it was a 15 minute walk to the strip or a $7 cab ride, either way, accessible and easy without being in "casinoland". Really enjoyed it, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Motley Crue Package”
Reviews.Author: ilsar01
Reviews.Content: The staff and housekeeping were great. The hotel itself was very nice, enjoyed the casino and the music at the casino. I would stay there again, however there were a couple of things I was not too happy about. First would be the lighting in the room (especially bathroom) it was very dim and hard to get ready which I could have dealt with during the day by opening the curtains but there was no mirror on the dresser so would have to stand in front of mirrored closet door (really a small inconvenience) The larger issue was we were told there would be a $50 security deposit each night we stayed and it would be refunded when we checked out which was true however there was a incidental fee each night of $20.16 (total for 3 nights $60.48) I don't recall this being mentioned and when I asked about it I was told it was for things like using the hotel phone, valet service, newspapers etc. I did not use any extra services and do not feel like I should be charged for things I might use and this fee is not refunded, I do not believe this should even be legal. I have heard that some of the larger hotels do this but I have never had it happen before so I was very unpleasantly surprised, to me that is like be charged at a restaurant extra because I might order a bottle of wine with dinner, ludicris. I did enjoy my stay and the accomodations just unhappy about extra fees, the room and drinks were expensive enough not to mention the money we spent at their restaurant & gift shop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rock & Roll Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jill S
Reviews.Content: Fantastic time! Rooms were clean, staff was awesome. Rocked it all weekend! Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Motley Crue package”
Reviews.Author: April G
Reviews.Content: Our stay at HRH was awesome! We stayed there purposely for the Motley Crue concert but the entire experience was amazing. Loved the suite and all it offered. I highly recommend it and I am sold for any future Vegas trips!

Reviews.Title: “Relequary Spa...very nice”
Reviews.Author: BethAustin36
Reviews.Content: Brought Travelzoo coupons for myself and my husband. I wasn't sure that spa and Hard Rock would go together but was pleasantly surprised. The lobby and casino are really loud but the spa was quite and peaceful with muted earth tones. We both had Cathryn for facials (25 min) and we both liked her and the treatment very much. After that we both had massage (1 hr) but with different masseuses. I liked mine a lot, even though it was Swedish she really worked on my knots. My husband didn't like his massage, too wimpy. Both the men's and women's dressing areas had spa, sauna and steam room (clothing optional). We both really liked the steam room. Sauna didn't seem hot enough for either of us. There's a co-ed roman bath (in the website picture and below is my version) that was nicely warm with jets. The staff was friendly and spent a lot of time making sure the area was clean and well stocked. I would have liked some lounge chairs for read or chilling out but overall, I thought the spa was nice and would recommend it others

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice, fun place”
Reviews.Author: annc123
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a two night stay at the Hard Rock (and one night at The Palazzo). We stayed in the Paradise tower, and it was great. PROs: The bed was AWESOME, and the room was very updated. It was quiet, comfortable, mostly clean, and had a great view (15th floor). CONs: The room was very far from the casino, and was kind of dusty. Also, the bathroom had terrible lighting. Note: this is not a place for families. It's an adult-theme hotel, and kids do not belong here. It made me uncomfortable to see a 2 year old near the girl dancing on the pole! Overall, we had a great stay and really enjoyed the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: Sixxgirly
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a very relaxed atmosphere!! Rooms are easily accessible and clean. Beds are especially comfortable! Room service was right on time!! Would definitely stay there again!! The Joint is an amazing venue!! Hotel however needs a shuttle to the strip!! Cabbies like to take advantage of tourists!!

Reviews.Title: “Rockin' Atmosphere & Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: jasmine6_12
Reviews.Content: We were at the Hard Rock for the Motley Crue show and we had a great time! The entire staff was so polite and friendly. The Joint is an awesome venue! We stayed in the Paradise Tower - our room was clean and we loved the black decor. The center bar was fun after the show. Loved the rock music that was playing all over the hotel . Ate at Mr. Lucky's for breakfast and the food was great! We will DEFINITELY stay at HRH next time we go to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: BriSanVan
Reviews.Content: I've switched from alternating between The Venetian and Mandalay Bay to staying exclusively at The Hard Rock. I'm in my mid-thirties and find the atmosphere much more energetic and the service is amazing. They truly appreciate my patronage and their Rockstar Club is second to none. HIGHLY recommend it for a terrific stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock is boring.....”
Reviews.Author: Helen P
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the new HRH tower, the front desk clerk told us about a new club at Bellagio to check out, very cool place called Hyde. The hard rock has no attractions, club is closed, no lounge, no place to hang out? San Diego hard rock always has something to do but Vegas is empty. Cheep room rates but it's a low key hotel that you have to leave for action. The strip hotels have a fun energy that Vegas gives off and this place is boring.

Reviews.Title: “Eh.”
Reviews.Author: Simon G
Reviews.Content: The good news: rooms were very cheap, hotel staff was accommodating with an early check-in, John Varvatos store in the hotel is great. The bad news: I'm not a 22-year old frat boy with tribal tattoos who wants to walk around my hotel in a bathing suit and pass out on the hallway floor in a drunken stupor, so I might not be the Hard Rock's target demographic.

Reviews.Title: “New favorite hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: msminniem
Reviews.Content: We flew in to see Motley Crue at The Joint on Feb. 3rd. We had reservations at a different hotel but upon arriving to pick up our concert tickets we fell in love with the Hard Rock. The place just feels like a party. Everyone working there was friendly and seemed to be having fun doing their jobs. The front desk was awesome. Found us a room right away in the casino section for a great price.. We didn't have any reason to want to leave the hotel. Everything we needed was there. The Pink Taco was pricey for Happy Hour but good food. Our room was SUPER clean and cozy. Decorated super cool, dark, rock n roll themed. That bed was amazing. Don't touch anything in the mini bar/fridge as it's weight sensitive and you will be charged for it even if you pick it up to look at it. (They'll inventory and remove charges if you didn't use it. I'm not gonna complain about the resort fees because everyone charges them. We tried to use the internet that was included but it was reallllllly slow. Didn't use anything else. I sure wasn't there to hit the gym! Loved the rain shower and yummy smelling toiletries. The concert at The Joint was so phenominal we ended up going two nights in a row. The only bad thing was that the walls seem pretty thin. We could hear EVERYTHING going on in the room next door and the drunks playing the cymbals on the walls in the hall ways but it's Vegas so I expect some crazy. Best trip to Vegas EVER! We will return to The Hard Rock FOR SURE!

Reviews.Title: “Superbowl weekend!”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: Wow, best superbowl party on the strip. Bucket of six premium beers, all the food you can eat, large led screens in the auditorium, comfortable seating, fantastic atmosphere. The hotel and casino with atmosphere cannot be beat by any other casino, go there, a once in a lifetime experience for adults! Tables liberal and paid off well, slots were liberal, just need more of them. Entertainment value off the charts! Ombiance and atmosphere set the mood and tone of the evening. When you go to luckys 24/7, ask for off the menu locals food and they will serve you, steak and eggs 4.99 with players card, prime rib and steak and shrimp after 4 pm 7.99, reminds me of the old days on food prices, and the french onion soup is to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing bed!”
Reviews.Author: VonAdams_NY
Reviews.Content: What to say?? We had a king suite in the HRH tower on the 8th floor... Our bed was the most awesome I have ever slept in, it just sucked you in. Also we had a juke box in our room that had the best music on it, you get to choose the era you are interested in. The bathroom was spacious with a glass wall separating it from the bedroom with a glassed in shower & a great deep bath tub. The hospitality at Hard Rock is 2nd to none... Everyone was so polite & accomodating... We loved the music throughout the Casino and also loved being off the strip. Their was plenty to do in our Casino & we never got to visit every place within the Hard Rock. Andy the bartender was very accomodating!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE, GREAT ROOMS HRH”
Reviews.Author: Kimmi72
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of a Groupon for the 2 nights HRH towers here, added an additional night separately. (Jan 30-Feb 2) Starting with reservations, very easy! Made sure our 2 reservations allowed us to stay in the same room without a snag. Ask your taxi driver to take you to the HRH entrance if you are staying in this section. Cuts your walk in half. Very prompt and friendly service at check in. I just love the vibe at this hotel. Music selection is so good and everywhere. Took the elevator to our room 822...Great view of the "relax pools" here. WOW, what a great room. EXACTLY like the brochure pics. VERY comfortable bed. HUGE Bathroom (with see thru wall) HUGE Shower and Tub!! Great music selection in room. 2 places to play your IPOD. Large couches, in room safe, 2 large closets. VERY IMPRESSED with this room. We ate only at 2 restaurants here, BOTH excellent. The Pink Taco, simply delicious drinks (try the Champagne Sangria!) and foo was SO good! Ate here 2x actually. The 24hr restaurant was really good too. Had breakfast here at 3am! Perfect! One night we did order room service and I have to say it was prompt, reasonable and great variety. We were here during the week a week before the Superbowl, so it was rather empty, (NO COMPLAINTS) Because it was Jan, ALL outdoor pools were closed although we did go walking around outside and decided, I am definitely staying here again in the summer!! Nice large cabanas, beach chairs and lots of places to escape from the hot summer sun. What i did enjoy was the SPA. VERY NICE! Beautiful warm unisex pool. Ladies locker room has ALL the amenities, a great HOT TUB, Sauna and steam room, although they offer wonderful services, I didnt have the time to take advantage of them. All in all the service was wonderful. It is about a 10.00 on average taxi to the strip, they do offer free shuttles every hr on the hour. Side note the Groupon deal I bought also included, a free bottle of alcohol, a $40 food and beverage credit and entrance to the spa for the 2 days I was there. ALL in ALL an amazing value and will definatley be back SOON!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel/Casino in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Taelorvans
Reviews.Content: We had so much at the hard rock I cant even figure out where to begin. Everyone we met was so incredibly friendly and welcoming. Ricky is by far the best bartender! The odds of winning in the casino are much higher than a lot of them. We actually won a ton a money compared to casinos on the strip that just sucked our money dry. The rooms are clean and neat. The views are awesome! I could just go on and on! We even met Vince Neil! Saw Steven Tyler, too! Not only was the staff incredible but everyone who stayed there was too. The scene is awesome and there's so much to do! Loved it so much, wouldn't stay anywhere else! One minor problem though, the short man with glasses in the back bar. I would have used him name instead, but since I don't know it, I thought a description would do just fine. He was very nice to the half dressed waitresses, but when it came down to customer service he was just completely rude. If he wasn't there this time, or ever next time, I would have nothing to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but not the worst”
Reviews.Author: noahandlaura
Reviews.Content: I traveld to Vegas for a conference at the Hard Rock Hotel and I would have to say it wouldn't have been my first choice, but it was fine. The rooms were spacious and the decor was tastefully done in a rock and roll theme (dark walls, dark furniture, dark everything). The room was clean, but you could tell they had been partied in. I appreciated that the rooms were nice and quiet and the beds were fresh and comfortable AND best of all the non-smoking room was actually non-smoking! Our group paid for internet in our rooms, but it didn't work and we tried to call guest services for help and were never able to reach them. Then the room phone stopped working.... The service in Mr. Lucky's (one of their restaurant options), at the front desk and in the conference area was fine, but not over the top nor did it seem like they would go above and beyond. We often had trouble identifying who worked at the hotel and who was a guest. Although I did not leave the hotel too often, it's not as conveniently located on the strip like many of the other hotels, however, it was easy to get a cab to and from the Hard Rock. Overall, it was fine and no major complaints, but I might try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty damn good”
Reviews.Author: mikebern
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock is the only hotel in the world that's ever checked me in TWICE to rooms that were actually still occupied. For that reason, I avoided it for a while. Until I got a deal that was just too good to pass up. Worth giving it another try...? A resounding YES. This hotel is like night and day week-days vs. week-ends. During week-days it's kinda quiet and laid-back on week-ends it's wall-to-wall pandemonium! Don't come here to relax: no way that's gonna happen. But you probably will have a good time. The location is good: off the strip, but not too far off the strip. It's handy to have a car. Still the best pool scene in Vegas. The 24-hr. restaurant is tasty and the "special" is a good deal. The front desk staff is friendly and you even get smiles... And they're more likely to upgrade your room (at least during the week) than one of the bigger, fancier casinos that have a steadier stream of high-rollahs... My room was beautiful, clean, big, comfortable. Points off only for a few things: 1) Although they've improved their sports book incredibly by making it a Cantor concession, the odds on table games here are bad. They pretty much uniformly are paying 6-5 on a blackjack, whereas most casinos still pay 3-2. They were also one of the first hotels to have dealers hit on a soft 17 (now most do.) Both give advantages to the house. So while the dealers are great, friendly, sassy sometimes, from an odds perspective it does not pay to play blackjack here at all. Also, MANY of the players here do not know how to play blackjack and do all kinds of stupid and infuriating things. If you can't roll with that, also not a good place to play. 2) The soaps in the rooms are TINY. I know, everyone's cutting back but this is almost ridiculous. 3) The bell staff is uniformly glum and rude. Maybe they're trying to look cool, but the actual impression they give is they hate their jobs and the hotel is a sucky place to work...I'm sure HR does not intend to put this across. Still, in a week, whenever I passed bell staff in the hallway, never a smile or greeting of any kind; not even any eye contact... 4) They (like almost everyone else in Vegas these days, charges a ridiculous 'resort fee' that covers things you'd never use (wireless Internet...completely unnecessary if you've got an iPhone or tablet) and they'd never be able to make money charging for anymore...Just figure that extra $20 into the room cost when you're trying to figure out whether it's worth it. Because you won't pay that at any of the Caesar's related places.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool celeb filled hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller570
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with very helpful staff. We were upgraded to a room on the top floor of the fairly new paradise tower. The room was kinda on the dark side, but very cool and has ultra comfortable beds. Glad we were so high up, I think the noise from the pool would have been annoying from further down (sometimes you need a little extra sleep from a hard vegas night). The penthouse floor also ment that we were down the hall from Carey Hart and Pink and kept running into Chris Brown around the hotel (glad he didn't Rihanna me, lol). This is def the hotel where all the beautiful people go. Never seen so many good looking people in one place as I did at the rehab pool!

Reviews.Title: “Good Time at Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: KUChris
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hard Rock for the World of Concrete trade show. Very nice place. Not overly crowded. Room in the HRH Tower was excellent. All the staff were very friendly. Food at Pink Taco and Mr Luky's was great. Only draw back in staying at Hard Rock is it is very far from the strip (must take a cab to strip). Otherwise great place.

Reviews.Title: “HRH Tower is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: PaintedCanvas1975
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Vegas to check out the AVN's and stayed in the Hard Rock because it was hosting the event. We thought we would treat ourselves and stay in the new HRH tower. We checked in, in the normal front area, which we were told during check in that we could have checked in back at the HRH tower. Once we got to our room, it was very nice. When you enter the room, you are in the kitchen type area, and closets. There is no room in the refrigerator for anything other than the Hotels High Priced Items. The next room is the living room, separated by a small wall type partition then the bedroom. The bathroom area is as large at the bedroom, with a stand-up shower stall, and separate area for the towelette, two sinks, and a large tub. The only downside to the bathroom is that the tub doesn't have the jacuzzi feature. The only thing I was unhappy with in the bedroom was that all the pillows were made of the same material, which as soon as your head hits it, it compresses to nothing. I ended up using one of the sofa pillows to sleep on. The staff on that tower (maids, bell men, and desk people) we very nice. We didn't hear anything going on in the hall, and we were the first room off the elevator. The HRH tower has a separate parking garage, which is nice and convenient. The biggest minus to the HRH tower is that there is no gym, and you have to walk over to the old section of the hotel to get to it. The gym closed at 7pm, which sucks because you are automatically charged for it, with the resort fees, so it should be open till Midnight or later. Since we visited in January, we never checked out the pool because it was mid-40's each day. Lucky's restaurant has a diner type feel, and the food is decent. Because Lucky's is in the main area, there is a line waiting most of the time. The Pink Taco on the other hand is terrible. We have eaten there twice and both times the food is not worth the money. I think Taco Bell has healthier and better food than Pink Taco. Overall the Hard Rock has a different vibe from the other Strip hotel, that Rock-n-Roll vibe, and you will see a lot more people with Tattoos and wild clothing, which we fit in with.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, atmosphere, restaurants....”
Reviews.Author: faby99
Reviews.Content: This by far is one of the best hotels in Las Vegas. If you sign up for their rewards card, they will send you discounts for future stays at very reasonable prices. The rooms are good, a little noisy if your room faces the pool, but you are in Vegas. Highly recommend this place and the tables have low limits!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good stay”
Reviews.Author: Mingo05
Reviews.Content: After reading the trip advisor reviews of this property, I was reluctant to stay at the Hard Rock Hotel in Las Vegas. A friend had already made our reservations because we were attending a concert at the Joint (the Hard Rock's on site concert venue). Everything I experienced was the opposite of what I expected. The doorman was friendly and welcoming, the check-in process was efficient. The resort fee and $50 per night room deposit were explained to me. My room was upgraded to a higher floor with a view. I received a complimentary bottle of alcohol and a voucher for $200 credit for the casino. The room was extremely fresh and clean, towels were thick, the bed and linens were comfy. I became ill during my stay and needed assistance from housekeeping. They arrived within 30 minutes and refreshed my room. The shuttle driver was also friendly and helpful. Checkout was efficient. The $50 deposit was credited back to my account within 24 hours. The resort fee does now include in-room wireless internet access (this was an extra charge when I stayed here 2 years ago). There are a few caveats. On Friday & Saturday nights, the hotel is crowded with a young party crowd. (I'm a 50 year old woman, but young at heart). You can't walk to the Strip, so taxi fees added up ($15 per trip). The shuttle will take you directly to Fashion Square Mall and back with the last return leaving the mall at 5:15 pm. Don't touch items in the honor bar or you will be charged. I didn't find this a big deal, just stay away from it. The store "Fuel" in the lobby has some basic items, but you can walk across the street to CVS pharmacy for better selection and less money. I was never hassled about bringing food or beverages into the hotel. I just received an e-mail survey from the Hard Rock. I didn't receive this last time I stayed here, so I'm hoping they are trying to improve their customer service. The bottom line: a nice hotel with good service, inconvenient location, great for a young crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Great for rock groupies... between fair and poor for us”
Reviews.Author: Bdev1
Reviews.Content: As with any hotel, your satisfaction depends greatly on what your needs are. We stayed in a standard room at the Hard Rock over Thanksgiving this past November. Rooms were decent size, clean and had comfortable beds. Nice flat screen tv's and rock style furnishing. The pools were closed (good thing we payed the "resort fee" to use them) but they looked great. Lots of great authentic rock memorabilia and music all around. The walls were thin so the hotel was quite noisy throughout the night. We could clearly hear people talking next door. One of the families in our group had to switch rooms because the noise from one of the night clubs was so loud. some things should be a given in a hotel, like some sort of noise control. They did not have to pay for that nights stay so I give the hotel credit for at least trying to make it right. Rooms did not include a mini fridge or a coffee maker which would have been nice and the bathrooms need to be updated. There were snacks, drinks and "other" toys available on the room dresser. Problem is if you even move one of them, they charge your room. That's ridiculous. Forget about the fact that kids might do it, my wife accidentally bumped it twice and we were charged twice. We called the front desk and they removed the charges. Just make sure you check to see if there are any charges before you check out. It's a few blocks off the strip (not walking distance) so be aware of that. The gaming area was ok and did not appear to be overcrowded. I didn't get a chance to try them but EVERYBODY had boxes from Pink Taco and said the food there was great. It's not the best place in Vegas to stay with kids. (the only reason we stayed here with kids is because it looked like one of the nicest hotels available with a discount for our sports event). If you're in Vegas just to party, and you drink enough, you may not mind the problems with Hard Rock. But if you're in town for business, sports tournaments, conferences, or for any other reason that might need a guaranteed good night's sleep, I would recommend staying some place else. I'm sure this Hotel is great for over-aged rock groupies, but if you're in Vegas for any other reason, including just to enjoy the strip, the are much better places to stay that are even less expensive. Overall I think this hotel is living off its name and pool parties more so than anything else... we won't stay here again. Suggestion for Hard Rock Hotel Staff: I understand that half the customers in this place may be drunk rockers who won't remember the tattoo they got in your parlor, let alone being treated poorly, but for those sober customers attending for other reasons, you should make a better attempt to satisfy them. Or, remove your name from the list of hotels that are associated with other events that don't mix well with your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Trip to Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: cbe0824
Reviews.Content: Nice visit to the Hard Rock. Fun energy all around. Was disappointed with the slot selection but overall a great time. The rooms were nice but very little light in the bathroom. Loved the Pink Taco, great food.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for young people, lots of action!”
Reviews.Author: dreamer8313
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel (the old tower) with some friends in a room with two queen size beds. It was a Saturday night and the hotel was busy! It was full of young people that go there to party. Went to bed late on Saturday night, and on Sunday morning, the pool party starts rather early and it is loud! Our room had a pool view so we were able to see all the action, but even with the windows shut, you could hear lots of noise. The room was updated and looked modern and we had a great time at the Hard Rock. Went to a party at The Joint and enjoyed every minute there. This hotel is amazing for people that want to party! Lots of action! =)

Reviews.Title: “HRH Tower - somewhat disappointed after a much anticipated stay”
Reviews.Author: Zeva2010
Reviews.Content: The HRH Tower is very close to the airport and the entrance area is very crisp. The reception/check in area has memorabilia adorned on their walls - nice touch. The area is pretty dark, only to be lit up by the lovely montage on the wall and their desks. Check in was OK - I found the staff a little rude to be frank. The reception area was a lot smaller than what I had imagined though. I checked in and went up to my room. I walked in and was greeted with a spacious lounge area. It seemed nice and presentable but it was let down by the curtains that was drawn back so carelessly, it looked completely out of place. I made my way to the bedroom - which was separated by two sliding doors from the lounge. I was not expecting a Queen Twin bedroom so instantly, I was disappointed. The view was of the carpark, not great. The bathroom was lovely and compact, double sink area, separate shower and bath tub and toilet. The toiletries provided could have been better. They provide you with shampoo, conditioner and body lotion. So bring your own shower gel! The room could of been cleaner - by the curtains in the bedroom I found a row of dirt - which looked like popcorn kernels. The lamps by the beds were also very dusty. Wifi is complimentary which is a bonus. Regarding the service at the hotel, I would said it was average - from check in to check out - excluding my visits around the hotel's shops and restaurants. It was medicore for such a high end hotel. I even checked out early. Considering I stayed in the HRH tower, I was not given any coupon/voucher booklets. Initially, I didn't even think to ask and was only made aware of such offers when a colleague informed me that they got a voucher/coupon booklet when they checked into the Casino Tower of The Hard Rock. Compared to the other hotels I've stayed at in Las Vegas, I have to say that I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the new HRH Tower”
Reviews.Author: c0r0nad0family4
Reviews.Content: Stayed this past weekend,room luxurious. ,huge built in couches to lounge on w iPod docks and speakers. Beds comfynr feather duvets ,huge stone shower w oversize cotton bath sheets.My only complaint the hall was little smoky on arrival but cleared later.Spa beautiful in same wing as HRH Tower

Reviews.Title: “50th Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: madisonvillebabydoll
Reviews.Content: I took my husband here for a few days for his 50th birthday.. The staff is great & they gave us a very nice location on the end of the 15th floor overlooking the strip away.. This is not on the strip - about 2-3 blocks aways but it is just a short cab drive away. We were in the Hard Rock Towers & it was just great!!! Casino is not as big as most but did not bother us.. Lucky's 24/7 has great service & good food/prices.. We would stay here again.... You can get great deals during the week for about $80/night and it is worth it.. We didnt hear all the noise like when we moved to a strip hotel... Sleep like a baby

Reviews.Title: “New rooms are very nice”
Reviews.Author: eddiesNYC
Reviews.Content: I have been going to the Hard Rock for about 13 years now and the place is great fun. The new towers and rooms are great and the prices now are a steal. There are good restaurants at the property and the new spa is really nice and upscale as well. If you are there in the summer the pool is huge and very fun.

Reviews.Title: “HRH Tower is pretty sweet”
Reviews.Author: urbangypsyt
Reviews.Content: We went for the AVN/AE Expo, which is usually at the Sands Convention Center, and this year changed venues to the Hard Rock. For a convention, this space is better, more intimate than the cavernous Sands though it offers way less choice of restaurants and bars than the Venetian does. There's only so many times you can eat at Pink Taco. Staying in the HRH Tower was the best move, just be sure to have the cab drop you at the HRH entrance or you'll find yourself dragging your luggage all through the casino to the private check-in counter in the HRH. Though the room was very nice, the service wasn't truly up to par for a suite. For a non-smoking room, it did smell of smoke. And the light switches were just odd. Apparently there are two kill switches that shut all the lights. I ended up in the bathroom in the dark more times than I would have liked. Still, the beds were EXTREMELY comfortable and the room was clean and tidy. The private check in was fast and there was a quiet lounge area outside the elevators. Little things like not getting new toiletries, there was only one bar of soap in our room for 5 days and we got 3 more the day before we were checking out, were annoying, but as I travel with my own supplies, not a deal breaker. We had to wait a day to get a humidifier delivered, which at the Venetian we got minutes after our request. The food at the Hard Rock ranged from fab to awful. Fab is 35 Steak and Martinis. Tuesday is $5 martini night, sponsored by Skyy. Great drinks, amazing steaks. Pink Taco is good. The Mr. Lucky's 777 deal, steak, shrimp, salad, mashed potatoes, is only $7.77 but not worth more, with dull steak and flavorless shrimp. Johnny Smalls was awful. These things are not tapas. They are merely small, mainly dry, little bites served by a snooty waiter. The Reliquary Spa is the place to go for a great massage. The pool, hot tub and showers were splendid and the attendants were very helpful. A must visit for relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock October 2011”
Reviews.Author: GinnyBeeking
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderfull and the room was great. Downside is the service. It took ages to check-in. Next to that we were'nt informed that we had to pay for our rehad tickets because we booked through bookings and not directly (which I think it a weird rule). Then when we bought the tickets a day later, they wanted us to pay about twice the amount they informed me of the day before! In the end they changed it to the orginal amount, but it's quite annoying going through such incomplete information and vague rules. Upon check-out (after a great stay by the way, facilities are great, not to mention the nicest pool I've ever seen!), the had us pay taxes, while bookings.com includes taxes. They said they didn't know and I had to pay anyway. Back home I needed to get a refund (because I DID pay taxes TWICE) via bookings.com (who have a great service by the way, they did a great job). All in all, I have to say the procedures and service is not what I am used to when I travel to the US. The hotel however is great, it's a bit of a long walk to the strip (min. 15 minutes) which in the heat is not as nice as I expected. But you do have the best pool in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “HRH king luxury suite lovely”
Reviews.Author: shaaley
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from staying at the Hard Rock Hotel. I had purchased a Groupon for a 2 night stay with a 3rd night free in their new all-suite tower (HRH Towers) staying in a "King Luxury Suite". We arrived and the main entrance walks right into the casino area and the reception. Turns out the HRH has it's OWN reception so we had to walk a bit further. The HRH tower lobby is very dark but posh lobby. We checked in easily, with a very pleasant woman helping us. We were on the 8th floor and were facing the pool, as well as strip. It was kind of neat to be able to see almost the entire strip from our hotel room! (The hotel is located about a mile off the strip) The room itself is very lovely. Very spacious, the decor was simple and modern. Has a living room area and a bedroom area (divided by a partition that houses a flat screen TV on BOTH sides so you can watch TV in both areas. Large floor to ceiling windows to really take in the view. The bathroom is also very very large! WIth two sinks, a large "rain" shower with a bench to sit down, and a VERY deep tub - one of the deepest I Have experienced (awesome). The best part was the bed!! It was SUPER DUPER comfy!! You just sink into it! It was hard to get out of it! The room also has an ipod dock as well as a built in juke box that has a ton of songs that it will pump into the room. Nice touch. SInce the tower is fairly new, everything was in good condition. I can't speak of the casino as my boyfriend and I don't gamble. We ate at the Pink Taco our first night. It was very good! I recommend you give it a go. We also tried Mr. Lucky for an early morning breakfast...the food is quite expensive for breakfast. We only grabbed cold food, so I can't attest to the warm meals served. But it was over-priced I thought. A note, across the street from the hotel is a little shopping centre with a 24 hours CVS (i.e. a pharmacy plus for the non-Americans) as well as restaurants. We ate a Johnny Rockets there the next night - very yummy burgers. There is a TON of rock memorabilia around the hotel (of course) so if you are into that, you will appreciate it. ANd of course, rock music is pumped throughout the hotel, including elevators. We experienced good service overall. But nothing is perfect. Here are some less than ideal things: The shuttle to the strip. When we asked the reception desk, they told us the shuttle ran every 10 minutes. So we wandered out to where we were supposed to catch it and asked the valet about it. HE said it only ran every hour (and we had just missed it). He said it only seats 7 and so you had to get out there quite early to be able to get a seat. Surely, they can do better than that!!! If they want to encourage people to stay at their hotel as oppose to right on the strip, they need to improve that service. My boyfriend and I are pretty young and fit and the weather wasn't too hot or cold so we just walked it. Took us 10-15 minutes, so no big deal. However, we have been to Vegas in the middle of summer when it is blazing hot and there is no WAY we would have walked it then. Apparently it costs over 11 dollars to take a cab to the strip, FYI. The other thing to be aware of...the bathroom wall and door is see-through glass. Now there is a curtain (on the OUTSIDE of the bathroom) that you can pull across for privacy. And there is no lock on the bathroom door..so when you are in the bathroom, you kind of have to trust the other person to not pull the curtain back or wander in. And, when the curtain is drawn all the way and you walk OUT of the bathroom, you get whacked in the face with the metal curtain rod (that you use to pull open and close the curtain). So, perhaps not the best design....Admittedly this is nitpicky, but I thought I would share for those who are very sensitive about their privacy...and getting wacked in the face multiple times. The room seemed quite clean. Overall, we had a nice stay. My one regret was since it is WInter, the pool wasn't open so we missed out on what is supposed to be a spectacular pool.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright”
Reviews.Author: 007John
Reviews.Content: The room was good but the bathroom floor was really dirty or I wouldn't have noticed. Tile floors with dirt stains. I was able to stay there for two days without getting charged for anything from the minibar or snacks which I was told was weight sensitive, so no bumping the furniture! Room was surprisingly noisy. I could hear people talking on the phone in the room next to me. The rock music on the casino floor was really good. We ate at the Pink Taco for dinner and that was very good. We ate at Mr Lucky for breakfast and that was pretty expensive $12 for a bagel and egg sandwich. The pool was not open. This place has a resort fee of $18 a day, which I am totally opposed to, especially when they advertise that it is for certain items, such as the pool, but the pool is closed, plus is it really necessary to charge a fee for internet?

Reviews.Title: “would be more fun with friends”
Reviews.Author: wormcreative
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights when I was in town for a conference. Hard Rock was $200 less than the conference hotel so it was a great deal. Stayed in the paradise tower and was really surprised at how nice the room was. Seemed like it was brand new with contemporary decor, flat screen tv and super comfy bed. However, it overlooked the pool and you could hear the music from the pool in the room so if you're trying to nap or sleep in this could be bothersome. Also, I had arrived on a Sunday which is when they have their big pool party going on. I was looking forward to relaxing by the pool, working on my tan and reading a book. Impossible to do. Pool was PACKED and loud and would have been fun if I was with a group of friends but solo, not so much. Location, I knew when I booked it was off the strip but didn't realize how far until I arrived. Walking everyday to and from the conference (at the palazzo) was far and if I took cabs all the time expenses would add up. Certainly not the most convenient location if you plan on spending lots of time on the strip. So, just know this going into it. Service was really good. I liked the smaller casino feel. Bartenders and dealers were all nice and the hotel has a really fun vibe. Highly recommend happy hour at Pink Taco (great food and drinks at dirt cheap prices).

Reviews.Title: “great beds, cool looking casino”
Reviews.Author: superflytilburg
Reviews.Content: i loved this places. A bit too much of "jersey shore" and that is why it doesnt get 5 stars. But besides that. only positives. for instance: -mr lucky steak and shrimp special. -the beds and down compforters in the hrh tower -the pool my favorite vegas hotel

Reviews.Title: “HRH All suite hotel? Dont think so!”
Reviews.Author: Iheartyahhhhhh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days during CES week at teh HRH all suite tower. Get to room, supposed to be non-smoking - ash tray in the room ... ok. Supposed to be a suite, with sectional, got a room with 2 beds, looks like any other standard room. Cant get a room change because they are "sold out" yah sure. More like since I used bookit for a deal they do not want to provide me with a "5 star hotel suite" they claim. Bathroom only had a shower, not shower with separate tub in floor plan. lets just say the room didn't live up to expectations and even worse the room wasn't even properly cleaned. The toiletries were previously used and were not replaced. The safe didn't close since the previous occupants locked a code in with the safe door open. The beds were a hazard cuz the room was so small we kept nicking our shins on the edge of the bed frame. On Fri nite could hear the bass from the nightclub below, and we were on the 14th floor. $18 resort fee for wifi, fitness centre and other amenities you wont use as were here to sight see, shop and gamble. Will not stay here again, definitely not on par with other 5 star resorts like Aria or Wynn. Even Excalibur Widescreen rooms are way better than this! Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Rockin' in Style at the new HRH Tower!”
Reviews.Author: Ladyoasis42
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonable place to stay during the CES convention when I discovered the BookIt.com website. I decided to take a chance on a great 2 night "Mystery Suite" deal and was happy to discover that the hotel was the new HRH Tower at the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino! Not only was it a terrific value, the staff was professional, friendly and customer service driven. We had a King Suite at the HRH Tower.The room was phenomenal! The luxurious decor trendy and hip with a separate sitting room, 2 huge flat screen TV's, Stereo, I Pod dock and the room is equipped with a great selection of music to listen to. The bed was one of the most luxurious and comfortable hotel beds I have ever experienced, firm yet soft with luxury linens.The bathroom was huge with a sunken tub and large shower. I highly recommend the HRH, even though it's a few long blocks from the strip, it is a great place to stay in Vegas, especially if you are a rock in roll music fan.(And we are both die hard old school rockers!) The Vanity nightclub is a happening place on weekends. The restaurants are good and affordable when you take advantage of the specials. Try the Pink Taco happy hour (The house Margaritas are 2-4-1 and delicious and the happy hour appetizer menu is filling enough for dinner. We had the sampler plate are were not disappointed. The Lucky 7 is open 24-7 and has some unadvertised specials (thanks Yelp!) Try the $7.77 special (Steak, potatoesa and salad, a basic comfort meal at a good value) and the $6.99 breakfast special of steak and eggs. These specials are NOT on the menu so you have to ask for them! As far as being customer service driven, for example, I was surprised upon check in that we were being charged an extra $20 per night "Resort Fee." which was not stated in the Bookit information. (Btw, that should be mentioned during the booking process and I have contacted bookit.com to disclose this information.) When we inquired about what the fee included, we were told that it includes internet access in the rooms, use of the fitness center, pools and a shuttle to the shopping mall. Gee, since when do you have to pay a extra "fee" for the right to use the pool and fitness center? "Resort Fees" are just another annoying industry trend to get more money out of guests. It wouldn't have bothered me if the pool and hot tubs were open but due to the winter weather, the pools and hot tubs were closed.The only indoor pool and hot tub would be in the spa, which charges $25.00 to use unless you book a spa treatment. I casually mentioned my disappointment to the front desk clerk and she cheerfully upgraded our room! Since we got such an amazing deal I can't complain but if I was paying full price, the "resort fee" would have rubbed me the wrong way. But I applaud the service recovery initiative by the front desk clerk to resolve conflict. It's not her policy and she wanted to make sure that we were happy.And we were happy campers!

Reviews.Title: “If you stay up late enough or drink enough you'll sleep OK, otherwise... not so much!”
Reviews.Author: eatsleeptour
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel and Casion in the "old" towers. There was a group of 6 of us, so we got two double bed rooms. The rooms were spacious. We were on the 4th floor and a great view of the pool, but since we went in Jan. the pool was closed. The bed was overly soft and had a top sheet and then a HUGE duvet so you had the choice of sleeping with just a sheet or under a heavy, hot duvet - so you could be hot or cold. One of the rooms was close to the elevator and we could hear conversations in the hallways on a regular basis. The TV in the room was large, but set so that if you were listening to the music channels it could be pretty loud, but if you were watching TV, it was too soft to hear plus the remote only worked from the center of the room and neither bed were in the center so you had to reach way out to point at the center of the TV with the remote. The location of this hotel isn't so great either. It is off the strip so you have to drive everywhere - not close enough to walk to any other casinos, etc. The bathrooms could use some updating and the entire room could use better lighting. I don't understand why hotels put in overpriced mini bars either that if you touch something you are charged for it - seeems like and excuse to tick off your customers. If I want a drink , ear phones, coffee, candy, I'll go buy it downstairs at the overpriced shop in the lobby - that way I don't have to "tip toe" around the mini bar on the dresser in fear that I might accidently knock something over and be charged for it?!? As far as Vegas hotels, I wasn't impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean room,loud casino”
Reviews.Author: Cfsdir
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, was overall fine, very young clientele, very loud music everywhere, sorry it was cold the pool area was amazing. Everything was as expected except they showed up at5 am with extra towels and hair dryer that we asked for the day before and got already !

Reviews.Title: “What a trip!”
Reviews.Author: nosetrap-UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October 2010 with some friends and had an awesome time. we stayed during the week as it was cheaper. I shared a twin room with a mate and the standard of the room was amazing in my opinion. the pool was awesome and so were the resteraunts. Also, as a rock music fan i found it very interesting to browse the memorabilia that covers the ground floor walls. I would happily return!

Reviews.Title: “Great . . . if you like all glass doors in the bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline862
Reviews.Content: Very, very nice in the HRH Tower (close to the VIP desk). We were up on the 7th floor so we could see the airport in the distance. It was beautiful, but it took a little while to get used to the glass door going into the bathroom, and glass door into the shower. (At least the toilet was separated by a wood door.) I like my privacy so I guess the glass doors seemed to eliminate my privacy. What I did like about the room was all the neat pictures and collages on the walls of famouse people who had been there. Also, there were good resaurants under the Hard Rock Hotel including: Mr. Lucky's and 35 Steak & Martinis.

Reviews.Title: “Another decent stay at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: Matt_UKTX
Reviews.Content: This is my third visit to the Hard Rock in two years. Overall, it was another great trip, however, I DO NOT recommend the rooms in the HRH Tower. I booked the HRH Tower this time, under the assumption that these were the best rooms in the hotel. This was a mistake. I looked at two rooms in the HRH Tower. Both smelled awful, had beat up furniture and looked like they had been partied in hard. The once white couches are now a soiled grey/beige. The carpet was stained, and the rooms not up to 4-star standards. With that said, I called the front desk, complained and was moved to a Deluxe Suite in the Casino Tower. The Casino Tower is the oldest and closest to main casino. However it was been renovated, and is still very nice. The suite was huge and has windows that open for an amazing strip, mountain and pool view. This is rare for Vegas these days - most hotels don't have windows/balconies. I've also stayed in the Paradise Tower before. The rooms are very nice, but a bit more of a walk to the main casino. So, in summary, if you can get a deal ($50 to $100 per night) the Casino Tower and Paradise Tower rooms are great. Avoid the HRH Tower, and don't pay more than $100 per night to stay here. Overall, I give the place 4-starts. Once the initial room issue was resolved, I was very happy with my stay. PROS: - Cheap - Great Bar - Mr. Lucky's Restaurant - Location (I prefer off strip - less traffic and walking distance to bars/eateries) - Rooms in Paradise and Casino Tower are nice CONS: - HRH Tower not worth the upgrade. Rooms are beat up from party crowd. - No buffet

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: jimmyrw
Reviews.Content: The Hard rock was everything we expected it to be, it is a fun, lively, cool hotel. For those wanting a quiet stay in a relaxing hotel then it isnt for you, but we never expetced that. The rooms themselves were of a very high quality, the casino was always lively and buzzing, the sports book was superb, the pool is top drawer and the high nu,mber of bars and cafes/restaurants all seemed good. I would have no problem suggesting staying here. It is off the strip but it is only a 20 minute walk which was more than do-able, though obviously taxis are on hand at all times.

Reviews.Title: “expected some more”
Reviews.Author: fbarros
Reviews.Content: As a HR fan, I should confess I'm a little bit disapointed. But I'm not saying its a bad venue- far from that - the hotel is great, clean, new, confy rooms, excelent enviroment, fun and not that crowd. But as a non-strip Hotel, with the franchise HR, I'd expected more. Maybe it was the very bad view from y room (Casino Tower), facing the celing and the back of the building. (Motel 6 across the the street might have best view). Or maybe it was the bad weather - cold, making the rehab party s'thing far away from us. Anyway, its a great hotel, but I think I'll consider a strip venue resosable with the cost next time in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend getaway.”
Reviews.Author: Steve H
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a suite in the HRH tower. Nice room with a nice view of the strip. Food was consistently good in Lucky 24/7, even during the wee hours. Walking distance to several of the gay clubs, so didn't have to drive or take a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!!!”
Reviews.Author: ConstanTraveler77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usually stay at the Venetian when we hit Sin City, however we decided to stay off strip this ONE time to get a better vibe for our trip. We attended the EDC music festival, and the Hard Rock was a perfect host for the weekend. The place is packed full of cool musical history artifacts. There are plenty of food option. The pool is a party. This is great for the 23-34 crowd. Those old enough to hold there liquor, who know how to party and what not to do. Great staff! The rooms are clean and contemporary. The bathroom was much smaller than I would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “You'll have a better time in the airport”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay H
Reviews.Content: Okay, so we had a few problems ( bad ones ) and as a consequence we had to move rooms. No big deal, hey it happens, but the hotel won't move you, you have to physically move yourself - again no big deal but you have to do it by 6pm or they give your room away - not good as the room wasn't available every time we went back to get the new key. So finally we move into a new room - excellent you'd think. At 1.30am after we'd just got to sleep there's heavy knocking on the door. After travelling for 30 hours, followed by an awful first night in this hotel, followed with spending most of our first day's holiday waiting to change rooms this is not what we wanted. On answering the door, it's 2 ladies from house keeping looking at me puzzled then apologising and backing away. Very angry, we eventually get back off to sleep. At 3.30am there's a hammering on the door with a male voice shouting ' security - open the door'. What the hell is going on??? I open the door ajar ( it has a security latch on it) and security is demanding to see photo ID. Seriously - at 3.30am in the morning. I refused and asked him what on earth he thought he was doing and told him to stop shouting as just maybe, other guests in the room opposite, were still asleep. When he explained that our room was supposed to be empty and we explained that we'd been moved into it because of a room change he apologised and couldn't explain how it had happened, but the strange thing is, he knew my first name. I tried to sleep again but ended up going down to reception ( no one answers the room phones) . Now the lad at the desk knew nothing, and said the manager on duty was 'unavailable' to me. After demanding he get her on the phone, turns out she's on the other desk due to staff shortages. I go to see her and she couldn't explain how it had happened and apparently she'd asked him to go to the room after housekeeping had reported they couldn't get in. Nothing makes sense here - why were they trying to get into a freshly cleaned room? Why does it take 2 hours for security to come bang on the door. How did he know my name when he was expecting the room to be empty?? Why didn't i believe the other reviews on this place?? Why oh why?? This place sucks big time. We were offered $50 to spend in the hotel food places for 'compensation'. So bearing in mind they make a profit on the food, that $50 probably costs the hotel about $18. So our room was $300 bucks for the night (new year period was pricey) and you offer us $50. Where's the effort?? At least a box of chocolates or even some flowers would have shown thought. The rooms are tired. Bedding is worn, quilts and mattress smell of smoke, bathrooms dirty, wardrobe falling apart, sinks don't drain, showers are a joke - use the shower and flood the bathroom, no facilities in the room ( no coffee, not even a shower cap!) Hair on the floor.Toenails !! Eew! Phone cover missing so you don't know which button is front desk etc. Dust everywhere. Lights not working in the room. Air con surprisingly good. Ipod dock doesn't work on new ipods. Cigarette burns in the furniture. Big chunks out the tables - repaired by colouring them in with black marker pens. What?? Internet reallllllllly slow. Shuttle service less than useless ( although the driver is really nice) Staff couldn't care less. Resort fee a con - $25 a day for what? The swimming pool area shuts down out of season. We stayed in december/january and it was beautiful sunshine. They pipe pool music in the outside pool area which makes you think that you can use the loungers, just not swim in the pool. Why else would they pump music here which is different to the hotel music. Wrong!! Security actually came and moved us and others on - we demanded to speak to management who eventually relented and let us lounge on the loungers as long as we didn't make a mess - are you serious ?? have you even seen the state of the place?? A mess?? They have one pool area that is available to use during out of season subject to weather. It was open the one day, closed the next ( no staff apparently) open the next but no loungers and the kids in the pool complaining the water was freezing. Lifeguard was really nice and good with people's kids but couldn't do anything about the pool temp except apologize. We had the unpleasant experience of dealing with the assistant hotel manager called Liz. If you wander why some hotels respond to comments on trip advisor and either apologize or explain how things had gone wrong or even thank people for positive comments and you wander why some don't? Well the answer is - this hotel couldn't give a monkey's about you. They just don't care. The hotels that respond to trip advisor at least show they care what there clients think. I'm pretty easy to please, have realistic expectations, know things go wrong and I accept this. This hotel works on the basis, there will be another punter tomorrow so who cares about the one today. Bad news guys, word spreads!! trip advisor works !! you'll find out soon enough. Apparently you were pretty good a few years ago - but not know. The casino tables are too dark to use properly so we'd go up to the strip. Tip - just get a cab to the rear entrance of Planet Hollywood and walk up through the Casino onto the strip. With a tip for the cab driver, it will be no more than $10 each way ( actual fare usually was $6.70-$7.10 )Planet Hollywood is much nicer, the Wynn is awesome, the Bellagio is looking a tiny bit tired inside but the staff are great. The Hard Rock - avoid!! Stay somewhere else. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Would rather sleep on the sidewalk!”
Reviews.Author: William C
Reviews.Content: Have never been to a hotel where the staff are so un-caring. Granted, things don't always go as smoothly as you'd like but the difference is made by how the problems are dealt with. We spent Christmas in New York and New Year in Vegas. The New York hotel had a water leak in our room above our heads and the dripping kept us awake all night. Suffice to say that at 4am the hotel was doing all it could to help find another room and indeed sorted the problem. They comp'ed the room for that night which one would expect and we were happy with that. The Hard Rock however are a different storey. Forget customer service, in fact, forget every expectation and you at least won't be disappointed. This place is great for the music - it's piped throughout the hotel and is the only good thing i have to say about it. Decoration is shabby, fittings worn, bed linen stinks of cigarette smoke in the non-smoking rooms - not good when you put your head on the pillow and can't escape the smell. Curtains with holes in, bed linen torn. There's no staff to answer the phone at night and i've read this from other reviewers and it's hard to believe, but when you book a room, even if you pay for it, you are only making a 'request'. BE WARNED!!!!!! if you are travelling with a friend and book 2 queen beds in a room you may end up with 1 king - even if you've paid for it - with absolutely no apologies except 'come back in the morning at 8am and if we can we'll move you' except, they don't, you have to move yourself so forget about going out, you have to wait around for the room to become free to move your stuff. They won't move you as it's a security risk!!!! What!!!!!!!!! Remember this hotel is off the strip so it's a cab ride every time you go up and down to the strip. They have a hourly shuttle which seats a small number of guests so don't expect to fit on it and it goes to the mall opposite the Wynn Hotel - not really ideal. REMEMBER THE RESORT FEE! The hotel will charge you an additional $20 per day! for use of the resort ( internet, swimming pool etc ) on top of the price you've paid, plus tax of course irrespective of use - internet is extremely slow and the pools ( which are stunning and in the summer must be a awesome place to be ) are shut in the down season irrespective of the weather. Don't expect to get a decent coffee after 10pm - the starbucks in the hotel shuts at 10pm and there's no facilities in the rooms. Trying to think of something nice to say - but can't. Didn't appreciate the toe nail clippings on the bathroom floor, the burnt face of the iron in the room, the smell when we opened the door, the couldn't careless attitude of the assistant manager Liz Hernadez. A bottle of cheap wine would have been at least a token. Suffice to say, i'd rather sleep on the sidewalk than stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Cool_Breeze_78
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay for four nights at Hard Rock Hotel but had to check out after one night. The room was old and not very clean. Small bathroom sink. The hallway from the elevator to the room was very dirty. The casino table was so dark so very hard to play jack black. The location is off the strip and each cab ride cost about $12

Reviews.Title: “dusty the cowboy”
Reviews.Author: marie n
Reviews.Content: room was okay. I have gotten just as good of a room at a holiday inn express. I travel once a month & that was actually a holiday vacation a booked with a co-worker friend; neither one of us was impressed. our room was in the paradise towers. haven't figured out the paradise yet. the room was super dusty so I cleaned it because of my co-workers allergies & don't have the patience to wait for housekeeping to come in. the shower......what a joke!!!!!!!!!! the water leaked all the bathroom floor because of the gap between the door & tiles. there wasnt any trim between the two. had to always have extra towels for that. I realize that we were only in the room at night to relax & sleep but I would have thought it would have been better. On a good note, the gentleman who was the bartender thanksgiving night at the bar by the poker tables was awesome as were the staff at the bell desk. our drinks at the bar were superb & the special drink he made us was yummy!!! the staff at the bell desk was super helpful with info and answering any questions that we had!!!! but overall, I wont stay here again just because of the room experience. besides what I have read here, I talked to lots of other guests while roaming around & a lot of them were displeased too. apparently, the quality of service has deteriated in the past few years.

Reviews.Title: “Local Staycation”
Reviews.Author: Mindy W
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. We loved the decor, music, atmosphere and pool. We traveled with children under five and they thought the pool was awesome. They also loved the look in the room. Our four year old danced down the halls to the great selection of music in consent play mode. Only thing I would change is there is really no 'family friendly' restaurant. All the restaurants had some sort of bar. Our one year old drank his water out of a the plastic Bud Light cup the waiter brought. On the upside it does not smell heavily of smoke which is a nice change from other casinos on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Yeaahhh...No”
Reviews.Author: NenaV
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in January with a deal i had gotten off Groupon. I was excited to go, my boyfriend and i were celebrating his recent graduation from college. We arrived around noon to check in, rooms were available and we were upgraded to a corner room... thats where my excitement died. Room(s): The first room 30738 in the Paradise Tower (our upgraded corner room), had a good view of the pool, lots of floor space, a mountain view from its second window and a huge bathroom with an amazing walk in shower... great right? wrong! The entire room was covered in a layer of dust from several days of neglect. As guest services agent at a hotel and an avid traveler i checked the room for bedbugs; no bedbugs, but i found a dirty towel by the bed skirt that stuck to itself (guess what that was covered with?) We were then upgraded to suite 702 in the Casino Tower. It was beautiful! huge living room, wet bar, plush leather couch, double doors that opened to the view of the pool and, a state of the art Bose sounds system. The bedroom had a plush king size bed, double doors to over looking the pool and, LCD Tv. The same as the original room it was covered in a fine layer of dust, it coulda been worse so we stayed in the room. Dinning: Johnny Small's tapas restaurant inside the hotel. Food was fantastic, the have a great all you can eat Tapas and Sushi for $24.95. It was great intimate little lounge, perfect for dinner for 2. Service on the other hand was TERRIBLE! Our waitress Layla ignored us for 10 min before taking our order. She was rarely around during our meal and took over 20 min to come by at the end and took another 15min to bring out check. Mr.Lucky's 24/7 was great. Food was fantastic. We were seated right away and our server Joe was on top of all his tables and never skipped a beat with us. Overall: I don't think we'll ever stay there again. The location wasn't very good, off the strip; not far walk during the day but at night can be pretty seedy. With all the service issues I'm not to keen on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and Casino Airport Disruption however”
Reviews.Author: dmw_123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for New Year 2010 The rooms are great as is the Casino, I found both to be spacious and very clean. However our room overlooked the airport runway and was very noisy in the mornings with planes taking off making it impossible to sleep. The pool looked great for summer and I can see why it is a popular place for the pool parties. The location is a little far from the strip. Would return if in a room in a different part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed for a month at HRH”
Reviews.Author: Zachariahd1
Reviews.Content: We were skeptical after reading some of the reviews, but had every expectation exceeded! Room was great an contemporary with large walk in showers. Great staff, only disappointment was limited pool hours. Only needed to stay one night wish it would have been longer !

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Gdacey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just got back from 4 nights staying here and we both loved it! I know it is out of season so probably not the same experience as staying in the height of summer but it was still very busy. The service was fantastic from the moment we arrived until we checked out. Infact, when we arrived the lady at check in upgraded us to a suite for free! Throughout our whole stay the staff were always extremely polite and couldn't do enough to help, including making all our dinner reservations for the time we were there! Obviously, being December, the pools were not really open(although there was nothing to stop you taking a dip and in fact many did while we were there) there was just no lifeguard on duty and pool bars were closed. They still played music around the rehab pool( which our room overlooked) which started at 9 and stopped at 5:30. It didn't disturb us really and I think if you stay at the Hard Rock, you should expect music to be playing all the time. Overall, we had a great time staying here and even won some money in their casino! This hotel was a little off the strip( about a 10 min walk to the main strip and bellagio) but I quite liked being a little bit away from the very intense strip! They do offer a free shuttle bus to strip and a cab was always waiting outside to take you anywhere for under $10. This hotel was a little cheaper than most of the big hotels on the strip and we thought it was great value! I would definitely stay here again if we are ever lucky enough to go again

Reviews.Title: “Still here writing this but wishing i wasn't!”
Reviews.Author: PaulLins
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 years ago in the Paradise Tower when it was new and loved it. Also spent a lot of time here 3 years ago. Come back 2 years later and what a change. Talk about gone down hill !!! Arrived to check in at 10pm into our PRE-PAID ( in full !!) Paradise Tower room with King Size bed and Non Smoking Room. I'd asked for a quiet room away from the elevators. I confirmed this at check in and after checking a floor plan chart she said no probs. Took the 10 minute walk through the casino dragging the cases to the room only to find the room directly opposite the lifts ( and there's 6 of them so the entire floor's population walk's past your room and not all the guests are particularly quiet - well it is Vegas). Not only are we directly opposite the lift but no King bed just 2 doubles. No big deal you'd think, but the doubles are tiny doubles. Thought there had been a mistake so took the 10 min walk back to reception as no one answered the phone down to the front desk. Got there only to be told sorry, fully booked, King Beds go on a first come first serve basis ( WHAT !!! We'd booked it !! and paid for it !!!! in full !!!!!). She couldn't have cared less and said to go back in the morning an they'd try and move us for the rest of our stay ( 6 nights ). Well the night was horrendous !! Party in the room below, moving house above pretty much all night for some reason, argument in the next door room ( and ALL rooms have adjoining doors for families so noise is a problem ) Girl in the hall at 4am decides to start kicking her door in because her boyfriend had locked her out after a row - she slept in the hall!!
