And do you think i could raise the front desk to come and sort it !!!!! No !! APPARENTLY they don't have anyone manning the front desk phone at the moment because they don't have the staff. WHAT !!!!!!! Thought we'd put the ipod into the dock in the room to disguise the noise - but the docks aren't compatible with new ipods! Tried to lock passport in the safe - safe had a fault code. Pillows smelt of smoke ! Basin drains don't open properly. Spoke to a manager in the morning who basically did everything right - i didn't want an upgrade, just sleep. He suggested we have a top floor corner room to minimise risk of noisy neighbours and said it would be ready by midday. The girl on the desk had said we'd need to move our stuff over by 6pm. So at 5pm we left Wynns on a $15 taxi ride to move our stuff, needing to go back to Wynns for a show ( Le Reve which is absolutely fantastic). Stopped at front desk to collect the key to our new room which we were looking forward to only to be told that the people who were due to leave hadn't. The hotel has a policy that once a guest is in, they can stay as long as they like as long as they pay for the room - EVEN IF IT IS SOLD OUT AND THIS MEANS TURNING PEOPLE AWAY THAT HAVE BOOKED AND PAID FOR THEIR ROOM. I've never heard anything quite like this before! BE WARNED! So they gave us a room on the 9th. Despite g'tees, when we get back to our room to move our gear our room key won't work ( we suspected this may have been the case but was assured it would be fine). There's no phone in the lobbies so we go to our new room to call front desk - guess what - NO ANSWER !! Hike back to the front desk, a little upset and it goes on and on......... we turned down free accommodation to stay here because it was so enjoyable last time. Wish we hadn't. Bytheway, it's only been a couple of years but the bathrooms are feeling really tired already, decor is suffering - its a real shame because this place was the business. Oh, and the awesome club Wasted Space has gone now, to be replaced with sports betting - nice move!! All we can do is make sure we don't spend a penny in their casino in protest. Really disappointed. One member of staff has been great ( guy called Ryan but he's now away for 2 weeks ) - good luck if you have problems and remember its a fair way off the strip. On the plus side, a little of the atmosphere is still there created mainly by the music they play. Also, still kept nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a fun stay.”
Reviews.Author: ANNMPLS
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 days with a freind that took me along for a business trip. I liked the hotel. My only complaint is that it is quite far from the strip. Otherwise it was really fun!

Reviews.Title: “just about alright”
Reviews.Author: kof1
Reviews.Content: A bit too dark in the room, a bit dusty. The staff were ok, mind you we were surpose to get an upgrade which never happened.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay a the Paradise Tower”
Reviews.Author: nadarien
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Hard Rock. It may be a bit far from the strip, but I still had a great time. I imagine it's even better in the summer when the pools' open. We stayed in the Paradise Tower on the 16th floor, which had a view of the pool and the Strip. The room was dim lit, but was otherwise comfy. The bathroom was a little off though, they gave 1 complimentary soap, shampoo and conditioner, lotion. They should at least give 2 soap bars, so we had to request extra. We ate at Pink Taco, Mr Luckys and Johnny Smalls. I recommend the latter and suggest you best get the eat all you can tapas coz the a la carte is expensive for a tapas place. Mr Luckys was overpriced and blah, Pink Taco had a $5 for 5 tacos and $1 frozen margaritas but the hubby said the drink was too sweet. Food in general at the Hard Rock is expensive and mediocre, but I would go back at Johnnys for the deal. Played some slots and lost a little money. They had a club and gym, spa, pool which we didn't get to check out due to time constraints.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place after canceled flight”
Reviews.Author: hamiltonc3
Reviews.Content: Our flight out of Las Vegas was scheduled for 6:50 am, and without notice to us it was moved up to 6:00 a.m. The next available flight home was not set to leave until midnight. Not good. After camping at the airport during the rescheduling process, I called the Hard Rock. We arrived at the hotel at about 11:00 a.m., and were immediately given a room. The ultra-soft beds were perfect for 4 people who had not slept at all the previous night. After a great long nap, we hit the casino. The Hard Rock is my favorite casino in Vegas. Great music for those of us in our mid-forties, and the friendly and fun dealers make it a fantastic experience. My group had a great time, and I really appreciate the quick early checkin and friendly and courteous staff. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “HRH all suites tower”
Reviews.Author: lifeisshortOhio
Reviews.Content: This is an all suites tower at Hard Rock casino. The suite had a nice flat screen,shower.bedding. large marble tub with seprate shower.Private Check in desk with easy parking.The tub and shower were not very clean(this was the only fault I found)no fridge in room but nice ipod dock.This hotel is NOT on strip so if this is important think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went as part of a group to the Maaco Bowl in December 2011. We did not choose the hotel. It was part of the package. It is beautiful and the staff was mostly terrific. Most dining prices seemed reasonable except breakfast which was outrageous at Mr. Lucky's. The property is a good 15 minute walk from the strip so be prepared for a stroll, or get a car or a taxi. Rock music blares 24/7, so be prepared. You'll either love it or hate it. Even if you don't stay here, visit to see the dozens of displays of rock music memorabilia, including performance wardrobe and instruments from famous musicians. It was too cold for the pool but HOLY COW the pool area is magnificent. Gorgeous, gorgeous. Acres of tropical paradise! This hotel would not be our first choice if we went back to Vegas. But you won't go wrong as long as you are prepared to be a distance from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Heather D
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. The room was clean and the beds are soooo wonderful. I would love to know where I can order one of those blankets. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were in Vegas for a softball camp and the nice hot shower was great after a cold day at the ball park. I loved the fact after a long day we didnt have to go anywhere to find great food to eat we just went downstairs. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad; Not Great”
Reviews.Author: MadHatterMom
Reviews.Content: We just returned a few days ago from a stay in Las Vegas. My husband, two kids and I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel (mostly as a request from my kids, who are 12 and 8). We booked a room at the HRH All-Suite Tower, which had a separate entrance and separate check-in from the rest of the hotel. The front desk staff were great - very professional. The room was nice too, except the bathroom layout was a little funky because it was separated from the bedroom by a huge wall of glass. So, if you wanted any privacy, you had to pull some curtains across the glass wall. That meant access to the bathroom door was blocked by the curtains. Weird, but not a disaster. When we were in a taxi on the way to a show, the driver warned us about the Hard Rock and told us it was known as a college-kid party hotel. The irony was that it was totally quiet at night and we all got great sleep. The biggest drawback for us was the proximity (or lack thereof) to the Strip. It's not walkable and taking taxis everywhere gets expensive. We ended up taking our truck out of the garage and driving at one point, but it was a pain to find parking when going from place to place. The hotel offers a shuttle that takes you to Fashion Show mall (right on the Strip), but we were told it left every hour, on the hour, until 5:00 p.m. We never used it because it didn't run very often and stopped running too early. It wasn't a bad stay, but it wasn't a great stay either. If you want to hang out at the hotel and the pool (which was really cool-looking) and don't mind being off the Strip, this would be a good place to choose. For my family of four, it probably wasn't the best choice and I will try another hotel next time we're in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Want the fun and excitement of Vegas, without the crowds at the Strip?”
Reviews.Author: momofmonkeys62
Reviews.Content: We had a three day weekend stay here mid November. We found it to be a great place to grab a drink and a little gaming during the day, without the crowds you find at the Strip casinos-which is a very short cab ride away. The hotel has a more intimate boutique feel than expected. We didn't hit the nightclub but fellow guests reported it to be awesome. Santana was appearing in the Joint that weekend, sorry we missed that show! Our travel agent touted the HRH as a 15 min walk from the strip-could be, but go for the cab. Staff was wonderful, the room was very clean and had a great view of the pool area which regrettably was closed for the season. The memorabilia in the lobby area is fantastic..its worth a trip even if you don't stay here! The diner has good affordable food, check out their Lucky 7 special -steak and shrimp for $7 after midnight.All in all, a bit off the Strip, but a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Uneven service levels but beautiful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: peytonisrad
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed here after getting an amazing deal through groupon. We checked in & were put in the Paradise tower which is quite a walk away from the main building but the room was gorgeous! The bathroom was kind of a weird layout, with the toilet & the shower being extremely close together but the view of the pool was wonderful. The next day, however, they were doing some kind of construction across from only our room on the whole hallway. The noise woke us up but we just went to get some breakfast & some coffee. When we returned, the construction was still going on so we called down to the Front Desk. After being on hold for 7 minutes, I was finally put in touch with a manager who was very sympathetic [she could hear the construction noises through the phone, it was that loud] & offered to upgrade us to a corner room AND give us $50 F&B credit. SO nice!! We went to the new room, which was even more gorgeous than the last, but the TV & shower head weren't working. We were wanted to shower then go out on the town so we called to have someone sent to the room. 15 minutes later, no one had come so we called again. Another 15 minutes goes by, still no one. I called again to let them no we still hadn't seen anyone & the girl very rudely said "this is a big hotel & they have other rooms to see, they'll be up there soon okay?" I was so taken aback we just decided to leave & hope things would get taken care of. The TV was but the shower wasn't. Pretty disappointing to leave with that impression when everything else was so great. Overall it was a great hotel & we would probably go back if there was another deal but they need to train all of their employees to be on the same level. One nice & one sour doesn't make for a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality at the Hard Rock Hotel LV”
Reviews.Author: Rollaboard
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is what makes this hotel great. From check-in to check-out, the staff in all areas were welcoming, friendly and helpful. Food and service at Mr.Lucky restaurant was A+. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Location is great for on and off the Strip activities. Would recommend to everyone, and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Hard Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maryrose98
Reviews.Content: My 22 year old daughter and I did a couple night "mommy and me" trip after securing a good Groupon coupon deal at the Hard Rock Hotel. The room exceeded our expectations, two big screen TV's in a mini suite, awesome huge bathroom, and high floor with a great view. The Hard Rock has a fantastic spa that should not be missed. Lunch at Pink Taco was delicious, and daughter highly enjoyed rocking to loud classic tunes in the casino late into the night while mama enjoyed a relaxing bath and drink in her huge tub and slept great in her ultra comfy bed. What a fun early Christmas gift!

Reviews.Title: “I can´t wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: evebella
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a great room , a villa, it was so nice decoraded, very minimalist, I think we spent a night like a rockstars!! excellent service, everything was perfect , although we stayed for only a night (we went to a concert) I will love to stayed a complete week :) I think next time we need to save more money for a week!!

Reviews.Title: “OHIO NURSES AT HARD ROCK HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne R
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel was beautiful, the service was great, we went to 4 different casinos on the strip Ceasars being one of them and we were so happy that my daughter had picked Hard Rock Hotel to be my Christmas Gift. Our flight was great, Airtran, no issues. wish we would of hit big, but we came back with money and our clothes on our back so we are happy, lol. What a wonderful experience. I want to go back and be able to stay longer and have more money to spend. Going to have to find me a Suga Daddy to take me to Las Vegas for another dream trip, you must play the Hangover slot machines at the casinos, they are a trip and so much fun... Good luck and enjoy your stay, take alot of money and snacks and you will have the best time of your life.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wjo602
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and the casino was appropriate, the Pink Taco had good food and good service. Hotel staff was quick and check out was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday weekend in LV”
Reviews.Author: cbailey77056
Reviews.Content: last minute trip booked to LV for my birthday weekend. went online and booked a suite @ the Hard Rock HRH Tower room was clean and comfortable.... bell desk and concierge were AWESOME.... didnt have a host, but didnt need one. bell desk guys arranged an escalade whenever i needed and wherever i needed to go: golf 2x, MGM, airport, mandalay, etc. had a small hiccup on the bill during checkout, but the front desk corrected the error without question !!! spa was great.... food was good...only ate @ mr luckys in the hotel...prices very reasonable. casino is clean and the music drowns out all the cheesey slot noise.....

Reviews.Title: “Hhhhhmmmm oh well, another hotel service failure.”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: So once again through the vagaries or airline scheduling, we wound up in our destination city early in the morning, long before hotel check in time. So, this time, we booked our room for one night in advance. We paid for the previous night so we could check in at 9 am and not get the "room is not ready yet" mantra from the front desk. So, we also called ahead the night before and spoke to the front desk so they wouldn't think we were a no show. Did this work? What do you think? When we arrived, they had no idea what we were talking about, and of course our room wasn't ready. They gave us a room in a different region of the hotel, but it didn't have the view we had originally booked and instead the room looked over the parking garage, very soothing. When we asked to move, we were told essentially that we had been upgraded already and we were out of luck. That, and there is no coffee maker in the room!!! Boo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay when seeing music”
Reviews.Author: Ed F
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in the fairly expensive HRH Tower suite when we saw music at the Joint. The new Joint is a really great venue for a show. The HRH Towers have their own check in area and elevator, and the rooms are pretty nice, although you can tell that a lot of partying goes on in this hotel. If that's the scene you're looking for on a concert night, then this is your place. Because this place is a bit out of the way on the strip, it makes sense to stay here if you're seeing music for a night. Parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, no complaints!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brazililli
Reviews.Content: Got a Groupon deal for this hotel tha tpretty much made the stay free, so I did not expect much but was pleasantly surprised...the rooms was a non smoking room that really has never been smoke in which is hard to find...super clean, nice decor, awesome view...even though we actually could see the airport and airplanes were landing over us, we could not hear a thing. I also did not hear neighbors or people in th hall...great sound proof to be short. The hotel is not huge and gambling is not a major thing there, so I really liked that. Very easy to get around because the small size and not a gazillion of slot machines. The parking was pretty much next door to our room, in tower 3...so easy!!!! Nice restaurants and stores...really liked it. If you are planning on staying there without a rental car, please keep in mind that it's a bit far from the strip so wear comfortable shoes. I had one but I have walked from there to the strip on New Year's eve because that's the closest parking we could find, and in a cold night and in high heels, it was not fun!!! With a car though, you are fine...Walgreens is accross the street for water, snacks and everything you need to save you $$$...Johnny Rockets also accross the street, my favorite Indian restaurant in LV too. Hard Rock restaurant in the same parking lot...a brewery accross the street also...and I'm straight and married but have been to a gay nightclub also accross the street with friends and had a blast!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Enjoy your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll leave the Hard Rock Hotel to the rockers!”
Reviews.Author: Derek D
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived in the room, there were wet spots all over the floor from spilled beer. The rooms are very dark and poorly lit. There is no refrigerator or coffee maker in the room. If you want anything, you have to purchase it from the hotel. There is some things you can purchase from the room that are stocked daily (however, do not pick them up or you are charged because each product has a sensor on it). The beds did sleep well though, and the rooms have a very nice view with large windows. There are 2 towers at the hotel, 1 above the casino which is loud, and the second which is a long walk to the front door/street. They do have a shuttle (which you are charged $18 a day for whether you use it or not) but it only fits 6-8 persons and runs on the hour from 10-5. As big as the hotel is, you have to show up at least 30 minutes before the next shuttle. Last but not least, if you wanted to gamble at the hotel, you have to do so with girls pole dancing around the tables. I felt it was very trashy for the hotel to have this. We love Hard Rock Cafe's so we thought we would also enjoy the hotel, but we will never stay with Hard Rock Hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be staying at HRH all-suite tower again & again!”
Reviews.Author: Katie B
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just returned from Vegas after staying in a city-view King suite at the HRH all-suite tower 12/1-5, and we can not say enough good things about this place! The decor in the rooms sets the perfect vibe for arriving in Vegas - modern, sleek, & trendy while also shockingly comfortable! The bed was by far the best hotel bed I have ever slept in! We liked the bedding and decor so much that we are now planning to redecorate our apartment to match the same vibe. We also got plenty of use out of the built-in wall-mounted ipod docking station that also had preloaded HRH favorite hits. The bathroom was equally well done with soaking tubs that are perfect for a rose petal bubble bath with plenty of champagne. As far as comfort goes, I really don't think you can exceed the HRH all-suite tower! The view, while not of the Strip, was also surprisingly cool thanks to the massive wall of windows in the suite. We took plenty of photos of the mountains and the clouds from the windows in our room. Customer service in the hotel is also phenomenal. We visited all of the major casinos while we were in Vegas, and the cocktail servers, bartenders, front desk staff, & bellmen were far friendly & more genuine at HRH. We stuck to the HRH all-suite tower side of the whole Hard Rock property & gaming areas because it just had more of a chill vibe than the main guest registration for the other accommodations. We also went to Vanity on Saturday night and had a great time dancing though drinks cost an arm and a leg (to be expected though). We ordered delicious coffee & mimosas to the room every morning while we were there, and room service was reasonably priced & prompt. Ultimately, if you are traveling to Las Vegas with a group of twenty-somethings & looking for a really cool, trendy, and unique place to stay, don't miss out on the HRH all-suite tower. You will love it. Even though it's a few blocks from the strip, it is 100 percent worth it. I am definitely going back for my bachelorette party next year and sending my fiance there for his bachelor party as well! And we have now made a pact that we will always stay here when we go party like rockstars in Vegas baby! Can't wait for the next time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Megan M
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice. Stayed in the new HRH Tower. Spa was incredible. Want to go back ASAP!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Quick Stay!”
Reviews.Author: esims04
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a stay at the Hard Rock for my birthday and we had a perfect time. The hotel is so cool. If you're into music and a trendy atmosphere, I would definitely recommend this place! The hotel is not that big either so it's pretty easy to get around. If you're staying in their HRH all suite tower, they have a separate check in near their night club. We stayed in the Supreme King Suite. Man, it was so nice. Everything looks brand me and updated. There was mini bar, HUGE bath tub and shower, perfect amount of space in the room and a nice firm bed. They had an ipod stand that played music threw out the whole room. We walked by their gym and it looked very updated and spacious. Watch out for breakfast though. They only restaurant open for breakfast is Mr. Lucky. Their menu looked good but totally over priced, 13 bucks for a breakfast burrito? No thanks. There is a Starbucks though in the hotel so go there! Also the Hofbrauhaus is right across the street, that place is super fun to eat at on the weekends! (see my review about that place too!).

Reviews.Title: “Good but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: gramie_e
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice & customer service was great but food & drinks were way too expensive. Also, just in case you plan on going to a concert there, it is a "stand-up" only; no seats, so be prepared to stand for 4 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “No such thing as customer service”
Reviews.Author: jjones4180
Reviews.Content: Even though I have not actually stayed at this property, I have emailed from their website 2 years in a row. My question to them both years has been do they supply complimentary refrigerators for storage of guest medical supplies (Insulin). They have never responded to the emails so I can only assume they just do not care about guest looking to stay at their property.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dbacklund
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino with all the gamblings, ounges, restaurants and shops in all one same floor with two towers of suite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service; would never stay here.”
Reviews.Author: SJRinKS
Reviews.Content: Unlike the last few positive reviews, my husband and I had a very disappointing experience. We arrived on a Friday evening and checked into our room. When we arrived at our room, we found that although we were in the tower that we reserved, we had the wrong room type and view. I attempted to contact the hotel manager with the room phone. After being disconnected twice, I had to unplug the phone to get it to re-boot. That, however, didn't work. Cell service was spotty in the room so in order to speak to the manager, I nearly had to flatten myself against our window. At this point, I was quite tired, upset, & frustrated. I unfortunately used an expletive and the manager told me that I needed to refrain from using such language. I apologized and began again. It was then that she explained to be that a room reservation is nothing more than a room request. That logically does not make sense. When you reserve a room online, it only shows you the types/views/towers that they have available, if it's not available you can't book it. At any rate, I was offered a DOWNgrade to be able to have a king bed but in a smaller, crappier room. I was told that they did have a room available to upgrade but that we would need to pay the difference. What in the world? You gave away my room and want ME to pay for the upgrade? Not a chance. I tried to explain that to the manager who told me it was against hotel policy to offer free upgrades. Apparently not - based on previous reviews, some people are offered upgrades without even requesting them. At any rate, I further explained that if this were the case that we would expect a full refund of our deposit; she agreed to do that but I had to stand in line for 20 minutes to sign paperwork. I also tried to explain that if we moved hotels, we surely wouldn't be back to spend our money in their casino, restaurants, or bars. It made no difference. I was so disappointed; this is the ONE hotel in Vegas that I had not stayed in that I really wanted to and I was really looking forward to it. After the way we were treated, we will never be back. FWIW, I didn't even bother looking at the bathroom but the room itself was pretty standard - really, nothing special at all. During all of this, I called the Venetian to see if they had a king suite available (what we had requested at HR); I was told they did and as I moved away from the window, I was disconnected; I called back but there was no record of my reservation yet so I had to start over. When I explained that this was the 2nd call, the gentleman offered to discount our second night's stay. We booked it over there and WOW; what a difference. Now THIS was a king suite. A huge marble bathroom with a glass shower, sunken tub, double sinks, separate vanity, separate toilet room, a sunken living room with a second flat screen TV, comfy sofa, and the bed was amazingly comfortable. We will be staying at the Venetian on our future trips to Vegas. On previous trips, I've stayed at the Bellagio, Caesar's, the Rio, & Excalibur; Venetian is far superior to any of those. HR will never have one red cent out of my pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Duh - shouldn't bring kids... ;-)”
Reviews.Author: Brenda C
Reviews.Content: Duh - dumb blond mom moment. I booked it last minute on a Iphone app for last minute rates (which was a great price!) as we were driving through on our way to Colorado for Thanksgiving. The room was excellent and perfect for a few hours of sleep (great bed!). NOT a good idea for kids -- as there were pole dancers at the bar in the lobby (my girl pointed them out and said "their BUNS are sticking out!!" LoL!!). Also -- barf on the hallway floor the next morning and spilled french fries, empty beer bottles all over the hallway (we got up and on our way by 6am -- as we had a long drive) and obviously someone had a GREAT party the night before!! Oh well --- next time I'll know better. My bad!!

Reviews.Title: “Summer time at rehab”
Reviews.Author: Destiny J
Reviews.Content: I love the hard rock its all ADULT themed so there are no little kids running around staring at adults having some good adult fun in LAS VEGAS! Love the Clubs LOve the pool going back for new years already bookee a room see you there!!!

Reviews.Title: “"HARD ROCK HOTEL GREAT PLACE"”
Reviews.Author: jgwstang
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived on Thanksgiving afternoon, grabbed a quick lunch @ The Pink Taco. The food and service was outstanding. We checked into our room got a room upgrade "VERY NICE" As a fan of music I loved the great music being played throughout the casino. Rockstar club was a good benefit worthwhile for the discounts alone but the free slot play was fun too. We always rent a car so being off strip was no problem. All the staff that we encountered were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, even with kids”
Reviews.Author: AR08
Reviews.Content: My husband, 7 year old boys and I went to Las Vegas over thanksgiving. We stayed at the HRH all suite tower and had a good stay. The positives: great bed, nice decor, in room music "stations" (kids loved being dj), plenty of space, separate check in with no line in the tower, tower access straight from garage (no need to walk through smoky casino), quick response to requests such as extra bedding/towels, surprisingly quiet at night. The only negative that I have was the housekeeping of the shower. I noticed a hairballl in the back of the shower when we checked in. I complained about it to the main desk the next morning, and throughout our stay, it was still there, even though the rest of the bathroom was immaculate. As a response to those who complained that this was not a family hotel, open your eyes! The Las Vegas strip is not family friendly. If you are going to bring kids here, be prepared to answer questions about suggestive ads everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “It Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: jsandoval562
Reviews.Content: I had doubts about staying at this hotel due to the theme but I had a great time. Best of all was the room I had in the Paradise Tower. It was a corner room on the 18th floor. Fanastic views looking east and southwest. The room was very spacious. The staff was super throughout the hotel. An added bonus was that it was across the street from the Hofbrauhaus.

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful assault”
Reviews.Author: Gary M
Reviews.Content: Remote from the strip. $21 for a simple breakfast. $20 per day resort fee and the pool was closed. $6 per beer. No fridge or microwave. All male bartenders. No movie channels. Try to force 'On Demand'. Other than being monetarily assaulted, room was great, clean, extravagant bed. Staff was nice. Felt safe, parking was easy. Nice array of encased RockyRoll memorabilia.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel/Hotel Hell”
Reviews.Author: rggrebvefve
Reviews.Content: I will give you an honest review about this hotel since I spend most of my work out of town and see a huge variety of hotels all year long you will get a very good prespective. It is for the young crowd without a doubt and if you like rock and roll, involved in a romantic relationship, drink like a sailor this is the place for you. I'm and X smoker and do feel that smokers do have a right to smoke. I have a very difficult time with the smell of it and it is impossible to get away from it at hotel. There is not a place inside or out to get relief. It seems to be everywhere and running into it occassion is not a bother but every waking moment smelling cigarettes. Did not like the mandatory resort fee. 21.00 a night will get you internet and work out room. This was not disclosed to us. I noticed alot of people where very upset of the nondisclosed fee. I also spoke with other tourist and this seems to be a problem in Vegas. They lure you in with a low rate and hit you with this resort fee. The Hard Rock is not located near the strip. They promised a transportation but bus was broke down. There van holds 7 people and runs every hour and 1/2. We had to use a taxi or walked 3 blocks. Taxi ran about 10 dollars to strip. Prices where out of this world. Coffee and omlette ran 18 dollars without tip. All the dining and club prices in hotel where a shock!!! I hope this helps you guys....

Reviews.Title: “Rockin out Vegas style”
Reviews.Author: daddy1020
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a nice getaway from LA so we decided to book the Hard Rock. We had a total blast. The room was so clean and quiet. The view of the strip awesome. The beds were really super comfortable. The entire roster of HRH personnel was made up of friendly, helpful and knowledgeable people who went out of their way to make sure that our stay was second to none. Loved the total rock experience, with all of the best rock music heard anywhere around the faciltiy. Rock on, Hard Rock, Rock on!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Beds”
Reviews.Author: JaneBerns
Reviews.Content: Loved the beds at the Hard Rock. It is a smaller casino and way easy to find your way around. We love Nobu and the Pink Taco restaurants and decided to just stay there. We also would like to give a Shout Out to Phil at the Juice Bar by the Spa. The Spa specials were 2 services for $200 which we also did. Great time in Vegas as always!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AnAislingSkye
Reviews.Content: great hotel with lots of interesting music exhibits . Rooms were clean and staff friendly.Good rates can be found if you look around. a bit away from the strip but only $10 in a cab to MGM etc

Reviews.Title: “Pool Party”
Reviews.Author: Philinstien
Reviews.Content: Went to the Sunday Rehab, booked a room o'night - which is the best way to do it. Had a cabana with friends - the party is a blast, the people show ponies - but what do you expect. The hotel rooms are really good, but the off strip location is a bit of a drag. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “HRH”
Reviews.Author: Tamela81
Reviews.Content: Our 2 night stay at HRH was fantastic. Our 2 beded room was very spacious and perfect for the 2 of us. I love this hotel the only disappointment was all of the pools were closed even though the weather was perfect. We booked this hotel after being advised the pools would be opened. The location is great and easy to walk to the strip. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Would definately stay again and recommend to anyone travelling to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend with Some Reservations”
Reviews.Author: LynnWVA
Reviews.Content: I'm in my 50s and out of the demographic for this hotel but I found a lot to like and a few things to dislike. I liked the rock music pumping throughout the hotel but found the black decor feeling a little dated. I stayed in Paradise tower and was glad I was in a room high enough that I could see the city otherwise my only view would have been the parking garage. I didn't like feeling manipulated. There's no coffee pot so you have to go downstairs to buy. The snacks are out on a motion censored platform so if you pick them up you're charged. I got a good rate on the room but felt I might have got more bang for the same buck at the nearby Embassy Suites or Hyatt Place. Lots of great memorabilia of rock stars throughout hotel which you can see without staying here. Pink Taco was a really good restaurant. If you're comparing prices, keep in mind there's a $20 resort fee added. Not that close to the strip so you may need a car or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Off strip, but good rates”
Reviews.Author: travelindb
Reviews.Content: I went to a training at UNLV so this location was perfect. It took us 30 minutes to walk to the Bellagio. I wouldn't do that walk late at night. As for the hotel itself, the room was clean and nicely decorated. When we first arrived and got to our room, it has not been cleaned so they moved us to another room. Unless I needed a cheaper room or needed to be by UNLV, I wouldn't stay there again just because I prefer to be on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary at The Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: Irishwake
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the Hard Rock for 4 nights/3 days in October for our anniversary. This was our 3rd time staying there and once again loved it. Great service, friendly employees and much more of a small intimate feeling in the casino. Plus we love the fact that you don't hear the noisy slot machines as they just pump in really good rock and roll music. We also spent a day at the pool and had a great time. Very warm for late October as it was around 88 degrees on our first full day. They pool is huge and the people watching is the best. We had lunch poolside and it was great along with the crazy drinks on the menu. We ate at Pink Taco twice, once for breakfast and once for dinner. Actually the breakfast was amazing and we really enjoyed it. The dinner is always good. Hopefully we will be back next year and stay at the Hard Rock for another anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “A Rough Ride for Rock n Roll”
Reviews.Author: timetune
Reviews.Content: Great beds and sheets ,but thats not what your there for ,right? Security staff over the top arrogant and rude,just stupid. Smoky everywhere.Pool, just brutaly loud,cold and costly.Top notch venue for live shows,awesome sound and lights at The Joint,bully security. Overall Vegas is better new and this is dated,old,and crass.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vibe!”
Reviews.Author: franci329
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Hard Rock Las Vegas. We were able to check in early and although our room wasn't ready they upgraded to a better room on the 9th floor. The room was decorated in a rock-n-roll vibe, the bed was so comfortable I never wanted to leave. I did not like the area for the toilet as the door is too close and the shower is also in the same area. No way can you move around. The lighting in the sink/make up area is very dim. This hotel is also NOT located on the strip. I knew that already when booking but really wanted to try it out. The strip is probably a good 15 minute walk, so make sure to take a taxi or where good sneakers. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The shopping is cool and they even have a tatoo artist on site. This is also the hotel for the Rehab pool- which was not open. Great eats, gambling and shows at this hotel. You really don't even have to leave if you don't want to. I saw Santana while I was here, bought my ticket at the hotel but should have bought it on the strip to get 50% off. This hotel also had free parking and free shuttle to the strip from 10am-5pm, wish it was a little later. I love the decor of this hotel and all the craziness!!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas done right!”
Reviews.Author: Nick M
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are awesome. You feel like you're a rock star. I loved all of the rock posters, pictures and decor in the rooms and around the hotel. I had a balcony pool view and it was cool to relax under the Vegas sun/heat. Saw an Incubus show at the Joint and had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah J
Reviews.Content: What an awesome Time with my girlfriends here!!!! Thanks for making my first visit to Vegas an awesome one hard rock Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay...”
Reviews.Author: Kevin C
Reviews.Content: Their room is nice, clean and stylish. Service is ok if you don't ask much. However, lobby and casino is crazy loudly, especially Friday and Saturday. If you like to party, here is the place. If you don't, better to find another hotel, or book their HRH suites because it has its own lobby. Also, location is kinda far from the street. Overall is ok for its price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful young hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colesjr
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at hard rock lv to finish a week long stay in lv. I must say I was very pleased with the feel and look of the hotel. I am a Vegas regular and have stayed at nearly every major hotel there. The room was outstanding in the hrh tower complete with a music system that even played my iPhone. The crowd was 25-50 and the music was classic rock throughout the casino. Lots of memorabilia to look at. The restaurants and shops where very modern and delicious food at 35 steak and matinini house. Check out the suites at hrh tower as I found them quite affordable

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, sub-par service”
Reviews.Author: jinisu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double queen in the Paradise Tower (got a really good deal from booking dot com). The rooms are big, relatively new, with a distinct Hard Rock edge. Bathrooms - Shower only; there's a door for the shower and toilet area, but not for the vanities. Room - great beds with the fluffiest pillowtop I've ever seen. Air conditioning is annoying though as it blows quite strongly right at the bed that's closer to the window, it really dries the room (and the people sleeping in it!) out. View - we were on the 8th floor; right next to us was the top floor of the carpark, but beyond we could see the lights of the Wynn. Service - the front desk (guest services) takes forever to pick up the phone. The laundry for some reason added a rush charge to our bill - we never asked for it to be rushed, and after some calling around, it was finally waived. The rooms aren't cleaned very well - the sinks weren't wiped down (obvious when you have glossy black sinks), our ice bucket wasn't emptied and we weren't given a new plastic bag (self-serve ice machine next door), our drinking glasses weren't cleaned nor did we get new ones. Also, Paradise Tower is a bit of a schlep from the main entrance. I'm not sure when rooms in the HRH Tower will be fully renovated, but if they are, it's much closer (and their lobby is much nicer.) Parking is either self-park (free) or valet (free, but tip the valet).

Reviews.Title: “Great One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: sleeplessinGlouceste
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the HRH before heading to the Grand Canyon. We had reserved a room in the Paradise Tower and the front desk upgraded us to a corner room which was awesome. There was a view of the pool and the strip. The Paradise Tower is a bit of a walk from the front desk but totally worth it because the room is huge and really posh, super comfortable bed, 46" flat screen tv mounted on the wall and swivels, enormous bathroom was a walk in shower and double sinks. The hotel has a great vibe, clean and modern. Not as hectic as the strip resorts. We ate at Pink Taco, good drinks and tacos at a reasonable price. Would stay here again, especially if we have a rental car again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel-perfect for young people”
Reviews.Author: KMM20
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend, both aged 22, stayed here June 17-20. PROS: Nice, clean hotel. It was never too busy -stayed at the MGM last year and it was sooo busy and so large that it took forever to get anywhere. Hard Rock was a good size. Pools were awesome! Definitely geared towards the younger crowd.. some days you have to be 18+ to get in so bring your ID's if you want to drink alcohol. No outside food/beverage allowed in the pool area. The cabanas and chairs are usually all booked up/taken, but we didn't mind just sitting on the edge of the pool. Mr Lucky's 24-7 Restaurant was very good, however, at 3am it can take over an hour to get food.. lines were huge. Went to the club in the hotel (Vanity) and it was so much fun. Way smaller than most of the clubs in Vegas but still great. Booths, tables, bottle service, dance floor, everything you need. Didn't gamble much, casino is pretty small but that's not why we went there. Rooms were gorgeous! We were in the Paradise Tower. Two sinks in the bathroom, and a seperaet shower/toilet area. I had requested a higher floor via email, and we were on the top floor with the penthouses! One of the only standard rooms on that floor. CONS: Not on the strip. Gets kind of annoying to take a cab onto the strip everyday, and it can really add up. We walked one day, took 20 minutes, way too long in my opinion! There is a "shuttle" (holds 7 people) that takes you to Fashion Show Mall, but it only runs till 4pm and if it's full then you're out of luck. Don't touch anything in/near the fridge, because there are sensors and if something is removed for 30+ seconds then you can be charged. The only other thing we did not like was there was not much for restaurants. Tried Pink Taco and it was alright. But we just went to the strip to eat! No other complaints. Any questions just ask.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: hilgrls
Reviews.Content: A nice property away from the Strip. It did not feel overly crowded which was nice considering everything else on the strip is so packed. The rooms are nice and clean but if you can upgrade to the HRH tower do it.

Reviews.Title: “Good pool - while in season”
Reviews.Author: MyOpinion1515
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip at HRH becuase I read that they have the best pool in Vegas - which is 100% true... but its closed in November. I did not realize this until after I booked and paid. The hotel was fun, I would have loved it for the pool but it was a bit out of the way, considering our days were on the strip and not at the pool. What I had a problem with - our room may not have been ready when we got there, but they made it seem like it was. We were missing towels, cups, etc. I also did not like the $20 resort fee - the shuttle only runs from 10am to 5pm and only has one stop, we never used it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has style, but a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: sharehelp
Reviews.Content: It's fine hotel, it does has a style, a little dated, got lots of male 80% compare to female 20% of the hotel's guests. But I think the best time to stay there is summer, the hotel has a great pool/night club Rehab, that's were the fun is. )

Reviews.Title: “The modern Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: jadiepoojade
Reviews.Content: If you are youthful, love fun and want a unique hotel...this is the one for you. This no holiday inn, it is however the life of the party. Everything puts you in the mood for Vegas, the lobby with Rockstar decor, the tattoo shop and tastefully decorated rooms. Loved itt!!!! Not for kids though. My favorite hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great experience”
Reviews.Author: Karen M
Reviews.Content: This was not my first trip to Vegas, but my first stay at the Hard Rock. It was a great hotel with awesome service and atmosphere. This is less of a family friendly hotel, and does seem to cater to a younger crowd. It's pretty loud, and has none of the traditional buffetts or vegas tourist shops which was nice, but if that's the type of thing your looking for your better of at one of the strip hotels. The rooms were really nice, and the overall cost wasn't bad either. We absolutely loved it and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Single Party-People's Place-not for quiet or families”
Reviews.Author: usfox4
Reviews.Content: Its a loud, young, party environment, definately not for peace and quiet. We aren't party-pooper types at all. Annoying and very difficult to get a pool chair unless you go down early. Go later and the lines and entrance fees are ridiculous. Forget the thorough bag check and that you can't bring an oversized beach bag or ANY water, snacks or even OTC or prescription meds. It was like the guests are privileged to be in their presence.

Reviews.Title: “Party Hardy...with great sleep”
Reviews.Author: Pluma002
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hard Rock is not a relaxing type of vacation... you expect to party like rockstars and have a great time.. which we did. I visited with my fiance and another couple during Halloween weekend and had a blast! There was an error processing our reservation and we did not get the room we paid for. The front desk ladies took care of us by letting us stay at the HRH Tower and offered us an upgrade for the next 4 nights for $120 total. The room was gorgeous and the beds were amazingly comfortable. I have not had such good sleep in months! The pillows were insanely fluffy. We could slightly hear the ladies in the room next door, but it was not too uncomfortable. You can definetly hear thumping from the pool music during the afternoon. Make sure you go down to the pool early 10(?) to score a seat at the rehab pool, the place was packed even for late October. A few amenities we liked- taking the free shuttle (aka an Escalade) to the Fashion Show Mall on the strip, the touchscreen ipod dock in the room, and the new coffee shop with yummy breakfast sandwiches and Illy coffee(!) by the Paradise Tower. Looking forward to returning next time....

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip, but still worth considering”
Reviews.Author: evapor8
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights here with friends over the Halloween weekend. My first trip to Vegas, and the main reason of coming was to see Tiesto at The Joint (tickets came as part of a hotel package, as The Joint is in the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino.) Rooms were great. We were on the 4th floor of the Casino Tower, at the end of the hall. Very quiet. Beds were amazing. Rooms cleaned daily. We ate daily at Mr Lucky's 24-7. A good variety of different food items. Breakfast was very good, as were the pizzas and burgers. We ate once at the Pink Taco, but the food was the usual watered down Americanised pap that no self respecting fan of Mexican food would touch! The bars were all good. Staff friendly. Drinks cheap! The pool area was massive and we didn't really make the most of it. Plenty of slots, poker/craps/roulette tables. You'll lose all idea of what time it is, as the lighting in the casino's stays the same all day long! It's about a 15 minute walk up to the Strip, but it's along a well used road so I felt pretty safe doing this any time of the day. I'd happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... Noisy”
Reviews.Author: MassiG
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good room... Bathroom in the casino tower is mediocre... Great pool. My main issue was the noise. Was there for work rather than partying and im afraid if your room looks over the pool you will be bombarded by music... The windows are no where near effective enough in abating the sound. Perhaps other towers are better!

Reviews.Title: “Love it...”
Reviews.Author: pbruno33
Reviews.Content: this place is hot...you won't find many older people staying here..it's mostly a younger crowd, great music and a fun place to hang out..

Reviews.Title: “Another viewpoint”
Reviews.Author: BrownsboroRed
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about some of the reviews before we went. We decided, without a second thought, that we would stay at the Hard Rock because we got tickets to a concert in The Joint and knew staying at the hotel would reduce a lot of the hassle of getting there and leaving, which of course, it did. We totally loved the hotel, and everything about it. The room was great...on a lower floor that we requested, with a beautiful view of the mountains, where we saw sunrise from our French door windows on 3 out of 4 mornings. Yes, it was over some of the lower roof lines, but that was really not a bother. The room was larger than most hotel rooms, there were two closets, the tv, which we watched very little, was a nice flat screen. The wake up service was right on time, even though I set my phone too, just in case. The restaurants that we visited had good service and good food...Mr. Lucky's specials were larger than expected, and while the meat was a little chewy, it had great flavor. We ate one big meal at Pink Taco and went back three times for the 99cent happy hour. Be careful...those frozen Margarita's are super cold. I don't know how to say enough good things about this hotel after being a little concerned. We loved the location.....no, not on the strip, but we were doing all off strip activities, and they were close by. Driving was easy, except for trying to find the Brazilian restaurant in the Miracle Mile shops,,,,big mistake. The Hard Rock is a polished jewel in a sea of gems. BTW, I am nearly 65, and did not feel out of place at all, and saw others my age enjoying themselves just as much. It's all in your perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you are under 25, and smoke!”
Reviews.Author: Angelm123
Reviews.Content: we stayed here as part of a package deal...it will NOT happen again if I could stay for free I would not go! Except to the the "Pink Taco"! That place had great mexican food! The Pool is great if you just want to drink and people watch. There is not enough places to sit unless you pay. Bring your I.D. even if you are 50! The staff was rude (and they where not busy)..excect one lifeguard...we ended up at Ceasers pool..much much better! staff was helpful and happy to take our money! lol The lobby is boring and the hotel is off the strip. The rooms are clean and the place is kept up well, but that is it! Poor service, no one offered to help with anything! To bad for them! We tip well!

Reviews.Title: “In a nut shell......”
Reviews.Author: nickandtash
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to party don't book this hotel. I think the Hotel would agree this is there one and only selling point and priority. We stayed mid october 11, in the hrh tower at double the cost of the rooms elsewhere in the hotel. When checking in at 7pm, after a 14 hour flight, we had to stand in line as only 1 representative was on the desk (one of 5). we were then given a room with 2 twins despite informing her we were here to get married? after calling back, we were upgraded to a corner suite with a double bed - we were not offered any help re-locating to this new room so had to go back down to reception, lugging our cases with us to get the new key. This basically set the tone for the whole stay, terrible customer service, they charge for everything.. even asking for glasses (there were none at all in the room) they charge $4/glass to be brought up.. i stay in hotels at least 30 times a year and having a glass to put your tooth brush in is pretty standard? just beware that customer service is not great and class this as a hotel without a pool as it's sole use is an outside night club (at weekends at least).. even to the point that if you want to sit in a sun bed that is in the sun on a sunday, you are charged $50 (on top of the $20 resort fee you pay to stay there/day) minimum spend on beverages, or your only other choice is to sit in sun beds that are, i presume purposefully are located in the shade. And as the review beforee me pointed out if you don't stay in a more expensive room as friends of ours didn't) they party comes to you if you like it or not, so just hope that you like the music. It all seems pretty negative, sorry. Positives are the suites are great, huge and really nicely decorated but as I said if you don't want to party ( we did but not to he extent that it is forced on you) this isn't the hotel for you. Last point, I am a fan of nobu and was excited to have a first night dinner there, it was fine but, the waiters were really helpful butthe standards are no where near the Nobu restaurants I have eaten at in London or HK.

Reviews.Title: “Full of hairy bikers!”
Reviews.Author: BluebellChloe
Reviews.Content: Gutted we ended up here on our first visit to Vegas, really wished we stayed on the strip! We were in one of the newer towers and while our room was spacious and perfectly nice, we struggled with the lack of anywhere civilised to eat downstairs for. breakfast. And walking through the casino each time to get to our room was like watching a re take from the Tarantino film 'dusk till Dawn'.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, but choose your room wisely”
Reviews.Author: ScottishPaul
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I stayed here, we never gave a thought to the rooms location, in fact when we opened the windows and looked down over the pool we thought this is a nice room with a great location. Later that night when we went to bed and the DJ was blasting tunes and the crowd were having a great time, the location didn't seem so good.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: brtn_girl
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great service, great decor, seriously i would'nt think of staying anywhere else in Vegas. Best vacation ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Deal”
Reviews.Author: Alberto N
Reviews.Content: Got here on a great groupon. Our room was really nice looking however I think some of the light bulbs were out. I didn't call down or anything since it wasn't a big deal. Stayed in the paradise tower which over looked the pool. They had music out there that you could hear in the room was disappointing. However the music didn't bother our sleep at all they started later in the morning so we would be out and ended early in the evening so by the time we went to bed it wasn't an issue. Parking next to the Paradise tower was really convenient. Made some money in the slots down at the casino. The bar tender had some great recommendations on night clubs which we took advantage of. I would come back again on another deal maybe. Mr Lucky's is a must. Missed it the first morning but got it the second.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin HRH”
Reviews.Author: frankt.o
Reviews.Content: Great Service - Great Rooms - Great times.. I loved the Hard Rock would recommend to anybody , this place was truly living up to its name. Pool was still open in October and the weather was top notch and the sights were even better . Eat at the pink taco dont miss out on this one , the tequila selection is second too none. The memobilia is awesome its like a museum to the gods of rock. The one suggestion i would make is that if you are looking for a quite place to bring your kids. THis is not for you..Viva Las Vegas --- and ROCK ON !!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock is Back Again!”
Reviews.Author: JaneEMorgan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hard Rock many times from its heyday in the 90s, through its decline and now in its recent revival with the addition of the HRH Towers. This week I stayed in the HRH Towers in a beautiful corner suite and was very impressed. My suite was only $129/night and I received an upgrade from the suite I had booked. The room was huge and immaculately appointed. Fantastic soaking tub, huge walk in shower with a rain shower and regular shower head, separate toilet room, and two flat screen TVs -- one for the living area and one for the bedroom. The bed was THE most comfortable bed I'd slept in in recent memory and I stay at a lot of 5 star hotels. There was excellent lighting, dual zone climate control, a beautiful wet bar. Nice bath products and the dental kit that the hotel provided upon request was very nice and promptly delivered. The hotel does not seem particularly busy so checkin was a breeze, unlike the long lines I've experienced at other casino hotels. The complex retains its small casino charm even after the expansion. They've kept all the good things: Nobu, Mr. Lucky's, the Pink Taco, and the Starbucks (great place for a cheap breakfast). Another benefit: Long hours of operation for the gym which is quite unusual in Vegas I have found. The new spa was beautiful but the massage not particularly good. I will be staying here again next time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously, Bed Bugs?”
Reviews.Author: Kendra E
Reviews.Content: I had a room booked for 2 nights in the Paradise Tower but ended up leaving after one. Thank god I left after one night; by the time I got home I was covered in bed bug bites on my right arm and back. I didn't notice these at the time of check-out, otherwise I would've filed a complaint. Looks like I'm not the only person to experience this horrific event! Needless to say, I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin Hotel and Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ladydesire05
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice hotel but beware if u booked online there is a 50 dollar a night deposit and 18 dollar a day resort fee and their shuttle bus is not a bus its a cadillac escalade truck limo so it only holds like 13 people and they only run it once an hour besides that this place rocked!!

Reviews.Title: “One of my best stays in vegas yet!”
Reviews.Author: TammyLee123
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas Oct 21 to 25. We were going to see Judas Priest at the Joint. Since we always stay on the strip we decided to stay at the hard rock in one of the HRH Tower Suites So glad we did! The room was very large, the bed very comfortable, and a huge bathroom! The food in the hotel was also very good! It is a little ways off the strip but well worth paying a few bucks for a cab to the strip! Will def. Be staying here again next trip to vegas :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fun, hip, and great cocktail waitresses!”
Reviews.Author: kelbel612
Reviews.Content: I loved coming to the hard rock in Vegas. It was such a fun place to stay. The rooms were awesome, super roomy and chic! The staff that work there are so nice, and the cocktail waitresses are so sweet and cater to your every need. They are fast, and on point when it comes to serving you drinks. I will def be staying here the next time I come out!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vero5422
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at this hotel and I was blown away by atmosphere. We stood in a Paradise Pool-View Room with a King bed and the room was amazing. We had a great view of the pool (which is awesome) and a great view of the strip. The room was very spacious and I loved the decor (nice rock-n-roll vibe). The beds were the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in (I could have lived in that bed!).The glass shower was really cool too. I didn't actually go to the pool but it seemed like a Sprink Break type of atmoshpere because of the large crowd and loud music. The hotel has a lot of really cool rock-n-roll memorabilia through out as well as lot of great restaurants and shops. The "Pink Taco" has really good food and so does Mr. Lucky's 24/7". I didn't try Nobu or any of the other restaurants so I couldn't tell you what they were like, but I heard the other restaurants are very good as well. I will definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not very rock n roll, actually”
Reviews.Author: Jazza40
Reviews.Content: They would have you believe this place is different, cool and so on. In truth, the rooms are great. The memorabilia does catch the eye, for a while. The main lobby is smoky, the ventilation being substandard. The staff were unhelpful, the whole place dreadfully overpriced. It's also a very,very long walk to the Strip. Is it cool? Actually not really. The drunken young guys dancing with each other which was a common sight in the evening reminded me of the saddest of Glasgow clubs on a Friday night. There IS an issue with noise in the rooms and corridors. I really thought that someone was being murdered in the next room on my last night. To use a Glaswegian description, it's pish.

Reviews.Title: “Always a party at the Hard Rock!!!!”
Reviews.Author: doubletakex2
Reviews.Content: We try and stay at the Hard Rock every 6 months or so.... we LOVE it and never want to stay anywhere else. They have wonderful customer service, wonderful resturants, music and the best pool and rooms ever! Why stay anywhere else? It is the very best! Pink Taco Rocks !! Best food and service...all the resturants have always been top notch food and service. Never a dissapointment! Thanks Hard Rock... already planning our next visit! :)

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have had a better trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jmgajewski
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I just got back from a 3-night stay at the Hard Rock. I don't know what happened to all of these people who wrote negative reviews, but we had an incredible stay at the HRH. We stayed in the Casino Tower and the room was up to date, clean and the beds were very comfortable. Yes, they start playing music at the pool around 9:00 a.m. but with the windows closed it wasn't that loud. Being older we were in bed by 11:00 and the music had stopped playing at this point. We went to see Roger Daltrey perform Tommy (which was AMAZING) in the Joint and it was an awesome place too see a concert. I also don't know which staff members these complainers came in contact with, but everyone, from the front desk, to the bell hops, to dealers to the cocktail waitresses to the restaurant staff were extremely fun, nice and accomodating. We ate at the Pink Taco and Mr. Lucky's and the food at both places was wonderful. Yes, the hotel is off the strip but anyone who books this hotel HAS to know this...I mean, really? Plus, we liked that the casino was not so big that you get lost. One day we took a cab to the Venetian and it was so crowded and overwhelming in the casino, we couldn't wait to get back to the Hard Rock. The HRH casino also had some $5 tables which I found surprising (but a nice surprise!) considering it was the weekend. There is a daily $20/day charge for internet, fitness center/spa and pool area which wasn't a problem for us because we used all of these services every day. However, I would say that the hotel should just include this in their room rates because there isn't an option not to use these features. It would probably stop a lot of people from complaining about this. I can only think that the people who write negative reviews about this place are probably obnoxious themselves because I could not think of a reason not to give this place 5 stars. Please ignore all the negative reviews and stay at the HRH. You won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING ROOMS, gorgeous hotel, BUT off the strip and full of posers!”
Reviews.Author: dean C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HRH for the weekend in August. Our room was in Paradise Tower and was absolutely stunning. The views were amazing, we could see a lot of the strip. Considering this is a party hotel the rooms and corridors were quiet. The decoration in the room was modern and really cool. The room itself was clean, comfortable, cool and luxurious. We had a powerful, hot shower, the best part was definitely the bed, this is the most comfortable bed ever, tons of pillows and a heavenly mattress. We had a great tv and paid to have access to wifi which was fast. Hotel has a really fun vibe, there are plenty of nice restaurants, a big casino and brilliant state of the art gym with tons of equipment. Pools are lively, fun, clean but busy, We enjoyed sitting by the pool on the Saturday, there was a really great atmosphere, and a great dj who played a wide range of music. The only let down was rehab, we had heard so much about it so we were really looking forward to the day. Unfortunately we had to be up at 8am to get our wrist bands, we were shocked when we were informed that in order to sit on a sun lounger you have to order $200 worth of food and drink. You aren't allowed to take any videos or photos. The prices are sky high, drinks and food were very expensive and you aren't allowed to bring your own snacks or water to the pool. Music was dreadful and customer service was non existent. Superb hotel but I wouldn't recommend rehab to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: kevine1974
Reviews.Content: The pool is the reason to stay here. It's incredible and just a very fun time! There are places to relax and plenty of areas to have fun. Suite in HRH tower was great, very modern and roomy, but showing a little wear and tear (stained couch, banged up coffee tables, in room audio system not working) I assume this is from the rock & roll crowd this place attracts. Not enough to bother me - I was there for fun too. The bathroom is awesome. Probably the largest I've ever seen in a hotel suite. The hotel is a bit further off the stri than I'd like. Overall, a fun stay!

Reviews.Title: “Outta the way”
Reviews.Author: Roropops
Reviews.Content: Great rooms. Fab bathrooms. Giant baths. Beautiful pool. No hassle gambling. But a half mile from anywhere. Can't really walk round much at night so cabs or driving a must. However great vibe at the hotel, preferred it to all other casinos we visited. Visit Roy's and ferraros nearby for fantastic dinners, the best food we ate in Vegas, both in walking distance. If you want an off strip experience this is it, otherwise you are better off at the Cosmo.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday ever!!”
Reviews.Author: angelface1111
Reviews.Content: When with my friend for 6 nights...only paid £60 a night for pool view room...room was lovely and never slept in a bed like it!sooooo comfy! we were there when dew tour was on,so the hotel was buzzing with cool people and loads of concerts like 50 cent and others by pool...in the six days we were there only left hote twice for just a few hours as it had so much to do it seemed silly to go off complex...the pool was buzzing all weekend but quiet and relaxing monday....only disapointment was vanity as never got to go in as we met a group of boys at the circle bar(which was great to) and cos we werent on guest list we would have to queue for up to 2hrs! as girls we could have got straight in but seemed rude to do that so just went back to circle bar....highly recommend this hotel for fun loving people and cant wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: NanCl
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Its my fav in Vegas and I've been to VEgas numerous times! Hands down the HRH is the bomb. We stayed in the new HRH Towers, and since it was our honeymoon they upgraded us to a suite! SUPER kick butt! We loved the room, and the amenities, the size of the room, the bed, etc. It was great and a good value for $165!

Reviews.Title: “A rockin hotel -Not for the timid!”
Reviews.Author: Laura W
Reviews.Content: Before writing this review I read the top 6 on this page. I'm always surprised when people have a bad experience and feel it's because they don't know what type of hotel they're staying in. If you want a calm, relaxing quiet hotel to stay in, go to the Bellagio, The Hotel or Ceasar's or one of the really upscale resorts on the strip. HRH is exactly what the name implies-a rock n roll hotel. This means the customers will be young, edgy, obnoxious, loud, tatted up, drinkers, gamblers, scant clothing and flamboyant-rock and roll life stylers! If you can hang with that, than this is a fun place to stay. If not, don't complain about the noise level late at night or the drunk people in the taxi line. (You'll find that anywhere in Vegas, btw, not just at HRH.) Also, when you book your hotel( any), always ask if there are special events going on when you're going to be staying there. This past weekend was the Dew Tour-if you were there when skateboarders, BMX, and moto riders were around and were offended, it's your own fault. 50 and the Dropkick Murphys played at the Joint-what does that tell you about the crowd? I've learned that even though I like the atmosphere and all that goes with it, I want good sleep too, so I always carry earplugs. I couldn't hear anything when I slept and I was next to a suite that was non stop partying. This isn't a romantic getaway place unless this is your lifestyle. This is a hard core RnR hotel and has the people to match. It also is NOT on the strip, something any info about Vegas will tell you. If you want to be on the strip, stay at any of the 60 or so hotels there. It's a cab ride away or a long walk. This isn't news to anyone. I had GREAT service from the desk to the room service and the engineering guy that came to fix my TV. I'll definitely return when I want this kind of trip again!

Reviews.Title: “This place seriously rocked!”
Reviews.Author: KristenFav
Reviews.Content: We came with a large group and stayed in the suites tower. All of the employees I encountered were very accommodating and nice. Even the waiter at Mr. Lucky's who teased me the entire weekend. The rooms we spacious, gorgeous and clean. The ipod docs made pre partying in the room that much better. The rooms didn't come with a mini fridge, but if you ask for one at the front desk they will provide. The rest of the hotel and casino was everything I expected. Girls were dancing on poles on top of the game tables (not what I was expecting). The restaurants were also great, my favorite was this diner-like place called Mr. Lucky's. The food was good and well priced, not to mention it was open 24hrs. The Pink Taco was also a fun spot for food and music. The Starbucks in the hotel was a perfect haven in the AM for my caffeine fix. And of course I can not conclude this review without mentioning Rehab. It is a huge pool party held on Sunday. Its free to get into if you are a guest at the hotel. Other than that you have to pay, but I would say it is well worth the cover charge. The pool area is hot in all the right ways, music was fantastic all day, the drinks were expensive ($30) but strong and came in plastic water bottles that you could keep as a souvenir (just keep your eye on it b/c they come around during the day and clean them up). (TIP: Make time to visit the German restaurant across the street...so much fun!) All in all a GREAT trip and the Hard Rock definitely lived up to its name!

Reviews.Title: “Always a good time”
Reviews.Author: luvdavegas
Reviews.Content: This is me third stay at the HardRock in Las Vegas. You cannot beat the price for the value that you get at this resort. The rooms are well we appointed. I am staying at the Casino tower and am very happy with the size and comfort of the room. The 24/7 cafe Mr. Lucky's is reasonable in price and consistently good. Casino area is spacious and not over-bearing. Look at this resort for good value and overall good service and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “HRH Tower vs Casino tower”
Reviews.Author: AA75
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel multiple times but this was the first time in the HRH tower. What a difference! The rooms are spacious, high tech and lots of amenities. The bathrooms are size of the rooms in the Casino towers. I love this hotel for the crowd, mostly mid 20s-mid 40s and no kids! This is not a family friendly hotel by any means (art around the hotel includes some partial nudity) My friends were staying at the Casino tower and when I was in their room I noticed how dirty and worn out the place is. We found 2 Vicodin pills on the floor, scary especially if someones kids would have found it. The location is really close to the airport which is convinient but also makes it pretty noisy, depending on where your room is. The restaurants are a must! 5 stars for the HRH tower, 1 star for the Casino tower. PS $20 resort fee per night!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Aces and Amateurs”
Reviews.Author: Glenn M
Reviews.Content: The mid rating is because some elements are superb. Others flop. The rooms in the HRH suites area a supremo renovation from years gone by. Very nicely appointed from decor to bed and bathrooom. Defintely gets one in a rock and roll mood. We travelled as group of eight after wrapping a film shoot in Ojai. WE were defintley looking to blow off some steam. But there is a lot of fizzle to navigate. Aces The table dealers. Best in all of Vegas. Attractive and engaging. Very profressional but not your typical Vegas bots. In general, they really understand the concept of fun. And there is no rule forbidding them to date guests when they are off duty. Huge BONUS. The rooms and / or suites. Everything whether the desired mood is to rock , or sequester to roll and romp, with ambient music from the pool or your own music WiFied in the room. . Pink Taco restaurant...not 5 star gnosh, but def way above mid-range Vegas faire. The Pools....Kudos to the designers, and guests on non-Rehab nights. Amateurs The front desk and 'security' staff are like W-mart greeters on 'roids. No one expects you whistle while you work but punkass attitude doesn't play in Vegas. Basic requests are met with "I hate my job' voices and grimaces. The guests are quite young, but if you avoid REHAB night the HRH can be a Dionysian experience. RH night beckons far too much drunken desparation by rookie Vegas partyers and lowlife locals. And 'security'? These punks are a disgrace. One of the sawed off twerps bad mouthed two of our female friends. Wrong move. Alpha females can put away Delta dimwits with a look or a word. Their behavoir toward the younger girls is reprehensible. One would think scantily clad girls are a new phenomenon to them. Back off and get a hooker. Guests are there to have fun, not be accosted. The HRH can truly be enjoyed if Vegas awareness is acutely engaged. WE may never return as the same group of eight..but all in all... our travelling party of 3 males and 5 females will most definitely return. Our very adult vacationing appetite was defintely satiated!!

Reviews.Title: “What a horrible location”
Reviews.Author: Scooterbrown
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vegas and it was not a pleasant experience. Pros: The room was nice, even if we constantly had to ask house keeping for toilet paper Pool was nice looking (complaints about it below) Cons: Location, location location. The shuttle that runs from the Hard Rock to the Strip (to the Fashion Show Mall) runs once an hour from like 9am to 5pm. It's an extended cab Escalade and seats like 7 people. So if you aren't there an hour early, you are taking a cab. It would be better to have a continuously running shuttle to Miracle Miles mall. In 6 days I took it once while trying to catch it a dozen times. The food was decent but HORRIBLY over priced. I noticed when leaving that food was cheaper in the airport than in the hotel. Casino is small and very basic Why am I getting carded to go to the pool? Why am I being charged $75 to go to the pool on Sunday? The bathrooms in HRH suites...have a glass door that takes up 90% of the wall, I'm sure it's awesome for sexy times with your significant other but if you are travelling with friends it seems kind of dumb. My suggestion? Regular door for rooms with two beds. Glass door for rooms with one bed. Resort fees!

Reviews.Title: “I wish there was a 3 1/2 point raiting. I like the Hard Rock.”
Reviews.Author: AmberVon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hard Rock in Vegas this past Friday because we saw Duran Duran play at the Joint in the Hard Rock. The Hard Rock is 'fun'. It lives up to its name. "Sex, drugs and Rock n' Roll" If you are looking for a quiet, laid-back experience in Las Vegas then this is NOT the hotel for you. I've stayed in a suite in the newer Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego and it was FAR superior but I'm not sure if that's because it was a suite or not. That said, I used a promotional code for our standard room which was nice and I had no problems with that. The people at the front desk were pleasant, fast and helpful. The room was clean and pretty much looked like it does on the website photos. The bed was comfortable and there were FOUR feather pillows which I loved because I love lots of pillows. It was not overly loud where we were but we did hear the occasional partiers as they walked down the halls to their own rooms. A few doors down there was a party ala "The Hangover" going on in some sort of suite but we couldn't hear them from our room - we only heard them we when walked by their door. The bathroom was typical hotel faire. Not spectacular but not bad at all. The bathtub was comfy enough to soak in for a while. We were there on a Friday night. The center bar downstairs was too packed to get a seat but there were a few other bars in the casino to visit. Waitresses were NOT fast to bring you drinks at the slots. It was really busy and there were tons of people but casinos should probably account for that when staffing on a Friday or Saturday night.
