We ate at the cafe in the main part of the hotel at about midnight. It was packed and they told us it would be 25 minutes for our food but it was much faster than that. The waiter was super great and even showed us pictures of dishes on his phone before we ordered to help us decide. Food was inexpensive and good 'drunk food'. I usually take pictures where ever I go but I guess I was too caught up and in "concert mode" to bother. Or... that the room and hotel were nice enough but didn't "WOW" me. Side note: I don't like the new Joint. The last time I was at the Joint was in 2005 and it was smaller and much more intimate then. The new location and layout is much bigger which is probably great for the Hard Rock but it's much less fun, in my opinion. There are several sections of General Admission and the balcony seats are so far back I don't know how anyone can see anything.

Reviews.Title: “50/50 HRH Suites”
Reviews.Author: CjC4
Reviews.Content: First off I am 39 and travel a lot and this place is geared for the younger crowd. I still enjoyed my stay for the most part. Price was decent the fees are stupid, food was amazing. I skipped the pool scenery but if you are young and single I am sure it would be amazing yet expensive. Johnny Smalls and the Pink Taco have amazing food. My bed was the best I have ever slept in, the room was clean and the non-smoking was truly non-smoking. If your on a budget this place is pricey. I go to Vegas frequently and will not return. To many other places to check out that are my speed.

Reviews.Title: “A Hoon Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Yarra71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel about a month ago for Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights, we could not believe the level of noise in the middle of the early hours of the morning! Hoons going back to their rooms banging on bedroom doors and screaming as they passed each door! When we mentioned this to he front desk each morning their response was "well it only lasts for a few seconds, if you are not happy with the noise we suggest you ring for security", NEVER AGAIN, talk about a could not care a less attitude! Then on Sunday afternoon till about 1930 there was a pool party, with more noise and the most boring music, if it can be called that?? Messrs Eden/Redden

Reviews.Title: “Good stuff!”
Reviews.Author: LordPocho
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vegas and I have to say I found this hotel a real treat. The general look is very fresh compared to those fancy looking hotels on the strip. Lots of music memorabilia everywhere. The style in my room was really neat. Soft mattress, LCD TV, good size bathroom, etc. What I didn't like is, that one day our room didn't get the visit from the cleaning staff and I had to give them a call. They were there in a snap to clean it. One more thing, the shower door didn't close right, so there was a huge leak every time I took a shower. Except for that I liked it very much. If you're 35 years old or less, this is your best choice to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel and Service!”
Reviews.Author: crazydazes
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vegas and the last time I will ever come to the Hard Rock Hotel. My experience was the worst experience I have ever had on vacation. I expected a lot more from a Hard Rock Hotel. The room was very dull and smelled of old, musty cigarettes. The bathroom was dark and very small (like something you would find in a cheap motel). On our first morning there we decided to go to the pool that we had heard so much about. We went downstairs, were searched, and wristbanded before we were allowed outside in the pool area. It turns out we had accidentally entered the VIP pool section (there were no signs indicating this was the wrong entrance) when we tried to put our towels on a beach chair we were told that it would be a $250 MINIMUM to reserve these chair!!! Are you kidding me!!!! They informed us that anything you spent in food or drink at the pool would come off this fee, but there is no way I am going to drink $250 worth while I am at the pool for a couple hours!!!!! We were then told that we needed to go to the "commoners" pool on the other side of the pool area to find free chairs. As we were walking past the cabanas to find our way to this other pool we stopped a gentleman to ask for directions. When we told him what had happened and that we were trying to find our way to the other pool he replied "We usually don't let GA's walk through here but since it is early I guess I can let you through". Was he serious??? I couldn't believe he had just said that to us (and yes, he was serious). It was like 10:30 in the morning and there was no one in the cabana's yet anyways. That made me feel like I was cheap and worthless. These people were being rude and outcasting my husband and I because we were not going to pay $250 to have a pool chair to loung in?!?!?!?!? HRH is also know for their "rehab" pool party on Sundays. This is a bunch of rowdy people (mainly college students) that get drunk at the pool all day. I am 26, so I'm not too far from the average at at the party, but even this was too much for me! While my husband and I were in the taxi line to go to a show and a nice dinner for our last night in town, we had to wait in line with all of the drunk, rowdy kids. I got bumped into more than once by drunk girls that could not stand up straight. This, ontop of the yelling and cussing was extremely frustrating and not how I wanted to spend an elegant date night with my husband. Finally, the worst part... Our last morning there, my husband decided to use the TV check out from our room to save us the time of waiting in line downstairs. We still had a little packing to do after he checked out so we were going to be about another 45 minutes to an hour. Before we were finished, a girl from housekeeping knocks on the door and asks why we are in there because the room was marked as "vacant". We explained to her that we checked out on the TV and would be finished packing in a few minutes. 5 minutes later she knocks on the door again and starts getting a nasty attitude with us. THEN SHE CUSSES AT MY HUSBAND!!! She tells us how her manager is on her to get the "f''ing" room clean. Pretty much yelling at us as she says this!!! I could not believe that housekeeping just yelled and cussed at us because we were still packing our belongings. Under NO circumstances should this EVER happen. My husband called from the airport that afternoon to complain and all we got was, "I'm sorry, let me credit you a day of resort fees" which was a whopping $18!!!! Are you serious??? That's all the corrective action that you can afford to do after all that???? I don't think we ever saw that credit either. HRH can keep their money and they can also make sure that I will warn everybody about how horrible we were treated while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “HRH...The Rock Bottom When It Comes To Service”
Reviews.Author: Scrapbetty
Reviews.Content: Just spent my first weekend at the Hard Rock Hotel, and it will be my last. I went to Vegas to see Duran Duran, and chose to stay at the Hard Rock since they were playing at The Joint. A friend had given me a promotional code, and we got a really good rate on our room. Problems started the minute we got to check-in. I had called the previous day to be sure of the "grand total" of our stay, as my friend and I would be splitting the cost of the room, and were budgeting accordingly. Of course, the total that was given to me on the phone and the total given to me upon arrival were completely different. The person at the front desk had no idea why there was a discrepancy, and kept having to consult with her co-workers to try and work it out. We were offered an upgrade to a pool view room, but said that we preferred the mountain view room because we didn't want to pay the additional $35 for the upgrade. When we got to our room, we realized that they gave us the pool view anyway, even though they took it off our bill. A nice treat, right? WRONG! Oh my GOD...this was like sleeping in the hallway of a night club. The music at the pool was SO LOUD I could hear every word of it in our bathroom, which was across the room! ALL DAY. The tables in our room, as well as the dresser and mini bar items all looked like they hadn't been cleaned in about a month. Dust on the canisters of candies, and smears and smudges on the tables and dresser. The lighting in the room was awful (dim), and the bulb in the floor lamp was burned out. The curtains on the window in our room were broken, and it made it hard to pull them closed all the way so the sun didn't come in in the morning. We had the same problem with the shower curtain. Which leads me to the bathroom....first of all, the lighting in the bathroom made it REALLY difficult to do make-up because it wasn't "even". Lighting was primarily at the sides of the mirror going about half way up, and then one (dim) light in the ceiling. We had 1 ROLL OF TOILET PAPER (whatever was left on the roll from whoever was there before us), an almost empty box of Kleenex, and 1 towel, 1 hand towel, and 1 washcloth for each of us. EVERY hotel I've EVER stayed in has always has 4 towels, regardless of the number of guests in our room (there were only 2 of us). My friend preferred to not have housekeeping services on Friday morning, so she called down to the desk late in the day to ask for towels, toilet paper, and Kleenex; she told them that housekeeping was welcome to just pop into the room if we were out. 3 HOURS LATER we STILL didn't have these items. RIDICULOUS! Once we got back to the room, my friend called the desk AGAIN and asked why we still didn't have our stuff. About 10 minutes later, someone from housekeeping came to our room...FINALLY! She told us that her key wasn't working in our door when she came up earlier in the evening, and that's why we didn't have our stuff. How about going the extra mile and asking a supervisor for some help getting into the room? No...that would have made too much sense and would have required some actual EFFORT on the part of housekeeping. Thursday night we ate at the Pink Taco because we saw on one of the monitors that they had a happy hour special...$2 tacos and some sort of deal on margs. So, when we went in, we told them we wanted to take advantage of the happy hour special. The "hostess" told my friend that we could only get that deal if we were actually sitting at the bar, but if the bar was full, to come back and she would seat us at a table and make sure we still got the happy hour pricing anyway. Well, the bar was full, so we went back to the hostess stand. She made us get in line behind about 10 other people to be seated, even though we were there before those 10 other people. Once we were seated and our waitress came, we told her that we wanted to have the happy hour deal. She said that was only for people who sat at the bar. We told her what the hostess said, and she insisted that they don't do that, and our hostess didn't know what she was talking about. We thought she was going to get a manager to talk with us about it. About 10 minutes later she came back asking us if we were ready to order. My roommate said, "We thought you were having a manager come by...?" The waitress said she already talked to a manager, we couldn't have the happy hour pricing and were we ready to order? Apparently, she also talked to the hostess, because she (the hostess) actually had the nerve to come back to our table and tell us we didn't know what we were talking about. Seriously. Her words were "I don't know if you misheard me or what, but that is NOT what I said. You can't have the happy hour deal if you're sitting at a regular table. That is NOT what I said." And the she turned around and walked away. Call me crazy, but I call that rude, disrespectful, and BAD customer service. Maybe my friend DID misunderstand what she said, but there are many ways to handle a situation like this (professionally), and this was NOT it. We were all stunned that this snotty little b**ch would actually have the NERVE to come to a table of paying customers and be so unprofessional and rude. After that, the manager actually DID come to our table, and I told her about the treatment we received from the hostess. She could have cost that casino A LOT of money...what if we would have been high rollers?? She apologized, said she would talk with the hostess, and offered to buy us a round of drinks. That was fine. We took our drinks and had our dinner. The food was really good, but because of the attitude we received at the Pink Taco, we'll never eat there again. I can get that kind of "service" at McDonalds. Later that night/early Friday morning, we ate at Mr. Lucky's. I had only ever eaten there one other time and I thought it sucked. It still does. I had pot stickers and my friend had the burger basket deal. The pot stickers tasted like they had come from a frozen package and were heated up in the microwave. They were served with a sauce that tasted like straight vinegar. Nasty! Our waiter took about 20 minutes to bring our drinks to us (nothing alcoholic, just a Coke and a tea) once we ordered them. I asked for extra napkins, and he didn't bring those until AFTER I was done eating! Needless to say, this guy didn't get a tip. We went BACK to Mr. Lucky's Friday night after the show, and were told by the hostess that there was a 30 MINUTE WAIT to get food. Not to be seated, TO GET FOOD. I have NEVER been told this at a restaurant in my life. I had chicken strips and fries, and my friend had the steak and eggs deal. Luckily, the hostess must have been wrong, because we got our food after a reasonable wait. The chicken strips were fresh, hot, and good, and our waiter was fast and friendly. My roommates steak was delish. I was pleasantly surprised, but the food was WAY overpriced. The guy checking me in for the show (I was VIP) was rude to me...I could go on and on. Bottom line, if you want a dim,noisy room, no toilet paper, rude treatment, lousy food, and bad customer service, stay at the Hard Rock. Otherwise, I recommend Planet Hollywood. WAY nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Rock On!!!”
Reviews.Author: Richard T
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the HRH tower and absolutlely loved it. The room was amazing. There was a touch screen music jukebox along with a ipod/iphone dock in the wall which was fantastic. The bathroom was huge with a seperate bath and shower. The room had a sepeate living room/kitchen from the main bedroom which had two double beds that were very comfortable. I really liked the constant Rock music wherever you go in the hotel. Be it the lobby, casino or even the lift! Excellent touch. We also found the Casino to be the most enjoyable we have visited in vegas. Due to the atnosphere created by the music and the enthusiastic croupiers. The Rock and Roll memorabilia is alos awsome. You could spend hours looking at it all! This Hotel is a little off the main strip but well worth a visit. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Mandelgroove
Reviews.Content: Room not ready till 5pm. At that point we were given an inferior room than what we paid for (PAID for poolview - see photo). Housekeeping didn't show up for 4 days. We had to call everynight for it to be done (7PM too early have room cleaned??). Managers hid from guests (asked for my phone number and would call me...never did!!). Wall entertainment system didn't work, guy came to fix it said hell with it and left...no one came back despite calls...My "superior deluxe room" (more expensive than a regular room) located on top of a club. Bed and windows vibrated. Cigarette smoke came in through vents. Complained at front desk to several people over a couple of days and NO ONE CARED...No appologies, no managers, no supervisors, no solutions! Sent complaint letter over 1 MONTH ago and no response! When we checked out to change hotels the cab driver said that was very common for him to take MAD guests to another property after a short stay at HR. NEVER AGAIN will I stay/eat at one of these 'joints'. Used to like this place and but it's clearly gone to he**. How rude and unprofessional of them. Casino ONLY had slots open on weekdays - no table games (at night also!!!). Even dealers and waitresses appeared as if they were about to jump off the building from depression. They too said it was bad. BEWARE AND TAKE YOUR BUSINESS ELSEWHERE!! Too many good places in LV to waste your money on this dump.

Reviews.Title: “First stay at Hard Rock was a lot of fun.”
Reviews.Author: NorCali19
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the HRH tower and the suite was unbelievably nice. Two flat screens, one in the bedroom and one in the living room that are seperated by two sliding doors. If you have an iphone or ipod there's a dock in the wall with a touchscreen so you can play your music or the hotel's music through a speaker under the flat screen in the living room. Huge bathroom and plenty of closet space. I know people don't usually spend too much time in their hotel rooms in Vegas but this room makes you want to just stay and relax until it's time to go out. Also really comfortable beds when you're in recovery mode all day. I tried the fish tacos at pink taco, I was disappointed. I'll give it another try but will just avoid the tacos. Really enjoyed the all-you-can-eat tapas for $20 at Johnny Smalls, you'll go full before you try everything you want to. Vanity was fun, if you're in a group it's easier to call before and reserve a table. You won't have to wait long or at all even depending when you get there. But that's the case with most clubs there. It is off the strip but not too far, and it has its advantages. Right across the street is a few restaurants and a CVS so you can grab whatever you need there like bottles or gatorade. It's a fun casino to stay at from my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DossDoss
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing, Clean, roomy, comfortable, perfect. Would definantly stay there again and would recommend it. The pool was nice, Hard Rock Cafe was great food. Made my time in Vegas that much better.

Reviews.Title: “It's why I keep coming back.”
Reviews.Author: Jen W
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth year staying at the HRH for my birthday... and I had a great time. The cabana's by the pool is great and has some of the BEST service and food I have had on the strip. A very big perk of the HRH is no kids. The room's are nice. We had a lg bathroom in our. I love the opening balconey doors. All in all this is the BEST HOTEL off the strip!!! You really don't have to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you're OK being off the strip”
Reviews.Author: bajanjamie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 4 nights at the Hard Rock, and really enjoyed our stay! We're in our late 20's so were looking for somewhere fun but not too crazy, and the Hard Rock delivered. We received a complimentary upgrade to the HRH Tower (originally booked Paradise Tower), which turned out to be awesome as it was super quiet and had its own front desk and taxi line. The only real con of the hotel was the location, as the rest of our friends were staying right on the strip. We walked it 3 times (a good 20 minute walk), took the free shuttle once (it only holds 8 people so you gotta get there early if you want a spot), and cabbed the rest of the time. Since we were going back and forth once or twice a day, the cabs did add up (between $12 and $15 each way depending on where you're going on the strip). We loved the Pink Taco, and also had breakfast at Espumoso which was a little pricey but good. The pools at the Hard Rock were AWESOME, but as with most Vegas hotels it was nearly impossible to get a chair. We still enjoyed lounging on the pool side with a cold beer in hand! Our room was huge, with a super comfy bed and lovely big bathroom. All in all, a great vacation in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Casino / Horrible customer service / Treated like a number instead of a guest”
Reviews.Author: Jhacker
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel and Casino was quite the experience. It was great but bad at the same time. I booked a room for a three day stay and got the full experience. This is definitely a hotel for Adults only as it is a constant party. The hotel and casino are both beautiful. Everything is up to date and looked awesome. The room was clean and very modern. House keeping would knock and instantly open the door to come in and keep. They surprised me twice and one of those times I was just coming out of the shower. The pool area is huge. They have two large pools and a swim up gambling area. The pool is surround with chairs, beds and cabanas. Here is the problem. I understand having to pay extra for the cabanas but even the lawn chairs require you to buy at least $100 worth of alcohol to sit there. We signed up for two chairs and were drinking beer. I did the math. If we bought 5 buckets of beer at $40 each then we would have to 30 beers to meet that minimum bar tab. The chairs have no supervision so I constantly had to keep kicking people off my chair telling them they were reserved. Went in the water and beers were getting stolen from my bucket. Security could be better. Hard Rock holds a pool party on Sundays called "Rehab". It is extremely popular. Tickets to get in are $50 for men and $25 for women. You get 2 free passes if you are staying at the hotel which is a nice perk. Here is the problem. The Hard Rock has so much disconnect between it's different departments. We tried to get our free passes and go in at 4:30 and waited in line only to be told that I could only have 1 pass instead of 2. I asked why since it was promised to me upon booking and I was told it was because I was in the wrong line. I asked where the correct line was and I was told it was somewhere else but they shut that line down at 4. ???? I was confused. They want me to stand in a line does not exist. When I voice my problem to the girl that is giving the wristbands she offered no concern or help. I asked for her manager and she first said that he was not here but later admitted that it was the guy behind her. We I tried to resolve the problem he at first ignored me and when I finally got to speak with him he told me that the pool doesn't have the same system in place as the hotel and I would have to go to front desk and try to resolve the problem. The front desk is at least a 10 minute walk from the line at the pool. Lots of hastle and nobody seems to want to help fix the issues. The rehab party was great and very wild. More security issues as people were stealing our beers and jumping all over the bed we reserved. Drinks are expensive but the party is worth it. The free shuttle is a joke. It isn't an actually shuttle but rather a guy driving a purple Escalade that seats only 8. Never could get a seat on the shuttle. The worst part of the hotel is it stinks like cigarettes everywhere. The halls are filled with smoke. The cocktail waitresses and dealers were very nice. To sum it up the hotel and casino are great. The pool is nice and worth seeing. The security sucks and you are treated like cattle. The front desk and especially the pool staff have no desire to help you. I would go again but will try to stay away from the staff. Oh, and I was solicited by 3 different hookers in 1 hour on Sunday night.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous suites, rip off rehab!”
Reviews.Author: Jenvive
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HRH for the weekend. We stayed in paradise tower and our room was stunning. Fab views, quiet, lovely shower, the most comfortable bed ever and great tv/wifi. Hotel is great, nice restaurants, cool casino and brilliant gym. Pools are lively, and fun. We had a brilliant day on the Saturday, pool had an amazing atmosphere, superb dj, lots of posers and celeb wannabes, girls in heels and make up by the pool all make for great people watching and entertainment. We had tickets for rehab on the Sunday, biggest disappointment EVER. Had to be up at 8am to get our wrist bands, to sit on a sun lounger you have to order $200 worth of food and drink, no cameras allowed, drink prices are crazy. No water or food of your own allowed, bottle of water $12, crazy crazy! Music was rubbish and staff attitudes even worse! So disappointed, preferred the free sub loungers, music and acceptable drink prices on the Saturday! Brilliant hotel but I wouldn't recommend rehab to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good time if you want to be nickel and dimed”
Reviews.Author: RTHOMAS10910
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hard Rock because it looked fun and had everything we needed, until after we checked and realized we had a question. We waited in line over 25 minutes to speak with a concierge only to be told she couldn't help us because she was off and had to wait to speak to someone else...awesome start. Then we waited for a shuttle for 10 minutes which when we checked in we were told there was a free shuttle, only to find out after we waited the the shuttle stopped at 5...again awesome customer service. Then the next morning we tried to relax by the pool and lay out only to be told by some rude employee that each chair came with a 100 dollar minimum because paying to stay there just isnt enough. We didnt mind the constant noise or random half clothed people in the hallway...because well its Vegas. I do mind however being treated like crap when I pay to stay some place. We were to check out sunday at 11am woke up at 8 tried to use the internet and was denied, even though it internet was supposed to be included in the 18 dollar a night "resort" fee. Overall I will NEVER stay here again or recommend anyone else to stay here, in fact if anyone I know ever mentions they are going to Vegas I will tell them not to stay here due to poor service and over priced services. Oh and I almost forgot our room was never cleaned, 2 night stay and no cleaning I guess the the "ammenties" part is optional according to the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible pool experienced!!”
Reviews.Author: janet g
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were having a great time in Vegas until we decided to go to the Hard Rock Hotel pool and our pool bag with 3 wallets, 2 purses and 4 Iphones got stolen from the Hard Rock Pool. This really messed up the rest of our vacation for all of us. We filed an incident report; they asked value of our items and some other basic generic questions. But that was all; did HRH do something about it?? No. Did they follow up with us as a courtesy? NO. Why? Because they don't care, it’s all about their business. One of my questions is why don’t they have lockers or bag check service?? Where are your surveillance cameras?

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: owensam10
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from honeymoon at the hard rock in Vegas, where we had a suite in their hrh tower overlooking the pool! It was gorgeous, spacious and very nicely decorated! With THE nicest beds, so comfy! This is our third visit to Vegas in three years we love the place, our second to the hard rock hotel. It is a great hotel, modern, fun and great for all ages! Lots of places to eat and drink or relax. A great pool scene, you really don't need to leave the hotel if you don't want too. We had just been married in Maui a week earlier, so we were relaxed and ready to enjoy Vegas to the fullest! We ate, franks lots and shopped. Caesars forum shoppes are good, as are the shops in planet Hollywood and at the fashion mall. To eat there is so much choice, Tao at the Venetian is lovely for a nice meal. The cheesecake factory is good too! We saw a few shows too, the jersey boys was fabulous, peep show was fun! And we booked rod Stewart tickets, he was great!! All in all we had a fun packed 8 nights. We will return to Vegas, for sure stay at the hard rock as it is our type of hotel. Fun, modern and relaxing! Try it if you haven't been, you ll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated.”
Reviews.Author: Steveut02
Reviews.Content: We were here in August and were not impressed at all. Customer service at the front desk was extremely lacking at check in and at check out. I was shocked they wanted to charge me a half day rate to check out 1 hour late on a MONDAY. Also, the TV in the room didn't work. Froze constantly. Someone was supposed to come in and fix it but never showed up. We didn't spend much time in the room so never followed up, but that was just another example of the complete failure of this hotel. Further, I was aware of the "resort fee" before booking, but could not believe they also charged an extra $25/person for the Sunday Pool Party. Ummm, isn't the pool what the "Resort Fee" is supposed to cover. Complete rip off. Every other trip to Vegas I've stayed on the strip. I won't be making the mistake of staying at hard rock again anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay...if you are young and like to party!”
Reviews.Author: nybeachbumm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a friend’s bachelorette party and it IS the best place in Vegas to stay if you want to see and be seen. It is without a doubt a hotel I would recommend to those in there twenties. If you are a bit older or not into the party scene you may actually hate this hotel! My friends and I had the best time ever here. There are young, good-looking people everywhere. We spent all day at the pool, where a drink will set you back $20 bucks, but they are a pretty big size. We were there for the weekend so on Friday as the day went on the pool got more and more crowded. Saturday was pretty busy and Sunday the REHAB party was incredible! If you stay at the hotel you get into the REHAB party free and don’t have to wait on line. Totally worth it since the line can be a few hours long to get in. We ate at Pink Taco twice, it’s great for after the pool. We also ate a NOBU one night that was excellent as well. The hotel is about a five-minute cab ride from the strip. The rooms are basic but nice. Very comfortable beds. We stayed in the casino tower on the poolside. The hallways can be noisy at night and the walls are pretty thin. We could actually hear more than we wished coming from the room next door. If you are staying here to party and have a good time you won’t be disappointed. If you are looking for a relaxing, quiet get away…this is the wrong place to go!

Reviews.Title: “It was alright...”
Reviews.Author: g0lf_vacati0ns
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HRH Paradise Tower for 3 nights in September. Check-in was swift and staff was welcoming and polite. I arrived on a weekend and the hotel was very busy. I had to help myself with the luggages and no help was offered even though I was more than willing to tip. Great atmosphere at the hotel, lively casino, entertainment and bars. Although it is not located on the strip..it still 'feels like vegas'. Not to mention, they have a rocking cool pool. Free parking just next to the paradise tower. The gym was very well equipped and free wifi in the rooms. All these come with the $20 a night resort fee. The room was very modernly decorated and felt fresh. I was putting up in a suite. King bed was huge and was comfortable. Bathroom spacious and clean...a pity no bath tub. Standard bathroom amenities like" Shampoo, body lotion, body wash, soap, shower cap. No toothbrushes. We called to request for them but were told 'they ran out of toothbrushes' and asked us to walk over to CVS pharmacy (24 hours) just across the street to purchase them. No bedroom slippers were provided. Large flat screen TV in the room.... Do not touch the mini bar items as they are weight detacted. Once you move them, you pay for them. Air-con in room was very noisy and actually weird. The cool air blows from a vent duct at the corner of the room. So it's just blasting cold air at that corner and the rest of the room can feel warm at times...especially at night. I was actually sweating every night...the quilts the gave were even ultra thick! Overall a good experience but would surely like to try out other hotels the next time I am in Vegas. (This is the 2nd time I stayed with HRH las Vegas).

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: JaneThom
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for one night-but loved the accommodations! Stayed in a suite in the Paradise Tower, with a amazing view. The suite was very clean. The casino was very clean, kinda dark inside, but very clean, sleek, and the memorabilla is awesome. Lots of music playing. Very Rock n Roll. Only draw back is the distance from the strip. Was a weekday trip and the place was kinda quiet, compared to other casinos on the strip-but when you want to get away from the strip it was appreciated. Also, housekeeping was on point. You ask for something-it's there lickety-split! Nice!

Reviews.Title: “HRH SUITES ROCKED!”
Reviews.Author: shanshanjan
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the HRH Suites last Wednesday 9/14 through Monday 9/19 for our annual Vegas trip. We had a blast! The pool staff was fantastic-from security to the servers and lifeguards. They provided us with top notch service at all times. The entire staff should be commended for their efforts!! Our suite was incredible. Clean, luxurious, perfect. No noise at night, it was quiet as could be! We visited Vanity and had so much fun dancing. This was our third stay at the Hard Rock and we could not be happier.

Reviews.Title: “Great party atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: DDDaaavvviiiddd
Reviews.Content: This is a great party casino with good ammenities great service.You will not be dissapointed with this hotel and Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: Truly enjoyed stay! Stayed in the Casino Tower and the rooms were awesome! Beds were very comfortable with nice beddings. Hug tub and large shower heads make for a nice stay =) Lots of stand up mirrors and closet space. Only one draw back, no refers in the room. Other than that it was a awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: laura p
Reviews.Content: just spent the best 1 week holiday at the hardrock hotel, was all we could have asked for and more. before we traveled to vegas we checked the reviews on the hotel, and were slightly worried as not all are so good, but once we arrived all out worry's dissapeared. we arrived late afternoon on a friday, we only had to wait 5 mins or so to be checked in, so staff are very prompt. had requested a room in paradise tower overlooking the rehab pool, our room was out of this world, plus we got a view of the far end of the strip which was amazing at night. the beds in the room are amazing, and the rooms are cleaned daily. the rehab pool is great at the weekend, and is always jumping, but was not overcrowded when we stayed, there are also other relax pools to chill out at. the hotel itself is amazing, the walls are covered in music memorabilia and the hotel always has music pumping out which makes the atmosphere great. the hardrock is a little off the strip, but i think this makes it better, as you dont have the constant stream of people walking through it, there is a shuttle bus that takes you to the strip hourly and it only costs about $10 in a taxi. All in all the hardrock is a fantastic place to stay, its laid back and welcoming, its full of people looking to have a good time, and i would recommend it to anyone, we loved it so much we didnt want to leave and are planning a trip back in march. great hotel:)

Reviews.Title: “Too old for this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cindy f
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights and on the third checked out. Our room was 2nd floor looking out at the pool. At 10 in the morning the music was so loud you couldnt sleep. The room was nice and the beds were ok. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Vegas for a few days during the week. I mostly chose this hotel for my husband as he loves all the memoribila. The front desk staff was great and the girl Andrea who checked us in was so nice. She upgraded us to an awesome room on the 18th floor in the Paradise tower with an AMAZING view. I thought it was too good to be a free upgrade. She was also helpful with the club scene. The casino was a lot of fun, unfortunately we did not win anything but had a great time trying. First time trying craps and won some money and then lost it. Beginners luck I guess. The restaurants were ok. Pretty basic and pricey. The pool was fun, didn't get to use it much b/c of the rain on the first day. The room was awesome! It was dark and contemporary. We were impressed. The beds were very comfy. We did not drink from the mini bar or eat any of the snacks. There are pleanty of liquor stores/CVS across the street that are much cheaper for pre drinking. There is also a great sandwhich shop across the street that is cheap and filling. Best sandwiches ever. The hotel is a little off the strip, but we found that there is pleanty to do there. I liked staying off the strip and getting away from the hustlers! The resort fee is a little rediculious. I was prepared to pay for it, but didn't think that the price was justifiable especially b/c it rained the first day were were there. They should make that optional for sure! Overall great experience for couples and singles in mid to late 20's. We'll be back to rock the hard rock!!!

Reviews.Title: “Meh...Ok room, far from anything”
Reviews.Author: banditgrant
Reviews.Content: My wife suggested we stay here because it has the "number 2" pool of Las Vegas per the Travel Channel or something like that... I agreed. The room is pictured fairly accurately with a little creative lighting. We had the king room with a street view on the top floor. It consists of a rather comfortable king bed and crappy pillows. The room is only really comfortable for 2 people, close people. Don't think of inviting a friend up there while trying to chill between Vegas adventures. There simply is no place to sit. Typically, the credit card holder on the room (me in this case), will be in a panic when anyone stands near the inferred wet bar. Anyone who tips over an overpriced Snickers or a random $35 pair of headphones will be forced to buy them. The pool was ok, but it rained and was virtually empty. The crowds on the pictures near the pool kind of scared me anyway. I think those party days have passed. I think I figured out the way to visit Vegas, and it doesn't include this hotel. I think that if you were planning on spending 3 nights in Vegas at this hotel, you should reduce it to 2 nights and take the savings and just stay at Mandalay Bay and live it hard. This will be my plan if I ever do chose to do Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Hip Place but be ready to pay up when u check out!”
Reviews.Author: blurcardi
Reviews.Content: HRH was overall a good time and fun, the pool is awesome and the rooms were pretty posh. My only real complaint is that when you check out they charge some BS fee per day. It came out to around $36/day.....NOT COOL!! Why does everyone feel the need to try and screw you??

Reviews.Title: “Rip off $20.50 per day.. very noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: fun888
Reviews.Content: Arrived the hotel at 9 pm, the self parking lot is very far and difficult to find. Loud noises and music everywhere, difficult to carry on a conversation without raising your voice. No writing utensil no paper to write on, Only one piece of soap in the rest room. They will automatically charge you $20,50 per day for the pool and the gym even you do not use it. Las Vegas hotels are greedy, love to rip-off tourist. Worst of all, it charges $16,50 per day to use the gym and the pool. Even thought we do not use the facility, they refused to remove the unreasonable charges.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Las Vegas Experience”
Reviews.Author: Scharfster
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the HRH Towers, the nicer part of the hotel. Very good room - a suite. It was supposed to be a city view, but all we could see was a parking garage. The facility had everything we could want, but there was a charge for all. Resort fee, fee to receive a package at the business center, etc. (All I seemed to get for the "resort fee" was a free newspaper.) There was a charge to go to the pool Rehab party, which was cool - but not really my scene (I'm a little old for it.) So, I was there for 2 minutes - but still had a $25 charge. We asked if it could be canceled because we didn't really stay long (and it rained) - we were told, no. The Casino: Good casino, but we had a really rude blackjack dealer. I never experienced that before. She actually gave my friend a hard time because he was smoking. Personally, I hate smoke, but it is allowed in Vegas casinos - so the croupiers shouldn't be unpleasant about it. That was the first time I ever had a mean dealer in Vegas - usually they want tips and are very nice! Also, there was supposed to be entertainment on the casino floor - dancers - like at Planet Hollywood. This is sometimes a lot of fun - but it just didn't happen for some reason. Food: Nobu is a great sushi place that everyone with a padded meal budget should experience. Mr. Lucky is good for basics like breakfast. There's also a mexican place called Pink Taco that looked nice, but I didn't eat there. Overall - this is a good place to stay if you get a good deal - otherwise, I think Planet Hollywood is a better bet. Expect your room rate to be higher than you think after resort fees.

Reviews.Title: “Sandy t”
Reviews.Author: pkoonreight
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place......great food ......housekeeping is lacking....we will be back Sandy, Dave Taylor

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you are 25 and drunk”
Reviews.Author: Kyle B
Reviews.Content: Pool is nice but full of drunk people. I was there for a conference and this hotel does not cater to middle aged lawyers. Nice bed but a little worn. Long walk to the strip which is fine with me. There was a problem checking in with my companies pre-payment and the clerk was not at all interested in helping solve the problem. Be prepared for the mandatory "resort fee" there is no way around. They do this just to be able to advertise (falsely) lower rates. And the whole place is a little smokey and musty-- i remember when this place opened it was a lot nicer over all.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay at the Hard Rock in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: seminola
Reviews.Content: Major crowds, lines, and security guards who make you feel guilty for just being there.... unfriendly bartenders too. The best part was housekeeping and the comfy beds. We did get a great rate which is why we stayed there---thank goodness it wasn't expensive--that would have made it worse.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pools and price, but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: tomnlaura
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an "upgraded" tower (casino) which I would not consider an upgrade if you like to sleep at night. There was clubbing going on until like 3am and that night was a nightmare! If I ever come back, I will stay in a different tower, bc I absolutely LOVED the pools--warm, beach-like feel. Fitness ctr was great too. Loved the Pink Taco restaurant and the price was fantastic. If you go as a couple, make sure they don't give you one of the rooms that adjoins with another--the space under the doors is very large--no privacy. Luckily--that, too, was just the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Good price but.........”
Reviews.Author: B717FO
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night, rooms where kind of dark and found some bugs in the bathroom. Over all pretty clean room and nice bed. This place is the Jersey shore of Vegas! If you like quiet this is not the hotel for you. Hotel is not on the strip. Would not stay here again and a resort charge is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place. Got married!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica K
Reviews.Content: I love the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino! I have gone once or twice a year for the past decade and have always had an amazing experience! This trip was the first time my fiance had stayed at the Hard Rock. We were there to get married and he LOVED the hotel. We ate at several of the restaurants & enjoyed ALL of them. The casino was really fun. The dealers are helpful and really fun. My NEW HUSBAND said he wants to go back to the Hard Rock in the next few months. My review... STAY THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great to be treated like a Rock Star”
Reviews.Author: Zen L
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock Hotel is the best that is why I keep coming back since 2005 for about 2 to 4 times a year for pool party. I love the staff for they remember customer who recognized and appreciate them. The Casino Tower is my favorite for it is so close to everything. The new HRH and Paradise is the best for great deluxe double queen room. I only play slot machine and I get the staff helpful and friendly approach. OMG... I love Mister Lucky for they are the only one who serve corned beef hash ;-) the staff are very friendly. I only go to Vanity but love the old Body English better. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great for couples"”
Reviews.Author: Barbaram612
Reviews.Content: Recently went to Vegas and stayed at the Hard Rock Cafe. It is definately for couples or young adults. Regular pool is really nice with lounge chairs right in the water. BUT not recommended for young kids. Right above the pool area is "Rehab" pool you have to pay to attend and has a plexi-glass pool...again, Hard Rock is for adults. I booked here because I have 20+ adult children and they loved it. Staff was very friendly, room was beautiful, bathroom was huge and clean.

Reviews.Title: “anything but rock”
Reviews.Author: mark w
Reviews.Content: the hotel has everything to be a great hotel, but it is anything but rock. my family are music enthusiasts and so i thought this would be the obvious choice. but to hang out by the pool and listen to very loud dance music just is not becoming of a place that has rock music memorabilia everywhere and during the slow part of the day plays good music. its such a shame cos the decor and the rooms are great if you like to wake up to dance music being pumped out round the pool, if only the place could live up to its name, even the staff agree when you talk to them, that cant be good.

Reviews.Title: “This place is alotta fun.”
Reviews.Author: Deger
Reviews.Content: Arriving at The Hardrock on a Saturday we checked into the hotel's newest tower, The HRH Tower. Great service from the check-in girl and we proceeded up the elevator. The room was awesome, clean, comfortable, new and big, perfect! The bed was really nice and the bathroom was fantastic. I believe it was around 700 sq. ft. where as most hotel rooms you find are around 450. We were on the 4th floor, Poolview, but couldn't really see the pool, I'd say you'd want to be 6th floor and higher to have a good view. *Note: The HRH Tower pool view is of the Hotel's regular pool and not the Rehab pool. To get the best view of the Rehab pool you should stay in the Paradise Tower, Poolview. Theres a strip mall with restaurants (awesome sushi) and liquor store (Pharmacy) located convieniently across the street from the hotel. I noticed people checking into the hotel w/ coolers.? Ahhh.. when we got into the room I figured out why. They have a mini bar fridge but all the contents are weighed and as soon as you remove anything from the fridge it is charged to your room! They did say however they could rent you a mini fridge for $20 a day. We opted to keep ice in our small bar sink, worked good enough. The hotel was busy on the weekend but died out quite a bit during the weekdays. It seemed pretty much an adult hotel as we didn't notice any kids while we were there, which for us was nice. The hotels on the strip seem busier because they have all kinds of people walking through the casinos etc even if they aren't staying at that particular hotel. Being situated off the strip the Hardrock doesn't seem to have that many outsiders milling around except for the nightclub Vanity and Rahab Pool Party on Sundays. If you want a hotel that is going to be constantly busy try one on the strip... but then you have to deal w families and kids all the time etc. It was a $9 cab ride to the strip, ($20-25 roundtrip w tip) which we did once or twice a day. It is a walkable distance from the strip but it was very hot out and we were lazy.! Also Hardrock does have the $20 Resort fee per day to cover wireless etc. I believe some hotels on the strip do not charge this. So make sure to factor these costs in when making your hotel decision. Overall super experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great midweek deal, everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: maxmindad
Reviews.Content: I booked on getaroom.com and got a $55 rate for a Mountain View room. This was $25 less than any other website. There is a resort fee of $20 so it was about $79 altogether including taxes. Get the #108 bus from the airport - only $2 and takes about 8 minutes. Ask the driver to let you know the stop (although you can clearly see the giant guitar sticking up). It's then a 3 minute walk across the street. I did not ask for any kind of upgrade, merely for a high floor. They put me in the highest floor overlooking the Pool and Strip. Great! The room was bright and clean and nicely furnished. A nice feature of the older Casino Tower (remodeled in 2010) is that you can open the large sliding windows - not so safe if you have little kids though! It's not really a hotel for kids though. Bathrooms pretty standard and no separate shower, so nothing special there. Actually the sink was VERY slow to drain and the lighting pretty dim for shaving. So, "null points" on the bathroom. Pools are really nice, lots of palm trees and sandy beaches with loungers half in the "surf". Bars right there. I've read that it's insanely busy and boisterous at the weekends but on a Wednesday it was really mellow. All the staff I encountered were really nice. All in all this was a fantastic bargain for me, a decent well sized room for a great price. You can EASILY walk to The Strip in under 15 minutes, and in the evening it's certainly cool enough.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: KlausInnsbruck
Reviews.Content: great room on the 5th floor at the Casino tower (the higher the better the view, clear!) wonderful Pool, more a Laguna! (with a car) almost centrally located, but without at least near the airport (taxi)! if you like loud music - fine! After 2 days I had enough of it - and left for a more quiet place!

Reviews.Title: “Lackluster Experience - not worth fighting for if you have other hotel options.”
Reviews.Author: E S
Reviews.Content: After convincing my friends to reserve at HRH vs. Cosmopolitan, had a lackluster experience at HRH. Pushed my friends hard to stay here as it was a smaller and easier to navigate hotel - NOBU is fantastic. Unfortunately, that was it. Due to HRH assigning my room to someone else, we weren't able to check in for multiple hours, forcing us to re-arrange as well as miss some parts of our plans. After multiple fiascos with re-keying the wrong room, giving our room to another group NOT in our party, and locking us out of room where we were already checked-in, the final straw came when manager came to fix issue, offered a $50 credit WHICH WAS LEFT OFF WHEN I CHECKED OUT - I had to call back and remind the manager of the situation - she promptly credited me the amount. Prior to her entrance into the process, had a hostile check-in agent (verifiable by 2 others in my party) who wouldn't help us and arguably told us that there was nothing we could do to get into OUR room, even tho it was their hotel check-in system that was preventing this. As for the room, wiring was confusing - in order to keep bathroom light on, needed to turn on a switch in the bedroom. BEWARE, one of our party had a "room check" where hotel staff came into the room UNANNOUNCED. As we were in the room, we asked what this was - they said it was standard policy. We're a group of 40 yr old dads in corporate management - why check our rooms without permission? completely unacceptable and shady. Whole experience made me look bad as I had pushed for this - multiple comments from my party. I had let the hotel know about my experience and was informed 3 TIMES that a manager would contact me - still no response, so posted my review.

Reviews.Title: “I still haven't aged out of this place!”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrvlr84
Reviews.Content: During a real depressing 4-week non-stop rain deluge in March, I received a promotional e-mail from the HRH. I booked a trip for August,, and once again, was not disappointed. Though I wasn't upgraded to the the new Paradise towers as in a prior visit, I found the Casino Towers to be excellent. (I do miss the robes they used to have in the past, though). I still love the pool, although I wish it would open earlier than 11:00. They do require a minimum food purchase in order to use the chaise lounges at Rehab now, but, no problem. I set my towel by the side of the pool, and spent most of the time dancing with the younger crowd. .Best Rehab ever!, and this was my 4th time. And for the older people who whine about the Jersey Shore atmosphere: If you run, swim, hit the gym, and take care of yourself, you will have NO trouble fitting in the the younger set. I tried the Prix Fixe special at the LTO Italian restaurant and was really impressed. I thought the glass of red wine alone was worth the price of the meal. I also had a continental breakfast at Espumuso one morning, and, since it is a Latin-inspired cafe, I read part of a Gabriel Garcia-Marquez novel with my coffee and pastry.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but dark”
Reviews.Author: Granby-Gobbler
Reviews.Content: We stayed wiith 3 teenagers, so we needed to get adjoining rooms in the HRH section. We were accomidated and the rooms were beautiful. The bathroom and shower were huge and the beds were very comfortable. We went to the pool in the morning and it was nice. Some problems I had was that the lobby area was very dark (maybe by design). I also found it difficult to get from the parking lot to your room. You always had to go down an elevator to the lobby and then a long walk to go up an elevator to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and amazing atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: blitzburgh11
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We will never stay anywhere else when we go to vegas. The hotel is clean, atmosphere is fantastic and the crowd was our age (25-35). Rooms are incredible, casino is spotless, and the whole property doesn't have that Vegas "funk" smell. Love this place. With the exception of over priced drinks at the pool, one extremely rude dealer (Bella) at the swim-up blackjack tables, and the table game waitresses avoiding you, and the shuttle to the strip ending at 5pm, the rest of the casino is great. Hells belles were hot! Made losing money easier. Music is loud and pumps you up. People at the pool are all hot and fit. Pool servers are hot. Perfect Vegas setting. If you want to party in a pool, gamble while drinking and swimming with hot girls all over, and meet awesome people, then this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Party Time”
Reviews.Author: MJL395
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at HRH 5 times in the last 3 years. Mostly come for holiday weekends during the summer. You know what you are getting here, a good size casino, numerous dining options, and a 24 hour party. The pool is great and Mr. Lucky's is great for a quick cheap bite to eat. Other restaurants include Rare 120 and Nobu. Going back in late September to stay at the HRH.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and Jersey Shore-ish”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelerBD
Reviews.Content: A group of friends of mine meet up annually in Las Vegas, and have stayed at many of the best hotels in town. I do not include Hard Rock on that list. At only age 33, I felt like an absolute old man here. I was perpetually annoyed by the loud partying 21 to 25 year olds in our hallway, and hated being woken up by very loud rock music coming from the pool at 10 a.m. every morning. Our air conditioning was also moderately functional, and the room was fine but nothing special for the price. This is a paradise for the Jersey Shore crowd, but if you're a couple or a family or even a group of friends over the age of 30, you're very unlikely to enjoy it here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, many extra charges for things not use”
Reviews.Author: katerinkaiya
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband over night in this hotel during our trip in usa. The rooms are very well design and pleasure to stay. The thing i have to say, watch your bill careful once you are making check out. We were charged for drinks we didnt even touch. We arrived in the hotel at 7.30p.m. and left at 8 a.m. and were charge of using a swimming pool, which we even didnt know exist. But this is a Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great two day getaway!”
Reviews.Author: BoookemDano
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hard Rock in Vegas so many times I lost count. The pool is my main focus for Vegas, it was 112 deg both days and the staff did their best to keep the drinks coming. The last few trips we have stayed in the new Hard Rock Tower which is very nice, modern and classy. The juice bar and secret library on the 2nd floor is great alternative to Starbucks, 2nd floor offers an ideal shortcut to the pool. We stayed later in the week Wed-Fri, this was the first time I had been there with all the pools open, we found a gem of a spot just behind the bar and second level, there was only one other couple present and later a few more people stopped by but really a peaceful hideaway, unfortunately the staff was not serving in that location but I almost felt it was worth it to get up to get my drinks since it was so quiet. The upstairs pool is very cool with a glass wall that faces the HR tower, there is also 3 glass windows in the bottom of the pool looking down into the bar below, we met other couples easily and enjoyed sharing stories. My game plan for the Hard Rock: Sunday-Thursday stay will save you big, avoiding the crowds, flights are easy and cheap. Closest resort to the airport, a $10 cab. No need to leave plenty of night life and great food!

Reviews.Title: “Had lots of fun just wish they would start the pool music later”
Reviews.Author: mermaidgem
Reviews.Content: Just had a stay at the hard rock for four nights and really enjoyed my stay. At check in I upgraded my room for an extra $5o per night hesitant at first but did enjoy the suite. The 7 th floor room had opening doors with views of the strip and pool below The bed was probably the most comfortable I have ever had in a I still enjoyed the re hab pool party , but every other day the pool music started at 9 am which in Vegas is a little early as the music works it way into your sleep in The pink taco was great for eats as well The only other downside is it is a cab ride in summer too the strip as it is too hot to walk at 110 degrees Apart from that will probably stay at somewhere a little more quiet but if you like to party than this is the place !!

Reviews.Title: “This was a great deal!”
Reviews.Author: fr0maustintexas
Reviews.Content: My daughter, 23, and myself, 59 stayed at the HRH in late August. We had a super weeknight rate even with the resort fee. No complaints. Our room had two double beds and a really gorgeous nighttime view of the pool area all lit up. We were quite impressed.... Finding ourselves hungry on the strip at 3 a.m. with no restaurants visibly open, we returned to the HRH expecting not to eat until the morning....Not! The HRH had a great 24 hour cafe...very reasonable with a wide variety of menu items. We regretted that we had booked a few other nights at the Flamingo which turned out to be a total downer...Travelers can't go wrong with the HRH. Jayne and Tejana from Texas

Reviews.Title: “Hard rock heaven”
Reviews.Author: charliegurl
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay and never been to Vegas before and we never left the hotel for the first day we had enough in the hotel to keep us entertained , great food great music and our room was in casino tower and looked out onto the beautiful pool area which was always buzzing but with dance music unfortunately ;) we will be back next year loved it! The only negative is it's a bit far away from main strip bit there is a free shuttle service there and back .

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, should be rated much higher.”
Reviews.Author: Danventure
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hard Rock during my first trip to Vegas as 21+ with three friends ala "Hangover." I was a little concerned based on the low TripAdvisor ranking, but I think if you're in your 20-30s (and not someone who likes to complain) you should enjoy the lower priced nice rooms (sign up for their email list) in the Paradise or HRH Towers, even though it's off the Strip. I've only stayed in the Paradise Tower, high floor, nice and quiet other than the occasional plane flying by (which is an inconvenient noise in most Vegas hotels). I wouldn't bother with the plain ol' Casino Tower based on other reviews. In Vegas, you want the newest options available, because visitors wear this city out til the wheels fall off. Pros: Great beds, most comfortable I can remember in any hotel. Clean rooms and nice decor. Laid back, casual casino atmosphere and friendly casino staff. The Australian dealer at the roulette table was classy and friendly. I won $350 in 3 spins by the way, and understand that you can actually observe certain things if you pay enough attention, which actually gives you a real chance of winning. Note: For people who complain about negative results at the casino games, look within your own betting decisions for the reason why you didn't win. It's no fault of the casino that you fall into the 95% or more of gamblers who give the casinos their profits. Cons: Didn't eat a single good meal at any of the restaurants, although I didn't try the fancier one. Better to stay here for the pool/casino/clubs/sleep at night but spend the majority of your day on the Strip. All in all, if you don't mind staying off the Strip, this is the place to be for twentysomethings.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Will definetly be back!”
Reviews.Author: famousamos77
Reviews.Content: I will make this short and sweet. We stayed in the HRH Towers and we absolutely loved it. The bed is DREAMYYYYYY! The room had an IPOD DOCK which was a great bonus, I loved listening to my music, when getting dressed, and doing other (adult) things. Every morning we ordered room service breakfast, and it was DELISH! The pancakes were ohh soo good! The food at Pink Taco was awesome as well. Poolside, we paid for a cabana, and the service was awesome, great food, and drinks. I liked the fact that it is off the strip and not as crowded, it made for an awesome Vegas trip. Cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel was Rockin'!”
Reviews.Author: scorejason
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock hotel in Las Vegas for a long weekend in late August. It is a wild place on Sunday's for their 'Rehab" party. The pool area is one of the best designed and laid out pool areas I have ever seen. There are actually 4 pools in the same area, Beach Club, Beach Club West, Rehab, and...oh boy...I can't remember the name of the 4th pool. oh well. We had a pool view room overlooking the Beach Club pool and it was a great spot. In the ealry morning around 10 am, the DJ starts playing music very loudly. We could hear the music clearly in our rooms even with the balcony doors shut. I do not know if the rooms without pool view could hear the music so keep that in mind if you really want to stay here but don't want the music. There is a high percentage of young people staying here. Mostly because of Vanity the night club, and the Rehab pool party. The casino is very well layed out and you are not overwhelmed with slot machines nor do youhave to walk through a sea of slot machines to get everywhere like you have to at most Vegas casinos. There was just the right amount of gaming available. The beds were ultra comfortable!! The service was very friendly. I would love to stay at this hotel again. I recommend this hotel if you want to party or be around a younger, cooler crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: IcePicks
Reviews.Content: I left my cell phone charging in the room, went to the pool, came back, phone was gone, beds were made. When I reported it, management showed no sympathy whatsoever. I was told to call Risk Management, who did not return my calls. Finally after a half dozen calls, I was offered no apology or credit despite the fact our group spent almost $5k at the Hard Rock for the weekend. DO NOT STAY HERE. With that said, this is probably the dumpiest casino near the strip. Spend the money and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not just for young adults!”
Reviews.Author: robrams
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the HRH tower in Aug 2011. We chose the HR because our teen son was with us & we thought he would enjoy looking at all the memorabilia. We were worried that it would be too much of a party atmosphere and we wouldn't be able to sleep at night. It was quite the opposite. Our room was on the 9th floor and it was spectacular. Very quite and the beds and the shower was the highlight! The beds were the most comfortable we have ever slept in. We even had a partial view of the strip which was really nice. Shower was huge and the 5 foot towels were nice! My only complaint is that (just like all the Vegas hotels!) the cost for anything extra was excessive; i.e. meals, water, snacks, souveniers, etc. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for me! Sux for my teens..”
Reviews.Author: maximilian010
Reviews.Content: this hotel was so much fun! I enjoyed it. Very clean and nice. The teens did not like it so much not sure why other than it was boring they said. We went and took the http://LasVegas2Hollywood.com tour , thank god for that tour! They saved the family vacation. lol I have done it twice now. I had to leave the OOOOO and AWWW COOL bursting out kids at home the second time. Its can be zenful for solos and exciting my family too.

Reviews.Title: “meodiocricy”
Reviews.Author: Draxxar
Reviews.Content: Nice room but very rude employees. Wouldn't let us into the main pool area even just for pics without proper bathing attire. Just a bunch of elitist pigs attached to a certain genera of rock music by way of convenience. Rock generations shouldn't have to conform to any type or style of dress code. You want in, you go there. You live it. Period. We did, however, rock the club scene, however selective for no real reason it was, and had a good time, save for the fact that the dance floor was so crowded you couldn't even really dance at all. Props for a good attempt. The penny slots were rock on. The roulette and everything else was criminally insane. Treasure Island or Excalibur looked to be far better hotels from our touring around.

Reviews.Title: “We hated it and won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Felisha L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in their HRH Suites on August 15, 2011. I rented two suites, both of which were dirty!! The front desk staff was very incompetent. Other guests were pretty irate and yelling! One angry man demanded a manager and the front desk girl in a very childish voice calls the manager on the phone Stating “I need you” What in the world? I was angry but I chose not to yell even though they didn’t have their stuff together at all. We had to wait until late evening until we were even able to get into our 2nd room!!! They “compensated” us with a late checkout. This wasn’t enough based on all the crap we had to deal with. When we finally got our dirty second room, (which we supposedly had to wait for so they could clean it HA!!!) the key didn't even work!! I had to make about 5 trips down to the front desk trying to get everything taken care of. HORRIBLE!!! I stayed in the suites with the 2 queen beds. The sitting area, though separate from the bedroom, was pretty cramped. It was basically a normal sized bedroom with doors and a wall put up. The sound system wasn't very loud. The sound comes through the TV, or a little bedside radio. It did give you a variety of different stations and songs that you could play. You could also play your iPhone through it, so that I liked. They had 2 of the 42” flat screen TVS. One was in the “living room” and the other in the bedroom, but only one remote??! “Hey honey can you run on in here and change the channel for me! Thanks!!!” The bathtubs looked nice but after seeing how housekeeping cleaned the rest of the suite I opted to not take a soak. The beds were big fluffy and comfy. However in the 2nd Suite we could only sleep on one of the beds because the other had hairs on it! Guess that's why we had to wait till evening, so they could sprinkle dirt and crumbs on the couches and leave a helping of hairs on the beds. Oh they also thought it best not to wipe the brown stuff off of the walls in the toilet area. That was a lovely touch!! Couple that with the clumps of hair and dirt on the carpets and you have an award winning stay!!! In the morning we ordered room service. There were 6 of us and our bill came to about $164.00. We paid for stale pastries and croissants, watery orange juice, cold bacon, cold pancakes, salt with a little bit of hash browns, sunny side up eggs instead of the scrambled eggs we asked for, sausage that looked like it was barely cooked, yogurt parfait, and chicken fried steak. They forgot our order of tea and the extra side of scrambled eggs we asked for. The coffee was however hot so yay for getting that one right!! The best part of it all is that we had to wait about an hour and half for our cold and disgusting breakfast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: tvpromo
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Stayed here for a conference so I didn't pay a dime but would have been happy to do so. Not as expensive as the other places (Encore, Bellagio) we've stayed for conferences. Atmosphere is great. Not overcrowded like all the hotel casinos on the strip. Lots of space to breathe. Decent restaurants and clubs. However, it is a a bit off the beaten path. A very short cab ride to the strip or a brisk walk if you are up to it. Great swimming pools -taking a nap during the day (hangover?) might be a challenge as there is the constant bass thumping of the pool DJ. Thinking about taking the wife for a getaway. If you love music and pop culture, then this is a natural choice. Rock memorabilia in every room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities and awesome pool!!!”
Reviews.Author: djet17
Reviews.Content: The pools are amazing. The food was great (luckys 24). Staff was very friendly. Club vanity is nice and admission was free since we were staying there. It is off the strip though so you need to take a cab to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't come here with children.........”
Reviews.Author: cleofish
Reviews.Content: .....not even teenage children. If they don't want kids here that's entirely understandable but they should tell you before you book rather than just try to make them feel uncomfortable when you've already paid to get them here. I booked the place despite it's considerable distance from the strip because of it's pool complex. We've been touring for a fortnight and this seemed like a good place to relax for a couple of days before our flight back. On trying to enter the pool complex we were stopped by someone pointing at me and telling me not to take food/drink in with us. He said this in such a way that I actually thought I was trying to get something dodgy in and had to look at what I was holding. In fact I had a small bottle of water in my bag which is allowed. I asked him which pool we should use. He jabbed a finger in the direction of my mild-mannered teenage son and said "That's the only pool he'll be allowed in". It was as though my son was a member of the untouchable class rather than a customer. The pool itself is ok. Has a sandy beach on one side. Not terribly big. Loud music which I expected. Not enough sunbeds. A lot of adults doing adult things which is fine but it's a shame they don't go to the adults only pools for that. My son was so uncomfortable we had to leave. So I'm stuck here for another two days with no pool we can use and away from the strip. It's put a downer on the end of a fantastic holiday. As for the hotel - in the HRH all suites. Very spacious and nicely decorated, fantastically well-equipped. The touchscreen music thing on the wall is excellent. When we got here yesterday it really wasn't clean - and I'm not particularly fussy - but to be fair we checked in a bit early and it does look a lot better today.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: kisstanza
Reviews.Content: My first time in Vegas with my boyfriend. We picked out Hard Rock to stay at because the reviews were good. Glad we decided to come here! The standard rooms alone are very modern and spacious. The beds and pillows feel like clouds. The casino is a bit dark, but the slot machine lights make up for it and it also fits the atmosphere. I like the new poker section in the back. They moved it from one day to the next. Pink Taco was amazing and the Rehab pool is very nice. There is one section nearing and into the pool where there is sand and makes it look like you're in a beach. Nice touch! When we go back to Vegas definately staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “If only this hotel was on the strip...”
Reviews.Author: Misha J
Reviews.Content: After a disappointing stay at Caesars, my travel companion and I moved over to the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino for a couple of days. Local maps are quite deceiving as they make it appear as though the hotel is one or two blocks off the strip. In actual terms, it is a few kilometres away - in the middle of nowhere. Having said that - the hotel itself is quite impressive. Very modern, with all the mod cons - we were staying in the tower - so I do not know how the lower level hotel rates. The cost of this hotel is so very cheap (one assumes based on the distance from the strip) so we opted for two rooms. My friend was disappointed to find out that they were on a low level - whilst I was up near the top. This meant that our rooms - which were identical (and credit to the hotel: very fancy schmancy) had two different views. My friend's of a building across the way, mine of the International Airport. Perhaps someone who travels too much - I quite enjoy the view of planes coming and going, with the mountains in the distance, so I was pleased. The casino is absolutely tiny - so we did not use it at all. We used the hotel as a base and taxied to the strip and other sights. The complimentary valet parking was a bonus too. The biggest problem (IMHO) of this hotel was the clientele. Perhaps due to price, or perhaps due to the name, it was a very (and I do mean very) young crowd - I would have carded everyone of them. People walked about the hotel and casino (including late evening) in swim shorts, and thongs (read flip flops), which is not what one wants to see on vacation (at least when not at the beach) in the middle of winter. When I drove in, a famous musician (stuffed if I know who they were) was also staying so that caused a bit of a stir and some check in delays - so security was somewhat increased - though that didn't bother me at all. Basically the issue here is the tyranny of distance. I could honestly say that if this hotel was on the strip amidst the other big names - I would have no problem staying there at all. Big plus was leaving Vegas to drive back to LA, the trip was made much easier not having to traverse the entirety of the Las Vegas Boulevarde. A good one for young'uns or the budget conscious who still like a bit of luxury. Good luck on the slots!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel would stay again”
Reviews.Author: suzanne054
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for 4 nights in July. The hotel is very modern check in staff where nice, i was not happy when i got there and was told i had to pay $20 (and you have to pay it No choice) a day for use of the shuttle bus which take you to the fashion show mall only and runs between 10am and 5pm, to free phone with in the united states (i was visiting from the UK this was not useful to me) and also for the internet which only let me have one device active on the Wifi. Also i did not get any help with taking my bags to the room. (Only complaints i have about HRH) When i finally got to the room it was very big, modern and clean. I had an amazing view of the pool area and you can see other hotels on the strip. Music starts being played at 9am in the morning so if you have a room facing the pool you will be woken up at 9am also you can hear the pool cleaners i didn’t hear them every day but that woke me up at 7am when i did hear them. The light shades are symbols around the floors of the hotel, which do get hit and it is funny when you do it but not so funny when other people hit them (that was over the weekend) Music is also played into the night but it is Vegas wouldn’t expect any think less. The hotel is set back off the strip, while the sun is out it is too hot to walk from the hotel to the strip but once the sun starts to set it will take you about 15mins but depending on were on the strip you want to go you might need to take a taxi. (Taxi was $11 from the airport to HRH). I used the shuttle bus once it was good but i wish it went up and down the strip not just to the fashion show mall. I ordered room service while i stayed here it was really good, service was quick and the way the food was set out was lovely, it comes on a table which opens out. In the hotel there is a Starbucks. I ate at the lucky strike (i think it was called that) chicken salad was not nice but the pizzas are amazing also ate at the hard rock cafe it is outside but on the grounds of the hotel. Service in there was amazing as was the food. There is a lot to do around the hotel from looking at the rock memorabilia, gambling and going to the pool. The concierge called Estaban was brilliant; he was so helpful and got me and my friend a cheap deal on a helicopter ride over the Grand Canyon and on show tickets. If you want to do any tourist stuff like that go to him first. Check out was quick and easy. It is a nice hotel will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “"My Favorite Hotel, Will not stay anywhere else.."”
Reviews.Author: Mark J
Reviews.Content: This is by far the cleaniest hotel (smoke smell wise) that I have ever been in. The atmosphere is incredible and I am hooked on the Hard Rock. I will not stay @ another hotel in Vegas, after staying here. The Pink Taco, freakin Rocks.... Best food ever..

Reviews.Title: “Loved it (but Hated Parts)”
Reviews.Author: MissMe08
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Mid-July and had a great time with my friends. Tips: if you can, check in on any day other than Friday - Sunday night. I know that's impossible for some. We checked in on Thursday and had keys in under 15 mins. The rockstar card gets you discounts and it's free to sign up. The Beds and the blackout curtains were JUST what the doctor ordered for a Vegas Weekend. The rooms were pretty clean. The Mountain View room was nice and quiet (Pool side, you can hear the parties and Rehab). The pool parties were great but since it's open to non-hotel guest, you shouldn't bring anything down that you can't stand to lose. In fact, I appreciate the security was as thorough as they were.
