The restrictions to get into the pool area are a bit extreme (no oversized bags, no mirrors or glass, no pills - I saw some girl have to throw away her allergy and birth control because she had it in her bag) but once you see the type of party you're walking into, you understand why. Cons: Price: everything from drinks to shop items are dumb expensive. be prepared to spend here. The shuttle: I made a joke while waiting at the "shuttle line" that it's probably going to be some tricked out Escalade. Well I was only off by the Tricked Out part. It was an Escalade that they crammed AS MANY people in though it was only really designed for about 7 people. It was the first and LAST time we used the shuttle during our stay. Housekeeping: They came to clean out room ONCE during our stay (thur-sun). And it was a pain to get clean towels. Hotel Size: It felt like a maze. A big, unnecessarily long maze. Hotel staff: for the most part they were nice. My biggest complaint is that no one seems to communicate with each other and JUST because someone has a staff shirt on doesn't mean they have a clue what's going on. Overall, I had a great time. If I was coming back during the summertime, I would stay here to that I have a place to crash after Rehab. But I'm not sure I would pick this place in general given it's price and location off the strip. I can get something cheaper and on par around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms..rude and snobby staff..anyone can just walk on in!!”
Reviews.Author: pingading
Reviews.Content: very dank and dark casino. nicely appointed rooms with large bathtubs and this is the only positive thing I can say about this hotel. decided to go for a a walk one morning and asked one of the hotel employees which way i should go to access the pool area. The short bald headed thug sneered at me and told me to " keep walking around and I would eventually find it"!!!!anyone can just walk on in and the whole time we were there none of the employees ever smiled or even greeted us. this hotel is a good distance away from the strip and is not "amongst the lights" of las vegas. never again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, and special mention...”
Reviews.Author: mlbarbary
Reviews.Content: It took us 5 minutes and 5 dollars each to arrive at Hard Rock in a limo from the Las Vegas airport. As soon as we arrived, the staff was super accommodating. The front desk agent who checked us in was awesome and very friendly. As soon as we finished scoping the room out after our early check-in, we started bouncing back and forth from the pool and the rooms. As a hotel guest, we received special treatment from almost every employee we saw. The rooms are stylish and modern, with a classic twist. I enjoyed the random musically influenced art that was displayed throughout the hotel and even in our room. Throughout the day, we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly at the pool, which was more like an adult water-park. (Don't play the blackjack tables at the swim-up bar, it's a trap!) I even lost my keys amidst the fray, and I returned to the front desk to pick up a few extras. AJ was clearly busy, but he took the time to stop what he was doing and offer me assistance. He confirmed my name on the room and immediately made me duplicate keys. His service was top notch. When I arrived to the room to share the great service that AJ provided, I couldn't figure out the internet connection right away. As soon as I called the front desk I was connected to Heather; she was very helpful and patient, professional and warm service at it's finest. There is too much fun stuff at this hotel to even notice a single shortfall! Make sure to stay here whenever you are ready to party and live out an epic party!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock lost a bit of it's Edge”
Reviews.Author: tgpooch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a bachelor party from Wednesday night through Saturday night. Overall the stay was okay with the highlights being the Pool, Vanity nightclub, and Pink Taco, not to mention I got a great weekly rate from their players club. I stayed in one of the older rooms, which had been updated since the last time I stayed, but unfortunately a pipe above my room burst while I was there (think it was a sewer pipe because it smelled awful). The front desk was quick to move me to another room, but didn't offer me anything for the incovenience of having to put my plans on hold and change rooms (i.e. meal voucher, etc). The new room was just like the other one, with the beds being decent as well a nice flat screen tv and Bose alarm clock. Only problem was the next morning I was woken up by construction promptly at 7:30am after a late night in Vegas. They were updating one of their restaurants and the drilling vibrated the whole room. I guess the only consolation was knowing that the entire wing of the hotel was going through the same thing, since I could hear it as I walked the entire lenght of the hotel. Spent 2 fun days at the pool. Great atmosphere and music with a cool layout. Some swimup tables if pool blackjack is your thing, and a water slide. Not the best atmosphere for kids, since it can easily turn into a dance party with lots of alcohol being served. The casino is so-so. The new extension keeps the crowds low, but that it part of the draw, in my opinion, especially on a Friday and Saturday night. Instead of a lively atmosphere it is more low key with the additional tables. On the flip side, you should never have a problem finding an open spot at your favorite game. If you have the option, go with Pink Taco over Mr. Lucky's...better food at about the same price. Really enjoyed the complimentary chips and 3 kinds of salsa. All-in-all, the stay was decent with the draws being the pool and the lower room rates. The trade-off is being off the strip in a casino that's not as "packed" as it used to be in it's prime.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin and Lovin”
Reviews.Author: Ace1108
Reviews.Content: Energetic vibes and upscale hotels! Will need to check the pool and hang out there next time.

Reviews.Title: “More than Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: ClareS84
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! Being Hard Rock fans and having stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Chicago and eaten in many Hard Rock Restaurants in America while on our 3 month trip we were expecting an enjoyable and friendly stay. It is important to understand that this Hotel is not owned by Hard Rock (we were not aware of this) so any loyalty membership you have is useless. The staff were rude and arrogant, our room was clean and modern but had a rather revolting smell which we reported when leaving the hotel for lunch. It was not until 6 hours later that someone came to investigate. The hotel was not busy on our stay but be aware that on Sundays they have a pool party called Rehab that can get out of control. Considering how quiet it was, when we visited the pool there were no sun beds available only cabanas at an extra charge! The hotel is some distance from the strip and because the hotel is struggling they have cancelled the shuttle service. You will need to take Taxis. The music is not what you expect from a Hard Rock instead expect Disney Pop Radio while you try to relax by the pool. The music by the pool also starts very early so don't expect a lie in! To top it off I had paid for this hotel in advance but they still charged my card for the nights stay and I am yet to see the refund!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: Nelly17332
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock is Fantastic. Fun, excellent value for the money and a great place to stay. No question it is top notch. If you want to enjoy your trip this is the place to be

Reviews.Title: “I've Stayed at Many Vegas hotels and This One is Up There”
Reviews.Author: lcarollo
Reviews.Content: I work for an event staffing company and have stayed in many of the hotels in Vegas for many different events. As a result I have seen the worst of the worst and the best of the best and can honestly say if you are going to Vegas for the true definition of Vegas; adult playground, I would absolutely recommend the Hard Rock Hotel. Though I have no control of where my company books our hotel reservations I love to read reviews and do some research on the hotels I plan to stay in and have to admit I was a bit skeptical after reading some of these reviews. Since my job consists of planning events, especially within the nightlife scene I have been able to compare and feel that many people that stayed at the Hard Rock and didn’t have an awesome time there really can’t handle Vegas and should have opted for a cruise. The Hard Rock is about a 5 minute cab ride from the strip which in my opinion makes it safer to not blow your money all in one night; as opposed to sporadically throughout your stay. The pool party at Rehab was one of the best I have been too. Great music and surrounded by people that just want to have a good time. Vanity also seems to be high up on my list of go tos. Not to small but not to overbearing either. I have been there a few times and love the fact that I actually have room to walk around. I must admit that I am a food snob and really judge my stays by the restaurants that are available. I am from LA and have an addiction to sushi and tacos of course and felt right at home when I was able to eat at my favorite LA taco place right in my hotel…Pink Taco!! You can never go wrong by ordering fine Japanese cuisine at Nobu as well. Lastly, I need my relaxation time as much as my party time which is why I can speak extremely highly of the Hard Rock’s Fitness Center. Very low key and comfortable with all the workout equipment necessary for a great work out to start the day off right! I don’t have anything good or bad to say about the Hard Rock staff which in my opinion is a great opinion because I was able to enjoy my stay in result of my own expectations and not because of a staff member swaying my opinions. The woman at the front desk did offer us an upgrade in result of a special promotion that was currently going on which I felt was sweet since she didn’t have to mention anything at all. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “For the Young Crowd”
Reviews.Author: Vacationgirl_0707
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a group in mid-July. We were upgraded to the Paradise Tower and had a pool view on a lower floors. The music at the pool starts up at 9am and goes into the evening. In our room, you could hear the music loud and clear and feel the bass. If you want quiet, make sure you don't have pool view. They have 2 different pools, one for families and one for the party types. Both are very nice, but the atmosphere is different. On summer weekends, the Rehab/Beach Club pool is full of the 20 somethings drinking a lot. The lounge chairs are not free to use, there is a bar/food minimum you must spend in order to use the chair. The vibe at the pool is more relaxed during the week as well as the security (no frisking required to get into the pool area). The hotel room was large, nice, clean and comfortable. Beds were great! Rooms have ipod docking stations, but we couldn't get ours to work. The resort fee includes in room internet and use of the gym, so that makes it worth it. No issues with service, but no one was outstanding either. The casino is on the smaller side for Vegas, but seemed to have all the games. The overall feel of the Hard Rock lives up to its name and encourages you to "Party like a Rock Star". Having food options in the casino is a necessity, since it is located so far from the strip and other dining locations. Unfortunately all of the options are pretty pricey and there is only one non-sit down place to get food (other than Starbucks).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing pool, service hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: uktomiami
Reviews.Content: Our room and experience at the Hard Rock was mostly fabulous. The pool is amazing and the casino, while quiet due to hotel location, is still fun to play in. Service on reception and around the pool is hit and miss depending on who you get. Some staff are so polite and helpful you can't help but wonder what happened when you then encounter a jaded Vegas employee who thinks they are above everyone else. Beware April who works around the pool, her service is hardly anything that resembles customer friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Will defo be back!”
Reviews.Author: banana89
Reviews.Content: Before heading on our trip to las vegas i was very nervous after having read the bad reviews about the hard rock hotel. But we were pleasantly suprised when we arrive that all of the bad reviews were wrong.We were greatd at the door and brought to reception where we recieved a friendly service. We stayed in the casino tower which is the oldest of the three however in my opinion there was nothing old about it. The room was amazing and very clean! The pools are brilliant and staff are at hand to any need you may have. The resort fees were $15 plus tax a day which wasnt too expensive. The only downside is that it is not on the strip but a 5min taxi ride solves that.i would defo reccommend this hotel and if you are staying there ignore all of the bad reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, despite a few initial problems”
Reviews.Author: Ings_9
Reviews.Content: A huge resort, very friendly staff. The stopper in our sink did not work properly when we arrived, but maintenance came as soon as I had notified the front desk. We discovered our TV did not work, but was by a front desk member that it would be fixed shortly. It was never fixed, but we decided to ignore it since we, after all, were not in Las Vegas to be in our room watching TV. However, when our safe deposit box decided to not open on the first morning, and it took security 45-60 minutes to come and fix it, we decided to go and as for a new room. The front desk staff were very helpful and upgraded us to a room with a view of the huge pool area. The pool area was really crowded, which can be expected with temperatures exceeding 100F..

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: quinnireland
Reviews.Content: Recently had a vacation in Hard Rock Hotel . We had 4 in our party (all aged mid thirties). I have stayed in a couple of hotels in Vegas before - this was by far the best. The pool is incredible - staff were great. Worth getting the Cabanas during the day - especially on Rehab day - which is one hell of a day!. Will be making our Hard Rock trip an annual one fore sure!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not my cup of tea...carry your beer funnel”
Reviews.Author: augirl47-39
Reviews.Content: This is not the place to stay if you want to have a relaxing day by the pool...even when Rehab is not taking place. I stayed a Monday-Thursday. The pool was filled with nothing but young drunks and loud music, no matter which one you went to. The pool servers were rude and almost non-existent. The service inside the casino was much better. But that's not really saying much. The room was fine, although some of the lights didn't work. But again, the blaring music from the pool made it less than relaxing. The best service I got was from the men's clothing store, John Varvatos, and room service. I know plenty of people looking for a good job who would happily provide the service the workers at the Hard Rock Las Vegas lack.

Reviews.Title: “Blocks away from the strip - Rooms are a bit small”
Reviews.Author: heathgirly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a couple of blocks off of the strip. There is no real night club in the hotel. The room had a modern feel. The rooms were a bit smaller than most of the hotels. I also recommend this place if you are in your 20's and 30's. It is a 'young' hotel' clientele. The hallways are a bit small as well. We had a great time hanging out in the main bar and casino area. The bed was comfy and the linens were nice. We had a great view of the pool. But, it is a cab ride away to everything else. We went to the night club in the hotel and it is closed!!

Reviews.Title: “I still love the Hard Rock after all these years”
Reviews.Author: nikkimac70
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Vegas since I turned 21 & have been more times than I can count. Having stayed at several hotels including Ceasar's, Treasure Island, Bellagio, Stratosphere, Bally's... and the Hard Rock several times, HR is still my fave! This was my first stay since they built the new towers & I have to say I was a little sceptical. I liked it old school.. I was there for the first ever rehab sunday (in what '04) & the night John Entiwistle of the Who died ('02) in room 658. SO - never mind how old i am now! haha! But seriously, 41, plus 3 years clean & sober ... it's a whole new world when I party in Vegas now. So let me get to the point... for the sober or not, for the young or middle aged :) The new HRH Tower - BEAUTIFUL! The room was stunning, the bed ridiculously comfortable & the shower - super sexy! The Pink Taco is still my favorite place to eat in Vegas & to check-in to on Facebook :) - great Mexican food & killer service. The gym is good size, well equipped & there are actual windows to see outside!! There are new pools everywhere.. I think I found 6. Lifeguards are cute & nice ... music is bumpin' & impossible not to dance to while laying in the sun. The hotel gambling area is more spread out & crazy enough the entire hotel smells really good! I had a great time & the Hard Rock keeps rockin' my world!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Rocks It Out”
Reviews.Author: 32655Annie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hard Rock this weekend, and were treated like royalty from the time we checked in. Our room on the 9th floor overlooked the pool scene; the room was amazing with the touch screen digital juke box and pictures of rock stars from the music world. Houskeeping was really helpful when I called down for scissors to take some tags off my new bathing suit. They arrived with a razor and took care of this for me. Check in was amazing and Diana and Nikki were awesome. Jenny in Housekeeping was always available, and greeted us daily with big smiles. Brittany,our server at the pool was the best ever. She looked after us the entire day, and made sure we were comfortable and relaxed in our cabana. The service couldn't have been better. The casino was fun, and the bar staff and even the casino staff made sure we were there to enjoy ourselves. There is something for everyone at this hotel. We saw a few shows on the strip, and the location is great to taxi it up to the entertainment venues. Management looks after its guests, and it shows. Remember that this is a place to have fun, forget your worries, and enjoy the moment!

Reviews.Title: “great time at ReHab!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Puma2218
Reviews.Content: we decided to stay sunday night here since it was cheaper then paying the cover to get into the Rehab pool party on sunday. The rooms were great, big and clean and spacious. Great view. the pool was awesome!!!! Best in Vegas so far!!! Rehab was great. Get there early. We stayed on the south beach side which was calmer but fun. you have to guarantee them $150 in food and alcohol to use the lounge chairs. $2,500 for the cabannas. So I would share or have just one person take a chair and the other can lay on the towel. a great experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel, rooms are lovely!”
Reviews.Author: KittyKat7574
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying here. We've stayed at the Venetian and MGM Grand before so wanted to try something different. We stayed in the HRH Towers in a corner suite. It was well worth paying extra, the views were great and both the room and bathroom was large. Two televisions and and a trendy dukebox!! The only downside to this hotel is that it is about 15/20 minutes walk to the main strip, however we got cabs most of the time as we had planned our ideal itinerary in advance, therefore it didn't make much of a difference. Typically Vegas! Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Party Less So For Service”
Reviews.Author: JSD1970
Reviews.Content: This is a great party hotel but the focus on the customer experience is less than remarkable. We had a complaint and when we pointed out to the manager we had a comped room at the Rio we could go to if they could not resolve the issue, the front desk manager said she would be happy to cancel the balance of our reservation. Interesting approach and we did ultimately go to the Rio and it was way better.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, aesthetically-pleasing room”
Reviews.Author: tarepandasary
Reviews.Content: The room was gorgeous and the beds were unbelievably comfortable. The hotel's music-themed decor was cute as well. Had a fun time and the cocktail waitresses were friendly. I would definitely consider Hard Rock Hotel again when I return to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “We had fun. The HRH towers were GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: JordanRex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Las Vegas to catch a couple of shows at the Joint located at the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas. We had read plenty of less-than-positive reviews here and were worried that we may have chosen the wrong place. After our stay, I am convinced that people who have a good time don't usually write reviews, whereas people who don't have a good time and have an ax to grind, will... So here is my review... We arrived at the HRH towers (about a $7.00 cab ride w/o tip from the Airport) at about 12:00 in the afternoon. The place was beautiful and the rock-n-roll memorabilia was very cool. The look and feel of the HRH lobby was a little like a "hip" funeral parlor with dark furnishings and monuments to musicians and performers who are playing in that venue beyond this life nowadays. The smell of lilies was prevalent and I found out later on that this pleasant smell was the result of the industrial air-cleaners they use for the facility. When checking in , the line was short and the clerk pleasant. He was ready to check us in early even though check in wasn't supposed to be available for several hours. When asked if we would have a "high-floor", the clerk responded that the only rooms ready for check in were on the third floor. We declined and asked for a higher floor, away from the elevator and ice machines. He informed us that he would try his best and that if we would provide our cell phone numbers we could explore or have lunch and he would have someone call us when a room that suited our wishes was ready. I joked with him that I had read reviews from folks where this did not happen. He said that although, it propbably wouldn't be him calling, someone would call. About 1/2 hour later, as my wife and I enjoyed a wonderful lunch at the adjacent Hard Rock Cafe, he called to tell us the room was ready. The suite was exactly what we had specified. It was on the 11th floor, overlooking the pool, with a wonderful view of downtown, and a partial view of the strip, about 1/2 mile away. It was away from the elevator and ice machines and was immaculate. There were floor to ceiling windows overlooking the infamous rehab pool. A convenient "shelf" ran about midway on the windows and provided a nice place to stand and rest a drink as the surroundings were taken in. I was prepared for the master light switches in the bathroom and at the door which controlled whole groups of lights within the room. If you stay here, don't miss these switches and think your lights are broken, they aren't. As for the decor and furnishings of the room, they were outstanding. We were greeted by some incredible framed photos of popular performers and musicians as well as Las Vegas area scenes. (A HUGE photo of ZZ Top front man Billy Gibbons next to his 1950's era Cadillac outside of a Texas duster radio station was AWESOME) A wet bar with a sink and some storage space was available along with the mini-bar fridge and tray. BEWARE: This is one of those setups that will bill instantly if you if you pick an item up off the tray, or take an item from the minibar. And don't think you can use the minibar as a makeshift fridge, they are quite clear that you will be billed for cleaning if you do this. This was a bit aggravating as I am a diabetic and need refrigeration to keep my meds cool. Room fridges were available for a daily fee of $20. -A little unreasonable in my opinion for someplace so nice to (A) not have a fridge in the room available for guests, and (B) charge such a high rate for the use of one. The 5-day stay would have cost $100 for this. We checked online and the local Wal-Mart had mini-fridges available for about $80. Instead of going this route, we opted to buy a cheap $30 cooler from the 24-hour CVS located across the street from the Hotel. As for entertainment in the room. there were (2)-42-inch LCD televisions, one on each side of the room divider that separated the bed area from the living room area. One of the TV's had a sound bar underneath that was connected to an iPod dock built into the wall of the suite with a touch screen that was apparently supposed to control the iPod, but did not seem to work fully. Now this is not to say the docking station didn't work, it did and the sound was great. It was the touch screen that was less than fully functional. The iPod could still be controlled and operated using its onboard screen. The one thing I would say is that it would have been nice to have an input jack for something other than an iPod branded player or device. There was also a DVD player in the living area. Plenty of storage space for clothing and other items if you want to unpack. (No signs of any bugs, bed or otherwise) The bed itself was VERY comfortable. My wife and I are particular about this sort of thing and were not disappointed. It would have been great to have pillows that were not goose down though. My wife is allergic and this was a little problematic. The bathroom was enormous with a walk-in shower and a large 2-person tub. One wall of the bathroom was tinted glass with a curtain that could be pulled for additional privacy. There were his and hers vanities with sinks for each person. One complaint was that the light in the water closet took a bit of time to heat up and provide light. Trips to the head could be a little dim at times. Also, be careful if you are testing the water temperature with your hand as the water head on the tub will immediately redirect all of the water into a channel around the tub and onto the bathroom floor if you are not. As for the casino and restaurants, we only tried Lucky’s 24/7 and The Pink Taco. Luckys 24/7 was reasonably priced, had great diner-style fare and quick friendly service. I would definitely choose this as a daily breakfast or late-night stop for food. The Pink Tack on the other hand was the low-point of this review of the Hotel. My wife and I showed up for lunch around 1:30 in the afternoon and were greeted by loud bumping rap music. I don’t have a problem with this, but it was a little odd in a restaurant that is decorated in the style of and serves fare that is traditional at a Mexican restaurant. Although there were many empty tables near the windows which overlooked the pool area, the hostess attempted to seat us in a crowded row of tables at the back of the establishment, under hot decorative lights, within inches of other patrons, and sharing a common bench that ran along the back wall. When we asked to be seated near the windows, we were informed that there were no tables available there and that we would have to wait about 10-minutes for one to be cleaned. I was surprised as there were plenty of clean, empty tables, although they appeared to be for about 4-6 people. My suspicion is they wanted to save those tables for larger parties and preferred to keep couples in the back under the hot lights where a single waitress could hit many tables without much legwork. After about 15 minutes of waiting, our hostess seated us at a small table near the windows next to a building column that was literally the width of our table and THAT COMPLETELY BLOCKED our view of the patio and pool area. (THANKS! –NOT!!!!) The food itself was not great and the service from our waitress, was pitiful. She took our order and checked back once BEFORE we were served by someone else and then, we didn’t see her again until we flagged one of the other waitresses, and asked here to find our lady so we could get our check and leave. We never got refills for our drinks, even though there were about 9 wait persons that I saw standing around and conversing with each other most of the time. Please keep in mind there were only about 20-tables in the whole place. I usually tip at least 20%. She got 0%, nothing….Nada…… This place evidently survives on the racy name and merchandise sales, because the food, ambiance, and service SUCKED. The casino was fun although I wish they had more $5.00 blackjack table to keep the pain level of losing down a bit. The Joint was great and we had fun at the shows as well. In spite of the bad experience at the Pink Taco, I would stay again and would definitely put in a good recommendation for the place. IF we go back to Vegas soon, HRH Suite towers will be high on our list.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Megnolia07
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a Hard Rock location in Florida before, so I figured this place would be just as good. Sadly mistaken. The hotel doesn't tell you that they expect a deposit in the amount of the room/night. And the deposit has to be put on a credit card. The staff wasn't very friendly. I understand the room locations can vary, but the room I was give was right by the elevators and I could hear them all night. The sink and the bathtub both clogged when using them. They do have great restaurants within the hotel. However, when coming back from a dinner with family, the night atmosphere was a little different. There were women dancing on pools in the mail casino lobby. It was also the same night at the Miss American pageant (I believe that one was held in Vegas). I wouldn't recommend staying here with children. One last thing to add, it's at the end of the strip and about a block away. If you want to be where all the main events are, I suggests find a hotel on Las Vegas Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced. Great Pool. Nice casino atmosphere. Good crowd.”
Reviews.Author: PDX-PDX-PDX-PDX
Reviews.Content: Went with some friends for the weekend and stayed here on recommendation from a friend from Vegas...mostly for the scene. Booking the room for 2 is cheaper than for 4 even though we got no hassles having 4 in the room we paid for 2. The downside is they only give you 2 keys and keys get you free stuff like the Rehab party. Room: Poor, especially for the price. Big room with two queen beds. Supposedly was a "pool view" room but being on the second floor we had a view of a roof and just a bit of the pool. Nice modern decor but they don't clean very well...dusty on the desk, bathroom was clean but not spotless. There were no amenities (no soap/shampoo/etc.). We called for some but they never showed. Light bulb in the bathroom was burnt out. They did replace that while we were out. One day they didn't clean the room even by 5pm. We called for them to clean it which they did but left a bunch of cleaning supplies in the room. The room was always too warm. Even wit the AC fully cranked it was never cool. This is Vegas. Not a good show for such a hotel. Bed: Awesome. Very comfortable. Nice linens. Pool: Awesome. Great scene. There are two. The Rehab pool was mostly full of meatheads. To get in you had to get patted down and go through security. Even on a Saturday they charged for chair....completely ridiculous. The West Beach pool had free chairs and was a better scene in my opinion. Lots of bachelorette and bacherlor party groups having a good time without being obnoxious. Also some families with kids which may be why things didn't get too crazy. Service was Ok but not great. Drinks were expensive but you could get a bucket of six 16oz beers for $25 which isn't too bad and perfect for sitting out in the sun enjoying the "view". The pool itself was great temperature and nice sandy bottom but that led it to getting murky at times. The parts without sand seemed clean. Casino: Great. Small by Vegas standards but always plenty of room at the tables. Good younger crowd with few of the overweight, smoking tourists in motorized Rascals like on the strip. The music in the casino was great; good selection at a good volume. Seemed to be sufficient $5 blackjack tables even on a Saturday night. Restaurants: Ate at Pink Taco for dinner one night. Good food. Decent prices. Good service. Also ate at Mr. Lucky's for breakfast. A bit overpriced but good size portions. Service was hit or miss there. Vanity Night Club: Night Clubs are not my scene so take my review with a grain of salt. It was a bit difficult to get in. Even though there weren't too many people in the club they made us wait in line with the velvet ropes while tough guys in cheap suits and ear pieces hassled us. Then a nice lady let us pass. Then more hassles by more tough guys and velvet ropes. We had some passes and used the room key that got us all in for free. DJ was good. Music at a good volume. Lots of people having a good time. I don't know the cost of drinks because I was not buying. Wasn't too crowded although we left before midnight so maybe it picks up. Location: Far off the strip. Walkable, but it's a long way. About $10 by cab. Not much else around there. A few restaurants in strip malls, CVS across the street (you can get booze and cigs there), otherwise nothing much around. Overall, too expensive for what you get. There is a good feel to it in the casino and the pool. I suppose the club wasn't too bad if you're into that thing. But the expense for the room and the distance from anything else makes it not worth it. The room was pitiful...dirty, no amenities, fake "pool view", no temperature control. Next time I won't stay at the Hard Rock...might visit but won't stay unless it's cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel and budget friendly”
Reviews.Author: SueRichter
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel and Casino in Vegas is awesome. If you search for specials you can get a room as low as $39/night. The pool, Rehab, is maybe one of the most rockin pools in Vegas (during the day). The restaurants are great including Nobu, Pink Taco, and Johnny Smalls. They have other restaurants but those are the only ones I've tried...all VERY good. I wouldn't bring kids here. It's an adult style hotel...pool dancers at night...party scene... but if you're ready to let your inner rocker out - come on down!!! Everyone from check-in to pool service is super nice. I'm going back for round three!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel a few down sides”
Reviews.Author: D-What
Reviews.Content: Upon check in the people were very nice. No problems checking in and we were quickly off to enjoy our first night in Vegas. Friday morning we got up to get a good spot at the pool. Servers are really bad at the pool. We had to chase them down. Saturday make it down to the pool to clam our seat only to be told they are $150. This was SATURDAY not ReHab Sunday! Had lunch at the Pink Taco. Worst service in the world. I'm talking bad! Took 30 minutes to get our bill. My friends wanted to walk on the tab everyone was so mad. Met some friends at Ago that night and the service there was amazing! The rooms at the hotel are actually really nice! The beds are fabulous! Ameneties nice. They don't have coffee in the room which is a little odd but smart. Why wouldn't they want a hungover person to go through the casino to get coffee. Well played Hard Rock. All in all it was a good hotel. It was a wild girls trip so the party atmosphere was great. The decor in the rooms was so well done. Our room was one of the cheapest and still so well thought out. All in all great place to party and super comfy to sleep in too!

Reviews.Title: “So so”
Reviews.Author: Lovacation
Reviews.Content: I would recommend it to those who want to stay in the hotel n enjoy the pool,it rocks! Rooms are huge! But location is a bit far from strip.. Shuttle avail hourly with accommondation of max 7paxes only.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vibe - Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wdejulio
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel and Casino has the best vibe in Vegas. If you are there to get crazy at the pool or just looking to be treated like a "Rock Star", this is the place for you. I was there for business and was happy to come back to the energy of the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Hottest Women”
Reviews.Author: St28
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock continues to be one of the best overall hotels for comfort, fun and value. Their rooms are consistently below the strip average while providing just as much as any strip hotel, many times even more. Both room towers are excellent, but it’s recommended that you always pick for a pool view room. The first reason is obvious, so you can wake up and see all the reasons people come to Vegas, the amazing women. Second reason, if you don’t pick a pool view, you can end up facing the airport and unless you like watching and hearing jets all day and night, it’s not recommended. For me the pool at Hard Rock is still the best in Vegas, even surpassing all the new entries into the market. I guess old habits die hard because I have been to every pool this year, multiple times, and Hard Rock is still the best place to people watch. The rooms remain top notch. The rooms are all done in a very contemporary meets hard rock type of look. Whoever designed the look did well. The beds are as good as everyone claims they are; you will have trouble getting out of it in the morning. The bathroom and shower are very hip. Women love the bathroom and sink area for getting ready while the shower is one of the largest stand-up showers I have seen in Vegas. The showers with their large stone walls and glass wall makes you feel like you’re in a spa. The only down side is the resort fee at $18 per night. You don’t learn about that until you check in or out and is usually not shown correctly on travel agent sites. Even though I hate these stupid fees, HR has made it worthwhile, something many other hotels in Vegas seem to miss. For the $18 per night, you get access to the hotel gym and most impressive, wireless high-speed internet. I have yet to find another resort casino in Vegas that offers both for that price, usually its only one or the other or neither. That being said, Hard Rock is still Five Stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, party place, off the strip”
Reviews.Author: neuromd
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere and younger crowd. I love vegas and it was easy to get to the strip but still not the same with hard rock being off the strip. Pool was excellent but drinks pricey. We got a cabana one day which is "free" if you spend 400 bucks on drinks and food for the day. We had 6 people and spent more than that at 40 dollars a bucket of beer. Stayed in one of the newer tower suites, excellent room, everything was clean. Ate at pink taco, the italian restaurant, and the diner. The diner was the best we had the 4.99 steak and eggs which was offered I believe from midnight to 8 am. There is a 15 dollar per room per night resort fee, you get good music selection and wifi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “An ok stay”
Reviews.Author: NOMA1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the hardrock hotel in Vegas. It was the end of an amazing trip in the States. The hotel is big, as all the hotels in Las Vegas, and unfortunatelly as in many big hotels the serbices was not great. The rooms were big, clean and confortable, which is a plus. The best thing of the hotel was the pool area, it was like being in a mini theam park! Overall the experience was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and updated, best for singles, or young couples”
Reviews.Author: sunnsandseeker
Reviews.Content: My 21 yr old son and I visited the area and booked one of our nights here. Our room was clean, with two comfortable queen beds, and a large flat screen tv that my son admired. We had a view of the pool and strip, although we didn't spend much time in the room to enjoy it anyway. Most of our time was spent touring the town, but we did experience the pool area. Somehow, even in 115 degree heat the place felt cool and comfortable. The sparkling pool was clean and refreshing, although nothing makes a 40 something mom feel old faster than hanging out a pool full of beautiful young people, lol! The spa was relaxing, and enjoyable, and made my visit very pleasant. I would not go back myself, but my son visited again with his buddies after moving to the area for a short work assignment, and loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Tried it once and once was enough.”
Reviews.Author: GlennGrammer
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the older casino tower had a nice view of the pool area. Problem is you are slammed awake by the music being cranked at 9am, first off I'm on vacation why the heck would I want to be awake at 9am? and second who listens to music that loud that early? worst of all on a sunday night before we had to catch an early flight the nightclub had an open patio directly below our room, can't sleep at 2:30 am cause the music and noise is just banging. We found the service to be lackluster at best, on arrival with all our bags in tow we weren't even offered an open door from the "doormen" we had to fight the doors and bags ourselves. When we called to complain about the fee to use the pool on sundays the management staff was unhelpful. This hotel also has a higher then normal resort fee. It is far from the strip so add in the price of cabs and the resort fee and it is probably still cheaper to stay either on the strip or close to it. The rooms were clean and okay but you can tell it is an older structure.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: RacheyLeigh
Reviews.Content: what a great hotel! The staff were great and friendly, our room was HUGE!! and spotlessly clean, with great decoration and the beds are so so comfy i didnt ever want to get up. It's a short walk to the strip which is fine but just too hot to walk it most of the time! Great atmosphere in the restaurants and casinos, with a range of prices. The pool was my favourite for sure and it got crazy on 4th July weekend. Overall a great holiday and will definatly be visiting the Hard Rock Hotel as soon as i save my money up again!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: kylu90026
Reviews.Content: Great Check in Experience stayed in the HRH Suites Room was Clean Updated and Had a chill relaxed vibe feel I really Recommend this part of the hard rock Hotel And Yes this is the place to be if you love the pools and Eye candy worth every penney and for a room this size well worth the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE experience, worst service in Vegas, would never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Eugene_OregonJesbal
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing experience that almost destroyed our trip. We checked in and trying to get help with the bell service and were told it would be an hour. After hauling all of our things to our room, unloading our belongings, someone else was given a key to our room!! 10 drunk college kids came barging into our room, started using our toliet, we called the front desk and were told this was impossible, finally they sent security. We had to ask to be moved to another room, which we were told would be provided with help from bell service that again never came. We had to haul and pack up everything and move to another tower. My friend was crying she was so frustrated. Service was like this everywhere at our hotel, apathetic and rude. I have never experienced this in Vegas/ We had to wait an hour to get into a mediocre club, no water was served unless you paid $9 for a small bottled water, same at the pool! The pool chairs were non-existent. If you wanted a comfy chair you had to pay a minimum of a $150 dollars!! And we were guests! This is a party hotel, which is fine, but treating guests of the hotel like under-age teenagers when were were again, "guests" is so wrong. Don't stay here, it's not on the strip, the pool is not that great, the rooms are just like any other room in Vegas. never ever again!!

Reviews.Title: “one night was not enough”
Reviews.Author: AlohaTraveler317
Reviews.Content: Checked in at noon on Thursday and checked out at noon Friday -- was a great 24 hours. A young, high-energy crowd - everyone is about having a good time and enjoying themselves -- great pool, fun casino, fun dealers/bartenders. Las Vegas is all about having a great time with your friends/family and new friends and family -- they do it right. Checking a bag was awful -- one kid and a line that never ended. This resort has enough volume that they can provide addition help with guest needing the check their bags at the bell desk during peak hours -- this is BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE. A lot of people standing 40 minutes to check a bag -- Hard Rock is losing some money in the bars and casinos by having so many people stand and wait.

Reviews.Title: “Definetly not a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: kara0521
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the older part of the hotel. The hotel was very empty compared to the other hotels, which i called that were booked. I checked in at the front desk and the girl was rather unfriendly. They CHARGE AN EXTRA 20$ for pool access which was not disclosed when I booked the room. The room was dingy not anything spectacular. It seemed old and not reinovated. Overall i wouldn't recommend staying here, unless you are in your early 20's and there to party hard.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: Ile26
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paradise tower, nice but nothing out of this world. Very good pools though. The location is awful, far from the Strip. Like someone mentioned before is not as clean as you expect, and the worst thing is: Customer service is very poor! The girl at the Registration when I checked out was rude and VERY slow, she had someone before me to check in and looked like she had no idea what she was doing. I was there for nearly 20 minutes just to return my key, I missed my pick up to the airport and had to reschedule again. Also, I asked front desk for new glasses for my room, and it took them nearly an hour and a half to get them there, I had to go to the pharmacy nearby to get cups myself. The Casino is small and not very inviting. Not really worth it. They should be really paying attention to the attitude of their employees. I've already seen several comments about their lack of skills to provide a good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Pool first, ask questions later”
Reviews.Author: latrell1
Reviews.Content: Different hotels in Vegas have different niches. You go to the Palms if you want to party. You go to Circus Circus if you have kids. You go to Caesars Palace if you want to try and emulate The Hangover. You go to Hooters if you have no other choice. You go to the Hard Rock, for the sprawling pool and beach complex that stretches nearly the entire length of the property. Most of the hotel's rooms overlook one of the pool areas, so they know what the deal is. There's a lazy river, artificial beach, swim-up blackjack, and seemingly countless cabanas. Go during a weekday and tip the right person $20 and you can get wrangled into one of them, but there's plenty of places to sit. Drink service is great, too. The rest of the hotel is OK. There are three towers, with the Casino tower being the oldest. The HRH Suite tower is, as you might expect, a tower of suites. I stayed in the Paradise Tower, which is relatively new and felt like an above-average Vegas room. The only problem was that it's a pretty lengthy walk from the main entrance to the Paradise Tower -- about 5-7 minutes any time you want to go to your room. Beyond the pool, this really isn't a very big casino -- the main pit is one of the tiniest you'll see in Vegas, and even the secondary slots area by the HRH tower isn't all that big. The casino itself has just one cashier cage, totally not visible from the main pit, and they stick a dumb name on it ("The Bank", also the name of a Bellagio club) to make it even more obnoxious to deal with. Service wasn't all that great. Girl at registration began processing my checkin before looking at the clock and realizing that she "had to leave", sending me back into line. I came up to my room while housekeeping was cleaning it and the woman was happy to let me into the room to grab things without asking for any proof that I was actually the person who was staying in the room. Room service at 2 AM answered the phone by saying it was in excess of an hour wait and that I should probably just go to the (admittedly very good) coffee shop. The other problem here is that this hotel is not on the strip. It has some advantages as a result -- you're a block away from a big 24-hour CVS, and the cab to the airport is among the cheapest in the city -- but you've just about gotta take a cab if you want to go anywhere on the strip, and you're not going to want to take multiple cabs to and from this place a day. If you're looking for a place with a great pool, this (or Mandalay) is where you want to be. If the pool really isn't of any consequence to you, you're probably better off going somewhere on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Party hotel, a bit rough round the edges.”
Reviews.Author: cjstott
Reviews.Content: If you want to come and party this is a great place to be. As we visited for my birthday we paid extra for a deluxe suite. This was in the old part of the hotel with a view of the pool. We arrived on Sunday with pumping music for the rehab party. If this is not your scene then avoid! The room was a good size. Sheets were clean, but the room could have been cleaner - but nothing gross. No tea and coffee facilities and despite the room having a wet bar it didn't have anything more than the standard 2 glasses. It's cool to have the rock memorabilia about the place. The casino is small but plays rock music which is cool. Yes there are resort fees, we knew about this before we arrived, but not really justified in my opinion for anywhere in Vegas. If you are young and want to party then this is a cool place to be. If you come for the rock chique you might be a bit disappointed and better staying on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Diriest Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtraveler29
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here! The hotel was so raunchy and dirty. Definitely not what was expected. This place of business neglects the rooms they rent out and they are not worth a fraction of what they rent them for. A complete waste of money! Front desk has no customer service skills and refuses to accept any responsibility for their badly maintained rooms and property. The ugliest hotel I have ever been in.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is trash”
Reviews.Author: kingo904
Reviews.Content: To start when I went to check in they tried to give me 1 room to sleep 4 people, when in fact i booked 2 rooms. Well when I tried to inform the front desk lady about the mishap she told me it wasn't their policy to help that I would have to call my travel agency and figure it out myself. This left me in a lil bit of a shock, i mean she wasn't even willing to help give me a solution or anything she told me "figure" it out myself. The rooms were pretty nice and nice size but weren't very clean but i was over trying to deal with this staff so i just went downstairs to gamble. As far as gambling goes at this place its pretty lame no excitement and non of the staff no where anything is its just a big mess, the pit bosses and dealers don't get excited for you if you win they actually seemed pissed off.Another thing that I need to add before i forget the Rehab pool is nasty as a toilet, and anyone that works there thinks that they are something special and that there nasty pools are supposed to impress anyone, also be ready for a cavaty search just to go to the pool.... I also noticed that nobody opens doors for you when you walk in to the hotel which isnt that big of a deal but most of the higher end casinos that ive stayed at do that for you. Seriously this is the worst hotel/casino staff ive ever in my life had to deal with. If you want to stay at a nice and good place for about the same price stick to the Wynn/Encore or Venetian/Pallazo.I say it again WORST STAFF EVER. STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: jcraft26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the HRH for a three-day business conference. I'd never been to Las Vegas and didn't know what to expect. HRH was very accommodating to the business traveler (and the food that was catered to the event was super yummy!). And during breaks and evenings, the HRH provided comfort and entertainment. I loved looking at the rock artifacts, and it was great to listen to the music everywhere we went. Most of all, our room and view were amazing... I felt like a rock start every time I crawled into that cozy bed!! The shops were overpriced for my taste, but there was a good selection of eats to suit most tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Hard rock was a bust!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fh904
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I have stayed at the Hard-rock before (Miami) and had a great time. However the Hard rock in Las Vegas was in no way comparable. Our trip started off with check-in (The new HRH towers) when we were greeted by a nice looking chick with a not so nice personality. We had booked two suites yet she keeps insisting that we only booked one. After about 25 minutes of calling the travel agency she called us up and admitted she had made a mistake. So we forget about because we are all just happy to get to the rooms. So we all change and head to the casino floor. We started throwing some chips on the roulette table and blackjack for a while and the dealers where all nice but not willing to help out much as they do at most casino's I have been to. They maybe had 1 or 2 cocktail waitresses on the entire casino floor so good luck getting more than 1 drink an hour. I thought the entire staff had a very nonchalant attitude which pissed me off because on vacation you expect some costumer service. The rooms were nice in the HRH towers, however NOTHING WORKS!!! The ipod player was broken, none of the lights worked like they should, and most of the lights in the front room were out. This was the case in BOTH the rooms we got. The highlight of the hotel was the pool. Rehab was great (little crowded) with a $100 min f&b order to even sit in a simple pool chair, but it was nice. They also have a new pool that was actually really nice and quite that has chairs to sit in for free so that was good. The food in the HR was ok, The Pink Taco had a good happy hour and the food was pretty good. Mr. Luckys was the 24 hour variety restaurant, the food and price here was good just be prepared to wait along time on your food. I will be staying on the strip next time.

Reviews.Title: “had some issues”
Reviews.Author: jim3355
Reviews.Content: hotel was nice but....a few issues...lovely pool area but the pool was so ice cold nobody could swim if i am paying a resort fee i want the pool heated 90 degrees outside and pool too cold to swim,,,also when entering pool bag searched and they refused entry with a tin of mints......i love to walk so a 20 minute walk to the strip seemed great to me but it's really not a nice or interesting walk..hotel has a shuttle to strip but it stops at 5pm so why bother.....at 4AM hotel staff was banging on my door demanding to come in and check smoke detector that was setting off alarm at their security desk...false alarm.. figured they would offer a drink voucher or something for the inconvenience but nothing.....

Reviews.Title: “Partylikearockstar!!!”
Reviews.Author: ReneeGietzen
Reviews.Content: Staff is amazingly attentive, the beds are more comfy than ANYWHERE else (and that's important if you only get a little sleep!) pool drinks (the lava flow) are pricey but very generously sized and really good! Food is excellent, the HRH suites are so impressive! Every friend I convince to come with me always thinks I've made the best choice and chooses to return to the HR the next time they go to Vegas! It's the best place to come and go from!you'll be happy if you stay and if you go, you'll be glad to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Great for 20's/30's crowd”
Reviews.Author: OldDaveinLA
Reviews.Content: Took 24-year old daughter & her boyfriend for weekend including Rehab on Sunday; perfect for them, although they didn't know any of the rock stars on the walls and I did. Rooms are no longer as good as some of the newer casinos, though clearly evidence of continued modernizing. Main thing about it is whether you're in 20s or 60s it has a great hard rock atmosphere that none of the others do. For some reason, at other casinos its just loud noise, but at Hard Rock its music. I'm in my 60s and love Wynn and Bellagio, but I always go to Hard Rock to gamble every time I'm in Vegas, and usually stay there twice a year, too.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service, probably wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Aimeebroman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel from June 15th to June 17th 2011. My husband and I joined 9 other people for a bachelor/ bachelorette party combo. The party planner had reserved and paid for 3 of the 4 rooms several months ago for the same price each. We stayed in the Paradise tower on the side facing the strip. Our room was clean and I like the decorations. However, when I opened the window I saw we had a terrible view. We looked out onto the top and side of another building and and dirt lot. (see picture below). When laying in bed all that could be seen out the window was the side of another building. Later that night I noticed that there was water on the floor in the bathroom. At first I thought maybe someone had recently cleaned the shower and it was left over from that. But then the puddle kept getting bigger and bigger. The toilet was leaking pretty bad from the bottom. We had to meet friends for dinner so I tried to speak with staff at the front desk but there was a long line and we were in a hurry. The next morning my husband called the front desk to tell them about the toilet and ask if we could switch rooms to one with a better view. The person answering was rude and put the blame on us for not calling right away when we checked in. He explained that we were in a hurry and didn't notice that the wet floor was from the toilet. They said the rooms on the other side of the hotel were more expensive and that we'd have to pay to upgrade. 2 of the 4 rooms our group booked had great views of the pool and we all paid the same. We declined to switch but asked that someone fix our toilet. Soon after a man came to fix our toilet and we left for a little while to hang by the pool. I came back at 1 PM and there was a pile of dirty toilet water soaked towels on the floor with the old toilet gasket and numerous rubber gloves. I thought he was still working on it so I left. Meanwhile, my friend who had booked our room, went to the front desk to ask why we couldn’t switch rooms. They told her we could switch to a room on the same side of the hotel higher in the tower. They said they needed to clean the new room and they would call my cell phone as soon as it was ready. I waited another couple hours and nobody called. I went back up to my room at 4 PM and the dirty towels were still on my floor along with all the garbage that was used to fix the toilet. I put the “Please tidy up” sign on my door and left again. When I came back at 5:30 my room was cleaned up. I never did get a call from the desk telling me a new room was ready. I felt like everyone had a different story and nobody quite knew what was going on. In the end, I did get credited the resort fee for both days, so I was happy with that. The pool was also very nice. There is a large sandy beach, hot tub and a water slide in the pool area. I must say that everyone else in our group didn't have any problems, it just seemed like our little problems could have been so easily fixed with a friendly attitude and good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to party and for R & R”
Reviews.Author: denverchick101
Reviews.Content: My friend and I, both mothers, had not been to vegas since before we had our children three years ago. It was the first vacation either of us have had without our kids so we wanted to make sure we planned our trip well. We stayed at the HRH in one of the towers for three nights over the weekend. We got in late Friday and relaxed in our room. It was quite and the beds are awesome and inviting. Saturday morning we went to the gym and found it accomodating. We were also told that the gym has a spa (complete with steam room in it) free to use but didn't take advantage of it because we had appts at Relinquary spa later that day. It is something we will keep in mind for next time. We went to the pool sat and found it had the perfect mix of a relaxing/fun atmosphere. Met some nice people. I will say this, we found the HR has a lot of different kinds of people and everyone is friendly! Never did we feel intimidated. That's an added bonus when traveling! Saturday afternoon we went to the Relinquary Spa. The staff is very friendly and attentive. The steam room was the best steam room I have been to, in my opinion. It is darker and has little light that shine up from the floor, creating a relaxing environment that makes you feel like yoou are drifting among stars. The steam was a perfect amount and perfect temp. The dry sauna and jaccuzi were smaller but still nice. The co-ed jaccuzi was gorgeous but could be warmer. Our services were not remarkeable though. We had the pear scrub/wrap and neither of us felt the scrubs were substantial. I think some of it had to do with the limitations of product the masseuses were allowed to use. As an individual with an MBA, I understand cutting costs, but for 130 for the service, we expected more. One valuable tip is that if you get a players card (its free) then you get 10% off your service. We went to Rehab on Sunday. It was awesome! If you are a guest and go in through the smaller beach pool, it is free. We we're there from about 1 to 6 pm and never had a dull minute. Beware, though, people do pee in that pool. I didn't think anyone would do that, but we found out yes they do! Might want to grab a place on the side of the pool instead of in it. Our whole stay never had a problem with noise and were able to relax in our rooms. Checking out was awesome too! We did not know that the front desk can check you in at the airport and print out boarding tickets! But the nice lady at the front desk walked us through it and I would highly recomend it. As 30 somethhing women we will definately go back because we found the rooms awesome, the staff nice, and had a great time. Btw a tip we tried and worked... we had the cab take us to the nearby vons on our way from the airport and picked up some alcohol. We saved money and had more money to spend on dinners and shows.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Brilliant rooms, moments from the best of the strip, lovely pool!”
Reviews.Author: ScottJM
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. We stayed here for the night before checking into the Bellagio - but we could have stayed here quite happily. The hotel is not on the strip, but it really doesn't matter. It's moments away from the main part of the strip in a taxi at night and they run a complimentary shuttle during the day to get you there. The casino, bars, pools, clubs and more in the Hard Rock are good enough to stay there all night if you chose to anyway. The rooms are fantastic. Clean, new, funky and well decorated. I loved this place and would happily stay there again - especially when I think about the deal I got compared to hotels that charge more, just for being on the strip. I'd save far more by being here and enjoy it just as much. Top marks Hard Rock. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this place- can't wait to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: MJISALIVE
Reviews.Content: I thought I would hate staying at the HRH since it's off the strip, but the place was so great it didn't even matter. the energy and atmosphere is amazing, its like a non-stop party. Good music playing throughout the hotel property ALL the time. NOT RECOMMENDED FOR FAMS WITH SMALL KIDS location: although not on the strip you can easily get a taxi to anywhere and we even walked to caesar's palace (wouldn't recommend walking at night if you are female or alone). being off the strip also meant less tourists walking through the casino pool: one of the best i've ever seen. rehab is very high energy and for the hard partyer- if that's not you, the other HRH pool is great too and more relaxing less crowded. the rooms: awesome, spacious, clean, new and modern looking, thick walls so u had privacy. Pink Taco= ate there almost everyday (go during happy hour to save $ on the drinks as they are expensive at normal price) Vanity= beautiful, fun, not too expensive either to my surprise! get to the door by 10/10:30 to beat the crowd staff was helpful and friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to the Hard Rock??”
Reviews.Author: MM2424
Reviews.Content: Wow, I have to agree with a lot of the other reviews on here....there are some serious customer service issues that need to be addressed. First off, the Hard Rock has always been my first choice in Vegas. Since 2002, I have stayed there 7 times. But this was my first time since the reno, and new buildings aside, the vibe was decidedly different. - We arrived on Sunday (at 10am) and received our Rehab wrist bands that were included in our room rate. - We walked out to the pool, put our bag (that was a bit lighter since our gum and Altoids had been confiscated by security) on a lounge and were promptly told that there was a $150 F/B minimum for each lounge chair. This was my 3rd Rehab visit and I have NEVER had to pay for a lounge chair. So we perched at the side of the pool for 4 hours, and then discovered the next day that there were FREE lounges at the new pool. And this speaks to the complete LACK of commuincation at the pool. If someone expresses their disinterest in paying for a lounge, they should be told about the free lounges at the other pool. It's just common courtesy! - Rehab "guests"- A lot of fist-pumping....which was entertaining at first, but started to get old after the 2nd hour. Everyone seemed well-behaved, but they were starting to get very sloppy by the time we left at 2:00pm. - Up ALL NIGHT listening to the night club that our beautiful corner suite overlooked. So glad I paid extra for the nicest room! - Resort fee: this didn't really bother me, because I've paid fees in Florida and Hawaii. But don't promise a shuttle as part of the fee, when it only runs on the hour and once it fills up (only holds 8) you're out of luck. - Thankfully, our stay did improve after Sunday....but I was disappointed that the pool music was hip hop/dance/R&B all week. I definitely miss the hard rock that used to play! Bottom line....my husband and I had always considered the Hard Rock to be our home away from home, and were immediately turned off by the "new rules."

Reviews.Title: “I guess paying for a Suite doesn't even warrant customer service!”
Reviews.Author: 2fourtea
Reviews.Content: Such a bummer, as we like the smaller feel of the main casino floor and the fact that there are no kids, but seriously...didn't anyone at HRH take a crash course in customer service?? You know you are in trouble when the 'concierge' AND front desk put you on hold EVERY time you call downstairs for a question. Most of the staff are dull and uninterested and don't bother getting someone to call you back if you have a problem. We had multiple things go missing from our room after we called to ask the front desk to check on a broken hinge in our room while we were at dinner. After 3 months of unanswered phone calls, I finally received a curt legal mumbo jumbo email from "Risk Management" saying they were not liable. How about sorry this happened, we can't bring your things back, but here's a free night's stay or something???? sheesh! After many years as loyal HRH guests I'm sorry to say we will NOT be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: 2fromTX
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Paradise Tower for two nights during the week and found it to be very modern and clean, reasonably priced, and a great option in Las Vegas for business travel becasue of the ability to be near the Strip but not in the middle of the traffic, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing daybed waitress”
Reviews.Author: jshook01
Reviews.Content: Went to the pool party on Saturday and decided to get a daybed. As you know daybeds can be very pricey but often worth it for a reserved spot and usually upbeat customer service. We had the worst customer service ever. Our daybed waitres, Megan, SUCKED! She was dull, slow, and seamed like she just didn't like her job. Whenever we are in Vegas we always get Table Service, Cabanas, and Daybeds. With the added cost you expect the customer service to be elevated. This was not the case at all. She had a backup guy helping us and he was really cool. Cant remember his name. He is a white dude with a shaved head and tattoos. He did a good job but your team is only as good as the slowest member. Im thinking they gave here a backup dude because they know she her customer service is subpar. The pool party is cool. Music was poppin. Everyone BUT OUR WAITRESS was really nice. She was so bad half of us stayed at the poolside craps table just to get away and get beers from the gambling service. But I won $500 playing craps!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hard Rock and will be back for more fun”
Reviews.Author: pozolegirl
Reviews.Content: great service all around. The food was great and had good bar service. Rooms are nice to. Really fun atmosphere, music selections are great. Every day felt like a party! Can't wait for my next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mslawik
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was great. We went to see Tiesto and the Joint. Brilliant concert!! Drinks were a bit pricey, but hey....it's Vegas!! We stayed on the 18th floor of the C tower. The view was fantastic. The pool was amazing and so was the casino. Everything was very clean and the service was great. Definetely would stay here again. Beautiful scenery inside and out:) !!

Reviews.Title: “THE best wedding ever!”
Reviews.Author: bnbsmall
Reviews.Content: My husband & I attended the wedding of our son's BFFs. I am 56 & in a wheelchair & my husband is 71. We had the best time as we knew what to expect before getting there. The staff was excellent & the music was a little loud but all great songs. We'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms in the tower but party reputation deserved”
Reviews.Author: Distant_Scott
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hrh towers. Have to say the rooms can't be faulted at all. Huge bed and bath. Showers were great as well. We turned up on Sunday at about 4pm, rehab had been closed down by the cops. Lucky we found the side entrance from the car park so didnt have to battle plastic Barbies and lil john wanna be's. Visited the pool once was the first and last time as I didn't want to have to hang out with drunk and faked tanned teenagers, im 26 bt most of these kids were idiots. There needs to be a specific pool for guests rather then letting in anyone that walks inn off the street. Getting to the strip was easy, maybe a ten buck taxi to the back of the MGM or we had no probs jumping in the shuttle though it could run a little more frequently. I know they don't want you to leave bt happy guests are going to spend more on gambling later on. Johnny smalls was great though should be opened all the time rather then just on the weekend. The pink taco was good value for money, food was really tasty and service was great. Gaming floor was nice bt found the service and variety of games better at the bigger casinos. Pretty dissapointed in the cost of the internet being 15 per day per device considering we had paid to be in a top level room. All in all I was happy with my stay. Would recomened to my single mates looking to party the hell out of a weekend. Would say a no go for older couple or famalies.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: stick007
Reviews.Content: I've often gambled here and bought the requisite Hard Rock Las Vegas souvenirs, but I've never stayed here.....until now. All I have to say to myself about that is: Why the hell did I wait so long to do so? From the moment I arrived to the Reservations counter to the time I checked out, I've never had such a smooth and comfortable stay. The desk clerk (who's name I've forgotten so I hope she forgives me) was very friendly and courteous. She gave me a corner room in the Paradise Tower on the 16th floor and was greeted with the best view I've ever had in Vegas. The left hand floor to ceiling window showed the 3 HRH pools while the right hand side window showed the LV Strip in all its glory. Another plus is that there were fewer drunken idiots there than I thought there would be! I saw people of all ages there, including this cute couple in their 60's hanging out at Center Bar Thursday night watching the NBA game. I've read previous posts about how comfortable the beds are here and have to agree 100% with them. It's not the best I've ever slept in but it ranks up in my top 5. While there I ate at Mr Lucky's, which is a personal fav of mine in Vegas. For players club members, the $4.99 steak & egg Graveyard special and the $7.77 Steak & Shrimp Gambler's special cannot be beat. (NOTE: They recently changed the hours for the Graveyard special from Midnight to Noon to Midnight to 8am). I also ate at Pink Taco which was pretty good but not spectacular. They have a pretty good happy hour special for 99 cents tacos and margaritas between 1-3pm and 9-11pm Monday through Thursday, I didn't get around to Johnny' Smalls for their AYCE Tapas but that is on my to do list for next time (NOTE: it's in the HRH Tower casino portion of the complex; I saw more than a few people walking down the corridor where the shops and some restaurants are looking for it). This brings me to the only "complaint" I have about this place. Anywhere you go inside a LV Casino, you see signs after signs directing you to restaurants, hotel towers, etc but none at the HRH. In the past, it was a pretty easy place to navigate since it was all in the round, so to speak but since the 2 expansions and renovations have doubled the size of it all, it would be a good idea to have better directions to give customers and guests on where to go (the property map they give you upon check in is good but really, how often is it looked at after you first get to your room and head out?). Overall, I had a wonderful stay and look forward to staying there again in September for my birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the 30's crowd”
Reviews.Author: LorrieNC
Reviews.Content: Love the music, We stayed 6 days at the Hard Rock. The main issue that I did have with it, we did stay on a smoking floor because other friends were on the floor. The min we got off the elevator Casino Tower floor 8, it stunk like pot. When we returned to our room that evening, someone was passed out on the couch, vomit everywhere. I'm not in my 20's anymore, grew up a long time ago, but didn't expect to see some of that on the first day being there. The rooms were nice and clean and the housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful. The water in the shower was luke-warm. Friendliest place in the Casino was the Tattoo shop which is where I got my first ever tattoo. The tattoo artist Mike was awesome and he caters to whimps. The casino area needs more waitress or they set it up that way to save themselves money, don't know which. I was playing slots saw the waitress, got a drink and almost an hour later saw her again. I personally will go to another hotel the next time I visit Vegas, while the music was from my generation the crowd isn't. Young 20's and to much drama. We did not go to the pool because we had heard from friends that they were groped just wanting to take a swim. When inexperienced men who have no real back-ground in security/law enforcement touch's a female inapproapriately, its a law-suit pending.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!! looking fwd to coming back and recommending it as the place to stay to all we know!!”
Reviews.Author: YIMIY
Reviews.Content: loved it!! looking fwd to coming back and recommending it as the place to stay to all we know!this was our 2nd time staying here. the 1st time was incredible! the 2nd time just blew us away! the new tower suites are amazing. the food was great,room service as well as the pink taco and mr. luckysthe place is filled with great music nostalgia.you could spend hours just walking through the hotel and checking it all out!

Reviews.Title: “One Great stay, one Horrible. Will not be back.”
Reviews.Author: MaxHouston_Tx
Reviews.Content: We had visited in Januaryin HRH, and in June in the Casino tower. One great trip, one horrible. We will not go back! The great: Santana, Beach Club Pool, HRH Tower and Ago. The good: Pink Taco, Dealers and front desk staff. The HORRIBLE: Housekeeping in the casino tower, casino hosts and less than full disclosure on promotion deals. The housekeeping, filthy hallways and elevators. Vomit in elevator Friday morning on way down, still there 90 minutes later after breakfast. Watched housekeeping person and supervisor, with trolley and garbage bin, stand next to and walk past trash on the floor and not pick it up. Casino Hosts, couldn't care less. Asked them why some terms were not on the info they sent me and was told, "legally we can not put that in writting, but you should have been told when you made the reservation" I was not, nor did the hostess in the VIP room care. Rock star hosts told us things that contradicted what was on their own materials."you need to register at least 30 minutes prior to the drawing", Your brochure says 10 minutes", "Oh, OK, but now it is too late.... we shut down the registrations. We went to relax, not to argue....... Some very nice people, but too many indifferent ones to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but be aware of the resort fee”
Reviews.Author: Rach_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights during our visit around the west coast. The hotel is located off the strip but having stayed in vegas before we was aware of the location. If you are driving it is only a few minutes drive from the strip and valet or self parking is available at the hotel and is included in the resort fee ($18 a day plus tax). Check in was easy and there was no queue when we arrive which was around 3 pm on a friday. Our room was on the 10th floor and was immaculate. It was a nice size with a king size bed which was really comfy. There was a double wardrobe which contained a safe and iron/ironing board . There was a mini bar in the room but is charged on a weight basis so if you do not want to be charged for anything don't touch it. The bathroom was smaller that other hotel bathrooms we have had in Vegas in the past and looked a little more worn that the bedroom but again was clean. It was quieter in the room that I expected although we were woken up a few times in the night by shouting/singing/banging. We were not aware when booking this hotel that there was a resort fee of $18 a day plus tax so calculate this in if you are planning on staying here.
