The fee did include valet parking/wifi internet/pool/gym and a shuttle bus which ran to the strip but only ran until 6pm so no good if you wanted to visit at night. We have stayed at other hotels in Vegas on the strip before (Planet Hollywood and Luxor) and have never been charged a resort fee. Our visit to the hotel included a weekend . If you want a quiet relaxing stay do not stay at this hotel. There are 3 pools at the hotel, two which were very boisterous and one which was classed as a quiet pool. Being in our 30's we felt a little past rehab so opted to visit the quieter pool. We were at the pool early so were able to get a sunbed but if you got to the pool after 10.30 it was impossible to get a bed. People were sitting on the floor around the edge of the pool and up against walls. You had to be id before entering the pool area and also patted down. A little over the top to sit around a pool and a little intimidating. Security were also walking around the pool area all day and had a real attitude towards us but seemed to turn a blind eye to others drinking and dropping beer in the pool. It seemed if you were willing to pay you could act however you wanted. Drinks around the pool area were also very expensive. From what we understand if you wanted to go to rehab you had to pay to get in and also pay for a bed. Our last day at the hotel was a Monday and was a lot quieter. There was no id on the door to the pool etc. although as we sat around the pool the security came round and wanted to give us wrist band to prove we were old enough to drink but never even check our id to confirm this!!! We also explained to him that we had been at the hotel for four day and had not yet been given a wrist band before. When returning to our room one day with a box of 12 beers we were stopped at the lift by security to check we were staying at the hotel. After showing our room card the security guy asked us if we were aware of the alchol limit in the room of no more than 12 bottles of beer. Again the security seemed to have a real attitude and again turing a blind eye to how drunk everyone at the hotel was and how they were acting as long as it was purchased at the hotel. One day when walking to a restaurant just down from the hotel we saw two guys come from the hotel that were so drunk they stopped 3 lanes of traffic and was lying in the middle of the road!! If we visit Las Vegas again we will not be staying at the Hard Rock Hotel, the hotel seem to charge more that strip prices (accomodation, drinks, food etc) for a hotel that is not on the strip. Planet Hollywood was a much better option.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best scene in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A52979
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. It was my third time staying there, and it did not disappoint. The rooms are some of the best in Vegas, especially the HRH Tower. The pool is nice, clean and safe. The music playing all the time is also enjoyable. Great room service and poolside dining options too.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel for the younger crowd”
Reviews.Author: g10betr0tter
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Supreme Double Queen Suite at the HRH Tower. The HRH tower has a seperate check in desk, which was difficult to find, especially with luggage in tow. The room was very large, with a separate bedroom. The beds were plush and comfortable. The bathroom was separated by a glass wall, where you had to pull a curtain over the glass if you wanted any privacy. The hotel seems to be geared more toward a younger crowd. The hotel's main attraction was the HUGE pool areas. Although the hotel has shuttle service to the strip, it was pretty incovenient all around. Would probably stay in a hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas a go go”
Reviews.Author: c0nanthelibrarian
Reviews.Content: If noise is your thing, here it is plus poker machines to burn. It's OK when one likes the music and artist, but after a while one is chased back to the hotel room for a bit of relief. The proximity to airport means opening windows brings in jet noises. The rooms are well appointed, restaurants tasty, displays interesting and in-house concerts good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but next time will stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: detroitgolf1
Reviews.Content: I arrived to an upscale room with great amenities. The bathroom was spotless and the beds were great. I only wish that I was staying closer to the strip. I would not recommend staying here if you are over 30.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs at Hard Rock Hotel Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: xoxo2118
Reviews.Content: I just stayed in May 2011, I woke up the 2nd day with bites all over my legs. The 4th day, had bites all over my neck. I stayed in the Paradise Tower. I only know these are bed bug bites because I was attacked years ago in New York. These things are blood suckers and extremely hard to get rid of now that DDT is banned. They are an epidemic all over the country now and if you bring them home it will cost you thousands of dollars to get rid of, not to mention your sanity! and will turn your life upside down trying to get rid of them. You may never even see one, but they feed on you about every week. They are disgusting and creepy. DON'T STAY AT HARD ROCK HOTEL VEGAS!!! BTW, they just deny that they even have a problem with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: tmc88
Reviews.Content: The beds in the hard rock were so comfy! Rooms were just what we were after. A little bit away from the strip but only a ten minute walk or they do offer free shuttles. Service was great. One of the guys that worked on the door/taxi was amazing! I cant remember his name - but he was so friendly and welcoming and made our stay very enjoyable. The only downside would be there is no free wifi. But this is no biggie. Overall an awesome experience at the hard rock! We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Grea place for a break in Las Vegas just off the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: Will46
Reviews.Content: Very good room nad the second time I've stayed there. May be a little noisy in the casino for non rock music fans but fantastic place to stay and gamble. Helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: AlphaKev
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas for a bachelor party and found a great deal through the hotel itself for 2 nights including bottle service (1 bottle) for 4 people included in the room rate. The room was more than enough and it was very clean. The restaurants were always busy but the waits were short and the service was great. We had a great time and the overall atmosphere was energetic. Don't know if it's the most kid friendly hotel and it is a little off the strip. I would definitely stay here again with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hote - Las Vegas - Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Girlpuke
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for three nights in April 2011, It was a great place to stay, the rooms were very clean and tidy and the maid service was brilliant, after leaving every morning, we would come back to find a beautiful spotless room. The staff were wonderfully friendly and the greeting from the Valet's was fantastic, they were very helpful and fun and seemed to really enjoy their jobs. The hotel has a fantastic pool area, compeletly out of this world, whilst we did not swim, it was very inviting and I will certainly return one day to enjoy that luxury. The restaurnats and cafe's within the hotel were great, a dairy and and starbucks are also on hand. The casino was well spread out and the hotel was easy to navigate. I very much enjoy music and the walls are lined with music history and the music filling the hotel 24/7 was great. I highly recommend this hotel if you are in vegas for a good fun time, and enjoy every musical. A short walk flat ten minute walk to the strip, gives it a definate plus, it is just far enough away to avoid all the noise, if you are wanting time away from the hussle and bussle of the strip. Suzanne Wood (New Zealand)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a good price.”
Reviews.Author: Foodie4lifeiam
Reviews.Content: We decided to book a room in the new tower at the hard rock. We both loved the the room, great modern decor, good mini bar selection, good view of the pool. The tower is by a restaurant 'Johnny Smalls' which is convenient. Friendly employees..would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite pool in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: L1a4u4r0a
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week, and absolutely loved it! I was hesitant because of it being off the strip, but got such a good deal I decided it was worth it. My favorite part about the hotel is the pool. The pool is amazing. I've stayed and MGM and Mandalay Bay before, and this one is my favorite. We went to the Sunday Rehab party, which was a blast. Also went to Relax Mondays. I highly suggest staying here if you like pool parties and will be staying on a Sunday. Funny thing about rehab, is it is the best looking people I have ever seen in one place. The staff was all very friendly, and they had a shuttle to the strip that ran till 5pm, so we took the 5 pm shuttle everyday and then took a cab or walked back later on. Its about a 10 dollar cab ride. A lot of people only want to stay on the strip, so here is my opinion about it, It totally depends on what you like to do in Vegas. If you like the do the pool thing everyday and only go to the strip at night, just consider it an addition to the rate. The cabs are very convenient, and they are always lined up waiting for people. Also, this is so close to the airport it is only an 8 dollar cab ride, so don't waste your time and money on those shuttles. The walk to the strip is under a mile, so sometimes we just walked. The food specials at Mr Lucky's were perfect for after a late night of drinking, it saved me from hangovers the next day! Pink Taco had 99 cent taco and margarita specials during certain time, and the margaritas were really really good! In all I had an awesome time, I would definitely stay at the Hard Rock again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the Jersey Shore West”
Reviews.Author: DFW_Foodie
Reviews.Content: I would avoid this hotel if you are over 22 and have any class. If you are into guys walking around wasted, bumping into you, and shirtless gambling, this might be your place. For disclosure, we did not stay there. We were going to Nobu for an expensive dinner and left. Better choices for ambience in Vegas. We did stay for a drink, and the service was poor, along with the taxi valet, who was an idiot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but extra mandatory resort charges and a bit off the strip”
Reviews.Author: TheCraigs1984
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had requested a non-smoking city view suite in the HRH tower of this hotel. On arrival we were advised that we would have to take a smoking room or the night and be moved in the morning. Not great! Queues were always long at the HRH tower reception desk. Beware that a mandatory resort fee is added to your bill of $16.80 per day. The shuttle service to the strip is poor as it only runs every hour until 5pm and can only take the first 8 people. Otherwise you can walk (which is difficult given the hot temperatures) or get a taxi which will cost $7-8 one way. The suite were were given was spacious and nicely decorated. No room in the tower faces directly on to the strip so the view is limited. There was a long queue to get into the pool area (on a Friday morning) and even guests have to show ID and have a bag search as you are not even allowed to take in your own bottle of water. Shortage of sun loungers in the pool area as large areas are reserved for people willing to pay extra. Overall you can get better value for money in another hotel located on the strip or one that provides a proper free shuttle service to the strip like the Hampton Inn Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock - Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: KiwiGirl022
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just recently return from our trip to America, while in Las Vegas we stayed at the Hard Rock Casino and Hotel, amazing hotel, nice room and great pool area, The staff were friendly. The Hard Rock is located off the strip and is an easy 10 minute walk, the hotel dose have a shuttle that runs from 10.00am – 5.00pm and will drop you at the Fashion Show Mall half way along the strip. The 10 minute walk was not much of a problem for my sister and I but if you are there in Spring/Summer it can be a very hot walk even first thing in the morning. There is a Starbucks and a small 7/11 type store within the hotel along with four other eating places. If you love all things Rock n Roll you will love the décor of this hotel and the music that plays 24/7. Great Hotel! Rachel (New Zealand)

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel--The Staff was so freindly”
Reviews.Author: Gregbh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 15th floor of the Paradise Tower. The beds were so very comfortable. All the people we ran into working there, from the bellhops to the Front Desk were very happy, and the response time was very quick. I had read so many reviews that slammed the hotel that I was a bit concerned, but after being there for just a few minutes, I felt welcomed. I would recommend to anyone to go there again. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Should have stayed here sooner!”
Reviews.Author: Chrispmoto
Reviews.Content: After years of going to Vegas with our young son, we left him at home and stayed at the Hard Rock. What a treat. From the time we parked at the Valet untill the time we left, we absolutely loved it. The service was great, the room was spectacular, we even ate their at least 4 times and had great meals everytime. It was the Supercross weekend, and all the racers stayed there so that was cool seeing them all over the hotel. The gym was really good, and we shopped there a bit too. I really have a hard time comprehending all the bad reviews from some people. They obviously had a bad experience somewhere on their trip and try blaming it on the hotel. We had no bad issues. Well, the only complaint would be that the slots seemed a little tight, and the waitresses were non existent when it was busy. But that seems to be Vegas in general. Thats it, EVERYTHING else was AWESOME. Would stay here again FOR SURE. Maybe it is a few blocks from the strip, but we always rent a car and it was super easy to get to everything we wanted from the HR location. We are in our early 40's and seemed to fit right in.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to Stay & Gamble”
Reviews.Author: imakedeals
Reviews.Content: I would defintly stay here again the employee's are great the dealers are really cool and the enviorment is great .

Reviews.Title: “If I felt like getting a pat down, I would have stayed at the airport”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustinwithsun
Reviews.Content: Man, what a scene.. and not the good kind of scene. I'm in my late twenties and came here for my bachelorette party. There were some god things about this hotel and there were some pretty crappy ones. The good: Our room was spacious and quiet, the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was great. Loved the flat screen. Cleaning staff and room service were some of the nicest people at the hotel. The bad: The pool scene. Uhmm.. w.t.f. They took away our gum, made a friend throw out her metal water bottle and tried to confiscate my other friend's inhaler. We were wearing swim suites and they gave us pat downs. Honestly, I'm too old and was waaay to sober for that kind of treatment. The music was atrocious -- loud rap blasting all day. When I'm relaxing by the pool, the last thing I want to hear is how fiddy shot some ... . Finally, the room service food was beyond sub par. I ordered soup and I am 100% certain they just dumped a can of progresso in a bowl for me. So, I think this place is great if you are 21 and are wasted out of your mind. Otherwise, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place If You Are In Your 20s or Feel Like You're in Your 20s”
Reviews.Author: VisitorFromWI
Reviews.Content: I was just at the HRH for a business conference. This was my 3rd trip to Vegas in the last 9 months - twice for business and once for a family vacation. I actually liked the HRH more than I thought I would and I am in no way in my 20s. Got early check in on a Saturday with a room in the Paradise Tower. Room was clean and decorated in blacks and grays. Went down to the Rehab pool and have to say it is easier to get on a plane than to get into the pool. Security is very tight. The party was going on and the staff at the Beach club are great. But on Sunday, the Rehab pool is very, very wild. If you are in your 20s and want to party, this is the place. I relaxed at one of the other pools and their pools are nice but not as big or good as those found at Mandalay Bay. Also, they should call this place the Hard Rap Hotel on the weekends because that's all the music they play. During the week, the hotel was more to my liking. The rock n roll memorabilia is interesting, the hotel staff is very helpful, room service is prompt, maid service is excellent and the eating places are good and they actually play rock and roll music all the time throughout the hotel. But the main drawback of this place is the location -- it is simply too far away from The Strip. You have to cab it to The Strip which adds up but if that is not a problem, then the HRH should be considered. And this is not a family hotel where I would bring kids. Out of the 3 places that I have stayed at before - TheHotel and Mandalay Bay is great for families, The Venetian is a very adult oriented place if you are not in your 20s anymore but not that old. And the HRH is the place to be if you are in your 20s or young at heart.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat customer, but was dissapointed this time”
Reviews.Author: rdkell
Reviews.Content: I travel to Las Vegas about 4 times a year on business for conventions and maybe 3 or 4 times for leisure and am usually there about 4-5 days at a time. I've been staying almost exclusively at the Hard Rock for a couple of years. I've liked the off-strip setting, lack of kids, & the lack of tourist crowds looking to take pictures of everything. My wife and I shot over for the weekend to get away and hang out at the pool. Everything this time was just mediocre. The room was in paradise tower and they charged me for a corner room (not a suite) even though the check-in agent said she'd waive that fee. On the first afternoon I called and asked for more towels, because the shower door leaks. They never showed up. For some reason on the 2nd day the water stopped getting hot, it would just get luke warm. I actually mentioned that happened to me a few weeks ago here when I checked in, and now the same thing in a different room? The Rehab pool party was a mess. First security told us to go use a different entrance as hotel guests. We walked across the hotel and at that door more security told us it was closed and to go back, and they did it with more attitude than the TSA. We get back to door one and 8 staff members are all standing around arguing about "where they've sent hotel guests" and if they have admission. I like Rehab, but seriously how long have you been doing this? It was like this was the first time in history they've tried this. Then the worst part is the male security they have patting down women in SWIM SUITS! I told the guy no way, that he needs to get a lady if he's feeling up my wife. So we had to wait 5 minutes. Meanwhile he actually runs his hand in the top of my boardshorts to the point that he was almost touching my crotch! Absolutely ridiculous. I can walk into Vanity (their club) wearing a jacket with enough room to hide twin .45's if I want to, but I have to almost get fingered wearing board shorts? Why are they more scared of people bringing weapons, etc. into Rehab than any other place in the hotel? I was pretty upset. My wife calmed me down and we had an OK time. The next morning I slip on the leaked water outside the shower and slam my forearm into the door frame. Got a nice tennis ball sized bruise. We were planning to check out on Monday but wanted to stay an extra day. Instead of staying at the Hard Rock we did a Hotwire and got a room for about $90 at Aria and left. I will say that this is the first time I've had a really bad experience here. The last time the water thing was a mess, but this is the first time I was actually upset. So I might give them another shot, it's just that so much was wrong. Even the bartenders and dealers don't seem upbeat or cool anymore. But even if I do go back, they've already got me looking elsewhere. The $90 I paid for that night at the Aria was a WAY better value than what i was paying at Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Still my favorite place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MsAlpineLass
Reviews.Content: We split our stay between HRH and Mandalay Bay; we ended up regretting not staying at the Hard Rock the whole weekend, as we've done in years past. The staff at the HR are top notch, unlike at Mandalay where they are not very polite and we overheard several of them complaining about their jobs. The beds/rooms are great, the vibe/energy is fabulous, and again, the way the staff treated us made us feel like princesses. Not everyone is made for the big, giant hotel. We like the size of the Hard Rock, which like Goldilocks said, was just right for us. Also, no kids running around; definitely an adult venue.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: ccwakimoto
Reviews.Content: I live only an hour away from Las Vegas and stay in Las Vegas at least once a month. This trip I stayed with Hard Rock in there new all suite HRH tower. It was amazing! The HRH tower has it's own valet entrance, these fuys were so helpful and offered a wonderful first impression. The bell service was very fast, we did not have to wait an hour for our bags. The front desk was conveniently located just inside the door. Very courteous front desk. The suites in the HRH were wonderful. There were many "party" groups on our floor and I felt we might not get any sleep. The suites were so quiet! Fabulous beds and linens. We ate in a couple of venues but our favorite was Johhny Smalls, tapas type food. If you like to party, they have a fabulous pool. If you would like to relax, their spa is incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: zafian
Reviews.Content: The hard rock treated us right. We went out of our way to find a non kid friendly experience and the hard rock was it. The hard rock upgraded us and the room was incredible. Suite overlooking the pool. Staff was friendly and helpful. Everyone should try eating at Nobu. One of my best meals ever. Pool was nice, no kids screaming. The hotel is not a monster that takes 30 min to walk from one end to the other. Great place, will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for bachelor party”
Reviews.Author: np206100
Reviews.Content: At first I was worried about not staying on the strip but I ended up enjoying this hotel. Pros: -The rehab pool was open but not for the big rehab party, the pool is huge, beautiful, well attended ;) and not too terribly expensive for drinks -The casino wasn't full of annoying slot machine noise, you could hear the rock music instead of the ding ding ding of the slots -No strollers or oxygen tanks in the hotel/casino, seemed to be all young people looking for a good time -Several food options in the hotel and not outrageously priced -Rooms were very nice and clean, bathroom was perfect -I'm not into night clubs but if you are Vanity seemed like the place to be -I won a lot of money at the blackjack table!!!!!! Cons: -Have to take a taxi (or I guess there was a shuttle) to go to the strip but it wasnt far -The bathroom door was glass and there was a gap between the wall facing the toilet and it was kind of awkward using the toilet when anyone in the room could see you -The resort fee was annoying (just raise the price) -Our room wasnt ready the first night but they put us in a smaller room and gave us extra money -The poker room was poorly attended -Internet fee was expensive but whatever, you are in Vegas dont spend your time on the computer, drink, play, gamble! Great place for a bachelor party if you want to hang out with other young people looking for fun!

Reviews.Title: “Jersey Shore Meets Vegas”
Reviews.Author: redshoegirl
Reviews.Content: Felt like we walked into an episode of Jersey Shore. Even the non-"Rehab" pool had trancedance music blaring so loudly that it was hard to relax. "Hard Rock" music would have been better -- and expected. Our hotels.com room had a beautiful view of a rooftop, lights, HVAC systems, and garbage. Not pretty. Everyone else staying there was about 21, walked around and acted like they walked out of a Jersey Shore party. Our waiter at Pink Taco was like this...he basically left us alone, someone else delivered food and after that, no one checked on us! We had to go to front counter to pay our bill. Have never left a $0 tip until that day. Hotel is closer to airport, but not very soundproof. Loud people walking up and down hallways all night, planes in the morning. Don't stay here if you want a good night's sleep: go to Aria. :) We left site and walked somewhere else for dinner so as to avoid the J.S. rush. Definitely visit the casino for an hour during the day -- the memorabilia is cool

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: redneon98
Reviews.Content: We booked through a third party website and got a great rate for a one night hotel stay. For the cost of the room the stay was GREAT! The room was large, the beds were very comfortable, the bathroom was large and the staff that we encountered were friendly. Of course we spent one night there and moved on to a Grand Canyon adventure. If you are looking for a crazy Vegas experience you might want to stay somewhere closer to the strip. The hotel is not too far from the strip, but its definately takes a short walk to get to all the action in Vegas. But for us it was a Great value for what we needed and I were to return to Vegas I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great choice outside the stip”
Reviews.Author: gatototo
Reviews.Content: I have always loved this hotel because it's not in the middle of the crowds. Since it was renewed and expanded, it has lost a bit of its coziness, but I still prefere it to some huge megahotel on the strip. The new rooms are modern but you can no longer open the window and face the pool or the beautiful mountains,. They constructed 2 towers that cover the pool making it difficult to catch the sun. The front desk service IS TERRIBLE. Worse than that. Slow even if there are only 2 peopel waiting. Uncourtous. etc... I still like it but not as before. If you are looking for something similiar, try the Hyatt Place right in front of them.

Reviews.Title: “Better places to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Wuntyme
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel to stay at as the rooms are quite big and comfortable but there are better hotels closer to the strip than the hard rock. The hotel is quite small and has extra charges like the resort fee which includes the gym and pool but in March the pool is not an option and the Gym is never an option unless you go to Vegas to workout. Also the cost of calls from the room is crazy and the staff are generally hopeless. Do yourself a favour and book somewhere on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “wow now thats a party”
Reviews.Author: rooster0777
Reviews.Content: Went on a guys trip. The purpouse was get drunk gamble and hang out at the pool. DONE DONE DONE. The pool was a crazy party, service was always there, and the eye cany was everywhere. will enjoy staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't book your stay at a better hotel in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: EttaColeman
Reviews.Content: Amazing, spectacular, and perfect! Thank you for always making my stay an unforgettable experience!

Reviews.Title: “LOVING THE HARD ROCK HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: shaybug14
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights at the Hard Rock Hotel for our daughters wedding. I was really impressed by the service we received at this hotel. We have three daughters, the youngest is eleven. There is a separate pool for minors, which is awesome. My daughter got married Sat. nite at Viva Las Vegas, which I highly recommend to anyone, they do a great job. After the wedding, we came back and had dinner at the Pink Taco Restaurant at the Hard Rock Hotel. It was a really good meal and a fun time, and the service was superb. We stayed in the casino tower, and the rooms are nice and the beds are comfy. Will definitely go back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice, feels cheap. Representatives need more training”
Reviews.Author: gattaca714
Reviews.Content: Went in the week of 4/22/11 and stayed at the HRH hotel. I encountered the following problems: 1) The air conditioning unit keep making clicking noises, it kept me up all night. I called for an engineer and they came. The diagnosis was that the pipe was too close to the drywall. So I call to get a room change. The front desk says, "Didn't I already upgrade you?" What does that have to do with anything, I got an "upgraded" room with a loud AC, a room where the bathroom light doesn't work, and no towels or shampoo in the room. With no "similar" rooms available, I had to stay there until something else opened up the next afternoon. I would have left if our friends weren't already staying there. 2) Went to go eat at Pink Taco Restaurant. We were there for 45 mins. The waitress didn't come once with refills, the beans were really bad, and to top it off we got the wrong bill. No tip for her. 3) Both beds I stayed in had bad beds. They were lumpy and sloped to one side. If your looking for a cheap room, then go for it. However, if you expect your room to be as nice and comfortable as your own bed then this isn't for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, extremely inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: brucenyc
Reviews.Content: I experienced both extreme highs and lows at the Hard Rock Hotel during my stay in April 2011. I spent part of my stay just with my girlfriend, and part with her and my 3 kids. On the positive side, the pools are excellent, great for both adults who want lots of eye candy as well as for kids who want to play in the water. I was surprised to see other people there with kids, but in many ways it is actually a kid-friendly place, without the kids ruining the coolness factor of the place. However, half of the pools including all of the hot tubs became 21 and over on Friday through the weekend, which is good for adults but not so good for the kids. Another negative is that it was impossible to get a pool chair whether we arrived at 10am or 2pm. So in my experience, if you actually want to stay at the pool, you need to pay a minimum of $150 for a poolside bed. That $150 is applied towards food and drinks. The food is reasonably priced and surprisingly good, the drinks are less reasonably priced ($42 for a bucket of 6 beers, $14 for a cocktail) but not outrageous for someone from NYC. The pool waitstaff was extremely attentive and friendly, although I had the feeling that they were under pressure to bring in as much revenue as possible. I spent about $400 over 2 days of lounging and using these couches. Apart from the cost of hanging out at the pool, all of these positives were negated by the unprecedented rudeness of one of the security staff. I don't want to exaggerate and criticize all of the security staff, because most of them seemed pleasant enough. But because my child was swimming in a pool that supposedly is not for children, although he had been swimming there for 2 days together with dozens of other kids and there was no sign saying "no children in this pool", I had to listen to one of the security staff insult me, criticize me, call me a liar, and in general communicate with me in all the worst ways that people in the hospitality business are not supposed to do. Even while he was regaling me, several kids were in the pool, and many more kids went into the pool while we were talking. I ended up speaking with his boss, who to his credit did all the right things in treating me like a guest rather than a criminal, and who also said that the other security guy was new and in training. But the experience definitely made me question whether I'd recommend the Hard Rock or return. Inconsistent service standards are really the same as no standards in my opinion. My advice to the Hard Rock is to either hire fewer moonlighting cops whose natural instinct is to confront rulebreakers as if they are crimiinals, or to train them better (or both). In summary: I'd suggest that parents with kids think twice about staying here, which is a shame since the pool really is great for kids. But perhaps parents with kids are not one of the desired customer groups for the Hard Rock anyway. Given the financial troubles of the hotel, I'd think they'd welcome people with money to spend, but ultimately I did not feel welcome due to the behavior of the security personnel. One last comment: my meal at Nobu was much better than I expected, definitely on par with the original Nobu in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Dano35
Reviews.Content: We visit Vegas 2-3 times a year and always stay here at the Hard Rock. We decided to mix it up this trip and try a deluxe suite in the casino tower. The suite was very nice and big (900 sq ft) and the doors open to the pool area(nice to have since we've been staying in HRH tower last few trips and kind of missed opening the doors for some fresh air!). Everything was great as usual, cocktail servers were friendly and fast with drinks and blackjack dealers were fun! Ate at Luckys and Pink Taco (always good food and service). We love the music and the vibe here, no other hotel really compares. Already looking forward to our next trip in Sept! Oh and not sure what scent is used in the hotel/casino but we love the smell of it!

Reviews.Title: “A HARD ROCKING time”
Reviews.Author: Wurz72
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the 15th April after a nightmare journey from the UK, picked the car up from the rental company and headed on over to the Hard Rock..What can I say? From the moment we pulled up to valet parking we knew we had made the right choice. Friendly attentive staff from the very get go. It only got better as we headed for check in, bags were taken from us by the bell hop and we walked up to the check in desk to be greeted by yet another smiling friendly face, a very very pretty one at that. Asked if there were any upgrades available, (we were supposed to be staying in the old part of the hotel) "one moment sir, I will see what I can do" sure enough we got upgraded to a corner view room in the paradise tower. didn't even have to try the old "sandwich" trick. Room was amazing with a view of the mountains and the rehab pool, and even part of the south strip. What can I say about the beds? well imagine jumping onto the largest softest marshmallow you can think of and you are still no where near. I need to find out where to buy one, it was simply the most comfortable bed I or my partner had ever slept on. Called down for the bags and they were in the room within minutes. The bathroom was huge with a very decent walk in wet room, water pressure was good as well for a room on the 14th floor, and like the room was spotlessly clean. Headed down to the casino to again be greeted by friendly and knowledgeable dealers and very very attentive cocktail waitresses. One in particular stood out, Mary Ragg who took time to recommend shows and some of the hidden sights of Las Vegas to us, as well as keeping us in drinks and explaining what to do with slots. So if her bosses read this give the lady a raise. the pit bosses, the dealers, every member of staff we dealt with were excellent. I could go on but I feel I am rambling now. So don't believe the bad reviews and if you want a rocking place to party and love your music this is the place for you. WE WILL BE RETURNING. Thanks again HRH you made it a very very memorable stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Venue”
Reviews.Author: Kayakman2008
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to see Carlos Santana who was playing at The Joint in the Hard Rock. The hotel/casino was great! The service was excellent with professional and courteous staff. It's like a small city with shops, stores, restaurants and you can even get a tattoo. The Joint is a great, intimate venue to see a show, Santana was Great. The only negative was the room lighting. Lighting was poor in the rooms and no way to make it brighter.

Reviews.Title: “VERY disappointed with HRH suite”
Reviews.Author: Chelseawashere
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel multiple times. We have always stayed in the regular rooms and have found it to be a slightly above average hotel. For our anniversary this year, we decided to splurge and book a suite for four nights. We were sorely disappointed and would have been far better off in a regular room. Not only was the room nothing like the one pictured on the internet, it was just a regular sized room with a couch thrown in so they could call it a suite. I found the staff at check in to be a little rude, but they were very busy in the hotel, so I can kind of understand that attitude after dealing with drunks all day. The room had scuff marks all over the walls, dents and chips in the wood bed frame, and big stains all over the couch and ottoman. There is an in room music system that you can plug your I-pod into, which would be a great feature if it had worked. The lights in the bathroom were all controlled by a master switch that is located in the entry of the room. We were not told about this master switch at check-in so it took us a couple of days to discover it. We called for towels and glasses twice and both times we waited about two hours before we finally got tired of waiting and left. The shower has a regular head and a rain head, which again would have been great if they had worked. As it was, the rain shower head was completely broken and the regular shower head was so loose that it was about to pull off of the wall entirely. We looked inside the mini-bar fridge to see if there was room for our own items (there wasn’t) where we discovered a folded up piece of pizza that looked like it had been there for at least a month. The air conditioner was never able to cool the room down more than a few degrees and it made a loud knocking noise as it operated. All in all, for a room priced around $350 per night, we were NOT impressed. We will never make the mistake of staying at the Hard Rock Hotel again. You should take my advice and look for alternate accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “A cool vibed casino and HOT poolside”
Reviews.Author: jakncoke
Reviews.Content: I love the Hard rock hotel. Instead of walking into some oversized, badly carpeted casino, this place is so hip - great tunes, sleek bar in the circular center, yummy food served all night long and the best pool scene in the city. There is no reason to spend time in your room in Vegas - its all about the action and ambiance and Hard Rock has a great mix of both. Check out the pool party on Sundays called Rehab...exactly!

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time with my friends while celebrating a 40th Bday!”
Reviews.Author: BigO68
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the HRH Tower and the suite was great. Very clean and the beds were super comfortable complete with featherbead and really comfortable pillows. Bathroom huge and the tub could have held two but didn't need that this trip. The property itself is very clean and easy to navigate once you've done some exploring. The Blackjack dealers were great....very friendly and engaging and even waved to us when we were just passing. The pool complex is fantastic with lots of options as far as what kind of crowd to noise level you want. And if we're being honest I would pick another hotel if you have kids that want to be a t the pool....It's on the adult-oriented side with the music. We had a great time at the West Beach Club (sand pool)...The servers at the pool really hustle too and are very pretty and extremely courteous. They kept us "old guys" happy. All need this week to recover. Remenber that Rehab is not for everyone so make sure you have alternate plans if you're not ready to be engulfed by a party crowd....Opening day for Rehab on Sunday was very well managed even though the crowd was huge. Food was great as well...try Nobu. This is a resort tilted towrds a younger more vibrant crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Quite expensive for what it offers”
Reviews.Author: Dorfo
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel... BUT for the rate you can fin something better.... Room service was not good and I've seen many other places around where internet was free... Quite far from strip too, so you always need to get a taxi.... They also charge you extra tax for the use of the swimming pool...

Reviews.Title: “Hard rock, I hope its better this time around”
Reviews.Author: patrickofthe818
Reviews.Content: Last time I was at the Hard-rock was in October. I wasn't looking for anything to fancy as far as the room went when I booked my reservation. But when I got there they offered to upgrade me in the old tower to a 1 bedroom suite. I paid the difference and went to my suite. The lights did not work, the bathroom shower leaked, and the stereo system was a wall ornament. Even after I called in numerous times to have it fixed, they sent numerous people (which that alone was a nusuance) to have the issues handled but were not able to rectify the issues. That being said, I booked my trip for May 28-31 through a 3rd party site for the pool villa suite. I'm paying more than $2300 dollars for 3 nights, when you take into account that I get comped regular suites at the encore I'm second guessing this now. Anyway, after my first experience I really hope that I have what I was promised and that everything works (or they fix it once I call in that it doesn't work).

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool location is a bit to far off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Caltom67
Reviews.Content: Made my 1st trip to Las Vegas stayed at the Hard Rock got a nice upgrade to the HRH tower nice room called it a suite but putting a wall between the bed and sofa and putting a TV on each side does not make a hotel room into a suite. I had to wait over an hour to get into the room because "it take a long time to clean such a large suite" Also when they upgrade you have to check in at another area of the resort and if you have already given you car to the valet it is parked on the wrong side of the hotel. The hotel pool is was cool! as well.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: dirtdude41
Reviews.Content: We were talked into staying here by our travel agent and wish I had stayed with our original plan to stay at an older hotel right on the strip. We were going to stay at the Imperial Palace which is an older hotel right on the strip but, our agent talked us into staying at the Hard Rock stating it was much nicer and newer. Were yold that the hotel had shuttle service that ran from 8a.m-9p.m. everyday to the MGM. Well the fact is it runs from 10-5 and goes to the Fashion Mall on the other end of the strip and the shuttle was a chevrolet Suburban that only would hold 7 at max, whichwas always full. It sucked!!! If you couldn't get the last shuttle back to the hotel then you had to get a cab and that wasn't cheap. The buses were a great deal at $7 a day but once again only go up and down the strip mostly and the ones that get you to the hotel are hard to figure out. We walked our butts off which took alot of fun out of the trip as we refused to pay the outrageous cab fare. I don't know if we can say who we booked through but book-it steered us very wrong and we will pass that on to everyone!. The shows especially any of the Cirque are amazing!!!!. Also the resort fee that would have been waved on the strip was a joke at $16 dollars a day for them having a pool and spa which we never used once in fact we didn't even go near them. All in all we had a great time being the first time there once we spent 3 days figuring out where to go and how to get there. we will go back but will stay on the strip for sure next time!!!! Oh before I forget the Lucky 7 restaurant had some amazing deals on meals and they were pretty good too!! It was the best thing about the hotel to us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better then anticipated”
Reviews.Author: abbo1963
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms for our party during our stay 4/3 thru 4/8. All HRH suite tower rooms. We ranged in age from 21 to 50. Our room was a pool view on 12th floor. We loved our room great view of the pool and back of strip from PH to Strat. The living area was large enough for our party of 6 to gather for cocktails before heading out or at the end of the night. Beds are super comfy. there are separate controls for heat and ac for bedroom and living area.Plenty of storage with 2 closets and large dresser. Bathroom is huge and has all you need. Found the digital jukebox a great addition. No coffee maker so what most in vegas don't have one. Mini bar expensive as it is in all hotels. We found the restaurants to be exceptional. We dined at Johnny Smalls(20 bucks all you can eat) Rare120(1/2 off mondays), Ago very good some in our party did the price fixe pasta @12.99 with salad,entree and glass of wine and loved it. Luckys whats better then 5.99 steak and eggs. There is a coffee shop by paradise tower that we enjoyed over starbucks (had egg sandwich ,crepes,bagels etc.)Pink taco we did 99 cent lunch special which for 99 cents how can you complain. We did room service 1st night for a snack and it was quick and served hot. The pool area was beautiful but got limited use due to weather ,cool and windy.the prices at the pool are crazy but having stayed at mirage,encore,mandalay bay they are right in line with these resorts We found service at the bars to be awesome only having encountering one less then friendly tender(NCAA championship monday) Cocktail service was spotty at best The casino is small and could use a better variety and more slots. The most recent table game area only open on the weekend but the main area was never crowded and you could always find a seat. The staff at front desk,bell and valet were just great (Jay@bell and Gunz@velet really stood out(hooked us with limo driver for the week who did a great job at a fair price PM me if you need info) Great Great music always playing at the pool and in the casino Overall we would stay here again doing 3 nights strip or downtown and 2 nights here. Here are some basic answers to question i see on TA all the time . 16.80 resort fee stinks but lots of resorts have it(if it included internet then it would be a nice touch) On prepaid rooms 50.00 a day credit hold Front desk will print out your boarding passes no problem. If staying at Hotel you get into vanity on sunday night for free if thats your scene. Any Questions just PM me

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice, but missing basic comforts”
Reviews.Author: Lissa2882
Reviews.Content: The beds were very comfortable, the bathtub was huge, and the room was nicely decorated. There were certainly some poor points to this hotel, however, which were: ~there is no fan in the bathroom, which is bad if someone took a hot shower, or a smelly #2. ~two of our lamps were not in working order, which meant that it got very dark at night ~The water in the hotel, as well as the restaurants were disgusting. Hard water, for sure. ~The mini-fridge was unusable. It was stuffed full of bottles of overpriced things, so don't count on being able to refrigerate anything. We requested that they clean it out, and they refused. What a waste of space. ~No coffee maker, no microwave, no continental breakfast. ~The drawers of the dresser were badly made, and they were extremely hard to open. You had to lift one up to open the one underneath. ~Our bathroom sink was clogged and took a long time to drain, which is pretty gross when you are trying to brush your teeth. ~You aren't allowed to order a pizza and have it delivered to your room. In fact, you can't even have it delivered to the hotel at all. You have to go down and meet the pizza delivery people somewhere off the property. ~The place was dirty, and the floors were not well picked up. Used room service plates stayed in the hallway all night. I will say this, however. This is not the kind of hotel that you want to come to if you want to have a family-friendly experience. They are very nice, but the crowd is certainly tailored to the young and hip.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel charged 800 USD extra after we left”
Reviews.Author: casf_1988
Reviews.Content: My friends and I checked out for a three day stay. After getting back home I see I have an extra 800 USD charge which says "stolen BOSE radio". They said I stole a radio <Which by the way I never saw in the room> an charged for it one day after I had left. If I were to steal something, I would have stolen the TV or something else, not a radio which I never saw and had to pay. It was my first and last time at this hotel. I hope they enjoy my 800 USD!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to play but food and service were subpar.”
Reviews.Author: Mike_G_07726
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at the HRH last weekend (Sat.-Tues.). It's off the strip so it's not as congested but to get to the strip is always a production, even with the free shuttle. I've been to Vegas now 6 times but this hotel's food and service def. lacked in quality. I always enjoy the casino because I win but there def. was inconsistency with the dealers. With blackjack, I double downed and 1 dealer had my 3rd card face up. Later at another table, they insisted on putting the card face down. Shouldn't it be the same procedure no matter when or where you are? The smell of smoke was quite evident in the casino and in the rooms. The food was okay at most places but Nobu was def. the best, but it was pricey. Pink Taco was fun and affordable. We did not make it to 1/2 price night on Monday at Rare 120. The pools were great but again some (not all) of the staff were friendly. Some had attitudes when inquiring about a cabana or asking to bring a small bag to the pool. Drinks are def. pricey. Rehab was not open for another 2 weeks and I'm not sure why. If the pool is open and you have sun, drinks, and DJ music, why can't you have Rehab on Sunday? Def. a fun casino for a young crowd (prob. under 40). Def. a hike from the strip but if you like to be away from all the touristy stuff (fountains at Bellagio, volcano at Mirage, pirates at TI, etc.), then this place may be for you. I think we'll stay on the strip next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time!”
Reviews.Author: patty4645
Reviews.Content: My 24 year old daughter and I stayed 4 days (Paradise Tower). Fantastic room, fantastic view and super clean everywhere. Would recommend HRH to all my friends and would stay again. Pools were fantastic, Mr. Lucky's food specials were great, and staff were friendly. The beds were so comfortable! We loved the free purple shuttle to the mall. We loved the Hard Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Our vacation / friends wedding in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: rocker92
Reviews.Content: Arriving at holtel was great, on five mins. from airport. Check in was quick and easy. The first room was very nice if only the A/C worked! ( you would think that they would know it isnt workin) Room switch was a pain to do, but front desk took care of it quickly. We did not like the fact that snacks and things were on an electronic 45 second timer.( so that if you picked them up without reading the VERY SMALL note you would be charged for them) Also the fridge was packed with drinks( whitch was nice) but you could not move anything to put your own stuff in there. If you did you would be charged. Our room was very nice, beds were very comfortable and plush, and room had a gret view of the mountains. Airplanes were a little noisy at times intill they changed take off pattern. One waitress at restaurant down stairs was very rude, ( only to us, for some reason) but dinner food specials were great!! All casino employees/ waitresses were very nice except a small few. We never really gambled at a casino before and didnt really know all the rules, therfore we were belittled / scolded if we did the slighest thing wrong at the tables. Really turned us off from gambling the rest of the time we were at the hotel. Overall had a great stay and hotel was good.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock slowly turning into dreaded nickel dimer category.”
Reviews.Author: creep1974
Reviews.Content: Background - I've stayed here 20x (usually on gaming comps or partial comp), love to party, have a good job but not unlimited/inherited money, and come to vegas because I like sportsbetting, craps, roulette, sun, and some nightlife. The new sportsbook looks nice and has tons of bells and whistles. They must have paid for it by stiffing the bettors on drinks because there are no drink tix, not for horses, 500 a game bets, nothing. This sucks even more because beers are 6-7 and mixed drinks 10. I swear everything is up 25% or more. The room in the new tower was great, bed was fantastic. The problem with the hotel from a room perspective is the resort fee. it's 16 a day for literally NOTHING. No one uses the minivan to the strip. Not many people want to pay to use the gym. Also dont even breathe on the mini bar or 11$ waters will rack up exponentially. Ate at Mr luckys for bkfst every day and a glass of juice is 5-6$, other than that food was average to slightly above, service was very good. I'm sure you get the point by now. If you just wanna rage, black out, and spend 2 grand for 2 nights (before gambling) to do it....stay here. The local chicks are hot, and the tunes rock. If your looking for even the slighest break on anything or even remotely have a budget of any size stay somewhere else. The hard rock used to have an angle on the young hot party crowd and cool pool parties, now everywhere has that. everywhere. It's sad but i think the hard rock has priced a lot of the fun people and 'scenery' out of the equation as the hotel felt quite dead even during march madness. I hope they change back to when it was fun laid back and cool. Everyone in my group use dto love to come here.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great business trip!”
Reviews.Author: exnavy84
Reviews.Content: The hotel areas were all very clean and not smelling of smoke. Room was nice (get a higher floor) and the in-room stereo was awesome! Great playlist and made the time in room great. Hotel music in common areas was really good, outstanding playlist fitting of the Hard Rock name.

Reviews.Title: “This place surprised me...in a GOOD way”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a convention and wanted an off strip location, and I found an EXCELLENT deal for a King Corner Suite in the new HRH tower. If you get a deal on these rooms GRAB IT!! They gave me a room on the 15th floor with views of the strip, the airport and the pool. The room was amazing. Really well done, They also have a seperate check in area and entrance. Never had to wait more than 15 seconds for an elevator. This alone is a major accomplishment in Las Vegas, The pics on their web site actually don't do it justice. I would stay here again. And again. And again. Bed was huge and really comfortable, the bathroom was really big, two sinks a big walk in shower with two shower heads and a deep dish bath tub as well. Everything about the room was perfect. Service was always friendly and with a smile. You can tell they are trying really hard here. After reading many of the reviews about the bad attitudes I was pleasantly surprised. Also, I am well past my REHAB POOL PARTY days, so I was expecting a scene between Jersey Shore and Animal House, but the hotel was surpisingly quiet and serene. (I was there during the week, so maybe it's really rowdy on weekends) HOWEVER - This is my big rant...Sunday night, one of the night clubs was open late and the music could be heard all the way up on my 15th floor suite until 2:30. And I mean it was freakin loud. This is TOTALLY disrespectful to guests staying in the hotel. To me, it says that the nightclub guests are much more valuable to them than their hotel guests. (For this reason alone I will NEVER stay at this place on a weekend with a room facing the pool) I cannot believe they could not find a way to muffle that music from the hotel. The odd thing is that I could not even hear the maid service outside the room, the room was otherwise perfect. To be fair they did move me to the other side of the hotel when I mentioned this. Had an omelette in Lucky's 24/7 and it was really good and reasonably priced. Service was perfect. Had the same omelette through room service and the price tripled! Ahh you gottal love those mark ups. Anyhow, this place definitely exceeded my meager expectations My one other rant...When you check in here, there are no "lines" just kind of hang out in front of the desks and hope that you will be next. They need to fix that. Seriously, just put a rope out and make people line up. It won't be any less cool, and will stop people from spending 10 minutes wondering if they are next or not.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas in a Nutshell”
Reviews.Author: TheSuperSupervisor
Reviews.Content: Imbibed a lot on this trip! Couldn't really fault any aspect, Rooms were exactly what it says on the tin! Food Average enough, wasn't there long enough to explore it fully. Can imagine its a happening place when Spring Break is in full swing! Would prefer a spot on the Strip though.

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply one of the best rooms I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: bjc76
Reviews.Content: I recently had the utmost pleasure of staying in a Superior Queen suite in the Hard Rock Hotel Towers and if I ever won the Lotto I would decorate my place exactly how this suite was decorated. The room was simply luxurious and I loved every single thing about it, from in the in wall ipod dock, to the absolutely massive bathroom and the most beautiful and comfortable bed I've ever slept in. I've travelled around the world and stayed in some nice hotels, but this one takes the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: SB11334
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HRH. Everything at this hotel sucked except for the service at the tapas restaurant. Oh, and Starbucks and the valets were nice too. First of all, I called ahead and was told they would do something special to the room for my boyfriend's 30th birthday. The minute we got there we had problems. We arrived at 12:30PM and were told that a room would be ready for us "shortly" even though check-in time was 3PM. We gave them our phone number to call us as soon as it was ready. They never EVER called us and when we went back at 3PM to the desk the room was still not available. Finally, they gave us a room at 4:02PM (they told us this at check-out) and were told they would give us complimentary wifi. The room was very nice, except for the stained duvet cover. Oh, and nothing special for the birthday. We called housekeeping to replace the cover of the duvet and instead they brought us a new duvet and no cover. Which they just dumped on the bed and never came back. We went to Vanity night club in the HRH on Saturday. I put one drink on my credit card for $15 (wow) and a few days later my credit card was charged $138.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate comfort!”
Reviews.Author: Stushouse
Reviews.Content: Casino awesome, pool really awesome.....all I have to tell you is, after I got back home, I emailed the hotel right away to find out what the used on their beds! Best night sleep ever on the most comfortable bed ever!! Has become my home in Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “My awesome side's home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: ReneeGietzen
Reviews.Content: A minute off the strip, but so amazing I could spend my whole Vegas vacation there! They have everything. Best of all: the BEST customer service! Even when rowdy and tipsy I've been treated like a VIP. The beds are the best, I miss them when I go home to my bed no matter what mattress I buy! Even the other guests are fascinating! I meet amazing people of all types and ages. The casino is well ventilated (I get migraines if they aren't) the music is heaven! Room service rocks and the food is really good! The pool is everything from relaxing to off the hook (they cater to both!) I can't say enough good things about the Hard Rock in Vegas! My best stories I'll ever tell from Vegas happened there! It's converts even my cheapskate and skeptical friends. Now they can't stay elsewhere either! You only get so many vacations: DO THEM RIGHT!

Reviews.Title: “a quick business trip, but one WELL spent at the Hard Rock!!!”
Reviews.Author: All1Mind
Reviews.Content: Some quick advice if you are planning on visiting Las Vegas and want to experience Vegas, and feel confident in spending your money well. The Hard Rock Hotel and Casino was an AMAZING experience. Very clean at all times, really friendly and sexy staff, all welcoming with smiles. Helpful as they come, on every level, from advice for dinners, schedules and helping with any questions or concerns you may have. This staff, all around, is exceptional to say the least. I felt pampered and very happy with every aspect of service. If you've stayed at other hotels, you've definitely noticed the run down, dirty feeling of the casino floor and the plain rooms, that feel like a motel. The Hard Rock experience is the complete opposite, clean as a whistle at all times, no matter how busy the crowd, and the rooms are pristine. I am very picky about my choices of service and in my line of work, I deal with a lot of traveling and have many friends, co-workers and clients, and I can say with full confidence that every penny I spent was earned by the Hard Rock's full service and staff. It was an experience like no other and will continue to stand by my word and spend my hard earned money in a place that I know is worth it. There isn't many reason to leave the hotel, as much of what Vegas has to offer is right there within the hotel. The room I stayed in was not a suite, but it was amazing! Very comfortable beds, room set up and design is "rock star esq" to say the least, and the service is unmatched. Other hotels lack in many of the categories, Hard Rock earns it's reputation in every aspect. I highly suggest staying here on your future visits to Vegas whether it's a weekend get away, vacation or business. This place will satisfy your every need, effortlessly. Great job Hard Rock!! Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away.....Unless You're a Partying Twenty-Something...”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripFour
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend you read the reviews for this hotel before booking. I highly recommend you do not stay at this hotel even if tempted with a great rate. This hotel has a 'club' feel and is for a twenties clubbing crowd. Check-in was very awkward, and not easy to find parking, the hotel entrance, and where to check-in. It felt uncomrtable waking luggage through the casino to find the lobby. The hotel has a dirty feel to it, even though its been renovated - I stayed in the casino tower. The staff is not friendly or helpful, two examples, after check-in I was given a hap hazzard the elevators are over there on the otherside and I must have walked by the elevator hall 3x before finding, and called on a question on my bill and they acted like I was dumb and couldn't understand their deposit system, and I would have to come see them for an explanation (vs over the phone). It felt as though they were doing me a favor. I booked this hotel via hotwire (4-star in East Las Vegas), and got a decent rate for the time period I was here. Beware of Hotwire 4* in East Las Vegas. The bed was comfortable, and I slept okay. The hotel is filled with a smokey smell (the halls) and the smell does seep into the room a bit, but you get used to it. The internet for 24 hours is 14.00. All around, not a good place, not comfortable, no service, and would recommend you stay away. Better choices for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Time At The Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: MoneyMarkB
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I are in our late 20s. We enjoy our 2-3 Vegas trips a year and we had great time staying in a deluxe suite at the Hard Rock in the casino tower. We try to avoid heavy crowds so we went during the week. We basically just like to relax, drink, and gamble and the Hard Rock was perfect for all three. Greg at the Center Bar was extremely nice. We don't go to Vegas and stay in places expecting to get our butts kissed like a lot of reviews of the HRH emphasize here on TripAdvisor. Everything from the food, to the service was very exceptable. Pink Taco is good. Gambling kept us busy, but we didn't win anything. We are looking forward to our next stay in July and hope to enjoy a concert or indulge with a spa treatment. If you want to avoid rowdy crowds I suggest you book during a time when a major event is not going on if you want to avoid long lines, packed restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Full of energy! Definitely not a retirement home!”
Reviews.Author: imsuperthanks4asking
Reviews.Content: We are addicted to Vegas, and that is an understatement. Each season we return, the question arises, "where do we want to stay?" We've tried other big name hotels and usually end up regretting it and coming back to the Hard Rock because... well, it just suits us better. The other hotels offer the glitz and glam that is the "marketed" Vegas, but their energy just seems to be tame. Sure there's that new Aria right down the street, but I want to be energized be Zeplin, Deftones, Beastie Boys, and other members of the Rock and Roll hall of fame while I'm gaming. I'd kill myself if I was on a table, loosing my money while "We've Only Just Begun" by the Carpenters came on. Tell me listening to that isn't draining. We've found that the regular rooms are nice, clean, and can be quite loud during the weekends when something big is going down in Vegas, but since the new HRH Suites Tower has opened up, we throw down just a little more extra to upgrade to get one of these awesome suites. The bathroom is huge, tub separate from the walk in shower that can fit 4 people at the same time (if your'e into showering that way.) There's a TV in the bed room and another TV on the other side of the wall facing the living room/lobby/foyer. Yes you read right, your room has 2 TV's and a wall separates your bed from the foyer! On top of it all, the bed sheets and pillows are so fluffy and soft! Perfect for getting the much needed rest after a whole night of partying until 5 AM at Vanity! I know that this may be a nit-picky, but I love their Irons/commercial strength steamers. It definitely helps when you're crunched on time, can't decide what to wear, and all your clothes are embarrasingly wrinkled out of the luggage. The gaming experience is even better! On the weekend nights, there's a blackjack pit surrounding two platforms with two hot go-go dancers working the poles. If that's not distracting enough, your dealer is an attractive voluptous female wearing a great smile and a corset. If that's not enough to draw you to the tables, they've got staff offering massages while you play. Since the Hard Rock usually attacts a younger crowd, you'll come across those that may frustrate you because they don't play by the book. Uncle-up to them and make conversation to show them the way the books play or just go over towards one of the other tables that require a slightly higher dollar amount. Rookies usually stay away from those tables. On a Thursday night, the waitress never lets me see the bottom of my hot cocoa mug, they are THAT attentive. Dining here is great. It's no Cut or Craftsteak, but Rare 120 definitely leaves you satisfied for the money you pay. AGO is an awesome Tuscan Italian establishment that does ok on the meats, but does outstanding on the seafood. Listen to the waiter's wine recomendations for your dish and you won't regret it. They have never steered us wrong! And if you're looking for a midnight snack, Mr Lucky's is open 24/7. Ask for a gambler's special. It entails a 12oz steak, mashed potatoes, shrimp, and a side salad for $7.77. Can't go wrong with that. The staff is what creates the atmosphere for me. Most are friendly, alot are beautiful, and everyone is ready to have a small conversation about what ever with you, especially the gentleman that waves the cabs down for you, he's quite a talkative fellow. I've even had some of the staff invite us out to hang with them after their shift ends. But then again, I'll talk to and hang out with just about anybody. Just be open! The Joint is their concert hall. It's not the Mandalay Bay, but they have some Rock'n names that come through. We saw Godsmack last Halloween. Also, make sure to check out their Fantasy-Fetish Ball around that time. You can thank me later ; ) If you're looking to come to Vegas to relax with your family Circus Circus or the Wynn is a couple blocks down. But if you're looking for a place that will keep you young and rock'n, the Hard Rock is your home away from home! It's a little off the strip, but Vegas has alot more to offer than just the strip and here's a tip: Vegas is much more enjoyable and cheaper with a rental car. Hotwire usually has awesome deals on Vegas rentals.

Reviews.Title: “The HRH is much more intimate and exciting than the larger "circus" cosino/hotels on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: 770PTD
Reviews.Content: A fantastic experience. I stay there whenever travel to Vegas. Great Food, Great Music, Fantastic Casino and Services, and the Pool environment is a blast. Very easy to find other members of your party, unlike fighting your way through the mass hordes on the strip. But if you really feel the need to visit the strip, its' a very short and inexpensive cab ride away. The HRH really does "Rock"!

Reviews.Title: “Great vibe”
Reviews.Author: PaintedCanvas1975
Reviews.Content: We extended our trip and were originally going to stay at the Luxor but after 10 minutes in the room at the Luxor, we checked out and headed over to the Hard Rock. We stayed in the Casino/Paradise tower, which is the older section of the hotel. The room was nice, but the bathroom was extremely small. My wife and I both felt like that should have used more of the bedroom area to extend the bathroom a bit. We got massages at the new spa area in the HRH section and it was very nice. Tons of drinks and stuff to keep you busy if there is a wait. One note, bring your bathing suits because the Roman Bath area is awesome, but you need a suit to go in. We ate at the Pink Taco in the hotel, and the food was ok, but we sat outside, and it we nice to see the pool area. Next time we stay there, which we are looking forward to, we will book the HRH tower.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay, but I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LJGull
Reviews.Content: My wife sends me to Vegas for my birthday every year (she refuses to fly), I make it a point to stay at a different hotel every year. Last year, I stayed at The Hard Rock. The hotel itself, I would say, was average for a Las Vegas Strip hotel; not as nice as, say, Mandalay Bay or Caesars, but nicer than the likes of the Imperial Palace or Riviera. For a fair comparison, think along the lines of Bally's or Treasure Island. I had no problems with the staff, nor did they give me any reason to brag on them. My overall experience at The Hard Rock was, however, below average. Keep in mind, I'm a middle aged white guy who goes to Vegas to gamble, I'm not interested in any of the other entertainment options. They seem to cater to the twenty-something crowd; which is fine, if you're twenty something. But they never seemed to have enough table games open (unless you're willing to play at a $25+ table), and there weren't enough video poker machines available. As far as the location, it's several blocks away from The Strip. I'd recommend renting a car if you're going to stay here; even a short cab ride will cost you at least $10 (each way) and there's nothing really within walking distance. If you've been to Vegas before and visited The Hard Rock and you think it's a place you'd like to stay, I wouldn't try to steer you away from it. But if you're a first timer to Vegas or even if you've been there before but have never been to the Hard Rock, I'd suggest looking elsewhere. Considering the quality, price, and location of the hotel...you can do a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: lucin
Reviews.Content: while the upgrade to the HRH is beautiful and the expanded casino is nice there are a few flaws to this place. They only have one shuttle which seats 7 people leaving for the strip on the top of the hour. Cabs can run $10-$15 to the strip depending on where you are going, seems like they would have several shuttles available. The Pink Taco is a marvelous restaurant the food was top notch. Mr. Lucky's was overpriced for what you got, we had breakfast and it was very average however it was $15.99. the bacon was skinny not thick sliced (which I would expect for the price). The room was very nice but the big downfall was hearing the people in the hall and stairwell all night long. I expected this hotel to be pretty soundproof. I did enjoy the decor but there are alot of better places to stay in Vegas with better amenities and much quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Nascar Vegas 2011 staying at the Hard Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tornado88
Reviews.Content: Good adventure. Fantastic room and casino except major issues with getting internet access to work which did FINALLY get resolved. Slots a bit tight compared to last year but overall great time. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Young and looking for your perfect stay? Look no further.”
Reviews.Author: Vega777
Reviews.Content: A week ago I was a 24 year old student and soldier searching for a hotel that suited my needs for a vegas vacation. I wanted a party atmosphere, a great casino floor, a sleek and sexy room, a great staff, and a great pool. I found everything I needed in the Hard Rock. I'm becoming a veteran of the Vegas strip, having previously stayed in Caesar's, the Palms, Venetian, and the Golden Nugget (don't ever do that unless swimming in an aquarium and old people are things you value on vacations) and let me just say that the Hard Rock is by far my favorite. Every staff member I met on my trip was great; from the front desk to the dealers and cocktail waitresses. Everybody I talked to had an interesting story and was friendly. The staff seriously helps ramp up the atmosphere because if they aren't promoting the party, then they are buzz-kills and all the staff members helped me rock out. I actually felt depressed going into some of the other casinos and ordering drinks or gambling. Kudos to the personnel manager. As for my room, the paradise tower rooms are very sexy and surprisingly inexpensive. If you are young and want to look impressive on a budget, then boom. You are welcome. As for the nightlife, Vanity is one of the most phenomenal clubs in Vegas. Bottle service prices compare well with the other high-end clubs but Vanity is truly something that has to be experienced. If I go clubbing in Vegas, I want excellent bottle service at my table and beautiful people in the club. Vanity will continue to be a place I will visit when I come back. The only downside to the trip was that Rehab hadn't started yet but as a guest at the hard rock, free admission would have been provided. Rehab is the wildest, sexiest, must-visit pool party in Vegas so you might as well just book a room in the hard rock and save the cover money for bottle service at vanity.

Reviews.Title: “Never had a noisier room”
Reviews.Author: Waeswww
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the casino tower have interconnecting doors which allow any sound from the neighbours to come through! Everything couch or word could be heard. Imagine how I enjoyed the constant music of my neighbours, middle of the night homecoming with afterparty and subsequent puking. Do not accept a room in the casino tower!

Reviews.Title: “Great music, great energy, awesome staff and their suites rock!”
Reviews.Author: bckaufman
Reviews.Content: If possible, get a room in their new Tower Suites. TOTALLY worth the extra cash and you will absolutely love them!! In-room electronic jukebox-like device to play all your favorite tunes, huge TV's, huge bedroom and bathroom and a separate area with couchs and tables. Well, you get the point. Eat at Mr. Lucky's at anytime of the day/night. We have not had a bad meal there yet. Great margaritas and mexican food at the Pink Taco. Really, all of their restaurants are a hit and you can spend a little or go all out for a spendy dinner. Rock n' Roll plays throughout the casino. Great club. It is not on the Strip, BUT a short cab ride (no longer of a cab ride than riding from one casino to the next on the actual Strip). If you like to walk (and you are not there in the middle of the summer when it is uncomfortably hot...for me that is), it is about a 20-30 minute walk from hotel to Strip. If you are there in the summer, they have one of the best pool scenes and pool parties in Vegas. So just throw on your suite, grab a spot at the pool and relax the day away with a few cocktails and a lot of awesome music and energy. Would highly recommend this for those looking for a younger feel vibe and/or a rock n' roll vibe:) People of all ages, though, do stay there (and yes, even kids).

Reviews.Title: “Impressive stay.....”
Reviews.Author: nursewebb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights after securing a fantastic rate with bookit.com. The resort fee is an absolute rip off, we used none of the included amenities but would have been happy to pay this fee if the wifi were at least included. Still under 100 a night with the resort fee included so we were happy. Staying off the strip is a non issue for us as we have visited Vegas many times before but for 1st time visitors i wouldnt suggest this hotel unless you like to walk (15 mins plus) or use the included in resort fee, shuttle that finishes at 6pm. Beds were very comfy, super modern room in HRH tower with built in music feature in wall. Large bathroom and HUGE bath!!! Air conditioning was not consistent... user error?? Liked how the bedroom could be seperated from lounge area and kitchen like facility for entertaining would be great for socialising if meeting up with a group in Vegas. Nice hotel and very adequate for our needs. Shame we didnt get to see the pool (out of season) Would stay again at below 100 rate.... probably not if rack rate only available. Thanks for having us.

Reviews.Title: “This place is pretty much a shiny looking dump. With awful service!”
Reviews.Author: movinglights
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice before and I don't remember it being this bad. I won't use the word that comes to mind here, but it it rhymes with 'Pit-hole.' Worse yet - the level of service is downright bad. I stay in vegas A LOT for business and I've never seen service so bad. When I was checking in I heard someone call the desk and complain that they had gotten a smoking room when their reservation was for a non-smoking room, and the desk guy told him they were all out and that he could try other smoking rooms until he found one that wasn't as strong a smell!
