Then my colleagues checked in and apparently went through a couple of rooms as well until they found one that was liveable. As for me, I was promised a refrigerator (for medical reasons), which was supposed to be delivered my first night. When I returned, there wasn't one...and the snotty front desk person told me they were out of them and that I should use the ice bucket. I asked if I could just empty the mini bar and leave all the liquor on the desk, and she pretty much guaranteed that if I i did that I would be charged for all the liquor and that there was nothing she could do. She said the next day was a sunday, so there would be many checkouts, and promised that when they had a refrigerator that day they would deliver one to my room. After working all day, I returned to - guess what - no fridge. So I call the front desk and they gave me the runaround again, basically blaming me for not having called them up during the day and requesting one. Yikes.

Reviews.Title: “It was adequate”
Reviews.Author: jsbachop1
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Vegas before. The place was very casual, though the decor and personality was hip. Staying off the strip was a bit of a mistake for us since we wanted to see much of the personality that Vegas is known for. It was a 15 minute walk to get to the strip from the Hotel. Be prepared to take a Cab. We had almost no interaction with staff except at check-in and check-out and they were professional but didn't go out of their way to make us feel welcomed or cared for. Our room was nice and we didn't ask for frills, it felt like the room of a rock star.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock is where I hang my hat in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: JoffyG
Reviews.Content: There are several reasons why I have always loved The Hard Rock! I visit Las Vegas twice a year on average for business. If you are a perennial visitor to this area like me, you will soon tire of the heavy tourist congestion that IS the Vegas strip. I will gladly pay the $13 cab ride to go down to the strip because I find it a luxury to be able to get away from there when I want to. Let's face it, Las Vegas is a playground for adults and The HRH is a casino built for exactly that. In fact, the last thing that I ever want to worry about when I'm in "Sin City" is whether or not I offend a family that's here on vacation. The decor, music, restaurants, shops, pool amenities, and concerts are why I love this place. If you don't like rock-n-roll music or if tattoos bother you, then don't stay here. I always enjoy my stay at HRH! The HRH staff has always taken great care of me and my business partners. Whenever I talk to a friend or business associate who is planning a trip to Las Vegas, my advice to them is simple. There really isn't a more genuine way to experience this city and all of it's swagger than to room and gamble at the HRH & C!!! Viva Las Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pure junk”
Reviews.Author: Tuesday949
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune of walking in to. From the appalling attitude, the disorganized reservations associates, the waste of time casino and overpriced well drinks. For the same money you could stay at 99% of strip casinos and enjoy yourself much more. Please, if you have never stayed here, don't. There is not one single advantage to it, the rooms are priced like center stirp rooms and the location means you have to drive or take a taxi to get anywhere decent. If you have an issue with any aspect of your stay and talk to a supervisor, you will be made to feel as if you are in the wrong. And to make it worse, the casino is HOT, meaning no ventilation system so if you are a non-smoker prepare to take everything you brought to the dry cleaners when you get home. Pease trust me, this is not where you ever want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suite”
Reviews.Author: PrsTrainer
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the HRH Suites. Nice room although the furniture is a bit dirty for a newly built addition. We had a king room with a view of the top of a parking garage at first and they switched our room to a double with a view of a parking lot. Oh well. Very large room with a large bathroom and nicely done. Self parking is free and a hotel car is available to take you to the strip or bring you back if you don't feel like driving. Bed is very comfortable. Casino was quiet but we were there at Christmas so I'm sure it got very busy for New Years!

Reviews.Title: “The HRH is the Happening place to be!”
Reviews.Author: rickybobby818
Reviews.Content: We only stay at HRH. It is so much fun there. The pool scene is like no other. The one thing we look for in a bed is comfort and cleanliness. HRH certainly has both. This is why we only stay there. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone. Its a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Rockstar weekend”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Drew2
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel twice in 2 months now. The first stay was in the Casino Tower and the rooms are quite nice and good value for the price. My most recent stay was in the HRH Tower and it was an amazing experience. The place feels like a separate hotel from the rest of the property because it is on the other side of the casino with separate check-in area so it has an exclusive feel to it. The lobby is very dark and has a club-like atmosphere. We were given a corner room that faced the strip. The photos in the room were of the band KISS. Unfortunately, the parking structure is right in front of the hotel and obstructs the view of the airport on the lower rooms. The other side of the hotel would have a view of the pool area. The room itself is really nice. It is bright with 2 flatscreen tv's, a huge bathroom, comfortable seating, and a really comfortable bed. There is a DVD player and a jukebox thing in the wall that supposedly has its own music but was not working at the time. You can also connect your ipod to it. There are 2 thermostats so you can control the air/heat in the bedroom area and the seating area. The shower is huge with 2 different shower heads and the rest of the bathroom is very modern. The corner room was all the way at the end of the hallway which is a long walk from the elevators and is very quiet. I feel that this room was nicer than the suites at THEHOTEL at Mandalay Bay except that there is only one bathroom. We were there during the weekend of the Tiesto concert and it was awesome. The Joint is a great place to see a concert. Staying at the hotel was very convenient after leaving the concert in the early hours of the morning. On our previous stay, we experienced the Reliquary Spa, which was quite nice too. It's bright, comfortable, and as nice as most other spas in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs Verified”
Reviews.Author: htoneill
Reviews.Content: I was only there for a night and only spent a few hours in the room. When I got home, I found bed bug bites all over both legs. They weren't itchy at the time of checkout, so I didn't complain to the front desk. The visit was fun otherwise, so I am reluctant to rate it "terrible". Shame that they seem to be having a bed bug problem but either can't find or won't acknowledge it.

Reviews.Title: “New HRH Suite Tower- Great rooms but long wait to get one”
Reviews.Author: sockster
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite thru a discount web site, and decided to stay here instead of my usual, The Hotel. The main problem was, and I know check in begins at 3PM, but at 1PM I was told my room would be ready in no longer than 20 minutes- TWO HOURS later, my room still wasn't ready, so they gave me a room on another floor- You get the feeling that this room was ready when I got there...I think the front desk likes to create a lot of drama. This said, after travelling eight hours to get to Vegas, I wasn't in the mood for drama. Once I finally got into the room, it was beautiful and very comfortable. Complaints: They charge $16.99 for a resort fee, and don't include internet connection!! That's another $13.99 per day- so you're looking at a $30 per day resort fee!! RIP OFF if you ask me. My other minor complaint was the shower, with a rain shower and hand held head, had NO PRESSURE at all. What a waste of an awesome shower....oh well. Otherwise, the HRH rocks!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun but far”
Reviews.Author: giuliotuseo
Reviews.Content: The hotel position is not great, a 20 minute walk to the strip and not much around; however the hotel itself is a great place to party and have fun. We did a late check-in at 23.30 (not late in Vegas time) and the guy at the reception was visibly annoyed; but I have to say during our stay the staff was friendly and helpful. The room was well furnished and clean, the view was terrible, I guess the late check-in in a busy period didn't help ;-). Overall my experience in the Hotel and Casino was good, I recommend going to this place if you don't mind loud music in the common area and walking a bit to get to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great time over super bowl weekend”
Reviews.Author: Ivan_fan
Reviews.Content: I've always enjoyed the HR, but I really like their upgrades..stayed in the paradise tower, corner room, & I was very impressed. Tho maybe a little dark for some (as is most of the casino), gives it a cool vibe. Video poker machines aren't bad! Tho please gamble responsibly, it's not for everyone. Have a couple drinks, enjoy the music, & take in the strange parade of people passing by.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent style”
Reviews.Author: Mihasto
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the HRH and Paradise towers weekend trip in the last month and I have not been disappointed. Opulent style, great integration of music, either Hard Rock selections or personal iPod, and the service and staff are beyond reproach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice HRH tower room, fun to party, bit far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: steevke
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights at the end of January for a Trade Show. The room was wonderful thanks to the (free) upgrade to a corner suite with marvelous city view. If you're lower than +/- the 10th floor and if you do not have a corner or pool view, you'll look at a parking garage aso make sure you get either a higher floor or pay extra for the pool view. The room is lovely, spacious saloon, nicely decorated, 2 flatscreen tv's for you tv addicts, bed is nearly perfect (but too hot), room safe did not work, asked twice for a repair at the reception, but nothing was done to fix it. Bathtub is DEEP, shower is large (but could do with some more pressure), nice mirror, real hairdryer, nice music station. The mini-bar is pressure sensitive so if you take something better drink, eat or use it. No bathrobes which is a pity!! The casino is fun, especially in the weekends, weekdays are calm. The "hells belles" girls are pretty and fun to watch if you're not playing. We had breakfast in Lucky's (not worth the money), dinner at Nobu (marvelous but $$$), steaks at Rare 120 (great but not cheap either), and some Mexican food at Pink Taco (not that special). Used the standard gym , which is OK, did not visit the (paying) reliquary spa. On Sunday we went to Vanity, and had a great night out. What I did not like: internet is payable (14$/24hr), resort fee does not give access to Reliquary Spa (charge 10$ more then), some "European" breakfast choices would be nice for those who don't eat 5 eggs, 2 pounds of bacon and a stack of pancakes at 7 AM. What I like about this hotel is that it is not a "fake" theme such as Paris, Venice, Rome - If I want to have a gondola trip I'd fly to Venice Italy and not to Vegas! The music theme is well played out, rock everywhere! Other hotels I liked when visiting around where The Wynn/Encore (great food in La Cave) and Aria (nice shopping) & good Thai food in Lemongrass.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE the Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: laurendesigns
Reviews.Content: We stay here almost every year and absolutely love the place! It fits the 20-50 something crowd and BEST part is it's NOT a family hang out. Nor is it your typical touristy crowd. It's off the strip so it stays semi-quiet without a ton of walk through traffic. No screaming kids...you see very few at the hotel or pool so it's fit for couples, girl stays, group outings. If you're looking for a chill place to stay with friends or your significant other this IS the spot! We just stayed in the new HRH suites and had a "Corner King Room". It was gorgeous and the only con was the night club noise Thu-Sat but we were warned of that. We've stayed in all of their buildings so if you're looking for that "out of box" type room look no further. Furnishings and rooms are very modern. Only 3 star rating I gave was for the service. Over the 5+ years we've been going the service has been 50.50. The door guys are awesome but the counter staff has been a mix. Our last trip left a bit of a sour taste in that we were ignored while leaving. We had a simple request that was treated like a "joke"...no one seemed to care or respond so we hopped on the plane and left. I had wanted to follow up with the manager but most likely not worth my time!

Reviews.Title: “On odd combination that just about works”
Reviews.Author: sonnywaheed
Reviews.Content: Being a hater of the HRH group (having stayed at the Chicago hotel twice and been treated atrociously on both times), it was with much trepidation that I appraoched this hotel. It's a venue that living and breathing the Hard Rock brand: huge guitar rises from the ground in the resort entrance, rock memrobilia is on display nearly everywhere, and music playing 24x7 throughout the hotel. The casino is surprisingly small (not tiny, but for Vegas, it's rather compact)... it's also very dark, as is the majority of the hotel... everywhere looks like a nightclub on a friday night. The rooms are very well sized and beautifully decorated and appointed. Again, however, as with the rest of the hotel, it is painfully dark. With all the lamps on, of which there are only 3 (one on a desk and one each either side of the bed), you can barely see around the room (don't try reading a book in there!). As with most Vegas hotels, you pay for the room and that's all you get - everything is extra (including using the gym or pool). The room doesn't even have tea or coffee making facilities; they want you in the starbucks downstairs and then in the casino ;) the crowd are very odd - either young trndy kids away for a mega-party or aging rockers/hippys; it's very much a party resort. It also has, probably, the busiest tattoo parlour on the planet - everytime I went past, they had a queue of people waiting for their 'ink'. The service, so unlike Chicago, was great; it was friendly, relaxed, but at the same time efficient - a tough balance to maintain. So in summary, a good hotel for the brand, but for the price and facilities, I'd say there are better hotels (for similar pricing) around Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The HRH Tower rocks”
Reviews.Author: cchase89
Reviews.Content: I loved the HRH Tower. Room was fantastic. If you do not mind being a 3 mintue cab ride from the Strip, this is a great place to stay. I hear the Casino tower and Paradise tower leave something to be desired, but that is not the case with HRH.

Reviews.Title: “After 100+ visits to Vegas I finally tried out The Hard Rock - You should to!”
Reviews.Author: AussieCR
Reviews.Content: Review is from a midweek 3 night stay in December 2010 - HRH Tower Suites As the title states, after years of visiting Vegas and from starting out calling The Mirage my home away from home through to The Wynn being my new must stay place, I'm very happy to say I've now moved on to my new "residence". Perhaps it's because I'm getting awfully close to my restless 40's (38 this month!) but for whatever reason I was looking for something a little more upbeat and whilst knew about the Hard Rock, had previously only thought of it as it being one of those places that is likely overflowing with pretentiousness.. boy was I wrong and happy to admit it ...(my only out on this is that come on Rehab did paint you guys a little off colour, right?!)... anyway... ... I humbly offer a HUGE SORRY to all those that work and play at the Hard Rock Hotel in Vegas because it's fantastic, the hotel staff are super friendly and were always smiling (check in, valet, room service etc.) and the casino staff were all fantastic (I dealt mainly with slots and cage staff). Those that say there Suites are not luxurious don't know luxurious in Vegas because these are I asure you every bit as luxurious as the other top end hotels in Vegas (I have stayed at most at some point in time) and very price competitive if your price concious. This is NOT a "locals" hotel and casino, it's a genuine Resort so yes your going to pay a resort fee (reasonable) and yes they are going to put a deposit hold on your Credit/Debit card because unlike "local" hotels you actualy get a very well stocked mini bar and great food and bar choices throughout the HRH to charge up to the sweet suite your staying in! I will list just two of my many personal reasons why I'll be going back and staying at HRH again; * Location - if your like me and always hire a car, it's the perfect location off strip and with the valet parking garage being right at the hotel entrence (literaly steps away from the elevators) its unbeatable. The Wynn has a great side Valet for there suites but this even beats that - when I needed to get out, I was out my room and in my car in under 5 minutes every time! This alone is worth the price of a room if your the mobile type. *Ambience - as I said above, HRH is the complete opposite of what I thought (seen on Rehab days) - staff were all fantastic, and the people in the place either playing or at the bars were all genuinely friendly and having a good time. I also got what I was looking for with far more of an upbeat musical feel be it when gambling or drinking at the bars. So in summary, I have nothing against my previous places of stay/play in Vegas but the HRH is now where I'll be calling "home" for the time being. I posted this because I believe they got a bad rap not only from me previously (having not even stayed there) but also I'm sure others that have seen "Rehab" and feel the same - forget what you have heard or read (even this review!) and go try a visit for youself.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mdgirllp
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas and got a fantastic deal at the Hard Rock Hotel. My husband had stayed before once and because of that they upgraded my two rooms to the new Paradise Tower. Rooms are very large, beautiful finish, great shower and a really amazing bed! Unlike some of the hotels we visited, the walk from the lobby to the rooms in the Hard Rock is not bad. Pool areas were really nice, though weather was not really right in January! There are some good food deals, Mr Lucky's 24 hour restaurant did a steak and eggs special for $4.99 and the 120 degree steak house offers half price food on Mondays. Hint - Join their club! You get discounts on food etc. If you want to work out, the gym is fantastic and included in the $18 a day resort fee. Two main drawbacks - not on the stirp and the courtesy shuttle last run is 5pm to the strip and 5.15pm back. So you will get some taxis, but we actually enjoyed being away from all the action at times. The lobby and reception desk are all around the casino area, so it is very loud and when we checked in on Friday there are pole dancers etc. Great for young but if you are planning on bringing kids this might not be great. Overall the hotel is very loud and there are not many quiet relaxing areas inside. I would definately go back and thought all the staff, especially those in the casino were really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The best vibe in the whole of Vegas! Awesome stay.”
Reviews.Author: PulpTraveller
Reviews.Content: Although the Hard Rock is a little off the Strip, it is not far off... Only 15 minute walk. The trade off is that the Hard Rock offers the best atmosphere for fun. It plays the best music while gambling, has reasonably priced bars and restaurants throughout, a fantastic spa and some very hot clubs. The dealers are helpful with the games and also attractive. Lots of fun. The thing that really surprised me was that the rooms are really nice. Big, clean and stylish. I really loved this place and would gladly go back. The pool area is brilliant and all the hotel staff are brilliant. It is also very close to the airport. No need for a transfer as a taxi is probably going to cost you a mere 10 bucks. It also conveiniently has a superette and liquor store across the road as well as quite a good fun strip club called Club Paradise. Everything about this place is great. You won't be disappointed. Standard rooms are awesome so I can only imagine how great the suites are! Great Stay. Can't wait to go back! The only criticism is that they don't have Free Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Girls Weekend at HRH All Suite Tower!”
Reviews.Author: MTaylor420
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were in Vegas for Thanksgiving Day Weekend to attend the Roger Waters concert at MGM. Since I was traveling with two of my best girlfriends we decided to splurge and rent a suite for our two night stay. The HRH was definitely a wonderful choice. The first thing I loved about HRH was the separate parking for their guests. The lobby is full of music memorabilia which we all loved. Even the elevator's were cool. At first we were given a non smoking room so we got in the room, noticed there were no ashtrays, called the front desk, and had to trek back down to get a smoking room. It was fine since we ended up getting a better view of the pool area (which was closed) and the north side of the strip. The room had two queen beds and sleek modern furniture. A wrap around couch, two flat screens, privacy doors separating living room & bedroom (which we all loved since I wake up at the crack of dawn and they don't). There was also an Ipod dock in the wall with speakers beneath the TV in living room, which we liked since we're more music types than TV types. The bathroom was amazing with a huge shower with rainfall shower head and separate soaking tub also big enough for two. My friends loved the make-up mirrors and we all decided we had to have one in every room we get from now on. Even though we were there to see Roger Waters and enjoy the hustle and bustle of Vegas during Thanksgiving Day weekend we barely left our room :). We even had a pass to get into Vanity for free (they give this to you at check in), but we skipped it. The only thing I didn't like about the Hard Rock was the lack of restaurant selection in and around it, but I lived. I have stayed on the Strip and can't stand the traffic that it comes with even though it's right in the middle of everything. I liked the HRH since it a. wasn't on the Strip b. was close proximity to the airport (I did have to go pick up a friend once I got to the Hard Rock) and c. has a CVS across the street so we could buy our own alcohol and not have to worry about going to the bars and paying a ton of money. It was a great deal, the staff were nice, the memorabilia is amazing, and if I ever get a great deal again I'll definitely choose the HRH at the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Not like the pictures”
Reviews.Author: lppenny23
Reviews.Content: The hotel didnt have much " life" to it. It was slow and quiet. The view from our room was horrible. We opened the patio doors and looked out onto the roof and all of the AC units. The ground underneath the patio was covered in cigarettes. The bed was great and the sheets were nice. The tv and remote system needs an update as well as the bathroom. The bathroom was the worst. Very outdated and there wernt even tissues in the tissue box. We went down to Pink Taco to eat and the food was not good. Have been there before and it was great... but not so much this time. We were gonna order room service in the morning, but decided against it due to the quality of room and food from night before. We checked out early.

Reviews.Title: “Partied like a rock star, and treated like one too!”
Reviews.Author: musicfan72
Reviews.Content: We stayed a night over this past weekend to attend the Buckcherry concert (sponsored by Jaegermeister) for my daughter's birthday celebration and we had a great time! Having read some recent reviews about the unfriendly FD staff I would say they are quite unwarranted (at least by my experience of working in the hotel industry as I FD supervisor). We checked in with Angel at the Front Desk and I found her quite friendly and more than willing to answer my questions. She gave us an upgrade to the Paradise Tower with a pool/strip view without even being asked (something that we definitely appreciated which made my daughter ecstatic!) We had arranged to have a gift delivered to our room my daughter's Sweet 16th birthday and Angel made sure it was delivered promptly. It was really cool and made her feel like a rock star to go into our room and see her own gift with her name on it waiting for her! Our room was luxurious and very very clean. The beds were like sleeping in paradise (maybe that's why they named the tower such.) My daughter loved the make up mirror on the wall by double vanity and now wants one for home. We loved the flat panel tv, cordless phone, and Ipod plug in radio too. My favorite thing about the room My one suggestion would be to have more than just two bath towels in a QQ rooms, since they usually involve more than two guests. We ate at the Pink Taco prior to the show. While waiting to be seated, we lucked out and got to meet Xavier and Stevie from Buckcherry. They were down to earth and more than willing to take a few minutes out of their day to take a picture, hug my daughter, and wish her a happy birthday. The food was spectacular and the staff was very friendly. We ate after the show at Mr. Lucky's 24/7 and the food was outstanding. My wife got the BLTA and was totally psyched at the amount of bacon that was on the sandwich (reminded her of home.) I ordered the Steak, Shrimp, and salad combo for $7.77--not on menu must ask for it--and the steak was cooked to perfection. The shrimp was very fresh and the salad was huge. Our waiter Paul was very friendly and our food came out almost immediately. Vinnie Paul (the drummer for Pantera) from the HellYeah act that opened for Buckcherry was sitting only one table away from us. Needless to say, it was an incredible night for my daughter. My family loves music and my daughter and I are both musicians. So the atmosphere and decor of the hotel was so much fun for us as music fans. All of the memorabilia really makes it an unforgettable experience. If you want to feel like a rock star and be treated like one this is the place for you! We can't wait to come back in a few months. This is our place from now on when we go on our Vegas getaways.

Reviews.Title: “The Dark Ages”
Reviews.Author: hummingbird012
Reviews.Content: The hotel ambience is angled for evenings, hence everything within the hotel is very dim. The casino has neon red and purple strip lighting within, the common areas are dim, and the hotel room is so dim, you can't see what you are reading. The wallpaper is black, with black shades, black furniture, black tiled bathroom, and no reading corner lamps. I like a cup of coffee early in the morning; there was no coffee maker in the room. When I enquired at front desk, the clerk says, "We want you to purchase your coffee at Starbucks or one of the other joints in the corridors." Even motels have coffee makers within the rooms, wow, am I amazed !

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get all the facts”
Reviews.Author: Tshipley6
Reviews.Content: Went to check in, and was charged an extra fee ($15.00) a day to use the fitness room and the shuttle. Shuttle only sat 7 people...didn't matter. We were still charged. Ended up with a $62.00 bill for absolutely nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Best Christmas Ever two years running”
Reviews.Author: rasputintx
Reviews.Content: This was my second year staying at the Hard Rock over Christmas. I go to Vegas to escape the "typical" Christmas/family/kids/annoying carols/etc. experience, and the Hard Rock is the best. Located *just* far enough off the Strip, they don't get very much "tourist" traffic wandering in, especially not very many families with kids. On this particular trip, we were originally booked into the Casino Tower, but we had a pretty crappy view, so our bellman helped us get an upgrade to a suite in the new HRH Tower, which is absolutely gorgeous! All of the staff we dealt with were so friendly and helpful. I particularly appreciated how nice and cheerful everyone was who had to work on Christmas day. Had great service and wonderful food at Mr. Lucky's and Johnny Small's, and I was fortunate enough to schedule a massage at the new Reliquary Spa on Christmas Day. Again, I was really impressed with the friendliness of the staff, and the Spa is incredible. I'm already planning to come back for Xmas again next year, although I suspect I'll be coming for a visit even sooner than that.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms beds amazing check in staff appalling”
Reviews.Author: doylelis
Reviews.Content: we went to hardrock for the christmas period and unfortunately my suitcase didnt make it with us so tired and wanting to check in we arrived at the hardrock the checking was the worse ive ever experienced jay was rude and argumentative we only asked what did the resort fee include and he was just so rude not a good start to the break. The hardrock other than that was great the food great value and the waitresses very friendly the beds are amazing the most comfortable i have yet to stay in. even thou it is a good half hour walk to the strip which we did every morning it was different to stay away from the strip this time

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Adam2554
Reviews.Content: Where to start? I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Las Vegas for new years and would like to post my experience. The first night, New Years Eve, was alot of fun right off of the plane. And I was in a rush looking forward to my stay on the strip. But then we checked in. Prices were high, but the staff had been pleasant. That lasted only so long. In just short of 12 hours our room had been broken into. My perscription medicines, wallet, including my identification and many other cards were stolen. In addition to those items was a new coat costing in excess of $300. The wallet and cards were eventually returned, but only after the cards had been cancelled and one had been broken nearly in half as a result of what I presume to be the individuals frustration that they could no longer be used. However, my identification was never recovered. The friend I had been staying with had his laptop, costing over $1,500, stolen. According to the hotel security they couldn't help us. Rather they simply brought to our attention that the hotel did not find it pertinent to install cameras in the hallways. Or request that they even moved from their desk to assist us. I suppose that is just the value they place on the security and safety of their guests. So the question. Would I stay there again? Absolutely Not!!

Reviews.Title: “TIESTO PARTY HQ - GET A ROOM EVEN IF YOU DONT PLAN TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: slickrickATL
Reviews.Content: Ok so we made the trip to Las Vegas for NYE and to see Tiesto at the Joint. We reserved a casino tower room for 2 nights. Our room was clean, recently redecorated, and relatively comfortable. It is NOT a luxury 4-star hotel so don't set your expectations too high. The casino is dark and smokey, almost out of place given the surrounding buildings. BEST PART: TIESTO @ THE JOINT! (& $4.99 steak and eggs @ Luckie's) If you are reading this then you know whats going down this year with Tiesto's residency at the Joint. We had floor tickets and party favors on deck. The best part of staying at HRH is that you can come and go from the concert whenever you want. Party hard for a while then go back to the room for drinks. This is huge cuz the drinks inside the Joint are way over priced ($16-goose/cran). Make sure to get up front at the end of the show, Tiesto was signing autographs when we left. Overall, our room was very stylish and had a great view. As for the casino, you can find way more excitement on the strip. The Joint is a decent venue, but Tiesto transforms it into something special. If you want to rock hard at Tiesto, get a room at the Hard Rock. If you are seeking opulence or luxury, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “BED-BUGS !!!!”
Reviews.Author: toots786
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife are locals here in Las Vegas, Nv. We have stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel's new HRH Tower 4 times now. We decided to get a room for Christmas Eve..& Christmas Day 2010. When my wife woke up Christmas morning, one of her arms was covered in bed bug bites. We filed a complaint, the supervisor took pics of the arm ( so did i, etc..) We ended up checking out at 1am on Christmas Day as we did not want to bother with moving to another room that late. I was given a number for the risk management department. I called back the following week and was told they did not find anything in the room !! Really...?? Of course they are going to say that ! The gentlemen who took pics of her arm and to whom i gave the written report to also admitted that they sure do look like bug bites ! Needless to say, i was not refunded for our stay. Will never step foot inside the Hard Rock again....will write as many negative reviews as possible..on as many review sites i can get my hand on, and will forward my statement along with pictures of her arm to channel 8 news and channel 13 news locally here in Vegas !! STAY AWAY FROM THE HR UNLESS YOU WANT BED BUG BITES !!!

Reviews.Title: “I would return to HRH Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mariaslp
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our Christmas night stay at HRH Las Vegas. It is about a 10 to 15 minute walk to the strip which isn't bad if the weather permits. We walked to the strip but took a taxi from Caesars Palace after midnight which cost $11 (without tipping). The traffic was very heavy at midnight on Christmas evening. The strip was busy Christmas evening, many Asian and Hindu tourists (I assume since many didn't recognize Christmas) but everyone seemed civilized. The HRH was very clean. We asked for an upgrade and they granted. We had 2 very comfy queen beds with down comforters, pillows and mattress pad. I could sleep on a bed like that every night. The mini bar has sensors so I would recommend that no one touches the items or you will be charged. The bathroom was nice, large shower, no tub. We had to ask for more towels since our room only had 2 bath size towels. Within 5 minutes of our request, a staff member delivered 5 more towels. The casino is much smaller but I consider it a plus. It didn't seem as busy as the other casinos. And the rock and roll playing was great throughout the casino. I didn't hear loud music in my room after midnight. I understand the music is loud when there is taping going on for a TV show at pool area but on Christmas night, the pool area was dead! The staff was very helpful. The waitresses delivering drinks were all very friendly and of course they were all beauties in their tight fitting clothing. I didn't eat at any of the restaurants b/c we decided to eat at the HR Cafe which is closeby but not part of the Hard Rock Hotel (different affiliation) according to the front desk staff. The concierge was very helpful in giving us information concerning the sightseeing. It was a short stay for us as we were just passing through. If I were to visit Las Vegas again, I would probably stay on the strip BUT I wouldn't mind staying at the HRH again as I think it met my standards for a hotel. And if you don't mind being off the strip, I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “The HardRock is the easiest place to stay in Vegas everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: russ7873
Reviews.Content: Spent New Years weekend with great friends in a great enviroment, couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Johngil
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week. Been to vegas many times. The place is too far from the strip. Noisy at night. People drunk in the halls banging on doors and passed out in hallways. The Pink Taco was good. I think this place is for young partiers, who go there for the prestige of saying they stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “HRH Tower Suites are awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Peak_10
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. A little over rated though. We stayed in the HRH Tower suites and the rooms were awesome. This hotel was a little too far off the strip for my liking, also they need to have more places for breakfast, and more places to eat in general. Overall a nice hotel. The front desk staff in the hrh vip section was a snob and really rude. One thing we did really enjoy was the Sunday Rehad Pool Party, it was so much fun, i would definetly go back to rehab again!

Reviews.Title: “One of My Worst Stays Ever, at Any Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: screamino
Reviews.Content: I stay at hotels about 75 nights a year, and I've stayed at Hard Rock Hotel in LV several times, but this stay was one of the worst experiences I've ever had. What's even worse is that our booking was at the new HRH Tower. Hard Rock management, in case you wondered, NO you do not even come close to competing with Mandarin or Wynn with your HRH Tower. We had booked a room with a pool view and when we checked in, were downgraded to a city view, aka a view of the parking lot. When I asked the check-in agent if there was a difference in rate, she said "Sometimes, it depends on the weekend." She never offered to adjust our rate for the downgrade even though if one looks at Hard Rock's website it's obvious that pool view rooms always have a rate premium. It was late and we were tired, so we went to the room and decided we'd live with it. In the room, there were no ice tongs or a wine opener, and when we moved one of the ottomans for our room service meal, it was littered with trash underneath. One of the two TVs faded in and out and effectively didn't work. We had to return our entire room service meal other than the wine and cheese plate. The chicken was as hard as a rock and seemed as old, while the pizza was like soggy toast with ketchup on it. The next morning we let the front desk know about our disappointment with the room, and the agent (a different one from the night before), said sorry and also had the manager on duty notified. To date, those are the only two people at Hard Rock who seem to care or said sorry. He promised us a suite and also made a $50 rate adjustment to our room from the night before. We were to be notified on my cell phone when the room was ready. We spent the day doing other things and in mid-afternoon returned to the room. No cell phone call, no message in the room. We were going to a concert at the Joint (btw, the VIP access folks at Hard Rock are very nice - I highly recommend the Joint and its staff), so thought we'd relax a bit and wait for our room to be ready. We decided something must be wrong by 6 pm, so we went downstairs to check. We should have known we were in trouble when the same check-in person from the night before was there. She let us know the suite had been ready for several hours, never said sorry, wonder what happened, we should have called you. We let her know that we know longer needed the suite, we didn't want to move our stuff and were leaving in the morning. We also indicated that we would like a rate adjustment for our downgraded room for both nights. She called the manager on duty and let us know we would get a $50 adjustment on our bill. What we didn't know was that we already had a $50 credit for the day before, so the manager actually gave us NOTHING. We proceeded to go to dinner at AGO - a great restaurant, we highly recommend it as well as Pink Taco. Oh, and also my girlfriend got her nails done at the HRH spa and said the service was great. She also spent some time at the pool - actually with several other people in an area that was closed. Management may want to consider not having their only open pool area being the one that is in shade the entire day. If you're noting a pattern here, you're right - despite the shoddy and impolite (actually incompetent) service, we still spent (gladly) plenty of money in other areas of the hotel, and were fine with it because of the service we received. In the morning, the same morning staff were working and we gave them more detail of our miserable stay. They let us know how sorry they were, that something must have happened with the room notification people or process, and that they would pass on my name and number to one of their general managers, who would call me the following week. That was December 12. I think you can guess what happened with that call - I'm still waiting.

Reviews.Title: “great stay for son's 21st birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: travel4w0rk_play
Reviews.Content: arrived on 12/26th and the front desk upgraded our rooms and was even able to check us in early (very appreciated!!). The rooms were beautiful and clean. We had a great view over the pool and could see the strip out our windows. My favorite part of the rooms - the BED! So comfortable and I WANT the comforter for home. Audria the concierge was fantastic - she was able to get us into a couple great nightclubs and recommended a great spot for dinner one night. If she isn't at the desk - ask the bellhops - they are very nice and knowledgeable as well. If you get a chance - ask for the turkish ritual at the spa! tips: check out on the TV and then you can avoid the check out line. Don't open the web bar fridge unless you want to be charged for drinks, and don't touch the food on the stand - as they are weighted. ** If you do - just make sure you let the front desk know and they can fix the charges.

Reviews.Title: “hotel ok, casino lame”
Reviews.Author: 8smartypants8
Reviews.Content: i have been to vegas probably a dozen times, stayed at different places every time. this place, well my first mistake was booking through orbitz. after being told we could have free drinks at the bar if we spent a certain amount of money at the video poker, betting $1 per hand, we hung out until we got our room all settled. the wall photos were interesting, but that's where it ended. the casino was totally boring and mostly vacant. cleanliness was fine, mexican food was good at that restaurant, but even when we returned from another casino at 2am, this one was still lackluster. the hotel location was convenient for getting in and out of the city (from the east). but because it wasn't on the strip, and the shuttle only ran downtown during daylight hours, i'd recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “extra fees, electricity went out, off strip, shower leaked”
Reviews.Author: kdoOregon
Reviews.Content: The electricity went out and we had to walk down 15 flights of stairs. The shower leaked. Also, this hotel is way off the strip. We were also charged about $16ish per day during our recent trip to the hard rock cafe for a "service" fee. This didn't include parking (parking was free) or an internet fee (it wasn't included). In fact, we can't figure out what it was for. Other than that, it was fine. Cool memorabilia.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: michael30Ireland
Reviews.Content: stayed here in july 2010, room was very good and very reasonable. hotel is off the strip, so what!! paid $59 for one night which was about 42 euro. modern clean fun cool hotel definately stay again. one thing check out early or else you'll be waiting a while and the person you're with wont like it, check in wasn t great either.

Reviews.Title: “Rock the hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: nonolan
Reviews.Content: We checked in the hotel late (11 pm) on 24th December, however, they upgraded the room for us without any requests (or my friend requested I am not sure), they gave us a bigger room in New building (Paradise Tower) on 17 floor. We surprised when we got into the room, it was clear, new and nice furniture with great view (poor view and little city view). And the most important was we got a very great promotion price online which was $120 for TWO nights include tax and resort fee ( $15 per night covers 2 complimentary rock spa gym passes per guest per day, strip shuttle service 10am to 6pm, free local & long distance phone calls, free valet parking if you have a car, and free internet) on Xmas. In addition, they offer $10 free slot play bonus if you sign up at the Rockstar Club, its all free. We all love the room and be willing come back next time in Vegas with nice promotion.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for a good time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ryenot
Reviews.Content: THis place is THE best place to stay if you are looking to have a fun in Vegas. It is not for the elderly although I think I know some that would complain less than some posters here. THe casino plays good music instead of listening to the same old sound of the machines which makes you tired of being in a casino sometimes. THis place makes it fun even if you dont want to gamble in the casino. I got upgraded to a pool view room upon check in and it was very nice and clean (until I left it). The crowd is 20-35 year olds having a good time so don't be surprised if noone listens when you complain about the music. Know what you are getting into BEFORE you book the hotel. If you want a nice family getaway, stay at the Belagio. If you want to have fun stay here! My room was great, clean. I never had a problem with the service because I really didn't need any, except for the waitress to bring my drinks, which worked out so good that I forgot my last night there. Im sure it was good though.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet suites!”
Reviews.Author: powderhound760
Reviews.Content: The new all-suite tower is amazing. We got a great deal via a sale/email notice and I didn't want to leave. Be careful while navigating the website- can be confusing what you are getting. The Casino tower is the original older rooms. They are not really re-done to new. The Paradise tower is new but I didn't see it. Those rooms are a little more expensive but probably worth it. The all suite tower is brand new and BEAUTIFUL. If you get a reasonable price on this, book it. Also, there are no kitchens in any of these- just mini bars. Separate registration and parking(nice) but direct walk into Center bar. The bathroom was cavernous and beautiful. I felt like a rock star and don't miss the stuff in the hallway- Michael Jackson's glove is right before check in. Awesome. Also, don't miss the NYsteak + eggs after midnight- $4.99 w/ hash browns and toast but don't get the $3.99 burger, it's terrible. Love the suites!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel I have ever stayed at!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rex1999
Reviews.Content: Way over priced for what you get! It's way off the strip of Vegas where all the action is at. The casino and staff are completely rude and incompetent! I have traveled all around the U.S. and I have never had a worst experience then this crappy Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay there!”
Reviews.Author: vlhe001
Reviews.Content: Internet $14.99 per day per computer, Frig $40.00 per day, pool extra, gym extra, lousy food, no Bell Hops or offerers to help, frees Limo to strip goes one place (mall) 6 passenger max, runs hourly, no coffee maker or hair dryer in room. Only mentioning a few non-perks. There are none.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel Vegas - Rock and Roll Vibe and ADA Friendly”
Reviews.Author: DFDfoREVer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hard Rock this past weekend (12-10/12-13). I just recently became paraplegic so we requested an accessible suite. We were elated with our room in the HRH Tower. The 700sq ft. suite was more than accomodating. The roll-in shower was beautiful and came equipped with a fold down bench. The bed was a bit high to transfer on to, but we made it with the help of a slide board. We also had tickets to the Avenged Sevenfold show at The Joint. The ADA seating in the venue was great and Security parted the seas to escort us to the seats. This was our first traveling experience since my accident, so we were very pleased how accessible the Hard Rock is. I can't believe anyone would give this place a bad review. The Hard Rock is a Rock and Roll resort.....not Disneyland. It's an adult destination. If you are intimidated by beautiful women and disgusted by tattooed people, this is not the hotel for you. I thought the tattooed up staff was sexy and very hospitable. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: twinki5
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock is the only hotel in Vegas I like staying in. The vibe is relaxed - not uptight, like some of the others on the strip. Yes, it's a little removed from everything... But, that just keeps the crowds bearable and makes for a more enjoyable time. The rooms are super clean, very comfortable, and beautifully designed. And, the fact that I can listen to music that I like, everywhere I go, 24/7, is the icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: “Far from the Strip but was still pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: LilPiggyQT
Reviews.Content: I had just stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel with my friend this past weekend (12/12-12/13) but thought that the hotel was great for such a short period of time. The hotel itself is pretty far from the strip and we drove from the hotel to the strip when we needed to get somewhere. There is a shuttle from the hotel to the Fashion Show Mall but we had needed to be on the other end of the strip at Mandalay Bay so we never used the shuttle (I believe part of the resort fee goes towards that free shuttle service). We checked in that afternoon, had lunch/dinner at the Hard Rock Cafe located right in the front of the hotel and it was what was expected in terms of food and price. Funny enough, the Hard Rock Cafe is actually not listed on any of the hotel brochures that are located inside the rooms. We stayed at the Casino Tower rooms of the hotel. The hotel rooms were prettily decorated and clean which made a good impression upon walking into them. The beds were decent, not as comfortable as I would have liked but definitely good enough to sleep on. There was a minibar located in our room and everything was placed on sensors so just make sure you do not touch anything if you did not actually want to pay for it. There is also wireless and wired internet offered in the rooms for a price of $13.99 a day. I did not use it but it was nice to know that I could have if I needed to although I considered it too expensive for one day. There is a gym there and I walked by it but I believe there is a fee to use the gym also. We had also placed our names down on the guest list for the nightclub Vanity at the nightclub concierge and we were able to get in for free (we are both female). A note about the wristbands they give you for Vanity - we were entitled to free rum drinks and champagne until midnight. I don't know if that was common but it was nice to get free drinks! Vanity itself was not as nice inside as we expected but the DJ played good music and the people in attendance were friendly and of sorts of ages (over 21 of course). We dined at Mr. Lucky's 24/7 the next morning and the food was typical diner food. The prices of the food there were not too expensive and pretty much expected. The casino itself is actually very small in terms of Vegas casinos though they do have table games and plenty of slot machines. There is also rock memorabilia scattered throughout the casino and hotel which was nice because it was like walking though a museum. The decor is very stylish and dark although the hotel did not seem dark to me. Overall, for such a short trip the Hard Rock was a great place to stay at but I would not recommend it for someone who has never been to Vegas before. There was enough at the Hard Rock Hotel to keep you busy for a day and night but not enough for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Hotel and The Joint are AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: JennaG_10
Reviews.Content: I would first like to say that the above reviewers are correct in saying that there is a $15 a day fee that is added that is not previously mentioned before you check in but all hotels in Vegas have a fee. I stayed at The Hard Rock Hotel while I was in town to see Avenged Sevenfold perform at The Joint and fell in love with this hotel. The atmosphere is so relaxed and the memorabilia is amazing. The valet and housekeeping staff go above and beyond. The food is great and the waitress/waiter staff is excellent. I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you want to be on the strip. The Hard Rock is maybe a 10-15 min drive from the strip depending on traffic so I would recommend renting a car or waking up early to use the free shuttle that the hotel provides. However, if you want to go out to the clubs you will need to take a taxi becuase the shuttle only runs till 6PM. Also, if there is a concert taking place during your stay in the hotel I recommend attending it. The venue is great, no matter where you are in The Joint you are no more than 150 ft. away from the stage. I would not recommend bringing kids to this hotel because there is nothing interesting for them to do here-it has bars, slot machines, poker tables, nightclubs, and resturants inside. During my stay I never saw any kids. However, if you're a rock fan this is the place for you! You will fall in love with it just like I did. I will ONLY stay at the Hard Rock Hotel when I go to Las Vegas! :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel & Rooms”
Reviews.Author: dtjohnnybrown
Reviews.Content: The new HRH rooms were incredible. I stayed in a corner deluxe room that was awesome. The bed was so comfortable, and clean. The bathroom was like something you see in a fancy magazine..........it was just the best. And lets forget the high tech gadgets in the room. One word.....WOW

Reviews.Title: “Rude....Rude...Rude...”
Reviews.Author: Ellie_123_777
Reviews.Content: We didn't meet a friendly person the entire time we were there. It was almost as if they could have cared less if we were there or not (or actually I think they would rather we were not there). Not family friendly at all. We did see two of the vallets be nice to two girls that they thought were hot...as they ignored everyone else. I would never stay here again. If I never have to step foot into that hotel and casino again it will be a day too soon.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Rude and Overcharged!”
Reviews.Author: camochameleon
Reviews.Content: They overcharged me and refused to fix it(reservation was for $129/night and they charged me $139). They also ran it right onto my credit card WITHOUT me authorizing them to do it. - and again refused to fix it. There is a $15 per day fee charged on top of the room rate " just in case you might use some of the facilities" such as the spa WHICH YOU HAVE TO PAY FOR ANYWAYS - IF YOU USE IT. We call that double-dipping. You have to pay for EVERYTHING. There is no refridgerator in the room, nor is there a coffee maker - unless you want to pay for it! The room was 'cleaned' each day: after the first 'cleaning' we found dirty pillowcases dropped in the corner of the room. After the second: blood stains on the comforter (not ours - and were not there before). Thied day: candy dropped on the floor (again not from us or our room) and they only changed some of the towels - left some dirty in the room. The last night; people in the next room were screeming at eachother past 2am. I called for security but nothing was done. Also; the lack of soundproofing between rooms was dissappointing. I will NEVER stay there again and I recommend no one else does either!

Reviews.Title: “we loved the decor and music memorabilia, but lots of fees”
Reviews.Author: RCantarelli
Reviews.Content: We really liked our room and enjoyed our stay because the hotel was convenient for us. It did seem like the beds were a little lumpy, but the room was very clean. I felt like the resort fee was a joke, and would rather just have that posted in my room rate up front. At least I knew about that before I booked the room. They put a $200 hold on your debit card at check-in if you are not using a credit card, which could put someone in a bind if that was unexpected. The food at Mr Luckys was super cheap late at night -$3.99 for a burger and fries, but our waiter forgot us and it took forever to get our food. All in all, I think if you are into the rock and roll memorabilia, check it out, but for the price I think you can find something closer to the strip if you are planning on spending a lot of your time on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Generally Comfortable, But Problematic”
Reviews.Author: hgelfand
Reviews.Content: In terms of the ambiance, it would be hard to beat this hotel as it is generally a fun experience with a positive energetic vibe. However, there was a significant list of problems (which I identified in a survey the hotel requested I complete, and then got no response to my comments and concerns) that in the aggregate made the visit less than perfect. The room had a nice view of the pools and was tastefully decorated, but was too dark and made me feel like I might have been blind. The mattress was not the best I have slept on and had some wear on it. The alarm clock went off both mornings in spite of my efforts to defeat it; and in spite of my hanging signs on the door, the housekeeping staff woke me both mornings, which did not suit me since I am a night person. The faucet in the room leaked non-stop in the desert. And I was displeased that the refrigerator was for payment only; I could not put anything in it without paying to do so. By far my biggest points of aggravation were the incapacity to use the pools- in spite of having to pay the resort fee- because of the time of the year (why keep the pools lit up at night? why advertise the pools? why charge a resort fee if the pools are off limits?), and the snottiness I encountered from three of the four front desk staff. On the positive side: the staff in four of the restaurants were incredibly generous and pleasant, as were the staff in the various stores I investigated; if you need to be near UNLV it is an ideal location, and if anyone was staying anywhere near me, I did not know as the room was blissfully silent.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected”
Reviews.Author: Chachis75
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing time partying like a rockstar. We stayed at the Paradise tower an it was definitely worth the extra money. The only negative thing I had to say was that the front desk staff was cold, rude, and had no sense of urgency. Pink taco was affordable and delicious. The handmade tortillas were to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: ravehawk
Reviews.Content: Favorite place to stay in Vegas! Took my sons (age 25 and 22) for our first trip to Vegas together. We were treated very well, only wished the weather was better and the pool would have been open. The boys had a great time at Vanity. Had a few problems with the room on our arrival (in room safe and sound system).... but they were handled immediately. Stayed in the new tower, the room was beautiful with all of the modern amenities. The staff was very professional and courteous. Pink Taco and Lucky's were great! The Hard Rock gives that big hotel feel but is small enough that the staff recognizes you and cares about you. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: MCLOVEN123
Reviews.Content: I visited the HRH for Thanksgiving day week, and I must say." Awesome Hotel!" First off, take a cab from Mcarren Airport--only cost $10. I tried the sandwich game at check in and it scored me a top floor Paradise Tower, pool view upgrade (original reservation was for old casino tower).SCORE! Second, restaurants were excellent. Especially the Lucky 7 cafe... they have two graveyard specials that are a great deal=$5.99 steak/eggs/hash browns/toast and a $3.99 burger and fries basket. Casino was located across the street of a 24 hour CVS. Also the best sandwich shop in Vegas, Caprioti's is next to the CVS. Definitely try the "bobbie." All staff was extremely friendly! Can't wait to get back to the HRH.

Reviews.Title: “Sneaky ???”
Reviews.Author: Abby_S_1
Reviews.Content: First off, this is not a review of the hotel, but of their customer service and some sneaky practices. I booked the hotel for a weekend stay using their twitter tuesday special. While confirming the order, it clearly stated "72 hour full refund". Now I had some change in plans, and called them to cancel the booking, and give me the refund as stated in the confirmation. The lady at the phone (Jacquelyn) was rude and said they cannot give me a full refund. I asked her why she cant do that even though it is CLEARLY stated in the confirmation. She said she cant because it is a twitter special. Now I understand that online specials are subject to different rules, but since it was clearly stated "full refund", either the hotel made a mistake by putting the wording in there, or they are ripping me off. Either ways, based on just this horrible customer service experience, I will NEVER stay at the hotel. So for those of you trying to book the hotel online using a special, beware that your booking might be non-refundable, even if you see the words"72 hrs Full refund" while booking it.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, service, but Item that was left in my room was never found”
Reviews.Author: gjfla408
Reviews.Content: I loved the modern interior, room was very clean and everything was perfect. I left my item in the room, I called about 5 hours later after check out to locate my item, lost and found service said, house keepers didnt even clean the room and told me to call back again, and they said another guest checked in. I complained big time for their lack of service, and of course,, my item was never found. It was most disappoint service that I got. obviously they didnt take my item as valuable as I wished.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Tower!!!”
Reviews.Author: parkerbris
Reviews.Content: The ParadiseTower is the all suite wing of the hotel, so our room was amazing! Loads of memorabilia for the music nerds(me included!) I spent hours walking round looking at it all. The hotel is quite a bit off the strip but well worth the journey. The complimentary shuttle to the strip isn't great as it only runs once an hour bewteen 10am and 5pm. Only down side is that the bell staff really had no interest in assisting with bags which resulted in us trecking through the casino with heavy bags both on arrival and departure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff---Best in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lawoman23
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino really made our bi-annual trip to Las Vegas a special one. We were there celebrating a recent anniversary and were just so happy to be on vacation, but the lady who worked at the front desk when we checked in took our experience from good to great. The only thing I requested was if we could have a room with a big tub, instead we were upgraded (I'm assuming this was more convenient because it was a Sunday through Tuesday stay) to a suite with an amazing view of the pool, city and Las Vegas strip. Oh, and did I mention it had an incredible jacuzzi soaking tub fit for two?! On Sunday, we went to the Sheryl Crow concert at the Joint which is a great venue to see an artist. The bartenders were very friendly, we didn't have to wait long and the drinks were generous for the price. We ate at AGO because I heard it was a recommended restaurant. The food was ok but way too expensive for the portion size. The environment was almost too stuffy for the Hard Rock Hotel. I wouldn't exactly use nice and inviting to describe the staff, however the staff was very professional. We ordered Room Service a few times and they were quick, friendly and the food was fresh. Pink Taco is a favorite of ours if you are going for great margaritas, great food and a chill environment. Overall, this is now our favorite hotel and casino in Las Vegas. We are frequent visitors and are excited to return during the summer so we can try out the lazy river at their beautiful pool.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!!”
Reviews.Author: tboy217
Reviews.Content: For 20 years this has been our go to place but this is our first time staying at the Hard Rock. To be honest it was never a thought to stay there but we went with a group & this was the chosen hotel. We were VERY impressed! Like the fact it is not one of the huge hotels that is crazy packed - it had REALLY good food, great music and a really helpful staff. We are already talking about going back this spring/summer so we can check out the pool.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB!!!!! young & lively”
Reviews.Author: paul_findlay
Reviews.Content: I was on my Stag/bachelor party and we decided to go to Vegas for 5 nights, and what a 5 nights it was, we decided to stay in the HRH and were not disappointed. There were 7 of us and they managed to accommodate us in joining rooms which was ideal, we paid £515 per person that was flights form london to vegas and 5 nights stay that was on Expedia so we couldn't grumble about the price. When we arrived at the HRH we were over whelmed by the theme of the place it was magical and if you are into you rock & roll even just slightly you will love this place. The pools are fantastic and i only wish we had went during the summer months to experience Rehab on a sunday which looks magical. The restaurants were exceptional especially the PINK TACO mexican. I really have no complaints about this hotel other than the view we had which looked on to a car park but hey your in vegas we only used our room for sleeping and boy the beds are the comfiest you will EVER sleep in that i can promise. If your young and want some fun stay here and hey if your a little older but want to feel young again also stay here.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF HIDDEN MANDATORY RESORT FEES - $16.80 PER NIGHT”
Reviews.Author: buckbrown3
Reviews.Content: This hotel will add $16.80 per night to your room for a "resort fee." I was never informed of the fee when I checked in, and when I called to discuss it with a supervisor was told that "apparently I had not read the two pages of terms and conditions when I checked in." Apparently, they expect you to stop, pull up a chair, find a flashlight (the lobby is very dim) and read two pages of fine print that explain how they are going to gouge you. Take your business elsewhere. Certainly, the Hard Rock is not the only place to ever charge a resort fee, but most are up front about it and tell you. They did not and were totally unapologetic about it.

Reviews.Title: “Picky, middle-aged person's paradise!”
Reviews.Author: purrpurr71
Reviews.Content: Yeah, I'm one of those. I usually find something to complain about at most hotels, but I have to say that I think the Hard Rock has gotten a bad rap here. My husband and I stayed for nearly a week and our experience was top notch. We were warned, here, about the attitudes of the staff. That was our first pleasant surprise. Everyone was, in fact, very personable from the front desk staff, to the lifeguards to the cocktail waitresses to the valets. We arrived rather late due to some issues with a connection (don't get me started on Delta!) and our check in went off without a hitch. We were even upgraded to a suite. We were on the 10th floor of the Casino Tower. I had visions of sleepless nights and no housekeeping. Again, not true! Sure, there was great music in the lobby and casino, but in our room, the noise level was almost non-existant. Sure, you could hear music if you stood by your window, but it was in no way overwhelming. The room was lovely and the bed was like a giant marshmallow that we didn't want to get out of. Housekeeping was very inobtrusive and left the room spotless each day. Again, I'm picky. If the Casino Tower room met with my standards, I would imagine that the newer towers are even better. I have to think that some of the negative reviews here are from people who have little travel experience, or the Hard Rock has really whipped things into shape. The one and only disadvantage is the cab fares to and from the strip. There is a shuttle, but it doesn't run quite often enough and there are always more passengers than seats, so we gave up on that quite quickly. At the end of the day, I would gladly stay at the Hard Rock again! Give the Hard Rock a chance. They will impress!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: VegasGirl22
Reviews.Content: The first thing that attracted my friends and I to this hotel (besides Rehab) was the reasonably priced rooms. I've been to Vegas many times and stayed at the best of the best hotels, so we decided to give the Hard Rock a try mainly because we love their pool party Rehab. We stayed in the Paradise Towers. Room was stunning, very clean, and the beds were so comfortable. I enjoyed the decor, it was very different from the typical rooms you see in Vegas. I'm in my mid-20's and I felt very comfortable here, it's sort of a "no-frills" kind of place. There were lots of people our age, and people of all ages. The casino is not too big to be overwhelming. There are plenty of great restaurants of all price ranges to eat at. We loved Pink Taco and Ago. One heads up, if you are checking into this hotel on a Sunday morning, be prepared to wait a while for your room. We flew in from LA and got there around 10am for the Rehab pool party, and our room was not ready so we had to change in the bathroom and check our bags. Our room wasn't ready until about 4pm. At that point we didn't care though because we were having a GREAT time at Rehab, best pool party in Vegas! This hotel is off the strip so you have to take a cab most places, but you pretty much have to take a cab anywhere in Vegas so it wasn't a problem. I loved the Hard Rock and I already booked my room here for my next trip to Vegas. They just renovated the Casino towers so we will be staying there this time, can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “It's like meeting a really hot chick, but she only has half a brain.”
Reviews.Author: zooch76
Reviews.Content: Remember that kid in high school that was really cool? All the guys wanted to be him and all the girls wanted to date him. He focused so hard on being cool that he ultimately failed and was held back a year because his priorities were out of whack. The Hard Rock is that kid. The place is really sweet and I love the overall vibe but they seem to be cutting corners and really cheapening the whole experience. Google "Hard Rock Foreclosure" and read the recent articles that come up. The HRH is in dire financial straights and after staying here it's easy to see why. Sure, the economy is hurting but it seems like in this ultra-competitive world the HRH is doing even less to impress. I travel to Vegas from SoCal between once and twice a month for work and recently have been staying at the Palms. However, they pissed me off on my last trip so I decided to give the Hard Rock a try since they have a similar vibe and were offering a great rate. I even noted on my reservation "Please be better than the Palms" - they weren't. Here are a few random notes: - I booked a room in the Casino Tower for two nights. It's the oldest room block but they were renovated recently so I figured they must be decent. When checking in I gave the receptionist a $50 sandwich to see what she could do for me but the best she could find was a room on the 18th (top) floor in the newer Paradise Tower. I was expecting a little more (after all, she got $50 for less than 5 mins work) but I took what she offered and was on my way. However, when I looked at the rates online that night, the difference between the room I booked and the upgrade I received was $20/night (so x2 nights would have been $40 more). Long story short, if you are going to grease the Front Desk, stick with $20. Better yet, book the cheapest room and stick with it since even their old rooms have been renovated recently. I don't mind throwing a few bucks to get an upgrade but give me a break - fool me once and you'll never see me again. The room itself was pretty decent and the beds were GREAT. However, there were a few things that really bugged me about it: - First off, the room was very dusty and it was even more noticeable when the sun was shining in. The mini-bar was the worst - it looked like housekeeping was afraid to get within a foot of it in case they moved an item. It worked out in my favor though since the layer of dirt kept me from being tempted to eat anything. - Next gripe - there was only one bar of soap in the bathroom so I had to remember to swap it between the shower and sink. Come on guys - even the Holiday Inn gives you one bar for the shower and another one for the sink. I left a note for housekeeping the next day and they gave me extras (props to them) but I shouldn't have to do that in a nice hotel. I've noticed other reviews mention this as well so I know it wasn't just a fluke. - Strike three - the shower. It's big, which was great, but the water pressure sucked and was very inconsistent. There were times when it almost shut right off before coming on again on its own. And the shower door leaked, big time. There was a gap between the door and wall that let out a lot of water onto the bathroom floor. If a contractor performed such poor quality work in my home I would make him redo it and then fire him - why does the HRH put up with shoddy work? After work on my second day I went to get some ice to chill some drinks. I walked down to the machine on the 18th floor and....NOTHING. Not really a huge deal so I went down to the 17th floor ice machine and......NOTHING! Seriously? WTF? I went down to the 16th floor and was surprised that the machine actually worked. Overall the staff was great and very friendly. I never got an attitude from anyone at all and was treated like a loyal customer so I have no complaints there. Yes, there is a resort fee but I must have read about it ten times before making my reservation so I wasn't surprised. Do I think it's a load of BS? Absolutely, especially since it covers crap that nobody uses or other hotels include for free but I knew ahead of time that it was going to be added on so whatever. How the other reviewers didn't know about it is beyond me (pay attention people!). The Palazzo and Venetian include Internet access in their resort fee (for $17.99) which is a much better deal and they are among the nicest hotels in town. I also noticed some people complaining that they had to walk a long way from their cars to the hotel - that's pretty standard for all the big Vegas hotel so suck it up, Fatty and walk off that buffet you are returning from. I'm a pretty easy going and laid back guy but I'm just really annoyed that the HRH is slacking and with just a little effort could improve the guest experience a ton. Come on Mark Carlson, you guys are SOOO close! Just work on the details and I could be a lifer at the Hard Rock. And seriously man, please don't even bother giving your standard canned reply to this post. If you guys really want to improve things go secret shop the other hotels in town and take notes on EVERYTHING from fees to room quality.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Jtgotmeluvstoned21
Reviews.Content: This place is epic! Stayed here for 4 days and I loooved it!! Always something to do and the resturaunts are awesome as well, that are inside.... Especially Pink Taco!! Rooms are nicely decorated and very modern, hip, and new.....THE BEDS ARE ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!! SO COMFORTABLE:) all and all it's just a great atmosphere all around, It was awesome looking at all the memorabilia they have around the place from the bands and artist and they play the best music through out the hotel! Loved it!! It was a great place to stay! Thank you Hard Rock:)

Reviews.Title: “Blood on the sheets”
Reviews.Author: bhphilip06
Reviews.Content: Awesome trip but i'll tell you the bad stuff. We got to the HRH tower suites went to our room we had two queens. I ordered 1 king. Had room change. Then the next day room service came and changed the sheets and me and my new fiance are laying on the bed we pull the cover back to discorer small blood splots on the sheets. As if someone was punched in the face and the blood splattered on the sheets. WAY disgusting. I would upload the pictures but I don't have my camera with me. I was pissed went down there told them they "upgraded" me to a corner view. Which wasn't that much different. Just more windows. Didn't really care. So I got pissed again and wanted something else for having blood on the sheets. I talk to some assistant manager. He said they can't comp the rooms but will comp dinner and the restraunt they have there. I think it was called YAO or something like that. Well our tab was 165. I tipped 35% of the bill. I go to check out of the hotel. He only took care of $100 of the bill. How crappy is that. It would have been fine if he would have told me that he was only going to comp PART of the dinner. Well enough with the bad. Me and my fiancee' are pretty easy going so we blew it off. We went to H20 bar and mannn did we have fun. Met awesome people bought expensive but strong drinks. I underestimated the 32oz they gave me, hardly any ice, which is what I wanted. My fiancee got whip lash from dancing so much. lol. We went to the club that night which was a boat load of fun also. We met the right people got drinks bought for us a lot. Danced like it was 1999 and had a blast. This hotel is very very nice I enjoyed it. Except for the sheets. The people at the front desk were awesome. They were extremely nice. The girls and guys aren't as HOT as everyone says they are. It appeared to me like a big group of average 20's early 30 something at the pool. Which is what I liked. I didn't feel out of place. I recommend this hotel, but check your sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not if you get it discounted!”
Reviews.Author: JunkyardJenny
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel/casino, but was told the hotel was full when they figured out I booked thru a discount web-site. The guy next to me at check in got his room, and I was sent across the street to a non-gaming property. Nice, but not what I had RESERVED four months previous. Besides the major inconvenience, they upgraded me to a very nice room. Don't miss the bedding- very soft and fluffy, and totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: LaceyLV
Reviews.Content: I had a short stay at Hard Rock with my boyfriend and from beginning to end we had nothing but bad service. The woman who checked us in was rude and didn't inform us of anything about the property or about the room itself. We signed something at check in that she didn't even ask us to read let alone tell us what we were signing. Finding our room was then an issue because we weren't told where the elevators were and the casino is pretty big. The room was actually pretty nice, though the bathrooms are small and plain. The bed was great. Our room had no view at all and was on the third floor. We also found that the "Tied UP" do not disturb signs meant nothing at all because housekeeping woke us up four times during our stay when we had the sign on the door. On the day of our checkout we called down to the front desk to see if we could have a late checkout and they told us noon was the latest we could have.
