This was on a Monday with no major conventions in town and nothing special going on at Hard Rock...they could have extended us to 1 or 2pm and had plenty of rooms for people checking in. When we came down at around 12:30 we were charged a $100 late checkout fee and were not asked how our stay went. I would never stay at Hard Rock again. This was honestly the worst hospitality I have ever experienced in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We had an awesome time”
Reviews.Author: Schatzl
Reviews.Content: I'm going to make this short since it seems that so many others have covered the details - good and bad. THE POSITIVES: Stayed in the HRH Tower and LOVED our room (the bed was too soft for our taste, but whatever), there were great places to eat all over the hotel with all different price points, the staff was pleasant and professional, the pool was closed but you could still go sit out there and relax, we didn't have a room over Vanity so what we gave up in view we gained in quiet THE NEGATIVES: Well, I'm trying really hard to think of something that didn't meet my expectations ... nope, I got nothing ... :) WHAT I LOVE ABOUT THE HARD ROCK: It's not kitschy ... it's cool. Cool decor, cool atmosphere, awesome music. I don't feel like I'm at Disneyland for adults there like at so many of those over-the-top casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but a bit of a walk to the strip”
Reviews.Author: retiredteacher0
Reviews.Content: The beds were quite comfortable, and the room was clean, but it was well after 2am until it was quiet enough to sleep as our room faced the pool, noise from a nighclub within the building pounded the walls even with the sliding glass door closed, until early morning hours. It was nice having a Starbucks inside the hotel but it was a bright, sunny, hot day and the pool closed EARLY for hotel guests, 5pm, They closed the pool for a pay function pool party open to the public IF you paid admission. Seems way too early to close the pool for guests!!!! Getting food at the pool is quite a chore in itself as well.Tried to make a reservation at the Rare 120 restaurant within the building and was surprised the girl on her cell phone, obviously a personal call, at the reservation booth, told us she did not know the restuarnat hours?!?! Made no effort to help us. DId finally make a reservation via phone call from the room and the food was terrific!

Reviews.Title: “My take on the Hard Rock....some ups and some downs.”
Reviews.Author: curtwill
Reviews.Content: Well, I will start this review by saying that I booked at the Hard Rock beacause I got a wicked deal on a package on-line...not because I am going to party the night away. I am not one of the 'beatiful people' (40's, out of shape). This hotel is FULL of young 'beatiful people' but that said, I didn't feel like a second rate guest. I found the staff to be quite freindly, from check-in to the bars to the floorstaff. Maybe the attitude does exist here but it never hit me in the face and for that I am glad. Ok, room....When I booked I requested king bed, non-smoking (casino tower-cheap package, remember). When I checked in I requested an upper floor. I was told that the only upper floor kings available were smoking and my room was on a lower floor but if I could handle 2 queens they would give me a non-smoking pool/strip view on the 7th floor right in the middle of the casino tower. I figure that I would rather look at the pool than the street any day and I was not dissapointed by the view...the Paradise tower and the HRH tower book-ended an awsome view of the strip...from the MGM right up to the Paris (I have a picture somewhere, really nice) and the pool area looked great. More on the pool in a minute. The room was as clean as I expect when I travel...i don't carry white gloves for the top of the bathroom mirror inspection but I do like to feel like the last group didn't leave 15 minutes before I got there. The beds are very comfortable to me and the down pillows are great. After check-in (late-9:30pm...no line:))...got put away and went downstairs...Halloween night , PACKED, SKIN EVERYWHERE! DO NOT take kids to this property!!!!!! while there was no 'full-on' nudity it was pretty close. Not only would a family have a bad time here....I would have a bad time with a bunch of kids hanging around. The Swedish House Mafia was playing at the Joint and the security dude at the elevator told me that they were moving into the nightclub Vanity after the show.....alright, not a club person so I thought I would find a spot for a drink and play a couple hands of video poker....sat at a bar in between the 2 main rooms and watched the parade of 'less than nothing' costumes on those aforementioned 'beautiful people' WOW. Drinks were offered as soon as I sat down...good start, I hate getting ignored, remeber I am not one of the 'B.P.' as they will now be known. Sat for a while and made my way to a blackjack table...$15 minimums this night ....oh well. Played for an hour or so...several drinks later and down a whole $40 I decide to pack it in. Here is where the first of only a couple issues came up. the nightclub Vanity has a balcony on the pool side of the HRH tower...The party was unbelievably loud and it made sleep almost impossible...until 7 am the noise was booming. The street view room was starting to look better. Deprived of sleep only on this night, the other 3 nights iI had a great sleep. When I dragged myself up at 9am after a couple hours sleep, I opened the french doors....yes, french doors to take in the morning. I never realized how nice this little feature about the old casino tower is. Anyhow, getting long winded, sorry. Never awakened by housekeeping...always left a couple dollars for them and the room was always well kept. a couple staffers in the halls always said hello when I walked by...not what I would consider unfriendly at all. Only ate in the hotel once...Pink Taco...good stuff, been there about 9 years ago...same, same...good staying power in this city. Another downer coming...this is not a great hotel for gambling...machines are few and are very tight...didn't see anyone celebrating the whole time I was there and you will not find a low table limit....were talking Wynn and Bellagio style limits but this hotel is neither. Pool. CLOSED, but....this was a good thing (for me) as I was to find out quickly. no staff, no service, no towels, no crowd, and NO CHARGE. the place was not jam packed with B.P.s but it wasn't empty either....brought a bag of my own beer that I picked up at Walgreens, a cigar, a magazine and my i-pod and relaxed...no hassles, no problem...cabanas were empty, beds were available...good stuff from a potential bad-news sign 'pool closed for the season'. Anyhow...just a couple of thoughts 1- no kids! take them somewhere else . 2- if you don't like it loud, stay away. 3- don't be intimidated, it's not a B.P. only hotel...most of them were very nice. 4- don't go out of your way to find problems...yes they are there but have fun, it's supposed to be fun in Vegas, isn't it? 5- hardcore slot junkies will be dissapointed. 6- rent a car...parking is much closer to the hotel than the big strip resorts and there isn't much to see nearby. 7- earplugs on the bedside table, just in case. Just one man's experience....considering for the same money I could have been at the Circus Circus or the Fiesta Rancho...I am not in anyway dissapointed with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Booom Chigga Booom!”
Reviews.Author: lapislazula1
Reviews.Content: I actully loved it! But I like loud music! I loved the relic's all around the hotel. Very cool to look at! We stayed during there costume party, let me just say WOW! GOOD people watching. That was almost the highlight of the trip. Vegas is Vegas either your feeding the monster or its feeding you. We stayed in the Casino tower which was fine our room was average but who really stay's in? You go there to sleep and shower. Minor downfall there was no coffee in the room. Seriously! I understand they want as much of your money as possible but come on.. Coffee makes most of us happy. Rethink that one. Over all I liked it. Yes there are "resort fees" most of the hotels out there have them. My next visit if I go back I'd like to try the place across the street ( I think its called rumors boutique hotel). That way I can have the best of both worlds.. Coffee and Sleep and Party (across the street a HRH) If your a night owl, like loud music, its up your ally.. My personal favorite resturant was Pink Taco. GREAT happy hour!

Reviews.Title: “Once a regular guest, I will not return to the HRH”
Reviews.Author: aqp
Reviews.Content: For the past several years we have stayed at the Hard Rock an average of 6x/year. It was my favorite Vegas hotel, but due to the changes over the past year, I will not stay there again. Without detailing specific incidents here is why: Once a boutique casino that nurtured relationships with regular guests, the HRH has become like most of the other casinos in Vegas. They do not care about returning guests, just taking your money . This change coincided with the opening of the new hotel wings and the doubling of the pool and casino areas. The head of security thinks he is a cop and treats everyone as a problem. The attitude of too many of the upper level employees is "That's the way it is, I can't do anything about it", and when they say "I'm sorry" it seems they are only sorry they have to deal with a guest. Many of the hotel's staff are nice and guest-oriented, but the people to whom they report are the problem. I had the same experience when I stayed in May 2010, but was assured by HRH management that my next stay would meet my expectations. It did not. This past visit I spoke with a hotel manager, and while at the time she expressed concern and promised to get my complaints addressed, I have yet to hear back from her. I don't mind the noise and I like the party atmosphere of the hotel, but I draw the line at harassment by security and hostile attitudes. We take a lot of trips to Vegas and I'm going to try and find a hotel that will appreciate return business.

Reviews.Title: “Rock all night and party every day!”
Reviews.Author: notdex
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Nice rooms in the Paradise tower! One of the biggest pool complexes I have ever seen. I have to start out by saying that after reading some of the reviews here I went in to this experience with my eyes open. Yes the place is noisy, moreso then other casinos I've visited. You'd better like Rock music because it's everywhere all the time, except for your room - unless the pool is hoppin' Check in was swift, we waited 5 minutes - I think the trick is to check in early, since later in the afternoon there were lineups. If you do check in early you can leave your bags at the bell desk and hit the town. The beds are soft and comfy, the bathrooms are nice - maybe the shower door could leak less. The room was quiet. We were on the pool side but high enough to avoid direct exposure. If the late night noise bothers you get a mountain view room. The food choices were great, Pink Taco was a hit with us. So was Johnny Smalls. Mr Lucky has decent food, but the service is spotty getting drinks takes forever. It can also get very loud. They need some soft surfaces to soak up the sound. Never tried Nobu or Ago. Shopping is limited but the John Varvatos store has some great menswear - but make sure you have a good relationship with your banker. The casino was up to normal standards nothing to write home about. Although I did notice that it didn't seem to matter if I was playing penny or dollar slots I was still getting comp drinks. Other places I've been to aren't as generous if you roll low. The place is off the Strip, but there is a shuttle and cabs are cheap enough. Even when I've stayed on the Strip cabs are a part of getting around. If you get tired of the grub at the hotel there's a PF Changs just a bock away, and other restaurants nearby too. All in all a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service right from check-in!”
Reviews.Author: realcapricorn2001
Reviews.Content: Just checked in yesterday and I couldn't believe that hotels in Vegas are still providing terrible service. I check in at 4pm at the HRH tower on Saturday, which they tout as exclusive check-in. It's not! I walk up to a random desk and ask if it's the front desk because none of the areas are marked or labeled. Just a walkway in the middle and the front desk on the other side. It was the weirdest layout ever. If there was a line these people would be waiting in the middle of a walkway. There was only one agent on duty for Halloween weekend which I thought was silly. I try to check in and she tells me the most dreaded news: your room isn't ready! It makes no sense to tell people check in is at 3pm and check out is at 11am. You can't enforce one, but not the other. They will charge you $100 for a late check out, but when it comes to having your desired room ready "there is nothing we can do, we are short staffed in this tower and we have no idea when the room will be ready, but I can offer you a late check out". Being short of housekeepers is not my problem! I did the research, found the room, PAID for the room and now you tell me it's not ready. I tell her to drop the resort fee, which is another story, and she states they can't "you agreed to it when you paid for the room". I say "I also agreed to having the room I selected ready at 3pm". It's the HRH tower which are only suites- either a King bed or 2 queens. She eventually upgrades me, but puts me in another tower, stating "we usually charge more for the room, but we will keep you at the current rate". As if she's doing me a favor, she should have offered that from the beginning, instead of arguing with me. I waiting so long to stay at this resort and then they ruin it the moment I check-in. These people don't care about the guests whatsoever. Which brings me to valet and bell. I pull into valet (which the resort fee covers, free of charge, like it is in all resorts) but the sign is not clearly marked , it's the far far left lane, but I pull into the left lane and I wait and wait and then the attendant sees me and tells me to come back through the correct lane. Most resorts have two or three valet lanes, apparently this hotel has only one! I state to the surly guy i need a bellman to help me take some bags to my room. "Oh that's going to be a minute to find someone." (they are clearly short of staff, with 15% unemployment I don't know how) Anyway, he finds someone and he loads my bags on the cart and tells me "its going to be awhile to take it up to your room". (What's with this place) I had food trays and three bags that needed to be taken up so I could get ready and I tell him "I need the bags now, not in 20 minutes".I told him I can take the cart myself and he wouldn't let me. He tries to say the valet is busy and they will get to it. I tell him "forget it " and he walks away and says something like "I don't want to argue". He just leaves me there to load all the stuff back in my car. I find the other valet guy to get my keys back and go up 5 levels and self park! This is the beauty of the resort fee. It's a non-negotiable add on that provides no benefit. You pay more, but the service is exactly the same or worse, than if they didn't charge it. In my case much worse! The suite is nice but the bed is low to the ground, the remotes are hard to figure out, but they have DVD players and Ipod docks in the rooms for the Casino tower, which don't have balcony's, per say, but have double doors which open to the pool and are railed off . If you get one of these be prepared to hear loud music coming from the club and pool, which plays music all night long (I dozed off about 4am) even in the off season, when it's shut down. I have a little kitchenette with a bar in my room, but it lacks a fridge. I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you are looking for great guest service or any guest service.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome back...”
Reviews.Author: GregorySCarsonCity
Reviews.Content: Welcome back Mr. Smith (that really is my name) was what I heard as I exited my rental car at the HRH valet parking and at the HRH front desk! Do you even know how cool that is? I've stayed here once a month for a couple days or so each visit since Spring. Don't tell me the service here isn't quality, they remember my name! The HRH tower is a perfect trade-off for my desire to be in a party atmosphere, yet still get a good sleep for the meeting in the morning. The separate entrance and desk makes everyone feel like a VIP. Watched both World Series games (Go Giants) this week at the LUXE Lounge a few feet from the most incredibly sharp flat screen you'll find anywhere and right in front of a video-poker machine that won't let you leave! The music is loud and the people are hot and friendly... can you tell I love this place. I've stayed at most major properties in Las Vegas over the past several years, but no longer... Hard Rock is home away from home... places like Wynn, Encore, Palazzo are very, very good with the service, but are a little too aloof for my tastes and most every other place is just a "cattle-call", run 'em in, run 'em out. I also don't get the problem about the Hard Rock's supposed "hidden charges"... the resort fee, the $100 day hold, etc. is on their website, in All these reviews and has been told to me EVERY single time upon booking my reservation and upon check-in! It's not a big deal and is becoming the normor most establishments. And some comments about indifferent staff? Wow... I've never seen anything of the sort...except maybe a couple of low-roller pimp wanna-be's who came in demanding everthing. The folks at the Hard Rock make me feel very welcome! ALWAYS! My only pet peeve of the entire place and it's a very small one is that the servers in Mr. Lucky's like to hang-out behind the soda stand wall and chat (or something) while the food sits under the heat lamps. Since I usually travel alone, I've found that if I eat at the counter it eliminates that problem. BTW, the food there is outstanding, which is why I like it hot.

Reviews.Title: “Diseaster”
Reviews.Author: olive311
Reviews.Content: If i could describe my stay in one word it would be DISEASTER!!!! We had problems with our rundown room. The airconditioner wasnt working at some points making the room humid and the entrance to the balcony accumulated water on the carpet from an unknown source. Maintenance was called and the problems were fixed however we werent offered an upgrade or discount. The Sunday Rehab Pool Party was the icing on the cake that cost me over $4000 US. Being exhausted from a weekend in veags and no sleep and a couple hardcore drinks i went to go sleep on a sunchair by myself. I was woken up to being put in a wheelchair for everyone to see and taken to a room where i was clearly awake and stating that i could not go or didnt need to go to the hospital and that i did not have insurance. I am a student who got a government grant to go back to school. To make a long story short, I was restrained on a stretcher and taunted at by EMS personnel. Brought to a hospital and NOT ALLOWED TO WALK OUT AND REFUSE TREATMENT which ARE MY RIGHTS because I was restrained. I was picked and probed and finally was released after 4 hrs to friends who had to come get me. Vacation RUINED!!!!!! The next day, I went looking for management to talk about what happened. Nothing could be done about anything. I was embarrassed and humiliated!!!!! The said that there is a NO SLEEPING RULE however i feel like different measures could have been taken. And like i said, when we checked out we told front desk about our stay and all they said was "IM SORRY" So now 3 months later im getting harrassing calls about the hospital and ambulance bill i cannot pay:( Happy 30th bday at the hardrock!!!!! Ill never forget it nor will i stay there again:(

Reviews.Title: “No Customer service”
Reviews.Author: MajaNO
Reviews.Content: I booked a one week stay for a group of people (7) incl. myself at Hard Rock Hotel and I will never stay there again. First, they do not reply on Contact forms whey you contact them trough their web pages which to me is Stone Age thinking. The Front Desk has no control over bookings and the Front Desk Manager is just rude. Examples: We were told to check out one day before we were supposed to, so after arguments and showing them in writing hotel confirmation for our bookings they let us stay in the rooms for one more day, all this without any kind of apology. Not to mention that I had to be at the front desk wile each one in my group checked in as they had messed up with names and so on. I called the concierge as we needed assistance with getting a doctor for one of the guests; it took a hour before they got back to me. I can continue; hidden charges are found (or not found) everywhere, no one ever smiles at you and when first entering my room the lamp was broken, and when I tried the shower the floor outside the shower also had a shower. I must say, no wonder the staff at the Front Desk have an attitude when their Manager is a prime example of how not to treat customers.

Reviews.Title: “24 hour non-stop rock n roll”
Reviews.Author: a79flh3873
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a Monday evening and departed Friday at noon. My king-size guaranteed room was not available and was given a 2nd floor Casino tower room overlooking the air conditioners and having 2 queen beds...it was immaculate, because I don't think many people have stayed in it. I arranged a relocation to a corner room in the Paradise tower on the 6th floor. It was fantastic! dark, but comfortable. Quiet and clean...overlooking the pool. I didn't eat at any of the restaurants as the conference I attended saw to all my dining and alcohol needs. But the catered food was awesome, so that is an indication of the quality. I didn't like that people smoke in the hallways. I expected it in the casino. No time for the pool or any other amenities for that matter, it was all work. The internet in the room was fast. The bed was super-comfortable. Don't touch the munchies or you get charged, they're on sensors. The closets were clean and I used the iron, but the ironing board was too cushy, hard to press a shirt. Not many amenities in the bathroom other than soap, shampoo and conditioner, but I liked the verbena and prickly pear. Safe worked fine. Plenty of hangers.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THE 01 ROOMS IN THE HRH TOWERS!”
Reviews.Author: VinnyG927
Reviews.Content: All of the 01 corner suites in the HRH Tower are right above one of the nightclubs. The bass travels all the way up to the top floor and you can hear it in every 01 room on that side of the Tower. The front desk will not tell you this when you check in, and you will be UP ALL NIGHT waiting for the club to close for the night. I am writing this at 4am and the bass is still pounding. Just spoke to security and they say this happens all the time. How can a hotel give you a room KNOWING that the noise from the nightclub will permeate through the floors??? The woman at the front desk was a moron and not at all accomodating. This is the final time I will ever stay at this hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: gvtwkr2
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a better hotel. The staff was very professional, helpful and friendly. The room was beautiful with a spectacular view. The bars and restaurants were fantastic. The casino was fun with great music playing all the time. The music memorabilia was interesting. We had an awesome time and would recommend this hotel and casino to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Hidden charges- $15 "resort fee" is imposed like it or not”
Reviews.Author: dinornis
Reviews.Content: Most of what there is to say about this hotel has been said. All I would add is, beware the $15.00 "resort fee" that is added to your account at the beginning of the stay. This charge, which the hotel informed me is mandatory, provides two "free" visits to the spa daily and the right to use the shuttle bus to the strip (not operating at night when most people would use it!). In other words this is a hidden charge that in my mind is a total rip off. I placed several calls to management to attempt to remove the resort fee and was told it wasn't possible. Shame on the Hard Rock Hotel for forcing hidden charges on their guests!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME The Hard Rock Hotel is the BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: chuck216
Reviews.Content: The HRH tower suite is terrific, great room and good value! The staff at the Casino are simply some of the best in Vegas. The Center is the p[lace to party! Music is LOUD but that's the point! "Hard ROCK"!!!! Loved it can not wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: futuremichelesmith
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel is off the strip, it is amazing!!! Great customer service, clean, comfortable and a really nice casino. I've been to Vegas a million times and this hotel is one of the best I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Did you come here to party or WHAT?”
Reviews.Author: belligero
Reviews.Content: Basically, the title sums up my first thoughts when I first arrived on Saturday. Alice In Chains and Def Tones playing at the Joint, the Dew Tour in full swing outside. I was home again. First of all, for anyone who's looking for quiet, unpretentious hotel patrons I suggest you look elsewhere. It's called the Hard Rock, that's your first clue. Every time I've been here I have received excellent service from the staff and to me that's the most important thing. When I stay at the Hard Rock I know I'm gonna hear some great music at the tables, see some eye candy and have an amazing room to stay in. I highly recommend staying in the new HRH Towers, it's worth the price. For late night eaters, you could do a lot worse than Mr. Lucky's. The 24-hour diner style restaurant in the casino serves a wide range of delicious food at reasonable prices. The new casino expansion means you no longer have waiting lines behind the card tables, and they've expanded the slots as well. This was the 4th time I've stayed at the hotel and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “If you're there during the week and getting a spot in the sun at the pool is important to you, don't stay at the HR.”
Reviews.Author: elewisRaleigh_NC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3-night stay at the HR and our stay was great except for one big, and I mean, BIG, negative for us. First of all, as previous posters have said, the HR is a loud, fun, exciting, clean, and beautiful hotel that most people would not want to take their children to, and it's sheer paradise for 20 somethings who want to party like rock stars all night. My husband and I are not in our 20s but knew that going in and loved the atmosphere. So everything was great, except when it came to the pool. As I said, I'm not in my 20s, I'm an old married hag with two small children who I love to death and who drive me crazy, so when I'm on vacation with my husband and without my little cherubs, all I want to do is sit my old, tired behind by the pool and lie in the sun all day, read books, and drink the occasional frozen margherita if I get a wild hair. Well, as it turns out, if you're in Vegas on a weekday (and/or maybe in non-summer months?), forget about getting a chair in the sun unless you're one of the first 3 or so people to get in line as soon as the one pool area that is actually open, opens. When we walked out to the pool area, the few chairs in the sun were already taken, the big "Rehab" pool was entirely CLOSED, and the other pool, near the Sky Bar, was closed, apparently because of the "Dew" BMX event over the weekend. Anyway, not being able to just lie by the pool in the sun as we had fully expected we could do was a major turnoff for me and my husband, so much that I decided it warranted a Tripadvisor Review. Hard Rock, you are a really cool hotel, with good service, a fun atmosphere, and awesome music, but you really need to reconsider your policies about closing the pools during the week. It really makes bad sense, at least for your customers, for you to keep open the one pool that remains in the shade of the new towers except for a brief time when the sun is highest in the sky. I don't need ten women with fake boobs to be standing right there asking me if I want to order a $50 beer, either, so if you're just trying to save money you can skip that part. Just please give me a chair in the sun by a pool, any pool, and let me be the one who determines whether I get skin cancer.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Entertaining”
Reviews.Author: Caitycat
Reviews.Content: First of all, it's the Hard Rock. It's trendy, loud, and modern. Definitely not a hotel for young children or people that can't stand young adults who are there to party. With that being said, this hotel is gorgeous. While it is off the strip, you really don't need to leave the venue for much. Fantastic dining (I recommend Rare 120 and Nobu) and great music (from The Joint to simply a good selection of music in the casinos) this hotel even offers good shopping too. It is a little pricey on the weekends. There is a resort fee. However, you DEFINITELY get what you pay for. The newer rooms (I stayed in the Paradise Tower) were stunning. Absolutely gorgeous decor and the beds are to DIE for. I fell right asleep (which is hard for me typically when away from home) and didn't want to get up in the morning. One of the most comfortable hotel stays I've had. Additionally, you do NOT have to pay to valet park or park overnight. When you think about it, the mere hotel fee alone is worth this! Most resorts charge up to $20 a night to park. They only work off tips at the Hard Rock—so worth it. Great service, (I needed a Band-Aid and security had one sent up to my room within five minutes). Very clean. Yes, there are a lot of pretentious people at the pool and around the venue, but that's the crowd they cater too. Don't go to Rehab if you aren't feeling the crowd, it's a given. Some of these reviews crack me up. My stay was fabulous, and I recommend this hotel. Check it out on Sunday-Thursday nights—you can get some incredible rates. And while the hotel itself is loud and busy, my room was absolutely silent. I heard no loud guests and was not interrupted once.

Reviews.Title: “It's the HARD ROCK. Do YOUR RESEARCH PEOPLE!!”
Reviews.Author: metaltwinmama
Reviews.Content: It is very disappointing that so many people don't research where they are staying, and in turn leave poor reviews because it didn't suit their lifestyle or idea of fun. Yes, it is OFF THE STRIP. Yes, they charge a resort fee, and yes, they charge a $100 fee per night, per room for incidentals. All of these things were disclosed to me when purchasing my rooms. Yes, IT IS LOUD. NO, it is NOT kid-friendly. All things you can avoid if you stay somewhere else. For people who research hotels before deciding where to stay (like myself), if you are in Vegas to PARTY (not to relax - go stay somewhere else for that) and LIKE loud rock, you will LOVE the hard rock! Myself, my husband, his brother and wife came to celebrate my 30th & stayed 2 nights in the HRH Suites tower. Rooms were beautiful, clean and the beds were FANTASTIC! Like sleeping on a cloud! I want to run out and purchase one myself. The casino was small, which I actually enjoyed. No getting trapped in a maze, designed to keep you gambling all night. The memorabelia (sp?) throughout was very cool. We didn't do the rehab thing, as you have to get up @ 9am to get a wristband for entry, and we were still sleeping. We went to the pool up at the skybar which was nice and not too crowded on a Sunday. We didn't have any problems using the facilities (couches, etc) without a reservation or fee while there. Drinks are expensive. I'm pretty sure they would probably be at any other resort in Vegas as well. Solution - bring your own for in the room, and then you will only have to splurge on one while at the pool. Oh and yes, the mini-bar IS motion activated and there is a sign stating this. The only restaurant we ate @ in the Hotel was the Pink Taco - DELICIOUS & super service. There is a lot to do in the HR itself, so you don't really NEED to go to the strip, but if you are catching a show or what-not, it is about a $25 cab ride (one way). Way cheaper than a DUI! If you want to relax, or are in Vegas for work or a family vacation, I wouldn't recommend staying @ the HRH. If you are there to party, it's def the place for you! If you want to come party, but still need to get to bed early at some point, to catch a flight or something of that nature, I recommend ear plugs or some other sleep aid. We will be back for sure!! **Oh, one last tip: If you are staying in the HRH suite tower, there is a separate (closer) parking garage off Harmon. There is a separate check-in desk, which is directly inside from the entrance from said parking structure.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Montoya42
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay in Vegas. Was at Aria for a few days and the atmosphere and experience was totally awesome. can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “GET AN OVERDRAUGHT”
Reviews.Author: RobboNHayley
Reviews.Content: From the first minute we arrived at the hotel the receptionist wanted an extra $30.00 a day paid up front! which we were unaware of, as we arrived late we decided to sleep, having just dozed off we were awaken by the loudest music like someone was partying in our room! so no sleep. Next day we asked to be moved, which the staff agreed to, however no sleep there either unfortunately and no view either! party people next door had parties every night until we left! on the last night as we had a long flight home so my husband phoned reception on five different occasions to ask for security to just ask them to turn it down a bit, nobody came, so no sleep at all for the whole week, when I complained I was told "your in vegas!" The mini bar was a complete rip off $10 for a small bottle of water.......so I filled my fridge with supermarket water at only $0.50 I then looked at my online check out bill and to my dismay I had been billed $250 as it was weight censored and they thought id eaten everything, after a phone call to reception I was informed that the fridge was not for my personal use! even though I was paying $150 a night to stay there. Dont even get me started on the pretentious pool, If you dont get up at the crack of dawn the rehab staff will have reserved all the loungers for their friends, so you have to pay $200 for the privilege of sitting around your own hotels pool while the "joe public" get to lay for free on the beds! oh and you cannot take your own water to the pool either it gets confiscated on the way in so you have to buy theirs at $10 a go! This hotel is a good walk away from the strip, and its not the best walk either shanty town springs to mind, so husband spent a small fortune in cabs and tips getting us there and back. All in all if you have plenty of money you are prepared to re mortgage your house you love loud music and pretentious chicks in tiny bikinis, oh and of course sleep deprivation this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “They just dont care”
Reviews.Author: Chronicle_Clothing
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the new HRH Tower for my 25 Wedding aniversary and it was fantastic but....staff were rude, the pool day beds in the SKY Bar are not for use unless you reserve them so dont asume you can use them, and there are no sighns, you will be kicked off by the "Pool Manager" so young girls can take your place which is very embarrassing. Venues take over the site facilities including pools and there is limited access...even to paying guests. They do not play rock music at the Sky Bar it is club music an quite irratating after a few hours. the est of the hotel plays great rock music which is one of the good points. Even if you are a paying guest you get no special treatment. Desk clerks are of no use and there is no help at all from the staff. althouth the rooms are great value for money, a can of Corona is $9.00 so beware of high costs for everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Dark and Loud”
Reviews.Author: Islander865
Reviews.Content: Was at the Hard Rock for a work conference. This hotel is off the "strip" so to get to the "strip" you had to take a short cab ride. You could walk but its a bit of a hike and I would never walk there in the dark/evening as it resembles back alleyways. The hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly so this was a plus. The biggest problem was it was the music is piped in everywhere and is soooo loud. You couldn't find a place to meet for a drink and conversation. Even in the elevators at 8am its blaring rock music. If you are 20-30 years old and like loud music all the time then this is the place for you! Younger adults definitely had the run of the place--booze and bikinis everywhere. We all also found it to be very dark. The walls, the tiles, the clothes cabinets are all mostly black. The light in the bathrooms is so dark you can hardly see to get showered/makeup/hair etc. The casino atmosphere is also very dark, nothing like the ones on the main street. I would never come back to this hotel, but if you are up for a party then be sure and check in here.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel and Casino: I miss you already!”
Reviews.Author: GoodTimesG
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas for my best friends' wedding, which took place at another hotel and was amazing. As I was the Best Man, I was in town for 6 nights to help them in preparations and to have a bachelor party. This was my first Vegas experience, and I enjoyed so much of it. The Hard Rock was a great (perfect) place to be, even as a solo traveler (all of our friends and families were staying at different hotels in town). I did have a check-in issue, in which the front desk agent authorized the wrong credit card (which thankfully was declined due to fraud prevention- it was a debit card), and the situation was then corrected when a different front desk agent took over and authorized the correct card which I had presented. I was slightly stressed about that initially, but as the days went by, I loved the place more and more that by the time I left, I was really sad to leave! I enjoyed the Beach Club, including Skam Saturdays, Johnny Small's, Pink Taco, even Brannon Hair, and the Luxe and Center Bars, whose bartenders were friendly and welcoming. The Rock Fitness Center was particularly well-done too. I wasn't admitted to Skybar because I was not in beach attire or Vanity because it was too late (around 2:30 am Sunday night), but I'll check them out next time. Music was great all throughout the resort. I stayed in the Casino Tower, whose rooms are contemporary and very spacious. The trip was a blast. I'll definitely be returning to the Hard Rock Hotel ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Awwwsom”
Reviews.Author: Lonestar61
Reviews.Content: Great place to spend a couple of days while in Vegas. Good food, nice views and plenty of help on getting around. The pool was great to hang out at and the night life was rocking!

Reviews.Title: “The time of our lives!”
Reviews.Author: alexandrab87
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Hard Rock Hotel in Las Vegas, NV. When we arrived to the hotel, it was around 10 p.m. We were informed that our room was not yet ready and that it would be about another half hour-45 minutes. We didn't mind much that we had to wait once we were there, so we played around on some slot maches for a few. Once we came back to check if our room was ready, we had been told that because of the inconveince that we were recieving a compliementary upgrade. We ended up staying the in brand new HRH Tower. Amazing room with an beautiful view of Vegas and the pool area. We had such a wonderful time and that free upgrade really started the trip off on the best note possible.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, Dirty rooms, Awful Service. STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: johnnyburns
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Hard Rock Las Vegas with 5 friends. We booked a Celebrity Suite with an adjoining Queen Room for 4 nights (Thursday - Monday). Booking the rooms: Their systems are from the stone age. Every time we rang to check rates, we would get a different reservations person who would quote a vastly different price. They didn't seem to have any system in place and seemed to nearly make up the prices on the spot! But that wasn't the worst of if by a long shot...! The Rooms, Hotel, & Staff: As mentioned we had 5 guys sharing a Suite and adjoining Queen Room. There is basically nothing in these rooms that you need. We had to call down to reception to get the ipod connection and roll out bed we were promised would be in our room. In fairness they did come pretty promptly once called. The main en Suite bathroom in the Suite was covered in dust and dirt (I will also upload a photo). On night 1 I went down to reception to tell them and was told by the girl on reception that it "wasn't her problem". I asked to speak to see the duty manager and was told there was none on duty. I asked them to call a duty manager and they eventually agreed. I spoke to Laura the duty manager and she seemed like she was going to be able to do something about it. She also said that she would make it up to us in terms of getting access to the club (Vanity) etc...That we would be looked after. She said if we returned to our room that someone would be in touch very shortly. We went back to the room and waited about 45mins for a housekeeping representative. When they arrived (2 of them) they took one look at the bathroom, said it was disgraceful, but then left never to be seen again! Next day we went to play golf and when we got back the bathroom was still exactly the same. Hadn't been touched. I went back down to reception again. They had no record of my previous complaint and didn't seem to care less. They also had no record about the club access we had been promised. In fact they said that the Hard Rock have nothing to do with Vanity niteclub and it is completely run by a third party. They also made me feel like a 2nd class citizen because I was staying in the main Hotel and not in their new HRH Towers. Even though the bill for our stay in the hotel was relatively large as we were staying in suite + queen. At this point I gave up as I was starting to get stressed about it and that's not what you want when you are away with a group of friends in vegas! I was extremely sorry and embarrassed that I had recommended the Hard rock hotel to my friends. I understand that Vegas is suffering as well as most places with Global recession but this surely can't be the way out of it! I've stayed in 5 other hotels in Vegas over the years (cheaper and more expensive hotels) but have never seen such poor service or manners in my life. Really disappointed. Stay somewhere else. JB Ps. the bathroom still wasn't clean on departure!

Reviews.Title: “$8 glass of Ice Tea - no refills!”
Reviews.Author: Unknown14
Reviews.Content: Let me start this review with the good things about Hard Rock - Las Vegas 1. The displays and art work are fabulous! 2. Food is not bad and fairly reasonable. 3. Rooms are beautiful 4. Pools are beautiful 5. ReHab is funny! Now for the issues 1. $8 for a glass of iced tea by the pool is non refillable 2. You can not bring a drink from anywhere else in the complex into the pool 3. Half of the pools are closed during the week 4. The rehab pool is only available for rehab 5. You must be betting 25 cents or more on the slots or drinks are not free, this change while I was winning on the nickel slots. 6. No crowd control for guests bringing their luggage through the rehab lines 7. slow lines at check in - no waitress offering refreshments

Reviews.Title: “Fun TImes for a young crowd”
Reviews.Author: fannyfance
Reviews.Content: had a bast at Hard Rock. Went for Labor Day Weekend and thoroughly enjoyed the stay. Rehab is a must, we got on a guest list, so it was less expensive, and worth it for sure. Rooms were clean. Only downfall was the noise level in the room during the day from the pool dj's (but I guess we shouldn't be sleeping during the day!)

Reviews.Title: “Funky Hotel shame it's off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Tommayes83
Reviews.Content: I must admit that I booked into this hotel as it was the cheapest big name hotel that I could find in Vegas. I was slightly worried when reading reviews saying that the staff were rude and unhelpful. However in our experience this was not the case. Everbody from the valet to front desk to the bar staff were all helpful and extremely friendly! The room was clean and very spacious with a very welcomed walk in shower. The pools were fun although being toward the end of summer and a week day some of the pools were closed. The only thing wrong with our entire stay was that on the first night there was a Greatful Dead concert going on in the hotel. This resulted in there being quite literally 100s of smelly hippies hanging about, including one chap who was walking around the hotel barefoot with his dog!!

Reviews.Title: “Great music, Great atmosphere, Great room, Great gaming = Great Time”
Reviews.Author: tuchek
Reviews.Content: When I go to Vegas, I prefer a "one property stay" - meaning I'm hanging at that hotel 24 \ 7. I'm there to gamble and have a great time. Been to Vegas ~ 10 times, but never stayed at the Hard Rock. I love my music, and booked the King deluxe room. I brought some CDs because it looked like a great sound system with CD player and Bose stereo. I got a free upgrade to the HRH tower. AWESOME ROOM and FANTASTIC SOUND SYSTEM with your personal "juke box". There is an LCD built into the wall and you can pick pop hits, hard rock's best, best of 80's, best of 70's, country etc. Coming back to the room between gaming sessions, it was awesome to crank up the tunes. Arrived Wednesday 7 PM - left Saturday 2 PM. The casino action and energy was light Wednesday night through Thursday afternoon, but I'm sure it's that way just about everywhere at those times. By Thursday early evening, it was rocking and it stayed that way until I left Saturday afternoon. The women coming in for the nightclub action was non-stop. Trendy spot for the younger crowd, but a good mix of people of all ages. The RockStar Club was awesome. I earned $4 in slots and $68 on my blackjack play for the 4 day stay. I played just as much at every other casino on previous stays and most I was ever comped was a free buffet. I was shocked Saturday morning when I learned I earned $72 and they threw in a free bottle of wine (which would run you ~ $30 - so my total comp was more like $100). Got a free t-bone steak and eggs breakfast and hit the gift shop. Had a great time. The suite upgrade really set it off. I will be back and the HRH Tower is well worth a few extra bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Nickle and Dimed to DEATH!!”
Reviews.Author: futureman44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with another couple spent a long weekend at this hotel in mid September. Our plan was to enjoy the pool all day, and the nightlife in the evening along with some gambling sprinkled in. When we arrived, they would not let us check in at 2:30pm because our room was not ready. However we watched numerous people check in to the Casino Tower after they told us to wait. We ventured out to the pool where we were hit for $9.00 a piece Miller Lite's. The next day we ventured to the West beach and had lunch. I ordered a Turkey Club and my wife got a chix wrap. There was barely any chicken in the wrap and all they serve is the sandwich. No pickles, no fries, coleslaw, etc. My wife ordered a diet coke and was charged $8.00 for no refill. I ordered water and they came back with a cup of ice and said the water fountain was behind me. The bill for two sandwiches and a diet coke was $44.00. The next 2 days we went off site due to prices and small portions. Try Capriotti's sandwich shop across the street....incredible! Before you are allowed in the pool, they search your bag like you are a criminal. Not to mention you cannot bring in any outside beverages. Our friend had a Starbucks coffee bought on site and they refused to let him enter the pool. This was at 11am in the morning. Once we got out to the pool, security searched our bags again!!. They also told us the pool was closed when we arrived at 10am. We asked, "can't we sit in the sun?" After thinking about it they gave us permission to sit in the sun but absolutely no going in the pool until 10:30am The pool scene at the HR is entirely overrated. You almost feel sorry for the crowd that is there. 20 something posers and pathetic. Or old men trying to pick up women. When we asked security why the vigilance in searching bags, they said they are not concerned with booze or weed, mainly drugs and weapons. That was a bit disconcerting On a positive side, they play great rock and roll music all through the property. The Pink Taco restaurant has 1/2 price apps and BOGO beers which was very reasonable. We also enjoyed playing blackjack by the pool in our bathing suits. I would not stay here again. They suck you in with a cheap room and then charge you high prices for EVERYTHING. They charge a $15 resort fee that does not include internet access??? They are also off the strip which forces you to cab it everywhere I would recommend the Palazzo or Venetian, or Mandalay Bay. Both for the service and atmosphere and a much better pool scene

Reviews.Title: “Best Pool around”
Reviews.Author: rayu66
Reviews.Content: What to expect from a Hard Rock Hotel & Casino? My first stay and I liked it. Since I am not into casinos or gambling at all I cannot make any notes about this. When arriving e got up-uo-graded to a huge suite with a great view to the pool. The ppol area is just great, one of the best I have ever seen. They even have sand beaches in there and of course alot of bars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: DolphinsVan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Hard Rock We were 5 buddies who were all celebrating our 40th birthday year and trying to pretend were still 25 We booked two basic Casino mountain view rooms – at check-in we were automatically upgraded to Casino Pool View – We loved the rooms 838 and 840 – we were facing the pools and had the strip in the background – Two of our friends smoked so it was nice you could open the patio doors and air out the rooms – Casino tower is the oldest ones but are the only ones with the opening french doors - Beds are very comfortable – Liked the flat scene TV and hooked up our Ipods to the stereo – at 6 PM one night when the pools were closing – two sets of couples put on white a show in the pools for us until they were asked to leave Yes there is a $15 resort tax and no free internet and don’t touch the mini-bar – you been warned And yes you do have to cab to the strip but we would usually only want to go out once a day The hotel has a real vibe to it – We loved the music in the casino, the pole dancers, the dealers in lingerie and all the young people I would not bring my wife or kids to this resort – pick another The pools are beautiful. They do juggle which parts are open on which days We left on the Sunday and missed the big Rehab party but went to a smaller one on the Saturday for free called SKAM Saturday – I would say it was 5-1 guys though that day, a lot of meatheads standing in the pool waiting for some women to come by -.$10 beers and $15 mixed drinks Went to Vanity twice – On the Saturday night, the Shannon twins were celebrating the 21st birthday- Lots of scenery and a real good vibe – Club Host Chris Coletta was very polite and helpful getting us in the place Some friends went to the Gun Store and loved firing off AK47s – Went to Bellagio buffet and had a great meal – walked across the street to Hofbrauhaus for some great German foods, 1 litre lager steins, buy some shots and asked to be paddled- a experience you will never forget– Luckys 24-7 is just OK and can get slow Was worried about the staff from some reviews but everyone was extremely nice to us – We had no problem with security or bringing alcohol up to our room to pregame So if you are planning an all guys or all girls trip do consider the HRH

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel but inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: angelina8756
Reviews.Content: Hotel was awesome. Rooms were clean, service and food were fantasic, decor and theme were amazing, but even though they had a free shutlle that runs from 10-5 we had to spend a lot of money on cabs going back and forth from the strip. Shuttle only runs every hour and drops you off behind the fashion show mall. Hotel is perfect if you aren't going to the strip all the time. Beds were comfortable, cocktail waitresses were terrible in the casino (took forever and not very friendly) but that seems to be consistent everywhere. Pool waitresses were more frequent but still somewhat unfriendly. Everyone else was great. Mr. Lucky's had great food at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: sol72
Reviews.Content: I had a great time, I loved being off the strip and away from the crowds. I love to watch the planes take off and land; I had a great view of the pool area and the airport, as well as some of the strip hotels. Everyone on the staff I came into contact with was cordial and professional. The Pink Taco had the best Mexican food I've ever eaten! If I hadn't been out, I would have eaten every meal there. The hotel offers very nice amenities as well. I loved the room also. Not (girly) romantic, but efficient and businesslike, while being trendy. The beds were some of the most comfortable I've ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: traveler100036
Reviews.Content: This room was very comfortable and in style. The decor was beautiful. The bathroom sink was black so we could see that it wasn't cleaned or that there was soap build up. The maids were nice and did a pretty good job but they totally disregarded our privacy sign. They walked in our room without knocking when we were in bed sleeping. There was a shuttle service that drives you to the strip but it didn't run all night. For a city that never sleeps, you'd think that they would run the shuttle after 6pm. We tried to walk back from the strip and it's not as close as it seems.

Reviews.Title: “Edgey atmostphere, great room, and average service”
Reviews.Author: chitownshandi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at HRH for a convention this Sept. Check in - first impression - received less than admirable service. She didn't like that my id and reservation had different last names, she checked my info numerous times and checking with someone in the back, she took my credit card - no thanks, no apologies for inconvenience, little to no direction to my room. The HRH tower suite is a must have, very spacious and a great music system. I ate breakfast several times at Lucky's 24/7 - outstanding staff and food. We made some purchases at the gift shop,and used the doormen for taxi's often - all were smooth and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do Coke in the Bathroom if your're Famous!!!”
Reviews.Author: JamesR6
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, I love the pool with the bar. The gambling was cool, I must have played blackjack for 5 hours wasting time and came out ahead after drinks and all. The rooms were very clean and decent sized. I will come back again in the future. ** As a side note, to any famous people; do not use drugs in the Hard Rock Hotel. They and their staff are out to get you, because they are jealous and don't like famous partying guests. Ask Bruno Mars, he'll tell ya.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock is all you have to say.”
Reviews.Author: Firestation22
Reviews.Content: The new Hard Rock Tower are all suites and man they're spectacular. Try a corner suite, rooms that end in '00'(pool view) or '30' (strip view). They are worth the upgrade. Best room view in Vegas. The Hard Rock is just far enough away from the strip to enjoy some relaxation and not be lost in a mega casino.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - I have a Hard Rock Hangover and I need to go back!”
Reviews.Author: LGauer
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying that my friend received promotional comps and savings, so her previous stay and gaming at the Hard Rock is what brought us back. I did not pay for the room, I don't know what the rates are, I only paid for my flight and fun so I didn't have high expectations - I was happy to have a girl's getaway. That being said, I had the BEST experience at the Hard Rock that I've ever had in Vegas (and I have been many times and stayed in many different hotels). We were truly treated like rockstars, even when we were utlizing our free cabana and not spending as much as a real rockstar would. The staff, from front desk to Rockstar club, bell desk to bartenders, cabana hosts and servers, were all extremely friendly. The resort spent over $350 million to make the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino an "oasis in the desert", a place you'd never want to leave, and they have truly succeeded. From the moment we walked in, I knew I'd never stay at another hotel in Vegas (and that was BEFORE all the great experiences!) The music, the vibe, even the smell (what is that, patchouli? Nag champa?) - all of your senses are awakened and you know you are in for a good time. We stayed in the Pool Tower and the room was very nice (although the lighting in the shower area is a bit dark). My only complaint is that I must've gotten the worst bed in the hotel, because everyone talks about how comfy they were and mine slanted to the right so much that I had to stack pillows on that side to keep from rolling off! We had great food and service at Mr. Lucky's, and also at the tapas restaurant (can't remember the name, something "Smalls" I think - Johnny Smalls?). The Happy Hour at the tapas restaurant is great - several plates for $4 and 2-for-1 drinks. It was the perfect way to end a day at the pool before beginning your night out! We also ate at the Pink Taco, but I may have chosen the wrong dish. I wasn't impressed with the fish tacos, but the salsas were good and we enjoyed the marachi band playing that evening. The pool areas are wonderful, but you do have to get there early for the best spots. However, if you can't snag a lounge, the small chairs were perfect for the lower-depth pool areas. Even better is having the cabanas! Our host, Blade, was very friendly and checked in with us several times throughout the day. Our waitress was also attentive. The cabana was clean and comfortable. And yes, there is a lot of great scenery - beautiful men and women everywhere! I thought it was the best experience of the entire trip until... Reliquary. Oh. My. Goodness. The best use of my time and money during the entire trip. In fact, if I had known about all of the amenities provided (for any spa service!), I would've spent the entire day there! The Roman pool was so beautiful and relaxing, and one of the staff even came by to ask if I needed anything, and brought me another bottle of water. The steam room was huge (and steamy). The showers were clean and I was impressed with all of the toiletries provided. I had a 50-minute massage from Channel and let me tell you, it was the best massage I've had in my entire life (and I've had a few)! I will definitely go back to the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino (the sooner, the better) and would recommend it to anyone who loves rock music, the party atmosphere, and rockstar service (even when you are using every single comp)!

Reviews.Title: “Awful service, given a free downgrade to a room worse than what had been paid for”
Reviews.Author: Pony_19
Reviews.Content: Be wary of booking a room at this hotel through a third party travel agent. We booked a Supreme room in the new HRH tower and paid for this in advance. When I checked in, a glance at my room key showed me we had received a room in the inferior Paradise tower. When I confronted hotel staff about this, their explanation was weak at best. I stay in a lot of hotels due to work, but never in my life have I been downgraded to a cheaper room when I have paid for the more expensive one. No apologies from the hotel staff either, or any decent sweeteners to compensate for the fact that they had ruined our stay. Service as a whole was pretty awful - several times we placed orders for new towels/glasses/room service that either took longer than expected to be delivered or didn't arrive at all. Location is terrible - the hotel is situated way off strip. If you want to sleep during the day, forget it. The sound system at Rehab will keep you from doing so. My room stunk of weed and a significant number of guests appeared to be under the influence of drugs. Defo a hotel to avoid if you're in a family. Rehab was the only plus side of this terrible experience

Reviews.Title: “I have to come back ;-)”
Reviews.Author: AnnaNorlander
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, all that equipment from our idols, the music. We loved the room and the atmosphere. The only negative was that you have to pay extra for wifi and that there was no coffeemaker in the room. It was not that noisy as some people writing about.

Reviews.Title: “Keep the fun out of the pool”
Reviews.Author: artvandalay1
Reviews.Content: New rooms are awesome, but if you want a true Sin City experience, stay clear. Massive security keeps entertainment away and a huge police and staff security at the Rxhab entrance. Dont think you can sneak anything into the pool area. EVERYTHING you bring into the pool will be searched. Inside of wallets/ money clips, zippers in purses are not off limits. Easier security at an international airport on 9/11....you will spend the night in Carson County's free hotel, with several others who didn't head this warning....stay clear of Hard Rock and MGM if you want to party... that being said, if you just want a good hotel and limited night life this will work for you....but there are many other better hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE TOWER 4 STARS! PERSONNEL & FACILITIES LACKING; WOULD NOT RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: bowman716
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas at least 3 times per year and maintain silver status with Starwood and Marriott. This is an honest review. The Good Stuff: My reservation was made directly through Hard Rock at a rate of $70.00 per night. Room was large and beautifully furnished. Decor and colors are true to the Hard Rock image. Charcoal and silver wall paper, leather accents, mirrored surfaces, embossed carpet and a dry bar for making drinks. 46' Sony Bravia TV is impressive. My king bed was ubber comfrontable with excellent linens and pillows. Bathroom has 2 sinks with separate toilet and shower. Hotel offers many good dining options. Pink Taco, Rare 120 and Mr. Lucky's all offered excellent food, personable service and were affordable. I don't know about room service... Areas that need help: Arriving at the hotel no one offered to help me with my 3 bags or open either double set of doors. My check-in experience sucked! Arrived at 2:45 on a Monday, room was'nt ready until 3:45. Was never offered to have my bags checked, no apology... nothing. I confirmed 2 days before my arrival the bed type, arrival time and other requests (non-smoking, extra pillows, etc) the front desk guy said nothing came up under my reservation? Additionaly the front desk staff ware printed white tee shirts as uniforms. This looks truly unprofessional and cheep... Burnt out light bulbs everywhere in the original casino, public areas and memorabilia displays. TV and programing did'nt work properly the entire stay (6 days). "On Demand" options are very limited and expensive. Never had enouph towels for 2 people. Each request for more towels took an hour to fill when I was told 10-15 minutes. Toiletries are of poor quality. Vegas is a very dry environment; all other hotels provide lotion and shower gel, not the Hard Rock. Bathroom is very dark with insufficient lighting. No coffee maker in room. There's a Starbucks in the hotel but not close. $15.00 per day resort fee??? Considering the pools were never all opened, the gym is an additonal $20.00 per day, no in-room free high speed internet and no priority or reduced fee into thier nightclubs; this is a complete scam!!! Check out was'nt any better, Had to wait 12 minutes in line to simply get a receipt... Conclusion: There are many nice properties in Vegas; The Hard Rock with some major help could be one of them. Regardless of a low room rate, would not stay here again or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Fees”
Reviews.Author: NiallJohnston
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days during September with my partner. The resort is amazing and very well maintained, we had a fantastic suite in the HRH Tower, which I can fully recommend. However, we were charged 15$ a day resort fee when we checked in, this wasn't included when reserving the room online. As i said it is an amazing resort, 5 pool areas etc. However, the my entire stay, 3 of the 5 pool areas where closed, if you went into the area, security should very quickly move you out. This was quite frustrating because if you did arrive at the 2 pool areas that were open before 11am, you would not be able to get a sun lounger and would have to settle for just a chair, normally out of the sun. It was quite frustrating to be charged a resort fee when more than 50% of the resort was closed. I've stayed at the Hard Rock Orlando, which was also a great resort and the arson for me choosing Hard Rock in Vegas. However, the staff, especially at the poolside and bars are much friendlier with less attitude in Orlando. No coffee facilities within the room which was an obvious omission for such a great suite, there is a star bucks in the complex, but quite a walk, so not ideal when you first wake up in the morning and crave some coffee. Please also be aware that the hotel will take a deposit of 100$ per day of your stay in case of damages when you checkin. For those who are planning a long vacation and do not have unlimited credit on their card, this is something to consider, especially as it isn't evident when you reserve online. Also, once I got home and inspected my bill I realized I had been charged several times for services including dry cleaning which i didn't use. I should have noticed this at check-out however I was late for my flight.

Reviews.Title: “HRH Tower”
Reviews.Author: Dano35
Reviews.Content: just got back from another stay in the HRH Tower. Had a great time but did expierence some small issues this trip. The rooms are starting to show some wear, which kind of surprised me since these rooms in the HRH Tower are still pretty new. Found baby powder that got on the wall from previous people, like they sprayed it over the room for fun (not a big deal just grabbed a cloth and wiped it off). The light hanging over the picture was crooked, so I adjusted that back. Marks on the wall that I wiped off with a cloth since it was bugging me. I called housekeeping to get two robes that were missing after we checked in and they never came. The next day went to the front desk and requested them and also to request the music jukebox be fixed since it was freezing up, the lady at the front desk apologized and said she'll have it taken care of. We came back later that night and found the robes hanging in the bathroom and the jukebox fixed. Everyone we came in contact with were nice and always smiled and said hello and asked if we needed anything. Found a light in the hallway that the shade was left hanging off (I had to put it back on, it was bugging me!). I feel to take ownership since I love this hotel and hate to see it get trashed by people who don't care. We had a great time in the casino, always love the vibe here. Played blackjack and always had a friendly dealer (Connie was the best, really made it fun!). Cocktail service was also great. Ate at Johnny Smalls and loved it (try the mac daddy, it's awesome!). Also ate at the Pink Taco and Lucky's (always great). This is our favorite hotel and we always stay here at least 2-3 times a year. The minor issues we expierenced this trip were not a big deal to us, It happens and you just deal with it. Hard Rock has always made us feel welcome and gives us great deals through Rock Star club to come back and we always do! Already planning our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel - Please bring back the Glory Days”
Reviews.Author: Chogar
Reviews.Content: I was at the Hard Rock for it's Grand Opening in the mid 90's. It was indeed a game changer. Peter Morton was the man! There was no hotel like it in Vegas. So when a bunch of old friends decided to have a reunion in Vegas - We thought the HRH was the perfect spot to relive the good ole days since many a great story and possibly a case of Herpes for our close friend Rubin. The recent renovations and new owners made it an even more exciting venture. We arrived Thursday for a long weekend. Check in was spotty, We had requested rooms on the same floor. The front desk did nothing to accommodate other than to tell us we did not request it. *I always love when someone in a service industry tells you it's your fault and your problem that they cannot make you happy. But, honestly, all check ins at most hotels always seem to go wrong. Finally got to the rooms (scattered thru floors and towers of the hotel.) And yes, the rooms are great. Well done Morgans!!! As a guy who goes to Vegas 5-6 times a year, I feel I have a good lay of the land and honestly am writing this in hopes that the hotel picks up on these suggestions as they seem more than willing to make the changes they need to make this place ROCK! Comfortable and well laid out -- They have captured the HR spirit. The hotel is so close to becoming a cool hip destination. The problem again is the service. Housekeeping is weak and spread to thin. Calls to Front Desk for anything are a complete waste of time. We had AC issues and they were ignored, But let's be real. This is Vegas and the room is only a place to hold your bags and nurse the hangover, As for the casino -- Again a really cool vibe. Service is adequate. Cocktail girls aren't what they used to be but there are a few winners. Doormen and security are to cool for school. They need to remember they are al part of making the guest feel comfortable. the new dining options are a huge step up. All in all, the hotel is moving in the right direction, as should be expected form the perfect management for this kind of hotel - The Morgans Group. They have always been cutting edge of hoteliers. Ultimately, I think REHAB (HR's key draw and moneymaker) and the TRU tv show create a bit of a conflict. The hotel aspires to be one thing but the TV show sends out a different kind of message. Bottom line -- The hotel has all the tools to be trendy boutique it once was and damn am I rooting for it. I guess only tie will tell and I definitely will give it another chance - But in the winter when rehab has closed and maybe the crowd the HR is designed for hopefully shows up. If not, back to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “made us feel very welcome”
Reviews.Author: ssummer913
Reviews.Content: I love the Hard Rock Hotel! We had a beautiful suite in the Paradise Tower which is away from the main part so was much more quiet. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. We are not the "Rehab" crowd but really enjoy the music and vibe. I like that it feels smaller and more manageable than the huge hotels on the strip. The new spa was fabulous!!

Reviews.Title: “Only if you do not want to sleep, like substandard service and have money to burn”
Reviews.Author: keylon
Reviews.Content: Pull out your wallet - this hotel charges for EVERYTHING! Our experience when we booked 20 rooms for a wedding. Room $400 per night, Maintaining the grounds fee $15 per day per room. Work out room per visit $20. Plan to smell illegal drugs and smoke everywhere - even inside your private room, fumes waft from hallways and other rooms. Do not plan to sleep- loud banging in hallways and other rooms all night each night. Swear words I did not know existed and many fights among couples. Paying for a pool view room gets you one small sliver of water nothing like the entire pool and it is mot the pool where the rehab party is held. The hotel staff have been trained very well to look at the guest smile and say we will do that or yes and then NOTHING happens. May we get extra towels? Yes, but none show up. over and over again - examples of this tyoe of scene -- they say yes but do nothing. If you choose this hotel you have done it only to say you stayed at the Hard Rock because I can promise there are much better hotels at much better prices and with superior service in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: Sammmantha
Reviews.Content: This hotel never fails to impress me. Stayed with a group of 22 friends this weekend and had a blast. Almost all of our rooms were upgraded without question. Best Vegas trip I have ever had! I recommend this hotel for the younger party crowd!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the negative reviews. Service is awful.”
Reviews.Author: HRHsux
Reviews.Content: Beware. If you book through an online provider you will be charged additionally when you arrive at the hotel. The pool is crowded, with limited seating. Pool bar staff will treat you like dirt, a common theme in this hotel. Anything negative you've read about the service is 100% true. The staff has a bad attitude. Noticeable as soon as you check in. Book a hotel on the strip. It's better located and the staff will treat you like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “What a Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: HannuVantaalta
Reviews.Content: I am a BIG fan of Hard Rock Cafes (visited more than 50 HRC's around the world), so naturally the Hard Rock Hotel was my choice on my trip to Las Vegas. But what a great disappointment it was. It started right from the check in and continued throughout my two-night stay. The staff was unfriendly in every department. The room was OK, but not very well maintained: the safe was not working at all, the desktop lamp switch was broken and the internet access cost $15/24hrs and it didn't work either! The most I have paid before that for the internet access had been $3/24hrs, but usually it is totally free. A maintenance guy came to my room to fix the internet connection and took at the same time the desktop lamp with him to get it fixed, with a promise to bring it back later that day. Well, I never saw that lamp again. The pool area is nice but they only had about 1/3 of it open (the nicest parts remained closed), although the pool chairs were practically 100% occupied. I got the impression that the hotel was not doing very well at all and it reflected to the staff. In order to compensate the declining occupancy levels, the management had decided to charge extras where ever possible (internet, $15 "resort fee" per day...) resulting dissatisfied customers, like me. It breaks my heart to say that I can not recommend HRH Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Stylish”
Reviews.Author: Swim4speed
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel this past weekend. The location of the hotel is within a 5 minute drive of the strip, but is not within walking distance. Pros: The hotel is very modern and stylish. The room was excellent and the elevators were fast. It was not noisy around my room. Parking was very good, although I did NOT have to deal with a Saturday night concert crowd because Sheryl Crow canceled that night. Cons: There was a $16.80 “resort fee” per night which kind of sucks. Their cable TV was not good. They need more channels and a better guide. I would definitely considering returning to the Hard Rock Hotel in the future!

Reviews.Title: “smile. you will enjoy this.”
Reviews.Author: kathrynannax
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel has two different personalities. During in the week , it is quieter and stylish, but still with a definite party vibe. At the weekend, it becomes and eye popping collection of beautiful people who want to be seen, which inevitably changes the feel of the hotel. Two holidays in one if you stay for a week ! In terms of rooms, and cleanliness, I cannot fault the hotel (be sure to leave a tip for your cleaner each morning, this made a Huge difference) . The rooms are luxurious, spacious, glamorous and comfortable. facilities are great, massive choice of places to eat, at reasonable value, Pink Taco was my favourite, and genuinely good food. Service was absolutely fine, I was nervous about this aspect because of the negativity on the reviews, but everyone I came into contact with was polite, friendly and helpful, even the busy security guards on Rehab day. If you come at the weekend, you have to a different pool experience than in the week,, so if you want to just relax, this may not be the place. Distance from the strip, a good half hour, fine in the evening, tough in the afternoon. it's 6/7 dollars taxi ride, so again if this is likely to annoy you, get a hotel on the strip. I really enjoyed being away from the traditional Vegas lunacy ( only swapped for a slightly different version) There are extra costs that are a little irritating, nightclub entry, resort fee etc. but these are clearly stated, if this kind of thing bothers you, again choose an alternative. I loved the Hard Rock, and would stay here again if I ever returned to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The only review you need to read for this Vegas hot spot”
Reviews.Author: RollinCubes
Reviews.Content: This will be an in-depth detailed review of the Hard Rock Hotel and almost everything inside its doors. The first thing to be noticed about HRH is the music. It’s loud! It gives that rock and roll party atmosphere that you were promised from the get go. At the check in counter we were greeted by a very friendly front desk clerk, Derrick I believe was his name. He was very good at engaging us in conversation, finding a common interest we shared, and then chatting about it to pleasantly pass the time while he found our reservations and placed us in an available room. He also explained up front the mini bar in our room was pressure sensitive so to be careful, and that we would have to come back to get wrist bands for the pool on the weekend, I was very appreciative of the up front information. The room was great. It had a very modern design, black whites and grays, very comfortable beds, nice decent size bathroom with a pretty big tub and stand in shower, lights in the mirrors, plenty of storage space, and we actually got a free upgrade to a pool view which if you plan to stay up late throughout your trip I would highly recommend it. The music from the pool penetrates your room with little resistance till pretty late in the morning, so if you have a bed time, I would suggest a different room…or hotel. Also there is a large wall mounted flat screen TV. That really just makes the room look impressive. The casino was by far the best thing about this hotel. Most of the gambling staff was amazing; we would literally come to gamble just to hang out with these awesome people. There were defiantly a few bad apples, some staff just didn’t seem to understand that everyone was there to get drunk and have a good time, but the good ones more then made up for it. Kenny?
