(His name tag said Ge? I think?)The craps dealer was great, always made us feel like friends and welcomed us to conversations and advice even though he was insanely busy. Cindy the pit boss for the craps tables was by far the best staff experience I have ever had the pleasure of encountering. She wasn’t intimidating like most pit bosses are, very friendly, and funny, treated us like her favorite customers. The thing that was most impressive about Cindy was her personality; she really treated us like pals. She playfully teased and harassed us and it really felt like we weren’t in her place of business, we were just out drinking and having a good time with some new friends. She also went above and beyond to look up our individual player comps and basically any other little thing we needed. Speaking of comps, the HRH comp system is both a hit and a miss. It’s great because with the amount of gambling we did most of the meals we ate there were completely comped and we did eat at some very nice places (more on the dinning at HRH in a bit), the bad thing about their comp system is that we were told the points expire 72 hours after you leave (actually this took many inquiries to find out most of the gambling staff had no idea about their rewards programs). We are coming back in October and it’s a shame we don’t have extra incentive to stay here again. They did however let us use our points in the gift shop which was great, but I’d rather of had my points carry over into my next trip instead of having to blow them all on over priced novelties that I really had no interest in. The gaming experience at HRH overall was great, young, rowdy, loud and fun if you’re looking for those things HRH won’t disappoint. The dinning at HRH was phenomenal! Very good variety and so delicious! The pink taco serves amazing Mexican food and the staff is decent, had to wait a while on one of our many trips there but the free chips and salsa diminished the irritation of sitting without a server for about 30 min. I would highly recommend their chicken taco’s although none of the food served their was worth complaining about, all very good. Lucky’s 24/7 is a god send! Now, the food is above average nothing to rave about, but still good, they have an off menu special of steak and shrimp for only $7.77 can’t beat that. Why are they a god send? If you are in Vegas to party hard, you will stumble in here at ridiculous hours needing good food quick, and that’s what Lucky’s will give you. The staff was very accommodating of the less then sober crowd, and the food came out before you even really knew what to order! (Not really but it was quick). Ago is a very nice Italian place that gets top marks in customer service. No complaints about the food, but no real raves about it either. It was good, nice portion and reasonably priced (well reasonably for a higher scale place… it’s no olive garden). The service though is outstanding. I wish I remembered our waiter’s name. Fine dinning isn’t really our thing and he very much made us feel comfortable and checked up on us often enough so as we were never with wants, but not so often that we felt pestered. Johnny Smalls is expensive for what you get, but there are some real gems here. The service was slow, but they are quite busy, this place is great for splitting between a small party, they serve only appetizers and they are very small portioned so you can order a variety and get a good taste of everything. If you make it here make sure you try the “smalls balls” and I also really liked the Phillish. My biggest complaint is they are never open! Such a small window of time to eat here. The pool was ok. The pool itself was very impressive I loved the layout and the swim up black jack, but like most of the other posts you will read here, I agree, the staff is way below par. First of all we had wrist bands for different days to get in the pool since we were hotel guests but the pool staff had no idea which day was which band (defeats the point right?), second WOW are they elitists. They are really good at making you feel small, and like you don’t belong. Mainly the male staff, the females that worked there I guess were pleasant enough, but I definitely did not feel like they wanted us there. We spent money, and aren’t bad looking, thought we had a good formula for that place, but apparently not. Overall I would recommend HRH to anyone looking to party for the weekend, it’s off the strip but honestly we rarely felt the need to leave and when we did… $7 cab ride, not bad. If they changed their rewards program, and did something about the pool staff I’d never go anywhere else. As it stands though, I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock is what you expect...Great!”
Reviews.Author: bizweb1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times, most recently in August and loved the place. I want to expand on my stay but I just have to respond to the last review so this hotel gets a fair shake. If you're choosing hotels in Las Vegas for you and your 11 year old, think about it...it's VEGAS and this isn't the Hard Rock Cafe, it's a resort...where people drink, dance, eat, party, gamble, smoke, swear, and do what legal adults do, so why complain? And you got there at 11pm on Friday, crazy that it was like a club, thought that was the slow part of the day, ha! As for the pools, the Rehab pool is great but so is the brand new West Beach pool which is just as fun and maybe bigger than the Rehab pool. I was able to get beverage service even though that last guy said you had to have a cabana, and I knew that drinks were going to be expensive and in plastic...that's for safety folks, don't want your 11 year old throwing glass bottles now do we? As for going to and from the pools, I actually liked the security...even though it may seem like a pain, isn't more better than less??? We did use the shuttle, and while it could go a bit later, it's nice to have when you want to get away. The hotel is about 2 blocks from the strip and anybody can walk there, not a big deal unless you're super lazy. And who cares where at the mall it drops off? Why did that last guy even worry about what door he was at, and why is he going into the mall when he's worried about where to go on the strip??? It's a service and you can't be too picky. We didn't have any problems with the mini-bar, we listened to what the front desk people told us and shockingly nothing showed up, strange how that works! All in all we loved this hotel...the Managers Laura and Grant did a great job with some of the crazy guests and the front desk staff is the best we've seen in Vegas...keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “HOLD ON TO YOUR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: flamingo56
Reviews.Content: Went to hotel for Labor day weekend . Put money in envelopes into the room safe as soon as we got there.The TV repairman came to fix the TV and when we returned the money was gone. Yes we locked the safe.We filled outreports and still have not had any resolution or compensation.We have been playing telephone tag with the manager. The pool parties were amazing but the security-forget it. Will keep you posted if they ever get back to me.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Rocks! Only place I stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sharbucks
Reviews.Content: I have been to HRH four times this year and every time I stay, it outshines the previous trip. If you love Mexican food and appreciate gourmet, Pink Taco will please your taste buds. Mr. Lucky's is great Cafe type food and comes out pretty fast, fresh and hot. We had the sliders and eggs benedict and were quite impressed with both. (I'm picky about specialty sauces) While Rehab is pretty much over for this season, don't make the rookie mistake and get in line after 10:00 a.m. - otherwise you will get frustrated with the wait. Get your wrist bands early and re-enter. Vanity - is the same thing. I roll into HRH to let loose, game and party and while I am not unrealistic and expect to win a lottery sized jackpot, the machines are pretty tight and unforgiving. The tables games at night will provide you with a lot of energy and entertainment. I like both rooms in the new and old towers, but getting to the new rooms will take about 10 minutes of walking, so be prepared...the 3 am walk (of shame - haha!) down the hall seems like something out of horror movie that never, ever ends. I have read that others thought the old rooms were run down and dirty, I hadn't experienced that ever before and I have been dubbed a hotel snob. The service from desk staff to servers is very attentive and professional, especially considering what they deal with in the wee hours of the morning. Like all hotels in LV, the pools and Rehab, etc, close at 6 p.m.. Ridiculous considering it doesn't get dark until 8-9 pm in the summer and is still 100 degrees out, but that is for all pools, not just HRH. HRH is the only place I stay in Vegas...the moment I walk in, I am 10 years younger in spirit and the dim lighting helps, too! Also, if you are any type of a gamer, I suggest you get yourself introduced to a casino host. It helps...

Reviews.Title: “Grand opening!”
Reviews.Author: Twiggy38
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a Vegas hotel in December 2009 and saw that the HRH Tower had its opening night the day we arrived. We thought it would be a fun experience to be the first staying in a hotel room – not a thing you get to do every day. By the time we arrived there were a long queue at the check-in counter. After some wait we found out that everybody was waiting for the same thing – the rooms wasn't ready! I guess that happens on opening nights : -) In the waiting time we went to the Pink Taco to grab some food. After a few hours of wait our room was finally ready ...and what a room – it was more like an apartment! The room included a big entrance area, lounge area, huge king bed, two flatscreen televisions, a really big bathroom and a great Strip view. After playing around with the in room touchscreen jukebox we went to the casino which is smaller than average. Downside is the location the hotel is located off the strip and is a 30 minutes walk from the big casinos on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Too many rules and not enough partying”
Reviews.Author: farmersSeguin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here so we could experience The Rehab. The media definitely overhypes this event. You have to stand in line to enter the event for at least 1/2 hour to an hour. Then you have to stand in line for an hour to get a drink. No food is served and you cannot enter with any food or drink, or camcorder or makeup or etc. They confiscated our peanuts from Southwest Airlines. Just ridiculous. If you want pool service for food or drinks you have to buy a chair or bed. Otherwise, you wait or go without. I recommend going with 10 friends and getting a bed by the pool, you get bottle service, food and your own waitress. You can enter with your cellphone and your ID and roomkey and cash. The DJ wasn't that good. I've heard better. The Rehab closes at 5pm. In fact all the pools close by 5pm or 8pm and don't reopen until 10 am. No food is served at the pools and if you bring your coffee or sandwich with you they will confiscate it. It doesn't matter that you bought it there at the hotel. The hotel kept telling me that there is pool service for drinks and food but I never saw anyone taking orders. Also they don't like camcorders even though I snuck mine in. Very disappointing as far as enjoying the pools. Too many restrictions not even my grandmothers house has this many restrictions. At other hotels, I am used to having mimosas at the pool by 9am with breakfast and use the pool late at night until I am DONE with drinks. I can say that the HRH tower room was very attractive and the bed wonderful. Vanity was ok, just another club. Otherwise, the name needs to be changed to Soft Rock Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do your research. If you want a party hotel, this is the best place in Vegas!"”
Reviews.Author: BigRooster81
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to write this after reading a few bad reviews on this website. This is not only a review from my experience but a rebuttal to some of the statements made by some reviewers. I stayed with 3 friends in late August and had an absolute blast there: PROs -Great casino, great atmosphere and some of the promptest (and strongest) drinks about. To those complaining about the poor drinks service…… maybe you’re not tipping? I actually had a problem keeping up with the drinks service and was getting laughed at because I couldn’t finish half a glass of whisky in 5 minutes! Croupiers were awesome, big shout out to Rhondi – she had me in stitches throughout 4 hours of Blackjack. -Great service at the check in desk. We were given complimentary upgrades to the Paradise (pool view), and we were sorted out for Rehab and Vanity. I also evidenced the fact that I agreed a $7 resort fee when I booked as opposed to $15 and they were happy to change. -The safe wasn’t working. I called and they came up in 5 minutes. -Amazing rooms, some of the comfiest beds I have ever slept in – great to recover after way too much partying. Room service was great, extra towels, etc. Maybe I am getting pedantic here, but tipping the maid may help. And once again I did my research and knew they had sensors on the mini bar drinks/snacks. So guess what? I didn’t touch them! My friend however did in his room, but they immediately took it off their bill at check out, they did not check on inventory or anything. They only said they’d re-charge it if they found out that these snacks were gone. -Great clientele. Yes, it’s people in their 20s looking to have fun. We did our research and chose the Hard Rock for that very reason. For those complaining that it’s full of 20 somethings looking to party, do your research. I chose this place over the Wynn as I did not want to be hanging around with drunk forty-somethings. -Good food. Pink Taco was great for pre-evening drinks and food - Mr Luckys is awesome for late night munching. -Pool is beautiful and loads of fun. -Good Poker room but Caesars is better. CONS (Sort of) -Rehab. In comparison to Wet Republic and Encore Beach Club, a bit of a let down. Too many idiots as opposed to those looking to have fun. I prefer a bit more of an upmarket pool party. -Distance from the Strip. But this is not really a con. Again I did my research and being lazy I cab everywhere, so didn’t make any difference to me. And do people really walk from casino to casino on the Strip? It takes 20 minutes!! Yes the queue for cabs on a weekend can be long. But we would walk up to the guy, nice word and a $20 bill and we’d be first in line. Vegas is a service industry and was built on tipping! OVERALL We booked this place for Rehab but turned out that was the only disappointment. Yes, it doesn’t have the luxury and attention to detail as a Wynn/Encore. But if you wanted that, stay there. With regards to the service here, although we didn’t get poor service, I can understand how it can be surly at times. The difference between this place and eg the Encore is that the Encore will treat you like a king whether you’re a high roller or a nobody. So, a couple of pieces of advice. If you want something, or not happy with something, do it with a smile and a bit of banter. People can be a lot more forthcoming. And also – tip!! I’m a Brit and not used to the tipping culture, but know that a few dollars here and there adds up to a much more memorable stay. This is the most fun you can have in Vegas with your clothes on. Love the rock music, the décor and the people – Vegas as it should be. I understand however it may not be to everyone’s taste, but please, please, please do your research – this is a party hotel. A married couple with kids coming to this place is like me and my friends going to eg Paris, and being shocked that we didn’t enjoy ourselves. When I come back to Las Vegas, HRH will be one of the top choices on my list.

Reviews.Title: “New HRH ALL SUITE TOWER is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: elpItaly
Reviews.Content: Last year my husband and I went to the newly built HR Paradise tower and enjoyed our pool view room. This year we tried the newest "HRH all suite tower". We found a good offer (118$ per night) for the "Supreme Deluxe Corner King Room" and booked it a month in advance. As soon as we arrived the concierge told us that they were all booked, however after a little research she found a room on the 7th floor. The number 1-0730. The Suite was great! Being the corner suite it had a F-A-N-T-A-S-T-I-C double view over the strip! Two HD TV, great music system, huge bathroom. We loved it. Much better than the Paradise tower rooms. The pool was already great last year, probably the best in Vegas but now they added a fantastic new a pool area easily reachable by the HRH tower. Lovely! Pink taco is good and cheap, all the other restaurants are too expensive. Negative sides: No room cleaning in 3 days. No wi-fi internet service for iphones, you have to provide a static IP address to have wifi. WARNING: free wifi in vegas is almost impossible to find! Not reccommended to families, the crowd is young, noisy and rock n roll. Ideal for young couples and groups of friends. Not sure how it is on weekends, probably too crowded, both times we went was on monday to wednesday. Hard rock night clubs and sky pool bar open only on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but too far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: LOVENYC82
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for three nights during the easter period. Luckily we were driving as the hotel is about 15 - 20 mins walk from the strip. The hotel itself is lovely and clean and has some great places to eat. Our room was huge with a comfortable bed but just becareful not too use anything in the room as you are charged for everything.. All and all it was a lovely hotel and I wouldnt mind staying in it again just it was too far from the strip so we had to get a taxi all the time but other than that a nice experience in Vegas.....

Reviews.Title: “HRH doesn't honor your room choice”
Reviews.Author: LittleOne33
Reviews.Content: First of all, this place is for 20-somethings who like to drink and party. I was prepared for that. HOWEVER, the Hard Rock did not give us the room we reserved - we reserved (and had in writing) a nonsmoking room with two queen beds. TWICE they tried to stick us with a king-sized bed - once by saying they had two queens but on a smoking floor which we accepted but when we went to the room it was a king-sized bed. When we called the desk, they gave us some BS about us reserving a king-sized bed (NOT TRUE and I can prove it) and they would "nicely" give us a rollaway and waive the extra charge. So they basically gave our room away or did not want to honor our reservation (and the nice deal it was offered under). We were so disgusted we just took the room with one bed and rollaway - didn't want to argue for hours and waste our vacation. Didn't even gamble here I didn't want to give HRH any more money. We left ASAP the next morning for Palazzo and will never stay at Hard Rock again. They are dishonest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino, Great rooms, crap service & rip off resort charge!”
Reviews.Author: Rusty1979uk
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good: The Croupier staff were pretty dam good, in comparison with the Bellagio & Caesars where we also went the Casino was by far the best - but this gets ruined by other elements i'll mention later. The pool is awesome in a number of ways but again this gets ruined later! The bad: - The pool is only open from 10am-6pm - There is a $15 plus tax "Resort fee" where you then have to queue to get in to your own hotel pool! - The security staff won't let you take a closed bottle of water into the pool as the hotel want to rip you off for $7 per bottle, I could understand them not letting people taking alcohol in but water is a joke - You can't take a bag into the pool on a Rehab day so your screwed if you want to take any spare clothes or anything you don't want to risk looking in with you! - The service by the pool is also pretty crap, perhaps it's because they're more interested in serving the mugs who have paid $500+ for a Cabana - My room got cleaned everyday but I think the definition of cleaning is putting new towels in the room and making the bed, there was dust all over the desk and bedside tables - The mini bar had everything on sensors and there were chocolate and crisps on the desk on sensors so if touched them you were screwed & when we came to check out they wouldn't guarantee we didn't get fleeced for another $100 per hour we were latre while we waited for them to inventory the mini bar so we let them "steal" the $5.41 mini bar charge which i know is not a lot but it was the principle! - Mr Lucky's is a great place to grab a snack 24/7 but the service is crap, they just don't get it! - Casino drinks - there were hardly any staff taking drinks orders at the table so you could die of thirst while loosing money but may be that was all part of the tactics! - Wifi - who in their right mind charges guests a $13 per DEVICE per 24hr fee?!!!? I can get free wifi with a $1.50 coffee and they don't violate me per device! I have an iPhone and Laptop who would pay $13 per device let alone for each! Get with the programme! On the whole this hotel has the potential to be great but there isn't enough room at the pool for everyone, you have to queue up to get in and it's not enough that you've spent money on the room, in the bar, restaurant, night club and casino so they feel the need to fleece you else where! Note to Hard Rock if you read this feel free to reply but it you reply with a templated response I will have an even lower opinion of you!

Reviews.Title: “Worst EVER”
Reviews.Author: jjpulido78
Reviews.Content: If you are over the age of 30, stay away from the Hard Rock If you hate all that is Ed Hardy, stay away from the Hard Rock If you oppose fist-pumping douche bags, stay away from the Hard Rock But mostly, if you love good service, hot food, nice waitresses, or even seeing your waitress during a meal, stay away from the Hard Rock. I will never EVER return to the HRH. Worst service ever at a restaurant, biggest tools ever walking around the hotel and casino, just an awful place to be. Over-priced cold food at their 24/7 restaurant. A waitress that we saw when she took our order and then when she wanted her money (that she so kindly RIPPED from my husband's hand), horrible food that was cold (burgers and fries should never be cold, not to mention why would you ask some of the table how they want their burger cooked but not everyone? And since when does medium mean hockey puck?)... just horrible... awful... terrible... don't ever go!

Reviews.Title: “Watch for Hidden "Resort Fee"”
Reviews.Author: starih
Reviews.Content: Pink Taco is great. The rooms are nice and clean. Housekeeping service was non-existent. I stayed for 3 days and no one came to change towels in spite of putting out the service sign on the door. A hidden "resort fee" of $16.80/day is tagged to your bill. Per the manager on duty, it is supposed to help maintain the facility. This is a very deceptive practice of Hard Rock Hotel not to include this fee upfront when making reservations. When I stated my objection, the manager told me the fee was non-negotiable and I could stay elsewhere if I didn't want to pay the fee and the room deposit that was charged to my credit card would not be refunded. I really can't say I enjoyed my stay because of all of this.

Reviews.Title: “I can't imagine staying anywhere else but the Encore”
Reviews.Author: cdnprincess1
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I went t to Vegas to party with my girls and that we did! It upset me that we had reserved a "2 queen beds" room and when we went to check in were told that they only had king size suites. Um, ok so we have to share a bed??? I find it hard to believe in down season they didn't have any other rooms??? I asked for the manager, yep no other rooms...you booked through a third party and until they receive payment from them, it is merely a request. Um, nice....so we went to our King Suite and when we got in the room the a/c didn't work. They sent a repair man, he couldn't fix it. At this point my normally sweet southern belle friend went off on the reception desk. The clerks response, well we can move you to another room, but all we have is "2 queen beds" rooms available....is this a joke??? We just checked in 30 minutes ago. So we get set up in our the room we originally requested, perfect! It worked out. So we go to get our tickets for Rehab Sunday morning and our room rate didn't qualify for tickets....we would have to pay an upcharge on our room to not have to stand in the general admissions line....ugh, is this a joke??? We went and paid the rate and got our wrist bands after standing in line at 8:00AM till 9:30AM....all a little ridiculious if you ask me... Other than the bad customer service, the bars and atmosphere are awesome!! The pool parties are where it's at. The rooms were really nice and everyone was pretty friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time at this rockin' hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NickJT
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a fantastic week in Las Vegas having stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel. This hotel is definitely aimed at the younger generation but if you're going to Vegas for a good time and like to party then you will love this place. Rooms are fantastic and very modern with plasma TV and Bose stereo in our room. The pool is absolutely spectacular if a little packed especially on Sunday afternoons when there is a pool party called Rehab and everyone in Vegas seems to turn up! The only downside to this hotel is it is not on the strip although everything you could want is catered for so it is not really a problem. Also there is a free shuttle bus going back and forth to the strip until 6pm so you can easily check out what's going on elsewhere. Overall I would say this is a superb place to stay for young couples or if you are on holiday with friends and like to party. Staff are friendly and service is better than average that I have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Let me sum up the Hard Rock for you....”
Reviews.Author: NDAshley
Reviews.Content: Let me break down a stay at the Hard Rock for you. Afterwards, you can decide if you want to stay there or not. START HERE: If you are over 45, you should probably turn around and check in somewhere else. Not to say older people won't enjoy this hotel, because there were totally older people having a great time. However, this place is made for people 21-40. People who are old and wise will probably not enjoy this hotel very much. Unless you're a 45+ man who likes to oogle 21 year old girls. Then you may like it. YOUR ROOM: Your room will be awesome. Stay in the Paradise tower and you will probably get a great view of the pool. (You can watch the drunken lushes from your window! Bonus!) It's decorated very hip and the beds are super comfy. Nice rain shower, down comforter beds, flat screen TVs and an area to set up your own bar-- awesome! THE STAFF: The staff will treat you like crap. The bell man, the front desk agent, the managers, the security, ESPECIALLY anyone who works at the pool, will all act like they're doing you a favor by helping you. Give them a crappy $2 tip and send them on your way. This is the price of staying here. Just expect it and move on. The pool staff feels that because they work at one of the best pools in the USA they are entitled to make you feel like you're worthless (double this if you're a guy that doesn't have money.) THE POOL: is AMAZING! If you're a girl, you need to be dressed up. Yes, I can't believe I just said that, but it's so true. Don't come wearing your stretched out bathing suit with a skirt. The girls at this pool all haven't eaten in a week and they are ready to show off their hard-earned bodies. You need to look good! If you're a guy, it helps to look good but it helps even more to have money. Even if you have money, they'll still treat you kind of bad, but it's likely that you'll get a lapdance in the lazy river pool. (It's true, I saw two girls doing this.) The girls here get crazy. They can't wait to show off their new fake boobs. You will like it. You will like it A LOT! The best pool is up at the Sky Bar. It has a glass wall so everyone on the beach below can see you. (If you want to see girls flash, sit right below that and wait like 2 minutes.) I had the best day here! There's even a water slide!!! THE CASINO: They have lots of fun slot machines (not the confusing kind, the fun ones with the cartoon animals and stuff). Their tables even have suprisingly low minimums, even on a Saturday. (I played $5 roulette on Sun!) THE FOOD: Pink Taco is yummy and the staff is among the friendliest people in the entire hotel. That's the only place I eat when I come here. THE LOCATION: Is kind of crappy but you don't have to leave. The hotel is an EXPERIENCE. They have everything you need to have a great party trip right in the hotel. It's 2 miles or so from the strip, and the cab line to leave Hard Rock on a weekend is INSANELY LONG. (Slip the valet a hund-o and you will have no problem getting one though!) Don't forget to ask about the free shuttle that runs to the Strip till 6. The driver will treat you bad, but hey...free is free. YOUR WALLET: Will be totally empty when you leave. But you will have had an AMAZING time!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel and Hard Rock Cafe are not the same company!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetonion
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is great. Everything from the Hard Rock memorabilia to the casino to our awesome suite was perfect. We´re glad, we didn´t stay at the regular hotel rooms! Most of the people were disgusting when they got drunk. So we would not recommend to stay there. Most of the staff was very friendly and helpful. But most of the pool- staff seemed less then thrilled to be working, very arrogant, slow and forgetful. The music was great!!! But during the Rehab and Relax (the pool partys) it´s only noisy and annoying. The music is so loud, you can´t get away from it! You always have to listen to two music-tracks! The great rock music (I mean that´s why you are staying at a HARD ROCK hotel and the techno-music-crap) You are getting nuts! So it was very nice being right next to a Hard Rock restaurants (to relax from the RELAX). The staff is great! and you´re really having a great time there. The distance from the strip is maybe a downfall, but not if you want to escape the mass of tourists near the strip! We enjoyed that to the full. Anyway, the building an the pool-area is really great and we had a amazing time there. But next time we would only stay from tuesday to friday to escape the whole Relax/Rehab/nightclub thing!

Reviews.Title: “If it is your destination, fine. Otherwise stay on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: cristjw
Reviews.Content: pros: a 40 acre party 24-7, the pool is to die for, shopping and nice places to eat right inside, great decor (obviously) cons: $15 gimmick-resort fee, 2 miles from the Strip, not-so-good neighborhood, 2 miles from the strip (that really sucked), and, oh, yeah, the $15 gimmick fee. I would go here again if I planned on living there for a period time. Otherwise, they are way too far from strip and only shuttle during daytime.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay, party and have fun!”
Reviews.Author: nbydeley
Reviews.Content: Third trip to Hard Rock, will be going again next week and eager to see the new changes made. This has always been our favorite place to stay with friends and have never had any issues at all, either with staff, rooms or restaurants. Always a great crowd in the casino and plenty of people watching. Lounge is terrific to hang out and have some drinks, food is great wherever we've been -Pink Taco rocks! - and the age group between 21-40, just perfect. We are in our mid-thirties and have never had issues with too drunk and/or loud people, but again, this is Vegas people, not the ballet :) Would recommend to those looking for a great Vegas vacation with no kids, just want to have a fun time and hang out!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Won't Stay Anywhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: laura4957
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for the second time in August 2010 for my birthday trip. I stayed there in April and had a few issues, which I brought to the hotel's attention and this trip was like night and day to my other one. I think it was one of the best trips I have ever taken. The highlight of my trip was Rehab, it was so much fun! The crowd was attractive, the music was awesome, drinks were strong, service was great. No problems there at all. I just can't wait until next season so that I can go back. I ate at Johnny Smalls, Nobu, Pink Taco, Starbucks, Beach Club, Juice Bar and Espumoso. Food and service at all of them was outstanding. Prices were good. Johnny Smalls was definitely my favourite, the food and service were both amazing. I will definitely be returning. The people who complain about the pool scene at the Hard Rock obviously didn't do their research before they booked. It's definitely a party atmosphere, which is what I was looking for. The pool area is beautiful, the crowd is fun, drinks are strong, staff are friendly and good looking, this is by far the best pool I have ever been to. Also, I found security to be really nice and friendly, I'm not sure who the people in previous reviews dealt with but it was clearly not the people I saw. I shopped at the Hard Rock store, sundries store, Love Jones and the Rock Spa. All of them again were great service, good prices and I would shop there again. I checked in/out through their VIP lounge and it was a great experience. The staff was friendly and answered any questions I had. They followed up with me throughout the trip to make sure everything was fine, which was appreciated, even though I had no issues at all. We had a corner king room in the Paradise Tower with a view of the Rehab pool. Nothing to complain about at all, the room was beautiful, bed was extremely comfortable (I didn't want to go home to my bed) and the room and bathroom were spotless at all times. The TV has an awesome selection of music channels to listen to while you get ready and there's also an iPod dock in the room. Next time I will most likely try the HRH Tower since I've stayed in the Paradise Tower twice now. I spent more time in the casino this trip than I normally do, but when the casino looks that great, and is that fun, it's hard not to spend time there. Drinks service was fast and the CW's came around often. Vanity was fun and a really nice club. I'm starting to really like the location of the Hard Rock. I like how it's off the strip, it gives the hotel a completely different vibe to the on strip hotels. It's like it's your own private oasis away from everything. Cab to Miracle Mile was around $9, cab to Palms was around $15, or it's around a 15 minute walk to the strip. You can't beat the crowd at the Hard Rock. This is where the best looking people in Vegas all hang out. I travel to Vegas 3-4 times per year and I won't even consider another hotel after this one. It's always the Hard Rock for me now.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel!! Loud guests and dirty pool”
Reviews.Author: lacop1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the new HRH towers. The room next to us was very very loud until 4AM. I called security and the front desk 5 times and they failed to do anything about it. The pool was nasty and smelled like urine. Too many drunk college kids are allowed by the hotel staff to ruin your stay. F-

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent”
Reviews.Author: rowezone54
Reviews.Content: Why would Hard Rock have to give special treatment to a travel agent? We all get special treatment! This resort isn't for everyone, I am the first to say that, but you have to understand that there are only a few places in Las Vegas that you don't have to leave your entire stay. There is always something to be seen/done/eaten or drank. I love it here and I will always stay at HR. Coming back September and Jan 2011. Already booked for both! If you don't fit in, stay somewhere else. Easy as that.

Reviews.Title: “Geezers Rock the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: synergydoc
Reviews.Content: Okay, we admit to going to the Hard Rock for the pool. No, not Rhab (yikes!), but the during-the-week, lots of places to sit with some shade, beach entry, lazy river, relatively uncrowded pool. Guess what -- the pool area is GREAT when the crowds have moved off elsewhere to party -- we had no trouble finding shady chairs, even at 11:00 A.M. The only drawback of the pool area is the high prices for drinks, etc. With a little less greed on the pricing, I'm guessing they could triple their sales. Bonus -- the new HRH (suites) Tower is terrific. Easy self park, easy stroll to the front desk with luggage, and then off to the elevators. The infamous indifferent service (widely reported here) was not in evidence when we checked in -- very smooth, pleasant, quick, and efficient, including detailing all those annoying resort, wi-fi, and other charges. The indifference only emerged later (after a shift change) when we stopped by the desk to ask a question about what times different parts of the pool area were open (e.g, vs. being scrubbed down from Rehab) -- then we got the "what planet are you from?" look and no information or helpful answer. All the extra charges are one of the reasons we don't give the HRH 5 stars -- perhaps the most telling is the required security deposit "In case you break anything" -- which presupposes that customers are positioned to be potential adversaries of the hotel (think frat boys throwing furniture out the windows) vs. valued guests. Hmmm, that's different. The only other major complaint we had was the temperature. True, the outside temperature was 112, but our room and the area of the Hard Rock casino itself adjacent to the new tower were the only interior areas in Las Vegas where we felt too warm over the next several days. Two phone calls to the front desk finally got our room temp to a point where we could consider sleeping by bedtime. In 3 days, with the AC cranking full blast all the time, it never got close to being too chilly. Don't know whether it's something that needs to be fixed or whether they're just conserving electricity $$, but if so, they should know that we took ourselves and our eating and gambling $$ to other properties during the day just to stay cooler. Rooms in the new HRH tower are fabulous. The beds are really comfortable (and back supporting!). The bath has 2 sinks and a HUGE shower and separate soaking tub. (There is a privacy curtain that can be drawn across the glass fronted bathroom -- too bad this oblivious member of our party didn't find it for a while.) The architectural planning may have missed the mark a bit, though, as one side of the tower faces the pool, and the other (virtually 1/2 the rooms) look straight at the parking garage. Oh well, there was a fun view of the strip from the parking garage . . . There are some great restaurant choices at HardRock -- Johnny Smalls had inventive, tasty small plates (but plan ahead, it's closed Monday and Tuesday). Mr Lucky had tasty and more interesting fare than most casinos' cafe style restaurant choices. The people watching? Well, it can be pretty entertaining, occasionally even jaw dropping -- think of it as free entertainment. The size of the rooms (suites, really, in the HRH Tower) is way more than 2 people need (unless you can't agree which tv program to watch on the giant flatscreens). Next time, I would probably opt for the Paradise Tower, and hope that it has some of the same comfort, luxurious fittings, and convenience of the HRH Tower, but with cooler temperatures in the rooms, halls, and common areas. Barring that, I'll wait for a cooler season, but I shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed by 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: LV_travelagent
Reviews.Content: I'm a travel agent and recenlty stayed at several hotels on the strip and off. I was not impressed by this hotel. Service was bad. Drunk girl in casino was exremely loud and vulgar and clearly drunk. She needed to be escorted out but no one seemed to notice. Hello secuirty. Room missing several items and front desk personal (including supervisor/manager) not very friendly or customer service oriented. Scary drunken people outside of parking garage in the middle of the night were very loud and scary! Would not recommend or stay here again. Resort fee outrageous and didn't use. Didn't feel safe. No special treatment for this travel agent!

Reviews.Title: “This Is Why You Pull Back The Sheets.”
Reviews.Author: richnanners
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hard Rock, was not the place I would not recommend for my worst enemies. First, the parking attendants raised their voices at me for parking my car in the green zone. Even though I have a handicap placard that hangs from the rear view mirror. They threatened to tow my car away. Once, I checked into my room. I pulled back on the sheets on the bed. And, I discovered a scene from "CSI" on the bed sheets. Plenty of blood. I disclosed this to the cleaning facilities supervisor. She apologized profusely. I proceeded to check out of this room. Where they upgraded me to, get this. @ queen beds & view of the pool. No big deal if you want to look out and see a variety of bad tattoos of various shapes & sizes. You just see how grafitti move if it ever came to life. The room that I was upgraded to smelled of paint. To make matters worse the walls are paper thin, like the Motel 6.I can hear the other room talking in Russian & speaking about last nights conquest. I am suprised that this room didn't come with a gun under the pillow & shower shoes. I wouldn't recommend this place for even my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - not for children”
Reviews.Author: SulaMetz
Reviews.Content: A great hotel to party at - the Sunday pool party is a must - we were there for a stag do hence the rating but not the place for children or for a romantic get away. Its off the strip but didn't find this to be an issue. Please also note the hotel has a number of different types of hotel within the complex from expensive (with a very good spa open to all) to cheap.

Reviews.Title: “awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Familyguy101
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights 3 days in July and had an absolute blast..... Stayed in the new tower suites and room was awesome... Night life was second to none anywhere in Vegas..there is absolutely no reason to leave...Loud music, beautiful women and an awesome vibe. Great gaming...good food..incredible room....close to the airport.....And of course the best pool in Vegas...Vanity nightclub was nice but INCREDIBLY douchey and pricey.. one drink and a beer was $23.00 ouch.... This is the place to stay for a fun hip time.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock once...and you'll Hard Rock again!”
Reviews.Author: coromoto11
Reviews.Content: I beg to differ with a previous review...I personally have stayed @ most of the hotels on the strip...MGM & Harrah's properties...have walked the entire stip....enjoyed several shows, fine dining....BUT BUT BUT...the strip gets old and I find that I relaxed at the Hard Rock, enjoyed the gambling better, and it does offer dining for all fussy and delectable pallets. It is my future choice of stay. If you haven't tried it....do yourself a big one...check it out! The rooms are incredible..."noise out"... I especially enjoyed the Pink Taco...it only offers approx 80 or more Tequila selections, great meals too! The funniest thing..the Sundries store -open 24/7 for all your midnite munchies, beverages, etc...great store! The "beach" pool and regular pool.....great! try it....You'll love it! And don't worry about walking to the strip.....Hard Rock has a van service from 10-6pm....leaves you by the Wynn.....so stop your complaining!

Reviews.Title: “Visited for one day the weekend of my...”
Reviews.Author: hotpinknails
Reviews.Content: Visited for one day the weekend of my b-day so I could party at Vanity. When we checked in, the gentleman assisting us said, "I see you'll be with us for one night, so let me upgrade your room at no additional charge." We thought "awesome, this is almost unheard of." When we got to our room we were blown away. It was a two bedroom suite equipped with a bar and drinks, located right above pool (DJ was playing at the pool and it was like having him right in our room, we could literally have a party and feel like we had our own personal DJ) The only minor complaint (for ladies) was the lack of bright lights in the bathroom. It was difficult to put makeup on. Had to sit on sink and get super close to mirror. Ranked service at #3 only because at Vanity the bartenders were overhanging me for the same exact drinks my friends had previously purchased. Two Bud Lights were $18; however I was charged $20 two times. Insignificant difference, I know; however, I hate being taken advantage of. Other than that, great party and entertainment destination. HRH thanks so much for the spectacular upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: BigN_80
Reviews.Content: Overall, this place is a great place to stay. You do need to know what the hotel is about to enjoy your stay and it is about Partying. If you fit a younger demographic that enjoys rock n roll, staying up late and such you will love this place. If you are going for the quieter side of Vegas (shows, nice meals, etc.), this may not be the place for you. I stayed in the HRH tower and it was amazing. I have stayed in 5 star Vegas hotels and the bed was much more comfortable than those places. The room had two large TVs, a separate living room, a jukebox (w/ iPod controls) and a sink for a wet bar. This one of the nicer 700-900 sq ft suites I have stayed in. I did go to the pool, and it was great. Very large, drinks are a little expensive, but they are that way at every pool in Vegas. Mr. Lucky's 24/7 was a good value and had quick service, and the new Joint is a great place to catch a concert or the Santana show. I would definitely come back, I enjoyed myself. If you like rock n roll and don't mind staying a little ways from the strip, check this place out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and great pool, but you are a way off strip”
Reviews.Author: mrs_slink
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock has had a bit of a facelift and my husband and I really enjoyed our stay in the new and shiny HRH tower rooms. Massive, beautifully styled with nice touches like photography of musicians everywhere, our room was a pleasure to be in. The pool area is amazing too, stunning, but you need to get out early to get a nice spot! In terms of nightlife and dining, this is also a lovely casino to stay in, with options from dance to rock and from noodles to top class cuisine. My only quibble is that you are a way off strip and it really is too hot to walk - meaning you do spend most of your time in the one resort. I loved the music and styling though so I was pretty happy with that!

Reviews.Title: “The most disrespectful service ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: Lucylulu115
Reviews.Content: At first I was happy with this hotel. I thought the rooms were decorated well and the bed was super soft. Once leaving my room for the first time, my experience went drastically downhill. First, it is quite far from everything else and getting a taxi took forever. The casino had very limited variety of slot machines. You will never get a drink while playing slots either. There is a foul, rancid smell everywhere around the hotel. I had read about their fabulous pool and was excited to check it out. This is where my experience went from so so to I will never return. We were never informed of their strict policy for pool access. We were greeted by several security guards and detection wands. A rent a cop went through my bag and began removing all the items that were not allowed, again, we were never informed of banned items. She then proceeded to accuse me of smuggling drugs to the pool, which actually was a breath mint. I tried to explain this and in the most sarcastic, rude way said "sure that's a mint" and then yelled at me not to touch anything. I also has a push pin in my bag that was left in there after I presented a professional poster at a conference earlier in the week, which according to her I planned to use to stab someone's eye out with. I returned to my room to discard all of my banned items ( breath mint, hand sanitizer, bobby pin, small vile of body splash, and the deadly push pin ). In the elevator back down, an employee asked if I were enjoying my stay. I reply that I was until the lady at the pool accused me of being a drug smuggler and push pin eye poker outer. He only laughed, no apology for this lack of respect, kindness, and courtesy. When waiting in line to go back through the security gate that is nearly as intense as the airport, I witnessed the same woman yelling at a man for proceeding in line without her permission " back up mothrtf***er, get the f*** back." He also had done nothing to deserve this treatment. I was so appalled that I only went on outside to find my boyfriend and tell him we were returning to the room. In my short 3 minutes outside by the pool, I somehow got a piece of glass in my foot while wearing flip flops. After all that tight security and never ending list of banned items (glass included), how did I get a piece of glass in my foot??? I guess the power tripped rent a cop missed that item. On my return to the room, the same employee from the elevator laughed at me again and made jokes with other employees. I will never return to this place, it seems they don't care to get returning customers anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a Casino that Understands what is NEEDED”
Reviews.Author: DonRuch
Reviews.Content: They Even are great when you have a problem...As far as I know there is no better way to rate the Casino and its Management than when you have a problem...John Baier is the MAN YOU NEED and he just happens to work with the friendly and courtious staff at the Hard Rock...The rooms are great the bed is one of the most comfortable I've ever sleep in and the service is second to none, all because of John...Thank you my friend for your help and service...I will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to visit, but don't stay there!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pambret
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot going for it, especially if you are a rock fan (which I am). I loved the building: it is a very cool atmosphere with lots of memorabilia to look at. We were there four days and did not see it all. The beds are very comfortable and the room was amazing, but it wasn't all great. The room was missing simple amenities that you almost take for granted even if you stay at the Super 8. For example, there is no fridge (unless you pay extra), and there is no coffee maker. Simple things, but their absence is very noticeable, especially after recovering from a long day on the strip. That brings me to the next point. The strip is over a mile away which is a long walk in the hot sun, or a 7 - 10 dollar cab ride each time. Although HRH advertises a shuttle, it only runs from 10AM til 5PM, and only once an hour, and you usually can't get on it anyway because it only seats 5 people. They also refuse to make a second trip if you are the sixth person. My biggest complaint was with the pools. They are great, but only open until 6PM. It is still 100 degrees outside and you can't even go for a swim. We asked the pool manager why, and in his smug manner told us that that is the way it is in LV and you can't expect any hotel to open their pool longer. We asked every other resort on the strip (minus a couple we missed) and found only one other that closes that early (but they opened 2 hours earlier). He told us lies like we have to close early so that people don't get too drunk around the water, yet in order to be allowed a chair at the other pool you have to commit to buy 200 dollars worth of booze. This complete lack of service costs you an extra 16.80 a day. I highly recommend that you go see the facilities when in Vegas, but choose a hotel that will offer you better services or you will leave disappointed like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great guys trip, some issues.”
Reviews.Author: BurghTripper
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock is really a unique experience apart from the other resort casinos in Vegas. 3 male friends and I(all 29-30) stayed there Fri-Mon recently, and we had an awesome time and most likely would stay there again. Above all else, the Hard Rock is about atmosphere and it truly delivers in that regard. Whereas other casinos try to one up each other in elegance or luxury or bright lights, the HR is dark, cool, and sexy. It is off strip, but then it's not entirely like any on-strip hotels anyway; the crowd it caters to is most likely happy to avoid the strip crowd. In other words, stay away, grandpa. Service: There are a lot of complaints about the service at the HR on this site, and for the most part my friends and I didn't have any problems. At check-in we were told we'd been upgraded from mountain view to pool view in the casino tower - happy for me, but not so much for my roomie with a sleep disorder who had problems with the noise. No prob - I called down to the front desk and explained the issue, and we were moved to mountain side and a bit higher. Bellman came up in 15 min(which is actually quite fast considering what the line in registration was downstairs) to give us keys and help us move. Very satisfied. Good bell service the morning I left, too. My other friends, however, did have(and have ongoing) a service issue considering over-charges to his credit card. Upon arrival at the main pool Saturday, we dropped our stuff on a chair, only to be told it was $100 per chair. This is apparently new, as we didn't have that problem last year. Don't know, it could be a weekend thing. Either way, we were offered a daybed for a $500 food/bev minimum- a good deal for a group of four considering we'd spend close to that anyway with their prices. However, my buddy's card was charged $500 three times. We figured once was the actual bill, since it wasn't $500 even, once was a hold that would eventually go away. The other still hasn't been resolved as of today(we left yesterday) and my friend has felt the hotel is giving him the runaround with it. He said the guy he's talking to is named Michael Fuller - didn't catch the title. So Mike, get this fixed and we'll come back. Don't, and we can't, on principle alone. Can't speak much for the restaurants, we only ate at Mr. Lucky's for breakfast - good stuff. The pools are awesome - the Rehab pool is the best day party in Vegas, and the beach club pool is a nice change of pace if you're not ready it hit the day so hard after a rough night. Both have blackjack tables, but the beach club's weren't open when we were there Sunday - cmon guys, don't you want to take my money? I LOVE the casino - smaller, but the best vibe in LV. No annoying slot machine chatter in the background, just great rock music, keeps the adrenaline up. The main circle is more the upbeat casino, and the expansion has a quieter vibe if that's your thing. One problem - guys, put a cashier in the main round, I can't walk a mile to the back with all drinks you serve me. We hit a lot of different casinos and I'd say they had some of the strongest drinks, so tip your waitresses fellas. Rooms were awesome, both the Casino Tower ones we were in and the Paradise Tower one my friends stayed in - good lord are the beds comfortable! Tips - if you want to hit the strip(and you should), cab it over to Planet Hollywood. Short ride, best place to start for easy access to all the big casinos, and also probably the closest match to the vibe at the Hard Rock. Just don't eat at the steakhouse there("The Strip"), it's overpriced and empty. "Rare," does not mean dry. Love the Hard Rock, had a blast. If you can't have fun there, it's probably your fault.

Reviews.Title: “The Joint Was Rockin'”
Reviews.Author: williewonte
Reviews.Content: The new HRH suites were fantastic. Not the usual Vegas faux elegance. Enjoyed the casino although some of the overhead tunes were not my cup of tea. The Joint is an excellent venue. Nice theater size with great sound and lights. Ate dinner a Nobu and really enjoyed the eclectic, fresh food. The place is a few blocks off the strip but well worth it. Great price, beautiful suite, excellent customer service & a professional friendly staff. Big Thumbs Up.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: patstlouismo_1963
Reviews.Content: was only here for a overniter, and the beds where the best. Probably the most comfortable bed you could ever sleep in. the rooms were large, and the service was great

Reviews.Title: “Sublime!”
Reviews.Author: Serendipi2us
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I truly love this hotel. Right from our smooth check-in to our sad departure, we had terrific service. If you're staying a couple of nights as we did, do make a point of going to the concierge for what's going on at the hotel. We got on the guest list for Vanity nightclub, which was great as there was a long line. We stayed in the new Paradise Tower and the room afforded us fantastic views of the multiple pools as well as our favorite: the to-die-for marshmallow bed. Sublime! Really liked the 'boutique' feel of the hotel as we've stayed at others on the Strip but felt overwhelmed because they are just too big. The pool was the highlight for me. Plenty of bars, gaming and great music playing made me want to stay all day. Plus they have chaise loungers in the pool. Top notch! No need to even leave the hotel as it has everything. We would most definitely stay again as the rock music vibe is right down our alley. Keep rocking!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: TimDS
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas after staying 5 nights their and came away feeling a little dissapointed. The rooms are fairly nice, can't complain there, though the shower was made for somebody much shorter than myself (I'm 6'3"). The bathroom also didn't have a fan (not a huge deal). On the first night I was their a guy from engineering came knocking on the door while we were sleeping to fix the plumbing issue that originated in the room next to us. It woke me up, so I let him in to fix the problem. 20 mins later another knock, same dude to fix the problem AGAIN. Internet is not free at $14 per 24 hour period and you'll be charged a resort fee of $16 every night you stay. This tacked on another $126.00 to my stay, which when you consider everything else you pay for at an inflated price, kind of sucks. That being said the casino is pretty nice and well maintained and the staff was friendly enough and helpful when prompted.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean, cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenT235
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock for a week at end of June. The Hotel is a short (15min) walk from the strip but we didnt find this a problem. Taxi's were easily available right outside the hotel and the staff were helpful and well organised when you wanted taxi. Hotel and room were kept immaculately clean and room was very comfortable with nice modern decor. We stayed in the Paradise Tower and had an end room with fabulous, (had to be seen to be believed) view of the strip. Pools were lovely although main pool was crowded during Rehab but there is a quiter pool at the back which is less rowdy. Great choice of restaurants and plenty to do/see just inside this one hotel. We loved our stay and found it great value for money - Would definetely stay there again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “If you're over the age of 23, you probably won't like this place.”
Reviews.Author: all121star
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hard Rock 4 times over the past 7 years, and even though they have grown (added towers and space) and remodeled, the experience seems to get worse each time I stay here. I stayed here this one last time because I wanted to see their new suites in the HRH Tower. When you first walk in, they have a "WOW" factor but after closer inspection the rooms are constructed with cheap finishes and accessories. For the same money that we paid, you can get a lot nicer room at Mandalay Bay, Caesar's, Venetian, Wynn, etc. AND be located on the strip, where you don't have to take a taxi to get every where. The casino is small in relation to the hotel's new size and their loyalty program has to be the most chincy of all the places in Vegas. But the worst part was that every staff member, except for one blackjack dealer, had a "not my job" attitude. From the front desk staff (especially) to the pool personnel: Rude, unfriendly, bothered, etc. All but one staff member!!! Sad. If you're under the age of 23 AND/OR you don't expect the most bang for your buck, then you'll like this place.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been Worse**BEWARE**”
Reviews.Author: KLP14
Reviews.Content: I can honestly tell you that of my 20+ years of extensive travelling, this was the worst experience I have ever had. First, the service; front desk staff unfriendly and unhelpful at every occasion, set the tone right from the start. Pool staff actually suggested since they were out of fresh towels, we should try the used ones. Atmosphere is dark and dingy, rooms were subpar. The only thing I can say is that the restarants in the hotel were in fact quite good (Nobu, Pink Taco). We were so displeased with our stay that we checked out mid trip to go stay at another hotel! We went to "the" hotel at Mandalay and the difference was exceptional. Although I am sure I sound like a disgruntled traveller, this is the first (and potentially last) review I may write. Save yourself the awful experience we had and don't get tempted by the cheap rates. This place is truly not worth your $$.

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever haven't been treated like this”
Reviews.Author: Anysuited
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ HRH for 15 nights in the beginning of July. Everything worked ok, staff was a bit rude but the atmosphere was good... The true service mindset of the staff was revealed when there were money stolen from my room. tl;dr-> Cleaning staff woke me up because had forgotten to put "tied up" sign to my door. I clearly told the lady that "No cleaning today". She answered ok and I woke up few hours later. Headed to the pool to see my colleague and left my wallet to my jeans' pocket, took $100 with me and counted the money, $724 was there when I left. When I came back an hour later, there were two cleaners inside my room, my wallet was on the bed and I immideately knew something was going on. I told the cleaners to stay put, checked my wallet and 224$ was missing. I had a $500 ATM receipt in my wallet and the one responsible probably thought that I'd have no evidence then. Called the security immideately and waited for them to show up. When the security came up to my room, filled an voluntary statement and when asking why they let the cleaning staff go, I was told that everything would be taken care of and I'd get a call back in an hour. After an hour, nothing. The next day, I went to the security podium and asked for any updates. The lady there said it takes 24 hours to sort everything out and while I had 8 nights left in my stay @ HRH, I was fine with it. The next day at the podium, I was told that it takes 2-3 days to investigate, and still no info. 4 days later I got pissed to the same lady who told me that it takes 5-7 days to sort everything out. I demanded to see the supervisor only to find out that I'd been lied to. Supposably nothing happens before you call Security & Risk management office. So I did, the very next business day. Elene Boyt was not at the office, so I dealt with Sonia Monahan, Security & Risk Management Investigator. She told me that she'd sort everything out, and I told her I was in hurry with only 2 days left before flying back home. She said it takes an hour and I could reach her from her office until 5:30pm. I called 3:30, 4:00 and 5:15, no answer. I left her a voicemail that I'd need all the documentation about the "investigation" to take back home, and would take this issue to police. It's only 200$ but FFS this is about a principle. You just can't treat people like this. When checking out 5am last Wednesday, there were no documentation at the front desk. Called the security again and they promised to take a copy of the voluntary statement and bring it down to the lobby in 5 minutes, maximum. Waited for 10 more and had to take a cab to the airport. Left my email to the reception and the girl on duty promised to email me a copy of the statement. Still nothing. Have been dealing with 10+ people, have been lied to as many times and NOTHING has been done to solve this issue. Have to say I'm disappointed to say the least. In my humble opinion and based on a two-week stay € HRH, the words "service" or "customer" means nothing to HRH staff. I will not ever stay at HRH again, and would strongly advice others to find another hotel as well. I travel 20+ times a year, and this is definitely the most ridiculous chain of events I have ever witnessed. HRH Poker room was great and never had any problems there... Staff was nice / flexible and the games were soft. Will definitely play there again.

Reviews.Title: “HARD ROCK IS OFF THE CHARTS”
Reviews.Author: travelcouple89
Reviews.Content: To Whoever reads this review, I would like to throw in my two cents from my experience at the HRH. This place is wonderful. It may not be tamed for everyone but if you are here to party enjoylife and have fun than the Hard Rock is for you. Where else would you want to be after all this is Sin City where pretty much anything goes. Location: Off strip but hey if you been to Vegas Enough times it really doesnt matter if your on the strip or off it. Some of there rooms offer an excellent view of the strip but yes like all other hotels there maybe a fee increase. Parking: Very convenient. Depending on which Tower you are in there is a garage for each one. The only one that doesnt have its own garage is the actually casino tower. But you can decide between HRH All suite Tower or the Paradise Tower parking garage. Checkin: When I have checked in i have not dealed with lines. Usually checkin midday if rooms are ready or late evening same applys for checkin each tower has its own checkin desk. Rooms: Fantastic. HRH all suite Towers are perfect. Where else can you find a place that has a built in soundbar system and you can select from a variety of music. Dont forget your ipod cause you can play your music on it too. plush bedding and a seperate living room with semi sectional couch. HUGE bathroom and shower with soaking tube. Plenty of room to store your belongings. Cant say much for the other two towers in the Hard Rock but everything is there for you on there website. casino: Love the expansion. very open with a smooth flow so there is no traffic. there are two wonderful main bars with generous sitting. plentiful of games and of course the poker room. Food: Mr.Luckys is a good sit down diner. I would recommend the french toast for breakfast. they also have other menu items to choose from like your ihop or dennys but my opinion it tastes better here at Mr.Luckys and its 24/7. Another place AGO all i can say is WOW. I had the Veal there and its was like butter. So soft and the portion was very generous. Waiters are very kind and service is great. club: Vanity is not your giant las vegas club but it is very spacious. With Dj ericdlux spinning. the dance floor is nice and has a gigantic multi colored chandlier . Note: make sure you stay in the HRH all suite tower. pool: Well what can i say about the pool. Hard Rock Hotel invented REHAB. and now all other Hotels are trying to top it. Not going to happen. They can continue to play second fiddle. fitness/spa: i didnt use it but it looked failry large when i passed by. the spa didnt go but went around the lobby area of it looked very nice. concierge: one word well two. Esteban Rey. This the best of the best. Very helpful and kind. I wont say much. Ill let you find out for yourself. Overall: The rates at Hard Rock are very generous. If your lucky you can catch on too one of there many deals when they have twitter tuesday. other than that the hotels website offers some very generous offers. And for being a 4 star hotel the rates you get are very reasonable. Or become a member of the rockstarclub where you can get even better deals. I am glad i became a member. All in all this places really Rocks with different concerts happening every week or some type of event you will be more than glad when you have stayed at the ROCK.

Reviews.Title: “WARN ME NEXT TIME YOU REMODEL”
Reviews.Author: daleChampaign
Reviews.Content: What a let down - walked into the hard rock hotel - and 90% of the gaming floor was torn down. Thanks for the heads up. Pool staff rude.

Reviews.Title: “I love you Hard Rock!!”
Reviews.Author: SDpartygirl22
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and love it. My girls and I go to Vegas once a year and always party at the hard rock. The rooms are cool and the staff is friendly. Rehab is Fabulous, but drinks are expensive. We went to the new club Vanity it pretty and fun.Pink Taco is great for mexican. Hard Rock is the spot for 35 and under. I wish I could go every month. I love you Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: elstevo-london
Reviews.Content: For my friend and I for the first time in the US the HRH was awesome! We were taken care of from the time we walked through those blessed doors until the time we left. This is a party hotel, we knew that going in and were pleased with it the whole way through. All of the staff were extremely helpful and courteous (Chris the barman at Center Bar is an absolute legend and treated us like family whilst we were there) Everyone we encountered from the hotel welcomed us as if we were regulars who visited every weekend. Only wish we had joined the rockstar club while we were there to get some comps on extra nights! There were leaf blowers in the early morning but hell we had just got home at 06h30 and passed out so didn't mind. Mr lucky's does an insane breakfast to sort that hangover too. Loved it, will be back with more friends in 2011. Would be back sooner but the 11hr flight from London is hellava ride man. Thanks again HRH you guys certainly ROCK!

Reviews.Title: “Get Over Yourself Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: JoJoDro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock in the new HRH Tower in May for my sister's bachlorette party & I can safely say I will NEVER stay there again. Don't get me wrong, there is some good to the Hard Rock...the rooms are BOMB & some of the people who work there can be nice, but for the most part the Hard Rock really needs to get over itself! The weekend we were there, it seemed to be every worker's "first day." That's what the guy said at the pool after a big gust of wind came, while he was carrying lounge chairs & slammed them into my friend's head. It also happened to be the "first day" for some of the security at the Rehab pool who told us not once, but twice the wrong color wrist band to wear. Not to mention at the end of my stay, I was charged $200 for a late check out I didn't even use! WTF? I had to call the hotel 12 times before they gave me a manager who refunded my money! Absolutely ridiculous service at the Hard Rock. The pool is the best, I will give them that, but so NOT WORTH IT! Get over yourself Hard Rock, you're not even on the stip!

Reviews.Title: “Rude front desk people. Would never stay again”
Reviews.Author: daniela722
Reviews.Content: The people are rude. There were drunk people fighting outside our room. Tried to call front desk for 20 minutes for security would just ring. I asked if they could move rooms for us. They were rude and did not care. I would never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pools!”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaCanadiangirl
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with the Hard Rock, I had never stayed off the strip before and wasn't a huge fan of that but the hotel was great. The rooms were very nice, and the pools were great! Exspecially the rehab pool party! If you are looking for a huge casino this is probably not the place for you, the casino is not very big compared to the other hotels on the strip. The Vanity club was really good, small but really good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Unpersonal Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Chris11982
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in June. The Hotel itself is "Super Cool". Cool Music, great pool area and a nice poker room. Which stuck out though was the unpersonal staff. They made the impression of you beeing more a nuisance then a guest. The HRH was a nice experience, but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place ... BUT beware of the switch”
Reviews.Author: TheHons
Reviews.Content: I sent my son to the Hard Rock with his friends as a 30th Birthday present. I booked thru a web site well in advance. My son called the hotel 4 different times to keep checking for 2 rooms with 2 Queen size beds. They told us that they could not guarantee that but that would do their best. My son arrived on June 24, 2010 at 11:30AM ( las vegas time). People are usually checking out at that time. He was told that there were no 2 rooms available with 2 Queen size beds, but for additional money they could get them 2 rooms with 2 Queen beds in the HR towers. They had originally been booked in the Paradise Towers. I just happen to look at the Trip Advisor log for something else and happen to see that the exact same thing happened to some people from Calgary, Canada on June 23, 2010 the day before my son and friends arrived. Something smells fishy here. Although they enjoyed themselves I think its terrible to take advantage of young adults. Hotel and pool were worth it! Good times for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Left standing at receptiong for 3 hours!!!”
Reviews.Author: leep_eers
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to LA and Las Vegas for her 21st birthday. The week in LA was brilliant! We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express on the Walk of Fame, and it was amazing. However, when we went to check in at the Hard Rock Hotel, they said they couldn't check us in because we didn't have a major credit card, and only had debit cards, to pay the safety deposit. The room was already booked and paid for. Credit cards aren't as popular in Australia, so we pleaded and begged for them to make an exception. They wouldn't budge. We had to fax forms and make phonecalls back and forth to Australia! I had to use my mobile phone, as they wouldn't let me use their phone! The girl behind the desk (Dee-Ann) was a very rude woman, and just suggested we check into another hotel. Obviously our business wasn't that important to them. After three hours, she had finished her shift, and we were dealing with the supervisor. After a rediculous amount of messing around, we finally got in. As an apology, we got.... 2 free beers! I'm serious! Not even a room upgrade. AVOID THIS HOTEL at all costs! Yes, the rooms are clean, but the customer services sucks, and you can't help but breathe in other peoples cigarette and cigar smoke at the bars and casinos! So much for that expensive aftershave I was wearing!

Reviews.Title: “Mind Blowing !”
Reviews.Author: TahaS
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in the world , Loved staying at the Hard Rock , Vanity was the most rocking club i've ever been to .. Rehab ..Sundays at the pool is pure craziness .. and it has the biggest casino in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Like Rock! then hard rock it!!!”
Reviews.Author: RichardWiggett
Reviews.Content: This is smart hotel. Me and my girlfriend stayed here for 2 nights and it was just enough. It's off the Strip so you have to get a taxi or walk to the strip but its out of the way but the hotel itself has enough to do around the complex. the Casino is nicely set up with rock memrobila all around and the table prices range to suit the wallet! the pools are ace the range from a over 21 pool which is chilled out and the rehab pool which was fairly busy on a friday afternoon but this place is rammed on a Sunday so get there early. You carnt take any liquids not even water into the pool area so make sure you take your wallet. There is a hard rock cafe just outside the hotel. We also ate at the pink taco which was nice and a good price

Reviews.Title: “awful with late check in”
Reviews.Author: BobKLV
Reviews.Content: I reserved a casino rate midweek in May for a single night. Based on my itinerary, I specifically requested a late check in, not a problem. Got a room in the old tower (casino) and it was at the end of a long hall. The room was on the pool side but the view was of the roof. No big deal since I was there late to sleep. A couple of moths in the room (throwing magazines around to kill them). Woken up in the middle of the night by some staff for some unknown reason (I think they had the wrong room). When you consider that they charge a resort fee (somewhere around $15/day + tax) that I couldn't utilize (gym, parking (already free), airport shuttle), not a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again but we did have problems”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Silver_10
Reviews.Content: All in all, I really enjoyed my stay at the Hard Rock. The beds were excellent, the shower had great water pressure, the room was quite spacious and the entire vibe of the hotel/casino was right up my alley. I also liked the fact the the hotel is not on the strip. There was a CVS across the street and several restaurants so it was nice to be able to cross the street and eat at a restaurant that isn't busy when you aren't in the mood to be surrounded by crowds of people. The pool area was beautiful and I definitely would have liked to spend more time just laying around out there but time flies. However, we did have some problems..... (1) When we checked in, we were told that the room we paid for (Paradise Tower) wasn't available but that they had a room in the Casino Tower available. We said that that would work for us but when I asked about getting a refund since the Paradise Tower is an upgrade from the Casino Tower, I was told that since we booked through a 3rd party, a refund could not be issued for the price difference. (2) We then asked the same person for directions to the Premium Outlet Mall. She proceeded to print out a map and directions using Google Map. I thought this was incredibly helpful but when we got to our room, we realized that the directions were actually from Las Vegas to an outlet mall in South Carolina! Needless to say, this wasn't helpful and was quite ridiculous. (3) Our room appeared as though it hadn't been vacuumed in quite some time. There were cherry pits, seeds, fruit stickers, twist ties, clothing tags, etc. all over the floor. (4) When we complained about the messiness and lack of a price adjustment, we were told that we would get a discount rate on our current room; however, upon checkout, we did not receive any refund (we did have to pay the $16/night resort fee, though). (5) One other strange thing... when we were going up to our room after a trip to CVS to buy some things, the guy standing at the elevator told us that he had to search our bags to make sure that we weren't bringing up a 26 oz. of liquor. He told us that we were only allowed to bring a case of beer and a mickey of hard liquor. ???
