So yes, we had issues with certain things but I liked the location, I liked the atmosphere, and I liked the room (if it would have been vacuumed, that would have been nice.) Some staff were great - when our a/c broke, it was repaired within the hour and the guy that checked us out was very polite and accommodating but at that point, the damage was done. So it seems as though the service you receive depends on who you are dealing with. I would recommend it to others but I would also explain what we went through.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Bachelor Party”
Reviews.Author: knup342
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the HRH Tower suites. Beautiful rooms just like the pictures. Beds are really comfy, walk in shower is spacious and has two heads. We had a great view of the pools. Speaking of pools the hotel has plenty of them. You can relax at one or you can party at another. If you like to party I would stick to the rehab pool Food at the hotel was really good, lots of choices. Casino was spacious and lively with great wait staff. Never a long line for taxis to the strip at night. Close proximity to the airport. Door staff offers great tips for ideas to eat, party, shop, etc. I really can't say anything bad about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: travelinmanBangalore
Reviews.Content: The joint and wasted space are probably the best rock spaces there are out there...

Reviews.Title: “If I could give this zero stars, I would!”
Reviews.Author: daisychick82
Reviews.Content: - I called the business center prior to our arrival to ask about having a package delivered to the hotel. She said that it was fine and we just need to go pick it up in the business center. When we went to pick it up, they charged us $9! What for? Oh, to sign for it. -When we checked into the hotel, the woman checking us in asked for a credit card and said that they wouldn't accept debit cards. She said “if you didn't like it, then you can leave and go somewhere else.” Then we're told that it's going to be $100 per night held on our card IN CASE WE BREAK THINGS! -Upon getting to our room, we saw that shampoo and conditioner were $24 EACH, and not included with the room! -We were told by the bell desk that the hours of the shuttle were 10am-6pm, and the driver confirmed this. They only go once per hour on the hour, and they only go to the fashion show mall. -We ended up leaving the Siegfried and Roy’s Secret Garden and Dolphin Habitat early to make it to the last shuttle back to the hotel. We showed up, but it didn’t come. I called the hotel and was told that the last run was at 5pm. I told her that we were told twice that it was from 10-6, she just said that there was nothing she could do. We ended up getting a cab back to the hotel ($12). -On day 2, we were woken up at 6:30 by the crew out by the pool using a leaf blower. I called the front desk and she said that there was nothing they could do about it. Never mind that the paper thin walls had allowed us to hear everyone partying until the wee hours of the morning and we were now up at 6:30, there was nothing she could do and she honestly didn’t care. -That night, we asked about the shuttle, just so we could clear it up. Once again, we were told the hours were 10am-6pm. When I explained the issue we had the night before, the bell man acted like I was stupid. He said that of course there wasn’t a shuttle at 6pm, the guy who drives the shuttle is off work at 6pm! So when they say that it runs from 10am-6pm, they mean that there are shuttles from 10am-5pm. How stupid of me to not understand that! -On day three, (after being woken up at 6:30 by the leaf blower again) we spent the morning on the strip and later went down to the pool. The woman handing out towels was irritated that we interrupted her conversation with her cute male co-worker and all but threw the towels at us. There weren’t any lounge chairs available at the first pool area, so we went up to the second area with these big white cushioned ottomans and sat down. We were then kicked out because they have a $100 minimum and we hadn’t reserved it. There was nothing to indicate that we needed a reservation (it wasn’t a cabana). We ended up going over to the back pool and hung out there for a few hours. There was a cocktail waitress over there with long black hair that was working her butt off and very nice. Didn’t see her very often and drinks took forever to get to us, but that was because the other girls working that pool weren’t doing anything but flirting with the cute male guests. -That evening, we went back to the hotel and called the front desk to ask about the dress code for Skybar. It was about 10:50 when we called. The woman explained the dress code, and we headed down to have a few drinks. When we showed up, it was closed. Turns out, the hours are from 6-11pm. The book in the hotel room is so old that it doesn’t even list Skybar, and the woman at the front desk didn’t think to mention that it was closing in 10 minutes. -We ended up going to the lounge by the poker room. It took a while to get the bartender’s attention. Not because it was busy, but because he was preoccupied with his conversation with the cocktail waitress. He kept looking over at me, but continued to chat it up with his co-worker. -On the last day, we packed up our things, and went down to the front desk where we discovered that we had been charged almost $100 for the mini bar, even though we didn’t take a single thing. Turns out, it’s all on a weight system and if you even look through the mini fridge to see what there is, you’re charged for everything you move. -We were also charged $15 per day plus tax for their “resort fee” which apparently covers valet parking, self parking, the shuttle, access to the gym, towels for the pool, and the phone in the room. That seems a little steep considering we used 2 towels, and rode the shuttle 3 times. -We still had 7 hours until our flight, so we headed out to catch the first shuttle to the strip at 10am. It never came. The old outdated shuttle had broken down and so we were stuck sitting there unless we wanted to pay for a cab. So much for the $15 resort fee which covers shuttle service!

Reviews.Title: “clean, noisy and off the beaten track!!”
Reviews.Author: sahara1982
Reviews.Content: myself and my boyfriend are just back from 6 nights there. It is a really cool hotel- probably the coolest one in LV- where all the beautiful people hang out!!! the rooms are exceptionally clean - but they never replaced the original fre bottle f water- and at $4 a pop in the shop - this is just plain mean!! the hotel is quite a distance from the strip- a 15/20 min walk- we had to cab it all the time because of the heat! we spent about $350 on taxis- and on checking out- we were informed that the hotel provided a shuttle bus to the strip - WE WERE SO MAD!!! there is a $15 dollar per day resort charge - a bit much!! pool area was lovely- but was off limits on Sunday for REHAB - ladies are charged $100 for entry! overall a cool hotel- not allabout the casino. plenty of places to eat. definitely one of the trendier hotels in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't have chosen a better hotel to stay at in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: jsv_10
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock has everything you could want or need right there on the premises. It was fun, friendly and safe. I highly recommend it to anyone who wants everything at their fingertips during their visit to Las Vegas! The staff is great and always eager to accommodate any needs or wants.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but not accomodating”
Reviews.Author: BillyBobAce
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel due to the low rate we received through Resorts Plus International. We read some mixed reviews online, but with the disount we received, we thought we'd try it out anyway. We were both pleased and disappointed. The hotel is clean and has amazing decoration, however, the staff weren't so accomodating. It felt as if there is too much hotel and not enough staff. I've heard the hotel expanded, maybe that is the reason. But we did enjoy our stay as the hotel had plenty to do, with a nice layout, great food and of course, gambling! One negative is it's a long walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock = nice room, memorabilia and entertainment”
Reviews.Author: Tacpatriot
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel was cleaning rooms at early check in so I took their shuttle to the Fashion Show Mall. The shuttle broke down and the hotel did not reimburse me for the taxi as they stated they would. My bill was slid under my door before the morning that I was checking out. An information thief could have pulled the bills from under the many other doors as they were visible. The front desk did not think much of it so I notified management voice mail and am awaiting a response. The room was very neat, clean and comfortable. The Poker tournament was throughout the day; the Denis Leary Comedian show was great. The security is really polite and provides a safe atmosphere with calm, cool and collected good sense. It was pretty easy to find good food at reasonable prices all day long. You can find what you need here or someone else will easily oblige you. There is a no-nonsense, no drug policy here. You might want to go to the pool and the Hard Rock does not even allow prescription drugs into the pool area. The Spa was just fantastic for exercising and using the Jacuzzi. I look forward to returning with someone for a relaxing enjoyable and entertaining time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice theme-hotel”
Reviews.Author: yannick_decleir
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, especially if you're in to (hard) rock. Rooms are spacious and clean. Lots of shops and restaurants around. Location is not that great, half an hour walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service in a Fantastic Room”
Reviews.Author: SprinceLA
Reviews.Content: I was there for business so really only spent evenings at the hotel but I stayed in the new HRH Tower and was pleasantly surprised by how nice my room was and the rate- $99! I WISH I could have gone to the awesome pools I was looking at below but I never had the opportunity. So strictly speaking about the cleanliness, help, room service, and the Starbucks downstairs (can you say fast?), it was exceptional. Everyone working there had such great attitudes. At one point I was slightly confused about where I was in relation to my rooms and a lady with a vacuum stopped and said- "Can I help you?" Wow. The only imperfection was that I was on the 15th floor and beginning Thursday night I could hear the boom boom of the club from the 2nd floor below me until late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: rpartees
Reviews.Content: Certainly has grown since we used to take our kids there in the late '90's and let them run free at the pool. Stayed in the new suite tower and was impressed with the service. Bell men/car valet service was polite and prompt. Room service was prompt and courteous, (they even remind you that the gratuity has already been included in the bill). Housekeeping was very prompt when we needed a new in-room iron. The beds in the suite rooms are fantastic. Did not see/have any of the problems that some have reported on this web site. Just be aware that if you move any of the in room food items/drinks to check them out and put them back, you may see a charge on your bill as it is electronically sensored, but they were prompt in removing the charge.

Reviews.Title: “Not horrible but would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SEGMN
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the HRH over a long weekend in May. We didn't have a horrible experience but we all checked out of the hotel in agreement that we definitely would not recommend the property to others. We checked into our two rooms on a Thur afternoon without any waiting or hassle. Our rooms were a few away from one another but in the same hallway. Our first set of keys didn't work so we called to the front desk. After two hours, three different keys had been sent up and engineering had examined the lock with no answers. We were let into the room but our keys still didn't work. The view from our room was of a rooftop that was full of garbage and cigarette butts. We complained at the front desk and requested that they just switch our room because we had already wasted two hours. They were nice enough to upgrade us at no charge to the new towers which were astoundingly nicer rooms with great views of the pool. A friend of mine living in Vegas came to lay at the pool with us for the day and had to pay $100 for a wrist band just to lay at the pool...for ONE day!! We all had complimentary wristbands with our paid hotel room but if we lost them, HRH staff said they were not replaceable. We arrived at the pool the first morning to find only two chairs open but there were five of us. The pool staff would not allow us to share the chairs and basically forced us to pay for a mattress if we wanted to stay...at our own hotel pool. We had to pay $150 for it and drinks were an additional $25 a piece. The expense took away from any enjoyment we may have had that day. In addition, when we checked out, we were informed of a $20 per day charge per room for a supposed "shuttle" to and from the strip. We never saw this shuttle and there was always a long line for taxi cabs. Overall, the hotel was clean and nice in the new tower. The pool was beautiful but also not worth the money. The hotel was always crowded because it is so hyped up on the Rehab TV show. I have been to Vegas a number of times before and have never had these problems at different hotels. We won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service degrades as hotel expands”
Reviews.Author: marbs978
Reviews.Content: The HRH has been one of my favorite hotels, but this was my first stay since the opening of the HRH tower and three new pools. My stay the first weekend in June was some of the worst service I have experienced in any hotel and certainly a departure from the wonderful service we experienced in September of 2009. Negatives: *not being told we would have to pay $100 for entry to Rehab since our hotel rate was not high enough until we specifically asked (fortunately the nice check in clerk was able to waive this) *being told repetedly throughout our stay that I was not eligible to charge to the room even though I was added by the primary name on the room and it was verified several times *getting served a meal with mushrooms after asking if there were mushrooms in the meal and then being treated rudely for asking the meal be removed from my check *taking 8 hours to receive towels *only two checkout clerks despite there being a long line - especially annoying when you are trying to catch a flight *unaccomidating guest service staff when I wanted to extend my stay by one night *waitresses at the pool who ignore you even when you say you'd like to order *not sure Rehab is as fun as it used to be - i'm sure there is a newer hotter pool party in Vegas these days On the plus: *the rooms were new, clean & comfortable *we were upgraded from mountain to pool side I think that it really depends on who you deal with - there are always some people who are more helpful than others. The food and drinks at Pink Taco are a great deal & the food at Rare 120 is excellent. Also the tattoo staff at Hart & Huntington were great. With so many choices in Vegas I think I will try out a hotel like Wynn/Encore or Pallazo next time i am in town.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock brand without the Hard Rock magic”
Reviews.Author: BuffyRocks
Reviews.Content: After visiting over half of the HR cafes in the world we thought it was about time to extend our love of HR to the hotels but don't expect that same level of HR Cafe service or quality. Check in was painfully slow with several receptionists just standing around looking busy rather than serving the 20+ queue. Our holiday was all prepaid before we left home but at check in we were sprung with the mandatory resort fee, even though there is nothing on the HR Hotel website about this. We asked to use their phone to call our agent and were met with sarcastic comments from the reception manager - not a great start is it, Hard Rock? The room looked like a bachelor pad, very cold and clinical with lots of black furniture, black and white carpet and a giant television. The room could have been in any hotel anywhere in the world, the only way you would have known it to be HR was the token framed Beatles picture on the wall. There was a tray of leftovers outside our door when we arrived and it stayed there for at least 24 hours. The stacked full of items from toiletries to food and drink - all of which had price tags on and the mini bar was weight sensored. It made you scared to touch anything and you felt the hard sell, not the hard rock magic. If you want to stay in Vegas there are FAR better hotels. Hard Rock, if you're reading this and actually care, then remove the resort fee which just starts the vacation with a very bad taste (it's a hidden charge to pay to maintain the facilities, even though you have to pay to use them anyway - it's just another way to make money and isn't welcomed) and get your check in staff to check people in and show they care. It was cold and clinical with sarcasm. It has really put us off ever staying in a HR hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hard Rock Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: flynnse
Reviews.Content: Had a beautiful suite in the new tower for an incredibly low rate. The staff at registration were pleasant and gracious when we had a small discrepancy with the charge. Had dinner at the Pink Taco, excellent Mexican food, friendly, efficient staff. Breakfast at Mr. Lucky's (try the blueberry pancakes, excellent). We are locals and stayed the night for my husband's birthday. It was everything we wanted. We are over 50 and still love the Hard Rock. They don't make us feel like Senior Citizens, like some of the "locals" casinos do. We gamble there almost every weekend. It's a fun place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great during the week”
Reviews.Author: nuts7hawk
Reviews.Content: Some of these reviews are real downers. While I was also disappointed with the resort fee being tacked onto my bill, I didn't experience the rudeness others did from staff. In fact, everyone was really nice to us. We came in Memorial Day and skipped Rehab since we were traveling with a 2-year-old. He had a great time watching it from our pool view room that was upgraded to the Paradise Tower complements of the concierge. The pool was beautiful on a Wed. morning. Certainly not crowded or rowdy. We didn't eat at the hotel, but took the complimentary shuttle to the strip for that. Loved the decor and music selection and just plain being at such a cool place. I would recommend staying there during off season, as we truly had the opportunity to enjoy the Hard Rock and all its personality.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!!! Much better hotels ON THE STRIP for less that this crap!”
Reviews.Author: hevin24
Reviews.Content: Myself and a few girlfriends decided to take a 6 day trip to LV for the Rehab party at the HRH on Memorial Day weekend. For the convenience we decided to stay here. Despite it being on the pricer side for a standard room we decided to go with it purely for the convenience. I have been to Vegas 5 times prior in the last three years and this was the first time I have ever been so disappointed in an establishment. For starters, staff workers were rude and nasty. Secondly, the rooms were no better than a motel. Granted the "theme" was a nicer but overall not worth the amount we spent. We called for towels and toilet tissue but they never showed. I ended up taking them from a cart myself. The water pressure was HIDEOUS. I had to fill up the tub an hour in advance JUST so I can feel clean. The rugs were worn and musty. Then to add insult to injury, prior to us booking we were told as hotel guests we would be receive some sort of discount if we attend the Rehab party. Bulls**t! The minute we arrive we are told there is no such "deal" for guests and not onlydo we have to pay $100 to get in but it was the same price for outside guests as well. WTF is the perk then???? The hotel is not on the strip, therefore you have to cab it (its walkable but who wants to do that in 4 inch pumps?) Oh God, even the food there sucked! All and all we made the best of it but when a cab driver tells you "no one ever stays at the hard rock after their first experience" then you know its not just you being picky. Lesson learned. I will never stray from my favorite hotels again. Shame one you HRH!!!! The one good thing I will say about this place was that Rehab ROCKED and it was the best $100 I ever spent for a dance fest. For those of you considering, stay elsewhere but make your way to Rehab if you can.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pittuk23
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night on my first night in vegas then stayed in the bellagio for 2 nights, i loved both but prefered this hotel for its modern look and spirit, the rooms we're very modern and i loved the casino. My only complaint was we we're told guests got in the nightclub for free, i got there at midnight and they said its too late now its $30, i complained and got nowhere then i saw some girls get let in for free, spoke to them later and they said 'girls seem to get everything for free'. Now I paid as much as they did to stay in the hotel so why should they get in free and me not? Either way though had a great time and would stay there again had a crazy crazy night!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jpriehs
Reviews.Content: I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone who hasnt been to vegas. It is a bit off the stip, but has anything you would want in a hotel. It has the resturants which are excellent, and the bars and club located right inside the hotel. If you love music, especially rock, than youll love walking down the halls and not only hearing the music you love and enjoy but also see vintage pics of your favorite bands. It was the best vacation experience I have had in some time, and its VEGAS.

Reviews.Title: “Peeping Staff”
Reviews.Author: ae321
Reviews.Content: Came here for Memorial Day weekend with my boyfriend and our trip started out badly when we pulled up and got out of the cab only to have no one there to greet us, help with luggage, open the door, etc. Walked in to the new HRH tower where we were staying and had to ask the bellhop where we checked in. He scoffed and pointed to the desk. Thank, I guess. Went to check in and we were told that the only rooms they had available were on the 3rd floor or we could pay an extra $60 or so and upgrade to a pool view room. We asked what the deal was with the 3rd floor, if it was loud or what the view was like. We were told it was fine but that some people "just like to be up higher." We decided to go with the 3rd floor room only to find out you are staring directly into a parking garage and we were roof level of the hotel. Not happening. We really wanted to get out into the pool so we decided to just pay a little extra and upgrade to the pool view room. We got up there and it was a handicapped room and it also just wasn't as nice as the original room we saw. We went back downstairs for the second time to ask to switch rooms and we were told there was nothing else available and we would have to wait. They called 3 hours later and had a room ready. By the way, they were also extremly rude the entire time, no apologies at all. So much for customer service. When we went back to get our room we realized we were back on the city view but were still being charged the pool view room. The girl basically said she never saw our original rate and there was nothing she could do. We asked to have a manager call us and they never did. We got to our room and I will say the rooms are really nice. The view still sucked but the room was nice. Got out to pool where my bf was padded down and they really, really search your things! They even opened my coin purse and went through his wallet! They did take away my eye drops, aleve, and compact and I did not get them back. I asked what the deal was and they said it would be very easy for me to empty out the bottle of eye drops and refill it with drugs and put it in someone's drink. Right...Had an $18 margarita served by a rude waitress and then inquired about getting a cabana. $2500 and they are tiny, the beds were $500 and it was already 2pm. What a joke. Casino was fun, room service was sub par and the pizza was cold by the time we got it and made both of us pretty ill. Called again to ask to speak to a manager and again, no one ever called back. Only got housekeeping one day even though we put the sign on our door every day. The day they did come they knocked once and walked in without annoucing themselves at 9am. The icing on the cake was when I was in the bathroom at 7pm getting ready and a man came in to our room to "check the minibar." If he knocked, I never heard him because the TV was on and the water was running. Usually if the staff knocks on your door and sees the TV on and hears the water running they would leave the room. Not him. He decided to round the corner looked into the bathroom where I was naked and annouced that he was checking the mini bar and would come back later. I obviously totally freaked out and threw a towell on and looked out the peep hole to see if he was there and if he actually did work at the hotel, he was out there with a cart. I locked the door and called security, who never came up to my room and came to speak to me. UNACCEPTABLE. After that one of the lights in the bathroom broke and we called for maintenance but guess what? They never came and it never got fixed. Service is beyond terrible, probably the worst I've ever had in Vegas or quite possibly at any hotel. I would call the manager to complain but I'm pretty sure he doesn't exist. Do not stay here unless you want a member of their pervy staff peeping on you in the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “A great 6 nights at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: al4175
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on here and often think that I must stay at a different Hard Rock than some of the reviewers here. I've probably stayed here 25 times since year one (1996). Typically 3 nights but this time 6. Pulled up to valet on a busy saturday afternoon and it was a slight wait to get the rental car and baggage situated. Less than a 5 min wait at registration. The room I'd specified was ready, a pleasant surprise - normally just a bit of a wait while they clean it. Desk clerk very pleasant and went to bat for me when I pointed out the discrepancy between current resort fee ($15) vs when I'd reserved in February ($7). With tax approximately $50 difference over the 6 nights and the clerk's manager said they'd honor my $7 fee at checkout. I'd specified Casino Tower, "new tower" (circa 2000 expansion), high floor. Exactly what I got, 10th floor under the penthouse. Second to last room on the hallway so no noisy partiers going by my room but a hike to the ice machine and elevator. Preferred the peace and quiet so no problem. Only noise was them moving some furniture above me in Penthouse on Saturday night. I stayed in Paradise Tower in August and found it too dark for my tastes. They've redecorated the casino tower, new furniture, patterned carpet and wallpaper and painted a lot of the former beige trim a dark brown. So the Casino tower now resembles the Paradise to some extent but it's still lighter and brighter and has the french doors that open. Weather was overall on the cool side while there and I turned off the AC and opened the doors quite a bit. Did my usual Pink Taco happy hour and steak and shrimp special at Mr. Lucky's. The new tapas place, Johnny Smalls, is a great addition and did that twice. Only gambled once but had one of my best sessions all time at blackjack. Sunday passed on Rehab and did the new West pool. Really nice, includes another casino, bar, table service, with SKYBAR above. Went to that pool three other days. Great service by waitresses Elicia and Stephanie. Chairs hard to come by but not too bad around 3 pm, otherwise get there before 11 am. Most weekdays they had both the West and South pools open with the North (Rehab) pool closed. Wednesday only the West was open for some reason, perhaps they were expecting poorer weather/turnout and it was too congested. Weekdays daytime they only had table games open in the new casino (and the pool), nothing happening in the original casino. Kind of sad. My sense is that the overbuilt, the business increase hasn't matched the expanded capacity. Even Saturday the overall casino space was far from packed. I'm well above the typical Hard Rock demographic but as always found the personnel and fellow guests pleasant and friendly. At checkout the desk clerk took care of that resort fee mentioned, it was quite a bit of work for her as she had to do each day individually but very pleasant and no complaints. There was one bogus minibar item for ~$8 and that was taken off with no problems. Best stay yet and look forward to next time at the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have stayed at yet! And I'm a flight attendant!”
Reviews.Author: 737FlyGirl
Reviews.Content: Super cool, clean and great customer service every interaction. The paradise tower was super posh and had a rock star feel to it. Reminded me of the W hotels. The beds were to die for with a huge TV on a swivel wall mount. Too bad we spent all our time at the pool, which were surprising clean, even with the amount of people who were there. The gym was awesome with individual TVs on the cardio machines. The only downfalls were the food at the Pink Taco, made all of our stomachs upset (both nights) and the 'sweet smell' in the original casino, smelled a lot like a clove cigarette...gross. But the new part of the casino was great! After all the hotels I have stayed at in my 10+ years as a flight attendant...The Hard Rock is #1 in my book, with W hotels, a distant #2...

Reviews.Title: “A 'barely off the strip' hotel that delivers!”
Reviews.Author: NoSupermanMD
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Vegas is simply amazing. From the moment that you check in, to the moment you check out, you will be glad that you booked here. They have great rates during the week, thus, less people to have to deal with...but still enjoy the charm of Vegas. HRH has a wonderful music selection in the casino, which you can enjoy while you gamble, have drinks or simply lounge by the pool. Speaking of the pool, there is a great lazy river, water slide and beach! The rooms were also simply amazing. I wanted to take the bed and pillows with me home they were so comfortable. The TV was huge and so clear (though, wasn't in the room that often!) The normal shampoo, etc were also fantastic. Overall, this was a great hotel that I would definitely come back to...so check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Rockin'”
Reviews.Author: TXgirly
Reviews.Content: The Hardrock Hotel and Casino has some of the most smokin' hot people in Vegas working and staying there. The hotel is clean and they play the best music to gamble to. We stay there almost every trip out to Vegas, but our only problem this time was the added $17 "resort fee" they tagged on with each night we stayed. We didn't know about it until we checked out and to boot it was for services we never even used. Stay and have a great time, but be aware of the extras involved.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: bulero
Reviews.Content: my room is very cozy, sophisticated system to check out on TV, wow night club was great and casino was awesome

Reviews.Title: “No Guest service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaBeachlover22
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel for the concert weekend as a gift to my wife as she is an avid Kenney Chesney fan, and for us to get away for a few days before the trip. Long short from the time we arrived at the hotel it started bad and got worse. We exit the taxi and there was no nell host readily available, no big deal we drag our 6 bags insode to find no sign pointing us to check in but after looking for a moment or two found it and preceeded to the check in counter where I gave them my information, I was advised that due to our early arrival "our" room was not available yet, I remided the host that per my phone coversation that we where to be upgraded only to be told that the had no courtesy up grades and the only room they had available to check right into was a hadicapp assesable room or wait for our room till later in the day and they would hold our bags or we could pay an extra 200 per night and stay in the paradise tower, I said thanks but no thanks and asked to see room they did have ready. Entering room i noticed it had two double beds and told bell hop that we had requested one king, he was very nice and called guest service and they said to check in now they could upgrade me to pool view for an extra 100 per night. After traveling 7 hrs i said to heck with it and took that room. Dropped our bags and went down to grab something at lucky 24/7's. Food was sub par we have cruised and had much better food and for beer, chicken ceasar salad and a couple soups I thought 35 was hign wow.. After lunch we went to check out on of the main reasons we booked this hotel other than the concert only to find 1 out of the three pools open (west pool) the security person was nice enought to walk us over and found it to be un croweded grabbed a couple chairs and relaxed. Beer ($7) Mixed (11) or (18) depending on size. Keep in mind we found out later this was the least expensive pool bar they have by a couple dollars per drink. You cannot take drinks out to pool from hotel btw. For dinner we went to pink taco and that was just ok mexican and priced a little more than lunch for two think around (50) After dinner headed to tables which I found to play very well compared to other strip hotels but maybe I was just lucky. The next morning my wife went into shower only to find out it had been taped up just so you could stand directly uder it so i called 3 times that morning just to get it fixed. (about 3hrs) Room service is quick and prices are inline with lucky's so that was our morning refuge. Rest of stay was about the same exce[t on friday -sunday expect to get to pool early and prices go up on drinks, and all pools except west pool are crazy packed r-x rated shows. Worst part was the night of concert trying to get our package tickets that where to go along with our concert tickets no one knew what that was and once one accknowledged it they claimed I had not paid extra for it nor was it still available. Big dissappointment!!! I spoke to both the Hotel manager and the Venu manager and one pointed at the other. Still I was out about 150 per person in the preshow activaties. If I was to book this hotel again which I personally would not I would get names dates and times and take with you.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive "Package" Deal for Concert, Promised VIP seats, Charged Extra, ended up with floor admission, Don't Do Package”
Reviews.Author: KCFANPetaluma
Reviews.Content: Went to See Kenny Chesney and purchased the VIP seating and tailgate package that included a room. Ended up with regular standing floor tickets, Paid $762 for the package ($360) was the value of the floor tickets if purchased seperately. Which means that I paid $400 for the room that normally goes for 150 night. When asking the Hotel Management about the issue they claimed it was the "Box office" issue. When asking the Box Office, they of course claimed it was the Hotel..... Place is noisy and off the strip with up charges for everything. Also think $10 beers and up.... Stay somewhere else and buy the show packages seperately.... you'll be way ahead of the game... These guys also tried to add a 360 duplicate charge to the bill for the concert.... Guess what the same game was played about who to talk to to fix it... that was worth an extra hour of heartache too....

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay and gamble, even for middle-aged couple”
Reviews.Author: MommaTiger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love Vegas and decided to give the HRH a try, mostly because of it's reputation for having a fun atmosphere and great pool. Got there before check-in time on Friday, so our room wasn't ready yet. I slipped the front desk guy a twenty and he found us a pool view room that was ready immediately. Lovely room, hip and clean with French doors opening to pool - nice! Staff was very nice, great dealers and boy does this place get hopping at nite - pole dancers in casino, husband loved it :) Join the player's club when you check in - we racked up $$$ off on our bill. The pool, Rehab, was happening on Saturday. Make sure to get in line before 9 am or you won't get a lounge chair. Beautiful pool, waterslides, waterfalls, swim up gaming and great people watching. They search everyone on way in so don't bring any drinks or liquids in (people were getting hand sanitized, cologne bottles and unopened boxes of Tylenol taken away). Cabanas are $5k on Saturdays, daybeds $1200 and bouncer guys have an attitude. Drinks very expensive - $25 long islands, but they came in big zippy cup and were strong - Bud Lights $9. You're on vacation, so be prepared to spend some $$$. We met some great young people from all over the US.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST SERVICE EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: yousuckbigone
Reviews.Content: They need to learn what customer service is. A fast food restaurant has better service then this place. They will insult you while your a paying guest and not care at all about it. They will call your friends girlfriend a ESCORT and just walk away after you ask them why they are even asking you these questions. I will never spend another dollar or step inside there doors again. Hard Rock good bye!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this off-strip hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: lolanola
Reviews.Content: This was my second or third time at the Hard Rock Vegas, can't remeber which. I had great experiences in the past - mainly because I prefer the smaller scale of this property to the enormous maze casinos on the Strip. And it used to be easier to park, but with the expansion that has gotten a bit chaotic. BEST THING - Mr. Lucky's!! Delicious and 24/7. Tried Pink Taco this time too, what a gross name, but wow I was impressed by the food. Fun little shops throughout and if you are a music fan you will love the memorabilia. WORST THING - this is a PARTY hotel, and you better just accept it. LOUD in the halls, and smoky in non-smoking rooms, blech. Would still probably go back as the beds are comfortable, rooms are roomy and I love the faux-balcony/doors that open to a view of the mountains or Strip area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: susmilelykethn23
Reviews.Content: We went down there for the supercross finals and couldn't have asked for a better hotel to stay in. We were able to check into our room right when we came into hotel at about 1pm and were given an upgrade on the room for free. The staff was awesome and very friendly. We were at the pool about everyday and thought the service was ok. The food slightly over priced, but all in all good. I plan on staying in this hotel again...we had a great time. It was werid we didn't want to leave vegas...but stay at the hard rock the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Terrible, horrible experience from Checkin to Checkout”
Reviews.Author: alluringgirl
Reviews.Content: The Nightmare at Hard Rock (HRH) begins at Checkin, with a 2 hour wait. Check-in stations not operating even with Hotel Staff mulling around behind the counter doing nothing, and not bothering to even acknowledge the long line of people waiting to check in and tired from the flight. We couldn't get the room or the price we booked, we asked to see a manager, and were informed by the other guest that they had been waiting to see a manager for 30 minutes, so we opted to just take the room offered. Then the un-advertised charges begin (and NEVER End), so there is a Resort fee per day, plus Wifi fee of $20 per day, the iphone wifi is blocked, so dont think of getting around this charge if you need email, etc. Then There is NO Bell Staff, but there is plenty of staff available to search you and your luggage for any outside food or beverages. We were actually patted down to make sure we didnt have flasks on us. This is the rudest staff we have ever encountered, Worse than going to France, which is saying something. When we got to our room, it hadnt been cleaned. so we put our luggage in and called room service to get our room cleaned. We could have saved our breath, it didnt get cleaned or restocked with towels until late afternoon the next day, fortunately the cleaning staff arent very alert, so we were able to steal towels, soap etc from the cleaning carts on another floor. if you order room service, expect a automatic 18% tip, 3 dollar delivery charge, 45 wait, and the most expensive prices for mediocre food. a modest Breakfast for 2 will run about $75, just food and coffee, not even an alcoholic drink. But thats just the start, try to go to the Gym $20, and thats for guest of the hotel. treatments at the spa start at $150. For a hotel where its supposed to be a party, they do everything to discourage you from having one, our group was trying to have a pre-dinner party in our room with 10 people, at 6 PM, Security came and cleared and searched our room, as they suspected drug use. They didnt find any, but did take the vodka we had managed to sneak in. We saw the staff actually lock down and entire floor at 2 in the morning to enforce their 'Drug' Searches. They kept an entire floor of people from exiting the elevator for this. Everything to eat is very expensive, and the staff at the resteraunts could teach rudeness, but the real scam begins when you go to the pool, first we got searched again so we could not bring in food or drink, even if its purchased at the hotel, with pat downs by overzealous and rude security staff. the charges at the pool are outrageous, a single drink is $20, food is likewise double the normal price, the wait staff at the pool are as rude and obnoxious as possible, and all of our party had to hunt down managers just to get food we had already paid for. They are always switching staff, or closing shifts, etc, so they have to close your tab, before you receive your food and drink, and then half the time we didnt get the food or drink or got the wrong order. Finding a manager was useless, as they promised to find the wait staff, and then they disappear also. If you want a water at the pool, it will run you $6 for a 5 oz bottle. Once you get the bill, the real nightmare begins, with a room deposit of $100 a night in addition to your room fee, plus some fee of amentities, plus charges for things from the mini bar, which we didnt touch, but once youve checked out theres no way to go back and verify inventory. there was no one in our party who wasnt hit with the mini bar fees. Weve been back home 10 days, and are still fighting to get back our room "Deposit" of $300 Oh and heres a fun one, if you dont actually check out and just leave your hotels key, your charged another $100 dollar for them to check you out without u there. But thats better than checking out late, 1 cpl in our party didnt check out until 12.30 (even though the rooms hadnt been ready until 7 PM when we checked in), they got hit with a $200 fee, thats right... $100 per hour for every minute of an hour your late checking out. Oh, and trying to get into the famous Rehab pool party on Sunday, another $50 per person, even if your staying at the hotel. plus they keep everyone waiting in line for 2 hours to make the event seem exclusive. We went, since it supposed to be such a good experience and they advertised a topless pool, Nope , no topless pool, No thongs, no bathing suit too sexy. and no lewd or playful behavior, I was stopped from cuddeling with my husband from the security goon who threatened my husband. The party is a big scam, heavily advertised, but it seems like everyone is standing around waiting for the party, If your a girl, your in luck because there are some buff guys there, about 10 boys for every girl. So girls can expect a lot of verbal attention, even if its its not wanted. Pick another hotel, and save yourself the grief. Even by Vegas standards, you will be gouged at every turn. Besides hotel and eating (2700 for three days) , and 19 drinks over three days- $472, we were lucky to only have to pay extra and hidden charges of $583. Why are we lucky, some people showed us their extra charges of just under a 1000.

Reviews.Title: “An Exasperating Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ruby84
Reviews.Content: Our room was filthy upon check in. The bed had been changed but the tables were all dusty and had sticky glass rings on them and one of the bathroom sinks still had 6 inches of soap scum . There were no glasses anywhere in the room and some of the toiletry articles were missing. We called the front desk to be moved but were on hold for 20 minutes and gave up. We were dead tired and couldn't face standing in line at the registration desk breathing smoke from the casino. We won't return - a totally unacceptable and exasperating experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hard rock really is a hard rock!!!!”
Reviews.Author: try_fly_high
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE!! i felt like i was in prison with all the K-9 dogs and undercovers, searching my bags to go to the pool!! I felt like it was a hotel for 18 year olds with a fake ID and old pervs wanting to go to REHAB!! Dont even think about touching the mini bar i moved some stuff around and got charged $455!!! WHAT!!!! I waited in a 25 minute registration line to "pre register" front desk told me there would be $100 PER day charge that would be refunded... no early check in it was 12:45pm came back to wait in registration line 20 minutes AGAIN!!!This time front desk said it would be one $100 charge total that would be refundud, when i checked out it ended up being $50 per day??? WTF!!! can i just get the best rate?? there were pot stems on the floor in my room when i checked in No bathrobe the Jimi Hendrix frame looked like it had been pried off the wall and re glued, cheap toilet paper too!! Nice clean bed though, felt like an office in there and the lighting in the bathroom was romantic dinner lighting. When i checked out i had to wait for Stephanie to remove each mini bar charge one by one it took 20 minutes just for that.. I will Never stay there i thought I had all this money and it was all wrapped up with hard rock not to mention 2 weeks later they end up charging my account another bogus charge for"a third guest in the room" it was only me!! WTF!!! but i got 3 wristbands for rehab never ended waiting in the hour and 30 minute line.

Reviews.Title: “pick another hotel, to stay, eat or party. stay away !”
Reviews.Author: mydavis
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the new tower, and even though the renovation is nice and the rooms are beautiful, the staff is AWFUL, we used to have wonderful experiences at Hard Rock, but with the renovation, the staff has changed, and it will be truly an awful experience. The room wasnt ready until 6 Pm, and we had to fight with the staff to get the room we booked. Then when we tried to take our luggage to our room, they actually had a goon at the elevators search our luggage to prevent us from taking any food or drink to our room. Thier response was that they were trying to prevent parties in the rooms, im not sure how bringing soda and food would induce a party, or why a hotel which bills itself as a party hotel would deny us having guests in our room. but they did, we complained that this was illegal, and they threatened to throw us out of the hotel with no refund. they finally relented on beer and soda, but not food or our own licqour The wait for everything is horrible, Mr. luckys cafe was nice and fast, but the Rare 130 steak house is expensive, for very small portions and took 75 minutes to get our food, and this was on a wednesday. Nobu on thursday was the same wait. We went out for other meals, we recommend taking a taxi somewhere else to eat. To get to the pool, they search you, pat you down and dont let you take anything to the pool, my wife couldnt take her compact mirror, a roll of tums in her purse, or aspirin. or any alcohol or food even if you bought it in the hotel, this is to make sure you pay for food and drink at the pool which is incredibly expensive. We ordered drinks and lunch and it took over an hour, and 2 visits with the manager to finally get our food. 2 lunches and 4 drinks was $160 plus tip and tax. the wait staff at the pool are just stupid, the next day (thursday) they put someone elses food and drink on our tab, and after waiting almost 2 hours, they still couldnt find a manager to fix our bill. we were leaving on a sunday, but on weekends the pool is a ZOO, dont bother, even if your staying at the hotel. On saturday, the staff is disorganized, rude, and dont make a distinction between hotel guests, and the people coming to party at Rehab at the pool, They treat everyone the same, make them wait and treat them like dirt. We had to fight not to pay twice to get into the pool. When going to night life at the hotel, the security staff is obtrusive and rude, and look for reasons to hassle the guest. We were ordered to move from the bar at the Joint, because a security person thought a waitress might want to get her drinks there, even though there was a waitress stattion 20 feet away. We watched the same thing happen several times until a manager was called and told the security person to back off. Ridiculous. Some bright spots, the Spa, still very nice, gym is small but adequate. Pink Taco is still fun and has the same fun factor it did before the renovation, perhaps the staff there could work the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: kwryder
Reviews.Content: The stay started with us pulling up to the front door and waiting several minutes for someone to acknowledge us. I got out of my vehicle and had to flag down a valet. He then scolded me and told me I needed to be in the next lane. The staff seemed to have an attitude the entire trip. We noticed that we had been overcharged on our bill after we checked out and called the hotel. We had to wait 2 days for a return phone call. NEVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Loose the Attitude”
Reviews.Author: dawnsully77
Reviews.Content: I just got back from The Hard Rock today for Supercross Finals. I dont even know where to start with this. The employees there are really snobby. Not friendly at all. I guess that some famous people stay there, they think that this is okay. I really could care less about famous people. They really dont have a great selection of food there, Pink Taco is okay, and lucky 7 is where I ate, Lucky 7 is more like not so lucky average Dennys food. The service there sucked too. I will now tell you my story. It all started on Sat night when I was walking into the casino and a Cochroach greeted me on the wall when I opened up the door. Okay, as soon as I walked in there was a young man who just thought it would be okay to snort something up his nose, right there as people were walking in. Interesting. Well I cant forget to tell you that if you have a room facing the pool you will be woken up at 5am by a garden blower as I guess this is when they clean around the pool. There is a famous pool party called Rehab that is fun, but to get in as a guest you must have paid a certian rate on your room to get in for free. If you got your rooms for a really good rate you will pay 50 dollars to get in to pool on Sun, and wait in a long line. If you dont feel like waiting it will be 100 dollars. So you have a friend staying with you well dont add them to the room,unless a spouse. If it is a third person it will be $100 dollars more a night. Im not kidding. So we decided to eat dinner at PF Changs which is walking distance from the hotel, there are symbols as light fixtures all down the hallways which everybody tings and tangs all night long. Yes we ting and tanged the symbol, as we got to elevator we were harassed by a security gaurd telling us that we had destroyed property. We were very confused, long story short they threatend that they were going to kick us out, for a burned out light bulb behind one of the symbols.We were going to have to pay for the light bulb. I know it sounds like im crazy, i was tripping. He said he heard us break the symbol. People its a symbol on the wall with a light bulb behind it. The light bulb had been out the whole time we were there. It got very intense, at this piont. I called other Hotels to leave because I thought that these security gaurds were on drugs, because remember the guy a the front sniffing stuff up his nose. I am not going to pay alot of money and be herassed for something so insane. After they realized that we were not idiots. We left and ate. I complained to the Manger of The Hard Rock,and she too was in shock about a light bulb,as to the man who worked the front desk telling me he as well bangs on the symbols as he is going down the hall. We were gone for about an hour and guess what, the light bulb was changed in the hall way and wasnt burnt out. We went to bed and again I was woken up at 5am to a garden blower. The older couple who was in the elevator this morning said they were so tired and they have never stayed in such a noisey hotel. The bathroom has no vent in there so be prepared to start coughing from the hot steam, if you have respiratory issues,because of the novent it smelled funny in the bathroom as well. The tub was crooked and thin and I felt as tho I was leaning when taking a shower. The beds are cozy tho,ill give them that. My review in a nut shell, if you dont care about sleeping,want to hang out with snobs,eat average food,not be near the strip, watch people snort ? ,be greeted by cochroaches, and get harassed by security great this is the hotel for you. Ill be staying at The Bellagio,Planet Hollywood or MGM.

Reviews.Title: “Rockstar weekend!”
Reviews.Author: CortneyChristine
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service! Got upgraded to a Celebrity Suite just because and it was spectacular! Amazing room, amazing views, amazing nightlife! I will never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: lagogirl70
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 3rd - May 5th...quick getaway..Staff was VERY FRIENDLY!! I have no complaints...everyone greeted us with a smile..pool area was fantastic..beautiful grounds..although drinks were 18.00 a little pricey, but large and STRONG! Stayed in the casino tower..room was fine, clean beds were AMAZING!!! Fitness center was great, bell staff accommodating, restaurants were good..We plan to make this an annual getaway!!

Reviews.Title: “It was the most amazing hotel experience! HRH corner room! The PLACE! WOW!”
Reviews.Author: c_brigitte
Reviews.Content: New Tower...HRH it is my recommandation! Would of stay longer! I'll be back for sure! I'm still dreaming about that room...(HRH Corner Room) Would love to copy it at my house...Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel perfect for relaxation away from the Las Vegas frenzy.”
Reviews.Author: Nightworker17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for 3 nights at the end of April in one of the new HRH tower suites which were in a word sublime. The rooms in the HRH tower are stunning but make sure you request one on a higher floor to get a good view of the strip, I don't really have a bad thing to say about the hotel, the staff were courteous and polite, the restaurants are great and suit all budgets, personally I would recommend The Pink Taco for great and budget friendly Mexican food and drinks, the casino is a great place to lose your money with some low limit tables mixed in with the high roller tables in fantastic iconography adorned surroundings. The Hard Rock is about a mile from the junction of East Harmon Avenue and Las Vegas Blvd where Planet Hollywood is so it only costs around $10 for a taxi to the strip which isn't too shabby. The only thing I would say is be wary if you are checking in with a debit card as the $100 per night security hold on your card will stay with you for over a week like it did me and I almost ran of moolah!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, off the crazy strip.”
Reviews.Author: buckeyetravel1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and another couple. The folks at check in were very accomodating and put us on the same floor with friends and upgraded our room! We were in the newer tower and it was awesome...comfy bed, great view, clean, quiet. We were there to see Santana and not big gamblers...the show was FANTASTIC! What a great venue. The service at the restaurnats and bars and shops was very friendly. The pool areas are beautiful, good food and service. My only complaint may be that Rehab made the hotel a little crazy, but fun to people watch in the halls.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, maybe not for your first time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dnb1982
Reviews.Content: We recently got back from a trip to Las Vegas. My husband and me traveled with his parents as they had won a trip for 4. We arrived in Las Vegas around noon and went straight to the hotel and were able to check-in right away. Our room was in the new HRH tower, so we had a seperate check-in from the main lobby. The main lobby did have a line-up for check in but it was moving pretty quickly. After check-in we went to our room, it was beautiful! Clean, modern, and the most comfortable bed ever! Every staff member we encountered at the hotel was helpful and friendly. We did see some people who had really embraced the whole "sin city" aspect of Vegas and security handled it quickly and courteously. My only complaint of the Hard Rock is that it isn't on the strip, it was my first time to Vegas so we spent alot of time on the strip and it ended up costing quite a bit in cab fare. I think that after a few more visits to Vegas we could stay at the Hard Rock and be totally entertained without leaving the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Our 14th Time!”
Reviews.Author: nancywis
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Hard Rock for the past 10 years - like the size of the hotel not too big and the friendliness of the staff. If you prefer a quiet stay I would suggest Mon thru Fri - weekends are nuts!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock not so cool”
Reviews.Author: thanks1234
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was sub par and rude from the front desk to the employees working at the clubs. At the Vanity club I had a off duty staff member want to fight me after being in the club for no more then 10 min. There staff that was on duty explained that he did not work for the club but a different part of the hotel and they were sorry so they comped my wife and I 4 drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Alitska
Reviews.Content: The rooms at paradise tower and the suites at HRH are incredible. It's my favorite hotel. The price is fair and the music is awesome. Love the style and feelings. Will be back for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's New and It's Great...”
Reviews.Author: Marcmarc
Reviews.Content: I took a chance and after all I was going to be in Las Vegas and taking chances is what it's all about this town. I booked into the brand new section of The Hard Rock Hotel that is managed by The Morgans Hotel Group and it was a great experience. I loved my room, very comfortable, loads of space, a terrific bathroom, an inviting and comfortable bed in short; I had hit Blackjack in hotel terms. The room came equipped with a IPod player dock that filled the room with my tunes, a great feature so bring your IPod. A very cool and removed from the hub bub of the casino reception area and friendly folks welcome you to The Hard Rock Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WORST TRIP..... DONT DO IT”
Reviews.Author: aburrel
Reviews.Content: This was the wort hotel I've ever been to and I've been to a lot. Plus I go to Vegas a lot and has tried several hotels jus to see which ones I would like to get a time share or even keep as my main hotel. The reasons I did not like it are very simple: missin tv remote, wine opener, broken room phone..... but was eventually fixed. But what really got to me was there attitude there. EVERYONE from front desk to the restaurant had attitude like I was inconviencing them. PLUS no hot water..... are we not in America were there should always be hot water. This might seem minor to you but trust me if you go to this hotel you will regret it..... I prefer the Planet Hollywood westgate..... thats a great hotel who needs to teach HRH customr service.

Reviews.Title: “You don't believe it, until you actually live it!”
Reviews.Author: peterson951952
Reviews.Content: I won a trip through work, so my husband and I did not have the opportunity to choose the hotel...the Hard Rock was chosen for us. Prior to our arrival, we did check out the reviews and we really thought we were prepared for our experience. We knew it was going to be a party atmosphere, but you don't understand what that means until you experience it for yourself. First, let me say that my husband and I are in our 30's and have two young children. We wanted to do nothing, but have a fabulous time....so, here goes! HOTEL DYNAMIC: Guests party all day long. My husband and I immediately noticed how old we felt. As a woman whose had two young children, I was a bit self consious because the "youngin's" (as I like to call them) all seemed to have fabulous bodies and implants. There is plenty to do at this property, so you won't be disappointed. It is about 1 mile from the strip, but it is easily walkable. A cab runs about $10. Above all, the hotel staff was SO nice and accommodating. ROOMS: we stayed in the Paradise Tower and the rooms are awesome! Our room had gray walls/carpet with an "affliction" type art deco. All of the furniture was black and the bathroom was black tile. Very retro and slick! POOLS: One pool area is used for "scam/rehab" and the other pool is for those who prefer a quieter pool experience. The quieter pool is located in the HRH Tower, near the nightclub Vanity. Part of the pool has a normal pool bottom, but the other part has a sandy bottom, which is really, really, cool. The staff was fabulous and try to locate "Brittany" as she is sweet as can be. There are plenty of seats around the pool. There are cabanas, too, but rumor has it they run approx. $500. The pool does open at 10am & don't worry about being there right at 10am to get your lounger. It's Vegas, so people trickle in/out all day long. I can honestly say that if there wasn't a quieter pool , I probably wouldn't have liked the HRH. The pool made it the party atmosphere very manageable. REHAB: HRH just started "scam" on saturdays and "rehab" on sundays. The best way to describe this...is to think of the largest pool party possible and amplify it by 10. Men....you will be patted down and women...your bags, wallets, magazines, will be searched. The security staff needs to control the crowds, so they will make sure nothing "illegal" is entering the area. The security staff is so nice, but will take action if they need to! INTERNET: You do have to pay for internet @ $14 day, so there is no reason to travel with a laptop if you don't want to pay for this service. If you have an iphone (like I do), the internet service will be blocked. FOOD/BEVERAGE: We attended a pool-side reception and the chicken parmesan sliders are my new fav! We also ate breakfast every morning at Lucky's 24/7 and the fruit & yogurt parfait is fabulous!!! The oatmeal is awesome, too! Breakfast was approx. $35 with tip (two people.) Overall, I don't think my trip to Vegas would be as memorable without staying at the HRH. My advice....embrace the party atmosphere & live it up!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME AT THIS DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: vic321
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hardrock Hotel in Vegas, and I might say I had the WORSE experience ever. The only reason I even decided to stay at this hotel (that is not even by the strip) was all because my friends wanted to party by the pool. Soon after arriving to the Hardrock Hotel my friends and I decided to head over to the pool and have a grand ol' time. Yet, we were told by secuity that we couldn't go to the pool. We asked the security, why couldn't we go to the pool? He said, that it was close. I asked, why? He said that it was just close. It was ridiculous because the pool was absolutely not close. I then headed back to customer service and told them that I wanted my money back. I wanted to go stay at another hotel, but I was told by the other moron working there that it wouldn't be possible. Ummm so I headed back into a room that was soooooo TINY. Being there made me feel so claustorphobic. Feeling claustorphobic made me just want to get out of the room, and to relieve my anxiety I decided to get a small bite to eat at MR. LUCKy's at the hardrock. They have a menu section at Mr. Lucky's dedicated to just asian type food, but to my dismay 15 minutes into ordering food...... I was told that they didn't have any asian food available. The only thing that made this trip worthwhile was grabbing a taxi cab and checking into another hotel room. I had to spend the extra money, but it was worth every cent. Next time you are thinking about going to vegas or checking into a Hardrock hotel...think twice. It's really a dump.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather sleep in a dark, dirty alley than stay at the Hard Rock again”
Reviews.Author: cemert
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at numerous hotels in Vegas, including the Hard Rock, and have never been more miserable than this stay. As an event planner in the NASCAR industry with an extremely large budget, I have never been treated more inappropriately and rude than by the HRH staff. There should have been prior indication of the impact of Rehab on business travelers, prior to making our reservation. I was appalled at the behavior of the Rehab guests, the naked women in the stores with security doing absolutely nothing about it, the sex in the hallways, it was absolutely disgusting. After my initial request to move from the Paradise Tower due to the loud party next door, with a front desk person who insisted on arguing the issue, I was told security would come handle which they never did. I moved two suitcases and backpacks to the front desk, when I was then moved to the HRH tower to only find a louder party next door to that room. I called down and asked for an alternative to which I was told there were no options. I promptly left the Hard Rock and I will NEVER stay there again and will be sure to let my colleagues in the NASCAR business hear my story to ensure they don't make the same mistake I did. I book thousands of rooms a year for incentive trips, so I hope HRH's management understands the impact of the way I was treated and the lost revenue which will be spent at a hotel property that knows how to treat its guests. The only silver lining was Eric at the Lux bar who went up and beyond for myself and my pit crew members who were hungry, tired and thirsty. He brought us food when everything was closed and did so with a fantastic attitude. Eric should be promoted to General Manager and then maybe the Hard Rock has a chance of redeeming our business. As much as I can appreciate the uniqueness and edgy feel of HRH, the rude behavior of the staff and the lack of guest service solidifies that I will never book a program there or visit again on a personal trip. You can renovate pools, have the most amazing surround sound in the room, the funkiest furniture, and the hippest clubs, but at the end of the day if you can't sleep what damn good is a hotel? No good in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Rock and Roll Experience, period.”
Reviews.Author: MoutonNoir
Reviews.Content: After years of slowly losing interest in Las Vegas, I stayed at the Hard Rock in November, 2009 (primarily to see Santana). It was a flawless experience. In fact, I enjoyed it so much that I just stayed there again last weekend (Paradise Tower). The rooms were clean (again), the music was great (again), and the staff ensured that you were having a good time (again). The pool and gym amenities are well maintained. I'm done with "the Strip" but will be staying at the HRH whenever I'm in Vegas. Had a great steak/lobster at 120 degrees. I would pass on Johnny Smalls (American style tapas) unless you're looking for something quirky and light.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Carrera4S
Reviews.Content: This newly build hotel is probably the best hotel in Las Vegas. The rooms are huge and very comfortable. The hotel is situated somewhat outside the main attractions of Vegas, so a taxi is recommended to and from the hotel. Given the fact that this is a Hard Rock hotel, you will have to accept that rock music is pouring out of the loudspeakers in most areas of the hotel at a fairly high volume. Also, go-go dancers by the reception area during weekends is something I find only in Vegas :-)

Reviews.Title: “Not your grandma's hotel.”
Reviews.Author: penguinnurse
Reviews.Content: We were there for only one night so we took advantage of the entire experience. The pool was great. Every employee that we encountered was very friendly and the the show at The Joint was amazing. The sound was great. I would have liked somewhere to sit at the Joint, though, as feet were screaming from standing for 3+ hours. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean.

Reviews.Title: “If you like rock music blasting at 7 am during breakfast, stay here”
Reviews.Author: sweetums0520
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here if all the following are unappealing to you: $10 cab rides to the strip, $14 a day internet access, excessive charges to your bill for opening the mini bar fridge, a pool that closes when it's too "cold" out (i.e. 70 degrees F), a dark, dingy lobby with no glitz, and bottled water that costs $4.50. Oh, and there is rock music blasting throughout the hotel, night and day, including in the breakfast restaurant (mr. Lucky's) at 7 AM. I got suckered into paying the $14 for a day of wi-fi, and proceeded to bring my laptop down to the pool area to surf the internet. I was met at the pool doors by the burly security guard, who informed me that the pool was closed b/c of the weather (which was bright, sunny, and 70 degrees) but that there was another pool open on the other side of the hotel. However, I wouldn't be allowed into that pool area with my bag...hmmm...is this place a prison (mind you, I'm a woman, 5'2")? I had my computer in there for goodness sakes. Anyway, I had to go back up to my room to bring the bag up and then I carried my computer down to the other pool. Bad idea, since the music was so loud there (at 11 am) that I couldn't think anyway. This place also has a sensor in the mini bar so you're charged for basically opening the damn fridge. My room was clean and decent...the shower handle fell off the first day...but otherwise it was fine & comfy. In conclusion, I've been to Vegas several times, and this place has none of the opulence, lights & glitz of the other major hotels on the strip. It has a very dingy and depressing feel inside, and is so far from everything else. Maybe this place is fine if you plan to be drunk the entire time and you're on spring break...otherwise it's a waste of money. and did i mention they double charged me for the internet service i bought that one day?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room - that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over a long weekend with a friend. Hotel is now owned by Morgans Hotel Group so had high expectations for this property. But it was a let down. The rooms in the new tower where i stayed were great. Nice modern design. GREAT beds - one of the most comfortable I have slept in (they get 5 stars for the bed - lots of down pillows, down comforter was very thick, and pillow top mattress - it was like a cloud). Flat screen LCD TV. Nice furniture. Decent bathroom. Plenty of clothing storage space. WiFI was a bit expensive. But the rest goes downhill from here. Housekeeping totally did not clean or enter my room on one of the 4 nights. Then the maid lied and said she cleaned the room. The front desk managers took forever to respond. Called them at least 3 times and promises were made to clean the room which never happened. Front desk check-in process was a nightmare - VERY Slow and people just standing around behind the desk doing paperwork or something and not helping people in the growing line waiting to check in. One of my pet peeves - either take it into the back office so we dont stare at you not helping us with check-in... or actually look up and help someone! It's about service quality, which is obvious this hotel does not spend much time thinking about. Perhaps that is because the clientele is on the younger side. and perhaps they dont care as much about service. Another pet peeve - dishes and glasses sitting in the hallway for more than a couple hours - several days I saw the same trays sitting in the hallway for hours on end - a better hotel would not let that happen. Asked for extra towels and never showed up. Asked for extra toiletries since two of us were in the room - never showed up. This hotel is not on the Strip so make sure you know that before you book. It is at least a 15-20 minute walk to the strip if you dont want to spend money on a taxi. I would not visit here again. I am wondering why Morgans Hotel Group bought and redid this hotel if it doesnt meet their same standards as their other hotels which I have stayed at in London, NY and San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A blast! A great time! Can't wait to go back in the summer”
Reviews.Author: sloppybachelor
Reviews.Content: For a seasoned gambler this is the place... I should sa y for the single dood who likes to gamble and doesn't mind some extra perks. Right when you walk in youi see a rowdy, loud happening place. the ppol is full of beautiful women. The restaruants are top notch... and full of beautiful wome too! We did not get a chance to get into the clubs but we did have a St. Pat's celebration at the "Wasted Space". Made some mistakes when you go to Hard Rock make your trip from Thursday to Sunday. Watch the minibar...anything with a price do not touch! This isn't for those who want to relax. This is a 24/7 party dont expect to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the low price of the room”
Reviews.Author: SFPHOTOMAN
Reviews.Content: I thought I was getting a good deal when I got a room for $63, Instead they automatically add $7 to the cost for incendentals like parking. When I got home I found another $33 charged to my card for the minibar which I never touched. The hotel is constantly blaring acid rock music. It took over 20 minutues to check into my room and its over a mile to the Strip. The only thing in the area is a strip club across the street. There are much better places to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: laura4957
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for three nights from April 1st – April 7th. I had already planned on switching my hotel to the Planet Hollywood for the last two nights of my trip (April 7th – 9th) to be close to the strip (and other people we were travelling with) but I really wish I hadn’t. It felt like a major downgrade going to the PH after 3 nights at the HR. Upon first impression of the hotel it was almost a surreal feeling. Music blaring and a really good smell (unlike other casinos), beautiful people (no other casino compares to the HR for this!), just a great overall vibe. I felt relaxed and excited as soon as I got there. Definitely for a young or young at heart crowd though. I had paid for a regular room in the Paradise tower (booked through the HRH website) and we were upgraded to the king corner suite on the top floor (room 31800 I think). AMAZING room! Floor to ceiling windows on two walls, a clean comfy king size bed (the comfiest I’ve ever slept in), trendy wallpaper and overall design, huge tiled shower, good lighting, Sony Bravia TV with HD channels. One side of the room had a view of Vegas and the pool and the other side of the room had a view of the pool and the strip. Nothing beats the desert sunrise in the morning coming through your window  The room and bathroom were spotless at all times and housekeeping was great. I know people say that you don’t spend a lot of time in your room in Vegas but once you see this room you might want to change your mind. I liked the distance from the strip. It really wasn’t too far, around a 15 minute walk or $6 cab ride (to the Miracle Mile) and the area didn’t feel sketchy like some reports have said. It was actually nice to be off the strip because the casino doesn’t get over crowed and filled up with “strip traffic”. The pool is amazing. No other words to describe it. It was like a tropical oasis, huge area with lots of different pools and little grottos. There’s areas for relaxing and areas for partying. I’m really looking forward to going to Rehab there in August. Lots of places to eat in the hotel…Pink Taco, Ago, Nobu, Starbucks, Luckys 24/7, Rare 120, there’s a Panini place in the Paradise Tower and there’s a general store to get drinks, snacks, etc. There’s not a lot of shopping at the casino but that’s fine, there’s plenty of other things to do. My brother got a tattoo at Hart & Huntington and was impressed with the whole experience. The Joint, Wasted Space and Vanity are all great places. There’s a CVS and a market across the street from the hotel. I’m definitely not a high roller (not even a low roller, lol) but the Rockstar Players Club was awesome. We got a comp for Ago in no time and it seemed like you actually got something for your money with it. I only played the slots but they seemed pretty decent, a few people we were with won quite a bit with only putting a little in. As for cons…. Upon checkout I asked for a copy of my bill. All that was on there was my room rate, resort fee (what exactly do you get for this at this hotel?!), and taxes. When I got home and checked my credit card bill a few days later I saw that I’ve been charged a $50 fee for the mini bar. I didn’t touch anything in the mini bar, I didn’t order any room service, I didn’t use their shampoo/conditioner, nothing! I’ve called every day since seeing that charge (Wednesday of last week) and so far no one has even returned my calls. Whenever I ask to speak to someone else I get told that they’re busy. If I don’t hear back from them by Wednesday I’m going to send it to the fraud department at my credit card company. I found the customer service to be kind of [--]. Check in/out was fine, but talking to the hotel on the phone and when I called down with a question I wasn’t treated well. Whoever runs their Twitter account seems nice though! All in all the pros definitely outweigh the cons and providing that the mini bar thing gets fixed I won’t stay anywhere else in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “a fun place with great people”
Reviews.Author: tom582004
Reviews.Content: new tower has great rooms. the pool alone is always fun. new friends to be made every visit.

Reviews.Title: “The consummate Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoNate40
