Reviews.Content: There is no place in Vegas quite like the Hard Rock. For the Rock music fan, the music playing round the clock is phenomenal - like they plugged in your iPod on shuffle. The gambling experience is second to none. The table limits are set right and the dealers/pit bosses are friendly, helpful and great to chat with. The rooms and amenities are terrific, and the pool is out of this world. You'll hear people complain that it's too far from the strip, but that keeps it from being overrun. I find that most of my weekends at the Hard Rock, I never leave to go elsewhere - why would I?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...but maybe not for a first time Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: HeidiRenee
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay in the casino tower, but because they were unable to get a non smoking room ready in that tower by check-in they upgraded us to the Paradise tower with a pool view. We were thrilled! The room had a great view of the pool (floor to celing windows the lenght of the wall), beds were amazingly comfortable, and the room was very stylish. I will say however by the 3rd morning the dark bathroom/room kind of drags on you. If you prefer light and spa like stay at Aria. The Pink Taco was excellent, and Mr. Lucky’s 24/7 was good and reasonable. The room service breakfasts were great and prompt. There is no shuttle to the strip from here and cab rides are $10. Its not as close to the strip as you might imagine. I wouldn't walk to the strip at night unless you're in a large group with men. It was our first time in vegas and I wish we had been at a hotel on the strip because it got to be exhausting to get to the strip. I'd stay here more for the Hard Rock experience, pool, and night club for a weekend. We were slightly irritated on our last day. The highs were in the upper 70's and they closed down the biggest pool. This was really frustrating because earlier in the week when it was much colder they had the large pool open. There were not nearly enough chairs for all of the people at the pool. They really cater to people who would pay to rent a cabana/bed...stake your chairs out early! We booked our vacation through Sun Country and were not aware of the resort fee which was $7/person.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!”
Reviews.Author: klourenco808
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the casino tower and the rooms were nice and clean. The bathtub was a little dingy but the rest of the room was nice. They charge for everything in the room like water, alcohol , candy etc. but everything is clearly marked with a price that you have to pay for it. Theirs a gift shop down stairs and you can get water and snacks there for 1.50. The distance from the hotel to the strip is not bad at all, its took 10 min to walk and a cab only costs 6 bucks. The hotel is a lot of fun and you must love rock music to stay there because the lobby is filled with loud music. The rooms are quite and spacious. The staff is friendly and the maids also cleaned the room everyday we were there.

Reviews.Title: “HRH Tower took property to new high”
Reviews.Author: golfsic
Reviews.Content: As a long time Hard Rock Hotel fan I have stayed at new HRH Tower several times recently. The new HRH Tower is extraordinary. They have taken their always keen design sense to a new level. Great suites, ultra quiet and the staff were all professional yet warm and funny. Always my preference while in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room”
Reviews.Author: awesomeamanda4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for two nights in the Paradise Tower. The room was very clean and obviously new. The room was all black, chrome and leather and was extremely cool looking. The room was form over function (especially the bathoom), it was dark and the black outlets were hard to find. The staff was friendly and had upgraded the room for free. Room service was very prompt and the food was good. The casino blares rock music 24/7, but that was to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Have you experienced the NEW Hard Rock???”
Reviews.Author: Superwhammy
Reviews.Content: The hard Rock hotel has never been my favorite casino or hotel, although I love the music and the rock star atmosphere the casino has always been too small and the rooms have looked like they were mid week at spring break at best. Not anymore, after spending 5 nights in the new Paradise tower and enjoying the expanded casino and new spa. I am a believer! The rooms are very rock and roll and have plenty of attitude but all the amenities that you could ask for are in place and the staff share a great eclectic personality. The Paradise tower is off from the casino floor but very close to the parking garage (if you have a rental). The new expanded pool looks amazing and I'm sure that it will be packed when the weather comes around. Overall I'm very impressed ad will be back there for my next leisure trip to sin city.

Reviews.Title: “Not as far from the strip as I had expected.”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELADIX
Reviews.Content: Took a cab to the strip twice, only about 7 or 8 bucks each time. The casino was great with good music, service from the majority of staff at casino was poor. We loved the pool area. The restaurant choices were great. The rooms were clean. I would stay here again if I got another great deal. We paid $55 usd per night plus a strange $7 resort fee. This great deal was an expedia.com special.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I want to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: agamble4
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel has everything you need in a Casino / Hotel. A wide variety of resturaunts, and stores. It's just off of the strip, so it seems more like a private getaway. The Joint is a great venue to watch a concert. The pool is one of the best in the world. There is no place in Las Vegas like the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, noisy, noisy”
Reviews.Author: Sugarlandfan
Reviews.Content: I'm used to going to Mexico and enjoying peace and quiet while sitting on the deck of my hotel or by the pool/ocean. Therefore, The Hard Rock was a huge disappointment. The music inside the casino so when you come down from your room, the first thing you hear is loud music. The music was even loud inside the italian restaurant. The room was nice but there was no deck. I was surprised to find no coffee maker, no small fridge and no microwave. Nice big bathtub, however, the sink gurgled like crazy and had I not had ear plugs, I would not have slept because it gurgled all the time. These are some amenities I'm used to getting at hotels such as the Comfort Inn and any hotel in Mexico. A bottle of water in the hotel room was $7.50, the fitness center was $20/day and internet use was $14/day. Had I known the last two items, I would not have stayed at the HRH. Beds were comfortable but we could hear every word being said by the people in the next room. We had to check out at 11am but our flight wasn't until late that night. Instead of paying $150 for the extra day, we moved to the Tuscany Suites down the street for less than $60. Oh how I wish I had stayed there from the start! HRH is good for people that want to PARTY. There is nothing relaxing about the place. The door men didn't open the door and nobody said hello as we walked by. Signs inside the casino were poor as far as directions to spots within the casino. There was no way to know there was a Starbucks inside the hotel had we not run into it.

Reviews.Title: “If heavan has a soundtrack, they stole it from the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: juviepros
Reviews.Content: There is no other place to stay. I'm 42 and have stayed almost everywhere else-Four Seasons, Mandalay Bay, The Hotel at Mandalay, Palms, etc. The HR is the best. The average age there is quite young, but the place has more energy and life than any other casino. And the music. If you're into rock and roll and you stay elsewhere, you're just torturing youself. The rooms are clean (but how much time are you going to spend in your room in Vegas anyway, really?). The center bar is a great hang The pool area is a little too small, but the sights are not to be believed. If you stay at the HR and find it too loud, too young, too crazy, then regardless of your chronological age, your emotional age is over 55.

Reviews.Title: “A bit off the strip but an excellent experience and value!”
Reviews.Author: tornado88
Reviews.Content: Room was very comfortable although no coffee maker, the Casino was CRAZY fun - best place to gamble that we found, location was quite a ways from the actual Vegas strip - recommend a cab versus walking it. Cocktail service was Excellent, Slot payouts were generous enough to keep us playing, overall a really excellent experience. The late night pole dancing still has my husband bragging to all about the Hard Rock stay. Music was Fabulous! Super fun vacation - Stayed 6 nights during Nascar weekend.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: dsdeioma
Reviews.Content: I'm 32. That said, if you are 22, by all means this is the place for you. Lots of eye candy, trendy, and fun. If you are 32, you can do better. The rooms (in the casino tower) themselves are 2-3 stars. They tried to clean the carpet, but there were lots of stains, the faucets were so old that the finish was worn off, and furniture/fixtures were cheap. Like the cougars downstairs, this hotel has been ridden hard and left out wet. It needs to be remodeled. The staff is generally aloof, prefering to be cool rather than hospitable. I realized I was beyond this, when the room next to me blared their stereo until 4am and the noise from outside penetrated the windows easily. Reasonable quiet in your room may not be possible here. This could happen in any hotel, but is more likely at the hard rock. sooooo.....if you are don't care about the above notions, stay, it's a great scene downstairs. If you do, do yourself a favor, just visit the hard rock and stay some place nicer for the extra dough.

Reviews.Title: “New rooms are really nice! Loud lobby casino. Young crowd (for Vegas)”
Reviews.Author: Sarelli
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock Hotel recently expanded. The new rooms are realy nice. The lobby and casino are always pumping loud rock and roll music. The crowd is much younger than your typical Vegas hotel. Lucky's is the diner there, great for all meals.

Reviews.Title: “Frat Hotel...Rock Music..Ho's..Celebs”
Reviews.Author: ItalianGangster
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock has the best Sunday pool party in Vegas with Rehab. Lots of Hos, Celebs (Saw UFC guys), and eye candy for everyone. Caters to 20 somethings. HOTEL is almost a mile from the strip, bring cab fare. You clowns complaining about the $8 a day resort fee are pathetic. ITS VEGAS. Every hotel has a resort fee. If you keep your expectations low you will have fun. If you want an upscale quiet hotel stay at Wynn or Center City. The rooms are below average. Hotel is a 3 star hotel. Club has a door policy, so if your a dude over 35 and your not with a hot chick you might not get in. If your over 40 you might feel out of place as if you were on spring break in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Diamond in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: nic0le1984
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband were celebrating our 2 year wedding anniversary and was looking for something nice and relaxing!! We got there room was ready, and staff was very nice! The room was beautiful, comfy, and so clean!! The cleanest room I have ever stayed in Vegas! The food was ok, but the overall atmosphere makes up for it!! The gambling was ok, the cocktail waitresses had a attitude! Overall We had the best time ever!! We would definitley stay there again, and would reccomend it to someone else! The matress was so comfortable slept like a god. Great job Hard Rock!! You arr truly a hidden gem in vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money given the number of hotels to choose from”
Reviews.Author: oduarte
Reviews.Content: As one of my bucket list items, I guess I have choosen to stay at least once at each of the major hotels in Vegas. Well this this I stayed at the Hard Rock with a bunch of friends that flew in to see the USA 7s Rugby tournament. The Hard Rock was the host hotel. Anyway, compared to other hotels in Vegas, this one is off the beaten path of the Strip and in my opinion worn down. It just seemed old and for theprice they charge, the room was average with some minor complications with bad plumbing. However, housekeeping was very good with taking care of the Matza sized hair ball. It wasn't a bad stay. The room was confortable. However, if you are flying to Vegas for the first time and expecting a WOW Factor, this is not it. It's an average hotel with an average casino. I will say that the nightlife and crowd atmosphere is pretty good. So if you are into the party scence, definitely catch a cab from your nicer hotel over and hit the center bar and dance club. Just don't expect too much from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel & Dime You”
Reviews.Author: kingkool
Reviews.Content: Overall I was disappointed with this hotel. -We arrived several hours after check-in and the rooms were not ready -The fact that you are staying there, get you no discounts to any of the clubs/shows onsite -Internet $15 per day -Gym $30 per day -About one cocktail waitress for the entire place -Drinks were very over-priced +Room was real nice +Good music always playing Bottomline for the oppulence, I would have expected the same free ammenities of your standard Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “It was fun!”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaN4
Reviews.Content: All paid expenses, I cant complain. I love the clubs and restaraunts... the casinos I didnt care for.

Reviews.Title: “gr8 place, absolutely unique”
Reviews.Author: Brasser
Reviews.Content: a clean, nice place a bit off the stip but nevertheless there is enought going on and not too far from all the other must see venues! Can recommend it to all young travellers. Good value as well.

Reviews.Title: “Music Biz Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngeliaC
Reviews.Content: Awesome ammendities ...beautiful swimming pool are with bars.... Starbucks inhouse....rooms are awesome with large screen wall TVs

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Better than Ever”
Reviews.Author: slatsvideo
Reviews.Content: The changes at the casino are terrific. The gaming area is very cool. Two more "center bars" in the new area. Its a fun place to gamble because it's easy to get drinks, the dealers are friendly, and it's a great vibe. The new tower is incredible. You'll love the rooms. The spa is done brilliantly with a great steam room and jacuzzi. The new clothing stores are a nice addition...high-end but affordable. Lot's of small spaces for guests to enjoy. We'll never stay anywhere else in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas place ever!”
Reviews.Author: Shlonka
Reviews.Content: This place is perfect! Big photo of Slash on my floor when the elevator doors open. Room was nice & clean, the doors open to the rialing, amazing view. Bed was the best one I've ever slept in. The hotel was cool, incredible memorabilia & music everywhere. And, oh man, those waitress & female dealer outfits? It was like the Bon Jovi show @ the Worceter Centrum all over again! Had a great time & will only stay @ the Hard Rock during my many hopeful returns! Best place to spend your tax return money!

Reviews.Title: “HRH Suites AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: taylorw22
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing time at this hotel. Staff, rooms, EVERYTHING just amazing and had a great time. Thank you Hard Rock hotel for the great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away "old andout of touch"”
Reviews.Author: Taggish
Reviews.Content: Went down for the USA Rugby Sevens I never ever got the price quoted for the rooms, then a resort fee for a pool that was closed .Casino tower rooms looked like they hadn't been cleaned or updated since the 60's. Music at breakfast "Luckies" was so loud you couldn't hear across the table. Drinks at Pink Taco watered down. Finally got into the new tower rooms are nice Casino old an smelly. Ruined a good rugby tournament ONE Star at Most

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Beardoc
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock is a great place to stay on a visit to Las Vegas. It is just off the strip, but you can reach it easily. It is also a great destination in itself. The rooms are clean and modern and the pool, spas, restauarants, and venues will keep you entertained for days. As far as gambling goes, there may be a few local spots with better odds on a few games, but you won't find better or friendlier dealers. The crowd is usually lively, too, and I find this more than makes up for the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Awesome - This place rocks your [--] off”
Reviews.Author: mwaynecribb
Reviews.Content: it doesnt get ANY better than this. Great Hotel. Great Staff, Good Location, Great Food, Great Scene, Great Music, What Else? Oh yeah, Great Casino. That is about it. What more can I tell you? Want to more, just ask. If and when I go back to Vegas, This is the ONLY place I will consider.

Reviews.Title: “HRH- will never stay anywhere else in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Starla74
Reviews.Content: From the beginning the staff was great, from check in to room service to engineering all staff was awesome! The beds were awesome, loved the tea for two bathtub! I will never stay anywhere else ever again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Totally Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: dedraannemarie
Reviews.Content: I live in Vegas, but when I want to "stay in Vegas" I go to the Hard Rock Hotel! I love this place! The new section is BEAUTIFUL, the new club is AWESOME and you can't beat ReHab for a Rockin' Good Time!! If you wanna have a GREAT time in Vegas... The Hard Rock is the place to be!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Time at HRH”
Reviews.Author: sissen
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a blast. It is clean and the staff is friendly in all venues. The room was cool and comfy and most importantly, clean. This was our first time time staying here and we will definitely be coming back. Wasted Space Lounge was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Santana Supernatural @ the Joint@ Hard Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monica A
Reviews.Content: We went to see Santana Supernatural at the Joint and he was amazingly awesome, great show. As a venue, the Joint was great-almost every seat is a good one, waitress service for drinks-pricey but strong. You can walk into this casino and breath. Lots of action at the tables and nightclub. Charles Barkley walked in. The Pink Taco was really good, much better than I expected for Mexican food: fish tacos great, homemade flour and corn tortillas, great salsa. I will stay there next time I go.

Reviews.Title: “Don’t plan on getting any sleep”
Reviews.Author: Rockos5150
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock HRH Tower in Vegas for 2 nights. The room was incredible; the bed was awesome and very comfortable. The bathroom had a huge walk in rain shower. There were some electrical problems but they were fixed right away. Tried to go to sleep at 11 pm and the music was so load and pounding under our room no one could sleep. The music was so loud that it literally shook everything in my room. Called the front desk and they blew us off 3 times. Told us we could move at 2 am. We packed all of our things at 3 am and moved to the 11th floor and we still could not sleep, we still heard the pounding music. At 4 am they finally shut the music off. When I complained at the desk the next morning, the response was "yeah, we hear that a lot." The concierge Esteban did put us on the VIP guest list to the club that was keeping us up all night but when we went down there the very rude bouncer took one look at us and our friends and said “we have the right to refuse service to anyone”, we are in our early 50’s so we were to old and not welcome into the club. It was at that time the group that I was with decided to take our gambling to a place where all of us old folks were welcome. So we all left the Hard Rock and went to the strip. There are a lot of choices in Vegas, I loved the room but I would recommend going somewhere else, especially if you are over 30 years old.

Reviews.Title: “EagleRider”
Reviews.Author: DevonH2
Reviews.Content: Accommodations were superb! Conference rooms were fantastic... Overall, had a great experience, and even won a little when we weren't working.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: TheAnswer
Reviews.Content: This review is for the room and the room only -- not the casino, shops, restaurants, and other areas of the property. Room was fantastic!! Absolutely impeccable and one of the nicest I've stayed in all my travels here in the USA and abroad. Generous use of black surfaces and glass made for an ultra-modern and hip ambiance. The two queen beds are the BEST I've ever rested on. The large wall-mounted flat screen Sony TV and clock radio with iPod dock made entertainment a breeze. The bathroom is immaculate and well stocked with amenities. Its fixtures and shower area are all state-of-the-art. The room also offers a beautiful view of the expansive pool area. The only inconvenience for me was lack of free wifi access. I'll make sure to look up the HRH first the next time I hit up Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ibocheva
Reviews.Content: in a nutshell-very, very disappointed. Didn't liveup to the expectations. Made us pay entrance fee at "wasted space" twice( didn't put stamps on our hands the first time we were in). When I tried to explain to the security that we were in the club literally 5 minutes ago, he told me to "get lost".

Reviews.Title: “Great fun”
Reviews.Author: angelicboyne
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, has such a great time here. The hotel has everything i actually saw very little of vegas itself. While there i ate in 3 of the hotel restuarants all great especially Nobu. Went out in the Wasted Space a great relaxed rock vibe there and saw a Blink 182 gig in the Joint. Also got a tattoo in Hart and Huntington - so as you see the hotel has it all. The rooms are very clean and spacious and I have to say the staff were very nice and helpful. The only negative was the huge que to check in and out - i really think they should have a specific check out desk.

Reviews.Title: “IMPOSSIBLE to sleep - a complete joke as a hotel”
Reviews.Author: wolftrout
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock in Vegas for 5 nights from Jan. 18-22. Since they charged us to utilize the room as a place to sleep, you would think something as simple as sleeping MIGHT be possible. Think again. My room on the 3rd floor was apparently over a nightclub. The music was so loud that it literally shook the lights in my room. I used Bose noise-cancelling headphones and still couldn't get to sleep. (These headphones will eliminate the sound of a jet engine, but not the Hard Rock's club!) When I complained at the desk the next morning , the response was "yeah, we hear that a lot." They did offer to allow me to change my room the last night, but it wouldn't have mattered - it was bad everywhere Granted, this casino/hotel is really here so the beautiful people can stare at each other, and overpay for meals, but the fact that it is so loud is riduculous.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: golflady7
Reviews.Content: Tried to go to sleep at 11 pm and the music was so load and pounding under our room no one could sleep. At 3 am they finally shut the music off. It would have been nice if they could have just changed the song. It was the same pounding hard music for 4 hours. Called the front desk and they blew us off 3 times. Told us we could move at 2 am. That is what I really wanted to do at that time. Pack all my things and move. We checked out a day early and front desk could have cared less. There are a lot of choices in Vegas. Judging from the empty casino it won't be long and Hard Rock will be gone. I like the cafe but the hotel is a joke and won't be missed.

Reviews.Title: “The best 'Pro' about the hotel was Esteban Rey, the concierge.”
Reviews.Author: ljgf
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and I checked in on Christmas Eve under 3 different reservations and Esteban got us into adjoining rooms on the 17th floor of the Pardise Tower. Sweet! Two days later he arranged a rental car for us through Budget after we were told by the Hertz representative at the desk in the hotel lobby that basically there were no cars available in the city because of the holiday. On to the cons-the valet staff many times did not manage the cab queue well, the HRH gift shop staff were impatient with my husband but did give us 30% off even without a readily available coupon in our possession, the hotel claimed to be environmentally friendly but provided 1/2 a dozen pillows per bed (laundry over load!), the shower area was very small, no lotion was provided, no in room coffee maker (Starbucks in lobby....expensive & busy), no shuttle to the strip. I also had a problem with the blood red wall paper which had daggers and animal skulls as part of the pattern. What happened to the 'Love All Serve All' mellow feelings?

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, vibe, beautiful people”
Reviews.Author: zambow
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend for the weekend, the hotel has a great party atmosphere and is worldwide knows for its famous Rehab Pool Party which happens during summer only. Make sure you pick a pool-side room view. It is one of the most exotic pool views Iv seen, once staying there, you gotta attend to sunday pool party Rehab. Dont miss it. The location is not very good cos it far from the strip, you will need to rely on cabs and it gets CROWDED during weekends, with long waiting lines for cabs, so beware of that if you are late to shows/concerts will probably spend more to get a limo and dont wait for transportation. There is a shuttle to-from the strip but with limited times, dont count much on that. The parking is huge and free tought, you can just rent if you dont drink.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet”
Reviews.Author: bkrosa
Reviews.Content: Hotel had all of the bells and whistles that you could ask for. Great outdoor pool, great scenery, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: banks10000
Reviews.Content: Overall I like this place, but some things you need to know before you book. The hotel has 3 different "towers" for rooms: Casino Tower, Paradise Tower, and the HR Towers. The Paradise and HR Tower just opened (July 09, Dec 09) while the Casino Towers are the original hotel portion of the property. AS with any Casino, the hotel is fairly separated from the Casino. If you are going to book here, I would highly encourage you to stay away from the Casino Tower. Usually when you see the $29 rates this is where they will want to put you. I would not stay here. It isn't awful, but it isn't what you expect in Vegas. For the best rates, I would recommend calling the hotel directly as that is the best method to try to get the best rate and get into the Paradise or HR Tower. Paradise should be cheaper than the HR Towers as the HR Towers is all suites. Casino is on ok Casino. Usually they have Blackjack from $10 and up, but I have seen $5 BJ in the afternoon, say 11am - 3pm. Poker Room is in my opinion the most comfortable room in Vegas. Spacious and the other tables are not on top of you. There is a bar in the Poker Room, so drink service is usually very fast. While the Poker Room is non-smoking, the bar area isn't so if you are at tables 1-3 expect to smell smoke. The action is average, but you rarely have to wait. I'd say if you are playing between 6pm - 8pm there is no wait and from 8pn on perhaps a 10-15 minute wait at the worst. The Poker room during the afternoon, apart from their $45 tourneys is very slow. Usually just 1 table of 1/2 NL. Food here is pretty good. Nobu is possibly the best Sushi in Vegas. They have an Italian place which I have never tried, but it is upscale and looks reasonable. Same with their new Steakhouse, Rare 120. It's a $$$$ place, but that is to be expected in Vegas. They have a mexican place, Pink Taco, which has some great Mexican fare at reasonable prices. A full Starbucks inside, convenience store open 24 hours, and a diner that isopen 24 hours, Mr Lucky's. Mr. Lucky's is well priced, has fast service, and the food is fairly good, although I do not recommend the Sirloin sandwich. Taxi's are lined up outside so you rarely have to wait, unless you are there at 8-9am during the week of CES. Airport is litterally 5 minutes from the hotel. This hotel is off the strip and I would say technically you could walk to the strip, but you shouldn't. It is too far and I'm not so sure this is where you want to be after dark.

Reviews.Title: “THE HARD ROCK HOTEL & CASINO ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: xxxxxLasVegas
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel late in the evening as flight was delayed, hotel reception staff were very efficient and quick in getting us all booked in. Bell Boy delivered our luggage quickly so we were already very impressed with the service received. Went to 24 hour restaurant in hotel straight away again service friendly and efficient, food was great. The beds in the room were luxurious, you couldn't wait to get in them and you had a hard job getting out in the mornings, also the bathroom facilities were excellent, clean towels, pillowcases everyday and bed linen was changed when ever you requested. The casino at the hotel was very tasteful with central bars in each section. The shops in the HRH are very limited but you are only 2 blocks away from the Strip where you can be shop acholics heaven. My family and I had a fantastic time in Vegas and could not find any faults with the hotel, we loved it and would definately stay there again. The HRH rocks and so does Vegas. If you do get to Vegas you must take the opportunity and visit the Hoover Dam and Grand Canyon it was AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyseas75
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 12:30 am on Christmas Eve and the room we were given appeared to be locked from the inside. We called down to the lobby from a cell phone and waited 20 minutes for someone to show. The person that came up to help us had to use a shoulder to open the door as the knob was stuck. He said he would let maintenance know about the issue with the door. Needless to say, we had to get into the linebacker mode to get into our room for the next 3 days. The room was clean, but lots of items for sale in the room - internet access at $14/day, honor bar with sensors, chips and cookies on top of bureau, shampoo in the bathroom...kind of tacky. Had a guy approach me late one evening in the casino wanting me to let him put his casino card into my machine to get points - I had two hundred dollars in credits on the machine - my guess he would have liked to use his card and try to take my winnings too. Creepy. We were with other family member and they had a room on another floor. They had a nice room. Overall - we were not too impressed.

Reviews.Title: “HRH Tower ROCKS!!!”
Reviews.Author: bmford
Reviews.Content: We were comped a weekend at the all suite new HRH tower. It was the best!! The reason we like the HRH so much is the fantastic music they play loudly. Many of the casinos on the strip play adult contemporary--yuck!! Anyway in the new tower, they have an in-room music system where you can play all of the great music they have in your room loudly without bothering the other guests. I blasted it and went into the hall for ice and couldn't hear a thing!! The bed was heavenly. There were two huge sony plasma tv's with HD channels in the room. The bathroom was very well appointed, but is all enclosed in glass with a peek-a-boo curtain. OK, if you're with your significant other, kind of wierd if you're with friends!! The only negatives I have is the mini-bar. It was very clearly explained to us not to touch anything in the mini-bar, or on the counter, because they were all on sensors and you would be charged for them. We got charged, alright, so check your bill. Also, the "fancy shampoo" is for a fee and maybe not well marked, so watch out. I found the service amazing, so I'm a little confused about the negative reviews. Right down to the maids, everyone was helpul and friendly. This is one of the reasons we like the HRH so much. We ate at NOBU and RARE 120. Both were great, but pricey. If you're in for a splurge, these are the places!! We'll be back HRH. THANKS!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Casino But the Hotel Service Needs Alot of Work”
Reviews.Author: 003bryanr
Reviews.Content: We booked the hote for New years. We traveled to Vegas specifically to see the John Mayer Trio show which was being held at "The Joint," located at the hotel. The Casino has a really cool atmosphere. We don't gamble much but we enjoyed just hanging out and people watching. The hotel service we experienced was the exact opposite. I am not a picky person, but I was a little peeved at the poor service. There was no explanation of the hotel whatsoever at check in. We figured this was OK, we would just look at the hotel guide when we got to the room. Unfortunately the hotel guide was missing most of its pages. I asked a maid manager in the gallway if we could get another copy. She said she would have one sent right up. Never got it. We got up the next morning and wanted to order breakfast through room service but the pages for this were missing. We called to see if we could get another copy again, waited 45 minutes, never got it. Called again and recieved an apology and was told they would bring it up right away. Again, THEY NEVER BROUGHT IT UP. We finally decided to leave to go to breakfast but tried calling again later that evening to request the guide again. STILL, NEVER GOT IT!. So after 4 attempts we finally gave up. We were put in a room in the old portion of the hotel. If you can avoid this I would suggest it. The rooms are OK but they just appear to be worn down. Laminate is peeling off the dresser, caulk joints around plumbing fixtures were peeling and dirty, carpet seemed to be worn, etc. The room was also not cleaned very well. There were wrappers laying on the floor near the bed. There was dirt on the light switches in the bathroom. The walls also seemed paper thin as we can here talking on both sides. We knew the hotel was off the strip but did see they offered a shuttle so we were fine with it. Unfortunately we found out when we got there that the shuttle would not be running until January 9th! What is this resort fee for? Seriously, the only thing we got was a room. There were no additional perks that were included in the room or anywhere else in the hotel that deseved a resort fee. The room was bare bones. Not even a coffe maker. Anyway, I cannot offer my reccomendation for this hotel. I will not be staying there again unless they get there act together and I stay in one of the new towers.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN! Worst hotel I've ever stayed in.....”
Reviews.Author: queenfm85
Reviews.Content: I booked my 24th birthday trip to Vegas for the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino because I LOVE Rock 'n' Roll music and the culture that surrounds it. I got a really good deal on the hotel's website for 2 nights, for a non-smoking King, and it is usually kind of pricey. I was a bit hesitant to use this hotel being off the strip but the website said that there was a free shuttle to and from the strip so I figured that would compensate for not being able to walk out onto the strip from the hotel. We got there about 11pm (drove 4 hours from Riverside, CA) and I heard the guy checking in at the desk in front of us and the guest services person was telling him about a deposit for however many days he is staying and also what the hotel offered, where everything is, what events are going on around the hotel etc. I kind of got nervous because we planned this trip on a low budget but when I approached my guest services woman she promised me that my TOTAL was only 177.80 and that amount would be charged to my card but my card would also be on file for any incidentals. She didn't tell us about the hotel at all though, just gave us our keys and told us where the elevator was. I thought that was kind of weird.... When we got up to our room it was a 2 Queen room. I was bummed. I called down and they said they ran out of Kings and it is first come first serve. Ok, I guess I understand that. I was told they could switch me tomorrow and put a room on hold for me and all I had to do was call or go down to the desk the next morning. When the next morning rolled around I called down and they put my on a "brief hold" which ended up being over 10 minutes so we just decided to go down to the desk. After waiting in line for about 20-30 mins we were told our room wasn't ready and someone would call my phone when it was. So my boyfriend and I decided to catch the free shuttle to the strip to get breakfast. We went out in front of the hotel and didn't see anything obvious to where the shuttle would be so we asked someone at the hotel. The lady working there told us that they don't do the shuttle anymore but the Hard Rock Cafe does which is in the parking lot. No big deal. We walked over there and saw a shuttle bus parked and empty in the lot. We went to the front of the restaurant and there was a sign that said it only runs on the weekends as of 12/14. Well, this was a Wednesday. We were shafted on our "free shuttle" which is also billed by the hotel as a "resort fee" of $7/day. In protest I wasn't about to pay a taxi so we decided to walk the mile. I am a pretty healthy 24 yr old girl and I don't mind a nice walk. I actually expect it up and down the strip but the fact that we were promised a shuttle on the website and not even told that it wasn't running is bull. When we finally made it to breakfast, I checked my bank account on my phone and saw there was only $20 in there. I was SUPER upset. Turns out, the Hard Rock took out over 2x the amount they told me they were going to. I called and they said it was a deposit for incidentals and I was told about it (even though I wasn't by the girl that checked us in). The only way we could release my funds was to have another card to put the deposit on but our family lives in MI so she said she could fax in her card and etc. We ended up walking the 2 miles (from the restaurant) back to the hotel to settle the credit card issue. We were THEN told that my funds wouldnt be released until 8-10 hrs later so basically we would be getting ready to leave by that time and it would be pointless. So, we had walked all the way back for nothing. We checked to see if our room was ready but it still wasnt. So I basically complained my butt off to this guy at the check-in counter (I was polite, but angry) and about the shuttle, he told me that "I'm from NY and I walk everywhere anyways so it doesn't bother ME" WHAT!!? That is what you tell an unsatisfied customer?! Then he told me the hotel isnt even in charge of the shuttle so its not their fault. As far as the rooms go, my reservation request is "NEVER" guaranteed and all he could offer me was a SMOKING King. He claimed that it didnt smell like smoke because they shampooed the carpets regularly. And all he could do to compensate me (after speaking to his Mgr was to refund the $7 resort fee). REALLY!?! I was SOOO upset! My bf was giving me "the look" because he didnt want me to make a scene and we just wanted to move on and enjoy our night. After being tired of walking and arguing with this guy we just settled on the smoking room. We went up there and walked in and it definitely smelled like smoke. I didn't want it to ruin my bday fun so I didn't waste my time. The next day when we went to check out the girl at the counter asked about our stay and I told her I was upset and the reasons why and she told me "Well no one uses the shuttle ANYWAY" and basically tried to make me feel stupid for wanting to use the free shuttle that was promised to me. She also told me "Its because its New Years, its not always like this". So.... what about it being my birthday the day before NYE? Am I just going to get [--] over at this hotel every year if I came back!? THEN on top of it all....she tried to say I used something from the minibar and was going to charge me an extra $4. WTF!? I swear to god... I have NEVER received such bad service from a hotel in Vegas and especially a 4 Star one! I am NOT a complainer at all and am usually a pretty laid-back girl but I felt the need to pass my experience on to everyone looking to stay here... Oh.. and the ONLY good part about this hotel was AGO, their italian restaurant. It was AMAZING and the staff was very friendly. I'm totally open to comments from others if you've received a similar experience or just have any questions for me.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: lisakmurray
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed there for our 25th anniversery for 3 nights. We were given an upgrade because of our anniversery, to poolside, overlooking Rehab, in the older tower. This room was cheap for the ambiance and ammenities, $99 for Sun and Mon night and $150 for Tues. night.The room was beautiful, awesome view from the 6th floor. We did find out that we couldn't take any food or drinks to our room from outside the hotel, everything had to be bought from them, but we were there to have fun and we weren't in the room very long anyway, except to sleep on their wonderful bed. It is off the beaten path and the odds of winning are better on Fremont Street, but the experience of being there was awesome. The music was perfect and if you get hungry, the Hard Rock Cafe is right in front of the hotel, where they serve up some great food and the staff there definately like their jobs and make you feel at home. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel great for a night”
Reviews.Author: kbass0001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hard Rock the last night of our trip. We got a great room in the center on the 9th floor overlooking the strip. Only downfall, no shuttles to the strip or airport, must take a cab. Beware: just about everything in the room you have to pay for. Except for the soap and small bottle of shampoo and lotion.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock totally Rocked! One of the top choices in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Taylor514
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Hard Rock for a combination business / pleasure trip and could not have been more pleased. Everything was perfectly smooth from check-in to exit. I was a little concerned about the over-the-top rock and roll image, but it was actually a very friendly hotel only made better by the rock music theme. Cool music and memorabilia everywhere made for a fantastic atmosphere. Stayed in the new Paradise Tower and it was everything that was promised and more! The room was clean and extremely functional with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. I wanted to take it home. Amenities were great and room was quiet. Here is what really made the Hard Rock special - the entertainment and restaurants were the best in Vegas. Nobu was outrageously good (but very pricey), Pink Taco was a blast, and the steakhouse superb. Always good music there - Santana at The Joint was incredible. The Joint is one of the best venues I have ever been to! Location worked out very well - free shuttles to the strip were always there (as were cabs) and we actually rarely had to leave the hotel. Also, the pool scene is not to be missed. Overall a great experience and I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “felt like i was on edge the whole time..”
Reviews.Author: BaileyLaCreme
Reviews.Content: I've read reviews on Trip Advisor before booking for 2 nights for the Marine Corps Ball, and didn't read alot of positive reviews, but we wanted something close so I could drink and not worry about driving. I Reserved a room in the new Paradise Tower, Pool view, 1 king, non-smoking almost 2 months in advance. I was told that the 1 king was a request but we for sure had a non smoking room in the new tower for the Ball rate that was blocked. After a long day of unfortunate events ont he road trip to vegas from 29 Palms, CA, all we wanted to do was sleep and I called when we go to the strip I called ahead to ask if they had any of our requests fulfilled and they said 'Absolutely!' That's when I thought I could forget about all the negative reviews I've read...buuuut no.. . There was absolutely NO parking in the self parking so we were forced to do valet and non of us had small bills to tip Valet so we felt bad. The Bell Hop took our luggage into a back room before we checked in to "make sure we don't have any out side alcohol" WHAT?!?! I didn't want anyone going through my stuff! When we got into the to the front to check in, the man who was obviously stressed out said "we don't have any V, C, I right now"... Since I work in a hotel myself, I knew the lingo that they didn't have anything 'vacant, clean or inspected'...Greaaaaaaaat... we were put in the casino floor, smoking, two queen and on the complete opposite said and floor of the couple we were carpooling with who were also guaranteed a room somewhat close to us. Same thing happened to almost everyone in my Fiance's battalion. One guy even got booted and had to stay at the Riviera. Basically, you give them your money for a room and they give you whatever they have, your requests are worthless. The bellman was cool enough to give us a heads up that everything was on sensors, so "if you don't want it, don't touch it, it charges you automatically." Sure, whatever, we didn't want to pay 4.50 for a tiny bottle of water anyway. Funny way they stocked it too, cuz if you wanted a specific drink, you had to remove the drink in front to get to it, therefore getting charged. Way too far from the strip, here were scuff marks all over the walls, a couple of flies in the shower and the tile was chipped and what looked like rust or mold in the corners of the tub, the room reeked and there was only one working light bulb, and the lighting in the bathroom sucked and the music was sooo loud no matter where you went. I heard alot of stuff gets stolen so we left the Do Not Disturb sign on the entire night and were frequently going up to the room to make sure Housekeeping didn't go in. Felt like if we were to even touch or move anything, then we'd get charged for it. The beds were awsome though Other then that the Ball was amazing and it was great to just have to stumble back to the room. Everyone just felt way to stuck up and into the whole "hard rock" persona. Wouldn't stay there again, even though we're only 21, this place made us feel old and they nickle and dime you for everything.

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: nmallard
Reviews.Content: it was great--they went out of there way to make it a great stay

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was a great, off-Strip place to stay...with a few drawbacks.”
Reviews.Author: JohnTes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock for a few nights in during Thanksgiving and thought it was a great place...but keep in mind that it is an off-strip casino/hotel, which isn't necessarily a "con." The check-in process was efficient and easy, the room was very roomy and modern and quiet, the bed was extremely comfortable (with nice linens, a down comforter and lots of pillows), the toiletries were very nice, a great shower-head and AGO is a great restaurant (oh, and Starbucks in the lobby). On the other hand, the bathroom was very small, there was an $11/day resort fee (though I am not sure exactly what is included since internet is around $15/day and every hotel in Vegas has free valet parking) and the public-areas of the hotel (elevators, waiting areas, hallways) were not clean/vacuumed. The pool area is awesome, though I didn't get to use it in November. I got a great deal on Priceline ($40/night) and it was definitely worth it...but, given what you can get other Vegas hotels for, I would not have enjoyed it as much if it had cost me the $100 that the hotel's website often offers.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock totally ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: hothearted
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly staff, most comfy hotel bed I've ever slept in. I had a fantastic stay at the Hard Rock. Everyone... our servers Mr. Lucky's, our room attendants, front desk agents, doormen, valet were very nice and very helpful. I had a total blast at the Hard Rock. I do however love my music loud and am hevaily tattooed. I felt very at home here when I would get stares at any other casino. They have a shuttle bus to the strip free parking. I had read from past reviews here on trip advisor that they were charged for mini bar items or shampoo and was very carefui during my stay. I don't know how you couldn't see the huge price tag on the fancier shampoos. If you were charged in error for anything from the mini bar than why don't you call the hotel and have it reversed. Mistakes happen at all hotels for mini bar. I had a total blast at the Hard Rock and will be staying there whenever I'm in Vegas from now on. I can't wait to go back in a few months when it's warm enough to take a dip in their beautiful huge pool.

Reviews.Title: “Stay on the Strip Instead”
Reviews.Author: intlfoodtrvl
Reviews.Content: This was going to be my 8th time in Vegas, and I had stayed at a new hotel on each visit. However, my friend was a Vegas newbie with a narrow-minded plan of spending most of her time lounging by the pool. Her sister advised us that we just had to book our stay with the Hard Rock Hotel. Since I had yet to try this destination and because of its party atmosphere, I conceded to the suggestion. We planned our trip to span a Thursday through Monday to ensure that we would be poolside for the Sunday Rehab party, which was still advertised as a prominent event on their website, though we had already entered the Fall season. We arrived on the scheduled Thursday afternoon and were confronted with a lengthy check-in line. We were dying to get settled and start our trip, but we were not allowed to check in prior to their 3 pm time. We were told that our room was ready but awaiting approval from the housekeeping manager, which should only take one hour. We dragged our luggage into the Pink Taco restaurant to grab some tasty Mexican salads (see separate review) and to enjoy the sun on the patio. We returned to the check in desk over an hour later and were told that our room was still awaiting approval, but that we could immediately settle into a room on a lower floor. At this point, we were just eager to get to the pool, so we agreed to the lesser room, which wound up providing a hideous view of the parking garage! The room itself had funky wallpaper, a spacious bathroom, an iPod dock with speakers, and a large flat-screen television. We had mixed feelings regarding our stay. First, their website did not mention that the Sunday Rehab party was over for the season or that their pool was not heated. So, basically, everyone was relaxing poolside in the 80-degree weather, but had nowhere to properly cool off. In regards to the crowd, my friend and I thought we were back home among Jersey shore guidos. Fist pumping was definitely not our scene...A final note on the pool is that the waitresses were extremely friendly on Thursday afternoon, but became snooty and pretentious on the weekend. It was as if they were trying to exude a "cool" vibe for the rowdy Saturday-Sunday crowd. All of the pretentiousness was more discouraging than impressive. Additionally, the hotel's free shuttle to the Strip only arrived once every hour and did not even stop anywhere close to Las Vegas Boulevard. We wound up opting for taxi service instead, which saved time but cost $10 each way. I was also annoyed by the $20 a day fee to use the fitness center, which was attached to the spa rather than being a part of the hotel. The large room was packed with equipment and would have been the perfect way to counteract my extravagant dinners and evening cocktails, but I refused to pay for this "amenity". The main reasons to stay at the Hard Rock are for the crazy atmosphere, terrific nightlife options, and large pool grotto. However, many of these things are negligible and can be found at other properties. I would recommend staying on the Strip instead.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is TERRIBLE!!! Stay FAR away.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTravelMan
Reviews.Content: Where to begin.... 1) My room did not have a single glass anywhere to be found. I had to drink from my hand. There WERE several dirty glasses sitting on the floor outside my door when I arrived and when I checked out the next day. 2) The television had no signal at all. Zero channels. 3) There was a huge moth between the sheets. I discovered it when it crawled up my leg after I got into bed. 4) The room had no coffee pot. 5) Construction began at 8 AM in the room directly above mine (the hotel was less than half full judging by the registration desk, why did they put me in a room below construction?). 6) The staff was impolite. 7) The hotel charged me $8 for an item from the mini-bar, which I didn't touch. For all I know the item was never there to begin with. 8) The music at the registration desk is so loud (from the casino floor) that you can't hear what the employees are saying from behind the counter. As a frequent business traveler I stay in a lot of hotels (I've flown 50,000 air miles around the US in the last 6 months on business travel) and the Las Vegas Hard Rock was, without question, the WORST! I've stayed at Best Westerns in the middle of nowhere that were preferable. I've also stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Biloxi and I found that to be so vastly superior that I am amazed the Hard Rock 'brand' would allow such a disgusting property to operate in Las Vegas. Do yourself a favor. If you're traveling to Vegas, avoid the Hard Rock at all costs. You won't be sorry like I was.

Reviews.Title: “Super fun”
Reviews.Author: JadenHolloway
Reviews.Content: Awsome pools, lazy river, hot tubs, and hot tubs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: timelessimages
Reviews.Content: Beware of 'Resort' charges not disclosed, but instead hidden in small print of paperwork @ chk-in. Awesome collection of memorabilia. Great shows.

Reviews.Title: “Not the place your father wants to stay at........”
Reviews.Author: livinlargeinpanama
Reviews.Content: Maybe I can officially be called old, (wife & I are 50) but I just couldn't stand the level of service at this place. Booked two rooms for the Santana concert which was awesome, The Joint is a wonderful venue but I won't be staying again in the future. From the minute you check in the vibe from the staff is not good, it's almost as if they are scared as hell of losing their jobs but forgot that their job is to make the guests have a good time. We stayed in the new Paradise tower, room is small but OK. Went to make a drink but they're were no glasses, went to get ice and the machine was empty. Tried to open a beer but there was no opener. Turned on the TV but the channels wouldn't change, went to call the desk but the cordless phone wasn't charged, tried to turn on the lights next to the bed to figure out the phone and they didn't work either! Switched the wall switch over the bed next to the lights and still nothing. Called the desk from my cell and someone came up. Turns out the light switch has to be on near the door and the TV has to be turned on and off to reset itself. Guy said it happens all the time. My daughter had her own room she couldn't get the TV to turn off at 2AM, service guy showed up and said it was a common problem and fixed it. He forgot his flashlight and called the room at 6AM wanting to come get it, yes waking them up. Apparently flashlights must be very valuable there. Also, both our rooms were charged for items taken from the mini bar which we didn't use, meaning we had to wait in a long line to rectify the charges. Oh, and they charge a daily "resort fee" of $8, no one could tell me what that was for. Finally, while waiting for our cab to the airport on Sunday morning we were kicked off the casino floor, apparently you're not allowed to sit at empty slots with your baggage. I was told we could sit outside on the stone wall, somehow after dropping $2500 at the place I was hoping for something better than a stone wall! I guess the 20yr old & 30yr old generations don't care about these things.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by Service and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Hot-Tati
Reviews.Content: We NEVER stayed here before, on all the trips to Vegas. We decided to stay here for the event in The Joint on Halloween night. We paid about $150.00 with the events special code. That same night was running many $400-500.00. The ONLY thing I did not like was the rooms view. We were on the third floor and facing the building outer workings, no pool, no lot, no mountains. We discovered this is pretty much where all of us with the special code were located. But how much time were we gonna spend looking out anyway!' The Valet was great, at first he was a little standoff ish, but with in minutes he warmed up to us. The receptionist got us into our room super quick, and was very friendly. We had to walk a ways to the elevator, but the ride was quick. We had a nice room with two beds, a large bathroom, and mirrors angled so you could look at your backside like never before. The clubs were ok, not our kind of music. The dinner at AGO was good. And the pool scene is great, We were at off season but a few were in the hot tub. We walked around and thought what a mad house it must be in summer. You can walk to the CVS and get beer for your room for what you pay for one at the bar. Hoffbrauhaus is across the way, interesting atmosphere. Sushi place across the street. Bus line near by. AND for all you single ladies...this is one of the best places to meet hot guys! They out number the women and are in abundance. We had a good experience with almost every aspect. Too bad it took us this long to stay here.,

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: KatyaKatya
Reviews.Content: I simply LOVED this hotel, it was the coolest hotel I stayed at so far, for sure. and what's best is that I got it for a really good price at lastminute travel website. I guess it's because most people use the casino, so it's good for everybody. anyhow, I will go back there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Resort Fee ruined an otherwise great stay.”
Reviews.Author: UCLaw98
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the new Paradise Tower and had a great stay - beautiful room, very clean. Great service with the Valet, they were fantastic even when our plans kept changing and we were getting the car in and back out every 15 minutes. Love all the decor and the new wing is under construction with the coffee shop area, but it's going to be great when it's done. HOWEVER, when we checked out we were SHOCKED to see a charge of $7.84/day for a "resort fee". I should have read TripAdvisor as this seems like a common issue but since we had stayed here before, I didn't even do my homework. The worst was that when I challenged the charge at check-out (the first time I was aware of it), the desk clerk told me that we were told upon sign-in (we weren't) and that we had signed off on the charge. She was very unpleasant and I asked for a manager . We waited for over 10 minutes and instead of a manager, she brought back a printout of what I supposedly signed. What had really happened was we checked in and they told us about the mini-bar and that our credit card would be charged for the remaining reservation days and then handed us an electronic signature pad, said "ok, just hit 'accept' and sign and you'll be all set". We signed and didn't think anything of it. After the fact, we learned that the signature pad has several pages of "terms" that the desk clerks were just skipping over and then handing the signature pad to the guests. As we were continuing to argue with the desk clerk, two other people came in to check-in and beautifully, the desk clerks did the exact same thing to both of them - handing the signature pad to each gentleman with the "just hit 'accept' and sign" instructions and not mentioning the resort fee authorization. So, we pointed it out to them and neither of them were aware of any resort fee. We were worried about missing our flight, so we left with both gentleman arguing about the resort fee. When we returned home, we contacted the hotel management and they apologized and refunded the charges. They also indicated that they were going to address the problem. I truly hope they do because frankly, we got a great rate and if it had been $8/night more, we still would have stayed there. But it was the principle of the matter. I would still recommend the hotel but be sure to calculate an extra $8/day in your rate before booking and make sure to read the fine print when you check in. Trust, but verify!

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Jmb138
Reviews.Content: not worth the hype very small casino and average rooms with some minor issues "The Joint" was cool though had a great time at the "Danzig" show

Reviews.Title: “If you are a music lover, you'll be in HEAVEN....”
Reviews.Author: sassyonemtl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did a spur of the moment trip to L. Vegas because our great friends from Hong Kong were going to be there for a conference. I chose the hotel because my husband who is a true music lover has always dreamed of staying there so he could gush over the guitars, etc. We stayed in the hip-n-cool paradise tower - facing the pool.. Thank you for this-- front desk! What classy renos you have done here. The room was perfect - super clean -- super modern. The bathroom awesome! The beds -- are heavenly - clouds !!! Slept like babies -- !!!!! Can you imagine - and even in Vegas? The pool areas were manicured beautifully -- nice atmosphere. Except for the fact that the pool water is sooo freezing. I don't think I could stay in long on a 100 degree day even. Also some of the lounges are looking it bit beat-up/tattered from your REHABs on Sundays. The purple bus at the Hard Rock Cafe (in front of the hotel) is very convenient when you want to go to the strip - it drops you off at Fashion Mall. The John Varvatos is also a store all music lovers should visit. It is within the complex. Awesome staff -- cool gear, clothes, etc.. Also, ate at both Pink Taco & Luckys.. Both cool... Pink Taco has a fun happy hour so check it out!

Reviews.Title: “the beast that is the priest ,THX Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: metaltravler
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip primarily to see Judas Priest at Thomas and Mack arena. What better place than the Hard Rock to stay . RIGHT? Location! short easy walk.The beast that is the Priest was AWSOME! Best show ever! The Vegas fans were great!all the people at the arena were nice, and the Hard rock also delivered! Our check in was very easy, we got a great room in the old edition on the sixth floor near the middle,GREAT view of the strip and pool area, and the doors open up to let in the sights, sounds and energy of vegas like NO OTHER Hotel Casino in Vegas can! The room was clean,maid service top notch! Everyone we encountered there was VERY nice!But having that french balcony was incredible! The pool was fun but not quite what I expected.(We had very high expectations) But the Barmaids and drinks made up for it.We booked an extra day so we could experiance Rehab! Did not dissapoint. Soddem and gamorra.whether at the pool or watching from our balcony from above, what a party!We also got tickets to the WEC fight that night at The Joint. WOW! Hard Rock knows how to pull off any event with style.Had a great time, all 4 days. We will be back when all the construction is done. But not to stay at the new towers, nothing could compare to the french balcony's open air exciement and energy

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever~ loads of hidden charges, left a bad taste”
Reviews.Author: SergioX777
Reviews.Content: It was a guys week-end away. This place really sucked. Dirty and past its prime. Customer service was bad and they stiff you with a $7 a day "resort fee" plus $100 for checking out a few minutes after 11am. Hello its Vegas Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints! Great night!”
Reviews.Author: LynneInLasVegas
Reviews.Content: We got a room in the new Paradise Tower that had an amazing view over their pool and the Las Vegas strip. The room was spacious and modern. Comfortable bed and a great shower. The front desk agent who checked us in was very friendly and helpful. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a care-free stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock definitely rocks.”
Reviews.Author: dgdarien
Reviews.Content: I had been to Las Vegas plenty of times but never had the opportunity to visit the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino. Well I finally went there on a weekend night and it is definitely a fun place to be. The casino itself seemed quite small but this place definitely boasts some fun clubs. I also noticed several shops and boutiques near the casino itself as well as a large circular bar in the middle. The pool area know as Rehab is the place to be in Vegas on Sunday afternoon to people watch and party.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it but there are hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: OctobersChild
Reviews.Content: October '09 Overall had a good time but was disappointed with hidden costs and poor service. 1) Internet service is not free. You have to pay a flat rate for each 24 hours of service. No mention of this on there website. Rate: $12.99 per day. 2)"Resort Fee" @ $7.84 per day--no big hardship but why hide it? Just another tax that I don't feel guests should have to pay. Apparently covers costs for pool maintenance, free shuttles etc. 3) I booked through a travel group, and prepaid, and was still billed over $700.00 for "incidentals" for a 5 night stay without being told. I can understand having to put down a reasonable deposit, but that's just wrong. (Received my credit about 3 days after checkout.) 4) If they are going to offer in-room snacks at ridiculously inflated prices they should be on top of things. I found some items in the snack tray had been consumed but resealed to look like they hadn't been touched. Reported it right away, so I wasn't billed for anything. Glad I checked. Too many of the staff are very cold and not very courteous. I had to deal with bad attitudes on several occasions--I get it, it's the Hard Rock, but you're not rock stars. I blame hotel management for this one. The pools are great, though some spots have very limited sun. The casino is relatively small but I can appreciate a space you won't get lost in. Cocktail waitresses don't always come around often enough and when you do order a drink they might keep you waiting longer than you'd like. Mr. Lucky's restaurant is reasonably priced and has decent food, but 3 out of the 4 times there, I had pretty bad service and or botched orders. Pink Taco has consistently great food and fair service but is a little more pricey than need be (Happy Hour is the best time for deals). Hard Rock Cafe has great food and I want to say good service ... Unfortunately, on one occassion, we received two checks for the same meal. To top it off, the second check was four times the actual cost of our meal! When we pointed this out to our waiter we were apologised to profusely and assured there would be no second charge. Of course, when the bank statement was checked a day or two later the second charge was there. We were back home by this time and could not complain in person. Needless to say my buddy was pretty livid. Note: There are a couple of reasonably priced restuarants just across the street from the hotel grounds you might want to try. You do have other options. So it's not perfect, but the good was good and the place does have a fun atmosphere. There are some some really great staff and they made up for some of the bad, but would I stay here again? Probably not. I would consider it if, say, one of my favorite acts were performing. I would recommend to a friend but only after all the warnings.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe hotel and stay”
Reviews.Author: stooksk
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 5th floor of the Paradise Tower 3, viewing the not-so-scenic garage. View aside, the room was deliciously luxe with trendy furnishings, linens, carpet. The flat screen was huge and the velvet sitting chair was very comfortable. The bed was a little too soft/plush for my tastes - I felt like I was swimming in it. Bathroom was also very neat. I ran into an issue one night with the remote not being able to turn the TV off (nor the buttons on the TV), but a quick call to the operator had someone to the room in 20 min. Check-in was a breeze and the guy was very friendly. Internet was $16-17/day. Tried Mr. Lucky's for breakfast and Nobu's for dinner and enjoyed both. Parking was very close to Paradise Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: BigCheese09
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock was definitely a good value for a guys trip to Las Vegas. I thought it was a great value for the quality of rooms and pool areas especially when compared to the on strip hotels. It was 5 guys in 2 connected rooms which were both very comfortable and ample room for what you need it for (sleeping and keeping your stuff in). There's so much to see out there that you spend less time than you think in the room. Pool: Very nice, just get a lounge chair before 10:00 if you plan to be near the pool for the day. Esp on Fri/Sat/ (didnt go to rehab on Sunday). Otherwise enjoy the strong sun and people watching. I strongly suggest sunblock. Casino: You can definitely get on any blackjack/ roulette table during the day, but at night it gets more crowded because the casino isn't very big. Food/ Clubs: Pink Taco and the 24/7 place both had good food. If you're looking for a buffet head to Caesars or Bellagio. Body English was great. We had 5 guys and got bottle service there. I strongly recommend it. We saw a concert at the Joint which was cool. Why I gave it 3 stars: When you consider the distance to the Strip, the relatively small casino, the loud music that starts at 9:00 am esp when you go to bed at 4AM, the lack of nearby amenities/ sights, and you have to pay for the Gym. I might have given it a 3.5 but that doesnt exist so it gets a 3. Wasnt a 4 but probably better than a 3. I would recommend it to people who dont want to shell out a lot of money for the top of the line places.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but beware of hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: LaylaC85
Reviews.Content: OK so there were things I liked and things I didn't and things I wish someone had told me before I booked this hotel. Firstly, the good stuff: • The room service was great. The staff were polite (the last guy I got was amazing - I wish I had taken note of his name to send compliments), the food was delicious and the costs were reasonable. • The hotel restaurants were also great and varied. I especially recommend Pink Taco. • If you're going to the Thomas & Mack Center for NBA it's an easy quick walk, and is also only about a $10 cab ride or 20 min walk to the strip. The bad stuff: • I strongly advise against taking anything from the minibar. Not only is it expensive in the first place but you end up paying the staff to restock it so it costs about twice the advertised price. • The gym costs guests $20 per day. Ridiculous. • The hotel puts a $100 per night hold on your credit card for incidentals. Again, ridiculous. I checked out 5 days ago and I'm still waiting for it to be returned. • The casino area is one of the smallest in the city. If you're a big gambler this isn't the hotel for you. • Its not on the strip... I knew that when I booked so it wasn't a problem but just be aware. That's all I can think of right now. Again it's not the worst place I've ever stayed. The rooms are comfortable, I think the hidden costs just put a big black cloud over my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing better”
Reviews.Author: Massi22
Reviews.Content: Amazing place, terrific rooms, the best swimming pool party ever, there's a tattoo shop and the people is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a winner!”
Reviews.Author: TwinVisionsPromo
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The staff are wonderful, the theme is fun (Rock and Roll) and the rooms are fabulous. You will not be disappointed in this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Still great after 4 trips!”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrvlr84
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, I requested a non-smoking room. They didn't have any available so they bumped me up to a real nice room in the new paradise tower. I found the staff to be efficient, courteous and friendly despite some of the negative reviews I had read. The pool was really well maintained, and the men's restroom even had an attendant who was constantly mopping so it wasn't as disgusting as it had been in past visits. Rehab seemed to be a bit toned down from previous years, but the Center Bar was really hot. The room had a discount coupon for the Italian AGO restaurant which I used. The waiter was Italian so I got to practice some of the Italian which I have been studying for the past few years. The George Clinton concert was fabulous, and there were all sorts of promos for complimentary 3-olive vodka, budweiser lime, and Cruzan Rum.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: g8torgirl91
Reviews.Content: I went to the Hard Rock to see a concert and I loved every minute of my experience! From the first drink at the Center Bar to my 4am dinner at Mr. Lucky's, it was a great experience all the way around! The hotel just oozes rock and roll and the service was exceptional. Our conceriege even found us tickets to the second night of the show that was sold out - could not have asked for a better experience. Will be the only hotel I stay at in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Would have rated higher at first, until our last day...”
Reviews.Author: grafam
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock is definitely a hotel that caters to the younger crowd and music connoisseur. Pros: Quick ride from the airport and semi-close to the strip ($11 cab ride). Rooms were very clean, having french doors that open (in the older tower; Casino Tower) was great, food was average and pool was nice (however only one side was open over the weekend). Body English was a great club. Cons: Getting a server for a drink at the pool was horrible! I was able to get someone over to our Cabana once within a 2 1/2 hour time frame. They played hip music at the pool, but it was so loud, that you couldn't 'relax' if you wanted to. Could hear it all the way up at the 11th floor room at 8AM too. The price of a bottle of beer went up by $3 depending on where you were in the hotel (casino floor bar = $4; Wings club = $5; Body English (club)= $7!). Had a massage and she worked my back kinks out nicely and then did a 'noodle rub' on the rest of my body (horrible!), my facial was very nice though. VERY smoky Casino! I know it's expected in Vegas, but their ventilation system was horrible! One of the guys at the BlackJack tables was a complete JERK (no tip for him!) and WE HAD RAW SEWAGE come up thru our sink shortly before checking out. RAW SEWAGE!!!! My rating on the room (they were fairly clean) would have been a 4 had raw sewage not come up in our sink! I brushed my teeth in that sink!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Not sure that I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Tower Rooms are luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: cuzwecan
Reviews.Content: Very helpful reservationist - called for a room after we landed for our overnight stay. She tried her "codes" after AAA didn't give us the "best rate." Room was mid-high in the Paradise Tower which was just re-furbished in August. Luxury!! Comfy beds - darker woods for ambience - great for romance and sleeping-in! We didn't need the 42" flat screen tv, but it was nice to have the option. Mini-bar fridge in room/typical expensive hotel prices on those items. Would definitely stay here again. Recommend valeting your vehicle and have luggage brought to the room - tower is opposite side of facility from entry. Then faster to self-park to get to Paradise Tower. [We don't like toting our luggage thru the casino]

Reviews.Title: “Young atmosphere but loud & awful guest service agents”
Reviews.Author: matou123
Reviews.Content: Very "in" and "young" customers that differs from typical huge Las Vegas hotels but do not expect to sleep on the afternoon and to check-in before 2 PM. I arrived at 09.00 AM on the morning for a conference and ask for a priority that I obviously did not obtain. Guest service agents were deceiving... The solution is to phone to the Customer Service (0-800 number) and to say that you received a call to confirm that your room is ready... My friend tried and had a room at 12.00! Moreover with beach parties going on, do not expect to rest on the afternoons for the "siesta".

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvrproduct
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic stay. The rooms in the new Paradise tower are comfotable, spacious and up to date. The pool is great and the atmosphere in the hotel (if you like Rock and Roll) is excellent. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE SERVICE AT THE HARD ROCK HOTEL & CASINO - DON'T STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: jds0105
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel & Casino is a smaller hotel off the Las Vegas Strip. There is considerable construction nearby that is terrible for traffic and long cab rides. An average 2 person cab ride to the center of the strip can vary from $15 to $25 depending on traffice on congestion. The new paradise tower is on the back side of the hotel and is a very long walk from the casino floor. While the tower is nice and new it was opened without working out all the "kinks", as many things don't work correctly or at all. When we tried to express our concerns after literally 20 minutes on hold the staff said they would "take care of it" and never did so. During our trip we requested a King bed and received two doubles. Only after bribing the front desk staff did they all of a sudden find the King room we purchased. We requested and were told we could have a very late check-out during booking but when push came to shove this wasn't in the plan. All of these problems we equate to normal hotel flaws and wasn't that bad overall. The casino drink servers were nice and worked hard, although it took about 15 to 20 minutes between drink orders a problem of saffing levels not the servers themselves. The biggest and main problem that should keep anyone from staying at this hotel is the service. While many of the casino employees were friendly and easy to work with, the same cannot be said for the hotel staff. The hotel staff is probably the most rude staff I have ever encountered at a hotel of this or ANY calibur. There is not enough room to go into all of the details but it's clear the very young staff at the HRH should NOT be in this industry and could care less if your a guest at the hotel or not. The will mislead you and treat you like trash. The horrible service alone is not worth the visit to this hotel and it will what causes this hotel to either be sold go bankrupt or shut down all together. You just can't treat guests paying a premium as we did to stay for a few nights this poorly and get away with it for to long. When the "cool" factor wears off this will be an empty casino and maybe then after it's too late will they consider treating guests as the deserve to be treated, with respect and kindness.

Reviews.Title: “life's better off the strip”
Reviews.Author: spiceyspice
