Reviews.Content: My friend and I hesitated about staying off the strip, but choose Hard Rock because it was of good value. After spending the long weekend in Vegas I would have to say, I would stay at Hard Rock again. The hotel doesn't have that huge casino feeling like many of the other hotels on the strip and there are less seniors there. We went to clubs and bars on the strip and when we would get back to our hotel for a "night cap" it seemed the fun would just begin. The other guests were friendly and the staff were great too. The pool was so convenient and we enjoyed it friday and saturday :) (tipped our waitress well, and she put us on 3 vip list's for some great clubs) Our room was very nice, and the hallways were quite. I was disappointed that internet wasn't free, and I called the front desk for a sewing kit, and it never came.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, the Hard Rock comes thru with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: aqp
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent guest at the Hard Rock ( about 7x/year), and we stay there because it's a fun crowd, great pool, and is much smaller than the behemoth hotels on the Strip. I have posted previous reviews, so this is just an update. Sometimes things go wrong with your trip. For me, the test is: what does the hotel do to make me happy and restore the situation? We had a problem with our reservation, but once I spoke to Laura, the evening manager, she quickly resolve the issue to our EXTREME satisfaction. We were treated as a valued customers, and I appreciate it. While we were there, the hotel had a fire. While this is something you don't often think about while on vacation, the HR's response was excellent - they quickly evacuated the hotel, gave us water while we waited in the parking lot, and everything returned to normal once the fire was extinguished. There is a lot of construction going on at the resort right now as they finish the second Tower addition and double the size of their pool. Since Las Vegas still has 100+ degree days, most of the work is being done at night, and yes, you can hear it. In general, the Hard Rock is a noisy place to stay, so if the party people scene doesn't work for you, I recommend Bellagio, where it is very peaceful. As for us, we keep going back to the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: OKBrandy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock from Sept 4- Sept 7, aka Labor Day weekend. Before I went, I had read review upon review about how bad the customer service was, how noisy the hotel was, how it was overall a horribly overpriced hotel too far from the strip. i was nervous. I arrived at the hotel right around midnight on Friday night. They were out of the standard rooms - which was the room on my reservation- so they upgraded us, free of charge, to a brand-new, amazing suite for the night, with their apologies. The suite was beautiful, with 2 bathrooms, several flat screens & mostly all white with a funky decor. I loved it. The next day we went back to check out of that little slice of heaven and again, I was nervous. i mean, hello - we had just spent the night in a deluxe suite, our room was bound to suck after that. We got our new room, which they had put us in the Paradise Tower on the 10th floor with a pool view. while it wasn't the suite, it was one of the nicest hotel rooms i had ever stayed in in Vegas. and all this after i had booked through a 3rd party site & gotten the room for less than $90 a night. So room-wise, i was thrilled. Onto customer service. It was without a fault. From registration to the bell-hops to the staff at the restaurants to housekeeping, everyone was friendly, nice, helpful & was always smiling. Reminder - i'm talking about labor day weekend here, people. the place was PACKED- but no one was ever rude or short with us. again, i was thrilled (and slightly shocked considering all the negatives i had read about on here). Is the hotel noisy? yes, of course. you're at the HARD ROCK. come on. they pump excellent rock music through the casino and the elevators and it's loud.but it's not deafening and frankly, i enjoyed it. it added to the atmosphere. our rooms- neither one- were noisy. i couldnt hear the people in the room next to us (as has been stated on this site). I couldnt hear the people at the pool - even at Rehab on Sunday. yes, i could hear the pool music, but just the beat - it wasnt loud enough to hear the words. yes - it is off the strip. but everyone who books a room there knows this. it's not like the hotel is keeping that a secret. sometimes it's nice to be off the strip & the hotel has so much to do & so many places to eat that i really didnt miss the strip this time. oh- and the spa is wonderful. steamroom, jacuzzi in the womens locker room & full use of it for the day if you make a spa appointment is paradise. so, overall, i was more than pleased with my experience. the ONLY negative thing is the $150/night hold they put on a credit or debit card that is not released until you check out. that was dissapointing to me, but not enough of a dissapointment to ruin our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations by far.”
Reviews.Author: Andymn847
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the new HRH Paradise Tower Aug 28-31 in pool facing room 424. This was my 4th time to Vegas in the past 3 years and 1st time staying at HRH. I was lucky enough to be invited out and was treated like a VIP from check-in to check-out. I read a few other bad comments from other hotel guests here and they should have known this hotel is geared toward 21-40y/o. The entire atmosphere is ideal. The loud music, dim lighting and great clubs/bars/food are what make this place work. I will never stay anywhere else. The Paradise Tower is a little far from the casino...but that isn't necessarily a bad thing. The pool and Rehab were beyond explanation, you have to see it to believe it. I am looking forward to checking out the HRH Tower Suites next summer. Pros: VIP services, Music/atmosphere, size of property, POOL and REHAB, Nobu, Rare 120 and Body English Cons: I don't know if I have any... I guess room service took a little long ( 45 min), but that is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “If you are staying for business skip this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rocknreconstruct
Reviews.Content: The hardrock hotel is not a place to stay if you are there for a convention to work. I stayed for magic because they were doing a deal with the hotel for the tradeshow. I didnt know that my poolfacing room on the 8th floor would not keep out the noise from the pool parties they hosted with house music bumping till 1 a.m..not to mention I couldnt relax in the pool after a hard days work because of these obnoxious parties that are invite only. You are charged a daily resort fee, and if you are not there during the day you cant use the pool at night because of these loud parties for other guests. I booked sunday night and I felt like I was walking through a drunken spring break party and had to fight off douche bags to get to my room... The room was nice, but the shower was cold, remote didnt work, 13.99 a day for wi-fi. Charges everywhere for everything. Not enough of a casino for my liking either. There isnt really any cool stuff around the hotel.. you have to cab it alot of places and it gets a little annoying. I understand its Vegas and people come to party..if you want to go to vegas and party your face off and never sleep .. stay at the hardrock, but if you are a business traveler who needs to sleep.. stay elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “HRH 16 Aug to 21 Aug (Never again)”
Reviews.Author: Kitchener23
Reviews.Content: Due to the poor customer service at the Hard Rock Hotel on our trip in August 2008, I wrote a letter to make them aware of their shortcomings in customer service. Their response was to offer us a free night valid till September 2009. As we were always going to return to Las Vegas in August 2009, we took up the offer. We decided to stay a further four nights at the HRH instead of moving to another hotel as we had previously planned. I had advised the lady that offered the free night that we will be arriving at the HRH at 2.00pm after a 12 hour flight from New Zealand and a further hour or so flight from San Francisco. She said that she would put notes into the system but could not guarantee anything as check in on Sunday was 4.00pm. Sunday 16 August: Southwest flight out of SFO on time and arrived at the HRH at about 1.30pm. After standing in the registration line for about 35 minutes, when I get to the counter, the lady advises me that I should go next door to the VIP check in (things are looking up!!). Go to VIP check in, they take the usual credit card imprint and advise that they would call me when the room is ready. Lunch at Mr Lucky’s. Good meals and service (wife had cheeseburger sliders, I had the buffalo chicken). Wife goes to VIP check in to ask how much longer our room will be. She is rudely told that check in is at 4.00pm (3.45pm already). At 4.30pm both of us go to VIP check in. They tell me that the room is getting made up right as we speak. Get to the room at about 5.10pm. When we enter the room (540) we are overcome by a very strong paint smell. DW calls VIP desk to advise. They say that it is a VIP room and it has been freshly painted and the carpet cleaned. We had stayed in this room last year and it was not a VIP room then. When DW advises the desk of this, they tell her that as we had requested this room we should deal with it. When DW insists that there is no way that we can stay in the room as even in the very short time we have been there we are both getting headaches and sore throats, the lady advises that someone will be up with keys to another room. In the mean time a fruit platter is delivered to our room. The room service guy that delivered the platter agrees with us that the smell of paint is very strong. After 30 minutes when still no key has arrived, DW makes her way to the VIP desk. They insist that the key has been sent up and basically call her a liar. They give her keys to room 538. We move to 538. No smell of paint in the room except from what is coming out of our clothes. By this time I am on the phone to expedia to see if we can cancel the four nights we have booked after the free night. I hear loud knocking on the door of room 540. I open our door. The porter is here with the keys to room 538. I had trouble explaining to him that we don’t need keys to 538 as we are already in it. He was very rude and upset that his trip to the 5th floor was a wasted one. Lady from expedia heard the conversation and commented on the rudeness. To cut a long story short, we would have lost too much money cancelling the 4 nights that we had booked through expedia and as we had planned to only sleep a few hours per night we decided to remain at the HRH. As our flight out of Vegas was at 5.00pmon Friday, we decided to ask for a late checkout (extend to 1.00pm from 11.00am). On Thursday afternoon I ask the VIP desk for the possibility of a late check out. They tell me that I should check with the VIP desk on Friday morning. On Friday morning I visit the VIP desk to ask for check out at 1.00pm. You would think that after the problems that we had getting into our room that they would let us check out at 1.00pm. No, I was told that the room had to be vacated by midday. So much for VIP service! My wife and I have made 25 overseas trips in the last 3 and half years and stayed in over 30 hotels so feel that I am reasonably well qualified to comment on hotel customer service. We have never encountered such rude, poor and arrogant service at any other hotel. From what was once my favourite hotel, I can safely say that I will not be returning to the HRH in Las Vegas. I realise that the hotel may be wanting to project a “hip / edgy / rock star” image but feel that the staff have taken this too far and have started to behave like rock stars themselves and think that they are more important than guests. When I advised the lady that arranged the free night of the issues that we had at check in time and the fact that we had to wait so long for a room that was just not ready to have guests, her response was to offer us a free breakfast (which I refused). I will not be staying at the HRH again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel staff I've ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: anangel898
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at this hotel so we wouldn't have to wait in the long line for the Rehab pool party on Sunday. We got into Rehab with no problem and our beds in the room were very comfortable but the room itself was dirty and dusty and we found items from the people who stayed in the room before us. We also put all four of our names on the hotel room but we had to ask for four towels instead of two towels EVERY day. The hotel inside is disgusting - people are smoking EVERYWHERE, including inside the casino and in every hallway. I was worried that I would get burned by cigarettes as I walked by, not to mention the stench that it left on my clothes and hair. During the four days we stayed at the Hard Rock, one of the girls left her wallet in the room for a little while and in that short time had her money stolen out of her wallet. Security told her they'd get back to her after investigating it and 3 weeks later, still no phone call. Also, one of my friends and I were assaulted by a group of guys inside the casino right in front of a security guard who did nothing to help us. After we spoke to him, he called over another security guard who showed up more than 10 minutes later. We identified the guys and the security guards went to talk to them but all they did was "warn" them to not do it again. They didn't get their names, didn't ask if they were staying in the hotel and didn't ask to see their IDs. Security told us that they cant do anything more than warn them to not do it again and the only thing we can do is press charges with the police, but they made sure to point out that we'd have to wait 2-3 hours for the police to arrive and that our statements would be public record so it would have our names, addresses and SSNs on it and these guys would be able to look it up and get our information. After I spoke with security again that night they told me they saw that group of guys in the casino again and spoke with them again but still didn't ask for their IDs or their names! Management was completely dismissive and insensitive with this situation. They kept passing me off to different people in administration, and no one called me back about it like I was promised. They said was that what happened in the hotel wasn't their responsibility, even though THEIR staff and security didn't react properly. After I got home from the trip, I found out that one of my coworkers was also going to Las Vegas and staying at the Hard Rock so I told her to watch herself and be extra careful in the casino because security won't help her and she told me she heard the same thing from other people too! It seems ridiculous to me that a hotel chain this popular would treat their guests so badly, have dirty rooms, and have "security" that doesn't keep anyone secure. I will never stay at a Hard Rock property again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: baltscottie
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay here if you have kids. Rooms were just ok, and bathrooms horrible. Shower head was so low, I had to bend down to be sprayed. Walking down to our ice and drink machine, the whole area was flooded. Pros- Young person hang out, lots of pretty ladies, access to rehab on Sunday, decent restaurants. Cons- Music blarred from the poolside at 8am on Sunday morning, 3 hours before pool opened. They cleaned the pool area after rehab and all I heard were power washers from 9pm to 1pm. WTF? Even heard this with the door closed. Too far off the strip. Overall a pretty rundown hotel, but i stayed in original wing. Would I go back, depends if they send me some comps.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you...”
Reviews.Author: shitshy
Reviews.Content: thank you for being on top of everything... the hard rock is fun crazy ans beautiful i love wasted space... and being able to make anything possible at the hotel... oxoxox

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful New Tower”
Reviews.Author: dlist25
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Paradise Tower of the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino, The bed and Pillows were very comfortable, and the room was very clean. There was a large shower, and the room was quite oversized, with a large flat screen t.v. Check In was very busy as their was a concert that night however the line moved fast and the associate was very helpful and responsive. We were upgraded to a corner room, more windows and a view of the strip. I have to say we did not hear anything during the night, our room was very quiet and there were people staying on our floor. This probably goes without saying but this is not a family hotel, people come here to party, and they do it well. If you are like us and like to party but then like a little peace and quiet once you do go to sleep go to the paradise tower. Also check out the Pink Taco's happy hour, the service was great and so was the food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Think about why you want to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Theate3541
Reviews.Content: I commute to Vegas about once a week for work, and as such, have stayed in almost all hotels in Las Vegas (including the Hard Rock). In my opinion, if someone were going to pick the Hard Rock as their hotel, they need to have very specific reason why they are doing so (i.e. entrance to Rehab in Sundays) – otherwise, stay somewhere else. The rooms are really nothing to brag about (though I did just stay in the new Paradise Tower, which is slightly nicer than the Casino portion), the service is atrocious (even worse than other party hotels such as the Palms), the food choices are pretty bad (really just three not so great restaurants), and their clubs have seen better days (Body English isn’t what it used to be). In fact, I’d even go as far as to say stay JUST the night you want to be there, and the rest of the time, stay anywhere else. The Hard Rock isn’t cheap, and for the prices it charges, it should really give you much more. Also, take note of the hotel’s draconian policies. For instance, if you want a late check-out, the latest I have ever gotten them to do for free is until noon (and that can be a fight, regardless of their occupancy on the day you’re planning to check out). And take note, if you’re late checking out, expect a $100 charge PER HOUR levied to your room (it’s in the terms you agree to when you check in). In addition, make sure to add $7.84 per night ($7 plus taxes) to your room rate as a “resort charge.” What that provides you, I’m not really sure since you’ll still have to pay for the internet, gym, and basically anything else that other hotels in Vegas charge you for but don’t make you pay that stupid fee.

Reviews.Title: “Lost Everything Cool about The Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: musicmanager
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for 12 years. After the hotel was sold two years ago it has gone down hill. I only continue to stay because they give me rooms for free. This week they put me in their new tower, just opened. The room was small, the shower was designed so bad that I was shocked at how hard I had to work to get in the thing and get the water turned on. Back in the day when Peter owned the place they understood customer service, those days are over. I am a 23 year music industry vet. I can tell you that the hip kids are staying at the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a rock star!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenV
Reviews.Content: After many vegas trips, I am in love with this hotel. Its small enough you don't get lost in the casino, big enough you can't forget you are in vegas. Room was incredible and hip. The hotel just has an energy about it. Pool is amazing! Spent lots of time there. All the restaurants I tried - Pink Taco, Lucky's (ask for the gamblers special), Rare 120 were great, and I'm a huge foodie!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: bmccain
Reviews.Content: Far from the strip, front desk staff was slooowwwww and unfriendly, construction everywhere, and a casino that would fit in my basement. We rented a cabana by the pool which was nice, but worker were rolling by with wheel barrels full of concrete and debris and jackhammers pounding all around us. The music was awesome, but played loudly at all times. There was nothing to do at the hotel or immediately surrounding which was really inconvenient unless you don't mind walking 20 minutes in 110 degree heat or paying $11.00 bucks for a cab everytime just to get to the strip. Either way you are dealing with the construction along the way. If you want the total Las Vegas experience DO NOT stay here. Stay on the strip. It's actually just as cheap and you won't spend near the money on cabs. This hotel was the only negative about our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: pabloscp
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights. The staff was brilliant and help ful even to a drunk like me at 0530 am. Best night clubs. If you like rock then Wasted Space and Body English are places to be. Besides, nicer girls come down to the centre bar. HR Rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Uhhh... run down, expensive and lackluster”
Reviews.Author: aurorab4
Reviews.Content: Got to say... the Hard Rock Las Vegas is now resting on it's past performance and name alone. They are far, far from the best venue in Vegas no matter who you are or what you are looking for. I will acknowledge that there is something to be said for vintage, and worn but worthy performance (think 60's or 70's rock bands on revival tours). But that comes with age, mellowing, and non-stop attention to who the audience is and what is relevant to the time. Hard Rock LV has done none of that. They might continue to book some decent bands - but they need to be judged on more than a concert venue alone. The hotel is run down and lacks the personal attention to detail that can be found in other hotels. They give you no sense that you are anywhere more exciting than a Red Roof Inn. blah....blah....and more blah.. Dark, no sparkle (and I don't mean the rhine-stoney kind - just give me some vibrancy in the staff.....the energy level....something!) The only thing they have going for them is that they still seem to attract a young 20' something crowd that brings the energy and beauty (okay superficial beauty, but none the less it's something) to what is otherwise an unimpressive environment. The rooms are a huge dissapointment - just flat out nothing special. Dining = $$ and .....(yawn). A $13 charge for internet connection (complimentary at other hotels) - extra for guests at the pool ($20)/per - get over yourselves. Ya just ain't "all that". Step your game up Hard Rock. We want more, and can (and did) find it for less. We checked out and went elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “If you dont sleep & like paying cab fares this is the Hotel for you”
Reviews.Author: shademann
Reviews.Content: I requested and recieved a room next to the elevators facing the pool. The room was nice but nothing special. However next to the elevator facing the pool was a mistake. The elevators make a loud vacume cleaner like noise that echoed through the room. Fri-Sun the pool blasts the music @ 10am, 8am or 9am on Sun. I'm all about a late night and good times but when you go to sleep @ 5am you dont want to wake up to 10K watts of G & R. Thier comp system is the worst I've encountered to date (I've played all over the country) My friend is a high rooler and dropped close to 30K in 7 days and they would'nt pick up dime one of the 3,600 in room charges. POOR!! This hotel is far from the strip. you are looking at 20 bucks round trip to the strip. This gets expensive quick.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, overrated & overhyped!”
Reviews.Author: Pandown10
Reviews.Content: This hotel flat-out ripped me off and I type this in good faith to warn others of how they may be treated if they stay here. Overpriced, overrated & overhyped! At first, I went to the pool party on Sundays called ‘rehab’ with my girlfriend and I asked for a menu to eat & drink. Prices were $11 a regular drink or $18 for a drink with a souvenir cup. The waitress decided to bring us drinks that were the souvenir cup… We never asked for that, but we dealt with it, big deal and the fresh cut pineapple was 45 minutes late and warm, we’re just tourists I guess. Then when the check arrived, the drink prices were actually a whopping $22 (without the souvenir cup to keep) and the waitress said that the menu was wrong saying that $22 was standard for drinks, yet she never mentioned that and told me that she doesn’t set the prices there. Then why did you bring me the menu??? Feeling like I was ‘taken’, after checking in I wanted to leave 15 minutes after and tried to, yet the Manager ‘Randy’ who wouldn’t meet with me would not honor me by letting me leave without charging me my $300 for the first night of my stay. Did I mention that the Hard Rock checked me into a lesser room that I didn’t pay for? The hotel phone did not work. The toilet paper dispenser would stay on and the door barely shut. In fact, some drunken girl came in to the room when I was on the phone with the hotel telling them how I wanted out of my room because of how I was treated. In addition, the place was run amok with loud & drunk fratboy’s who were acting ‘hardcore’ wearing goofy Ed Harding clothing to try and impress each other while acting like they actually had money. What happened? I went to where I usually stay, Caesar’s Palace, where (as usual) the rooms, customer service and respectful class was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.. stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: ckone1906
Reviews.Content: My friends and I decided to stay at the Hard Rock for memorial day weekend just to ensure access to the Rehab pool party... we paid $750 a night just for a regular size room with a view of the construction.. when we checked in they wanted a ridiculous amount for a security deposit which could not fit on any of our credit cards since 1000 was our limits.. we had to borrow a friends CC in order to check in... the room was clean and nicely decorated but overlooked the construction work and a strip club... the music from the strip club came in our room till about 5 in the morning and we were then woken up to the construction at 7 in the morning... there were some days our room didn't get cleaned.. We had to wait at least an hour every time we ordered room service and that was when we were able to not get a busy signal or no answer... the pool is nice but drinks cost you $18 plus tip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bigacabobby
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hard Rock Hotel and it was wonderful. The staff could not have been nicer. Beds are comfortable and excellent restaurants. Rare 120 was the best. Their servings were well worth the price and their presentation was something to experience. The Rare 120 staff was so attentive and could not do enough for you. Hard Rock was clean and smelled clean. Great music and pool area. Would highly recommend this establishment. Lots of action for viewing.

Reviews.Title: “I had a horrible experience last night at the HR.”
Reviews.Author: liberte1
Reviews.Content: Some people who work there are incredibly rude but the majority of the employees are try their best. while I was losing $25 a hand at Blackjack last night. Some old grumpy pit boss who i had never seen before accused me of saying something disrepectful to him; .I have no idea what he was talking about. It was bizarre & humiliating & it will be a long time before I go there again;

Reviews.Title: “TOO LOUD & TOO EXPENSIVE, WON'T BE BACK!”
Reviews.Author: MaggieSport
Reviews.Content: The Pros: The beds are really comfortable, the rooms are clean, the décor is nostalgic. There is an on site concert hall called “The Joint”. The seats are folding chairs and not real chairs, for the price of the tickets I expected something nicer. Santana was an awesome concert! There is Free Parking but it is a long walk to the Hotel rooms and Casino. Now about the Cons: We had a pool view room and a view of the strip, (sorta) we also had a view of the construction crane and all the garbage and all the noise. The music in the pool area was so loud that it was impossible to take a nap during the day so you could party at night. We couldn’t carry on a normal conversation in the pool without practically yelling at each other. We had a guest meeting us at the Hotel. He was in a suit and they were going to charge him $10 to come into the pool area. He was in a suit and wasn’t even going to use the pool. The Jacuzzi was a joke, barely warmer than the pool and the jets barely moved any water. The music was just as loud in the casino area and in the restaurants. The Hard Rock charges $25 a day to use the fitness center. $25 if you open the frig just to put in your own drinks to keep them cold. The mini bar items are really expensive. You would be better off walking across the street to the drug store or the liquor store and buying your own. $13.99 a day per computer to access the internet. At 5:30 AM the maintenance crew was doing an early cleaning of the pool area. It started with gas powered blowers and power washing equipment. When we called the front desk to complain they said that they would check into it. They tried to tell us that is was the construction personnel and we told them that we had a visual on the person using the blower in the pool area, and it was not the construction. They did nothing!!! So if you like lots of noise, and paying too much for everything stay at the Hard Rock. But if you want to have more money for gambling and night life stay some where else. I know I will. There are lots of nice hotel choices

Reviews.Title: “Just wow, upgraded without asking...”
Reviews.Author: Olivier82
Reviews.Content: I was on a 5000 miles road trip and we just decided to book the hotel a few hours prior to check in. The hotel was amazing, service too. We got upgraded to a nice room, view on the poolside, wonderful furniture, everything was perfect... except the prices for the mini-bar :) but hey, it's Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Quite fun - if you can stand the noise”
Reviews.Author: Scrimshaw
Reviews.Content: Was booked here to cover a TV shoot in Vegas. I did not pick this hotel and would not have chosen it if given a choice. First off, there is the noise. Hundred-decibel rock music, 24-hours-a-day, in every corner of the hotel save, thank the lord, in the rooms. Of course this is the point - this is not a criticism - but beware: if loud music at 6am over breakfast is not your thing, stay elsewhere. It's also a fair walk (20 minutes) from the Strip and there is a noisy construction site next door. Oh yes, the pool was closed during my November stay (why? It was plenty warm enough) All that said, the rooms are huge, comfortable and spotless. The decor - lots of white and black leather, proper 1970s-style carpets and huge beds is perfect for what it is. Decent gym and the food is pretty good as well. Best of all, the staff are friendly and bend-over-backwards helpful. Something went wrong with my laundry ( a small delay) and lots of stuff was knocked off my room bill in compensation without being demanded. I thought I was probably 20 years too old for this place but noticed plenty of ancient rockers having a great time. IN fact, everyone here seemed to be having a good time. Ended up quite liking this bizarre establishment, despite myself.

Reviews.Title: “The best rooms in town”
Reviews.Author: MillsMC
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at 18 hotels in Las Vegas, and this place is way underrated. The rooms are unbelievably incredible. Large room, big HD-TV, the most comfortable beds in town, and I liked the bathroom. The pool area is great. They sure do play some strange music in the casino. The go-go dancers around the gambling tables are gorgeous. It's not close to the strip, but I believe they have a shuttle to it. The Hofbrauhous (German restaurant) is right across the street. I am really stunned this place is rated so low. I can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “2 views for the price of one...”
Reviews.Author: Jellybean50
Reviews.Content: Good room rates on pool and construction site view. You get to see men in bathing suits, and men in construction hats. 2 views for the price of one. We expected some construction noise, but the safety beeping of the trucks backing up was noticeable even from our 9th floor, center, pool view room. The beeping and the construction noise starts at 6:30 am and continues until past 10 pm. Though, you don't notice the noise, when they play rock music by the pool. The new hotel tower additions look like boxy office park office buildings. They have none of the “boutique” flavor and character that the existing hotel has with its French doors opening out to the pool and signature curve shape. All in all, we were still glad we were there. The beeping noise did not bother the one with the hearing loss (due to years of listening to hard rock music). Still, try to bring a pair of ear plugs if your hearing is good. See attached pool construction view photos. On Mondays they play hip hop music by the pool. The other days is regular rock music. The hotel will be nice once the hotel and pool construction is finished. Come back in 6 months, you're better off waiting. Especially with all the good rates on hotels in Vegas that are not undergoing construction.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel is the Best Hotel In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mauigirl10
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Hard Rock Hotel and it's still the best hotel in Vegas. We've stayed at the other bigger hotels in Vegas - but nothing compares to the Hard Rock. It's Classy, full of great amentities, friendly, and reasonbly priced. It offers something for everyone. Of course it's geared towards the younger, hip crowd. But there is something here for everyone from 80 to 2. The pool is the best and unique. The restaurants and bar or fabulous (check out the new Rare 120). Starbucks just a quick elevator ride down from your room. The gaming area is intimate and fun. The staff was fabulous - better than ever. We rquested assistance several times for minor services in our room - and they were prompt and friendly. Get a room faciling the pool - it's worth the upgrade. The pool is lit up at night with the Strip's light in the background. You can open up your french doors that look over the pool and soak in all of the sights. If you're in the room before the pool closes - you'll get to listen to rock and roll music and enjoy the sun coming in/setting. we were nervous about the reviews regarding the construction. And it was not that big of deal. We could "kind of hear" some typical construction noises in the morning - and we didn't notice anything at the pool They have the great Rock and Roll music playing. So don't worry about the construction. Sometimes you can hear the planes - but it just depends on what their flight paths are during the day. They have a shuttle you can use - and taxis are always usefu. If you have a designated driver, renting a car is a nice option. They have a self park - that is free and VERY convienently located/connected to the main building. It will save you a lot of money in cab fares - IF you have a designated driver. Overall, this is our number one place to stay. We've been here alone with just the two of us, we've brought our children (12 and 13 years), and our grandparents. It's a great setting for all. But if you're 21 to 30 - and like the night scene and young bodies - of course this is even more ideal. But there are all ages here too. And they treat you all the same. You feel valued as a guest - even if you're not 25 and a model's body. Looking forward to coming back and staying in the NEW towers - though the Casino Rooms are classic. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocked.”
Reviews.Author: bulletbender
Reviews.Content: Wanted to review this too, as I just reviewed Mandalay from when I stayed there. I'm not sure if restaurants/clubs should be part of the review. I'm counting it in with my four star rating. Body English was a great atmosphere, and the japanese restaurant we went to before was also amazing. Being Spring Break, I didn't spend too much time in the room. But I did spend enough time to be able to say it was clean, the beds were great rest, and the bathroom was really nice, too. I think the high price here was as justified as you can probably do with these high-end hotels that are hard to justify 'Value' in the first place. The pool here was also out of control. We actually got passes, but whereas normally I'd think having to pay at these high-ends is lame, I would have actually forked over the money. I stayed in March '07, so ymmv, but at the time, it was definitely the hotel in Vegas that I'd stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Construction Noise”
Reviews.Author: Kasidie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, as always, but the new construction going on for the towers starts, literally, at 6:30am. So if you go to bed late (and who doesn't at the Hard Rock) then be aware that jackhammers, radial saws and other really, really loud equipment will roust you out of bed right at 6:30am. And regardless of what they say at the fron desk, there is no soundproofing or location that'll fend off the noise. Otherwise, we love it here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dubioushalo
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal so I was looking forward to staying here, but I found the room and experience disappointing. The bathroom is very small. There was no counter, just a sink. I had nowhere to set my toiletries. I've never seen that in a hotel. The beds are comfy, and there is a large flat screen TV. Room noise is an issue because you are close to the airport so be prepared for jet noise, plus noisy guests walking down the hall in the wee hours, which you can hear right through the door. In a nice touch there are french doors that open to the outside. The room is stocked with overpriced water and snacks. Go to the CVS across the street. No coffee maker either in the room. The casino is filled with restaurants but I found them pricy. Mr Lucky's the diner is the cheapest of the lot but you can pay a lot less for diner food elsewhere. But the wait staff was nice. The pool area is beautiful and probably the high point of the hotel. There is construction going on around the pool area with two new towers going up, but the noise was not an issue. Again drink prices from the pool bar are pricy. $7 for a can of Heineken. The bartenders and staff are very friendly though. You will be charged a $7.63 a day resort fee, whatever that is. I just get the feeling this place is nickle and diming you with this mysterious fee and the overpriced goods in your room. I resented that. Finally the place seems isolated with no convenient way to get around if you don't have a car. It's over 2 miles to the strip through some dodgy neighborhoods. There is a free shuttle that runs from 11am to 9pm. It leaves from the front of the Hard Rock Cafe on the corner and drops you off at the Showcase Mall (next to MGM) But if you stay out later (and most of us will) getting back will run you a $10 plus cab ride. That adds up.

Reviews.Title: “It's worth a look--but not a stay.”
Reviews.Author: veela22
Reviews.Content: The biggest beef I had with the hotel was simply the location. It's quite a walk to the strip. Sure they advertised a shuttle--but it only ran from 11am to 9pm. Who goes out that late and comes in that early while in Vegas? We did enjoy the room. It had a large screen TV and some of the most comfy beds we've been in at a hotel. That being said, I've never been to a luxury hotel. There was a lot of construction going on. Be warned: They have you sign a disclaimer that you won't bring outside drink/food. We did anyways, hiding it. Their stores where very costly to buy from them. They are located next to a CVS with reasonable alcohol pricing. We did love the music. After purusing casinos all day, it's nice to get a break from the typical casino noise the machines make. I would recommend a mid-day visit utillizing the free shuttle that sits outside the MGM. However, for the sake of your wallet or feet, pick something closer to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “hard rock parking garage”
Reviews.Author: ktontsch
Reviews.Content: It was in the evening, waiting to pick up our kids at the airport, and had some time to kill. Went up to the 8th level of the Hard Rock Casino parking garage and parked west and had a FANTASTIC VIEW of the strip and jets landing and taking off from the airport. We were the only ones there on the entire level. Please don't be there the next time my wife and I do this as it will ruin the romantic feeling. We like to come to Vegas to relax and enjoy life in the easy lane and this was wonderful. Ken

Reviews.Title: “My last time at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: jnneil
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times at the Hard Rock, and have loved it's edgy, hip, rocker appeal. Not this time. My wife and I just returned last weekend staying at the Hard Rock and the entire hotel is being renovated. WARNING: CONSTRUCTION ZONE! We were expecting to hang out by the pool, but it is closed until the summer. This is not mentioned anywhere on their website. A Resort fee is being charged..... you would think that the resort fee would be for the use of the pool? NOT!!!! Beware: Jack hammering starts at 5:00 in the morning. Make sure you bring your ear plugs. The Hard Rock hotel Blows!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Have the”
Reviews.Author: Boricua1
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with this...steak, three grilled shrimp, choice of potato, and a salad for $7.77!!! Yes, that is correct, not a typo...it is NOT on the menu...you have to ask for it by name...SO worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Room Deposit Surprise.....CAUTION !!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mdin
Reviews.Content: Booked 6 nights through Hotwire. Went to front desk to check in and they asked for my credit card for a deposit. Card did not go through because they tried several times to put $1000+ for a deposit. The credit card thought it was suspicious activity and they put a hold on the card. I told the front desk person that was a ridiculous amount for a deposit and would not pay it. He said that he would not check me in if that was the case. I told him that i had stayed in MANY Vegas hotels and NEVER had to pay such a deposit on a room. He remarked that the Bellagio does it...this is NOT the Bellagio! He then said it was because they have plasma tv's in all the rooms and they need to be protected...the Holiday Inn on Boulder Highway has plasma tv's and they DO NOT charge that kind of deposit...try another excuse! I ended up leaving and calling Hotwire from the parking lot. They got me into another hotel for my stay and did everything they could to make me happy. Kudos to Hotwire! Had plans to meet colleagues at NOBU...not happening after that check-in fiasco....will never go into this hotel or any of their restaurants again. Your loss Hard Rock! Spoke with fraud department at my cc company hours later and they remarked that Hard Rock had continued to try to charge me for the deposit even after I had left...a total of 9 times! Not good at all.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: europeangirl1980
Reviews.Content: We are newlyweds so my husband and I went to LSV for a "mini-honeymoon" 'cause we wanted back home to spend Christmas with my family, so we tought that going would be funny, and it was, but the hotel was the most terrible experience that I've ever had and I must to say that I've stayed several times in Vegas and Hard rock is just not that good, moreover, is very expensive for what it offers. We stayed there from Dec. 18th-22nd., when we arrived, the front desk staff wasn't polite at all, he also offered us an other bedroom (we have booked a King size room) and as we were so tired (we were driving and got the December snow storm!) we accepted, after that, he told us about a $600 charge as deposit for "futures damages", we were lucky to have cash with us, because we have to pay more than $1100 with our CC. The room was ok, with a good view to MGM and other hotels, the construction was under our room, but as we were staying at the 11th. floor we didn't hear the noise. By the third day, our towels weren't changed, we have to ask for it at the front desk, also the sink wasn't working and we informed about this too, they said that someone were going to fix it but never came, ever!... The last night wast the worst of all, the people staying next door, came to the room around 3 am, and were laughing sooo loud, then yelling, and finally..... well you can imagine, the noise was insuffrable, and it felt just like if they were at our room, I called to the front desk thousands of times but I think that they didn't do anything, becuase the noise finished around 6 a.m. After our experience we can only advice to stay away from Hard Rock, there is not even a good reason to stay there, not even when most of people says that this is a good hotel if you are around 21 - 35 years old, well, I'm 28 and my husband 29, and this is not the kind of hotel that we want to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Hated my Stay!!!!!!!!!!! Dont Ever Stay Here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: parislingerie
Reviews.Content: We went for the largest convention of the year and stayed here. We stayed for four nights, I had a bad time because as soon as monday morning came we were woken up by Jack hammering above our room at 8am. In vegas thats the last thing you want to hear during a hang over! The first morning it happened i let it go thinking that it would not happen again the next day. But then they start up the next morning even earlier at 7:15! you would think that they got the picture when the whole floor complained the day before! Another thing, we pay exra for a "poolside view" and they dont even tell us that the pool is under construction and drained out so we get to look at garbage all weekend. When i call guest services to file a complaint the second morning the jack hammering was happening, they place me on a "brief hold" for 10 minutes, in which i had to call back a second time before they heard my complaint, they tell me there is no manager in that can stop the horrid noise until after 8 and offer to bring down ear plugs. When our boss that traveled with us compalined yesterday, they admitted to putting us here because we booked through a travel website. When i come to vegas again I will never book a room at HRH again this was the worst stay i ever had!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Rocked!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sylvoosh33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Vegas. I have been there twice before and stayed at Treasure Island and The Venetian. By far, the Hard Rock was my favorite. All of the hotels on the strip are great but they are too overdone. We wanted a young atmosphere where people don't care what you wear, what you look like, etc. It was very laid back. The food at the Get Lucky 24/7 was awesome. It wasn't expensive. They serve so much food that my husband and I shared all our meals. The rooms were very clean and the bed was so comfortable that it was hard to get up every morning. The staff was very friendly and put us on the guest list every night for Wasted Space and Body English (just ask at the front). We will stay here again end of May because we loved it so much.

Reviews.Title: “Things they don't tell you.....”
Reviews.Author: StephieDevonUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the New Year and didn't think it lived up to the hype. The rooms were OK but nothing special. It all had a tacky feel ..but not in a good way! (I have to add here that i do actually like tack.) Anyway it's a long walk from the strip and not a particularly nice walk. And the noise from the airport is ridiculous...and there's planes taking off every 2 minutes. Just thought you'd like to know. On the plus side...some great places to eat in the small shopping parades across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Funnest Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: goonie48
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel is aimed at a younger group of people. When I statyed I was 22 and it was one of the funnest times I every had. The pool was the best part of the hotel. It was huge and the staff working was great. We went for a bacholer party and it was the perfect enviroment. THe women working and at the pool were amazing. The only thing that I did not like about the hotel was the location. Cab fare killed us throughout the couple days we were there. THe hotel is off the strip. Overall terrific hotel if you are looking to party.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel In Vegas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Candelisaton
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October of last year with my boyfriend. I came from the Venetian (which was pure heaven) to this hotel. I stayed 2 nights and being a big hard rock fan i was really excited. We went to check in and a really rude girl at the desk asked us for our credit card for incidentals. Our stay had been already pre-paid. She told us that it was declined but we explained to her that the Venetian puts a freeze on your card and doesnt release it for 24 hours (as do most hotels) so would it be ok to pay the deposit in cash instead. she then told us that they dont accept cash and that if they do make an exception they'll have to take a bigger cash deposit. when i asked her why that was, she said 'well its us doing you a favour'. She said we'd have to wait for the supervisor who wouldnt be back until the evening and she may or may not make an exception. So we were so worried that we'd already paid for our stay which was non-refundable but they may not let us stay after all, we might have been homeless for the next 2 nights. I then decided to go up to the concierge desk and explained everything, she said that the supervisor was in fact there and the whole time she was standing beside the girl we were talking to. She called her over and the supervisor said she can reduce the amount to one night's deposit which was eventually accepted on my card. If that wasn't enough, the room was small, nothing to brag about and was a huge dissapointment after the luxury of the venetian and you had to pay for access to the pool and when i looked out the window nobody was using it, anytime of the day, which is no surprise as you dont have to pay in any other hotel. I've been to Vegas 3 times and this was the worst hotel i stayed in. I've stayed in the luxor, the mgm grand, the golden nugget and the venetian and ALL of them were a million times better than the hard rock. BE WARNED - dont stay here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wasted Space Nightclub Review”
Reviews.Author: rocnrlr
Reviews.Content: Wasted Space, the Hard Rock Resort Hotel & Casino's new "anti club" nightclub, is not what it is purported to be in its advertising. The only difference between it and every other resort hotel nightclub like Pure, Lavo, Tao,or the Voodoo Lounge is that you can wear street clothes (yes, tennies &t-shirts!) , and its sound system is worse than those in the other clubs. Other than those differences, Wasted Space is just another dark, Hip-Hop/House music club. Yes, there's a little rock, but it's set to a serious hip-hop beat, so it doesn't sound like rock at all. And, with the distorted sound coming from a mediocre system, it's like torture. My suggestion to Carey Hart, Jason Giambi, & Benji and Joel Madden is to be true to your club's advertising. If it's a rock club as you state (“I wanted a place where my friends and I could hang out and listen to some great rock music with a cool atmosphere…there were no options in Vegas, so I made my own,” said Hart), then play rock, and don't change the rock. It's what we rock n' rollers expect when we get there. Also, if you're an "anti-club" unlike the other Vegas clubs, allow your patrons to sit, relax and party to the beat of some real rock drumming without having to spend $200 for a fifth of Grey Goose and a booth. Last but not least, Guys, get a decent sound system. What a disappointment it was for me, a former regular in the mid 90s at the Hard Rock Hotel, to have been so excited to check out the new venue Wasted Space, only to find out that it is truly a waste of space.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Casino Hollywood Florida”
Reviews.Author: blackjack1234567
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is new and very expensive. Don't waste your time or money in this Casino. They use nothing but those cheating pile of crap auto shuffler machines on the lower limit black jack tables. I have gone four times and lost money all four times. They have stacked the odds heavily against you with these auto shufflers. Also keep in mind any time you play the Indians you play a self regulated Casino. Which in my opinion is a huge house advantage. Unlike Vegas, the Indians create and apply their own policy in the casinos. Now who do you think they are looking out for? If you guessed the Indians, you are correct. The slot machines are all controlled my some "Whopperesq" computer system that is probably always working the odds away from you. So in my humble opinion, STAY WAY! Don't cry, I warned you. Go to Vegas, they are giving away rooms now near Freemont, or go on a cruise on NCL, Carnival, or Royal Caribbean instead. You will be able to play hand shuffled shoes in these places where you can almost make 50 - 50 odds against the house. By the way, unlike Vegas, you also get treated to expensive drinks at $7 a pop in the hard rock. So you need to pay for your drinks just so you can give the house an added advantage. That sucks if you ask me..

Reviews.Title: “Serves its purpose”
Reviews.Author: dtwillow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hard rock for three nights recently for a guys getaway. Enjoyed the hotel, the price was right and the rooms were fine. This isn't the place I would take my wife for a nice getaway. It's not fancy, it's a bit smoky and has a little bit of the old Las Vegas feel. Pluses. The beds in the rooms were very comfortable, the rooms had french doors which is nice to get some fresh air. Nice big flat screens with lots of channels. Everyone was very friendly, check in, bellboys, dealers. Casual restaurants had great inexpensive food and the table minimums were low. The place is very fun, it has a good vibe, it isn't massive like most hotels on the strip. I'm sure it would be even better when the pool is open. Did not hear any construction at all, however airport is near and sometimes the planes are loud. Negatives. No fan in bathroom (a good thing to have when staying with guys) room is a bit dated with some scuff marks and wear and tear. Smokey gambling floor which is annoying. All in all I would recommend the Hard Rock for a guys getaway or for a fun inexpensive weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: harborWisconsin
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights at the Hardrock for my daughter and son in law on her birthday. I booked the room several months ahead and specifically chose the king bed mountain view room. The room was prepaid and charged to my credit card at the time of booking. When they arrived at 6 Pm they were told there were no king bed rooms available and they would have to take a 2 bed mountain view room. This was hard to understand since the reservation specified a king bed room and was prepaid months in advance. The room was quite expensive and I feel this was not only deceptive but poor customer service. We will think twice before staying there again even though the rest of the stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: autumn015
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was great! The room was the best !Great beds great tv and great maid service. Ther room was very clean!! We stayed during the holidays in the winter so it was fairly calm. Im not sure how loud the pool gets in the summer. There was construction going on but it didnt bother us at all. You couldnt hear any noise from it except when you open your doors to look outside we could hear the crans beeping every once in awhile no big deal! It is away from the strip so you must drive or plan on taking a taxi!! Casino is a bit smaller than most of the big hotels we visited but that can be a good thing!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience at HRH Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LorenzSingapore
Reviews.Content: My experience as follows: 1st an unbelievable rate to start with: I stumbled upon an unbelievable rate which I booked immediately w/o hesitation. $14 a night incl taxes. This is the thread where it all started (http://las-vegas-hotels.tripadvisor.com/ShowTopic-g45963-i10-k2317252-Unbelievable_offer_any_catch-Las_Vegas_Nevada.html) 2nd. I tried to do the $20 trick to get an upgrade (the check in staff didn't know how much I was paying. Failed! 3rd. When my kid opened the minibar and moved some of the items, it immediately triggered charges to the room account. NOTE: Item moved = hotel will assume it has been consumed. I called to front desk to explain and they happily credited back the charges. 4th When I checked out, I was shocked to find $239 charged to my room as room rate. I spoke to e front desk, they are equally puzzled too as mine's supposed to be pre-paid. They promised credit card won't be charged and gave me a Guest Services Manager's card in case. 2 days later, my card was charged. I tried many times to reach that manager but can't. Finally I spoke to another GSM and he promised to take care of it. The charge was finally reversed few days later. Ok room wise, its pretty standard according to Vegas standards. Nothing fanciful. Location is off-strip, so u probably want to have a car to get you around.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: wbrightfl
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great service, but watch out for hidden fees. Check your credit card statement!!!! I reserved my room through Hotels.com, which I expected this to be the full, total price. This is not the case. You may think you are getting the best rate through hotels.com, but they don't tell you that this hotel will charge an additional daily $7.63 resort fee, on top of what you pay hotels.com. So expect the unadvertised resort fee to hit your credit card after your stay and don't expect any help from hotels.com about it as I requested they pay me back for the fee as I paid them for the room, not Hard Rock. Hotels.com refused to refund me for the fee and stated that any hotel can charge an additional fee at anytime and it's out of their hands. Seems like a shady way to operate. Hotels.com and Hard Rock should have this worked out and included in the advertised rate. Also watch for minibar charges as I got hit with charges on my credit card and I didn't even open the refrigerator. Other than the extra fees this is a great hotel, full of good looking people.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!”
Reviews.Author: sunkist_michelle
Reviews.Content: One of my best friends and I booked a four night girl's trip to Vegas - it was a blast. The only downside about the Hard Rock is that it's quite a walk from the strip - we didn't really mind because we drove from LA and they have free valet - but those without cars would have to rely on cabs (or not wear heels). We made friends with Estaban, the fantastic concierge, who put us on all the lists at some of the best clubs (Tao, Body English, Tryst, etc). When we showed up at the clubs we didn't wait in line or pay cover (always easier when you're a girl in a cute outfit!). While I noticed the construction we didn't hear anything in our huge room. We were upgraded to a room for people with disabilities so had a lot of space. Pink Taco was also fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction, Decent Rate $65 Dirty Carpet”
Reviews.Author: GerryKurl
Reviews.Content: Okay, I booked this through Hotels.com, got a great rate, non smoking room, large room, stain on carpet, I felt could've been cleaned with a spot carpet cleaner. Construction going on outside, but did NOT effect inside activities. Here is the kicker..........the bed was the BEST I have had all year. So I rate this with 5 Curls..............Gerry Kurl was rocking. I also saw IRON MIKE TYSON at the Wasted Time Lounge. He was kicking it with some females! GO GET IT CHAMP!

Reviews.Title: “Always my fav”
Reviews.Author: jvevil
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the HR numerous times. All I can say is this place ROCKS!!!!!! It's my favorite hotel to stay at when in vegas. I could write a ten page review as to why I love it so much but I'll keep it simple. Food, bars, club, events, pool, atmosphere, gaming, ALL GREAT. This is a place you go to party and have fun. If your looking for a quiet getaway or a place to relax then don't stay at the HR. It's a place to let loose and party like a rock star. VIVA LAS VEGAS BABY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: luvscigars
Reviews.Content: I give the staff here second to no casino hotel in vegas & close to a Four Seasons! Front Desk, Bell Staff, are great! Even better are the Center Bar Tenders & the Staff at Pink Taco! What a great time!!!! Dont miss their happy hour & the $7.77 steak at Lucky Sevens (tip well & you can get it to go!) Rooms very nice but nothing truely amazing (no complaints, just typical for the upper crust of Vegas!)

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you throw up somewhere in the bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: Miramami
Reviews.Content: So, I'd always heard amazing things about the Hard Rock ... being a young 22 year old woman I've always wanted to stay there... I came out on the Monday before Veterans days for shits and giggles and I really really really enjoyed the young singles scene and the party atmosphere. It's wild and I WOULD NOT recommend it for families or anyone conservative and boring. On a Monday and Tuesday night it was packed with people ages 21-late 30's. No offense older folk, but you will be the social pariah of the casino! My only complaint is that a friend of mine brought a party friend of hers up to my room and she threw up on the bed. Being inebriated myself, at the time it didn't seem like a big deal and something I could deal with in the morning. The reality was harsh the next morning when I received the $700 bill for replacing the WHITE duvet cover and other random [-]. So my advice is don't have messy intercourse on the beds, eat ANYTHING on the beds, or even breath on the beds cause there may be a charge. I understand throw up but $700!!!! Ridiculous. The Hard Rock has a great atmosphere, horrible service, & rude front desk people so I recommend staying somewhere else and paying the $10 cab ride from the strip. I'm honestly really bummed that I didn't have a better experience because it's such a killer scene but everybody deserves a second chance. Soooo I'll give it a second go and make sure to bring my plastic booties to wear over my shoes so I don't have to pay for anything ruined by my shoe bottoms! FYI: Nobu rocks! I live in LA and have been to the one in the 'Bu and it's definently comparable!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, dissapointing service”
Reviews.Author: DrRobert78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HRH 9-10 Nov. Unlike the other reviews we had no nuisance with the current construction work. The rooms were big, very clean and had a massive flatscreen TV in it. Very nice bathroom and cosy bed. But that was it. No breakfast, no (free) gym (costs 20 USD for already paying customers). Overall it looked nice. Front desk lady was a bit cool, explaining thoroughly about the minibar and it not being free, well duh..!!) You do need a car! Walk TO the strip is it least 20 min. Go for breakfast to Hotel Paris: Excellent breakfast buffet!

Reviews.Title: “I Love The Sound Of Construction In The Morning!!!”
Reviews.Author: DDHYYZ
Reviews.Content: I LOVE punishment it seems. I knew there was construction going on, but I just didn't think it would be THIS BAD. At around 5:30am, the AIR HORNS go off...yes, I said AIR HORNS. I don't know whose job it is to simply blow an air horn every 10 minutes, but its seems that if I wasn't up until 2 am, that it would be a fun job, and certainly the person in charge of air horn blowing at the massive construction site next to the pool does enjoy his job...thoroughly! Then there are the dump trucks, hammering and the coming together of steel beams. This, if done in the right order, creates an spectacular vibration throughout the hotel...did I mention this was at 5:30am? Just making sure... Oh wait, something serious must be going on...the AIR HORN MAN has now stepped it up to every 5 minutes... My view from my superior King bed room, overlooking the dorment pool (its closed and needs a serious cleaning) allows me a spectacular view of the Venetian, MGM and Paris (who's guests are still sleeping). Now add the gentle rumble of the cement mixer and some Spanish swear words drifting up with the dust clouds at the construction site and you have the cherry on top...PURE HELL! Did I mention this is at 5:45am? This hotel used to be fun, but without the pool, it is GARBAGE! Oh, and did I mention the AIR HORN??? Moving to the Palms tonight...this is ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Construction noise at 5am!”
Reviews.Author: jp5o
Reviews.Content: My first room was dirty, which I mistakenly put up with until they started construction the next morning at 5AM!!!! And it wasnt a little bit of noise it was terribly loud construction noise for their new wing. I complained to the front desk which was unable to help. I had to call again and get to the manager who sent me to another room. Which appeared to be an inconvienence to them. They made it seem like i was overreacting. The casino was also EMPTY. So if you are looking for a fun time, go to the Palms (which was packed) or someplace else trendy. Dont waste your time or $$ here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kalayka
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. I got there on Halloween and it was very crowded. All rock fans in the area were probably there. I have read in earlier reviews that they wont allow you to bring even a bottle of water and the reason is surely because they want guests to drink the bottled water in the room that costs $4.50 each. I am not sure if the deadbolt really matters, but the one in my room did not work and there is no security clasp or even a chain. I really did not feel secure with only the card lock in operation. It is very far from the strip that it is necessary to have a car unless you intend to just stay in the vicinity of the hotel. Staff members I encountered appeared to be nice and I may stay again but has to be very careful not to even touch any of the merchandise they have in the room. You touch it, it's yours!

Reviews.Title: “Porno palace”
Reviews.Author: CyndeeAustinTexas
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the HRH and proceeded to check out our accomodations. The "mountain view" was a view of the rooftop of the casino air conditioners. The room was very plain and average. Suddenly, my husband and I noticed that we could hear very clear and loud noises coming from next door of people having sex. The loud sexual noises went on for about 15 minutes so I called the front desk and asked if we could be moved. They moved us to a top floor room overlooking the pool. My husband went up to check out the room before I went up and he walked into a live porno movie set! He said the porno actress and actor were engaed in "Cirque de soleil" acrobatic sex. Several fully dressed men were sitting on the bed and a camera man was capturing the event. The movie director came after my husband and was upset that he had interrupted their scene. Luckily, an HRH porter was with my husband so he had a witness. The good news is that we were upgraded to a beautiful suite. The hotel was okay but sex is the theme here. We were told that the week before, they hosted a Porno convention. So be prepared. We rented a pool cabana and had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL LITTLE HOTEL IN VEGAS!”
Reviews.Author: Dottie
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel is the only Vegas hotel we will ever stay at again! Excellent value, spotless room and wonderful location. Yes, we knew the hotel was undergoing construction but tell me what Vegas hotel is not under construction??? They ALL are!!! OK, we are in our 50s and actually I own a small upscale lodging property. So you can imagine that I looked over the hotel room very carefully. We have stayed at other much more expensive and much larger Vegas hotels -- never again! We were overnight guests at the HARD ROCK HOTEL on Sept 21, 08. Oh my -- this hotel is a breeze for parking and for checking in and out. You are not walking for miles and miles inside the hotel to come and go from your room. You can actually ENJOY the hotel -- and the staff are VERY friendly people, and even the store keepers are full of SMILES! We enjoyed the hotel located EXACTLY one mile off "The Strip" from The Bellagio and Caesars. Our room was on the 11th floor. The two king beds were spotlessly WHITE with not one smudge or spot whatsoever on any of the bedding including the waffle weave jacquard duvet -- and the six spotlessly WHITE pillows on each bed. And mind you, the beds were VERY comfortable . The bathroom was absolutely spotless including all grout lines around the tiles on the floor and in the tub/shower. The sink and counter were spotless. I wondered if the entire hotel has just been refurbished because everything -- though modest -- was so fresh and CLEAN! Our room was on the pool side, however the pool and the rock music blaring at the pool close down at 6 in the evening, so nothing to worry about there. We remembered to bring our drinking water with us because as with any Vegas hotel, bottled water requires you to nearly take out a mortgage on your home ($8 - $11/bottle of water). All in all -- a nice little hotel with room rates that don't keep you awake all night. We will definitely stay again. Oh, did I mention that the Hard Rock Hotel is VERY CLEAN (hahaha). P.S. Excellent room air conditioning!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: hardrockcasinosucks
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my bachelor party after booking a pool room through Hotels.com. Three weeks before checking in I thought it would be a good idea to call to check that they have the right reservation. They had my room as a mountain view room which is not what I payed for. I called Hotels.com to have it fixed and it was resolved. I called back the next day and requested that I be on a lower floor anywhere from 3rd to 6th. They happily took this request and said they would make note of it. I called again several days before the vacation to verify the floor request and they said I was on the 11th floor. I requested a lower floor again and they claimed they made a note but there was not a note from before. After arriving on a Friday I received my keys for myself and my three roommates. We have the room for two days and check out is at 11am. On Saturday I stopped by the front desk to have a key fixed because it was demagnetized. They said I had the room until Monday which I immediately informed them was wrong and that I only booked the room until Sunday. They made a note of this and I went about my vacation. On Sunday after checking out at 10:51 am and paying for the room service bill which I find out was already paid for by a roommate that left earlier in the night I return home. It is Wednesday the following week and I have a charge (not a hold) on my credit card for two amounts, $358.61 and $195.11. I called the hotel several times and was passed around for several hours. I had to make a three way call with the hotel reservations on the phone to my credit card company to prove to them that they have made a charge and not a hold on my card. I have been trying for the past four hours now to get this removed and now I have my credit card company sending me a complaint form. When it arrived I have to write up what I've been trying to tell them for the last four hours. Manuel was the front desk manager that made sure to make this entire experience as difficult and unhelpful as possible. I would not recommend to anybody stay at this hotel unless they want to billed another $600 for staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel to stay in if you like fun”
Reviews.Author: pearson252
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the bad reviews, though I would set things street. Reason to stay If you young Like to party Like rock music Like to relax by the pool pre fair to be off the strip Don't mind walking Reason not to stay If your wanna hotel on the strip If you wanna quite Sunday As rehab pool party's will be on Don't like rock music. Rooms Size Average on comparison with other hotels in Vegas very clean Bathroom Good size full size bath very clean good supply of towels and toiletry Beds 5 star the best nights sleep ever, didn't want to leave the bed, they provide you with a comforter on the bed. Hotel Not to big compare to other major hotels in Vegas which means you don't have to walk miles to you room. Staff Seam pleasant enough and very help full. Just remember there people too. Pool one of the best pools I've ever been to and I cant swim. Has a Faux beach like effect has been used on the OC and entourage TV sets, nice cabana with mattress and safes, swim up black jack. Casino Fairly standard nothing stuck out about from the music memorabilia looking at other reviews they have slated this hotel due to circumstantial (wrong room snot answering the phone etc )events or they have done the research on the location and are blaming it on the hotel. Out of the 3 hotels I stayed in this year (including hooters and the Bellagio ) in Vegas this was by far the best . If you go here with and open mind and positive attitude I guarantee you will have a great experience. And dont forget to tip

Reviews.Title: “ALways fun at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: BoookemDano
Reviews.Content: I always have fun at the Hard Rock, but then again I have my own agendas. This is not a family destination or a romantic getaway spot. After reading all the bad reviews I have to put in my two cents. I visit vegas 4 times a year for fun or business, stayed all over the place and have settled nicely into the Hard Rock, if you can book early in the week (mon-thurs) its a bargain most of the time, most important... tip the front desk and the bartenders and you will have a great time. You do not need to be a high roller to have fun! The pool is fantastic for people watching or meeting new friends. The last time I was there in June I got upgraded to a plush suite, the bed looked and felt like a cloud floating in the middle of the room. Since the hotel is under renovation I would have to agree with the others that if you are light sleeper the noise could wake and annoy you but this also might be because you stayed out too late.

Reviews.Title: “Like It Loud!!”
Reviews.Author: pjggolfer
Reviews.Content: First of all, it's not like any other casino in Vegas. Yes it is a short 6 blocks from the strip. But the pool is fantastic even if i was 10 years older than the closest guest in age. i had a blast. The construction was a little loud. I easily rolled back over. I gambled at night and loved the dancers and the loud rock-n-roll. the poker room was not open yet but will be for my next trip. The room was great and the most comfortable bed I ever slept in that was not my own. Hotel cleaning staf was great when i asked for extra towels and to come back later to clean. Front desk was having a bad day I guess. I did not feel the love. dealers were friendly and willing to chat even though it was slow mid week. My biggest complaint was the cocktail service on the grave shift. Terrible. I watch one girl walk up and down the bar and never come over to me. This was at least an hour, maybe longer. I finally got a hold of a security guard to get me a drink. They were even peeved that the girl did not come over. When a cocktail waitress did, she said i was not in her section but would get me a drink after i told her the girl never came over. The casino is round. The girl never walked the circle. If you play after midnight order your drinks in two's. Other than the one cocktail issue, I loved the place.

Reviews.Title: “Rocks as usual!!!”
Reviews.Author: Justinssvc
Reviews.Content: Best place during the summer. Great food, great pool scene, fun gambling and the clubs are off the hook!!! Always travel to Vegas with buddies each summer, always stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hopelessly outdated”
Reviews.Author: kgro
Reviews.Content: First of all - the hotel is quite a distance from The Strip. It does not look glamorous and the drive in is rather unimpressive. There is no lobby per se - rather the playing floor with all the shops, cashier desk, registration desk etc. scattered around it. Music is very loud on the playing floor! 90-ies rock is played. There are long queues at the registration desk. The interior of the hotel is rock and roll stylized with quotes from songs written at random places. Rooms are old and tired. Bathrooms are a disaster. Standard rooms have a view on the backroad and construction sites. Pool rooms have better views, but the music from Rehab (the pool club type of thing) is extremely loud by the day time. The entire hotel is designed in the way to make you gamble, since there isn't much else to do there. Unless there are couple of rock'n roll buddies, who came to Vegas for a bit gambling, I wouldn't imagine why anybody would stay in this hotel. Basically we checked out the next day and moved to Wynn

Reviews.Title: “Early morning LOUD construction 5:30AM !”
Reviews.Author: BostonBigtrav
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here if you need sleep. They are adding a new wing right next to the current wing and begin construction every morning at 5:30AM sharp! Several loud backhoes and trucks driving around, beeping as they back up, slamming metal, ... you get the picture. It is impossible to sleep after 5:30 AM, and there are no rooms that are immune to the problem. Otherwise it is a fine hotel - but just use it to hold your clothes and shower. You will not get sleep due to the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Don't recommend it highly”
Reviews.Author: lovesports
Reviews.Content: A couple of problems at the Hard Rock. First, they are doing construction, so I asked for a room not affected by that. I received a poolside room. However, the night I arrived, there was a concert at the pool and I heard the whole thing in my room. If you want to go to sleep early on pool concert nights, forget it. Secondly, the hotel is surpisingly strict. You cannot re-enter the hotel from the pool with no shirt. I found this a strange rule for when you come from a pool. Also, they make a big deal about wearing wristbands at all times at the pool. They will not accept you just showing a room card. Other Vegas hotels don't have this rule. Also, the wristbands are very difficult to get off! I had to break it to remove it. Thr sports book is very small. And the TVs in the rooms are for some reason very difficult to use. Finding the right channel was a challenge. Finally, housekeeping walked into my room and announced as such after entering. The good news is the hotel is incredibly close to the airport. You can be there in 10 minutes easily. The nightclub, Body English, is posh.

Reviews.Title: “I'll wait until 2009 before I try again”
Reviews.Author: 4198SD
