Reviews.Content: Went with co-workers to the Hard Rock on Monday July 7th for a one night stay. I will think twice before I stay here again. This was my third time staying here and I am amazed at how run down it is looking. I was on the 9th floor and couldn't believe how dirty the carpet in the hallway was. When I got to my room the carpet was filthy and very worn. The doors that opened out to the pool would not shut properly and when the wind blew hard enough it would blow the doors open. This would not be a big deal if the air conditioner worked well. My room was hot through the night and didn't cool off until the morning. Worst bed I have ever slept on. If I had been staying more than one night this would have been an issue. On a positive note the bathroom was very clean. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone while the construction is going on. I was awakened at 3am to the clanging sound of steel. It is ridiculous that they are allowed to do construction all night long. I found the staff to be very friendly. At check-in they changed my room from a mountain view to a pool view without me asking. I checked in at 11am, headed out to the pool and my room was ready by 12:30pm. All dealers I spoke with were very nice. We ate at the Pink Taco and it was enjoyable. Some of my friends ate at the 24hr cafe after midnight and said the portions were huge and the food very good. I called two weeks ahead to reserve a pool Cabana. I was told I would be called back in a couple of hours. After not hearing from them for a week I had to initiate the call back. I was willing to accept this since the week of the 4th of July was coming up and I am sure they were swamped with phone calls. The Cabana was the way to go. Due to the construction the North pool did not open util 12:30. When it did open our Cabana was right next to the pool in a perfect spot. No extra tipping needed for this location (though that was implied when I made the reservation). The cost of the Cabana was a $500.00 food and drink fee (gratuity not included). Simply stated: we paid $500.00 and as we drank and ate it was deducted from that. I was with seven other guys and we went over the balance by $5.00 without needing to be concerned with how much we ate or drank. The cabana had two couches, plenty of towels, a television, a safe and a refrigerator. All in our group agreed it was a good thing to have. I would wait until after the construction is done before I stay here again. I was in Las Vegas two weeks before this trip and stayed at the Monte Carlo. Right next door to that hotel is a huge construction project (largest in vegas history I think) and they stopped at night. I'm hoping that after the new rooms are built at the Hard Rock they will give the original rooms some attention.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor- stay somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: KatieKatPDX
Reviews.Content: I spend about 6 weeks per year in Las Vegas for business. I've stayed at many different hotels from Hampton inn to Mirage to Bally's to the Palms. During past trips, I've visited the Hard Rock, and I've always wanted to stay there. So when the opportunity arose, I jumped on it. My 60-year old mother decided to make the trip with me, and we were both excited to stay there. I can't tell you how disappointed I've been with my experience with the Hard Rock Hotel. It began immediately upon entering. The front desk staff were incredibly cold, rude in fact. The clerk seemed annoyed to have to answer my one question (What room rate am I signing for?). They did not have our room ready when we arrived, thus, someone had to call me to inform me when the room was ready. This guy was incredibly snotty toward me. I was floored by the way I was treated. He talked down to me to the point where I was almost in tears. We sat at the casino bar. The waiter was rude there (saying he'd only comp our drinks if we were playing dollars... I've never heard of such a policy. What was worse was that we were playing dollars). We visited the 24-7 cafe. The host finally had to come wait on us when none of the waitresses had come to help us after 20 minutes. Our food arrived cold. I had to go to the hostess stand to get my check. The day we arrived (monday) when we finally were able to access our room, the music at the pool was so loud it rattled EVERYTHING in our room. I'd gotten up very early that morning and wanted a nap after a long day of work. Sadly, it was not to be. There is construction taking place here. I was awoken at 5AM today to the sound of airhorns, which continued every minute or two until I left at 8am. Half the pool is closed off, forcing all of the drunken teenagers who stay here into one side of the pool. There were literally NO chairs during the last two days of my stay, and the pool was basically standing room only. The clientele of the hotel is another thing... PLEASE NOTE- if you are over the age of 22 and mentally older than a 12 year old, you probably won't find this place interesting. I'm a fun-loving 31 year old and I feel very, very old at this place. Last night around 230am, I was awoken by a girl screaming "IM DRUNK" at the top of her lungs right down the hall. I've seen way more than my fair share of people stumbling through the casino, restaurants, and common areas of the hotel. I've been bumped into by a sloshed person more times than I can count. I will N E V E R stay here again as long as I live.

Reviews.Title: “No, I would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Brevic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock for a bachelorette party trip. We reserved adjoining rooms. We get up to our rooms and they are not adjoining. The front desk said to our faces that there were. We complained, then they said well there are no more rooms even next to each other. Nice, why did they lie to our faces? We look out the window of our room guess what the hotel is expanding there is construction going on, and its loud! Then the hotel alarm goes off its being tested for about 10 minutes. Thats great. The beds were nice and the rooms and shower were big enough. Nothing fancy, just minimal. The casino is tiny, which is why they are expanding. The party at the pool on Sunday is out of control. This is a definitely a party hotel, with lots of young people with their tops off and passed out in the hall way. This hotel is loud, if we didn't get the construction we would have got he pool view which is loud all day b because they play loud music at the pool. If you wouldn't like any of this then do not stay here. If you want to be loud and party all the time, then stay here. There are nice restaurants like Nobu, and Ago here, just take a taxi from a better hotel to have dinner, do not stay here. The people who work the front desk are slow and just act like they don't really care. There are some positives as well some service was nice, but the negative really out weighs the few positives at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return to the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: firebird_mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock for four nights in June 2008. My husband and I were in Vegas for a trade show/conference for his work and the choice of hotel was not ours. A company that his does business with chose it and booked a large block of rooms. My husband and I would like to return to Vegas for a non-work related trip sometime, when we do, we will not be staying at the Hard Rock. The biggest issue while we were there was the construction. They began at exactly 6am, so no sleeping in. The vending and ice machine on our floor did not work the whole trip, we notified staff a couple times, but nothing was done. Housekeeping barged into our room once without even knocking (we had allowed a coworker to put her luggage in our room for a few hours while they got her room ready, the maid saw someone with luggage leave the room, assumed someone checked out and just walked right in). I also did not like stay off the strip. This may not be an issue for some, but we ended up making 3 trips to the strip per day in cabs @ $20 round trip. So about $60 per day in cab fare. Finally, the pool was a bit intimidating for an over 30. I'm 31 and in fairly good shape, but not quite up to the Hard Rock scene. They also would not allow me to bring a water bottle (that I purchased at the hotel) out to the pool. I cannot sit in 110 degree heat in the sun without access to water, especially when already a bit dehydrated from the night before. So I didn't really spend much time at the pool. We did not eat in any restaurants but I had room service twice for lunch and the service and food was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for about 10 minutes”
Reviews.Author: Lupush
Reviews.Content: Prior to my arrival, I was excited to stay at the Hard Rock. That feeling of excitement turned to frustration as soon as I walked through the doors. Front desk staff was surly at best. I found the room to be a bit small by Vegas standards. The decor in the room, casino, and common areas is tired and outdated. Basically its the same exact things you'd find at the Hard Rock Cafe in NYC. The pool is cool looking, but the drunks just kill it. This place is filled with young 20 somethings that dont understand that people dont go to Vegas for a frat party. Beer cans floating in the pool, belligerent drunken guys and sloppy drunken girls rule at this pool scene. Ate at AJ's Steakhouse one night, found it to be quite average as compared to some of the other steakhouses in Vegas. The food at Lucky's is decent for a 24 hour joint, ate there most meals actually. All in all, the Hard Rock is a cool concept, poorly executed. They need to market this place to a more suitable Vegas crowd ie: young professionals as opposed to college kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not Cool, not even close!”
Reviews.Author: Jupitersmoon
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Hard Rock when it first opened many years ago, and found everything to be just peachy. Although I was way too young to gamble at the time, I still had a blast. Fast forward a few years and man, things have changed! At check in on Sunday night I explained to the clerk that I was in town for seminars and all I was interested in was a quiet room, away from the party activites and that I couldn't care less about a view. I get to the room and on both sides of my room there are at least half a dozen kids drinking, smoking etc. on the balconies with the music booming. So I call down to the desk and ask the clerk if he's trying to be funny... 'cause I'm not laughing. Those kids are just trying to have a good time - and good for them. I on the other hand belong someplace else. So the clerk offers me another room and I of course take it. The second room is off in the corner, which fine with me. The problem was that there were no pillows, linnens, and most of the furniture (lamps, charis etc.) was missing. So again, I call down to the desk and complain. I am again offered another room, so again I move. The third room has furniture and linnens, no view, but is quiet. I am happy. That is until I go into the bathroom to find the sink is filled with what appears to be puke... no matter what is was, it was discusting! Again, I call down to the desk... But now I'm just frustrated. I tell the clerk to just send someone up to clean it, in the meantime I need to go back to the second room to retreive a jacket I left behind in the move. I end up spending another 45 min waiting for security to esscort me to the seond room, where I left my jacket. Guess what - no jacket. And it was a super cool jacket! I go back to my room (the third room) grab my swimsuit and head down to the spa. All I want at this point is to chill out and luckily the spa was open till 10pm. By Las Vegas standards the spa is pathetic. Your local 24hour fitness offers more amenities. And i can't for the life of me figure out what the draw is for the pool. It looks just like the pool at Hooters. With pool complexes like Red Rock, Flamingo, Mandalay Bay, and even the Golden Nugget in town, I can't fathom paying up a cover charge for what amounts to really nothing special. I get back to my room at about 9:30pm and the maintence guy is still working away. So I decided to head down to the lobby for something eat. The Pink Taco is nothing more than an overpriced Taco Bell. Seriously. So back up to my room I go... The maintenece guy is just leaving. He's very nice and appologetic . I order some ice cream from room service and call it a night. Although it takes an hour, it's cold, solid and sweet. The next morning I had a long conversation with the manager who did end up comping the entire stay and even offered a second a complementary stay for a later date. But I checked out that morning and made it clear that I wouldn't stay at the Hard Rock again, even if he paid me. (I moved to THEhotel where things ran smoothly) I spend almost a month every year in Vegas hotels. Most hotels with a three star or higher ranking are just fine, especailly for a twentysomething. But not the Hard Rock. The bottom line is this - the Hard Rock attracts kids who are desperately trying to be cooler than they could ever hope to be. There is nothing "edgy" about this place at all. Even the memorabilia is dated... who caes about Axcel Rose and the Bare Naked Ladies anymore?!? The casino is tiny. The rooms are okay, but nothing special when compared with similar hotels. The desk staff and security are rude at best. The place is all about hype, not substance. And since it is now under construction, I suggest you do yourself a favor and stay someplace else. However, The Joint is in fact an okay music venue. Sadly, one of the best in town for relevant acts.

Reviews.Title: “30 is over the hill ....I guess”
Reviews.Author: rmhayward
Reviews.Content: Outside of some construction and over bearing (young) partiers the Hard Rock was a comfortable stay. The view of the pool and other hotels was breathtaking in the evening. The service was excellent. Rooms were clean. The food was excellent through room service, but the hotel was lacking a nice restaurant. This hotel does cater to a younger crowd although what should you expect from the Hard Rock. If you are going to party...Go to the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Good times..Hard Rock is the place 2 B.. (NYC, NY)”
Reviews.Author: NYC23
Reviews.Content: Three of my girlfriends and myself stayed at the hardrock during Memorial Day weekend.. If you want to party and your late 20's/30's this is the place to be.. We had a sick time at Rehab on Sunday..but be aware you have to stand in line at 7am for admission to the pool.. and if you don't stay at the hardrock you have to stand in a public line (so uncool).. The overall scene is a great and everybody is out to have a good time.. Only complaint is that we booked a room with 2 queen beds and got a room with a king and a cot (They comped us a night)?!? but whatever.. it's memorial day weekend in Vegas.. who sleeps anyway??

Reviews.Title: “Too old for the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: ousax
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I traveled to Las Vegas to see Duran Duran perform 2 nights at the Hard Rock Hotel May 9 and 10th. We were very disappointed in the hotel. Here are the reasons: The construction started at 6am and was very loud. We couldn't be moved to another room. However the hotel did comp us for the 1st night. It was the cheapest night of our stay. Nice gesture, but hardly worth it. Thankfully our room was a mountain veiw because the pool side would have been horrible with the music playing all day long. One of our friends had a poolside room and you couldn't get comfortable in your room because of the noise. The music started at 9am on Sunday morning and progressively got louder and louder. We like music, but there comes a point when it is too much. Closing the balcony door did even come close to drowning out the noise. The hotel is great for the newly 21 and not great for anyone over the age of 25. Kids who can't hold their liquor were all over the place and you had to step over them and dodge the crazy arms. But if you want cheap gambling, then this is the place. $5, $10 tables all over the place and there are even penny megabuck slots. The ventilation in this hotel is horrible and you smell like an ashtray 5 miuntes after walking into the hotel. I bascially felt dirty in this place and will never stay there again. Nothing about the hotel was good. It is turning into a run down facility that caters to the kids with little money.

Reviews.Title: “Good times at the Hard Rock!!!”
Reviews.Author: jay379
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock for 4 nights back in March 2008. My girlfriend and I had a blast!!! The pool is probably the best highlight of the hotel. Great scene for chilling out and throwing some cocktails back. Not a place for kids, if you have kids go elsewhere. I found the room we had to be pretty neat. Big comfy beds, tons of pillows, a flat screen plasma TV and a great high powered shower. We had a few late night eats at Mr. Lucky's which has some great food and killer milkshakes!!! A few drawback is the renovation currently in place. We actually had a room that pointed out towards the construction site, but I didn't hear too much noise like other reviewers. One day I was walking by the starbucks down stairs and a big chunk of roof fell on the floor. A few minutes later I saw one of the manager's on his walkie talkie cursing someone out about it. So the new renovation could cause some inconveniences. Played blackjack one night and I found the dealer to be extremely rude. With the exception of the renovation and blackjack dealer, I really liked the Hard Rock. Will stay again, but will wait until after the renovation is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place, rough crowd”
Reviews.Author: JetSetRsSLC
Reviews.Content: First off: I wouldn't ever take children to this hotel/casino. The price was right, the music, rock memorabilia and Italain restaurant were good and it was a smaller hotel so it was easy to navigate. BUt the pool was half closed and litter was everywhere around it, and the construction noise really did start very early, like other reviews stated. Biggest issue we had was the really rough-acting young crowd- the atmoshpere at the pool was actually intimidating and the numbers of screaming drunken young people were staggering. Literally staggering- as in nearly falling down, unable to operate elevators, cursing out restaurant staff and being kicked out- the crowd was the real downfall of this hotel/casino. We stayed one night instead of three - we moved to the Flamingo for the last two nights- and had an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel for Nightlife!!”
Reviews.Author: Kinderteacher4
Reviews.Content: This is a really fun Vegs hotel. It has a great nightlife. It has a good night club and restaurant. The hotel was modern and clean. The bar is in the center of the casino which is nice to hang out in. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino, Great Pool, OK rooms”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeJamey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Las Vegas several times. We always ended up spending a lot of time at the Hard Rock gambling because the music, center bar, Lucky's 24/7 restaurant, and Pink Taco restaurant are awesome! This time, we decided to stay there. I wish I could pair a The Hotel at Mandalay Bay room with the Hard Rock pool and casino and you would have a perfect hotel! PROS: The casino is the best in Las Vegas. It is not huge, the bar is great, and the dealers are friendly. The music is awesome! The pool is fantastic, on Sundays they have a party and are currently filming a reality show called Rehab there. Swimup blackjack and a lazy river in the pool complex. There is a nice big flatscreen TV in the rooms and the bed is comfortable. Room service is timely and the servings are generous. Pool room views have a view of the pool complex and the strip. Restaurants are great, Body English cool too. CONS: I did experience problems at check-in, I arrived before my husband and they would not let me in the room, b/c the room had been reserved in my husband's name (even though I had the credit card and all the info). I had to wait 6 hours for my husband's flight to arrive and mgmt did not offer me anything for my inconvenience Lots of construction now, but there appears to be construction everywhere in Vegas. Bathrooms are nothing special, just like you would find at a Hampton Inn. Our bathroom (RM 906) had a slow drain in the bathtub that was never fixed despite informing the housekeeper. Request extra pillows as the feather pillows do flatten quickly. You are near the airport, so be ready to hear some airplanes taking off and landing. We will probably stay here again, but request a room with a bigger bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great crowd but warning jack hammers starts at 8:00 a.m.”
Reviews.Author: greatjourney
Reviews.Content: I stayed April 6-8, 2008. Beautiful younger crowd, great resteraunts, nice rooms but I would not stay again until the construction is over. We chose this hotel for the pool and were dissapointed because we were not notified the pool was under construction and only partially open. Beds were comfortable but the jack hammers started at 8:00 a.m. and were ridiculously loud. The construction crew messed up the cable so we could not watch the beautiful flat screen TV in our room. Spa would have been nice had there not been a male technian changing the locks in the ladies locker room. Staff was not empathetic or apologetic. It would have been nice to have been warned about the guy in the ladies locker room before they took my money. I received no warning or apology about anything. My advise is before you stay here check to make sure there is no construction. If friendly staff and great service is the most important thing - go elsewhere. If you want to mix with a young beautiful crowd & hear great music this may be your spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: tinamagill
Reviews.Content: Pros: Price was very good! Food at Pink taco was great and large portions. Food at the 24/7 was comparable to a good Nj diner and prices were reasonable. Hotel room was very nice and the bed is the most comfortable ever! The POOL is AWESOME!!! The spot to be! Body English on Sunday night was the best club in Vegas! Cons: $7 for a bottle of water. And if you buy the hard rock water in the gift shop, you can't bring it by the pool which makes no sense. Go to the CVS nearby and pick up a few bottles. Food by the pool was outrageously priced. Eat inside. Aboout a $10 cab ride from the strip. Renovation/construction leaves a not so nice mountainside view, but should be nice when complete.

Reviews.Title: “What is with all the Hookers?”
Reviews.Author: Terrier32
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nites and was really appalled at the number of hookers. They are very forward with their approach to the hotel guests. The circle bar in the center of the casino was almost all hookers after midnight. The pool was under serious renovation and only half open. The other side of the hotel had a ton of heavy construction going on which was bothersome in the room. I was able to get my room changed fortunately. The rooms are showing their age especially the carpets. The pool area that was open was fun for a while and full of mostly 20 somethings. As the day went on the pool crowd went from fun to drunk and obnoxious. I think next time I will try another hotel. Seeing all the hookers really was a little depressing and I am a single guy!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock ROCKED!!!”
Reviews.Author: calgal81
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Hard Rock for two nights. Sunday March 16th and Monday March 17th. We went to view some things for our wedding out there in June. Since we went Sunday & Monday the room rate was onle ninety-nine a night. We checked in around 4:30 p.m. and after a rude customer interupted our check in, we got upgraded to a suite. The front desk was extremely polite and it took us less than 10 minutes to get checked in. The room was awesome!! We had a living area with a bar and both rooms had french doors, instead of windows, that opened up with a great view of the pool and a decent one of the hotels on the strip. We ate at the Hard Rock Cafe the first night. However I didn't care for their cajun chicken pasta that I ordered. I sent it back because all it tasted like was bell peppers. We also ate at the 24hour cafe they have called "Mr Lucky's" . Food was great, service was fast and the prices were reasonable. The atmosphere in the casino was right on. I love the fact that they have the music playing 24/7. It gives the place a good vibe. There was construction going on during our stay and our room was at the end right next to where it was going on. I did get woken up once but that was it. Other than that it wasn't a big deal. Parking wasn't too bad, since the construction is going on the driveway from the main entrance to the parking structure is inaccessible. You just have to enter on Paradise instead of Harmon which is no big deal. Any complaints about that and your just an impossible person who needs to get a life. All in all our trip was great and we'll defintely stay at The Hard Rock again.

Reviews.Title: “Where did all the cool beautiful people go?”
Reviews.Author: JaneEMorgan
Reviews.Content: I have been a devoted fan of the HRH for more than ten years, but have only stayed there once in the past five years since I had a baby. In its glory day (and even the last time I was there), the HRH was a destination for young and attractive gamblers and partyers. Not anymore! The scene was filled with low end tourists wearing flip flops and clothing not fit to be seen outside the house. Plus the ventilation system was not doing its job of getting rid of the cigarette smoke which permeated the casino. Our room had not changed since ten years ago. The carpet had multiple stains, and, remarkably, the pillow cases (nice quality) had little holes in them! We were appalled. One ring on the shower curtain hung off its hook when we arrived, and remained that way after housekeeping came through a second time. I had to fix it myself. The good news is that all these rooms will be renovated by 2010 and they should be pretty impressive, but the bad news is that it's not a good place to stay until then. I can't believe I'm saying this but I hope the prices go up to keep the rif raf out. The restaurants (Nobu, Pink Taco, and Mr. Lucky's) were still excellent and a great value. Also, the gambling there was still fun, and $5 blackjack tables could still be found on a Sat. morning. At night, the minimum bet is $10.

Reviews.Title: “Rock & Roll fun just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: bubbafb
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel & Casino is located about a ½ mile or so from the Strip on Paradise Road & Harmon Avenue. We stayed here on business due to the low price ($69 per night) as compared to similar resorts on the strip. Note: there is a lot of construction going on at the outside of the property and it is difficult to come and go by car. Also, the banging starts pretty early (7am). As you can imagine, the entire property is rock & roll based. As you come in through the main entrance, there is a walkway that surrounds the center casino. To the left is the registration; small with only a few check-in stations but this place is about 20% of the size of the larger strip resorts so there was very little wait. The rooms follow the rock & roll theme with classic rock star pictures on the wall. There is an HD TV in the wall, a refrigerator, a small desk, a chaise style lounge chair and a Bose radio. The bed was comfortable and everything was clean. The bathroom was a bit small and felt cramped. Our first room had a non-functioning TV and maintenance was there right away and got us a new room when they could not fix it. Both rooms were facing Paradise Road and the noise from the construction was audible. If you can, get a room on the pool side until the construction is complete. There is a sharp contrast to the restaurants: 2 are casual (Pink Taco – cool atmosphere, so-so Mexican food; Mr. Lucky’s 24/7 – excellent breakfast) to 3 really expensive trendy places (Nobu, Ago & AJ’s were too pricey for us). The club was closed during the week and there was only one non-restaurant bar in the casino. The casino is definitely one of the more fun places to gamble with the rock music blasting. The dealers are great and the bartenders were the best with the comps while playing at the bar. As a matter of fact, all the service personnel were top notch. The pool was closed in early March but looks like a fun place to hang out. This does not rival the larger, strip resorts like Mandalay or Venetian in terms of entertainment and posh, but if you are looking for an inexpensive, fun atmosphere, this is a cool place to stay. Deserves about 3 1/2 stars but needs to get through the construction.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the $$$$”
Reviews.Author: Collie23
Reviews.Content: This is probably my 10th stay at HRC. I don't know why I keep going back . Maybe because it is a smaller hotel and it only has 11 floors. The patio doors open so it's not so confining. Also, the casino is nice with friendly dealers/ wait staff and great music. The bell staff is great - Mark, etc. Mr. Luckys is good with friendly staff and good food. Other than that, the front desk staff is useless. They charged my credit card twice for the deposit and then told me that I booked 2 rooms. And, I didn't give the 72 hours cancellation notice. I think I finally will get credit with help from a travel agent. The rooms need work. They are very basic and getting old. When we checked in, they didn't have any king size beds available so they gave us a suite. They told us we would have to move the next day. (Very convenient). You think since they screwed up they would eat the cost difference! The suite was nice but definitely not worth money. The toilet didn't even work. So, I was actually glad to change rooms. The players card comps are a joke. I think my husband and I have spent a lot of money gambling there in the past 5 years and still only get a free breakfast!! The cost of the rooms is ridiculous. We could stay at the best suite at Venetian for the same price. They are adding on and it will probably be a very large hotel when they are finished. Maybe that's when I will stop going there!

Reviews.Title: “didn't honor a "guaranteed room" for superbowl weekend”
Reviews.Author: cincinnatigirl0
Reviews.Content: We booked a large suite at least a month or two ago and was told we could fit up to 26 people in it while they were trying to sell it to us, my husband planned a superbowl get together with an important client and employees, a week before they called and said there was a computer "gliche" they offered us a meeting room with cafeteria chairs as a substitution which is ridiculous, I believe some who's who wanted the large suite for the superbowl and we got bumped, mind you this room was guaranateed. They had terrible customer service and were not able to resolve this fairly so we at the last minute have to go somewhere else, we were spending thousands of dollars with bumping up the tv size as well imagine how bad they could treat someone spending only a hundred or two.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Faces Tough Competition”
Reviews.Author: Vikingstad
Reviews.Content: As someone who travels to Las Vegas about six times a year on business, I am well-acquainted with many of the higher end hotels in the city. The Hotel at Mandalay Bay used to be a favorite before the Wynn opened up, and next month I'll be staying at the brand new Palazzo at the Venetian. In January of 2008, however, I found myself on a personal trip to meet my family. Not wanting to break the bank on "my dime," I chose the Hard Rock. Five years ago, this was THE place to stay if you were visiting LV on a business trip and were between the ages of 21 and 35. The rooms were decent, but the restaurants and pool scene were great. The casino was small and kind of cozy--a rarity for Las Vegas. Well times have changed a lot over the past five years in Las Vegas, but the Hard Rock has stayed about the same. And it is finding itself facing stiff competition. The new tower that is under construction will probably be terrific, but in the meantime, here's some things to know. The room is okay. Some adjustments have been made, including a nice big flat-screen TV, but the newer hotels are so much nicer. Despite a carpet that needed to be cleaned or replaced, the room was clean and serviced well. The bedding was very comfortable. The bathroom was small but clean. There's no turn-down service here as there is in the nicer hotels, nor is there delivery of a morning newspaper. Mini-bar seemed nicely stocked, and the bathroom amenities were okay. Internet is $12.99/day. I didn't use the gym or spa this trip, but as I recall both are acceptable. I've actually had decent massages at the spa in the past. What's not acceptable is the $20 a day you're charged to run on a treadmill for a half hour. While that's not unusual for Vegas, you don't get access to a grand spa like the one at Madalay Bay. The spa here is small. Restaurants are great at the Hard Rock--from Starbucks and Mr. Lucky's (upscale diner) to Nobu (famous sushi) and Pink Taco (Mexican). I've never been to AJ's Steakhouse, but have heard good things. A new Italian restaurant has opened where Simon used to be. The casino is small, but has a fun vibe. If you're a serious gambler, there may not be enough options for you. I actually prefer to play blackjack there. I like the intimacy of the room. Here's my gripe. All guests are charged a daily $7.00 (plus tax) "resort fee." This is not disclosed to you when a reservation is made. You are made aware of this charge at check-in. What this includes is criminal: free local phone calls and a shuttle to take you to the Strip. How ridiculous. In this age of cell phones, no one needs to use a hotel room phone, and you expect a hotel that is off of the famous Las Vegas Strip to provide transportation to it. It does not include access to the fitness center or free wireless. The charge is nothing but an attempt to nickel and dime guests. Why not simply quote a rate that is $7.00 higher? I threw a fit upon check-out and had the charges removed, but HRH should lose this deceptive charge from its business model. In short, you could do a lot worse than to stay at the Hard Rock. But you can also stay at hotels that are a lot nicer and are beginning to understand the value of good service and repeat business. Don't let the location dissuade you from staying at HRH. If you can get a decent rate and don't expect a lot of luxury, you probably won't be too disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “good place to party”
Reviews.Author: MichaelRinck
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hard Rock a bunch of times since college and have always had a good time. It's a few blocks off the strip and has a pretty young crowd. My wife and I stayed here because we decided to meet up with some family at the last minute and their hotel was booked and the Hard Rock had some pretty good rates over the weekend. The room has added a 42 inch plasma tv but for the most part it's pretty much the same hotel it's been for the past decade, with the multiple stains on the carpet as evidence. It's a party hotel and it's obvious that people treat it as such. I had some trouble sleeping because every few minutes this weird banging sound reverberated from the walls like someone was banging on the ceiling. Turns out the toilets have the strongest and loudest flushes on the planet because it sounded like we could hear every flush in the entire hotel. Strange phenomenon indeed. Also, the shower kept going off for no reason. Doesn't seem like the hotel is kept up very well. The bed was comfortable and we had a nice strip/pool view from the top floor. The pool is drained for the winter but for some reason we were still charged the $7/night resort fee. Luckily we got a great rate and it didn't matter all that much. But it still felt kinda odd. I'm trying not to slam the hotel all that much because it was always my favorite hotel but it seems like it's seen better days. Maybe I've grown up a bit and want more from a hotel. This kind of place is great if you're going with a bunch of guys/girls and want a great party hotel but maybe it's not the type of place I'll be going to in the future with my wife. We still had a good time but overall it could've been, and has been, a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest hotel”
Reviews.Author: can_can1130
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock is a nice hotel, but is overrated.I loved the restaurants they have to offer, which all offer meals at decent prices, but the rooms are not as nice as I would expect from one of the higher-end type of hotels.The carpets are full of stains, however the rooms are clean and the same goes for the bathrooms. The staff is not that joyful to be around and don't seem to keen on helping out their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Party Hotel”
Reviews.Author: detailz0
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past July for two days for my friend's bachelor party. The right hotel for this type of group of people! Amazing pool, gambling was ok, not a huge or lavish floor but nice. Didn't really eat there since we were always going to the strip and elsewhere... Cymbals made out of records for wall sconces to light the hallways not a good idea for people trying to sleep... But I didn't really plan on sleeping in Vegas. Nice hotel, wasn't too expensive, but not on the strip... It was a party hotel definitely. If thats what you're not looking for, stay somewhere else. All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is tired...”
Reviews.Author: pugnut
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock was recently refurbished yet it has a way to go. The casino is smalllish but fine, rock music and memorabilia liven it up a bit. The room was adequate for the price-small dated bathroom though. Plasma t.v. is a nice touch and the bed was comfy with decent sheets (we hate scratchy sheets!). The location isn't the greatest and we were a bit put off by being required to sign an agreement upon check-in that if we didn't check out on-time there would be a $100 per hour charge. We understand that there must be a need for this but it just didn't seem very customer friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock--pretty sweet place”
Reviews.Author: nitalp429
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock hotel this past weekend and it was a really nice hotel. Everything was exceptionally clean, and the housekeeping staff did a fabulous job. The hotel atmosphere was great---quiet around the room areas and a gigantic party at night around the casino, restaurants, and club. I definitely recommend this hotel. it's not very far from the strip at all, probably about a $7 cab ride away from the strip. the casino was cool because it wasn't super crowded until later on in the evening. the only bad thing about this hotel is that i think it's made for short people! I'm about 5'4" and the showerhead was just high enough for me to use, but no one taller than me! and i found the beds were a little small (my feet could almost hang off). so if you're a big guy, i would try to request maybe a king bed type room (if available). otherwise, very fun place! I'd def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “oh dear”
Reviews.Author: nailgal
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here for our 7th aniversary. If you are looking to PARTY hard stay here. You will feel like you are living a movie stars life here, party night and day. If you want to be able to relaxe stay some where else. I would say if you are turning 21 and going to vages with friends stay here you wont forget it.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay with a filthy room”
Reviews.Author: kujhawk
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock was the last of the "energetic" Vegas properties I had not stayed at before. I've been told by friends what a great place this is...great food...great crowd...great ambience. I guess it was like seeing a blockbuster movie that all the critics raved about...you have to come away disappointed. That was my stay. The good...the ambience was very cool...the whole rock-n-roll thing? I get it. And appropriately so, it's 90% rock...with zero rap or hip-hop that I could see. Thank god. The casino was fine other than the two morons at my blackjack table who insisted on sharing their knowledge of all things with everyone else. Seeing as how they kept losing green and black chips left and right, I guess that knowledge stayed back home in Podunk. Ate at Pink Taco, decent Mexican fare...now to the room. WOW. Ever hear of steam-cleaning and carpet shampoo...or are you just content with a carpet that looks like poo. I refused to take my shoes off unless I was getting into the lumpy uneven mattress to go to sleep. The volume on the TV had a mind of its own and would go from a comfortable level to ear-blasting all of its own volition. Like all rooms, mine opened with a double-door t the outside world. That was nice. But I was on the 3rd floor on the pool side. Just about the worst possible view of the pool area you can imagine. One major positive...this property is not a massive city unto itself like some casinos have become. It was easy to get from one end to the other, out to the pool, out to the parking lot, etc. Next review? Four Seasons Las Vegas next week...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Love the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: KareninRedding
Reviews.Content: My husbsand and I are in our late 50's. We absolutely loved our stay at the Hard Rock and can't wait to go back. Our suite was lovely and the view of the pool was beautiful. We enjoyed the energy of the daily music at the pool. Every one of the staff members we came into contact was very friendly and accomodating. The massages at the spa are the best we have had and worth every penny. We visited a lot of the larger casinos which we enjoyed very much, but we were always happy to get back to the Hard Rock. The Pink Taco has terrific Mexican food and the service was superb. Thank you to all of you who made our vacation so special. Dell & Karen Redding, California

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: julie_chicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock for the first time from a Monday through Wednesday. Great time to stay here, not as crazy but still really fun. I found it nice to not be at a huge casino/hotel, it was so easy to get to the pool and not have to walk 2 miles. Room was good enough, probably could be updated a bit. We got a pool cabana for both days, loved it! Great service, misters to keep you cool, and super music all throughout the place. Nobu is always a hit, and used the really nice gym and spa as well.

Reviews.Title: “fab pool”
Reviews.Author: miztraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a couple of weeks ago - unfortunately just for one night as we had just flown into Vegas before travelling East. The room was huge with two king size beds - V. comfy. The bathroom was well lit, and had the biggest shower head I have ever seen - the size of a dinner plate!!! We stayed with our two children and they loved the pool - mostly shallow with beach areas - great fun. Although its not on the strip - its a good 20-30 minute walk, or a $10 taxi ride I would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A few problems”
Reviews.Author: FionaJM
Reviews.Content: Our room was comfortable and quiet with good water pressure for showering (ALWAYS a requirement for us). Being such a 'compact' casino you dont get lost walking around which we found good. Easy access to the airport. It is not a bad place to stay we simply had alot of problems being able to connect and then stay online. They tried to fix it but a maintenance man really isn't a computer geek !!!! We were there for a convention and friends said their connnections worked perfectly but our room was simply in some sort of 'hole' (room 1034). We ate at Nobu .. wouldn't rave about it, food was ok but not worth all the 'hype' for us. The 24 hour restaurant Mr Luckys has great salads which we enjoyed more.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: jackiexxx1
Reviews.Content: After seeing this hotel showcased on TV and in movies, I was expecting a lot more than we actually got. Being off the strip, I thought our room would have a nice view of it at night. Instead, we overlooked a construction site. The pool area, which tried to create a beach atmosphere, ending up just being grimy and dirty, with too much sand in the water (not to mention empty glasses and cigarette butts). The casino was unique and fun for a night or two, but not enough to keep us from going out to the strip multiple times looking for more fun. The cab rides really added up. The room itself was just average, as was housekeeping. We would not return to the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Casino and What a Pool”
Reviews.Author: kryszkuk
Reviews.Content: Took a short vacation and decided to go back to Vegas. Got a really good deal for the Hard Rock ($69 a night) and I booked it on Orbitz. When I checked in I found out there is a $150 a nite security deposite, $12 a day for internet, and a $7 a day resort fee. The only other issue I had with the Hard Rock was the $18 Margaritas that were not that big or even that good. The rooms are very nice and the pool is fantastic. You could walk to the strip in about ten minutes and there is a great burger place across the street called the Rainbow Bar and Grill. Overall if the price is right I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Most degrading, humilating treatment at any hotel, ever.”
Reviews.Author: RockMusician
Reviews.Content: I very recently stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Las Vegas. Upon checking in, I was told by the woman at the front desk that she noticed that there was a $25 credit associated with my room, to be used for room service, mini bar, movies, she explained. Cool, I thought. The next morning I ordered a modest breakfast from room service and logged onto the internet service, which has a hook-up charge for every 24 hours of access (I would have skipped the internet, but had business to attend to online). Upon checking out the next day, I was told there was in fact no credit associated with my room and that I would have to pay for these charges. I asked to speak to the supervisor. I repeated to him I would have gone to a cafe or a diner for a cheaper breakfast had I known there was in fact no credit. He quoted an email written by the woman who checked me in the night before that I had requested the credit. I had done no such thing, except to ask for a quiet room. Why did she write the email in the 14 hours I stayed at the hotel? To cover her back? They insisted that I pay and put the charges on the credit card account I'd left with them for incidentals. I asked the manager if he thought I was lying, because I was being made to feel that way. The 40-odd dollars felt like $4000 for how emotionally expensive the experience was. Never in all my travels all over the world, from 5-star to 1-star hotels have I ever been treated so poorly. The experience was degrading, humiliating. I never want to set foot in another Hard Rock establishment again. The irony of it all is, I'm a professional rock musician. The Hard Rock Hotel needs staff that understands hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “excellent midweek value!”
Reviews.Author: mmvend2002
Reviews.Content: We just keep going back for more! Granted my husband and I are decades older than the average guest, but this is our hands down favorite. The staff is so friendly, we love the views, location, but mostly the music. Always happy with the room. We see there are additions in the works, it will be interesting to see how they handle the construction. It won't stop us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vibe!”
Reviews.Author: scottca075
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel in Las Vegas is one of my favorite places to stay in Vegas when I want to get away and relax. The pool area is one of the best in Vegas. Not only is it a great place to relax it is about the best place to people watch! The rooms are very comfortable and functional and very quiet and dark when you pull the blinds closed. There is also a great vibe in the casino. The one big draw back here is the location and how hard it is to get a cab there on the weekends. It is a great place to stay if you are there for a function at the convention center and it is also very convenient for the great restaurants in the Paradise and Flemingo area,

Reviews.Title: “Just what I expected for a Vegas hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelPrincess3
Reviews.Content: It was just two young twenties girlfriends staying at the Hard Rock for my first time in Vegas and had an awesome time!! Although the casino was a bit smaller than I expected, the bar was great!! Unfortunately, for our stay there was a private party out on the pool so we were not allowed to go out. But the rooms were incredible and the circle bar was the perfect place to meet new people!!

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jenwest1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were extremely thrilled to be taking a trip to Las Vegas and as a music lover I was ecstatic to be staying at the Hard Rock. First off our room was not ready for our 3:00 check in time but they did watch our luggage so that we could enjoy the pool. While at the pool we ordered four drinks (three light beers and one vodka lemonade) the total was $38.00. Come on, I could buy two cases of beer for that. When we were finally able to get into our room I was pleased with how big it was and the cool Jimmy Hendrix pictures on the wall. We all decided to check out the Vegas Strip later that night so we took a $20.00 cab ride (no one informed us of the free shuttle!) to The Strip and when we returned we noticed that our friend's room door was open. It turns out that someone had entered their room and robbed them of all the money that was in the room. After the security finally arrived (they were very nice) we were told that they would look into the matter (the room next door was robbed as well) and it would be top priority. We never once heard back from them, we called every day that we were there to find out the status, the women was rude and told us that she had 'bigger issues to attend to'. Not one person said that they were sorry that this had happened. I have never been treated so poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tommyboysf
Reviews.Content: We stayed Thursday through Sunday and had a pool view room on the 7th floor. The room we requested was ready when we checked in at 4:00pm. Overall we had a great time. This is my first time staying here (but have visited during previous visits to Vegas) and what I like best is the festive attitude and everyone is really friendly and up for a good time. Another big plus is the relative small size of the hotel and casino (like other reviewers have commented, it's nice to be able to navigate the hotel without a map). The room was clean and comfortable. We asked for extra towels and they gave us six. All of the staff was very accomodating. We had room service once. It was very prompt and relatively affordable but the portions were HUGE. I could have eaten three meals from one appetizer and entree - I felt guilty throwing so much away. Overall I would say the quality was good but not great. Nobu is in my top five restaurants of all time. If you like Japanese food I can't recommend it highly enough. I also like the Pink Taco but mostly for the vibe and drinks - the food is good but not great. Here is my feedback on some comments from other reviews: I had no issues with noise from the hallway or noise in general. Although technically outside beverages and food are prohibited, we, along with other people I saw, brought these into the hotel without issue. There were glasses and an ice bucket in my room. I thought the water from the faucet had a slight off taste so I went for bottled water which is expensive (until I went across the street and bought my own). The shower water pressure is pretty good but the shower head is a little low for my 6'1" size. This isn't a negative as few shower heads are high enough. The plasma tv is nice and the picture quality was very good. There are a majority of young and fit people at this hotel. However, it's not like the pool is full of models. I saw young and old, skinny and fat, singles and people with children and no one seemed to care one way or another. I had no issues with security and nothing in my room seemed to be disturbed. If you turn the tv on (but don't turn the channel), it plays the same music that plays in the hotel and the pool. It has been a little over a year since I have been to Vegas and I'd have to say that the biggest dissapointment is the attitude of the dealers in the casinos. We visited a number of casinos and found this to be the case everywhere. I'd say the Hard Rock is better than most but it's still worse than the last time I was here (and I had the same thought after my previous visit).

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, great atmosphere, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter002
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HR May 15-18 with a group of five girls. We were concerned about the $50 per person charge, but we just told them we only had two people in the room. Later, we called guest services and got a rollaway bed. We were only charged for the rollaway ($25 per day) and not for the extra people. The service was great the whole time we were there. We called several times for extra towels and they were brought up immediately. The entire experience was really great. The pool is wonderful and we were able to find chairs at 10 a.m. on each day except it got very busy on Friday. I'm sure that is how it is on weekends. The casino is a smaller scale than those on the strip, which I preferred. We went to the Rock Spa on our last morning, and that was a really relaxing way to end the trip. I recommend eating at Nobu if you like Japanese food -- we had a great meal there. Body English was only open one night while we were there and they closed too early (3 a.m.) for us to make it there. I'd definitely stay there again next time. The only drawback was the distance to the strip, but cabs are always available and only cost about $8 to other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Corruption in clubbing”
Reviews.Author: Nixxrite
Reviews.Content: A group of eight of us went to Body English at the Hard Rock on Sunday night. Now I'm from England so queuing is a national pastime. We were told to get into the queue at about 9:30ish or roughly once we see people joining so that’s what we did. Now it would help if somebody had explained to us that there are three or four different groups of people allowed entry before anyone in the queue; in fact it turned out that it wasn’t really a queue but a gathering of people waiting to be allowed entry. After about one hour and thirty minutes and witnessing several bungs to the doorman I asked how long it would take us to get in. I was asked how many of us there were and told the doorman there was eight guys; he pretty much went on to say that we didn’t stand much chance because his job was to see an even distribution of women to men but if we could muster a little something together he might be able to see his way into sneaking us in. Now I have to ask the question if we had "mustered" a little something if they'd have stopped letting blokes in until the balance had been redressed? I seriously doubt it as it was obvious this was about bunging the doorman a bribe regardless. So be frank, if you’re going to Body English, you have four options to get you in. 1.Make sure you book a table which will cost you $350 per three people but you get a bottle of spirits for your money. 2.Be prepared to bribe your way in. 3.Take a girl. 4.Stay at the hotel. Major gripe aside, we stayed in the bar and Casino until well after 9am the next day and we had a great time, the bar and Casino staff we’re helpful and friendly and the locals were fun too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Pool, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: isletraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock May 4 - May 7...the second weekend Rehab at the Pool is open. We are 34-35, and stayed with one other couple. First, I really didn't expect such good service from a big hotel in Las Vegas...I was wrong! From the reception desk to the pool staff, everyone was very friendly, welcoming and helpful. Their customer service is A +. The rooms were a good size, with comfortable beds, down pillows, and a nice shower. Everything in the room was clean...no complaints. We had mountain view rooms, which were just fine. The pool area is great. If you can, rent a cabana...they are fun! We were poolside Sunday for Rehab, which was crazy! Lots of good people watching...around 3pm, the crowd wins and it's time to head back inside to the casino! The Rock Spa is great. I had a GREAT massage with Chris (female)...go ahead of time to sit in the steam room and hot pool. The treatments are worth every penny! Pink Taco is overrated...the food was mostly bland and overcooked. This was my second stay in Vegas...I think for my next one I will stay on the strip, just to be able to walk out of the hotel from place to place. The cab fare to the strip from the Hard Rock was not bad though, so don't let that deter you!

Reviews.Title: “Another Room Theft! Poor handling by Hard Rock Staff”
Reviews.Author: hm823
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here recently on a business trip. And he too was told he was automatically upgraded to an executive suite (for no reason what-so-ever). Maybe that's the scam that Hard Rock staff is running since it's much easier for someone to break into the living area of your room while you are sleeping in the bedroom. Overnight, they stole his laptop, wedding ring, watch, $300 cash. They left his credit cards and I.D. (probably so they couldn't be traced with an easy get-away). There are NO cameras in the hallways at the Hard Rock, only in the elevators. My husband was told that was for the privacy of the guests, obviously not for their safety. I used to stay at the Hard Rock with my girlfriends at least once a year, but we will no longer stay there because we no longer feel safe. I'm glad more people are writing in to inform others. If you travel to any hotel, make sure you lock up all of your valuables and put the safety lock on your door when you are asleep!

Reviews.Title: “It's the Hard Rock, what did you expect?”
Reviews.Author: VegasDaisy
Reviews.Content: I should first start by saying, I'm a local. I live in Vegas, I'm 21, I party. If you're hoping the Hard Rock will be quiet, don't stay here. This hotel caters to ages 21-30, end of story. I stayed here with my best friend for one night to go to Body English Sunday School. I booked on the Hard Rock site and later received a promotion. I called and the reservation staff was super nice and willing to change my reservation to the promotion (even though it meant cancelling my original and rebooking me). I work in room reservations out here and this is NOT easy, it is NOT fun, and being nice about it is truly great service. I was not able to check into the room myself so I called and they added my friend to the room so she could check in, no problems. Her check-in was quick, when I arrived, I picked up my keys; the staff was friendly and courteous. We had dinner at Nobu and it was fantastic. The service was outstanding, the food was wonderful. Be warned: If you are going to Body English, check their event calendar first. I have been here twice (buy VIP passes if you can) and if there is a big event, no matter how important you might be, there is a great chance you won't get in. I was there the night of Paris Hilton's birthday party, people were not getting in after midnight without tipping the bouncers in the hundreds. The club is awesome, it's beautiful and the waitresses are hot! The music is kinda weird if you get there too early, but it gets normal once the club fills up. It's great people watching; I even ran into Frankie Muniz after the Grand Prix during one visit! The first night that my friend and I went in 12/2006 was the night of the big Christmas party that was being hosted by Ron Jeremy. On a Sunday night, it gets CRAZY. People WILL bring the party back upstairs so if you're hoping to get a good night sleep, don't stay here. It was loud, people would knock on our doors all night, it was crazy. This would really bug me anywhere else, but considering the price of the room and the clientele at this hotel, we didn't expect it to be quiet. My best suggestion would be to keep your expectations realistic. If you're going to one of the restaurants, try to make a reservation. If you're going to the clubs, BUY VIP passes (I know the VIP hosts and I still buy the passes just in case). Know what you're in for and you'll have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Disrespect”
Reviews.Author: daveinsandiego
Reviews.Content: Very excited about spending my 40th birthday in Vegas with my wife...even happier to think I was going to Hard Rock. However the hotel did everything possible to dissolve that excitement. My wife booked through Vegas.com and when we arrived we discovered that room requests are not honored through "affiliated on-line sites" Despite not being completely full, they would continue to hold rooms for the "true paying customers" who booked through their own website. i.e. this is the Hard Rock's way of pushing out the online services...maybe not a big surprise, but I was amazed at how bad it got. We requested a non smoking, king size, room and got smoking, 2 beds, Handicap accessable, next to the elevator....could not be a worse room in the house...we heard elevators all night as if they were in the room with us...finally made enough of a problem out of it and got moved for a good night sleep the second day. one other thing, while the TVs are fantastic (big plasma screens), they get a low def signal thereby making he picture unviewable......its as if they had no clue about the hotel business.

Reviews.Title: “Rather Sedate Actually”
Reviews.Author: BSQ
Reviews.Content: Ours was a Sunday-Tuesday stay. We had all been to this Casino over the years, and one in our group had stayed in the hotel on a previous trip. We were aware of the atmosphere, and relative age of guests that would be staying here. Our group pretty much isn’t their target market. ; ) Parking – plentiful. We parked (free) in the covered parking structure each night. Check-in – Sunday late afternoon, plenty of staff, no line. Check in quick & easy. Clerk confirmed we were NOT the oldest people staying at the hotel. Bless his heart. : ) Note, in the evenings when you go up to the elevators you must show your room key AND if you are carrying any bags they will ask what is in them. You are not allowed to bring alcohol purchased off site up to your rooms. HOWEVER, the elevators were not staffed during the day. Rooms – OK. WOW. Note, if you have tweens or younger, you may want to edit the Mini Bar section. Not sure they would need the position a day book. ; ) Beds are on a platform so while there’s not much give to them, they are comfortable. Linens were OK. The 42” plasma flat panel is almost too big for the room. I said ALMOST, (the rooms just a touch small, right?). Ample desk area and a small seating area near the windows. The black out curtains actually worked with no little rays of sunshine poking in to wake us up. (I hate when they don’t close all the way). Bathrooms … another WOW. Huge deep tub, rain shower head that even the tallest Bubba wouldn’t hit his head on. Good quality soaps & lotions, plenty of towels. Liked the lighted mirror. Only downside, no vent to help clear the room after a steamy shower. Sound proofing wasn’t too great, as we could hear everyone in the hallways as well as people in the parking lots. Admittedly I’m a light sleeper, so I was armed with my earplugs. A non issue really. Pool – incredible pool atmosphere. Needed a wristband to gain entrance to the pool area. Music loud & good in the pool area. If you’re not confident about how you look in a swimsuit, you might be intimidated here. Mr. Lucky’s – ate breakfast/lunch here one morning. Service good, people friendly, food reasonably priced and fresh. No complaints here. Casino – this was an absolute snoozer. I’d guess about a quarter of the tables were staffed. Slots had a good variety but were tight. For me, half the fun of Vegas is all the people in the casinos and lively tables. None to be had here. In the evening the place was nearly empty. Overall: I was advised this might not be the best place to stay with a couple of teenagers in tow, but have to say most of the caveats did not apply. Although it’s a young college crowd hanging out at the pools, and while I might not agree with some of the respect shown to women by some of the drunk guys (or lack there of), our teen travelers reported that no one really bothered them at all. In fact one was a bit miffed because someone called her 12 (meaning 12 years old, she’s 17). The valid complaint of staying here with Teens is that there is absolutely nothing for them to do. Our stay was during spring break, but early in the week. There really wasn’t a lot of activity going on at the Hotel. Seemed a bit sedate actually. If this hotel was on the Strip, it would have been totally perfect. But, it would have also probably cost considerably more than $80 a nite.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed NOT being a part of the gargantuplexes on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: debphoto
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical about our upcoming stay after reading the bad reviews on the Hard Rock Hotel in Vegas ... most especially because we are a family with a 3.5 year old. Granted we were staying during the week, not a weekend (which I wouldn’t hesitate to do again), but I'm pleased to say that all went well. The pool was beautiful and awesome (mostly in size per capita) and I was surprised to see many other families with kids out there. As we were there during the week, there weren't numerous 20-30-somethings partying. Don't get me wrong, if our kid wasn't with us, I'd be out there partying with them (see Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach review) and I’m almost 40! I agree however, after viewing the Rehab-Sunday video ads around the hotel that kids are completely inappropriate at that venue and my kid is pretty cool (see attached photo with her playing guitar left-handed with Jimi Hendrix). We were staying with a relative that had VIP status with the hotel so that made things slightly smoother (check-in was private, the rooms were a little cheaper and we got a few rides in the hotel car) but it didn’t drastically change our opinion of the hotel. We were still regular people there and still had to pay $11.99 for internet access. We were put in a “mountain view” room (7th floor) and my husband promptly went down to ask if we could switch to the other side. He was told that it would be an additional $120 to switch to the “pool/strip view.” Mountain view it is! Turned out to be the best decision we made that week as it kept our daughter highly entertained watching all the airplanes land and take off from the airport both day and night. My initial concern was that we would hear a lot of noise from both the airport and the air conditioners. Other than 2 jets that sounded like they landed in the room next to us, we didn’t hear a thing. That includes people in the hallway too. As a parent, the Hard Rock Housekeeping gets 10 gold stars for getting a roll-away bed up to us in under 10 minutes at 2am! They even did it with a smile. Wow. That’s service. We stupidly thought our daughter could sleep in her blow-up, Nemo bed but when we got to the hotel, there was a hole in it (Nemo, not the hotel). Hence the roll-away. Hence housekeeping. Hence the 10 gold stars. The things I would change or complain about have nothing to do with the hotel and everything to do with Vegas ...the incessant SMOKING, the self-importance of people who think they are beautiful (especially when drunk) and the air of desperation for money where people will take advantage of you at every turn. While the hotel is definitely a cab ride from the strip, it was still a good time and I thoroughly enjoyed NOT being a part of the gargantuplexes on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Theft and unresponsive management”
Reviews.Author: RW500
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with a group of 10 friends stayed at the Hard Rock for a long weekend at the end of March, 2007. We enjoyed the fun vibe of the hotel and the pool scene, however, we had a major problem with our stay. The last day we were there, my husband discovered he had been robbed. His work bag, which was in the room the entire weekend, had been opened and meticulously searched (someone spent some time opening up all the various compartments of his bag). His iPod and about $300 in all types of foreign currency were stolen. We were on our way to the airport, so he stopped to fill out a report at the security desk before we left. They told him they would question all the people who had used their cards to access the room (housekeeping, etc.) and get back to him. After about a week (my husband had to keep calling for updates) the woman handling the case said that they questioned everyone and there was nothing they could do. She said we could write an email to her boss, which we have done, but have not heard anything yet. Obviously, we are very disappointed with how the hotel handled this case. After all the money that we spent there individually and as a group of 12 (food, pool, casino, etc.), we expected them to be much more proactive and responsive to our claim. Another example of poor management occurred when we checked in--we were told they did not have the room we reserved and that we would have to move to a more expensive room. They said they would only split the difference with us, instead of giving us the room at the original lower price. We will certainly never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but watch out for sneaky management!”
Reviews.Author: alliecat920
Reviews.Content: Watch out for Manuel!! My 3 girlfriends and I stayed at The HardRock on March 30- April 1st and it was an overall GREAT hotel. I was a bit skeptical because of some of the reviews I've read on here...... but I will never stay anywhere else in Vegas! Its a few minutes from the strip, but it was a cheap cab ride and not a huge inconvenience at all. Definitely a party hotel, but what else are you going to Vegas for?? I wouldnt recommend it as a family environment......but its classic Vegas and if you are going for a good time, this is definitely the place to go. Unlike some of the other uptight reviews on here, I thought the rooms were wonderful. Decent size for a Vegas room- bigger than several of the rooms I've stayed in in other Vegas hotels. GREAT TV and french door which opened to the pool. We ordered room service the first night and it was delivered pretty quickly. Unbelievable pool atmosphere. We reserved a cabana which was a little pricey, but WELL worth it. We didnt have to fight the crowd for a place to sit and the service was GREAT! Our waitress was Victoria and she was unbelievably nice and helpful. There was a TV, fridge and safe in the cabana, which was nice because you could walk away from your stuff and not have to worry about it getting stolen. It's one big party all day long. Again, I wouldnt recommend it for children. But then again, I don't think most of Vegas is really children-friendly! Now for the downside...... Watch out for some of the hotel management!! I should start out by saying they arent all bad. We were checked out by a very nice man who was courteous, helpful and very respectful. If all management were like him, I would have no complaints. But unfortunately, I can't say the same for the gentleman (and I use that term losely) that checked us in. His name was Manuel (dont know his last name). He was a shorter man with glasses and we were told he was a manager. He came off as very nice and courteous at first.....but dont be fooled!! When we checked in, we were asked how many people we would need wristbands for. Because we were having two people join us at the pool the next day, we listed 4 names. He then had me sign my name on an electronic signature pad for my credit card (the electronic pad did not give me amount though). After giving us the standard speech about the location of the elevators blah blah, he vaguely mentioned something about an extra charge for more people. When I asked him what he was talking about, he said that there was an extra charge for the extra 2 people we listed. We asked him what the charge was and he danced around the question and wouldnt give us a straight answer. Once he realized I wasnt leaving until I got a straight answer, he admitted that there was a $50 extra charge PER PERSON PER NIGHT. I asked him if this charge was in what I had just signed for and he said yes. I found it funny (and very sneaky) that he "forgot" to mention this BEFORE I signed. I pointed out that we only wanted the wristband and there would not be extra people in our room. Manuel then told me that it would be an extra 50 for each wristband anyways (which was a lie!!) I asked him if this was true even if we rented a cabana and he said yes (which was another lie!) Because I could tell he was not going to be up front about anything, I asked for a print out of the charges to my credit card for the room. Manuel told me "we dont do that." Feeling like he misunderstood what I was asking for, I told him again that I just wanted a copy of my bill to see what the charges were. He again said they didnt do that and that they had no way of printing one. I said again "So you don't give your guests any record of what you charged them?" and his response was "that is correct". Well anyone who has ever stayed at a hotel before knows that there are printers right at the computer and all hotels will give a guest a copy of their bill! They usually do it without even having to ask!! Needless to say, he was lying. I was able to get a copy of my bill the next day from another person at the front desk. And of course, they printed it from the very computer that Manuel was using when we checked in!! Again, I'm sure all management isnt as dishonest as Manuel, but please be aware!! Require them to give you a copy of the charges at the beginning and end of your stay. And if you get Manuel, ask to check-in with someone else!! He will try to rip you off!!

Reviews.Title: “Sex starved teeny bobber hotel, not for business.”
Reviews.Author: flyingladybug2003
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a Business conference at this hotel. The Hotel room itself was nice and well kept but the environment was bad, bad, bad. loud, Loud LOUD. From The minute you wake up to leaf blowers at 7:am to the constantly blaring music from the Pool and everywhere and the crude sex games placed for purchase in the mini bar, this Hotel is crude and has no class. I was up on the 10th floor by the pool and even with the doors closed and drapes pulled you can always here the MUSIC 24 hours a day. NO sound proofing so at least you could go to your room for quiet. It is definatly not a place for a professional conference. Unless of course it is for prostitute loving types. I am perfectly aware that sex sells in Las Vegas but most of the Hotels manage to pull it off with some class, this hotel does not EVEN TRY to have any class about it. It is a straight white trash dump. If I ever have the misfortune to have to attend a conference here again I will book a room elsewhere. Please NEVER bring a child to this hotel. IT is designed around a purely Sex, Drugs and rock and roll theme. NOT FOR FAMILIES or professionals EVER. It is like a Warped flash back to a 24 hour a day college dorm party. But at least in the college dorms thay had times and places where you could go for a little peace.

Reviews.Title: “Love the rooms - felt out of place in the casino”
Reviews.Author: Snarky
Reviews.Content: Company put me up in the Hard Rock last weekend. Plusses: 1. The bed - featherbed with a down comforter - I was asleep in minutes. 2. Amenities - 40-something inch plasma TV in the room, Bose Wave Radio, well stocked vanity. 3. Surprisingly quiet - despite the party crowd that hangs out here, once you're in the room, you don't hear them. Maybe the people who hang out in the casino can't afford to stay in the hotel... and security is good about keeping non-guests out of the rest of the hotel. 4. Mr. Lucky's remains my go-to restaurant in Vegas. When you want a good meal, fast, and without any BS, go straight to Mr. Lucky's inside the Hard Rock. The $7.77 steak and shrimp is still available (off menu) - just ask. It's not the biggest cut of meat you've ever seen, but it's plenty for me. 5. Nobu is still my favorite for the expense account. 6. If you have the time, you need to go to the pool. 'Nuff said. 7. The curtains overlap each other in the room, so you can actually block out sunlight and get some sleep without having to use some clothespins or a clip hangar to close the curtains. Minuses: 1. Proof of one of my laws of travel: the more you spend on the room, the more you get nickeled and dimed after you check in. Want to use your laptop for either wired or WiFi internet access? That's $11.95/day. Want to use the WebTV in the room? $5.99/two hours. I didn't bother to open the minibar. 2. The rooms could use a little more light, especially by the closet. 3. With all the college age hotties hanging out in the casino, I felt old the moment I walked into the place. Don't get me wrong - I don't like walking into a casino filled with blue-haired old ladies, either... but I felt a little out of place. 4. Setting the alarm clock on the aforementioned Bose radio isn't very intuitive.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jwandsa
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Las Vegas we stayed at the Hard Rock. The Hard Rock would not have been my choice but I had business there so it just made sense. Upon arriving I walked to the registration desk and ran into my first problem. When I made the reservation I was told I could pay with a company check that my company was giving me to cover costs. Well, the desk agent then said we do not take checks and told me I would have to go to the onsite bank to get it cashed. So, we grab our 4 bags and walk over to the bank area. After about 10 minutes of questions they were able to cash my check. So we made the short trip back to the registration desk and attempted to check in to our room. Ouch! Unfortunately we were being helped by a new desk agent who wasn't quite ready to be left on her own. Anyway, I told her that I wanted to use the cash to pay for my first 3 nights and would like to use my debit card for the last night. Well, this didn't happen. She ended up running my debit card for the full amount of the stay plus an additonal $100 a day "security" deposit. I again told her how I wished to pay for the room and this time she seemed to understand. However, she again ran my debit card. More on that later. So, she gives us the keys to the room and which point I asked her if this was a king room. She then told me it wasn't.
