I personally called the hotel before our arrival and was told I would have a king sized bed. Well, she said she could do nothing about it but we could have a king bed that was a smoking room. This was unacceptable. Eventually they moved us to an upgraded room (however it turned out this was a smoking room as well). We got to our room and immediately accessed our bank account to see what damage the agent did to our account. It turns out the agent authorized our debit card for over $1200. And all we wanted to do was pay for the last night using this card. Anyway, we went back down to the desk and asked for a manager. Unfortunately he was in a meeting but the another agent at the desk asked if she could help us. Luckily for us she was able to call the bank and release the authorization from our debit card. She was the best part of our experience at the Hard Rock. So, we spent the first 2 hours of our time at the Hard Rock trying to check in and settle our bank account. Not a good start. On the day we were to check out we inquired about a late check out. We were told we could extend our check out to 1:00 pm for an additonal $100.00. The Hard Rock doesn't appear to regard customer service as much as their guests do. Outside of these issues our overall view of the Hard Rock is that it is a small casino, very average restaurants, very tight with the beverage service (on the third day we got our first "free" beverage service while gambling), pool area closed and just a lack of customer service. Next year I don't plan on staying here even it my business requires me to be there. Will stay elsewhere and take a cab!

Reviews.Title: “Good tub, bed and TV”
Reviews.Author: TxTravelPro
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night for a conference. I hate casinos and I hate the strip area of Vegas. So my perspective is purely that of a corporate traveler. I LOVE FREE PARKING and the parking was not too far from my room. Check in was easy and pretty fast. It would have been faster if the 3 Dallas Cowboy Cheerleaders in line in front of me would have been able to make a decision. They were really cute girls, but just a pain to get checked in. Ok, so I head to my room and it is just sooo far from the check in. It could have been much worse, I suppose. The Hard Rock is tiny compared to some casino properties. The room was large with a nice pool view. The room colors were not too attractive, sort of a pale green with purple duvets and chair. Vegas hotels sure take a beating. Guests just tear up rooms. So, considering it was Vegas, I give the hotel a little slack. The condition of the room was just fine, for Vegas. There was a huge plasma TV (with working sleep timer) in the room. Nice. The double bed (2) was comfortable. The bathroom had horrible lighting for daytime makeup but the tub was HUGE and clean. It was maybe 24" deep and 6' long. There was a rain type shower head which many people love... I do not like them that much but it worked and thank goodness there was enough water pressure to rinse my hair. We had an event at Body English. Really nice place. Ugly people... this is the place for you! The lighting is so flattering, EVERYONE looked pretty good! The meeting services were good... food was good. The location is actually good, in my opinion. Walgreens and restuarants across the street. Of course the best thing about the HR is all the memorabilia. It is a lot of fun just walking around and looking at all the displays.

Reviews.Title: “Fav place in Vegas (and I've stayed at all of them!)”
Reviews.Author: HomerJaySimpson43
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel >10 times over the last few years and it's my favorite place to stay in Vegas. If there is one flaw, it's that the hotel is not on the strip so you have to take a taxi to get pretty much anywhere. That being said, I've gone days without ever leaving the property so that's not always an issue :-) As points of reference, I have stayed at a number of other hotels in Vegas as well, including: Wynn, Bellagio, MGM, Venetian, theHOTEL, Mandalay, Palms. The Hard Rock is my fav because it's the most fun place to gamble and the pool is unbeatable, especially on Rehab Sundays. The club is fun and the food at the restaurants is great too. Unless I have to stay somewhere else, I always choose the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “lose ur inhibitions”
Reviews.Author: allyroad
Reviews.Content: feel free to e-mail me with any questions allysondawn@hotmail.com...I've stayed at hard rock 2wice with my girlfriends and we are all in our late 20's-which is pretty much the age range. the pool is the best!!! great food and drinks, hot guys and girls and great music, especially during rehab, theres a DJ. I highly reccomend Simon Restaurant-yummmmy. the room prices are a bit chi-ching, it includes pool and gym usage even if you don't use it!!! careful with your belongings, use the safe in ur room and the pool especially. the circle bar and Body English are lots os fun;) the hallways of the hotel are definitely the party place in the middle of the night, coming back to the room from a night of partying is a new and better party waiting to happen. if u have kids or want some peace and quiet or are on ur honeymoon, stay somewhere else!!! free shuttle during the day to and from the strip

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: irishwhiskey
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Rock three times in the last year and love the place. Unfortunately for me I am no longer in the 20s - 30s crowd but have transgressed into the 50s, and disagree with the comments that you should not stay here if you are 40+. I do not party like I used to and don't want to, but, where else can you immerse yourself in good rock, party in the casino, eat in fun restaurants and not have to worry where the elevator is. On the three occasions I stayed here, I never felt slighted for being dumpy or old and everyone just seemed to be there to have a good time. Same for the staff - always friendly. I think its always dependent on your attitude. A good example - one day I finished business early and went to the pool around noon. It was packed with alot of 20-30 types with only a few like me. A group of guys made some xxx comment at me - I threw it back at them and ended up partying with them the rest of the day. Had a great time. So, my review of the Hard Rock Great fun place to escape and listen to good music All the restaurants are great, particularly the Pink Taco The Casino is loud and fun Rooms are great - not the Wynn but who cares. Take an MP3 with RCA cord and listen through the Bose radio - french doors with a view of the parking lot and strip clubs is priceless. If you are coherent into the wee hours, you'll get a glimpse of what you used to act like at 3am but can't remember. Relax and have fun

Reviews.Title: “Terrible/scary experience”
Reviews.Author: Nadia36
Reviews.Content: Hi: We stayed at the hard-rock hotel September30th through October3 for a going away ( kind of bachelorette party) and it was a weird experience... We had a group of 10 girls... We checked in the hotel and went to check out the pool area before we went to the rooms... One of the bouncers grabbed my wrist, and wouldn't let go until one of my friends confronted him, he verbally attacked her also! Very odd he was possibly high on something... We formally complained to management, who then replied that the security for the hotel was handle by an outside company so they weren't responsible... We wrote a formal complaint to the hotel management and we still waiting for a reply... Girls alone should not stay here!!!!!!!! Even their staff is high or drunk..... You can party here as a group ( they have a reat casino and great pool party!) but the management does not care about keeping their female guests safe. Good place if you are going with your boyfriend or a bunch of guys... Also scary for families. Don't take a chance, it was a terrible experience...

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: laur05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock from Dec 30 till Jan 2. We were a group of 8, 2 couples in each room. I read that many people had problems with check in and I must say we had the complete opposite. Check in was quick and we requested 2 adjoining rooms and that is exactly what we got. The rooms were nice, the beds were sooo comfortable and the bathrooms were big. Also staying right across the hall was Tommy Lee which was awesome! The casino and hotel were smaller then the others but very laid back and fun. I didn't really like the club they have there, Body English but I'm not much of a club person anyways. Overall, I have no complaints of the entire trip. We saw lots of famous people around the casino and were treated very well by everyone including at the gambling tables and housekeeping who were always giving us extra towels. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: sandchaser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock for New Year's Eve to see Supernova. We are seasoned travellers and have stayed at many hotels in Las Vegas. The rooms at the Hard Rock were just mediocre. They don't provide blankets, coffee makers, or even a vanity mirror. Our first night there, the shower drain was plugged so bad that it was flooding. When we tried to call customer service, the phone didn't work. We had to call the front desk using our cell phone. They did send someone to fix the shower that evening. The beds were lumpy and the bathrooms were so small that you have to be careful to avoid rubbing up against the toilet while closing the bathroom door! Oh and get this...There is an extra $20 charge per person to use the gym each time. The casino was a happening place during the evenings. They need to update their ventilation system to handle the cigarette smoke and upgrade their sound system which sounds sub-standard. If you plan on staying at the Hard Rock plan on paying a lot for Taxi rides to the strip as it is too far to walk (approx. 1.5 miles) to the strip. Also note that the hotel's restaurants only give 2 for 1 discounts to guests of all Las Vegas hotel guests, EXCEPT for Hard Rock guests. Which doesn't make any sense, since one would think the hotel would give special consideration to those people who are guests of the hotel and gambling in their casino. There are lots of other hotels in Las Vegas that treat their patrons better and have better amenities.

Reviews.Title: “hard rock is the best”
Reviews.Author: cushman78
Reviews.Content: as the organizer of a trip that usually consists of 15 to 20 males aging between 22 and 30, the hard rock is the place to stay. we said we would stay at a different place every year until we found a place we liked. if your looking for a party, and of course you are or you wouldnt be going to vegas, then this is the place to stay. the rooms are all you can ask for. clean, small little balcony, but big opening french doors is very nice. bose steros are a nice touch. the rooms also have safes which are free and work very well. the casino is great. there is a party going on all the time. the dealers are very friendly and helpful. myself, always stopping to play cards on my way to the room every nite, usually not to sober whatsoever, the dealers would look after you. most places will take advantage of you, but the dealers there seemed to go that extra mile to make sure know matter how drunk you were, you werent missing anything. the pool is amazing. i highly reccomend renting a cabana. there about 250 for the day, but have a flat screen tv, fridge, safe and lots of chairs and couches. you get amazing waitress service when you have one of these. (the grilled ham and cheese is so good when hungover drinking a corona sitting by the pool.} there is a water slide, a sandy beach, and more woman than you can shake a stick at. body english is located at the hard rock. this is one of the best bars in vegas. (pure is still the best.) we had a vip room there, with 19 of us i bet we had another 50 people in there that we had brought in. definetly a good time. the only downfall, was the front desk staff. not very smart. are rooms were all prepaid, but they kept trying to charge us again. they just couldnt understand what was going on or problem solve this. luckily my travel agent fixed all this when we got home. all in all, if your in your 20 s, 30 s, or still like to give er in your 40 s... then stay here. if you dont drink, party, like rock music, like it loud.. then dont stay here. i will stay here every year from here on end. lots of single guys/girls.. whatever your into. i stongly reccomend this place and i will be back next year for sure......good times

Reviews.Title: “Not My Kind of Place...”
Reviews.Author: mrfargo2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night during a business trip. I'm a mid-40's guy and discovered pretty quickly that this was not the place for me. First, I felt as if I was old enough to be everyone's father. The guests, staff and club visitors here are mostly 20-somethings. Much of the crowd were party-hardy types and seemed to compete for who could yell the loudest at the bars and around the small casino. To give them some credit, you practically HAD to yell to be heard over the loud rock music that seems to be seeping out of every corner of this place. I liked a lot of the tunes, but gee, could you turn the volume down just a little bit?! The minimalist-styled rooms were fine with huge plasma TVs and a decent work area. Believe it or not, some of us actually do come to Las Vegas for business! Internet access was expensive at $12/day. Be aware that sound really travels in this hotel -- through the walls, ceilings and under the doors. Didn't get much sleep and glad I had no meetings the next morning. People were running up and down the hallways yelling all night. I had to put towels against the substantial opening at the bottom of the door. That helped a little. Then at 2:00AM and again at 3:30AM young partiers were banging on doors. Was exhausted the next morning. Didn't experience any of the restaurants except the 24/7 coffee shop which was OK. Waitresses were attentive, food came quickly and at least the music was a little less loud in there. The hotel is in a poor location if you want to go for a walk to escape the noise. I've stayed at practically every major Strip hotel (been to Las Vegas for conventions nearly 100 times) and will go back to one of them next time.

Reviews.Title: “Lock all your belongings!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hac0226
Reviews.Content: The weekend of September 15-17th we stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Las Vegas. I ALWAYS stay at this hotel when I go to Vegas becasue it is always a fun time. We put the "DO NOT DISTURB SIGN" on our door. We did not want anyone to enter our room to clean it, or any other purpose. On Sunday we returned to our room to find items missing from our room. Purses, wallets, perfume, makeup, shoes, etc. Over $3,000 worth of stuff. We went to the security desk where we were rudely told that "our maids don't steal" and there will be an investigation, but probably won't find anything. As you can imagine this is VERY insensitive to your guests who are upset about their belongings being stolen. They investigated it and found out that a maid came in our room. Our room was NEVER cleaned and nobody should have entered our room. I understand that investigations take time, but it has been almost 2 months now, and we know who took the items, a Hard Rock Hotel employee. We haven't gotten A THING from Hard Rock, no letter, no apology. NADA!!!!!!! If you do stay here - lock your suitcase up!! Don't leave anything in your room that you don't want stolen, bc apparently its free for the taking for Hare Rock Maids!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the hidden charge!!”
Reviews.Author: msikcr
Reviews.Content: Beware the hidden charges!!! Everywhere you look they hit you. First the rate on the web looks good. Then when you check in and ONLY when you check in after you have signed the Early Checkout $75 payment agreement do they tell you that there are two $5 per night charges automatically added on. 1 for the resort fee and one a shuttle charge. I didn't even know they had a shuttle. Also the rooms have NO glasses in them, so if you want / need a drink of water to take a pill or are just thirsty you have to drink from the sink or open a $6.50 bottle of water. Nice touch. In addition they make you sign a statement that if you bring any food / water into the room they will charge $25 for it. The room is on par with any Holiday Inn in the country, but no Holiday Inn I have stayed in would put up with the stains on the carpet and furniture. Go to any one of the many other wonderful hotels in Vegas.. Avoid the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Times At Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: juleshills
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in late October, 2006 from Thursday to Monday morning and had a pleasant experience. It is definitely a singles/ young adult hotel. I would say the target ages would be from 21-36. I have nothing bad to say about the hotel at all, it's not my favorite hotel in the world, but it definitely is a great party hotel. I went with a party of seven friends (including myself) and we were put in standard rooms next door to each other. Standard rooms aren't very big, but they're made for sleeping and they were clean and pleasant. The casino was a little smaller than I thought-- but had everything you needed. The pool was amazing, and if it was that good during the fall-- I can only imagine the summer. My favorite restaurant in the Hard Rock is Mr. Lucky's 24/7 which is a diner that is always open. The staff never gave me any problems and I did like it because it was in a world of it's own off the strip, but a very cheap, quick, and convenient cab ride to the strip. There are local stores and strip malls nearby when you need a dose of reality and not the Las Vegas glitz. I would probably stay in another hotel next time-- just to experience something different-- but I would NEVER turn down another stay in the Hard Rock because it was good. I would definitely stay there again though if I make repeat trips.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Music, the Food, and the Casino”
Reviews.Author: Tucsontourist
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at the hotel, because we were on a budget, but we ended up at the Casino every night because of the wonderful food at the 24/7 restaurant. We loved the music, which included everything from 50's to present--and were left alone to play the penny slots or walk around as we wanted. Strangely enough, we didn't mind the music being loud because it was good. We were taken back when we noticed a group of young men walking around with what appeared to be a huge bottle of beer(?), until we realized that they were probably performers. Because of our schedule, we didn't get to go into any of the various shops--but they looked like something we'd have enjoyed. If for no other reason than the food (and the great waiters and waitresses), it's worth a visit. We noticed three older women who looked like they were out of place--sort of like they were expecting more "action" than anything--it was far more crowded on Friday and Saturday night, which was understandable, but it didn't appear to be a pick-up bar--although like anywhere, if you look for trouble, you can always find it. By far, our favorite Las Vegas restaurant and casino--and we saw several. If our budget allowed, we would have stayed at the hotel instead of across the street, but we were still easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: TheLiens7
Reviews.Content: An excellent place to stay. We have stayed at around 15 other casino/hotels and we would place this in the top 3. The room was great. The view was stunning. From our balcony, we could see the Luxor all the way to the Stratosphere, and also the pool area. The Pink Taco was excellent as well as Luckys. Also the room service was quick and the food was great. All in all, we would recomment this highly. We will be back in the near future. We go to Vegas every 4-6 months.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: richcaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a couple of nights in early September and this is by far thest place I have stayed in Vegas - it actually feels like a hotel with a casino inside it rather than a casino that happens to have some bedrooms. Room was well appointed and unlike previous posters expereience my room was made up in the morning and everything taken care of. Staff were all extremely warm and helpful. Breakfast in the 24 hour diner was excellent. Agree with the last poster that a taxi to the strip is essential and cost no more than $7. There was a surcharge on the room for use of a shuttle service but I saw no sign of this operating while I was there. Overall, it was worth the detour from staying on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock rocks”
Reviews.Author: BarnetBlackDog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in early Sep 2006. Great location - 5 mins/$7 in a cab from the airport. Short cab ride or brisk (hot) walk to the strip - walking not recommended. Check-in is probably the only downside - see if you can pre-register or arrive at a quiet time otherwise you have to register, leave your bags and return later (say 5pm) to actually get the keys to your room. Rooms are spacious and clean but room service is late (well after 1pm) and erractic (our beds weren't made and our towels weren't changed one day). The Sunday pool party (rehab) is great fun - well worth being in town for. Pool complex is really good but does get busy so arrive early for a lounger. Casino is OK - min bet $10 though - bar is good and open all hours. Food is good at both the breakfast bar and the other eateries and the starbucks is helpful. All in all great fun: would come again.

Reviews.Title: “HR Rocked”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveler2006
Reviews.Content: I stayed a the HR with my girlfriend in mid August. We are in our late 20's (26,28). We had a great time. The HR treated us well. I have stayed at many other Vegas hotels but none like this. We never felt lost or in a sea of people like other strip hotels. (This hotel Tops THEhotel for overall experience.) Friendliest dealers by far in Vegas. I loved playing cards to good old Rock-N-Roll. Never had more fun playing at the tables. I met lots of good people at the tables. I enjoyed that the casino was much lighter, smaller, and more open than other Vegas Casinos. There were plenty of non-smoking tables open. We really liked the party atmosphere. It was not too much but just right. If you like to play at the tables or the slots I recommend getting a Back Stage Pass (Players Card) before you start gambling. The HR is extremely generous with comps. Most places on the strip do not even let you get a players card unless you play at least $25 a hand. That is not the case at the HR. Once you play for a while just ask the pit boss if you have any comps for food or anything else. They are nice and will tell you yes more than no. Not only that, once you are on that list they will send you special email offers. I just got one that offered rooms as low as $25 in the week and $49 on the weekend! Food at Mr. Lucky's was great. My girlfriend loved the oversized bowl of coffee. Pink Taco was a pleasant surprise. The Guac plate was perfect. The room was good. The carpet was a little wet (from the steam clean) when we checked in, but at least I knew it was clean!! Loved the french doors opening to fresh mountain air. I am glad I brought some CD's for the Bose stereo. I did enjoy the large plasma and the live concert channel was showing Woodstock. The bath tub looked new and was a great excuse to just relax a little. The pool was very nice escape. I will say that we were lucky to get an umbrella. With out that we would have fried. I had a few celeb sightings. Tommy Lee, Dave Navarro, and Wee Man. I missed Mike Tyson on a couple of occasions. Overall I think the HR is the place to be in Vegas. I have already booked another trip in December with a group.

Reviews.Title: “Good times @ the Hard Rock!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl9999
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation through Travelzoo and got a good deal plus alot of 2 for 1 deals on meals. I went to Vegas with 15 people, 9 of us stayed at the Hard Rock and absoultely loved it! Yes it's not on the strip but it's a short cab ride away! At night I didn't feel anyone was really being loud in the hallways upstairs...however this is the hard rock people are here to party not hang out in their rooms! The music in the casino was great, my friends and I sung along to all of it and didn't find it too loud. The room was good it looked exactly like the picture that only disappointing thing was that it appeared that every room had a balcony but on the mountain view side it was french doors that opened up to a 6 inch balcony. Mr. Lucky's was a big hit with all my friends especially the chicken fingers...if you're on a budget you can eat for under $10 a person here, we were more concerned with spending our money on alcohol. There is also a strip mall across the street with other cheap food options! Rehab the pool party was crazy but an amazing time everyone needs to experience it! The Rock Spa is good as well we spent an afternoon their and enjoyed our whole experience! I would advise signing up for the players club at the Hard Rock you get $10 free slot play and $25 match bet and a few other nice perks. Body English was fun but if you want to get in free with your room card bring a lot of girls with you and be at the door by 10:15pm. However if you have kids this is NOT the place for you the other Hard Rock hotels are a lot more kid friendly than their Vegas Outlet! I would definitly stay at the hard rock again it's small and managable unlike other casinos in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angie&Monte
Reviews.Content: We (married couple 30 & 31 yrs) stayed at the HRH for 5 days. We visit Vegas every year for the past 5 years and this was our first time staying at the HRH. This place is FANTASTIC!!! From now on this is the only place we will stay. The staff is incredible. Very friendly and courteous and will go out of their way for you. We are not big spenders, yet were treated like high rollers. The room is spacious and has a very cool plasma TV, and Bose CD player. It was nice to open the french doors at night time to let the cool desert air in. We went to the "Rehab" party on Sunday. WOW!!!!! What a fun time! A must for our next trip. We rented a cabana during our stay and our cabana host Erik did a great job making us feel like VIPs. It was well worth the money. We have stayed at the Bellagio, Mirage,TI, and MGM. The HRH tops all of these hotels easily. If you are trying to decide on what hotel to stay at you can't go wrong with the Hard Rock Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Vegas_Shopper
Reviews.Content: I have visited the HRH on many occasions, always enjoying the atmosphere, gaming, and friendliness of the employees. Today I choose to spend some time at the Hotel and Casino so I took a spin on my bike to the property and entered to enjoy some Starbucks coffee and a little gaming action. I was shocked to find that my bike had been removed by security during my visit. When I inquired as to the reason the hotel staff would cut my lock and take my bike, I was told that bikes are not allowed anywhere on the property. I find this very disturbing since the Hard Rock Hotel has always marketed itself as a “save the planet” sponsor of the global environment. I guess customers who ride bicycles have less monetary value to offer to the hotel and are looked upon as less then the regular SUV driving customers.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun at Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: haley01
Reviews.Content: OK, so it has taken me a while to get to this review, but I'm going back to Vegas next month and just started thinking about it again. The Hard Rock was lots of fun; the music was good. The rooms have Bose Wave Radios. We had booked a mountain view room and were woken up at 7 am by construction noise outside (they were building a stage for the killers concert a couple of days later). Also, mountain view actually means airport view. Don't do it, unless you really need to save the money. A couple of other things in our room were broken. We complained and eventually got moved to a suite on the pool side. Nice!! Separate living room, huge bathroom with jetted tub, etc. We had room service. I wanted the tuna steak sandwich that I had gotten at the pool the day before, but it wasn't on the menu, but they brought it to me anyway. I think we got much better treatment in the suite. We were 2 single girls, age 28. There were hardly any other women at the hotel. Every time we sat down to gamble, some guys from another table would try to get us to go over to their table. We were there mid-week. At first, we didn't like it bc it was too far from the strip, the shuttle service is limited, and taxi rides were adding up. But by Thursday we didn't want to leave! the hotel definitely takes on a different attitude as you get closer to the weekend. The highlight of our trip was on the last night, when we came in at 5 am, two members of Green Day were playing at the $5 blackjack table. They saw us checking them out and invited us over to play with them. Very cool!! I would stay there again, but it is so expensive during the weekends, which are the really fun time. I wouldn't recommend it for your first trip to Vegas, since it is a good way from the strip, unless you don't mind paying $10 for a taxi numerous times a day. We ate at Mr. Lucky's several times. Good country-fried steak and mashed potatoes. $7.77 deal is just ok, but it is cheap. Also, pretty good comps at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Pool Decent Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 1 night but have visited many times for gambling. The room was very clean, modern looking with a flat screen tv, and well sized for a standard room. The rate during the week was reasonable but on the weekend way too overpriced. We don't have any complaints about the accomodations except for the disgusting pool area. To keep it short: the water was not clean at all, it had a cloudy appearance and a slick greasy layer on top. There were straws floating around from people drinking in the pool. I had to swim around a fake glitter eyelash and beer can tabs buried in the beach area. Overall, I was grossed out after 5 minutes of wading and swimming around. I wouldn't mind staying at the hotel again but I will not ever visit the pool area again. It needs to be sterilized.

Reviews.Title: “Special meal deal”
Reviews.Author: ShakeYourBon-Bon
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at the Hard Rock Las Vegas but we did manage to walk to the hotel and eat their 777 special meal deal. The staff was friendly and attentive to our needs. The food was fulfilling and the ambiance throughout the casino was great and had a nice young feeling. Great memorabilia throughout the 1st floor of the establishment. It’s off the beaten path but there’s always a taxi cab to take us where we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to have fun and party”
Reviews.Author: viaum
Reviews.Content: I went to the Hard Rock Hotel last year with 10 friends to celebrate my bachlorette party. I had the best time ever. The rooms are very spacious, there was a plasma and a cd player wich we used all the time. The bathroom was a little small but it was very clean. This is definetly the hotel to stay if you want to party, have fun and meet young people. If your are planning a family trip, or a quiet and peacefull hotel this is not the place. The staff where all extremely helpfull, not to mention the concierge who helped us make reservations in the BEST night clubs. The view from my room was incredible (the pool). The pool itself is amazing, the music, drinks and service is great. I would stay here again in a minute but only if I'm planning to party, like I said if you are planning to go with your family or are looking for a relaxed time this is not the place. I LOVED STAYING HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “People having SEX at the pool - Worst hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked three nights at the end of May 2006. As soon as we walked in the lobby and overheard someone complaining at the registration desk that people were openly having sex at the pool, we asked to cancel our reservations. Sorry, need 72 hours notice. We were stuck. The rooms were sub-par to say the least, and we were disgusted to see that handcuffs and sexual aids were on the room service menu. Our room overlooked the pool and we were treated to a view of half naked women parading around the pool, and couples engaging in sex acts right out in the open. It appears this is encouraged by the staff, considering the room service menu. The walls are painfully thin, so we were able to hear the party next door on one side and the couple engaging in very vocal sex on the other side of our room. A couple that we met at the restaurant told us they were denied admittance to the pool because they weren't young swimsuit model-types. And a hotel with a restaurant named "The Pink Taco"? Come on. We left the next day and will never return. Families beware. Stay clear.

Reviews.Title: “Party on, dudes! (But really, it's not that bad.)”
Reviews.Author: california_vagabond
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock is definitely a party spot. Don't expect a quiet night's sleep (that's what the music channel on your TV is for -- to block out other guests' noise). Do expect tons of attitude from the staff and other revelers (if you look like the SoCal "in" crowd, it'll make it easier.) And forget about using the valet parking -- the traffic flow pattern is awful, and it's quicker to just self-park in the garage then walk into the hotel through the casino. All of that sounds pretty negative, right? But there's a lot to love here. From Muay Thai kickboxing in the spa gym, to the all-night diner Mr. Lucky's that serves great good, to the swim-up blackjack in the gorgeous Polynesian pool area, to Body English nightclub (which really does have a decent DJ), to the super-mod design of the rooms, which have the most outrageous and naughty mini-bar and room service items. Free local calls, too. All in all, given the prices (especially mid-week), it's a good deal for Vegas. And fun! If you don't have a car, plan on taking taxis to/from the Strip, as their shuttle runs short hours.

Reviews.Title: “Party Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrystaldave
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a bunch of other people for my best friends birthday on the kick off weekend of the Rehab party(Sundays). There was also a popular concert at the Joint going on. It was very busy there that weekend. It didn't start off too well when checking in as they informed me I would be charged 150 a night for incidentals because I was using a debit/credit card. I have stayed at the Four Seasons and Mandarin hotels and never been charged that much for incidentals or had any problems with my card. The rooms are average with a decent bed and flat screen and a nice view. The one horrible thing about the room was that there was very little hot water. I turned the water off and one one morning a few times before getting any water that felt even remotely warm. Room service was great and had excellent food. Casino was my favorite place for gambling. We gambled at Ceasars Palace for several hours and couldn't wait to get back to the Hard Rock casino. We never even got one drink there in 3 hours! The Celine show there was wonderful, but I would only go back to that hotel to see her again. Pink Taco and Luckys both had good food and service. Nothing spectacular, but nothing to complain about. Geared towars YOUNG people and great for people watching. Pool is very nice although I never heard the music under the water? We had a cabana one day and that was really nice with very attentive service . The waitress at Rehab was horrible. They kept our license for our tab and when it was time to go we couldn't find her for an hour. I doubt I would stay there again for the price, but all in all it wasn't too bad. A very cool hotel to stay in for like a 21st bday celebration or a bachelor party. Once you hit 30 or so you might want to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: BDavisDecatur_GA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock for business meetings. Arrived to check in at 11:30am, no rooms available (check-in is at 3p) so they took my cell. I was in the middle of shopping in the casino shops when they called to tell me my room was ready, about 10 min after I got there...excellent turnaround. The room view was non-existant (of a roof and side of building) but didn't mind since I got checked in early and was there for business. Room is a nice size...roomy with good internet access. Drawback has already been reported many times in previous reviews...the walls are paper thin so if sleeping is a goal this is not the best place. Overall it's a great casino since it's smaller and more intimate. Shopping is good and eating good too...ate both at the steakhouse and the Pink Taco. Room service breakfast was excellent morning of check-out. The constant heaviness of cigarette smoke/smell in both my room and the meeting room really affected me but everywhere you go in Vegas its like living in an ashtray so I don't fault the HardRock for that. I'd stay at the HardRock again to get off the strip and away from the hustle of the bigger casinos. The dealers were upbeat and friendly. Nothing beats playing blackjack with great music playing...the discerning detail of gambling at the HR.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Front Desk: Nobu was great”
Reviews.Author: dwarly
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock hotel has a great collection of rock memorabilia and great atmosphere in the casino. Nobu restaurant has wonderful sushi but is pretty pricey. The serving staff at Nobu's is great. However, the registration front office staff was incredibly rude! We asked what the rating was and they said that they had been open for "11 years , 3 months and 5 days and we do not need a rating." We asked if they had brochures showing other rooms and they were brusque and not helpful. The hotel staff seemed unhappy and perhaps they are having labor problems. The rooms are ok but not worth the relatively high price for a casino off the strip. We ended up back at the Venetian and had a great time as usual. Bottom Line: Problems with rude hotel staff and there are much better values in Las Vegas but the environment in the casino is worth a second look.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The purpose of our stay at the Hard Rock was to have my son and his friend attend a concert at the Joint (the hotel's concert hall). It was convenient to have a room at the same facility so that I, as a parent could be close by and the kids and I could come straight up to the room safely. The most impressive part of our stay was the great customer service we received from the staff...from the registration clerk, to the maid & housekeeping services, to the restaurant (Mr. Lucky's), to the hotel gift shop clerks and the bell & transportation services...they were all cordial, helpful, professional and polite...it did not matter that it was obvious that we were not "high-end" clients...they treated us with the same level of service as if we were. We appreciated that. The kids thought the decor was awesome, with the comprehensive rock memorabilia...it was a Rock museum..I had fun looking at all the displays of past to present rock n roll memorabilia. Our room was very clean, the bedding was excellent...the kids loved the big screen tv, the bathroom was quite large and clean. The view out the french door was wonderful. We enjoyed a very peaceful sleep...no noise, which I anticipated from other reviews... The hotel had a wonderful shuttle service, every hour on the hour to two destinations on both ends of the strip...so no need for a car rental. The kids enjoyed the rock concert and the stay at this "cool" place...and I, the mom enjoyed it as well!

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock " Rocks"!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Love the hard rock, stayed there more than 6 times, with and without our kids 9 & 14 yrs. we are going back again April 23, 2006. We love it rooms are nice On one occasion we had a crappy room at check in the carpet was wet, we were imediately moved to another room. the pool is awesome, beach shack food is pretty good, I ordered a fruit salad one day and the fruit was rotten, my entire bill was cleared and new food was brought. the waitresses are friendly and accomodating, clean. I love " The Joint" we have seen alot of different concerts the last being Motley crue. the first being Bonnie Raitt with Indigo Gilrs, it was great. can't wait to go back the securty up to the rooms is excellent no one gets in and no one sneaks through. the Rock spa is comparable to reg sp prices and services.Lots to see many celebreties frequently around. Rod Stewart, nicki sixx, vince nell, Jackson Brown, lisa presley..sum 41. can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “we even decided to get married in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: minkyone
Reviews.Content: Hi, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel - it's the coolest in Vegas and definitely the best place for celeb spotting! We met Matt Sorum and his girlfriend Ace who were staying at the hotel - both of them were really friendly and stopped for a chat. The drummer from Green Day (sorry, I forgot his name!) stumbled out of one of the great hotel restaurants draped over two blonde girls.. Motley Crue were playing that week (great gig by the way) and Vince Neil and his entourage just wandered past as we were sat at the bar! Its the kind of place where you recognise familiar faces everywhere! The hotel itself if sooooo cool, the other hotels on the strip aren't a patch on it - it's definitely the only one I would stay at in Vegas. If you are worried about it not being on tne strip, the hotel offers a free shuttle, and we actually walked to the strip most days which took about 20mins - it was October and warm, nmot sure if this would be a good idea in the hotter temperatures..?! The concert venue - The Joint - was one of the very best I have ever been in - the atmosphere was fanstastic, great views and because its not so big, you get to see stadium bands up close :o) We stayed near the back (and the bar!) and still had great views of the band. We are from the UK and gigs here tend to get very crowded and everyone gets jostled around - this was not the case at the Joint and we enjoyed the gig even more because of it. The people seenmed too cool for that sort of thing and most hung round in groups just enjoying a few beers and the atmosphere. We took a walk out to the pool which was fantastic, the only thing I would criticise here is that unless you are a size 8, 6ft perfect looking model, you may feel slightly self concious! We enjoyed the margaritas at the poolside bar underneath the waterfall instead! All the staff seemed very friendly - even the security staff were far too cool for their own good! The only thing that I would say is that the corridor decor could probably do with a bit of a re-furb, but thats a small minus! Great hotel, fab city! Enjoy! :o)

Reviews.Title: “Coolest hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard rock in October. It was definitely a great place....as much as you can expext from a party spot. Check-in was painless...although they did require a 200 dollar deposit on a credit card which I had no clue about. The room....for being a standard room...was absolutely out of this world with the huge plasma TV and the 24 hour live concert channels and the CD player and some interesting merchandise in the mini fridge!! There were a couple spots on the carpet and on the bathroom floor..but honestly...if you are there to party, who cares about those minor details. I booked through Expedia...so obviously I was given a mountain view...but you still get a pretty cool view I thought. You can see the strip club right across the street. The pool was sweet....a great place to drink, party, hang out, play blackjack...whatever you wanna do. At night, the whole place turns into a big party scene...there's people hanging out at the center bar, playing roulette....its awesome. I didn't make it to the Body English, but I've heard great things about it...and its true that its hard to get in if you show up with a big group of guys, but thats true of any good club in vegas....and quite frankly I am glad its that way. I've read some reviews about the service not being good and the staff being snobby and although I don't know what these people had to go through...I didn't see that at all. I thought everyone was way nice and friendly and pretty laid back. I am definitely staying there again next time I go to Vegas...not even gonna think twice about it.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good experience at HRH”
Reviews.Author: HotHotPennyAddict
Reviews.Content: Got to hotel by courtesy shuttle around 1 in the afternoon. Took a bit to check in because we didn't have the credit card we reserved room with to put a $100 deposit for it. We had it in cash, but they had to have it on credit card. Finally got checked in after making a call to parents. The room was wonderful, very clean. Loved the plasma tv. The bathroom was nothing special. Had a view of pool and strip. It was cool at night how the outside lights change in waves. We had our doors open for a little bit, but it got cold and breezy(plus we could smell the yummy food from the first floor.)My friend and sister got a slot card and there was a coupon for a free shot glass with a $15 purchase, but they said the clerk in the HARD ROCK STORE just gave them the shot glass without making them buy anything. So, when I go in store I got a cranky who got all snotty and said I had to buy something. I tried explaining that my friend and sister didn't have to buy anything, but she insisted I had to buy something. I refused, and walked out. The cocktail waitresses were always asking if we wanted something to drink while playing slots. Ate dinner at Mr Lucky's 24/7. Very good.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amadoresoftravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Thanksgiving Weekend - The hotel was fine. The main problem was that the windows kept opening up - It was really windy. The rooms were clean but the comforters looked worn out. I think this is a perfect hotel for the younger crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Way OVERRATED”
Reviews.Author: elroy74
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock used to be such a nice spot. They were off the strip, but still a great place to go for the weekend. I used to have a hostess there who made sure I never had a problem in the world. My last trip was a nightmare. I called my hostess only to find out she had left the Hotel earlier that week. I was given another hostess and assured I would have no problems. The booked me my room but only comped me one night this time. Explained that things were getting more expensive. (I had been comped every other trip for my entire stay due to my play in the casino.) Upon arrival they said that my reservation for a Pool View room was changed to a mountain view due to excess demand. (Another slap in the face.) On top of that I needed to wait an hour or so as they were still cleaning my room. (It was 6:00pm.) When I called my hostess to complain she never go tback to me. When I checked out they said I was comped one night already and my play did not rate for any other nights. I have since been back to Las Vegas three times. While I am not a heacy hitter, I have been comped my rooms, meals, and services at the Venetian and Mandalay for the same level of play. Hard Rock is getting pretty full of itself. They used to be a great place for people to go. Now it is a snobby 20 year old's dream hotel. Why not just stay at The Palms then.

Reviews.Title: “Another experience not so good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OK Let me start with it is so true about the people who work at the Hard Rock - they act snoobby or like they just don't want to be at work. Nobody says good luck at the cashiers. The waitstaff in Mr. Lucky's was a tall rude man. The food is always great at Lucky's and Pink taco is great too. I has a dirty martini a SIMON its yummy but pricey as well. The sushi at NOBU was fabulous and I thought somewhat reasonably priced. We were upgraded to a luxury suite when we arrived to our room. I went to take a shower, the box of soap that it comes in when I opened it had a wet used bar of soap that the maids had left in there. I felt this was disgusting. When I called the front desk to report the probelm they offered to move again. But refused to do anything for us as far as any credit for food or off our stay. I think The Hard Rock Hotel has some issues they clearly need to address with their Maid staff because whoever is managing this housekeeping department should be fired. I stay here once a year in November and sometimes December as they have pretty good rates on Sundays. I wil return again but I am hoping that we can get some people who have nice personalities. Example the young dark haired girl who works in Cuba Libra in the mornings on Sundays is kind, helpful and friendly. The rest of the staff could take a lesson from her.

Reviews.Title: “Hate The Hardrock”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hardrock was horrible. My husband and I went to vegas for a wedding and thought if would be fun to stay at the Hardrock. The room was O.K. but there were stains on the bedding, blinds that would not open. The halls were loud at night, since this is obvibously a party hotel. They charged my credit card over $800.00 after we had checked out of an absolutely spotless room for damages. It took us two months to dispute and get a portion of the money back. MAKE SURE IF YOU STAY AT THE $$HARDROCK YOU TELL THEM ANYTHING WRONG WITH YOUR ROOM OR YOU WILL PAY.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that!”
Reviews.Author: sjp1
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas several times and decided to try the Hard Rock Hotel my last visit. I was not impressed at all! Being 27 years old I heard it was the place to go. It may be the place to go if you like to see people who don't have any money. I have never seen more low class kids than this place. I mean come one, have some class. The whole atmosphere seemed like an MTV dance party gone terribly wrong. There were loud and obnoxious rock star wanabbes all over the place. It seemed to me that there were more hookers in this place than the whole city of Las Vegas combined. The rooms were clearly in need of some updating. There were stains on the carpet's, the bathroom was dirty, and the sheets looked way past their prime. I did like the decor of the hotel though, especially the casino floor. Many of the dealers had crazy attitude's though. Like they were something special. How can you act like you are all that if you are a dealer at a casino??? Get a life! I will never stay at the Hard Rock again.

Reviews.Title: “Experience Was Bad...Except For The Pool”
Reviews.Author: dcdude
Reviews.Content: I had heard so much about The Hard Rock Hotel that I was really excited to stay there! My excitement quickly dwindled as soon as I entered the hotel lobby. It was a bright, sunny afternoon -- about 3:00 p.m. -- and the interior of the lobby was dark. I guess that The Hard Rock likes the "dark" look. At night, I think 'dark' can be cool...but it feels sort of vampire-like when it's sunny and gorgeous outside during the middle of the day. The Hard Rock, as you might expect, plays loud rock music. That's OK, except when you need to communicate with someone...like the front desk personnel. Speaking of, there was a long line at check-in...and it moved slowly. When I finally got the counter, I was surprised that I was not greeting warmly or with a half-smile. The front desk representative seemed like she would rather have been anywhere else rather than doing what she was doing. That's a turn-off. I asked a question, and she seemed annoyed to have to answer it. I knew at that moment that the stay might be problematic. The room was fine. It looked somewhat "worn," as the hotel is obviously constantly busy with lots of young partiers. I ate in the more casual, cofee shop-style restaurant for a late dinner one night. The food was TERRIBLE. I was shocked at how bad the food (and service) was. Wow. The one good thing that The Hard Rock has going for it: The pool. Well, not specifically the pool...but rather the people at the pool. In short, I saw the **best-looking** men and women I have ever seen in my entire life at The Hard Rock's pool wearing, of course, close to nothing. It's a surreal experience. You feel like you've walked into a photo shoot for some glamorous magazine. On future visits to Vegas, I will *not* stay at The Hard Rock again. The overall experience was very poor. (But I will try to visit their pool again!)

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After we booked our rooms for the Hard Rock my wife noticed a lot of negative reviews. I tried to change our reservation but it was too late so we decided to make the most of it. We arrived and things went good we checked in to our room and it was a standard room with a mountain view. Room was nice with a 42" plasma. After about an hour someone opened our door and walked in while we were getting ready. Didnt think too much of it (its Vegas) within the next 20 minutes another couple walked in saying they just arrived and they gave them the same room. I called the desk and they moved us to a luxury suite, we arrived there and they were still cleaning the room. We decided to wait and I went in to the restroon and one of the maids were doing a #2 in the bathroom. So the Bellman called the front desk and they moved us to the 3rd room within the first two hours there. We got to the 3rd room and it was ok for a "luxury suite" no plasma tv! We opened the french balcony doors and someone had puked all over the railing and floor. We called the desk but nothing was ever done about it. They did end up giving us a 100.00 credit to use for food. While checking out we noticed they had tried to charge us for Movies, Phones etc. We did not use anything. The highlight of the Hotel is the Pink Taco and Luckys 24/7 Resturant. Pink Taco has 2-1 drinks and 1/2 price appetizers. Which were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta love the Hard Rock.”
Reviews.Author: colooney
Reviews.Content: Granted, I usually stay at the Hard Rock mid-week for business so I rarely spend more than $120 for my room. I always find it to be a good value. The rooms are stylish and spacious. The staff is good. There is an abundance of nice restaurants and the hotel is so easy to get in and out of. Request a strip view room.

Reviews.Title: “Less-than-perfect...”
Reviews.Author: alohabc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the Christmas season and found nothing to brag about. We asked for early check-in when we made the reservations and they told us that they could not "promise" anything but would note our request. We arrived at the hotel at 8:30am and didn't expect to get a room at that hour but wanted to check-in and get the paperwork done. They said that we were the first to arrive that day so they thought that it would be just a few hours. They took my cell # and would contact us as soon as something was available. At 3:00pm they contacted us to say that nothing yet was available and did we still want to wait. I told them that it was hard to believe that, but yes we still wanted to wait. (I was somewhat stern). About 5 min. later they called to say that a room had just become available (what do you know?) Room was nothing special, view of the airport, etc. Restaurant service was terrible. Food was just ok. With as many hotels in this city, I will look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money Anymore”
Reviews.Author: txbecket
Reviews.Content: My most recent stay at the Hard Rock Hotel was in January of 2006, though I had stayed there nearly 6 years earlier. My first impression of the rooms during my most recent stay was that they are really REALLY starting to look run down. The linens and beds are still great, but the bathrooms are nothing better than you get at a 2-star hotel and they are starting to show wear as well. One of the best things about the Hard Rock used to be the pricing, but for the cost I paid on my most recent trip (out of fond memories and loyalty) I could have gotten a small suite on the Strip. One gets the feeling they have given up on trying to attract any real spenders in the hotel and have settled on attracting MTV Real World fans in their early twenties. The restaurants (most notably Mr. Lucky's and the Pink Taco) are still great and the gambling can be pretty good during the day, but for my money I'll be staying on the Strip from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At The Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas several times and have stayed at a different hotel each time. This visit was a short one night stay as we were only driving through Vegas. The check-in was quick and easy. We got to our room quickly (after parking in their parkade). The pool closed quite early that night (6pm) but I think it might have been slightly earlier than normal because they were doing some sort of re-tiling work on it later in the evening. The restaurants are great! (Mr. Lucky's 24/7 and Pink Taco in the hotel, and the Hard Rock Cafe on site, but not actually in the hotel) and we loved the loud music playing all over the hotel! This hotel is off the strip, so if you have seen and done everything on the strip and want a break from it, this is a great place to stay. It takes about 25 minutes to walk to the strip, or the hotel has a shuttle, or there are always lots of taxis available. The room was awesome! It is a slightly above average sized room for Vegas. We had a room with a pool view. The beds were very comfortable and the Bose stereo, big screen plasma TV, and stocked mini-bar were great extras! It was nice that the shower and toilet were separate from the sink and mirror. The only complaint I would have was that the bathroom floor didn't seem completely clean. There were spots on the tile (what looked like water spots from people getting out of the shower), but it wasn't a big deal as we were only there for a night and I always lay down towels anyway. The pool was the part of the hotel that I was most excited about so we tried it the next morning. It was wonderful! There was plenty of loungers on either sand beach areas or tiled areas. The "sand" however is more like rocks (I guess to keep it at the edges of the pool and not in the filters) and really hurt my feet so I had to keep sandals on when I walked on it. There are waitresses who will bring you drinks and food. The cabanas looked great with chairs, a fan and fridge and music, but we didn't rent one because we were only there for a quick visit. There is one area in the pool that is very shallow, like a lap pool so you can sit in the water to keep cool, but still be in the sun! There is even swim-up blackjack but it wasn't open as early as we were at the pool. This hotel is a great place to stay if you want to be away from the strip in Vegas. If you want a fun hotel with great staff, awesome music, and a lively atmosphere the Hard Rock is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Armpit of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BusTraveler
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, this is the worst hotel experience of my life. From a hooker ringing my phone at 3:30 a.m. before a 9 a.m. business meeting (thanks to a dyslexic hotel operator), to the all-night frat party next door, to a TV and Internet connection that didn't work properly, I can't understand why anyone stays here at all!

Reviews.Title: “Why All the Fuss?”
Reviews.Author: toddnath
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from the Hard Rock Hotel for Thanksgiving weekend, I'm a little surprised at all the negative feedback I've been reading here. I've always enjoyed my visits to the Hard Rock but this was the first time I actually stayed at the hotel. Let me attempt to clear up some of the complaints. The unfortunate thing about these reviews is that a hotel can be unfairly criticized for issues that are out of its control. Vegas is a tremendously popular destination, especially on weekends. As a result, there will be lines at check in, waits at restaurants, etc. Also, stop complaining about the casino taking your money, because you lost your shirt has nothing to do with the quality of the hotel. My check-in just happened to be quick and pain free, but yes, the $5 resort fee is ridiculous and unnecessary. I've read many complaints about the rooms, most of which I found to be blown out of proportion. Our room was equipped with a flat screen tv, Bose Wave radio w/ cd player, digital safe, iron & ironing board, & web capabilities. There were various cd's in the room to listen to and rock n' roll photos throughout. The best feature in the room was the window/door that actually opened up to the outside. I know of no other major Vegas property that has fresh air access. One reviewer complained that the alarm clock was bolted down and that it somehow cheapened the feeling of the hotel. The 'alarm clock' in question was actually a $300 Bose Wave Radio so you can understand why they might bolt it down. The water pressure in the shower was poor but otherwise it was a clean, comfortable room. I think a lot of people who don't regularly travel to Vegas need to understand that it's only been in the last decade that the hotels have been creating standard rooms with luxury in mind. In the past, the idea in Vegas was the more time people are in the rooms the less time they'd be spending in the casinos, shops, restaurants, etc so they never put much emphasis on amenities. As the high end casinos become more and more competitive, they've had to seriously upgrade the quality of the rooms to keep their clients coming back. Unfortunately, the Hard Rock was completed just prior to the onset of this change in philosophy. Nonetheless, this is still one of my favorite Vegas properties. It is small and manageable and I fit right in with the target demographic (under 35, single, rock n' roll fan). I had another enjoyable weekend there and I will continue to make the Hard Rock a fixture on my future Vegas visits.

Reviews.Title: “Warning: The Pool is CLOSED Nov.-March”
Reviews.Author: fallingdollar
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Hard Rock Hotel and were very disappointed. We chose to stay there because of the fantastic pool, only to learn AFTER check-in that the pool is CLOSED mid-November through March. No one told us this when making the reservation, on the website or at check in. I don't believe the rate was reduced to reflect this major drawback. We were able to sit out by the pool, but there was no drink service, music, restrooms. Swimming was "prohibited." This was especially disappointing since the weather was beautiful -- sunny and in the 70's. Several other guests we spoke to expressed the same disappointment, having also chosen the Hard Rock Hotel specifically for the pool. In spite of the the pool closure, they still wanted to charge us a $5 per day "resort fee." C'mon, Hard Rock. You can't be serious! We checked into the Wynn for the remaining 2 nights and enjoyed the gorgeous pools all day long.

Reviews.Title: “My loyalty is dwindling...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Hard Rock since it opened 10 years ago. In the last few years, I've stayed there 2-3 times per year. I was at the 10 year anniversary weekend. Whenever someone asks me where I stay in Vegas, I enthusiastically say "The Rock!" But my enthusiasm is starting to wane. With the exception of a few select hotels in this world, most hotels have problems in one form or another. So my expectations are not unrealistic. And as a result, I've overlooked a few incidents I've had at the Rock over the years (such as the time we checked into our room and found food beneath the sheets). Because in general, the staff is friendly and responsive. And it's just a cool place to be. But problems are definitely starting to surface. The rooms are starting to look a bit worn down (and some of them have a very strange scent). I don't appreciate being told that there are no tables available at Body English one month in advance, while also being told that they don't reserve tables more than a week in advance. It also bothers me that I get no preferential treatment whatsoever when I know that I stay there more often than 95% of their guests and regularly spend $1000+ in the casino in a night. Each visit feels like the first time. And their website -----. But I do love the restaurants - Nobu is one of my favorites. I love AJ's - I've eaten there multiple times and have never had anything close to the bad experience described in another review on this site. I also like the Rock Spa and Brannon Salon. And the casino is one of my favorites in Vegas because it doesn't feel like you're gambling with 10,000 of your closest friends (or their kids). I've also always liked the Rock's location off the Strip, which creates an atmosphere that attracts more locals and young people from the Southwest, and less tourists or kids. So while I haven't officially written this off as my Vegas hotel of choice yet, I am shopping around for other options (and the Palms is not a viable option...don't get me started on that...). To start, I'm checking out THEHotel in a couple weeks. And I'm looking forward to the W Hotel that is supposed to open across the street from the Rock in a couple years. Bottomline - the Rock is no longer the only game in town when it comes to the young, hip crowd that is increasingly using Vegas as a weekend playground. The sooner they wake up to it, the better - afterall, this is the city that is constantly reinventing itself.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock has gone downhill fast - STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The following is a copy of a letter I sent to the HRH after I received an email requesting a review of my stay. After the letter I have some additional info that you should read. Dear Mr Morton, Thank you for asking for my comments about my stay. I would like you to know that I travel frequently, I have visited over 20 countries, and I spend 20-30 days a year in hotels with three trips a year to Las Vegas and that this was my second stay at your establishment. I will tell you about my stay as events occurred chronologically. For starters, your online hotel reservations system is buggy. I made a reservation and for some reason it was automatically cancelled and re-reserved. I had to call to confirm my reservation. Also, I do not know why you do not include the $5 “resort fee” into the cost of the room. Am I going to be nickel and dimed at every turn? Is there an option of not paying the “resort fee”? If so, why was I not notified? What’s next, a bathroom fee? You could raise more revenue by requiring guests to place a quarter in the bathroom door. Is this a classy resort or a cheap motel? Upon arriving, the check-in line was short and I was able to get to a representative within 10 minutes of standing in line. The representative was professional, kind and courteous. Upon arriving in my room, I noticed that the carpet was still wet. While I appreciate that you shampoo your carpets, I feel you should wait until they dry before renting them out. It was somewhat uncomfortable to walk on it with bare feet. The carpet was a very cheap looking green/yellow and not the deep purple I remember from my last visit, but I suppose this is just a matter of taste - some people like the color of vomit. The bathroom was tiny, there was mold in the shower, the bar holding the curtain was rusted, the bowl was stained and the sink drained very, very slowly. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning the room and restocking towels and other supplies. I appreciate that there is a free room safe. I was impressed by the large flat screen TV in the room. One peculiarity of the TV is that once it was turned on, it became progressively louder and louder and the remote did not control the volume until it became uncomfortably loud. Also, reception on many channels was poor. Maybe you should include some aluminum foil and rabbit ear antenna so we can get better reception. My impression kept diminishing as I noticed that the alarm clock was bolted down. Do you really think we’re going to steal the alarm clock? I cannot remember the last time I stayed at a hotel that bolted things down to prevent them from being stolen. I’m starting to get the feel that this place is more of a cheap motel. I thought it was great that you have a refrigerator in the room, but I didn’t realize that it was sensors and that if you touch anything in there, you will get charged for it even if you put it right back. I know you don’t have a poker room even though on my last stay more than a year ago I was informed that a poker room was planned. This is understandable because poker is not very popular and no one likes to play (sarcasm intended). When I called the front desk to ask about the nearest casino with a poker room, I was misinformed that Terrible’s has one. I eagerly went there and found out that I was lied to and that they do not have a poker room. The next day at the pool was another disaster. At every hotel I have stayed at in every country in the world I was able to order drinks and food by the pool by just mentioning my room number and my last name. Not at your classy joint. There I was told that I would need either my ID or cash to purchase drinks. So, back to the room it was. Later, at about 4:15 I decided to order some food but the pool waitress informed me that the kitchen is closed. I’m sure you’ve done your accounting, but I was surprised that the kitchen would close so early considering the sun is still out until after 7pm this time of year. Oh well, your loss – I spent my money elsewhere. To top everything off, I clicked on the survey in this email and after I submitted it, I got a bunch of gibberish. Considering all else, this came as no surprise. As I mentioned earlier, I have visited Las Vegas many times and I have stayed at the Flamingo, Bally’s, Excalibur, Aladdin, Mirage, MGM, Stardust, Sahara, the Las Vegas Hilton and of course, the Hard Rock. I would recommend many of the hotels on this list, but certainly not yours. I’ll stay at the Palms next time. You can contact me if you need any clarifiacation. Sincerely, DELETED ***** In my letter I forgot to mention that the ice machine on my floor did not work. After sending this letter, they were kind enough to mail me a form letter addressing a few of my concerns. It was clearly a cut-and-paste job they send to everyone who complains. One month after my stay I noticed that my credit card was charged again for one night. I called and the accounting department had no record of my card being charged again. I had to fax them a copy of my statement before the charges were reversed.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Vegas every year for a 3-4 day getaway. Each year we try to stay at the Hard Rock. We don't always make our reservations soon enough. This year we waited too long and could not get a reservation. We stayed at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay and loved it but we did miss the Hard Rock. The Hard Rock has great rooms, especially if you upgrade your room. The restaurants onsite are all good and some of them are great. The casino is not so huge that you need a cell phone to find your friends. The music is always great and the other guests are usually pretty cool. Each year we discuss if we want to try another hotel. We always decide to go back to the Hard Rock. This year we had to stay somewhere else and it was very nice but I look forward to next year and will try to make my reservation sooner. If you like huge, sprawling casinos, like the MGM, then this is not for you. We enjoy going out and seeing the sights but then coming back to the relatively small Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: roknrol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock the weekend of October 7th, for a Friday and Saturday night. We chose the hotel because we love the music, and were there to see concerts on both Friday and Saturday night. At check-in we knew we were in trouble. The 20-year old clerk was very unprofessional and treated us like this was our first visit to ANY hotel. We had made reservations with another couple (to have adjoining rooms), but they had checked in earlier that day. When we checked in, not only were we not adjoining, but we were on another floor, and got 2 queen beds instead of the King we had requested. The room was very mediocre, slightly dingy, and the only partially redeeming factor was the 42"" plasma--which is the only reason our room could've been $399/night. The pool was great, but hardly worth putting up with the attitude of the waitstaff who could care less whether you stayed there or not. The Pink Taco restaurant was good when we finally ate there. On Friday night there was a 50 minute wait, and you had to leave your credit card at the front to reserve your table. (all for Mexican food????) Do not stay here if you want any kind of customer service or respect, because it does not exist at the Hard Rock Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not as good as I hoped.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew-Beaumont
Reviews.Content: I am a huge Hard Rock fan and wanted to stay at the hotel. First the good : Pool is fantastic - underwater music, slides, beach etc. Hotel is much smaller than 'strip'hotels which means walk is much less to car park. Music obviously - it is everywhere. Now the bad : Location - too far from the strip to walk - courtesy bus finishes at 7pm. Taxi is $8 each way. Ad hoc charges - $5 resort fee (for nothing - Hard Rock I expect the room to be good in Vegas so dont come that) Charged $10 for a crib!!! Charged to make 1800 calls from room Hard Rock Cafe was built around 'Love All Serve All' and 'Take Time to Be Kind' mottos. Sorry Mr Morton but you are trying to rip people off. When the Hard Rock Cafe moves to the strip next year, I think this hotel will struggle. My advice - you are better in a strip hotel - even on arrival date I could get better deals in Aladdin and TI than rate I paid for Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Pool Closes At 4PM”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I generally liked the room, the pool and the Hotel public areas which are of a good quality, although being located away from the strip is a negative factor. The clientel is also a nicer younger crowd than in other hotels in Las Vegas However, ALL the staff are rude and unhelpful. When you ask for the manager they hang up the phone or keep you waiting half an hour. They do not even attempt to solve your problem. Check in is at 5pm whereas check out is at 11am! (why does it take them so much longer to clean the rooms than in Europe?) The pool is rented for Private Parties EVERY evening/night, which means that it effectively closes at 4pm, when staff start to move you all to one end of the pool and then remove all sun beds and generally hassle you so that you leave. This can lead to confrontations between staff and guests that refuse to leave so early! There are hidden charges for everything! A resort charge of $5 /day is automatically added to your bill and it costs more than $20 to use the gym. Guests are secondary citizens in this Hotel as they obviously make more money from the private parties,events and casino and dont really care whether you enjoy your stay or not. One other negative point is the noise from the corridor leading to the bedrooms which can be heard clearly inside your room

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visit Las Vegas many times a year and I usually like to stay on the Strip. But this visit my friend and I decided to change it up and stay and the Hard Rock. We felt it would be a fun place to stay and be with others in our own age group. After check-in we ask the front desk about putting our name, as guest of the hotel, on the list for Body English. She told us to speak with the concierge. We did. He said a host would be calling us in our room. We did receive a call and he informed us our names were on “the list” for Saturday and Sunday nights. Saturday night we were too exhausted to go out, but Sunday night we made it down there. We approached security and told him we were on the list and where did we need to go. He said, “We should go to the bar, get a drink and stand in this huge line of others who were on “the list”. We got drinks and stood in line. As we stood there for 1 ½ hours, we watched and listened to security tell people that the club was locked down, it was full to capacity and they weren’t letting anybody in. During that 1 ½ we must have seen him and some of the hosts let in approximately 200 people. These people would come up and say they knew this person or that person. Next thing you know, they are going in with many others in their group. As you can imagine, this was very disconcerting to us. We then decided not to wait any longer and we went back to our room. I am sure had we given any one of the security officers some money would have been allowed in, as we saw this going on also. In addition to the fiasco at Body English, Saturday afternoon I was retuning to the pool from my room and one of the security officers, was very rude to me, as I was entering the pool area. As I was walking back to my chair at the pool, I stopped another security officer to talk to him about this officers horrible behavior. He claimed he was the “security manager”. I tried to tell him what happened, he was very disinterested and not any more pleasant than the first one. Not only is the security staff dreadful, but many of the bartenders and the waitress are also, especially at the pool. Friday afternoon we were in the pool, I asked four different members of the staff if they would get a waitress for us. We probably waited 2 –3 hours when one finally came by. And then she was extremely rude to us once we did order. And it wasn’t just my friend and I that had trouble with the staff, we heard many other guests complain about some of these same issues. In the guest rooms the beds are very comfortable and very nice. But our sink and tub had an awful drainage problem. The tub took probably 30 – 40 minutes to drain. Luckily there were only two of us. It would have been a horrible scene had we had more people staying in the room with us. I would think the Hard Rock would want their staff to provide good service to the guests. I would imagine they would want return guests and them to tell others how wonderful their stay was. I was absolutely amazed at the dreadful treatment my friend and I received during our stay at the Hard Rock Hotel.
