I sent a letter to Peter Morton at the Hard Rock and I did receive a phone call from one of his Vice President's. We discussed the situation for a few minutes and he offered a complimentary stay. I told him why would I want to do that!!!!! I told him I would discuss his offer with my friend and see what she thought, since it wasn't just my weekend that was ruined. He said, okay, and to call him back. I called back and left him a message. I never heard back from him. I then sent him a letter and still haven't heard back. Horrible service all the way!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but over rated”
Reviews.Author: McTravel55
Reviews.Content: March 2005 My wife and kids stayed here for 2 nights. It is a very nice hotel but not worth the exorbitant price. For one thing, it is to far from the strip. You can find better hotels at a better price on the strip. The casino is nothing special but the swimming pool is excellent. The room had a 42" plasma TV which was nice but we did not spend much time in the room. We booked this hotel at the last minute and it was the nicest we could find at the time. Next time, we will book further ahead and stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: cheesehead74
Reviews.Content: Having visited Vegas numerous times in the past & had my hotel rooms paid for by my employer, I didn't quite care where I stayed, but each visit I made it a point to cross Koval Lane & check out the Hard Rock. I did all my gambling there & ate at Mr. Lucky's & Pink Taco. I even made it out to the pool to take a look-which I'm not sure how I managed to gain access to at the time, not having a room key, which they checked each time on my recent visit-The pool is amazing, & it was the reason I choose to book a room here on my vacation to Vegas. From 9am until 6pm I would just lay out in the sun by the pool & order a Corona or dive in once I got too hot. The eye candy at the pool is truely amazing! Hot girls everywhere! It was like Spring Break in Cancun! And don't think that the pool is just someplace for celebrities & models under 30, there was a wide array of different people hanging out at the pool when I was there. Families even, with kids. As long as you don't mind loud Rock music-which you can even hear underwater in a certain area of the pool-and feel comfortable in a Rock N' Roll, laid back atmosphere, then you'll fit in just fine at the Hard Rock. I for one, loved all the music they played at the pool, 95% of which seemed to fit into the "Rock" category, either Alternative, Hard Rock, 90's Grunge, 80's, or Classic Rock from the 60's & 70's. I did hear a Dean Martin song one day, which was played right after the Scorpion's "Rock You Like a Hurricane", an interesting segue. The rooms at the Hard Rock are equally awesome as the pool. Flat screen Phillips TV's in a large room with pictures of Jimi Hendrix & Keith Richards on the wall, all decorated in a Nordic Minimalist style. One of the cool things about the TVs, is the muisc they pump in on several channels, as well as the Music DVD's they sceen on other channels. It was cool to watch old concert footage of Led Zeppelin on a huge flat screen TV when I came back to my room after gambling late one night! If youv'e read any of the other reviews, youv'e no doubt heard about the mini barrs in the rooms. The Front Desk staff are quick to point out that they are on motion sensors, & you will be charged if you move anything, so be warned. But $5 for a Corona is not bad, only $.50 more than at the bars downstairs. Keep in mind that Vegas is just like New York or LA, everything is more expensive, just accept that, & you will be prepared for your trip! A few other observations about the hotel; they will probably never have your room ready if you arrive before 2pm, I was on an early flight & got there at 11am. They did give me a key so I could go hang out at the pool, though. Just somthing to keep in mind should you arrive as early as I did. The Sportsbook bar was very cool also. If you gamble at least a dollar per hand on the video machines in there, they'll comp your drinks, so at worst you'll have gambled for free for a half hour or 45 minutes & paid for your drinks with the money you lost! Loved being able to watch like 8 baseball games at once, too! I'd love to be there during NFL season! Other cool things of note nearby are the Hofbrau House (German Beer Hall & Restaurant) across the street, as well as a small market (white building, red lettered sign) that will sell you sun tan lotion, aloe vera gel, soda, & almost anything else you could buy at the Hard Rock for half the price (suntan lotion @ Hard Rock=$10.95, at the market $5.95). You can probably buy beer there much cheaper, but you'd have to be discreet about bringing it back to the hotel, as that is strictly forbidden, & they have security watching the elevators in the evening, so I guess if you must drink as cheap as possible, bring it in in the daytime! I prefer to get my drinks at the circle bar or the sportsbook bar though, especailly if you gamble, & do well, they are pretty much free down there anyways! I did have 2 beers from the minibar, though. One right when I checked in & another the last night after I finished gambling. Oh yeah, if stripclubs are your thing (bachelor parties, guys night out, etc), Club Paradise is also across the street, you can walk there versus paying $35 roundtrip cabfare to somewhere else. Decent club, although you will probably go through your winnings quickly! One thing is for certain after my last visit to the Hard Rock, I will never stay anywhere else in Vegas again! Awesome hotel for the under 40 crowd!

Reviews.Title: “Most fun in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a Sunday night just to experience "Rehab" at the pool - it was my first time at the Hard Rock (I usually stay at theHotel or the Mandalay). In a word: incredible! The Rehab beach party on Sunday is even better than advertised. The entire Hard Rock scene is not for everyone - only 25-35 year-olds who like to see and be seen will feel at home. The casino is very small and gambling seems to just be a by-product of people hanging out! Other than the eye-candy and great beach party, I was very impressed with my room. I only paid $100, but they gave me a huge two-room suite facing the pool area and strip (excellent views from only the 5th floor). The suite appeared to be about 800sf with 2 large TV's, double french doors and two mini-balconies, a wet bar and the best audio sound system in Vegas - complete with a receiver and high-end Klipsch subwoofer that, along with the separate main speakers, produced top-notch sounds. Perfect for a suite party. In fact, the Hard Rock is all about having a party...day and night!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock the most sinful Casino!!”
Reviews.Author: Fredrock
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hard Rock many many times. I've stayed at quite a few Vegas hotels like Excaliber, NYNY, Tropicana, San Remo (soon to be Hooters Casino), the Orleans and the Palms. I don't know why I keep coming back to The Rock but I do. I love the pool and on Sundays they have a pool party called Rehab. I would not stay at the Hard Rock when the pool is not open, that's what they are known for...the pool. I would say the service at the Hard Rock is not all that great but they are known for that. And it's all good. It's a party house. From Body English the club(formally Baby's), the Joint (Beacher's Madhouse Comedy Show is great), to the circle bar. AJ's steakhouse is great....best shrimp cocktail and crabcakes in town. Like I said Rehab pool parties on Sundays is the bomb!!! Lots of eye candy for both men and women. It's worth taking a later flight back home or leave on a Monday. Rehab is open to the public but you would have to wait in long long lines (sometimes 3-4 hours on 3 day holidays). The Hard Rock is not a place where you want to get some sleep....um you're in Vegas....sleep when you get back home. You'll hear people crashing the symbols down the hall (there are drum symbols on the walls), to room parties to little naughty room action if you know what I mean. Don't be offended if you smell some strange cigarette smell down the halls. Like I said it's party house and don't bet on getting 1st class service. It does seem like half the OC are there on the weekends. You'll see a lot of fake boobs and lots of wanna-be Nick and Jessica's out there. You'll see a lot of whale tails (thongs that show when ladies sit) just walking around. There is a strip club across the street (Club Paradise) and some of the girls come to the circle bar after their shift to make some extra $$$. This is the most sinful casino in Vegas. It is off the strip and advise you not to walk especially in the Vegas heat. There is a shuttle that drops you off at MGM, Ceasars Forum shops, Fashion Mall. If you want to take a Taxi sometimes it would cost you a lot depends on where you want to go and how bad the traffic is. Best advice, if you can probably share a cab with someone going to another hotspot. Just yell out "who's going to Drai's, anyone wanna share a cab to the Palms" etc. Good way to meet up with some hotties that night. The taxi lines can get really long but they do move fairly quickly. I would try to find a taxi on the side of the casino then walk your way to the taxi line. Many taxi's drop off people on the side then you can grab that taxi. If you need some business work done or to print a a boarding pass for your flight, there is a kinko's nearby. I print out my boarding pass the morning I leave therefore I do not need to get to the airport 2 hours early. That's more time for me at the pool. Well hope this helps. I'll be back at the Rock labor day weekend!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Motel 6 with a guitar on the wall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided to rent two rooms and request that they adjoin so my 13-year old stepson, my hubby, and I had extra space plus the joy of two bathrooms. When we checked in, the rooms weren't ready, so we left our luggage in one and told everyone we would happily visit the Cafe. One of the rooms had to have the carpets cleaned (eew...don't wanna know why), so when we returned we had the lovely smell of wet carpet. The mountain view rooms (which really is a view of the airport more than the mountains) looked a bit worn. Like too many parties had occurred. The rugs seemed washed out and faded. The purple satin comforters on the bed probably looked regal during the first few months, but are now pretty beat. Four pillows in white pillowcases finished the "bedding," so it looked like dorm room decor. The mini-bar is completely sensored so I couldn't use if for my son's medicine (which had to be refrigerated). They told us we could rent a fridge for $25 a night. WHAT?!?!? That's just lame. We viewed the pool from one of the top floors, which had a tropical theme and COULD be great, but the water was murky. We went down to check it out, but it just looked dirty and uninviting. The whole place just seems to be neglected. We checked out after two hours. While the staff was amicable about not charging me $75 per room for canceling, they couldn't help but snidely add that they would be able to rent the rooms again to someone else that evening. I just smiled and said, "I'm sure you will." Then, we skipped off to THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay and we were in heaven. (Read that review...awesome place that made our trip enjoyable!) Sorry, Hard Rock. Ya already need a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “I checked out a day early.”
Reviews.Author: pitton
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas for my birthday and thought the Hard Rock would be fun. I ended up checking out a day early. The pool area was so crowded that my friends and I couldn't find a place to sit. The pools are poorly laid out and too shallow. The people were loud and aggravating. The rooms were noisy and we had to listen to jets arriving all night.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel was a great place to stay! Everyone from the staff couldn't have been friendlier to us. Smiles were everywhere. The room was very nice and the bed was very comfortable. The food was terrific. The cabanas are a nice place to relax in when you are at the pool. Check in and check out was a breeze. We are an early forties couple and we brought our twenty-three year old son for his first visit. We couldn't have chosen a better hotel to stay at for his first time in Las Vegas. We felt very welcome here. We hope to return again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: mrswho
Reviews.Content: We stayed there July 10-13. We were upgraded to a suite facing the pool, for no charge! It was awesome! The pool was great! the music was fantastic! My husband and I are 32 & 34 and really felt comfortable there. We didn't really do a lot of gambling. Mostly "hung by the pool" and the typical sight- seeing. It's definately the place to go if your not planning on "a lot" of gambling. It's more of the party atmosphere like everyone else has already said!! I would definately stay again and recommend it to anyone.!

Reviews.Title: “Great but its for a specific audience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a good time at the hard rock. The place is more geared for partying instead of gambling. The table limits are the same as any south strip casino. The food at the 24 hr diner is relatively cheap for its location. I also had steak at their steakhouse restaurant and it was as good as you would get anywhere else. I don't like the menu in the steakhouse b/c you order everything as one item. You order a steak at a certain price, then vegetables at a certain price and then a starch at a certain price. Doesn't make sense to me, they should just have one price for a meal. One thing to be aware of is that the hotel is about .7mi away from MGM Grand (the nearest casino) so if you don't have a car, you will need a cab for every trip. The rooms are very nice with their Bose radio and flat screen TVs. But, you will pay top dollar for a Saturday stay. HR customers are mostly 25-35. If you exceed this age range you will probably look out of place. I'm sure the Hard Rock will take your money, but when I get too old I will probably stay at Manadalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “One word to describe-AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmnla
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best hotel i've stayed in. Most comfortable beds around. If your a music lover, this is a must stop! I can't wait to go back. Bonus-there are 3 music chanels that just feature live music. I woke up and watched a U2 concert and Coldplay show (on plasma tv's no less) Absoulty wonderul!

Reviews.Title: “Rock Music At It's Best”
Reviews.Author: Anhonestmember
Reviews.Content: What a great place. Good, current rock music playing throughout the casino, no boring stuff that you hear just about everywhere else. It keeps you up and in the party mood. The decor makes you feel like you are in a rock 'n roll museum, there is plenty to look at. The pool is fantastic too, great service and surroundings with an excellent pool bar with food. The rooms are really nice and confortable too. You must have dinner at Nobu, which is in the hotel at the pool entrance, if you like sushi...very, very good, a little pricey but worth it if you like that kind of thing. Everyone is very helpful and friendly there, the circle bar in the casino is a great place to meet people. Finally, try and take in a show at The Joint, a great venue to see a concert. I always stay here when I go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “TRL!”
Reviews.Author: Gemma Storey
Reviews.Content: Not much more to add really, except that while we stayed at the hotel TRL was filmed in the pool and we got to see Mario, Shakira and Hilary Duff! The internet access in the rooms was shocking, really slow and awkward to use, though we were impressed with the huge screen and wireless keyboard. Would defo recommend this hotel to anyone, it is really nicely decorated and well kept, the pool are is clean and well managed.

Reviews.Title: “Take it from a Local!”
Reviews.Author: sexxdevil
Reviews.Content: Take it from me (A Local). After living in Las Vegas for 61/2 years, I have visited my share of Hotel Casino's. Hard Rock Hotel Casino is by far one of the KeWLeST casino's here. This has become a second home to me. I am known by alot of the staff. I have come across some bad apples with attitudes, but never let that effect my opinion of the place in general. The staff in Mr Lucky's are always awesome to me. Scott in particular gave the best service I have ever received. He has no problem making even your typical local feel like a VIP! Kudo's to him. Most of the dealers are friendly, some have had attitudes but dealing with thousands of drunk tourests daily, people spilling drinks on the table, people bending cards, smoking at the table (not all dealers are smokers) well, you get the idea. Anyone can have a bad day. I have seen more guest's that pissed me off then I have dealers. If you really want to have fun, track down a dealer named Bam Bam, this guy is a ------ to sit at a table and play with. Trust me he will make it for a fun experience. He's usually on Crap's or in the peacock lounge (high stakes room). Ok, no I have never spent the night in the any rooms, I will one of these day's. But I have had some dealings with alot of the staff and have always been treated friendly. You will not find a hotel in town that play's better good old Rock and Roll. I have been to Body English too, and this club is off the hook if you can get in. 7 to 1 girl to boy ratio. A true high class club. OMG! Rehab? Let me tell you this. I just celebrated my 35th Bday there. This was the most OFF THE HOOK pool party I have ever been to. More hot chicks in bikini's then you know what to do with. The service from Chris at the pool was great. Drink's, food, shot's, water, hot chick's, loud music, sun, what else can you ask for? Only one thing though. If you attend Rehab, you will truly need rehab for a few days after. They should change the name because this is not where you go after partying all week to be rehabilitated! This is a continuation of the party. Screw the night club's, get some rest and go to Rehab.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Cool”
Reviews.Author: telcogirl
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Las Vegas on a a business trip. The Hard Rock is a really cool hotel. Like anything else, it was its pro's and cons's. Pro's: VERY Clean - the elevators are polished down at least once a day. Leather walls and leopard print carpet, funky. The rooms are in great shape, kept clean and fresh looking. The entire hotel is spotless. Security - At night, there is a security guard posted at the elevators checking roomkeys. no room key - no elevator. The music rocks. It is just awesome to hear classic rock everywehere you go in the hotel. The pool........the whole beach club area is amazing. From the sandy beach that extends right into the pool, to the swimup bar and blackjack tables........it is a great place to hang out. The BOSE alarm clock in the room was spectacular. 102.7 is an all 80's radio station and to have that music on that clock radio every morning was a great way to wake up. The entire staff was tremendously upbeat and accomondating. The Pink Taco has some of the best Mexican food I have ever had. The bed was big and the pillows very SOOOO comfortable. CONS: Booked my room via the web and got a great rate, however my room faced the airport. I was told it was a mountain view room, which it was; the mountains were behind the airport. Extra charges for EVERYTHING. Room Servie adds a $3.00 delivery charge per order. HELLO ??? IT'S ROOM SERVICE. In addition, there is an automatic 18% gratuity added to the bill. Your $9.95 breakfast quickly turns into $14. The mini bar is on a sensor. If you move anything around, you will be charged. Also, upon arrival, I had an iced tea from the mini bar and someone was at my door within 15 minutes to re-stock. Kind of freaky knowing your room is being somewhat monitored. I purchased a sixpack of beer to have in my room. I expected the ice bucket to be filled when i came home back from work that day, but it was not. I assume they are not going to assist you in drinking for cheap at this property. The hotel is not on the strip and the complimentary shuttle stops running at 7pm. you will have to pay for taxi's to get back and forth, it is a pretty good walk from the Hard Rock to Las Vegas blvd. The pool is only open from 9am thru 7pm. So, if you are there for business, you are not going to be able to take a swm at night and enjoy this awesome spot in the hotel. There is a $5.00 per night resort fee added to the room that is supposed to cover the shuttle and pool area. But, again, both shutdown really early. The casino is small in comparison to other hotels in Vegas. Overall, I am glad I got to experience this resort. If you are with a group and don't mind splitting taxi's every night, I would recommend this hotel as a great party place to hang with your friends. Just be prepared to spend your precious gambling $$$$ on TONS of miscellaneous fees.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved it, Loved it, Loved it!!! Visited in June 05 and it was my first trip to Vegas. I'm in my 40's and people kept telling me that the HR caters to a younger crowd. I was worried at first that I might feel out of place. I was wrong to worry. There were a lot of young kids in their 20's and early 30's, but there were also people there my age and even older. The HR was the only place I wanted to stay and I was definitely not disappointed. Booked our room thru Expedia and got a great price. No problems at check in and within 20 minutes of arriving, our room was ready. Room was very comfortable. Great bed and great pillows! The lighting in the bathroom was great, three full length mirrors and a wonderful shower head - one of those "rain" showerheads. Within two hours of arriving, we ran into two celebrities - that was way cool. The pool is amazing! Crowded, but not uncomfortably so and very clean. Beautiful people and everyone was so friendly. Service at the restaurants and bars was great. The Center Bar was lots a fun and a great place to hang out on Friday night. The security guys at the elevators at night were not bothersome at all. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock is THE place to be - At least for bachelor/ette parties”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content:
Just got back from my bachelor party at the Hard Rock, from June 2 through 5, 2005. Let me just say that taking the following day off from work was the best idea of my life - I needed to catch up on my sleep from staying up basically for 3 straight days!!!!

Now, if you're reading this review to decide whether or not to stay at the Hard Rock, it's important to understand who the hotel is meant for. If you are part of a bachelor or bachelorette party or just with a group of buddies and are looking for a great time, this is, hands down, the place for you. The place is rocking 24 hours - every day I was there, I was up until 7 a.m. gambling, drinking at the casino bar and hanging out, and up by 10:00 a.m. to hang out at the pool with absolutely gorgeous women (about 50% of whom have fake breasts, by the way). Let me just emphasize, again, how GORGEOUS the women at the Hard Rock are (and the guys seemed to be good-looking as well, for you ladies). 24 hours a day, they have a really kick-a*s mix of rock music playing in the casino and at the pool. The nightclub in the Hard Rock, Body English, is awesome - it's kinda hard to get in, though, if you're with a group of guys - I only got in because one of the guys I was with is a major player at the casino. (And he couldn't even get all of my group in of about 15 guys, only 5 of us - the rest had to slip the bouncer a good wad of $$ to get in). MTV was there for two of the days we were there - one day we saw Black Eyed Peas, the other Fat Joe - we missed Snoop by a day. Another day I saw the actress Shannon Elizabeth on my floor. Down the hall from us, Run DMC had rented a ridiculously lavish suite for the weekend, and a few of my friends actually managed to get in for a party there one night. All in all, it was absolutely what we were looking for, and I could not have had a better time. Truly, a bachelor party to remember. If you're also looking to book a bachelor party in Vegas, don't look anywhere else!!

However, if you're looking to go somewhere in Vegas with your family and kids, or if you're part of an older crowd (my group was late 20's and early 30's), I'd advise you to stay somewhere else. After I get married and I take my family to Vegas, we're sure as heck NOT gonna stay at the Hard Rock. But if you're in my situation, this place cannot be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Purdie
Reviews.Content: Decided to contact our agents re booking at Hard Rock and was informed we would have to check in July when we were there to see if we still had rooms!! We booked into this hotel back in March this year and upon phoneing a few folk who live in the states were informed rebook another hotel because they also have heard bad reports and traveling all the way from the UK we really dont need the hassel of no place to stay after 14hrs of Travelling. We have cancelled our booking at the Hard rock and found some place else now to stay. All i can say is i hope the Hard Rock get they act together very soon with such attitude from staff and reports from people who have been treated rudely just remember we pay your wages.

Reviews.Title: “Better than anticipated”
Reviews.Author: ctribbs
Reviews.Content: My hubby, myself and another couple stayed at HRH from 5/15/05 to 5/18/05. We had standard rooms that we had gotten through Expedia for $95/nt. The room was better than I expected. The decor was contemporary in furniture style and the colors neutral. The bed was very comfortable and the feather pillows were heavenly. The plasma screen TV gave and excellent picture. Housekeeping did a great job of cleaning our room early in the day and responded quickly when asked for more towels. The bathroom was average w/ the shower head being very low so that my 6'2" hubby had to duck to get under it. It was also a very deep tub and you have to be careful getting in and out if it. The worst thing about the room was the bathroom lighting. It is horrible. It was nearly impossible to put on makeup. I had to put my face right up to the mirror under the small light and even then I couldn't see. I called to see if they had light up makeup mirrors and was told that they did not. My friend also noted that she had a horrible time seeing in the bathroom too. Definitely could use some updated bathroom lighting. The casino was very nice. We were pleasantly surprised. It is small and round. But even better, they had a lot of $5 min. tables which we were thrilled about as they are hard to find at most places. The piped in music was a much better alternative to annoying slot bells and whistles. The music had a lot of variety in the casino and at the pool. The dealers are very nice and made the gambling experience much more fun. The pool is really nothing great. I did not care for the sand beach part. The water temp was great and bar service at the pool was fast and efficient. The loungers were adequate and the pool towels were nice and big. We are in our early 40's and were led to beleive that we would feel out of place here. We did not. In fact we were about the average age of people staying and gambling there. We enjoyed our stay immensely and would definitely stay again. Next time however we will use the hotel shuttle to get to the strip. Registration neglected to tell us about this perk and we paid a lot of money for taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again, but Rehab on Sundays is great.”
Reviews.Author: rde45218
Reviews.Content: After spending 2 nights/3 days at the Hard Rock, I would not recommend staying here, just pay the $20 or $30 bucks to party at Rehab on Sundays. Pro's: Nice pool on Sunday, that’s it. Con's: Nickel and dime you to death. Be careful not to move anything in the refrigerator, it has an electronic scale that is hooked up to their wireless network. Your room will be automatically charged if anything is moved for more than 15 seconds. If you missed the 4 point sentence at the bottom of the price sheet, good luck explaining to the apathetic guest services Gestapo you failed to read the rooms' fine print. Want to go to the pool, but have family or friends in town or more than 2 people staying in a room. Pay-up. $40 per additional person per day over 2 per room. And make sure you don't lose the wristbands issued when you check in, they assume all guest are liars and will not issue you a new band without you issuing the hard rock $40. If you book through say Expedia and anything does wrong, for example you get a cot instead of a standard bed, it’s not the Hard Rocks problem. It seems the only thing they are obligated to do is take the $399 per night from Expedia and if they feel generous, offer to book you another room for an addional $399. Want to go to the pool and actually get a lounge chair, be prepared to wake up at the crack of dawn to reserve a chair with your towel. If you go to the pool past 9:30 there will be no chairs left, but there are $400 cabañas available. Overall, I was disappointed. Sunday at the pool was defiantly hot, but it seems their hotel guest clientele is mainly 20 and 30 something men. Since their pool policy is so restrictive, poolside Friday and Sat there were a lot men meandering around just looking at each other in disappointment. I’ve stayed at the Palms in the past and plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Deal!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was hands-down the best time we've ever had in Vegas. At check in we asked for an upgrade to our standard room and were given a spectacular, rockin' $600 suite COMPLIMENTARY! Wow, and this on Cinco De Mayo. Our room was dead center of pool view on the 8th floor and we had to force ourselves to leave the room to go swimming. Once at the pool, the sun shined, the water was perfect, the drinks were strong and everyone was in a state of euphoria! The casino has a great circular layout with a bar in the center (drinks were terrific, & not too expensive). Loved It! Only gripe is that we did not win a dime in the casino!

Reviews.Title: “Lovin' the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Six buddies and I planned a bachelor party at the Hard Rock from May 5th through 9th. We discussed a few options as far as hotel selection went, but we all decided to give the Hard Rock a try. Man, am I glad we did!!!!! If you are looking for a romantic getaway with your significant other, or a quiet, peaceful resort......move along, cuz' this place ain't for you. However, if you want to feel like you are living in a beer comercial for a few days, or even a "girls gone wild" video" (especially on Sunday at the pool) then this is your place. The rooms were great, beds were comfy, plasma TV's, big tubs....blah blah blah...you shouldn't be spending much time in your room at this place anyway. The dealers were crazy friendly and fun, even though they took all our money. As mentioned before, all the people there are beautiful. The have black jack and craps in the cabana by the pool and swim up black jack. The food from Mr Lucky's was good, so was the Pink Taco. Obviously, there is Rock and Roll music playing all the time. It is right beside the airport, so of course you are going to hear planes. The light shades in the hallway are cybels, so gee......I wonder if anyone is going to hit them. If you want quiet........dont go here.........if you want to party and have a great time........there is no where else to go!! The age range of guests is between 22 and 40, mostly 27-35 though. For those who gave negative reviews because your rooms were given away......after staying here, I'd be Pi$$ed too, but only because this place is awesome. Hey Hard Rock.......KEEP ON GIVIN'ER

Reviews.Title: “fantasy come true in las vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent and almost everybody was beautiful. It is a younger, hip crowd who are just trying to have a good time. The pool is fabulous and the decor (throughout the entire casino) is very hip and up to date. You get to see famous people, it is almost like being in a movie. Who wants reality when your on vacation? I would highly recomend this casino to people who aren't afraid to party and have fun all night long. The staff was helpful and playful. We had some of the best dealers that I have ever seen. The night club was exquisite, very upscale. A great experience all around!

Reviews.Title: “This place -----!!! Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I will NEVER EVER stay at this hotel again. What crap service. Of course, we got booted for next weekend too, because the Hard Rock cannot get it together for what is supposed to be their biggest weekend. I booked my room over a month ago, and when I called today after reading on TripAdvisor that this had happened to another person, I called to confirm, only to find they had “no record of my reservation. And they were really quite rude about. I even had a confirmation number and everything, which their explanation was “Someone forgot to enter this into the computer, and now we are oversold.” That. in my opinion, is unacceptable. I was planning a big weekend, had paid $300 to see Coldplay, and am now unable to do either. Oh, and one last kick in the ---, Nobu called to cancel our reservations due to a private function. Way to kiss celebrity --- Hard Rock, and forget about the real people. I will never stay at this crap hotel again, and neither should you.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!! Please read Before booking this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NYCharles
Reviews.Content: AWFUL! Hard Rock Hotel has RUINED my Birthday weekend!!! I assure you this will not be the first email of this kind that you will read on tripadvisor... My friends and I booked three rooms at Hard Rock 5 months ago for my 25th birthday. We are supposed to be staying there next weekend. Even called to confirm two days ago. Today we get a call from Hard ROck reservations that do to overbooking (they claimed they over-booked by hundreds!) they are moving us down the block to a motel... and there is NOTHING we can do about it! I couldn't beleive it, so I called and spoke to mangement, then the supervisor, etc, etc, and NOTHING that was it- end of story, we were out. It is too late now to replan the trip so now my friends and I are spending hundreds of dollars on what was supposed to be the best party weekend at some random motel. The Hard Rock graciously offered free passes to their pool- HA- thanks, can't wait. I honestly can NOT believe this just happened to me today. Can they do that?? yup. Its one of those things you read on a posting like this but dont think can happen. well it can at the Hard Rock! We were choosing between Palms and Hard Rock and the biggest regret is choosing this rotten place. Still can't believe it. HORRIBLE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience at the hard rock.”
Reviews.Author: ericmoe1
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here on a Sunday during peak season. I hosted a bachelor party here in July, 2004. Our group purchased tickets to the Hard Rock "Rehab Pool Party." It was quite a scary event, to say the least. Fights broke out, paramedics were called several times, and it was way too overcrowded; I just felt unsafe. And to end a hectic day at the pool, the Hard Rock EMT staff ran over my friend's foot (breaking it) with their stretcher loaded with a patient. The management would not provide medical attention to my friend unless he signed a Hard Rock release of all liability. So he had to hobble out to the street to await a public ambulance. So much for Hard Rock's "out of sight," minimize risk injury policy! All in all, I loved my stay at the Hard Rock every day except for the Sunday Pool visit. So, If you want to have your bachelor party at hardrock, skip the pool party, especially on a Sunday!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We didn't do so well in the casino but the food was great at the Pink Taco and at Luckys. D. DeLoach Jacksonville Florida

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convienently located to the airport, and not far from the strip. Hotel provides a free shuttle to the strip at the top of every hour, but not at night. Room is nicely furnished, but most impressive was the widescreen flat tv on the wall. Casino is not too big, so you don't get lost as in some of the ones on the strip, and table minimums are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiTravelgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the the Hard Rock February 22-24, 2005. I must say I fell in love with the hotel as soon as I walked in. The Rock & Roll atmosphere is fabulous and I loved the music. The front desk staff was very pleasant and accommodating. The room was very spacious and beds were very comfortable. There was alot of noise from the airport traffic, however, it didn't bother us in the least. If you are a light sleeper, you will want to request ear plugs. I do wish there was coffee in the room, but it wasn't a big deal. We rented a car this time, so we didn't try the shuttle to the Strip. When we wanted to go to the Strip, we drove & parked at Ballys. The only complaint I have about the Hard Rock is the concierge desk. Being a travel agent, I make sure when I am traveling, I take notice of how I and others are treated by everyone at the hotel. When we went to the concierge desk to ask a question, the gentleman was on the phone. He made no attempt to acknowledge us the entire time we stood in front of his desk. We stood in front of him about 5 minutes until finally giving up. This will be something I will mention to my clients when recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock for one night only over President's Day weekend, and loved it! Upon check-in, we were upgraded to a Suite that had a separate living room with huge TV, stereo system, wet bar, etc, etc. The bedroom and bathroom were very spacious, and everything was very clean. Despite the cool temps, we opened both sets of French doors to get some fresh air into the room. No complaints and kudos to the folks at the Front Desk for knowing how to please their guests!!

Reviews.Title: “not for the noise sensitive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The thing no one tells you is that this hotel is a few miles from the airport and that every five minutes during the night I was treated to a 747 headed out to some other destination. For those who are light sleepers this is not your hotel. Also, I travel extensively and haven't been to a hotel that did not have coffee in the room. Come on...if the Hampton Inn can do it so can you. I think this is a way for them to make money as a pot of coffee runs $17 by the time you get room service, tax and tip. For coffee lovers who can't live without this ends up adding $85 to a five day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommend Overall, With Minor Caveats.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock this past Sunday night, which was over President's Day weekend. I am a late-30's financial exec from New York City. Pros: Extremely efficient check-in and check-out....smart, fast, courteous staff at the registration desk. Very good staff all around also, including casino dealers. Everyone seems on the ball and hard-working. I ate breakfast at Lucky's, and it was excellent. Hotel looks great inside and rooms were fantastic, except for the very iffy water pressure in the shower. Lots of great-looking women walking around. Room rate for a long-weekend night was extremely reasonable and the best I could find among the top on or off-strip hotels. Cons: The day I checked in, there was some sort of massive motorcycle rally/concert in the parking lot below my room. It was incredibly noisy, and I was on the top floor of the hotel. Add this to the brutally loud jetliner noise what seemed like right outside my window (the hotel is right next to the landing path of McCarran) and you've got a prescription for a major headache. I was on the "mountain view" side of the hotel, so I do not know if it would be different on the other side. Take earplugs if this bothers you, or I guess you might buy them there. Overall: I would stay again, but on the Strip side of the hotel since noise does bother me. I do think the hotel should note this issue on the website to inform guests before they make a reservation that it may be an issue for some. It is a tribute to the rest of the hotel that despite this, I enjoyed my stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to navigate, fun to explore”
Reviews.Author: DavidHanna
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock for four days in late May 2004. I very much enjoyed my stay and am planning to return in mid-April of this year. I'm 40-something, but I didn't feel out of place at the Hard Rock in the least. On the contrary, I felt welcome right from the time of check-in. I requested a room in the new tower because I had heard rumors that the bathrooms were better laid out and appointed there. There were two (2) queen-sized beds and they were probably the most comfortable beds that I have had in a hotel anywhere. I was on the mountain-view side of the hotel and could enjoy that view from an extremely comfortable chair. As others have noted, the pool area is beautiful (I found it even more attractive than the pool at Mandalay Bay) and the cocktail servers were always very pleasant. That made it very relaxing to hang out poolside and enjoy a drink while people watching. Hard Rock's casino is probably too small for serious gamblers. I didn't play tables there, but I did kill some time at the slots during the afternoons and had about as much luck on Hard Rock's slots as anywhere else, I suppose. I seem to recall that cocktail service was good, at least when at the times that I was around in the casino. For the record, I would mention that I've been to Las Vegas several times and have stayed in various hotels, including New York-New York, Treasure Island, Circus-Circus, Paris, and theHotel at Mandalay Bay. I wouldn't stay at Circus-Circus or New York-New York again, but Treasure Island would be a remote possibility. I liked theHotel at Mandalay Bay (and MB's pool is nice), but I wasn't awed by the place like so many seem to have been (I got an offer there at the time for $159/night but I question whether I would pay that for it again). The Paris is excellent and its casino is one of the most attractive in Las Vegas, but if you want an attractive pool scene, you won't find it at the Paris. Therefore, stick to the Paris during the cooler months. One final note: I wouldn't recommend Hard Rock for the first visit to Las Vegas. It would be wiser to stay on the strip for better access to explore the other casinos. I've been there and done that, though. I'll stay at the Hard Rock and enjoy a drink at the pool then gamble at the Paris and the other Caesars Palace-affiliated hotels and downtown. The rest of you hard-to-please 40-somethings can stay at theHotel at Mandalay Bay. Just don't come complaining to me about how hard it is to use MB's comps. Live and learn. See you in April Hard Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Not Rock and Roll Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Lindymagoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March, 2004 to celebrate my daughters' 21st birthday. We attempted to check in around 1:00 p.m., but were told the room would not be ready for several hours. We walked across the street to the Hoffbrau House, and had a great meal served with authentic German beer on tap! Upon our return, we were told the room was still not ready, even though we arrived later than the estimate they had given us earlier. The front desk staff was rude, and the "tude" did not improve during the course of our stay. I definitely got the feeling we did not fit the target demographics for the hotel, and because we were a tad "older" (over 40)we were not welcome at the HRH. When I questioned what the "resort fee" was for, I was told that it was for things like the pool (that was closed the whole time), the phone in the room, (gee, paying extra to have a phone?), and towels. HUH? Most hotels include these items in the daily rate. Not here. The rock and roll decor, music, and even the elevators are great fun. We also enjoyed the size of the room, and the french doors that opened for fresh air. The noise from the low flying planes was a bit of an annoyance, at times, however. The beds were quite comfy, and the bathroom and toiletries were very nice. The casino was energetic and fun, but we found the slots to be a bit tight. Yes, this place is definitely for the 20-somethings, and the center bar is one big meat market at night. We even experienced the "joy" of having college age kids falling down drunk around us, but have to say security was pretty good about keeping the drunks in line. Overall, the Hard Rock Hotel was not a heavenly experience, but we do understand its' appeal to the masses. Even my daughter, who generally loves everything Hard Rock, found it to be elitist and unfriendly. We are planning another trip to Vegas in May, and my 25 year old son wants to stay at the HRH for the pool, but "the fogeys" will be staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock has it all”
Reviews.Author: lemonade
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (36/41) stayed at the Hard Rock recently and loved it. The staff was outstanding. We asked maintenance to fix a slow draining tub and it was fixed immediately. Even with several events happening the week we were there, the hotel was not overly rowdy. The walls between rooms are thin though (we heard our neighbor yawning). Music played in the hotel is typical rock stuff. It is not loud. The restaurants in the hotel are great also. We felt that staying off strip was a great choice. Only thing that bugged us was driving in and out of the hotel property. It can be tricky at times because the traffic can get nuts especially when there is an event at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My Happy Place!”
Reviews.Author: kksummergirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hard Rock three times and it gets better with every visit! If you’re looking for a relaxing vacation, look elsewhere, because this place is a 24-7 party. The experiences I’ve had hanging out at the pool have been a blast. Where else can you stand around in a gorgeous pool with a drink in your hand (try the Sweet Tart, my favorite!) and meet great people from all over the world? I still keep in touch with some guys me and my girlfriends met more than 2 years ago. It’s just a great setting and everyone is so nice. I like to call it a Spring Break for 25-40 year olds! Every time I’m there, we don’t leave the pool until 7/8 PM when it closes…I’ve been chased out of that hot tub at closing time more times than I’d like to admit. It’s just that difficult to leave! Another aspect of the Hard Rock that just sucks you in…the Circle Bar. Again, you’ll meet great people, make friends and the bartenders are great. Get down there early and get a seat. This entire place is so much fun, the last time we were in Vegas, we left the property TWICE…one time to go across the street to the liquor store. The other time was on our last night in town, we forced ourselves to leave and go to Olives at the Bellagio for dinner. While dinner was great, we went right back to the Circle Bar afterwards! My friends and I can’t get enough! On top of all of this, the rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. The beds are unbelievable…soft sheets, great pillows, etc. Get a pool view room if you can…it makes a huge difference. We love the French doors, being able to get fresh air in your room is a rarity in Vegas. I personally like the rooms that have vanities outside the bathroom (not sure if this is the older or newer section), makes it easier for two or three girls getting ready. I’ve found the staff to be friendly and fun every stay, even on Memorial Day weekend last year when the place was mobbed. I love the Hard Rock, my “Happy Place”, and I can’t wait to return in March!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a member of the (let's say) older crowd, I'd thought we might be in trouble staying at the "Rock". I could never have been more wrong in my life. Everything was great. All the staff members treated us as if we had been long time guest at the hotel even though it was our First Trip to Vegas.Some even went out of their way to help us get around the strip. The room was large and had an excellent view of the strip. It really was a lot more then I was expecting. The choice of music they played was great and in fact reminded us of our high school days. Our only wish was that it was a tad bit warmer so we could have use the pool, but hey they can't control the weather (although I think if they could they would have)

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nothing could have been better. the restaurants & pool are some of the finest in the country. Even though I was in Las Vegas on business, I had a day to enjoy the surroundings & relax by the pool. Simon service is second to none. The steak was awesome......Try it, you'll like it too.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Rocks”
Reviews.Author: MJthetravelerfromMN
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Hard Rock several times. I would never stay anywhere else. Definitely for the better-off 25-40 single or single-seeming crowd (what happens in Vegas...). Don't bring kids...seriously. The mood is sexy and friendly and the music makes it a party atmosphere at all times. The bouncers at the pool keep things in line, so it never gets too out of hand. But it is a crowd that doesn't go too nuts anyway. Just laid back party mode. It is small enough to get to know a lot of people around the pool. We spent many a night at clubs with people we met around the pool that day. A definite plus. And best off, you don't have to walk 15 miles to run to your room from the pool, at least on the main hotel. And the rooms are pretty cool too. Unless you are next to a suite that hired a d-jay. But if you just join in their party, it doesn't bother you much. Most of the staff is the bomb. The waitresses are all fine and friendly (this from a woman), and the male staff are usually good to look at and basically okay, though they chat little. The bell-hops are great! The drink slingers are okay if you tip appropriately...and you should at a place like this. So go there.

Reviews.Title: “Why Resort To A Resort Fee!”
Reviews.Author: SimonLancaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at three hotels during an eight day vacation in Vagas. This was the best..but..If I mentioned the other two you wouldn't be suprised!! All smiles at check in .....from both sides of the desk..we just love your English accent et al... and then the words I was waiting for" and there will be a $5 RESORT FEE PER NIGHT for, and get this..OUR UPGRADED AMINETIES" when I enquired where the Resort, ie pool area was to be found, the receptionist, still smiling told me it was closed..???!!..??..!! say what? Come on pleaaaaseee if you really feel you must con another $5 from your guests why not include it in your room rate or not as the case may be when the thing is closed!! Nice room for Vegas.. no gold or marble in sight thank god. Simon's restaurant also very good When I wanted some "FREE" and thats not a word that seems to be understood here, help from housekeeping ( I'd locked myself out of my holdall) all I got was a no can do and an uninterested attitude from the front desk. The same front desk not 5 minutes earlier said who wondereful my accent was while slipping the aforementioned RESORT FEE into the conversastion..short memory or 2 Faced. After a three minute plea ( I had no clean clothes after enduring a 14 hour trip from the UK) the receptioist told me that someone would be up in 15 minutes to help. Some how.. after remembering reviws on this site. I thought no o ne will turn up. And guess what...no one did. So no night out.. no clean clothes and a trip to the local hardware store in the morning to purchase a junior hacksaw ($4) and after 10 seconds in got into my holdall( the tip to the housekeeping would have cost more so I made a buck or two there..sorry Hard Rock). All in all a good hotel for this town but do not desert your guest as soon as you have relived them of their dollars and do somthing about your RESORT FEE situation.. you dont need to charge it so DONT

Reviews.Title: “Like an MTV Party!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having heard mixed reviews about the Hard Rock, we were a bit nervous about our stay there. On arrival we were told that the booked room was not available and that they could arrange a room for us at some other crummy hotel. After explaining that we had come from England and that we were on our honeymoon, the lady checking us in changed her mind an upgraded us to a suite - which was amazing - as was the rest of our stay! The food was fantastic - especially Nobu. The casino is not too big but full of young people having fun. And the pool! It reminded us of an MTV Beach Party with good music (also under water), palm trees, beautiful young people and a great vibe. Loved it! Oh, and we also got flashed by a random girl in the lobby - so that was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great!”
Reviews.Author: lrobin622
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HR over thanksgiving and was impress by somethings and other well lets just say not as good as I had hoped. Checked in mid afternoon with no problem, no line, fast service was great. I hadn't eaten all day so decided to go Pink Taco for a late lunch. I was impressed with the food and setting. After that I went walking around hotel and casino, I had pictured the casino being a bit bigger, but no worries it still had all the gaming tables I would like. I would have liked a bigger sports betting room, it was quite small compared to many casinos. As for my room, I loved the french doors that open to let the fresh air in room. The only problem is the hotel is located close to the airport so you will get a lot of noisy from planes coming in. I spent quite a hours at the Center bar and found the bartenders to quite friendly, they offered me ticket to see Tears for Fears one evening. The only real draw back is that is not on strip, if you plan on walking to the strip use the shuttle service provided by the hotel. The walk is over a mile and not throught the best of part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Veneitian for two years running we decided to try out a smaller hotel, and the Hard Rock was our baby. In our previous trips we always enjoyed the dealers and the casino at the HR so we thought we'd also try the hotel for once. What a great idea it was. We had a large group with 10 people and 5 rooms. They put the 5 rooms right in a row, all interconnecting. The front desk staff was kind and professional. I read several horrible reviews so I was worried about this part- well, don't believe them. Without fail EVERY staff member I encountered in our 4 day stay was great. Again, we are used to the venitian, which had 700 sq foot rooms at about 400/night. So you're getting a good reviewer here. I have high expectations and was NOT let down. The HR rooms will surprise you right away. They are plainly appointed, but the money is put where it counts- the beds. The bed was among the most comfortable I've encountered in any hotel stay. Down comforters, super high quality sheets and fanastic pillows guaranteed a sound sleeping experience. Each room also has a 50 or so inch plasma tv on the wall, which is awesome. If I could complain about anything it would be the complete lack of soundproofing. You can hear every conversation in the hallways and every peep from the rooms next door. Rooms 220-238 or so have administrative offices accross the hall from them, which helped here. It was relatively quiet for us. If you had some partying room next door though, you would not get any sleep unless you were deaf. The casino is unbeatable. I have gambled at almost every major casino downtown and on the strip and have never encountered nicer dealers. There is also rock and roll playing in the background, which really makes losing your money more fun. The casino is small and cozy- fantastic. Don't doubt the Hard Rock- it is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “The last hard rock visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well. let me tell ya. I stayed at the Hard Rock opening weekend back in 1995, and have never stayed anywhere else. I would estimate probably 25-30 stays, some as long as six days. I always got stellar service. I got engaged at the Rock, honeymooned there, and spent my first aniversary there also. Now, we come to October 2004, my second anniversary. Heres where it all goes bad. I booked the room through another travel site, in full, on my credit card. I suppose its my fault, but I did not bring this credit card with me to the hotel. Upon trying to check in, I was informed by the clerk that I would not be allowed to because of the absence of the card. Their attitude (expressed to me by more than one employee) was "there is nothing we can do" and basically, my only option would be get back on the plane to Los Angeles and get my card. I had never been asked before to present my credit card for inspection before, the hotel always kept it on file. I also had never incurred any incidental room charges or done any damage to any room I stayed in. After much negotiation, I convinced the 'head honcho" desk clerk (who looked to be about 19) to accept a faxed photocopy of my credit card, front and back. Not an easy thing to get someone to do 400 miles away at 6 pm on a Monday evening. Even though this eventually (3 hours later) got me into the room, the "Honcho" made me feel as though his behind was on the line, and he truly was doing me a huge favor and I should kiss his ring. The attitude of the people I dealt with was never "Lets see how we accomodate you and solve this problem", it was more like "Sorry. Next." Its amazing how one experience can sour 9 years of fantastic memories. It was surreal. I couldnt beleive that was how the Hard Rock was going to do business. I felt like I was truly snubbed and blown off by the staff, who obviously couldnt give two yanks about my situation or how to take care of me. Thanks, but no thanks, Hard Rock. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Hard Rock restaurant, only it's a hotel”
Reviews.Author: rollin59
Reviews.Content: My company reserved this place for a trade show. Hard Rock Hotel was not as bad as I'd feared based on other reviews. It was not a convenient location for a show at the Convention Center. Relatively small, HRH is more convenient than the very large hotels (shorter lines, less waiting for cabs, etc.) Visualize a Hard Rock restaurant, only it's a hotel. The historic costumes and guitars displayed were kind of interesting. The musical theme was well done throughout. (E.g.: Zildjian cymbals for corridor light sconces). The lobby is very loud, and the main restaurant was closed for a group, so only breakfast restaurant available was Mr. Lucky's (loud, crowded, smoky and overpriced). One morning they were working on the lobby floor with a jackhammer. Instead, I got room service, which was prompt and very good (expensive, $18.00 for a waffle and coffee, about the same as Mr. Lucky's). I did not eat in the restaurants but friends said the Japanese restaurant was good. At night, security made a decent effort to check for room keys at the elevator. The taxi starters/doormen were helpful. The desk staff was prompt. No check in / check out issues. The casino waitresses are all dressed like hookers in fishnet stockings & leather minipants. Service at the elevated bar, located in the center of the casino, was good and the ever-changing colored lights were cool. Drinks were pretty expensive at the bar and at the gift shop (Coors Light, $3.50. Each.) No minibars in rooms. The room itself was pretty good, with French doors opening onto the pool. However, the jet exhaust from arriving planes and loud music outside prompted me to keep them closed. Live or canned rock music plays continuously in the pool area from 9AM to 10PM. It was too cold to use the large pool area, which consists of palm trees, a fake "lazy river", a shallow pool and swim up bar. Nevertheless, I got dinged for a bogus $5.00 per night "Resort Fee" whatever that is. All in all, the HRH is the Hard Rock Cafe of hotels. Not great, but not that awful. Personally, if I went to Vegas on my dime (which I don't), I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “I just love it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite Las Vegas hotel. It's small, behind the strip which makes it cozy and without so much traffic nor noise. Rooms and spacious and very modern. But the best is their pool and beach. Lesss expensive that other hotels, it's the best value while in Las Vegas. I would love to live there!

Reviews.Title: “Phew! Good times at Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a bit leery of the 'party' atmosphere and customer service after reading a lot of the reviews of Hard Rock, but was pleasantly surprised! I did not get attitude from the staff, they in fact were very helpful and made me feel safe to walk around with all of the MANY guys that hung out at the circle bar (and everywhere else). Circle bar rocked b.t.w.! Good prices and service. Food was pretty good at Lucky's - Pink Taco was awesome! Pool looked good, but closed at 6pm (including the hot tub) so didn't have a chance to see it. Did I mention that there are tons of guys? Not all of them wanted to hook up (thank goodness!), but lots were up for it if that's what you are looking for! Ended with a massage at the Rock Spa and it was well worth it. Watch out for the $6 bottles of water in the rooms...you drink it, you get charged for it!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: HBrooks_8
Reviews.Content: Compared to the other large hotels on the strip (such as MGM which are just to big!!) the Hard Rock is an ideal size, you don’t need to have a map just to find your way back to your room!! It was very busy on the weekends, the swimming pool area was jam packed, especial on Sunday when they have their “rehab beach party”, but the rest of the week it was quiet. It was a bit of a drawback that we were set so far back off of the strip (about a 20 min walk), but taxis were only a couple of dollars and there is a free bus which runs till 7pm; and we did have an amazing view from our room (on the 10th floor), which was of the entire length of The Strip; especially amazing at night.

Reviews.Title: “customer care-I do not think so”
Reviews.Author: referee
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed at this place a couple of years ago, during it I slipped on their slippy tiles in the bath-room, broke my ribbs and taken to hospital by ambulance, treated brilliantly at the Suncoast Hospital, but was in terrible pain when Iarrived back at hotel, as the pain was so severe, I believed it would be impossible to move out the next day as we had planned to do [we would pay of course], I called and spoke to the manager, regarding this, imagine our horror, when he told me that this was out of the question, that his hotel was booked out, that the best he could do, was to allow us a late check-out, 12-noon, I did contact contact a local solictor regarding this matter, but they said that I would be wasting my time , going further with this matter. customer care I, do not think so

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock....whatever”
Reviews.Author: SwamiG8R
Reviews.Content: Not a big place, nor very cosy...it is surely for the youth, with ALOT of money.... Other than being made feel like you are intruding on someones "break time" every time you try to order/buy/eat something in this place, and the trash all over the pool area, and the distace from ANYTHNG, without being told there even was a shuttle....other than that, it was ok

Reviews.Title: “Slots go nowhere”
Reviews.Author: Jaybie1
Reviews.Content: James Billie is right these guys will never do what he did. Slot machines with Bingo cards and balls? Big rip off. First time visit and yet while I was there Wheel of Fortune never turned for anyone. Weekend should be busy but hardly anyone on machines. Lots of complaints. The new leaders that ousted Billie better go back to the drawing board. The only thing there worth any kind of play is evening Bingo. Morning and matinee Bingo run like jet propelled too fast and too sloppy. When you can walk into a Casino and find hundreds of machines available on a weekend that casino is in trouble. Don't waste your time or money on the slots. And be prepared to stand in line for hours to play poker. Poker room is so small with only 15 tables. Much better action in CT Foxwood or Mohegan Sun or Atlantic city Hurrah's or Taji Mahal. Don't like Hard Rock heading for Vegas but will not play at Hard Rock . Hotel too expensive for my taste. No freebees any where. They want my money but they give nothing back in return. Winners usually spread good words. And I was a winner! How about some freebee stuff incentives they are called you have to lure me there.

Reviews.Title: “Did we stumble into a Bachelor Party???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at the hotel, nor will we ever after visiting the Hard Rock Casino...It was packed with greasy, grimy looking 20-somethings that looked like a bachelor party gone bad. Women dressed in a halter top and lacy boy short panties with bunchy looking behinds (no, these were not the Pretty People at all!) Bathrobes everywhere, and the guys all wore LONG SLEEVE button down shirts and tighty witeys-Tom Cruise style. I am no prude but I wasn't expecting stripper costumes and bathrobes! We just wanted to party and have a good time. Don't they have ANY dress code? Go if you want to see Freaks and the less fortunate looking trying to outdo the other women in sleazy attire.....

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Here Again If You Paid Me!”
Reviews.Author: rosegorham
Reviews.Content: As alot of other reviews here have previously stated this and it is true, this place needs a serious attitude adjustment. If you are not the right 'type' of person at this hotel ie young, beautiful or famous then expect to be treated as if you don't exist. My husband and I checked into the hotel on a Sunday morning for a 2 night stay. Beware of the $5.45 per night 'resort fee' they tack onto your room rate. When we questioned what this was for, we were told it was for the 'free shuttle' (which only runs to the strip between 10am - 7pm on the hour) and 'free local phone calls'. So we are paying $5.45 per day for something we are getting for free we asked? I could tell even the desk clerk was embrassed by the charge and I expect he gets a lot of complaints about it. We had to wait 45 minutes for our room which really wasn't a big deal. While we were waiting we were given pool passes which are basically wristbands which allow you to enter the pool area. Sunday in the pool area is called rehab day and if you want to see posers as far as the eye can see then this is the place for it. If you can get into the pool that is. On our first attempt to get into the pool area we were told it was 'full' even though a lot of people were walking past the security guard (they have a security guard on the pool entrance) without wristbands. When we questioned why this was when we had wristbands and were registered guests we got a nice big shrug of the shoulders and were told to move out of the way as we were blocking the entrance! We did eventually go to the pool area which is NOTHING SPECIAL. Honestly it is small and cramped and not at all attractive. I don't see the big deal in it. How it got top 3 pool in Vegas is beyond me. On Monday we also went to the pool and were only able to get a towel after the staff decided to stop having a towel fight and serve us. We found half of the pool was closed because the pool area 'wasn't busy' but once again this hotel has one rule for guests it likes and one rule for guests it does not because we did see guests swimming in the 'closed' section but when we asked why, we again got the infamous shrug of the shoulder! The in-pool blackjack tables are closed during the week though I suspect if the right type of person came only they would be opened up. The only place we ate was Mr. Luckys which was okay but very expensive and it took them 3 gos to get me a cup of hot tea, I got brought a latte first of all and then a coffee! The rooms are nothing special, in fact they are quite dull and I had to wait 30 mins to get paid out on a slot machine. I think this hotel lives on its reputation cause it hasn't got much else going for it.

Reviews.Title: “cool pool, cute girls, but dull nights.”
Reviews.Author: rsrtTrvlr
Reviews.Content: Generally I loved it. I did not detect any attitude from the staff or the employees of the shops or retaurants. The female staff were all cute and sweet. The pool was really great. I was a bit dissapointed in the lack of nightlife aside from gambling. I was hoping the nightclub would be open or that there would be pool parties at night. I was there during the week however, so weekends might be different. I do think security should be a little more vigilant. I saw people smoking in the elevators, and flicking their ashes onto the carpets. In general, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great People Watching”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock last summer with my husband and two teenage kids. It was a last minute vacation and the Hard Rock was the only one that had reasonable prices. I was a little hesitant about being off the strip, but it ended up being fine as they have a shuttle that goes back and forth every half hour. Check-in was a breeze unlike many Vegas hotels. We checked in early because our flight was early and they gave us a room with no hassle. The whole family loved the pool- it was spacious, yet private. Rock music was in the background but not too loud and we could still lay back and take a nap. The whole family loved the waterslide but we all agreed that the best part of the pool is the comfy floats you can rent and float around the pool in. We loved the size of the hotel. It wasn't huge like all the other Vegas hotels, so we could easily access the rooms and it didn't take forever to walk from one side to the other. The staff treated us like individuals and by the second day, the cocktail waitress at the pool knew exactly how we like our drinks and she would just bring them out for us- it was great! The casino was small, but we didn't use it much anyway. They could improve the dining options, though. The bedrooms were wonderful- the beds were extremely comfortable (pillow top matresses and egyptian cotton sheets), we had different pillow choices, there was a small balcony, and there was a nice sitting area. In the bathrooms they left tiny tubes of toothpaste along with the usual shampoo and lotion. When I told a lot of people that I was bringing my kids to the Hard Rock they thought I was crazy since it has such a bad reputation. It was definately a wild, young adult crowd, but my kids have seen worse on an episode of the "Real World." Plus, it made for great people watching and you might even catch a glimpse of a celebrity (my daughter got some rock guy's autograph at the pool). The main floor was a little too smoky for my taste, but everywhere else it was fine. I will definately stay at the Hard Rock again and I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “I had a blast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to the Rock, tipped the registration clerk, got upgraded to a deluxe suite. Room was excellent, nice picture of Janis Joppelin in our room. We had a nice hot tub/jacuzzi in our room, where i was able to order cadillac margaritas deliverred to me in the hot tub. Also had a pool view overlooking the strip and the famous pool. During our stay we got to witness stripper dodgeball championships, unbelievable. The hotel offers free transportation to the strip. All in all it is good stay off the strip, away from all the families, and traps of the huge casino's. Go during the week for best rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing special”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently on July 31. Our stay was okay but nothing to brag about. We checked in rather late but encountered absolutely no problems and courteous service. The bellman, doorman and security were very friendly. The room was clean but no water glasses. Called housekeeping with no answer. Called front desk and it took more than 30 minutes. The walls are paper thin and you can hear your loud neighbors easily. The housekeeping staff was really rude and woke us up at 8 AM with tremendous laughing, talking, walkie talkies blaring and vacuuming without turning it off right outside my door! I heard "towels for room 355 and the like for what seemed like an eternity. It seemed like they were conducting their union meeting right outside my door. With the three hour time difference and a long flight I just wanted to sleep to 10 AM. When I opened the door to ask for some quiet they continued their loud banter. I spoke to the manager and he was wonderful and sympathetic and at least made me feel better. This is definitely a hotel for the young. The pool area looked awesome.

Reviews.Title: “It depends on what you want”
Reviews.Author: ljnative
Reviews.Content: I am early 30s, a little old to consider myself hip or cool, but I have stayed here twice, both times during the week, and it has always been fine. It is not a place for serious gamblers or people who generally like the traditional vegas scene, but I prefer it because it is less crowded and overwhelming than some of the larger strip hotels. The pool is great, sandy lagoon, water slide, cocktail service, etc. I ate at Nobu and it was ok - Pink Taco good for drinks and a quick bite. All that being said, I would never try to stay here on a weekend. The rates are outrageous and I am sure it is extremely crowded at that time. Also check their concert calendar - you might want to coordinate according to who is (or isn't) playing during your visit!

Reviews.Title: “It's a great place”
Reviews.Author: DavidPortland
Reviews.Content: I'm shocked by all the negative reports on the Hard Rock Hotel. I've stayed there three times and would definitely go back again. Yes the clientele is twenty-something but what's wrong with that. I'm in my late 50's and enjoy being aroung the young folks. I must admit that all my stays have been "off season" with no major events going on and therefore extremely reasonable rates ($49-69). Their website is terrific for indicating the days with the best prices. Twice I was able to get a pool view room for just $10 extra. I love the decor and the wooden floors. I haven't tried the "upscale" restaurants but have enjoyed the Pink Taco and the 24 hour cafe. During the day when everyone is out at the pool the casino area is quiet, attentive and winning. I've always been impressed with security measures around the elevators at night and never experienced the loud noise and disruptive behavior described by others. One other nice feature is the feee shuttle to the strip. Every driver I've had was courteous and on time.

HotelInfo.Name: Hard Rock Hotel and Casino
HotelInfo.Address: 4455 Paradise Road, Las Vegas, NV 89109
